Review_Date: Marie Oxford 32 wrote a review Mar 24
Review_Title: Beautiful tranquil hotel, 15 minutes from bustling medina
Review_Text: Lovely hotel. Pool is wonderful with water brought round in coolers. Breakfast excellent. Room v nice spacious suite with water replenished daily. Concierge booked great tour for us. Easy to get taxi to medina they call them as required from entrance 50mad. Perfect weather max 30 in day cool at night need jacket to sit outside restaurants. Great trip!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My partner and I opted out of staying at a traditional Riad in the Medina in favour of five star luxury on the outskirts of Marrakech. We wondered whether we had made the right choice.  All our fears were allayed from the moment we arrived through the huge secure private iron gates up the sweeping drive and into a magnificent air-conditioned welcome.  This chain understands service! In our week's long stay we had absolutely no issues whatsoever - just a fantastic stay being waited on hand and foot.  Our Premier Garden Terrace Room was superbly appointed with double sliding doors to the large bathroom and double doors to the huge terrace. When all opened up the room is to say the least - impressive!  The public rooms are also magnificent and thoughtfully finished in traditional yet modern Moorish style.  The breakfast is expensive (as is all the food) but exceptionally good. By the side of the hotel is a newly-opened retail street with shops restaurants and even Christiano Ronaldo's boutique hotel. This is an option for a great breakfast too.  The adult pool area is an oasis of calm although occasionally children did sneak in to go in the pool with their parents and nothing was said. The hotel grounds and gardens are so beautiful and relaxing that they almost rival the famous Yves Saint Laurent Gardens!  Being slightly detached from the hub of activity in the main town was not a problem - a taxi from the hotel cost between £5-£10 depending on the integrity of the driver!  Thank the Lord for Abdul who was the greatest gift to taxis since Uber and had to be almost forced to take payment from us! If anyone needs his number please let me know.  In summary whatever the season (or reason) this hotel excelled. Thank you.

Review_Date: Simon B wrote a review Mar 24
Review_Text: We had a 3rd floor suite with garden and Atlas mountain views. A nice welcome birthday surprise of roses fruit and nuts was delivered. The breakfast is excellent and we ate in all the restaurants service top notch. Food and wines reasonable quality and value. The pool is fabulous long and gently heated pool area service great with complimentary iced water sun lotion hats and occasional fruity sips. Price to stay is between the budget 5* like Sofitel and high end 5* like Mandarin which suited us    My one complaint not well handled was the temperature of the cardio fitness room which on every occasion I went in was far too warm despite 5 requests to the fitness staff to sort out the A/C. Nothing changed: Comfort and safety were not taken seriously in this area. I spoke to reception twice (and asked for my concern to be escalated the the manager) but no response except to be told that some guests like to work out in a warm room!    We recommend this hotel overall for its good points described above and its location not too far from the Medina. We plan to return in November and I hope they can sort out their gym A/C by then.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: laouad a wrote a review Mar 14
Review_Text: Thats not the forst time i come to four seasons marrakech ..i come here for the birthday pf my best friend . Everything was good and abdellatif from azaera was really perfect . But that person who said to me that i must go out abd he was about firing me . And telled me if i can pay the 75 euro to be in piscine. Make me angrey and that was direspectful . I will give 2 stars just for abdellatif . Thank you and never will be next tim . Do not ever go to that hotel . By

Review_Date: Bernard Z wrote a review Mar 13
Review_Text: This exceptional hotel makes every guest welcome and the staff anticipate what the guest needs - a rare quality. Rooms very comfortable with excellent amenities swimming pools well laid out with complementary iced water as you arrive. if you are celebrating a special occasion they know how to make it very special
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Definitely recommend this hotel- just 15 minutes drive to the busy Jamaa el Fna square. Taxis vary in price but on average 100-200 dirhams (£8-16). It is a luxurious hotel couldn’t fault it! The food staff room facilities were excellent. Breakfast is expensive but definitely recommend Symphonie Patisserie in the shopping centre (M Avenue) next door grab a lift in the buggy down to the hotel entrance and then a few minutes walk.

The hotel is a 25-30 minute walk from the hustling and bustling Medina area. You experience the four seasons attention to service as soon as you step in. Our room was beautiful and had a gorgeous little terrace overlooking the gorgeous gardens and pool. The breakfast is brilliant and my favorite were the Moroccan pancakes and shashuka they made.. shukran Younis. The complimentary car service that dropped us to our dinner at the Medina was a nice touch. The Hammam at the four seasons with Fatima Zahra was discreet and amazing. I highly recommend dinner at La Sultana. We also ate at La Moroccon at La Mammounia but were not super impressed. We almost booked La Mammounia for our stay but last minute switched to four seasons and we’re glad we did. Oh and there is an extremely modern shopping avenue called M avenue that is right next to the hotel. I recommend venturing out of the hotel and walking and exploring the area in and around the Medina by foot.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Everything was perfect. This is how a Four Seasons is supposed to be executed. Loved every minute. The food the staff location and quality of everything exceeded our expectations. We spent days by the 'adult' pool even though it was only 68 degrees. The clear blue skies of January kept us plenty warm!
Loved staying here. Wonderful hotel quiet comfortable beds amazing staff great food! Loved walking around the grounds. Having dinner on the patio. Such a wonderful experience! The rooms were perfect!

Review_Date: Ben L wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Text: We had a perfect stay at four seasons - the room was beautiful & small touches and treats in the room were delightful. The service was amazing attentive and very friendly. The restaurant Quattro was particularly good and the breakfast is outstanding
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nancie D wrote a review Jan 2023
Review_Title: Wonderful stay here at The Four seasons In Marrakech
Review_Text: I really loved my stay here. The rooms are spacious and the grounds are just beautiful. The breakfast Buffett was so yummy and the staff here are attentive and friendly. We stayed here in January and the mornings can be quite chilly. The afternoons sunny and warm.

great place amazing staff ambience.. Hotel is located in a nice serne setup and also close to all key attractions and also a short ride from airport... staff are extremely courteous and go an extra mile to look after the guests.. Must come back place...

The service at this hotel is the gold standard. We arrived at the hotel without our checked luggage. The staff sprang into action delivering us full sized toiletries Moroccan robes and diapers for our youngest. We stayed for 5 days and the staff got to know our preferences and everyone was warm and friendly the chefs even customized some meals for my pickier eater.    We stayed in their standard rooms which were well appointed and spacious. We tried all 3 restaurants and all of them were quite good although we thought that Quattro is the standout. Huge in room dining menu.    Highly recommend!

Review_Date: Ian C wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Text: We had an issue with our room on the first night and the Four Seasons team went way beyond what was expected to rectify the problem.    Overall we had a very positive stay.    Pros:  -Pools: good split for adults and kids. Good pool side service.  -Child friendly: we had a nanny for our one year old who was fantastic. Kids club is one of the best we have seen.  -Staff: all incredibly friendly and they all made a massive effort with our child.  -Gardens: beautiful established gardens. Relaxing to sit on the terrace listening to the birds. We enjoyed several lunches and dinners on the terrace on the third floor in total privacy.    Minor things to consider:  -Don’t expect a cultural experience at the hotel. The lobby and reception feel very monotonous and needs updating.  -Lighting (bright) and music (cheesy pop) at the Italian restaurant for dinner was a not fit for the environment.  -Weird set up with the duvet where the inner kept coming out of the cover. There are no buttons on the cover itself. You end up waking inside the duvet inner.    We were super impressed with the hotel friendliness and the overall quality of the stay.    Their ability to fix our room problem effortlessly was a great touch.

Review_Date: steven b wrote a review Dec 2022
Review_Text: I stayed here for a winter sunshine break as a solo traveller. The room which was a premier garden terrace room was perfect for my stay. Good size well equipped with lovely garden views and west facing for the afternoon sunshine. It was also really quiet and peaceful which is what I'd requested.  The hotel is near the airport so being met by a hotel car and driven to the hotel took only a few minutes.  The pool areas like the hotel are really stylish and relaxed. The adult pool was perfect for me and I was pleased to see that if families with children arrived  they were politely redirected to the family pool area. The pool service was friendly and prompt and the provision of bottled water in a cool box was very welcome.  The hotel restaurants were efficient and friendly with good service although I did find breakfast a bit erratic on two days when the hotel was full with a large tour party.  The concierge also organised the trips I wanted with an excellent english speaking guide which added to my enjoyment of this city.  I will certainly return to this hotel without a doubt and would highly recommend it to anyone who wanted great service in a peaceful location.

Beautiful hotel with incredible facilities. The rooms are extremely spacious and beautifully decorated. A very special place. Exceptional staff and service in all areas. We will definitely be back next year. Thank you to the whole team.

Very nice staff extremely spacious rooms comfy bed good breakfast good room service cosy bars and a walk in the huge garden is like a therapy for the absent minded. Bonus: Nespresso machine and pods in the room🤗

Review_Title: Incredible service at Inara at The Four Seasons in Marrakech
Review_Text: What a wonderful time we had sipping mint tea listening to beautiful guitar music. Our server Yassine was beyond wonderful! Such care and kindness in a beautiful place. The music was super and the conversation during breaks educational.

Review_Date: Gaurav T wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Title: Caring staff, stunning property, convenient location
Review_Text: We had a great stay here in late November. Although we loved getting out to explore the Medina and desert the best part of the trip was this amazing resort with its very caring and attentive staff. They helped ensure our short stay wasn’t too impacted by our luggage not making it. Our suite was perfect and our kids enjoyed the plunge pool on the patio. The Italian restaurant and room service were delicious (please add more vegetarian food to your menu - tofu or veggie burgers).    We would 100% come again to Marrakech and would definitely stay here again.

Review_Date: Laura H wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: Once again Four Seasons delivers. Outstanding service location and staff. This resort property is beautifully landscaped with two pools. One pool for adults only and the other for families. A great experience all around.

Review_Date: Dan R wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Title: Great stay, wonderful hotel, superior staff team
Review_Text: My wife and I spent five nights at the Four Season Resort Marrakech recently and had a wonderful stay. Like most Four Seasons somehow you find yourself feeling like you're the only guests at the hotel. This property was no exception. The setting is beautiful with manicured landscaping fountains and pools. You have absolutely no awareness of the bustle beyond the hotel property. The hotel staff was very attentive to any needs always greeted us and really seemed to go the extra mile of service. The food was very good and we had breakfast lunch and dinner at different times during our stay. The Italian restaurant Quattro was quite good. The hotel arranged transportation and tours for us and were extremely helpful even when we had last minute changes. The room was very nice and has a terrace with lounge chairs and table/chairs discreetly nestled by the adult pool. We'll definitely find our way back to this property. We've stayed at Dorchester collection hotels as recently as a few months ago and i would place this property as comparable or above the staff service levels there. A real gem!

Review_Date: Marc B wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Title: A Good Choice for Luxury and Relaxation
Review_Text: After 5 days in Marrakech's Medina and a couple of days spent in the Atlas mountains we chose to return to the posh Four Seasons Resort for some coddling before heading home a few days later. Gorgeous grounds a blissful “adults-only” pool (which they enforced - they sent folks with children to the also very-nice family pool) with poolside service (including a cooler filled with chilled bottled water as soon as you sat down) a lovely spa and a couple of restaurants and bars it was the right choice to decompress from the sights and sounds of Marrakech before heading home. While the property was not as characterful as the other properties we stayed in through our trip (being an international chain) it was a lovely and relaxing few days.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Bruce Brunning wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: We spent 5 days in this hotel and enjoyed every one of them. Our room with its small plunge pool was excellent spacious comfortable and with a small private garden. The staff were all relaxed and friendly whilst still being efficient. The hotel grounds are big enough to not feel crowded and the style is true to Morocco. We will certainly return probably quite soon!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: From the moment we arrived the sense of tranquility and beauty washed over us. We considered staying at a local boutique hotel but did not regret our decision.    The staff was overwhelmingly perfect from the valet drivers to the front desk/concierge pool attendees housekeeping and some of the restaurant(s) staff. Our needs were always met and service was over and beyond. Jahine was always available - even if it wasn’t her responsibility to bear.    Must go to the spa! This is the first time I tried a hammam treatment & was extremely happy with the end result. The bedroom & bathroom was spacious loved our balcony and the view.    Tiny deficiencies that we noticed: no Four Seasons store which we typically expect. I forgot gym clothes and was looking to purchase at their store. The safe in our room kept giving us errors. Make sure you can lock & open before putting items in.    The food in the lobby (upstairs restaurant) is just mediocre & the Italian restaurant was ok. Nothing we’d go back for - just convenient.  The breakfast buffet is great but by the 3rd day I had hoped for a tiny change in offerings. There are several options to choose from but if you’re staying for more than 3-4 days you definitely can tire of it.    Otherwise the Four Seasons helped made it easy to fall in love with Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The hotel is beautiful and the staff couldnt do enough for us. Cant wait to go back. Location is perfect 10 mins to the centre and 15 mins to the airport. The singer at the pool bar on Saturday was fantastic.  My wife and I thoroughly enjoyed our few days away in Marrakech.

Review_Date: Laura A wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Title: Very good service and food, beautiful extensive grounds, lovely stay
Review_Text: The hotel grounds and gardens are lovely it is a very relaxing place to stay. Nice pool areas; there is a separate pool for adults only which is good.  The breakfast was excellent with everything you could wish for and beautifully prepared. The service was also very good we had a lovely time. Our room had a large terrace with sunbeds on it too which was nice. 10 mins a ride by Taxi to the Medina so the location is quite convenient. You can see it isn't a new Hotel so the room deco seems a little dated but the comfort and service were excellent.

This hotel illustrates that some luxury chains are all about expansion even if they sacrifice on quality.  The hotel is mediocre. Hard to tell that the hotel is just 12 years old. The decoration is bland it is not well maintained and you could be anywhere. Hard to tell if you are in Doha Atlanta or Capetown.  Food was mediocre at best.  Only positive note was the friendly staff and the spa therapists.  To be honest if you choose this hotel for your first stay at a Four Seasons you will never want to stay in Four Seasons again.  Also zero environmental policy. Breakfast arrived always with everything wrapped in transparent film and they still have small plastic amenity bottles. Enfuriating in 2022!!

Review_Date: irene l wrote a review Nov 2022
Review_Text: Enjoying a perfect week at the wuiet resort. Outstanding pool and restaurants attentive service and although fully booked you find space and relaxation.  The suite is spacious nicely decorated and with a terrace. All very well designed.

Review_Date: Francis D wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Title: Good place to stay if you are in Marrakesh
Review_Text: Dear Reader you will like this place.Its a fusion of American efficiency and a traditional Moroccan hospitality extended to visitors.The stand out feature is the staff their training their attitude and we waited for nothing.  The morning room service got forgotten twice which is curious but all said and done very good hotel indeed with well trained staff an astonishing western shopping mall next to the hotel and within easy reach of everything in the city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Chris S wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: The food in the flagship Inara restaurant boasted of an eclectic mix of LebaneseMoroccan & Turkish fayre…what we got was nachos (Doritos) with flavourless smashed avocado masquerading as guacamole…neitherLebaneseMoroccan or Turkish the last time I checked…fully Mexican..  To the main course of cheeseburger & club sandwich…not exactly a mouthwatering melange of either of the aforementioned countries cuisine either…  In short the food was at best a poolside snack bar standard on the Costa del Sol…not one that I would expect in a £1000 per night 5* hotel…
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Joachim P wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: one of the best Hotels in Marrakech and a real 5 star Hotel with a 6 star service. location is extremely good between airport and Medina. Room was similar to four season Dubai and the Hotel Pool Hamam is every dinar worth

This trip was a long time coming as it had been postponed for the last two years so by the time we eventually came it coincided with my sister’s 50th birthday celebrations. All off to a good start when he emailed the hotel a few times before arrival with various questions and all promptly and efficiently answered. I also mentioned it was for a special birthday which was rewarded with a room upgrade and Prosecco and a chocolate cake for the birthday girl delivered by a lovely lad who quite happily joined in singing happy birthday with us three ladies in our room.    Special note to the three gentlemen all called Badr on reception who tended to our every request and even beyond. Just to mention when you get your room key there is a QR code on it which if you scan you can then WhatsApp front desk if you want any restaurants booked etc. This worked really well. We changed all our money from GBP to MAD at reception too.    We took advice from the hotel and as none of us had been to Morocco before we booked a half day guide through them to take us into the city. The chap we had was Jamil who was lovely super informed and guided us through the Bahia palace the sights and sounds of the Medina and the souks and gave us tips along the way. If possible ask for Jamil - you can’t go wrong!    The next evening we went to watch the sun set over the main square in one of the restaurants there that overlooked the hustle of bustle of the street food sellers as they set up shop. Then we went into the medina felt very safe and just followed the advice from Jamil. The souks shut up shop around 9pm.    At the hotel’s recommendation we had dinner one night at La Sultana which was lovely. Would highly recommend. Also lunch in the medina at Le Jardin - delicious. We also went to La Mamounia which is the hotel where Churchill used to stay for pre dinner drinks. And then onto a fab Italian called La Trattoria which again was quite breathtaking.    We were on b&b basis at the hotel and breakfast was plentiful with lots of choice. We sat outside on the terrace every morning.    We made use of the hotel pool every day relaxing on the sun loungers. Very attentive staff who bought us cool boxes with iced bottled water. Special mention to Ismail who we interacted with the most. Very helpful and friendly young man. We had lunch most days in the pool side restaurant usually sharing a pizza between the three of us. We didn’t eat in the hotel in the evenings.    The hotel provide a free shuttle car into the city wherever you want to go from 18.00-22.00. You can’t book it you have to wait if it is already out on a run or book a taxi. About 50 MAD each way but set your price before you get it. It is a final price so you don’t have to tip. You can also book the hotel shuttle to bring you back to the hotel but there is a charge for this.    Our flight home was quite late so we were able to use the facilities at the spa to shower and change for our onward journey which worked really well.    So all in all we had an absolutely fantastic time. Everyone we encountered at the hotel from the gardeners to the resort manager and hotel manager all lovely.    Thankyou all so much for making our stay so wonderful and we all said we would love to come back sometime.    Below are pics of the hotel and also of our dining eves out.

Just AMAZING!! This was one of the best hotel experiences we’ve ever had. Magdy (guest relations) was unbelievable. Accommodating and thoughtful he went out of his way to give us the best vacation. Bedr (front desk) was also incredible - helped us figure out dinner plans etc.. AbdelRahim (baggage handler) was our first interaction and set the tone - incredibly sweet took his time showing us around and answered all of our questions - EXCELLENT service! Literally ALL the pool bar staff - AMAZING!!!! Thank you for one of the best vacations of all time!!!!

Review_Title: The best hotel stay I’ve ever experienced!
Review_Text: I travel very frequently and I’m highly selective when it comes to hotel accommodations. Hands down this was the best hotel experience I have ever had. Magdy (Guest Relations) was absolutely phenomenal and went above and beyond. Our stay would not have been the same without him - he went out of his way to give us the best vacation. Bedr (front desk) was so kind and accommodating and went to great lengths to help us with our reservations. Abdelrahim (baggage handler) was so gracious and thorough and made us feel like family. The staff at the pool bar were all excellent and hospitable and always made us feel welcome. Thank you for the vacation of a lifetime!

enjoyed several days for our anniversary trip in Marrakesh everything was top notch! Nice garden pool and restaurants. Rooms are nice and clean. Staff is very helpful. will come back again if my travels take me back to this part of the world

We stayed on a combination business trip and family holiday. The property and rooms are excellent and on par with what you would find in Miami or Florida. After enjoying the madness of downtown Marrakech it is literally an oasis of calm and luxury. All the staff we interacted with were very friendly helpful and professional; well trained but with a genuine Moroccan welcome. You can see attention to detail everywhere; from the flowers in reception to the baby welcome pack changing mat and baby bath in our room. Child cutlery was provided at breakfast without prompting and you felt the hotel put effort in to be family friendly. The kids club is excellent (Samira is great!) and although it says from 4 you can take in younger kids if parents supervise. There is an adults only pool family pool AND a toddler pool with sunshade (this pool could do with a little maintenance on tiles etc). I can see the attraction of staying in a Riad or cheaper hotel but we would really recommend the 4 Seasons particularly for families.

Review_Date: Lauren Y wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: We had the worst experience we’ve sever had at a four seasons here. The customer service was terrible. The staff at the front desk was very rude and didn’t speak English well. We actually cut our trip short by a few days and just flew home due to the terrible customer service.

Review_Date: Bruce W wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: A great hotel for a quiet getaway close to the city centre with great facilities for relaxation. Excellent accommodation we had a one bedroom suite on the ground floor offering privacy and its own plunge pool. The front of house staff were very attentive at all times and nothing seem too much trouble.

Three nights at this hotel sadly was not enough. The hotel is lovely the staff are so helpful and simply want to make your stay perfect particularly Hanane she is so friendly and helpful she can not do enough for you a real asset to the hotel. It is a great location to explore beautiful Marrakech and offers another level of tranquility.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Alison B wrote a review Sep 2022
Review_Text: A really beautiful hotel. Spacious with mature grounds. Two beautiful pools. We were upgraded to a Pavilion room which was large with a huge and comfortable bed great bathroom and lovely balcony. Breakfast was great pool side food lovely and we went to both restaurants. We much preferred the Italian restaurant as we found the international one had a limited selection for my daughter who doesn’t eat meat. Spa treatments were great too. Every member of staff we met was lovely with unobtrusive but high quality service. Wouldn’t hesitate to recommend for a short stay. If staying longer you may need a greater choice of restaurants.

Review_Date: Joachim P wrote a review Oct 2022
Review_Text: A really beautiful hotel. Spacious with mature grounds. Two beautiful pools. We were upgraded to a Pavilion room which was large with a huge and comfortable bed great bathroom and lovely balcony. Breakfast was great pool side food lovely and we went to both restaurants. We much preferred the Italian restaurant as we found the international one had a limited selection for my daughter who doesn’t eat meat. Spa treatments were great too. Every member of staff we met was lovely with unobtrusive but high quality service. Wouldn’t hesitate to recommend for a short stay. If staying longer you may need a greater choice of restaurants.
