Review_Date: Erica M wrote a review Jun 2022
Review_Title: Stunning hotel, great location, extensive gardens
Review_Text: Just come back from a week stay with husband and 13 year old daughter. They offered us two style of rooms and let us look around both before deciding which suited us better.  Both rooms were beautiful but the one we chose was bigger and therefore better for us spotless with lovely bedding which you expect from this level of hotel.  The gardens are extensive well maintained and both pools are gorgeous and relaxing.  Staff are super friendly and attentive.  The hotel location was great too. We ate in almost 20 different restaurants around the city over the week and all where only a short 10 minute ride in one of the hotels cars which were always a available to take us and pick us up.  Can’t wait til we come back here and to Marrakesh.

We stayed here three nights and almost everything was excellent. The grounds and public areas are stunning and the food and service were great. Our room was lovely with a beautiful terrace. The problem was that when we opened the door to either go out on the terrace or just to get fresh air the AC went off - and never came back on. I tried to adjust the temperature but finally had to call for assistance. The maintenance guy came immediately (amazing in a huge hotel) and said he needed to turn it on from his end. That worked fine until the next time we opened the terrace door and it happened again. So the sleep quality wasn't great because our room was hot on a couple nights until they finally got it fixed. Other than that the bed was comfortable the bathroom was large and had two sinks and housekeeping was prompt every morning. The drinks in the bar are strong and they come with various nuts/olives etc. We ate dinner in the hotel one night and the Italian food is fabulous. The breakfast buffet is ample with omelet and crepe stations and we thought it was a better option than ordering off the menu. The beautiful setting on the terrace with palm trees and a reflecting pool is beyond compare.

Review_Date: AHARON G wrote a review Jun 2022
Review_Text: I understand why people travel just to stay put in this resort. We recently went for our 45th anniversary. The Hotel upgraded my wife and me to a suite overlooking the garden and adult pool. Everything was fabulous. First of all the room itself was perfect. Large spotless and modern furniture consistent with Four Seasons quality. Then the grounds including the lobby the pool and the gardens were glorious. Truly paradise. I stayed at the Mamounia on this trip too. To compare- I would take Four Seasons' room 10 out of 10 times. What makes Mamounia unique are the pools and the grandeur of its lobby. You can't make a mistake in deciding to pick one of these. Four seasons has impeccable service and 5 star treatment with a very strong Moroccan charm. Thank you Four Seasons for a trip we will remeber for the rest of our life-and we only stayed ONE night! Next time  we will correct this.

The Four Seasons Hotel has one of the largest (and nicest) grounds compared to other 5 Star hotels in Marrakech. Our trip did not start well as they had forgotten to pick us up from Airport however we quickly forgot the issue once we arrived at the hotel and the team made up for that blunder in other ways. You can tell the quality of a hotel by the way they sort out problems and believe me that's exactly what they did! Hotel accommodation is amazing. We had a 1st floor suite away from the main pool and the accommodation was so tranquil. Breakfast has a good amount of choice quality is good (fresh eggs pancakes etc). Lunch by the pool is recommended as they have a good amount of choice. In the evenings they had 3 places you can eat from or you can walk around the corner and experience some other local places. Highly highly recommended !

Great place clean great service just perfect. We stayed here 4 nights and ate twice at the restaurant. Pool service was the only disappointment- waiters never came to ask you for service we had to chase them. One day we got free water at the pool in a cooler another we didn’t. Once extra towels were wet.    Besides this everything else was great.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Thomas Wouters wrote a review Jun 2022
Review_Text: We stayed for 3 nights in this beautiful resort.    Comfort was as expected in Four Seasons but service level was above and beyond. Friendly and caring staff across all departments.    We tried all the restaurants which were all extremely good. Special mention to the Italian one.    Strongly recommended for any type of stay in the ocre city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Daniel Perdigão wrote a review May 2022
Review_Title: An Oasis in the heart of Marrakech!
Review_Text: We stayed at Four Seasons Marrakech for 2 nights and we had such a wonderful stay!  It was our first time staying with the group and we couldn’t have asked for a better experience!  The property is just beautiful with a lot of gardens 2 pools (one for families and one for adults only) and all the other facilities that you might need such as gym spa tennis courts restaurantsetc  We tried the Azzera restaurant for lunch by the adults only pool and the Quattro restaurant for dinner and the food was absolutely delicious in both restaurants.  Breakfast is super complete with a lot of options and the food was equally delicious (their orange juices were some of the best we’ve tried in Marrakech).  Highly recommend you to stay at FS Marrakech if you look to relax in this beautiful Oasis with 2 amazing heated pools!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: the hotels staff superb attention to detail there approach to the customers is the best i have seen the food lived up to 5 stars poolside atendants are brilliant water delivered in whicker baskets around the pool

Review_Date: isaac niego wrote a review May 2022
Review_Text: This hotel is gorgeous incredible service and amazing rooms  very good location and near everything the food is outstanding and the decor super gorgeous  you have to be there to enjoy it and believe it  really incredible experience never expected this kind of hotel here .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Flash M wrote a review May 2022
Review_Title: Avoid. Not a five star hotel.
Review_Text: Really dire hotel very poor customer service. I had issues with our room which we raised with the hotel who were unresponsive and did not address any of our concerns. They believe they are a five star resort but have a one star customer service rating.    Rooms are poor. The hotel is very loud constant banging of doors echoes everywhere. Poor amenities. Terrible value for money.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Very poor - not up to the Four Seasons standards
Review_Text: Stayed here end of April / beginning May. Starting with positives - pool facilities and dining options were great.    The issue however is the condition of the rooms. They are very outdated and not clean. This can be looked over somewhat - though the biggest issue was the condition of the mattress. Very squeaky completely worn out. The noise makes it almost impossible to get a decent night sleep. They have a sign in the room outlining that the room rate is EUR 617 - for that much you'd expect a mattress that doesn't squeak and hasn't sagged!    Be careful if you have stayed at other Four Seasons. This is a big notch below other experiences we have had at the other FS resorts/hotels. Better value luxury hotels in Marrakech!

Review_Date: Jacques B wrote a review Apr 2022
Review_Text: The good thing about any Four Seasons resort is that you are never disappointed.  and in Marrakesh that could never be more accurate. the ground is superb the rooms are spacious and comfortable and the service is faultless.  we hesitated between the Four Season and La Mamounia for our first trip to Marrakesh and i have to say we were very glad with our choice and we would highly recommend it.

I give this hotel five stars although we had a problem with the heat/AC in our room. We had a lovely terrace but when we opened the door the AC went off and we couldn't get it to come back on. A maintenance man came to the room immediately and said he needed to turn it on from his end so it was fixed until the next day when it happened again. By the third day it was fixed for good and everything was fine. In general service was very good and our issue was quickly addressed. The food for dinner and breakfast was excellent. We appreciated the plug converter and the bowl of fruit. The bathroom was spacious with two sinks and a plug for my curling iron (unlike some hotels which only have plugs for shavers in the bathroom). The hotel is not within walking distance of the main area because it's on a big road but it's not far by cab.

The hotel grounds were spacious enough for nice long walks. The hotel room was large clean and well-maintained. The staff were courteous and helpful. Restaurants had a wide selection of delicious food.

Review_Title: Very pleasant stay and luxury comfort
Review_Text: Delightful quiet and luxury garden and swimming pool. Usual comfort expected for a four seasons : perfect. The only disappointing point is the breakfast . Cool and elegant. Location is ok altough not in the medina. Nice arez

We just came back from a fantastic stay at this hotel. The staff was kind enough to upgrade us when our original room had an issue with the bed and the new room was one with a terrace facing the pool. Wow ! Spacious  well designed and even with sun beds outside. The only small things that didn’t work well were the toilet that kept running water after flushing (you had to press the button twice) one of the terrace doors which wouldn’t open and the round switch outside the bathroom which kept falling off (room 38 incase management wants to take a look. These are tiny details that were noticed but didn’t take away from our amazing stay!).  I also enjoyed the spa as I was always the only person there at around 4pm (it has a sauna and hammam and two different pools and also a relaxation area and an outdoor space - all separated men/ women). I played tennis two days in a row and the coach was great. The service was impeccable and I would especially like to thank a member of staff at the concierge / reception desk who helped us plan dinner outings and a short trip to the mountains (his name is short and starts with Ba…). The hotel has a lovely energy is well designed and feels quiet even if there are families and children around. I would include more options for the breakfast buffet but other than that the food was very good. The most important thing is that I never felt ripped off for anything  which is a feeling you often get at big luxury resorts. This is a huge plus. I would like to return !!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sean M wrote a review Apr 2022
Review_Text: This great hotel is a 3 minute taxi ride to the Medina and central Marrakech.  It has great facilities a good restaurant great bar well equipped gym and 2 pools- One is adults only which during the Easter holidays is a real blessing.  The rooms are well appointed and grounds are well kempt.  But there are 2 things that make this hotel exceptional and which makes this our go to hotel when visiting Marrakech.  The first is the staff the service throughout our stay was superb nothing seemed to be too much trouble and we were always greeted with a smile.  The second is that even over the easter period when it was busy it was an oasis of calm the pool area was quiet  the bar relaxed and it never felt busy..a welcome relief after a day in the Medina.  We would also like to personally thank Jihane on the front desk whose exceptional service was world class and made our holiday.

Review_Date: nawaf m wrote a review Mar 2022
Review_Text: A true 5 star service by the butlers in the villa  i would like to thank them especially.    Perfect stay  feels like home. Definitely ill be back to this hotel.    Thanks four seasons for the amazing service.

Review_Date: P Michael H wrote a review Mar 2022
Review_Text: My wife and I spent four nights at the Four Seasons Marrakech in early March 2022. It was a great stay.    The hotel is located on a large 40-acre property and appears to be fairly new. The room we had was large and well appointed. There was a walk-in closet and a large bathroom. The bed was large and comfortable and the linens were nice.    The bath was large and had a separate shower plus a tub. The room had a small frig a coffee maker and a pot to make hot water. The coffee maker used coffee “cassettes” and they didn’t replace the used ones during our stay. In the main lobby they would put out a coffee maker and those cassettes so I’d pick up a few cassettes each day to replace the ones we used.    It was easy to connect to the Internet and the speed was adequate.    We at in the Quatro restaurant several times and the food and service was good.    As you’d expect at a Four Seasons the staff was uniformly excellent. We very much enjoyed our stay. Recommended.

Review_Date: Saleh A wrote a review Mar 2022
Review_Text: amazing stay  great staff especially butler for villa royal Muneer and Essam. great job keep it up.  we were 4 friends we had our best time and we are looking forward to come back here again as soon as possible.    again thanks to four seasons and staff

Review_Title: its a perfect place to stay
Review_Text: the staff is more then perfect they make your stay amazing  breakfast and lunch are delicious room absolutely clean and spacious  garden around is nice to walk and again quiet  check in fast and check out without any problems

This hotel was such a wonderful place to start our trip to Morocco. They helped us arrange fast track and a ride from the airport easily and checkin was a breeze. Everyone was very friendly including a very nice Amin who served us for our first meal after arriving. The gym was well equipped (though I didn’t use it). The breakfast had a nice variety with a staff that was eager to please.

The Four Seasons Marrakech was the perfect destination for my 6 night holiday to profit from some much needed sunshine. From the moment I arrived I was made to feel comfortable and very welcome. The staff were always visible and attentive although not overbearing- as can be the case.

Had the most magical family vacation at the Four Seasons Marrakech. We couldn’t have asked for a better stay.    The location: is absolutely perfect! Away from the hustle and bustle of the Medina but still near all the landmarks restaurants gardens and shops. This resort is like an oasis in the middle of a desert. Once you step inside there are tons of palm trees…it’s very green and beautiful. Plus you can walk to M Avenue that has many shops and restaurants open. This resort is a PRIME LOCATION!    The amenities: include adult AND family pools kids club teens club clay tennis court fitness center with cardio AND weight room plus a beautiful spa. We used all of the amenities while here. Perfect for families because it has a bit of everything no matter what age.    The food: is super good! You can have lunch at Azzera which has the coolest outside ambiance with live music on the weekends. You can also eat at Quattro it’s an Italian indoor/outdoor restaurant. Here you can enjoy the best breakfast buffet or dinner on the terrace. Then you have Inara a cool Moroccan Turkish Lebanese lounge area where you can order cocktails and food. Great at sunset time because of the most gorgeous view. They even have heaters and blankets outside if it gets too cold.    The rooms: do not disappoint. We stayed in room 30 and connected to room 31. It’s a private patio suite with its own pool. Incredible! The layout is spacious and the room itself is gorgeous! Great location for a family because it’s next to kid’s club and family pool.    My fav part: THE SERVICE! They deserve 10/10! Top Notch Service! The absolute BEST! All staff members have been SO nice cheerful considerate helpful and make you feel like royalty. From checking in with Badr Allal and Sami to Ahmed who is in charge of housekeeping and decorated our room for our anniversary to Mohamed from room service who made sure we always had the correct food order Sara Abde Yassine and Madhi from Azzera always chatting with us every morning with a huge smile behind that mask to Abdu who brings in fresh fruit everyday day Abdel’s turn down service is the best and always on point to Samir in the Inaca lobby restaurant Karima and Samira from kid’s club who took such great care of my kids and even made pizza with them Mohamed and Marouane from Quattro were so accommodating and super sweet Siad is the best pool waiter….always happy Safa who made crepes for us every morning at breakfast Mounir who always is so joyful gave us the best room service. Abdelaziz also from room service was so nice! Abderrahmane was very kind and provided amazing service. Abderrazak was our absolute fav always greeting us with such great energy and making sure we were always cared for. Fatiha from the spa gave me the best massage make sure to request her. Ghizlane from house keeping who kept our room clean all week with such a great attitude!    We love you all so much! None of this would be possible without Asmaa and Reda. You both are amazing people. Thank you for making our stay so memorable! Will never forget you all.

Review_Date: Oliver H wrote a review Feb 2022
Review_Text: We loved our stay at Four seasons Marrakech it far exceeded our expectations. The hotel is very well maintained clean and safe with a great location. Gorgeous hospitality from parking to front desk to restaurants to all amenities. Very professional and courteous staff; Mr Kamal / room service was very welcoming friendly and extremely helpful. We will definitely come back again. I am highly recommending this 5 stars hotel everything was just Outstanding. Can’t wait to go back.

Review_Date: Matt B wrote a review Feb 2022
Review_Title: Exceptional staff in a beautiful setting
Review_Text: Beautiful resort with great facilities but the real stand out here is the extra mile that all the staff go to make your stay amazing. Nothing is a problem and it makes for an incredibly relaxing tranquil atmosphere. We are definitely coming back.

Review_Date: Khaoula B wrote a review Feb 2022
Review_Text: I got a great stay in th four Seasons Marrakech.  All was perfect service staff attention quick arrival and departure nice food nice room and accomodations. I will definitly return back in the future.

Review_Title: Understand why this property is globally ranked so high!!!!! WOW!!!
Review_Text: We had the pleasure of staying at this resort for three nights on our recent tour of Morocco (Room #208). The service is exceptional and the hotel and grounds are the loveliest we've seen throughout the world. Staff is well trained and go above and beyond with everything they do.    The grounds are tantalize the senses as they are beautiful to see and so fragrant.    The only issue was about the maintenance to the pool and the decision to move the children to the couples pool. We were looking forward to spending some downtime at the pool along with other guests from our tour and others we met in the hotel. Each day we attempted to use the pool we were frustrated with one family of 6 children 2 parents and a nanny who decided the pool was theirs alone. The children screamed splashed and harassed other guests until they left. The lifeguards attempted to talk to the parents twice but the parents got upset and ranted that their children were only being children. Management never intervened to resolve the issues. What disappointed us was the decision to put the children with the couples in the first place. It appeared only half of the family pool was under work so not sure why the children use that half. I did note this in my feedback directly to the hotel management and they apologized for the inconvenience and noted the both pools are now open. That's great for those there now but in the future recommend against mixing couples and children as some of are on vacation to relax and not battle ill behaved children. Also advise management to update guests when work is done on pools and other areas prior to arrival so guests can reschedule if needed.    Overall great experience and we will definitely return and stay at the Four Seasons Resort Marrakech on our next trip to Marrakech.

Review_Date: Carol W wrote a review Dec 2021
Review_Text: I had a memorable trip even with covid time! The staff is having a great sense of hospitality and this exceed my expectations! They were able to make my experience very easy! I am pleased by this and highly recommend the place

We had a great time despite covid. Great service. We were given a late check out without even asking. Great staff. It is sad to see Marrakech with no foreign tourists though because the country is closed.

Review_Date: tara c wrote a review Dec 2021
Review_Text: What an amazing experience! Travelled with my husband and baby boy Reiss! He is 1 and the upper bar/restaurant was soooo amazing in letting him crawl giving him private space with the fireplace and providing him with love! Thank you soooo much! They gave us a half of gallon of milk everyday and were sooo attentive! Never too forget!!!!

Review_Title: a paradise in the middle of marrakech
Review_Text: if you look for a amazing place to stay with a great staff perfect food great hospitality in a tranguil atmosphere then go to four seasons .one day is to short .  surrounding gardens are beautiful and in a city as marrakech its a good place to relax

Overall staying in 4 seasons was an amazing experience and we would always come back. On the positive side:  + The service standard friendliness hospitality is very high the employees really care about their guests and try to surprise them positively starting with the concierge and the very friendly bell boys - always with a smile - the waiters cleaning staff they are really fantastic  + The spa area w separate areas for men and women  + The long 40 meter heated pool and the separation of pools for families and adults  + the gym  + the food in Quattro was very very delicious (the tiramisu is a wow)  + the drinks in the bar 👌  + they provide filtered water in glass bottles    On the improvement side:  - the breakfast buffet is good but a bit expensive considering that the selection does not alternate much (maybe due to Covid?)  - overall price of the rooms is high  - Environmental program to be improved: there is a massive amount of towels that is constantly exchanged although they describe it differently would call it kind of green washing.    all in all very recommendable!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Hans T wrote a review Nov 2021
Review_Text: Great hotel about 5-10 minutes drive from the Medina. Friendly staff in every department. Great restaurant & restaurant bar. I enjoyed my 50th birthday here and the hotel contributed to make it a nice celebration in every way. A special thank you to the concierge services in house dining and the Quattro restaurant staff. Thank you so much.

Review_Date: aga t wrote a review Nov 2021
Review_Title: great oasis in the bustling city of Marrakesh
Review_Text: I stayed there two nights and was amazed with the hotel itself pools restaurants and rooms. Staff was attentive kind and up to the highest standards. Food was fresh and delicious.  I got a wonderful upgrade on arrival and gifts which was so sweet !  Thank you for a marvelous stay !

Review_Date: Manuel QP wrote a review Nov 2021
Review_Text: I was told that children do not pay to eat.  Bill always came with what my child eat.  my Child is 2years and so would not go to have dinner to restaurant. All he eat in the room was charged. It does not make sense to say children do not pay and then charge him to have dinner because he does not have age to have dinner in a. Restaurant. Just does not make sense.  in check out I had to go and look at all bills and there it was thinks that my child eat during the day.    reception took it out of the bill.    ate night when I was home I got info from my credit card the the Hotel Four Seasons tried to charge my card with out any warning. This is not admissible!  For 20 ou 30 euros your hotel tried to charge my card. Do not know the reason however for such a value it is very bad!  there is no qualification for this act.

Some 4 Seasons aren't as good as others.....this is one of their better properties for sure!  The setting is amazing.  The restaurants serve top notch food  Its location in Hivernage is a 5 minute 30-50 Dirham ride away from the Medina  Signature Four Seasons bedding......meaning you won't want to get out of bed....but don't worry breakfast runs quite late  Price of food at the restaurants was reasonable    The spa is also fantastic with a beautiful Hammam    The best part was the staff though. They had no problem preparing me a custom dish not on the menu at the pool restaurant.  And Badr C at the front desk was the best concierge ever. he took tons of time to help me with planning itineraries and making reservations for me.    definitely recommend.

Review_Date: Fiona Uk wrote a review Oct 2021
Review_Text: My husband and I went to the Four Seasons in Marrakech during October 2021. All I can say it was an absolute pleasure and delight being there guests once again.  No one could do enough to make our stay a delight. In fact we had planned to go to another hotel in the Medina but we ended up returning here for another 2 nights.  It was that pleasurable. As I mentioned to my husband your sensibility has sort of shifted in these COVID times so you basically want to relax in peace and have some quiet time to chill out.  Everyone from Abdellatif hnini the food manager at the restaurant who made our meals a delight and had such a calming and professional manner to cater to our needs… to all the girls at the Spa helping us ease our worries away.. everyone couldn’t do enough for us. The service is impeccable. They even gave us a lovely upgrade upon arrival.  I will be returning here every year as it’s just want we need at this time. Fabulous location service everyone so polite and courteous!!! A fabulous hotel to stay while visiting Marrakech!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: S Rogers wrote a review Oct 2021
Review_Text: Another excellent stay at the Four Seasons Marrakesh. Superb service and hotel looking beautiful with stunning gardens. The staff in every department helpful & professional nothing too much trouble. We were beautifully looked after and very happy with our holiday there. Will return. Highly recommended.

Inara Balcony is the chillest place we spent one of our evenings in Marrakech. We were met personally by Marwan who makes their fabulous cocktails. Amid their attentiveness and professionalism they made us feel so relaxed and at home without crossing boundaries. Their menu are reasonably priced and the place is just as georgeus!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My sixth stay here and it feels like my second hone .  I got a very warm welcome and my room  Was gorgeous . The bed is a dream and it was spotlessly clean .    The pool is my favourite part of hotel and said Is always vert professional.    I had the best tiramisu I ever tasted there .  The spa is fabulous but i was booked in for hamman buf I had to wear a mask and it was way too hot .    I was not offered a drink in spa and left me in the waiting area for a while but I had a lovely scalp massage . They are bot doing and facial treatments there at the moment .    I’ll definitely be back

Review_Date: Mauriece D wrote a review Oct 2021
Review_Title: Unreal experience during a never ending pandemic!
Review_Text: During a time of covid staying at the Four Seasons Marrakech you are reminded of a time before covid. Though all safety measures are in place the experience serviced by staff makes you forget we’re still in a pandemic. Service was impeccable staff meticulously gracious with the outmost respect of your safety that you forget you are still in a pandemic.    From the arrival experience to our well maintained guest suite to dining both in-room and restaurants spending time at their beautiful pools and to decompressing at the spa… we felt normalcy.    Kudos to the management and entire team for making us feel at home away from home! And help re-build our trust in travelling again! The attentiveness to detail is exceptional and very well noticed throughout the resort.    Thank you for such a warm and beautiful experience!

Review_Date: Will E wrote a review Oct 2021
Review_Text: We had a wonderful week at the Four Seasons. We couldn’t fault the hotel. We loved the pools the AMAZING beds fabulous rooms but above all the staff were unfailingly kind and helpful. In particular the reception/concierge team who recommended the best local restaurants and organized reservations. We had one small hiccup with our bill which was immediately resolved to our satisfaction. Finally we loved the restaurants - and ate incredibly well. Just a perfect week - THANK-YOU!!

Review_Date: Four seasons Fan wrote a review Oct 2021
Review_Title: The dirtiest Four seasons in the world
Review_Text: I came to this hotel for 5 nights to relax after a long trip. To my surprise the hotel is super old with sagging furniture and dirty amenities. Their bathrooms in the pool were dirty and full of human fetus. In addition nobody could wash their hands because the skin wasn’t working. Nobody was attending to the area and it was a hub to catch covid 19 virus. The resort manager Pierre is just a punk and a loser. He is racist and all the staff now to him like he is royalty. The hotel room itself doesn’t warrant the price tag of 700 dollars a night. Bad menus wrong pricesclocks that don’t have the precise GMT time. All their hotel clocks are two or three minutes ahead. Their menu in the room is ugly and it feels like a holiday inn carte. Cold food bad toilet paper ugly granite shower leaking plumbing issues hotel parties although there is a curfew I will come back for more reviews because I am not done. Avoid At all expense. I am attaching one example picture of the sink that wasn’t working in the main pool so all guests were swimming with dirty hands. Nasty place and bad leadership.

Review_Title: Understand why this resort is on many of the top hotel lists
Review_Text: My wife and I had the pleasure of staying at this resort for three nights on our recent tour of Morocco. We had high expectations of this hotel reading the reviews and they lived up to it. The service is exceptional and the hotel and grounds are the nicest we've seen throughout the world. As a Four Season (we've been to a few others) this is best of the best. Staff is well trained and go above and beyond with everything they do. Our first night we arrived my wife and were a little lost (yes it's that big of a hotel) and a restaurant manager noticed us. He immediately left the restaurant and walked us all the way to our door. He didn't give us directions send someone to bring us etc. Nope he dropped everything to ensure we immediately got back to our room. That's the type of service you don't see many places. The grounds are beautiful and so fragrant with the ground staff using rakes and their hands instead of mechanical devices to avoid noises to the guests. Loved the automated temperature scanning of guests as you enter the property.    Our only complaint was about the maintenance to the pool and the decision to move the children to the couples pool. We were looking forward to spending some downtime at the pool along with other guests from our tour and others we met in the hotel. Each day we attempted to use the pool we were frustrated with one family of 6 children 2 parents and a nanny who decided the pool was theirs alone. The children screamed splashed and harassed other guests until they left. The lifeguards attempted to talk to the parents twice but the parents got upset and ranted that their children were only being children. Management never intervened to resolve the issues. What disappointed us was the decision to put the children with the couples in the first place. It appeared only half of the family pool was under work so not sure why the children use that half. I did note this in my feedback directly to the hotel management and they apologized for the inconvenience and noted the both pools are now open. That's great for those there now but in the future recommend against mixing couples and children as some of are on vacation to relax and not battle ill behaved children. Also advise management to update guests when work is done on pools and other areas prior to arrival so guests can reschedule if needed.    Overall great experience and we will definitely return and stay at the Four Seasons Resort Marrakech on our next trip to Marrakeck and recommend you stay there also. It's one of the best resorts in the world.

Review_Title: Perfect stay in an amazing hotel
Review_Text: This was not an intended visit but afterwards I was very glad that I had to spend two nights there beautiful rooms and friendly helpful staff and a gorgeous setting. The scrambled eggs at breakfast were probably the best that I have ever enjoyed from a buffet however they could do with proper wholewheat bread to accompany it.

This resort is magnificent! The grounds are well kept. We enjoyed taking early morning walks around the property. The gardens are lush- lots of orange and olive trees as well as tall palms. Many fountains and places to sit and enjoy the outdoors. They have two large swimming pools adult and family. The restaurants and spa are very good. Our room came with a large balcony and a full view of the adult swimming pool. The room is spacious well maintained and nicely decorated. Pillows and bed are comfortable. The bathroom is spacious and comes with complete amenities. Wifi connection throughout the property is stable and strong. Staff are outstanding! They are pleasant attentive and accomodating. They made us feel welcome when we first arrived till our departure and every time during our stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Four Seasons was the perfect oasis/retreat from the bustling city. We loved staying here and the ladies at reception were exceptional.the food at the bar/lounge area was great specially the burger -best I’ve ever had !!  We look forward to visiting again .

Review_Title: Tired and outdated Hotel: worst of the 5* hotels in Marrakech
Review_Text: We stayed in August for 3 nights.    The entire stay from start to finish is the worst I have experienced in many years. I will go as far as to say the front office manager is the rudest individual I have come across in 25 years of international travel.    The check in process was very poor nothing was explained regarding the changes due to covid such as the process of gym bookings or where the hotels facilities were located (the next morning I was asked to leave the gym as I hadn't booked). The rooms were small and outdated compared to the Fairmont and Oberoi (both were hotels we had stayed at during our 10 day stay). Even after fighting for an upgrade the room was not on par with what other hotels were offering.    Rooms remained uncleaned even at 3pm - we were told they normally have until 4pm. This was completely unacceptable for us and I'm sure any family with children would agree. The kids area and young adult centre had broken cues broken playsation controllers missing pool balls. It was embarrassing to see the four seasons in such a state.    In summary I would avoid. There are many 5* options that are infinitely better.

Review_Date: Gabriel B wrote a review Aug 2021
Review_Text: We stayed in a 2200 sqft villa very expensive but worth every penny. The place was spectacular the grounds amazing the service was remarkable through the use of the Four Seasons app. absolutely recommended.

One of the best Hotel/Resorts we have stayed at. Whilst we had high standards for the Four Seasons - the staff here were absolutely amazing and went above and beyond to assist us during our stay.    If you have kids (all ages) there's lots to keep them entertained in the kids clubs! Child Minding Service - was fantastic!    Hotel was very close to most sites around Marrakech facilities were always clean and of the highest standard.    Great place to relax and unwind and enjoy the tranquil surroundings of the hotels vast grounds.    Staff once again fantastic all round.    We will be back!

Review_Title: Four Seasons Resort Marrakech, a piece of paradise.
Review_Text: ultimate luxury very nice stay i loved itResort Marrakech a piece of paradisethis is the real Marrakech  I will visit again  In my best special time Eating sleeping swimming relaxing was so beautiful

Much better than Four Season Casablanca. Great attitudes and service. Fantastic property. Breakfast so much better than Four Seasons Casablanca. Not a huge buffet but the best breakfast we had in all of Morocco.. Great pool area. Loved the property and glad we choose it.

We booked a Patio suite with private pool for family of 2 adults and 3 children. It’ll the room was perfect very spacious and very clean. House keeping visited twice a day. Staff were very helpful anything extra we needed they provided. Extra necessities provided for baby without asking. Badr at reception was exceptional and went over and beyond to accommodate us he was very nice with the kids and has very good communication skills and forms a fantastic face for the hotel. Lena (manager) at Quattro breakfast provided exceptional customer service we had a slight problem and she went out of her way to rectify it and make us feel very comfortable. She epitomises what a manger should be like she is a credit to four seasons.  Amazing hotel and stay.

Thank you for my 8 day stay in Morocco. As a single women traveling alone it was nice to have a driver available at all times. Im thankful for Ayoub the driver who took great care to show me the city and recommend some of the must see places.

Came to the Four Seasons just as a guest to avail of the day pass pool/lunch. We were staying in a riad as only in Marrakech for 3 days and wanted to spend most of the time sightseeing. Given the extreme heat we needed a break. Hotel is outstanding will certainly be returning as a guest during my next opportunity to travel. Having stayed at several FS properties around the world we expected it to be great but had thought the service might be a little lacking as we weren’t residents. How wrong we were?!… From the moment we entered we were made to feel like royalty until the moment we left. 10am-midnight (it was that good we stayed for dinner and then some…) The hotel itself the grounds etc are absolutely stunning. The food and service is top notch. A special shout-out to Tariq who is a true gentleman and a kind-hearted man. It was a pleasure to meet him. All the other staff by the pool and in the outdoor restaurant by the fountains were excellent. It was a truly memorable day and I look forward to returning as a guest. Not a single negative comment to note! Bravi!

Review_Date: The Nomad wrote a review Jul 2021
Review_Text: This is a beautiful resort in marrakech. We stayed here in July with 2 families. This hotel is on a large area of land close to the D'jma Al fana area. The resort is like an oasis in the middle of the city. There was a problem with our room when we first got there and we were immediately upgraded and moved. The hotel restaurant  grounds and staff were all outstanding. There was plenty to occupy the kids. The lady who is the guest services coordinator is truly outstanding. I thoroughly enjoyed my stay.

Review_Title: Place of tranquility, quality and service.
Review_Text: I have travelled extensively around Morocco over the years and always seemed to have missed staying at The Four Seasons Marrakech. Well as the saying goes you save the best till last!!!    I have been blown away by the peaceful tranquility of an amazing hotel in central Marrakech. The service is sublime and the overall beauty and quality of the property is without doubt the best I have experienced in Morocco.    My bedroom is perfect room service and housekeeping exceptional and when I have had two issues to be resolved both have been handled speedily and without fuss.    Sitting by the pool yesterday evening and having drinks and snacks was such a relaxing experience and of course the weather helps but everything about this place says quality service and customer care at the highest order.    They have a children’s pool with all the toys and the main pool is luxury. I had a superb lunch at the poolside restaurant yesterday. Simple Classical food done brilliantly well and the breakfast this morning with excellent covid protections In place was as good as it gets. There are staff everywhere always on hand to help and not hiding from the guests as happens in so many hotels.    This is without doubt the best resort I’ve experienced outside the Far East resorts. I know people like to read complaints and negatives but here there are genuinely non because even when I needed things sorted out in my room it was done promptly and to my satisfaction.    It’s truly worth a visit so you can see for yourself.

Review_Date: Lanita M wrote a review May 2021
Review_Text: My husband and I stayed here when we left another property. It was absolutely amazing and we should have booked it to begin with. From the food to the service and the well maintained rooms. We LOVED it. I don't believe we had one thing to say that was negative.

Just outside the busy medina with easy access to the Valleys. Superb food in Quattro restaurant with very well trained staff. We had 2 rooms next to each other within a separate "enclave" which proved very useful as a family with 2 young kids

Best place to stay in Marrakech ! Caring staff and beautiful installations along with beautiful Olive trees garden.  ‘Un havre de paix’. In the morning you’re awaken by beautiful birds singing @ your balcony too.

Review_Date: Lee L wrote a review Oct 2020
Review_Title: Wonderful Experience ! Staff service is just impeccable
Review_Text: I was staying at the residence the service was warm and friendly it mades my stay a truly enjoyable and memorable one. Abderrahim Ait el kadi the bellhop look after me very well he showed me around the places and also help me to take lots of amazing photos. I will return as soon as the government guidelines on traveling changes. Thank you!

I visited the four seasons marrakech last year. Its a beautiful resort! Very kind und professional service and nice environment! The staff is very kind und helpful. My special thanks to the bellboy Abderrahim hit el Kadi who provided me a lot of warm and helpful advices during my stay.    Thank you very much!

Amazing service food beautiful grounds. Exceeded our expectations in many ways. Beautiful pool and restaurant/dinning areas. Lovely suites with private terraces.. very quiet and relaxing perfect choice for some sunshine in August the weather was very dry and heat extremely pleasant!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We had a great experience in the four seasons. wonderful pool. great bar food. nice breakfast. excursion to desert is highly recommended. The gym is first class. all in all definitely worth going. The only downside is that it is not directly in the main tourist area.

Love this hotel we have stayed here twice now as a family. Everything about the Four Seasons in Marrakech is amazing the lobby smells incredible the rooms are beautiful crisp sheets beautiful personalised touches  wonderful views from the balconies. We have travelled with our children each time and the staff are so attentive to them little gifts in the room nothing is too much trouble. The hotel offers free food for under 5's which has been amazing for our little one and the kids club wow the staff are incredible. Our son had the best time at the kids club with his little friend (who was French) absolutely exceptional service snacks included and they will even take them to lunch all together (at no cost) we were blown away it could easily rival a high end English nursery. The pool staff are wonderful bringing complimentary iced water and a pool side meal service (which was really amazing food). The pool is heated and there is a jacuzzi hot tub too. Nothing is too much trouble I forgot some medication and asked at reception and they sent their driver to the pharmacy to get the medication and only charged us the few pounds of the cost of the item. Just incredible. We love everything about the four seasons Marrakech everything from the smoothies in the morning to the evening meals one of my most favourite places in the whole world.

We really loved this property. It’s huge so walking around town from this location is not doable but taxis are easily accessible via the staff. Spa was great especially for those who don’t want to venture off to experience a hammam. The property really has everything you need. Only drawback is the location which is only about a 10 minute drive from everything so no walking around which might be best. Staff was wonderful especially Hannna who located a personal liaison for my wife and I so  She could go shopping and skip all the low quality establishments. Highly recommended property for those who want a lot of space and great pools to lounge by.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Javed K wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: We stayed four days during the Coronavirus Pandemic when President Trump banned all travel to the USA. Let me just tell you that I spent over two hours with the front desk trying to get connected with the airline US Embassy and they helped me book another flight home. I cannot say enough good things about the staff at the Four Seasons Marrakech.    We flew in early morning and arrive at the hotel around 9am significantly earlier than check-in time. The front desk was so welcoming and offered us breakfast while they got a room ready for us so we can check in early. I used my American Express Fine Hotel & Resorts card so we received additional benefits such as complimentary breakfast $100 spa credit room upgrade late checkout etc.    I cannot give enough praise to the hotel staff. Within a few hours the staff new our names went above the call of duty to make our stay memorable. The room was nice and cozy as were upgraded to a view overlooking the pool. Snacks were in the room they gave us plenty of complimentary water bottles and even when we hit the pool they gave us plenty of water bottles.    For those with kids this is probably the best hotel in Marrakech. They have a children's club which my 7 and 3 year old loved. It also gave us the ability to leave the kids behind so we could have some alone time at dinner. Lots of games and very friendly staff in the kids club.    The breakfast was nice although the same foods every day. I wish they offered more traditional Moroccan foods like tagine and harira soup as I've seen at other hotels in Morocco. The smoothies or as they call detox drinks where tremendous as were the nutella crapes.    Dinner was nice we tried all the restaurants. The kids love pizza so even for lunch we tried the restaurant in the lobby and they went to another restaurant by the pool to get us pizza.    I always collect Four Seasons hats and although they did not sell this in the boutique the shop gave me a green hat which I did not like and the front desk gave me a yellow one which I loved and refuse to take my money. This is the extra service you expect from Four Seasons.    In the early hours of March 12th Trump banned all travel back to the USA so we were stressed about being stranded. The hotel was so nice and made accommodations for us and spent two hours with us to do so.    Another plus the hotel offers a guide for 550 MAD to visit the medina. They have their own taxis that they use so you don't have to worry about getting ripped off. They give you the option to use their luxury cars albeit expensive or they can call a taxi for you which is much cheaper. I liked the options.    My wife had a hamman and loved the experience. I visited the spa and pools and liked it. My only complaint is that both hot tubs (jacuzzi) outside and in the spa are not hot at all. My only other complaint was that we frequently saw ants in our room and each day of our stay. I wouldn't expect this at a Four Seasons.    There is also a teen club with a basketball hoop pool table and air hockey. What am amazing place for families.    Thank you everyone at the Four Seasons Marrakech for an unbelievable stay. After leaving this hotel we stayed at the Four Seasons Casablanca and that hotel did not come remotely close to living up to the Marrakech experience. I would recommend anyone to stay here as you will be grateful as it's much more low key and chill versus staying in the medina walls which is crowed polluted and hard to navigate through.

Review_Date: Wiam K wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: I was so lucky to stay at the four seasons marrakech. Best hotel at the city.by the products facilities and the services provided by the staff. My stay was amazing one by the warn welcoming and assistance of badr from receptionthe care and the attention and the wonderful discussion I had with Rashid from guest service.of course I will not forget that mahasine was attentive and friendly and delivering great serviceby assisting and taking care of the preferences marouane one of the staff from the bar lounge will makes you feel u did a great choice to stay at the hotel by his recommendationsassistance and care.team of room service were delivering high level of service at well.    Thank you so much for making my stay an amazing I liked the hotel a lot for sure I will come back and I will always recommend

Review_Title: Fantastic hotel - amazing staff and services
Review_Text: We spent a week at the Four Seasons in Marrakech in October 2019 for half term. We went as a family with two kids aged 3 and 8. We had two connecting rooms one with a living room.  Overall the experience was what you can expect from Four Seasons. Excellent service at all levels from check-in to all the restaurants room service kids club spa sport...  You can see how well run the hotel is when everything is delivered smoothlessly by the staff. They all know what who you are what allergies you have what you prefer... needs you didn't know you had are being met discretely. The staff clearly goes beyond their duties in order to help you whatever you need and ensure whatever you needed was delivered.  Most things were arranged prior to arrival thanks to the hotel: private guided tours baby sitter for the 3-yr old spa program golf rounds... We only added swimming lessons for our older boy.  one magical experience that remains anchored in our boys memory is the sunset and evening in the Agafay desert at Inara Camp. This was of course organised by the hotel. We had a camel ride before being able to enjoy the sunset and a delicious dinner under the stars.  Thank you so much to all the staff at the hotel that contributed to our fantastic stay at Four Seasons. We are looking forward to coming back.

We liked our stay in Four Seasons Marrakech a lot. It is a small city so although it is not walking distance to the Medina it is a very short taxi ride away.    The hotel itself was generally very quiet except the busy breakfast with two very large pools separated for families and adults. There are plenty of places to rest and relax around the property.    We visited the spa and I think they could do better the Hammam and spa space was very small compared to hotels of this size around the world.    Our room was spacious and comfortable with a large balcony to enjoy the Moroccon sun. The only issue I have with the room was that it gets too much noise from the corridors and the plumbing system of the building. For light sleepers this can be an issue.    Overall I think this is a very good hotel with standart Four Seasons luxuries.

Review_Date: Ms Sparkle wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Title: Wonderful hotel with attentive and friendly staff
Review_Text: I came here on a business trip for lunch and to view the hotel and it’s facilities and can honestly say it was delightful! The food we were served was beautifully prepared and the staff were attentive and friendly. We had lunch with Karima and she was so friendly and helpful with any of our queries. She gave an excellent tour of the stunning hotel and beautiful grounds. Everything about our visit was special and I would happily visit here again.

My mom and I stayed at the Four Seasons in Marrakech for 5 days and our experience was flawless. The room was amazing the staff were friendly and helpful the facilities were beautiful. We also booked a trip through them to the Atlas Mountains and Essaouria our driver (I believe his name was Faisal) was very kind! He found us a guide both places we went and everything went perfectly with him. I would definitely recommend the hotel and the tour services as well!

Review_Title: This was our last stop in a 10-days Morocco visit
Review_Text: Its good if you want to be in a local-themed hotel and experience excellent spa time (hamam specials) at the end of a hectic historical trip. Their outdoor swimming pool surrounded by palm trees is beautiful with sunbeds. The rooftop terrace and dining is good too.

Poor service We arrived around noon I was told if will be ready for check in at 2:30pm after I asked a few times as they send us to wait in the restaurant for long time without telling us when... then I asked them if I should come back to reception for check in or someone will come to us replied just wait by the pool. By 3:30 no one came to us and I went to reception again myself finally got in. When I said I was told ready to check in at 2:30pm they replied their check in time is 3pm. I said it doesn’t matter to me 2:30pm or 3pm my point is when you told me 2:30pm someone will come to us then someone should have come to us at least 3pm. But no one came to us one hour later. I was stuck there waiting. I could have gone for swimming or do other things. The person says he will report it to the manager and come back to us never happened. At check out I mentioned it he didn’t bother again to remind me their check in time is 3pm totally ignored my point.    After check out I realise I left my facial cream in the bathroom as I have friends who are going to Marrakesh the following week I asked if they have found reply is no. I am 100% sure that I left in the bathroom as I used shortly before check out in the bathroom. Luckily only a facial cream !!!    Facility is ok much busier than Amaneja service is much better there. All super friendly & attentive service won’t ignored you such a way

Review_Date: Ramsha A wrote a review Mar 2020
Review_Text: My husband and I went to Marrakech on our honey moon and stayed at the four seasons for about 8-9 days. It was absolutely amazing! The resort itself is stunning and all the employees go out of there way to help you and give you great recommendations on where to eat and what to do! Highly recommend! Also it smells AMAAAAZING there. I wish I knew what they were using in the hallways because I was in love!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A Four Seasons in Every Sense
Review_Text: The facilities are top notch. The service is impeccable. We needed very little in addition but when we asked for something it was delivered with a smile and a recommendation. Those little ideas really added to our enjoyment.

Review_Date: Nicolas G wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Title: A peaceful oasis in the city
Review_Text: Beautiful pools and excellent services with a very good morrocan restaurant. Large and elegant room as expected from this type of hotel. Very helpful friendly and attentive staff. Our room was very nice but noisy due to hotel trolleys being moved outside.

Review_Date: Daniel C wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Title: Four night stay in balcony guest room overlooking the central fountains.
Review_Text: The Four Seasons is much more than just a resort anyone can stay in a Riad but you come to this hotel for the service. Sonia Bendich our concierge arranged excursions with the safest most reliable tour companies guides and drivers throughout the city. From hot air balloon rides with reputable companies to one of the most fantastic guides of Marrakech Adil. I recommend asking for Adil by name as a guide throughout the city. He knows everyone in Marrakech was able to get reservations at any restaurant at a moments notice very educated in the history of Marrakech and was able to tailor our experience to our interests. From the best food cultural sites excursions and places to buy specific items. He even haggled on our behalf in shops and in the souks! I had arranged a surprise engagement as well as a surprise family visit with partial planning in advance and the rest as the trip progressed Sonia was able to make it all happen. At a moments notice we had a driver throughout the mountains to camels and a private dinner in the Agafay desert. I have traveled all over the world from Qatar to Bali to French Polynesia and Europe and this experience was one of the best I have ever had. All due to the service provided. Thank you again!

Review_Date: Joanne T wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: My family and I have just returned from a break at this wonderful resort and we could not be happier. We returned feeling relaxed refreshed and rested. It is the most enjoyable and interesting holiday we have ever had overseas.    The property is stunning and the staff attentive and genuinely friendly and engaging. My children aged 6 and 10 had the time of their lives enjoying a luxurious suite with private terrace family pool and absolutely amazing kids club. The team at the kids club are fantastic with the children and so enthusiastic particularly at an evening Pirate Party or 'soiree'. Yasmin Imane and the rest of the team took no time at all to get to know our children very well and were very flexible in when and for how long the children could attend the club. The range of activities were varied and interesting; Bread making model making talent shows yoga football the list is endless.    The adult pool was serene and calm plenty of sunbeds available. The family pool well appointed with water toys and activities. There was even a very shallow covered pool available as part of the kids club.Particular mention to Muhammed the life guard who was great with the kids at the pool and came to the aid of our youngest when he needed help.    I found the 40 acre gardens to be immaculately kept and enjoyed strolling around the peaceful array of fountains features and plant displays.    The breakfast buffet in the Quattro restaurant had a wide array of items including fresh fruit cereals baked goods hot food and freshly made to order pancakes crepes and eggs. We found the earlier we attended the quieter it was and we enjoyed the service of many attentive staff who went out of their way to engage with our children helping them into their chairs asking them which soccer team  they supported etc. Our 10 year old even commented about how friendly everyone in Morroco is! Youssane gets our compliments at breakfast thank you for your service.    As well as the luxury of the resort we took a guided trip to The Medina and Souks as organised by the concierge and it was a great way to see the hustle and bustle of the old town - a true flavour of Marrakech.    With only a 10 minute transfer from the airport everything is so seamless and easy.    I will truly miss waking up to a magical call to prayer overlooking the misty High Atlas Mountains at dawn.

Review_Date: Toby W wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: Our family of 4 (children aged 7 and 9) have stayed at the Four Seasons in Marrakech for February half term. All in all it has been a great holiday and the hotel has lived up to expectations in most areas.    We have stayed in a number of Four Seasons resorts around the globe so have a good benchmark against which to evaluate. We had a pool view suite (70m2) in the main Pavillon wing which was very well appointed and clean.  If you opt for a room in the Pavillion we would suggest you ask for the top floor as if you have several people walking on the stone floors in the rooms above you it can become a little irritating. All staff were very friendly and the concierge very efficient at arranging trips out with very knowledgable guides. Our visits to the Medina and also to Berber villages in the mountains were excellent.    We tried all 3 restaurants. Service was a little slow in the Moroccan within the pavilion however the food was great and always served with a smile. The Italian served great fish and the daytime pool restaurant is a nice relaxed outdoor space.    Alcohol can be a little on the expensive side as you would expect (wine from 50 Euros a bottle beer 10 Euros). Should you not have breakfast included in your room rate factor in that it will cost 120 Euros for a family of 4 per day if your children are aged 6 or over. We were aware of that when making our booking.    Breakfast is a buffet with a good variety for all however can be busy if you time it wrong. During our visit in February it was too cold for most families to want to eat outdoors before 10am hence everybody inside. Great omelettes!!    Family pool is a very good space and despite being during a school holiday was not overly busy. 50% of the pool is heated the remainder not however that is probably not an issue in the heat of Summer. We noticed that the cement edges of the pool had broken away during our visit and some small mosaic tiles from the jacuzzi pool had become loose and led to cuts on a couple of children’s feet. The adult pool looked pleasant and a lot quieter!    Our children did not use the kids club although the itinerary looked comprehensive. The young adults club had a pool table table tennis basketball games console and a cinema    Our overall evaluation of the hotel is positive. It is not the best Four Seasons hotel at which we have stayed however the staff were excellent enthusiastic and extremely friendly. We would recommend.

From the moment you enter the beautiful grounds.you know this is a very well run hotel. Immaculate gardens and attractive low level buildings in Moroccan style speak volumes. Relaxed reception with very well dressed staff creates just the right impression. Very comfortable room immaculately presented and at least 2 good places to fine rounded off our arrival. If you want comfort and have the the cash - enjoy.

The hotel is relay amazing! The staff incredible! Unfortunately we didn’t stay there but we went for a drink! Everyone there is always smileyvery kind and very very welcome ! We felt like home and this is the best hospitality that I ever received!! Thank you for everything! You did a great job !

Review_Title: An amazing holiday facilitated by outstanding hospitality
Review_Text: My boyfriend and I stayed for 4 days in June-July. I had contacted the hotel prior to arrival about celebrating my boyfriends graduation. They said they would put a little bottle of champagne and balloons in the room for us. However they actually put rose petals all over the bathroom balloons champagne and a mini cake saying congratulations. Then the next night we get back and they provide another bottle of champagne and a cake for him - beyond any expectations we had!    On arrival we were whisked away in the golf buggy and relaxed by the pool whilst we waited for our room to be ready. When we got to the room we realised we had been upgraded to the Pavilion Patio Room. This came with a massive walk in wardrobe bathroom and patio area with a cute nook.    The adult pool was lovely and relaxing and the shrive was brilliant. Free water in water coolers was provided by the pool and the staff were very attentive. Free treats were brought once a day around the pool (such as coconut covered frozen mango sticks).    The restaurants were lovely and smoking shisha in the bar overlooking the resort was a relaxing way to end the evening.    We request and book a tour around the Medina with a personal guide. He picked us up from the hotel and walked us around the Medina giving a little history to it and took us to some of the better shops in the souks. This was great and organised by the hotel!    Breakfast was amazing the buffet spread was outstanding with a vast array of foods.    We loved it so much and continually talk about the holiday and will definitely return!

Visited with our sons in December holidays.  Marrakech Medina is busy and noisy. Didn’t want to stay in that area. Chose this hotel for that exact reason. Besides the brand name guaranteed a great stay!  Rooms were substantial and provided tons of amenities. Our sons’ room was closer to the pool and was much bigger than ours. Ours was in the hotel and overlooked the garden! The balcony was beautiful allowing us to enjoy breakfast or coffee privately.  Sometimes getting taxis to get to the medina took longer than expected. Takes less than 10min to get to Jema al F’na Market.  Swimming clay court tennis gym and spa were clean and well worth a visit.  Staff was very helpful and ready to help at all times.

A family holiday. Hotel was fabulous staff attentive. Perfect time to visit Marrakech as the weather was great and we made use of the beautiful pool and facilities. If you want to stay in the hotel the Italian restaurant is very good

Review_Title: Fabulous stay at Four Seasons Marrakech
Review_Text: My partner and I recently spent a lovely 5 nights at this hotel. The hotel kindly upgraded us to a lower pavilion one bed suite with a pool. The room was really nice and spotlessly clean.    The gardens and grounds around the hotel are beautiful and peaceful.    We spent a couple of hours each day at the adults only pool. Service was great and the food at the pool side restaurant was very good - for us it was the best food we ate at the hotel.    There is also a very well equipped gym and good spa with separate sections for men and women. Found it a bit odd to find women wandering around in the men’s section though!    We also had a couple of good Moroccan style meals in the Azzara restaurant. Ate once at Quattro and neither of us rated the food. Ordered medium rare rack of lamb that came well done and dry. Similarly we found the breakfast buffet underwhelming.    Service at all the restaurants and around the resort is first rate and all the staff are unfailingly helpful.    It’s a little way out from the center and not really walkable to the center. About 10 minutes in a taxi. You could walk but it’s not a particularly pleasant walk.    Would stay here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The Four Seasons is a top class hotel. Nothing is too much trouble the staff are friendly efficient and helpful. The facilities are fantasic. The rooms are exceptionally clean and comfortabe. I would highly recommend staying there

Review_Date: zara s wrote a review Feb 2020
Review_Text: Well.. where can I start with four seasons... I visited their hookah/sheesha bar almost every evening whilst my stay at marrakech. The place was super super comfortable beautiful and the staff and their service was really 100% remarkable. They tried their best to make sure everything was on point for their customers. Their security and the way their protect their customers was impressive. Their sheesha were on point one of the best I’ve had. I must say the view was breathtaking the atmosphere too. They go the extra mile. And I liked that.

I could not make a choice and had to split my stay between several hotels. Four Seasons was high on my list and I did not regret it. Everything is perfect in particular service. I really enjoyed the outdoor heated pool (majority of 5* have heated pools in winter). Mornings v cold but what a delight to have a swim in the afternoon when it is warm and sunny (in January ... less than 4 hours from London).  The good thing about the hotel is that it is a bit isolated from the city and therefore peaceful and a great place to relax from the busy city. The drawback is that although it is walking distance from the Menara Gardens a taxi is necessary for the other places of interest but not a bad thing given walking is Marrakech is quite tiring.  The food I had was excellent.

Review_Title: Most likely the best stay in Marrakech
Review_Text: I had a wonderful 5 night stay at the Four Seasons Marrakech.  The rooms are spacious and amazing always clean and got everything you could need.  Always bottled water in the room and they seem to clean it every time you leave the room so that was amazing.  The hotel breakfast is fantastic tailored to everyone.  We tried the room service it was a bit slow but when it did arrive I must say it was my best experience of room service and in room dining ever. You feel like they transform your area into a restaurant table.  I didnt use the SPA but the gym has everything you need and the pool is great.  The hotel is located so that you do have to get a taxi to and from the hotel but they help you get a taxi within minutes so that wasnt a problem for us.  Overall a lovely stay and I will definitely be coming back again

We had a wonderful stay at the hotel. Everything was great. Good service. Comfortable room. They didn’t have any hot spa. And jacuzzi wasn’t heated fully. We only had breakfast there and it was delicious.

While the room itself is not as new the common space (reception restaurant pool) is very nice. Wonderful service from the staff members. Environment more friendly and cozy than places like La Mamounia and Mandarin Oriental.

My fiancé and I stayed here for three nights. We had the most amazing stay. They arranged everything from transport to dining reservations and gave us amazing recommendations! Service was impeccable. The kind of hospitality you only get at luxury hotels. Highly recommend the resort.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jeff O wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: My wife had a meeting in Marrakech and we decided to stay for 5 nights to relax and celebrate.a milestone birthday. From beginning to end this was an exceptional experience. The staff is very attentive without being overbearing. The front desk is very resourceful and helped us enjoy the city and the surrounding area. Our room was quiet nicely furnished and up to date. The food and beverage operation is well managed and the food is great. Housekeeping is very good. The spa and fitness areas and the pool provide an opportunity to relax and recharge. The location is close to the city (5-10 minutes by taxi) but is away from the busy downtown area. This is a very well managed hotel that provides a luxurious experience in a totally unique part ot the world.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Gillian R wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: A haven to go to after the madness of the soul markets. The four seasons always exceeds my expectations. Abdelmoula from romm service spoilt us and went the extra mile to make our visit special. I would highly recommend staying here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Fantastic, Relaxation in Luxury From the Hustle and Bustle
Review_Text: A lovely hotel fantastic scenic views when you have breakfast outside with the fountains lovely spa and pool certainly a recommendation for anyone who wants some relaxation away from the crowds and bustle of Marrakech and square.I felt truly relaxed in luxury! Restaurants in the hotel also worth a visit one night lovely seating area on the terrace. If I ever return again to Marrakech in the future this hotel would certainly be the first choice on my list.

Loved my stay here. A beautiful property with a lovely spacious room and wonderful service. The food was amazing. Huge gym...prob one of the best I’ve seen at any hotel. I had always to stay here so finally was able to experience this!

Excellent services and special mention to Mr Alexandre and Mr Ismael ( Reception )  Since our arrival we were upgraded and from the beginning to the end the staff was extremely courteous. All our table reservations at various places were hassle free and managed very well by the reception/concierge
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Janet T wrote a review Jan 2020
Review_Text: The Four Seasons Marrakech is a spectacular oasis in a fascinating city. They treated us SO very well upgrading our family of four to an incredible room and catering to our every need. From whisking us in immediately to our room to the fruit baskets and holiday treats it was an extraordinary experience. I know that the riads are a very popular option but for those who want to be a little further away from the hustle of the Medina in a quiet extremely beautiful and tranquil setting you can't beat this hotel. Breakfasts were wonderful workout facilities great spa incredible. I just can't recommend this hotel enough. Thank you Four Seasons Marrakech we will be back!

Review_Title: Most likely the best stay in Marrakech
Review_Text: I had a wonderful 5 night stay at the Four Seasons Marrakech.  The rooms are spacious and amazing always clean and got everything you could need.  Always bottled water in the room and they seem to clean it every time you leave the room so that was amazing.  The hotel breakfast is fantastic tailored to everyone.  We tried the room service it was a bit slow but when it did arrive I must say it was my best experience of room service and in room dining ever. You feel like they transform your area into a restaurant table.  I didnt use the SPA but the gym has everything you need and the pool is great.  The hotel is located so that you do have to get a taxi to and from the hotel but they help you get a taxi within minutes so that wasnt a problem for us.  Overall a lovely stay and I will definitely be coming back again

Overall a lovely stay and I will definitely be coming back again

Review_Title: Excellent service, amazing rooms and outstanding pool experience
Review_Text: One of the best check-in experiences I have experienced. Lovely large rooms with very large bathroom including a sunk-in bath.  Very good quality food at breakfast.  Again one of the best pool services I have experience: providing lovely complementary cool snacks and a pic-nic basket with iced water as soon as you sit at the pool.

Review_Date: Aad v wrote a review Dec 2019
Review_Text: If there is a heaven this resort must be close to heaven! Just about everything is perfect! Where do I start; The arrival reception amenities gardens room bath room room service housekeeping bar guide swimming pool and restaurant it’s too much too mention! Everybody in this hotel/resort was do incredibly nice and helpful! I absolutely loved it

The resort is spectacular..from the staff the rooms the spa the pools..everything is so clean and well thought through. The restaurants have amazing food especially the Azzera..best food we had in Morroco for sure! Also try the massages..they are so relaxing!Definitely recommended! Thank you for making our vacations a bit more luxurious than what we expected to find in Marrakesh :) it was amazing!

The Four Seasons Marrakech is simply outstanding in my experience! I have stayed in numerous luxury hotels around the world and this one is hard to beat! The level of service and personal attention that one receives from every member of staff is exceptional throughout the resort! Everywhere is immaculate with beautiful grounds and great facilities. I will be returning frequently!

This is a beautiful resort. The room was large and expertly decorated to reflect Moroccan style. It was clean quiet and large. All was perfect- beds linens the view. The bathroom was large and clean also. There was a closet as well as a large balcony with a nice view of the mountains.  Service was impeccable- truly five stars. All members of the staff were professional gracious and accommodating. The resort is enclosed but it is possible to walk to the center of town. Ask reception for the quickest way.  I would definitely stay here again.

Review_Date: S Rogers wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Text: Excellent stay in Marakesh at the Four Seasons Hotel. Our first time in this fascinating city. Beautiful hotel exceptional customer service in all departments. Highly recommended. Would return in a flash !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Went for a few days to escape the terrible weather . Lovely resort with lovely family pool and quiet pool. Loads of sun loungers . Was a very peaceful time of year to visit. Staff very friendly and good fun. Food was really good in all 3 restaurants and the prices were high but not nearly as high as we had expected after reading some other reviews.  Room was lovely  we had Upper Pavilion no noise from anyone staying above .  Spa is beautiful and the free facilities to residents are worthwhile.  Would stay again
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Karen O’Connor wrote a review Nov 2019
Review_Title: A Peaceful Oasis that Pampers and Delights!
Review_Text: The resort is a lovely resort. It is close to the airport. I had a driver for when I needed to go to the medina or to meet someone off the property. The service was perfect the room was nicely appointed. There was a private garden outside where I could sit and relax. The inside sleeping area and bed were very comfortable. The staff pampered me and cared for me while I was there and after two days I felt like I was home.

We enjoyed 4 nights at this hotel in October (2019) and with one exception had a fabulous experience. We tried two of the restaurants and experienced great food and service. The service in the hotel was exactly what you would expect from a Four Seasons. The grounds were spectacular. We did have one horrible experience and I wish to share so that others do not have the same experience. There was an old rug in the room partially under the bed and settee which was an accident waiting to happen except we did not realize until my wife fell and injured her knee. The hotel responded the very best they could. The rug was removed immediately and the hotel apologized profusely. BUT A WARNING TO OTHERS: GET RID OF THIS TYPE OF LOOSE RUG THE MOMENT YOU CHECK INTO YOUR ROOM. P.S. We would still go back to this hotel if the opportunity presented itself.

The service was excellent and the hotel in perfect conditions. The food was delicious and the area of pool was amazing. The staff service was superb. I will definitively recommend as the best choice in Marrakech. Also the location is very central

My wife and I had a wonderful 4 nights at the Four Seasons. The staff could not have been more helpful and attentive the food and ambience of both the restaurants was superb. We will definitely being coming back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lars B wrote a review Nov 2019
