Review_Text: This hotel truly delivers a great 5 star experience. Staff is very professional. Highly recommended. We had a very comfortable and relaxing stay at the Four seasons in Marrakech. We have stayed at many 5 star resorts and this gave us that feeling of comfort that you expect from these hotels. The rooms will be needing a makeover in about ~5 years time but for now its still perfect. Pool area is very comfortable (we used the kids area because no kids were there). Spa is great breakfast is great. Felt very private even if the hotel was fully booked we almost did not see any other guests while we were there. This hotel comes highly recommended. cheking in was smooth. Car service was Perfect! thanks; will be coming back.

The hotel along with its villas is on 40 acres and the grounds are beautiful with numerous palm trees and flowering shrubs. There is a family pool and a quiet pool which is somewhere between 40 and 50 yards. It was great for doing laps. The attendants also pamper guests. One cleaned my sunglasses brought me a fresh towel after I dried off from swimming my laps brought me a wicker basket with a small ice chest filled with ice and bottled water inside and also brought me a raspberry popsicle.  Our room was huge. It was also very quiet. There are three excellent restaurants. One is a lunch place by the pool and another is an indoor/outdoor one by a large reflecting pool.  The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. I didn't want to leave this hotel.

My wife and I visited in mid to late October for our wedding anniversary as part of a 2 week vacation in Europe/Africa. What an amazing resort overall and definitely one of the best I have ever stayed at (and I have stayed at multiple 5 star resorts throughout the world)!    Service- absolutely phenomenal. From the front desk staff and concierge to housekeeping and wait staff everyone made us feel welcome and was always available to help with any task. We gave a list of restaurants we wanted to visit over the week to the front staff team and by the end of the day they had booked times and drivers to and from the restaurant. On more than one occasion we decided to change the reservation (timing or restaurant) and they were more than willing to help. Another thing about the private drivers it is 20 euros each way for the driver but we thought it was well worth avoiding dealing with taxis and also the drivers would walk us to the restaurant as well (especially helpful in the maze of the Medina!)    Food- We had breakfast everyday and always had great coffee juices and food to start the day. We ate dinner at Quattro and loved it. We also frequently had lunch at the poolside grill which also had amazing food and great drinks.    Location- Away from the hustle and bustle of the Medina but still close enough to be able to get there quickly for dinner or visits to the Medina.    Tours- The hotel set us up with a guide through the Medina. Our guide Aziz was absolutely amazing and took us to the palace souks and Jemaa el-Fnaa. If you can book a tour with him we would highly recommend it!    Overall an amazing trip and can't imagine a hotel with better service. Would love to come back someday!

We stayed for a week in October half term and had a lovely stay. Grounds and pools are brilliant really beautiful and pools are a perfect temperature. Our little boy enjoyed the kids club and the spa treatments were great. The room was nice enough water provided plentifully (although in plastic bottles would be great if there was an alternative). Our boy loved his little dressing gown.    Service on the whole was really good. The barman and a couple of the waiters in Quattro were particularly friendly and helpful. concierge desk and bellboys also notably helpful and friendly.    Food and drink were of a high quality well cooked - breakfast lunch and dinner. Not cheap but not OTT compared to other similar hotels elsewhere. some good recommendations of places to eat outside the hotel too. The kids menu had a decent International selection with some healthier options too would have loved a couple of Moroccan options on there. Some of the lunch specials in the pool restaurant were particularly tasty. Very drinkable Moroccan wines and some tasty cocktails.    A few small things that could be improved for us. A proper outside bar area for a pre dinner drink - there were just a couple of tables attached to the restaurants (appreciate it’s a Muslim country and maybe that’s why). Toiletries for kids in the rooms - no kids shampoo or shower gel. Gym could be better air conditioned (good equipment though). Stopping people reserving sun beds before breakfast (grrrrr - it wasn’t occasional it was about half the beds every day nearly all the front ones and sometimes the beds not then occupied until late morning). keeping the adult pool an adult pool - on two of the three occasions we went there were several kids in it. All very minor niggles!    It’s a well located hotel near the airport and near the city with lovely grounds brilliant pools and good food and wine. What’s not too like!

Our first trip to Marrakech and I cannot speak highly enough of this hotel. The hotel is up to usual high four seasons standards. The staff from reception through to waiting staff are all so friendly and helpful. The breakfast is superb and the spa is excellent. Thank you for great stay!

My wife and I had lunch at the pool restaurant. Very nice staff with excellent food. A destination restaurant. Everyone we encountered from the Resort entrance to the time we left the hotel we found nothing but accommodating First Class staff.

Just returned after a weeks stay and can honestly say it was the most amazing place with genuinely lovely staff members you're made to feel welcome from the moment you arrive.    We stayed in a double deluxe room as we travelled with our 15 year old the room was immaculate and furnished to a high standard and the beds were extremely comfortable!!    The hotels amenities are fab with something for everyone including kids pool spa young adults centre adult pool and gym etc.    Breakfasts were superb with a wide choice and we loved the crepe/omelette stations - something for everyone and great service. We mainly ate at Azzera for lunch by the pool and Inara in the evening - the only problem is we will struggle to get a decent Lebanese Meze now we are home in the UK!!    We ventured out a couple of times into Marrakech itself but in reality you dont want to leave the hotel!!    I would highly recommend and we will be coming back!

Review_Date: Daisy L wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: We first stayed 2 nights took a desert tour for 3 days and returned to the hotel for 2 more days. The service and attention to detail in this hotel is outstanding. We loved our stay all the way from the bar/lounge at night to the walks around the beautiful gardens. And the exotic scents of the hotel makes you not want to leave the premises. Loved the entire experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The receptionists were very friendly and attentive. The room was large with a view. The bed is high quality and I loved the different kind of drinks at the mini bar. The breakfast was great as well not like other hotels where the menus are usually limited. I really enjoyed my short stay there but I have one small “bad” remark one of the staff in the breakfast room asked me if I’m a Moroccan and when I told her that I was she said “then why are you speaking in english?” And I found that very inappropriate.  I highly recommend this hotel because of his strategic location as well.

Had the most AMAZING stay here. It was a special occasion (my daughters 21st birthday) and they added lots of extra treats for us. The staff are truly world class their attention to detail is 2nd to none I will return to Marrakech for the experience at this hotel. Cannot recommend highly enough. The hotel is beautiful as are the staff

Review_Date: L G wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: Short stay but very enjoyable. Suite very comfortable with all working amenitues; bed quality very high; breakfast choice varied and tasty. Staffs are attentionate and helpful.    Cocktails are deceiving and food at restaurants (except breakfast) is too much westernised to my tatste. I found the quality of the food not special enough to justify the price tag.    The hotel; spa; service: is very clean and definitely recommendable

My husband and I stayed at the Four Seasons Marrakech for a week this October. Our stay was wonderful and we can't say enough about the accommodations and the staff.  Upon check in we were upgraded and our room was very large and comfortable. It had 2 outside patio areas which overlooked the beautifully landscaped pool. There were fresh flowers and fruit in the room upon arrival which was a nice touch. The resort always made sure we had plenty of bottled water which was appreciated as most hotels will offer only one or two bottles gratis.  The grounds of there resort were stunning. The landscaping was beautiful and there were so many walkways and quiet seating areas. It was lovely. It was the perfect place for some serenity after maneuvering the busy streets of Marrakech. The lighting at night was spectacular and made you want to just sit and take it all in.  We ate at both restrauants and both were delicious. We didn't think they were overpriced in comparrison to other Four Seasons we've stayed at. We had drinks one night on the patio and its was lovely.  I think the thing that makes this resort stand out for us was the staff. From the moment we checked in until we checked out they went above and beyond. They remembered our names when they would pass us and would always stop to ask if our visit was alright. We asked to arrange for a private guide for one day and it was done with no problem. Our guide Mohammad was fantastic and we would highly recommend asking for him. We also requested a driver for a day to go to Essaouaria. Our driver Faisal was great! He answered all of our questions about life in Marrakech and pointed out great spots along the way. I would highly recommend asking for him also. The staff at the front desk was top notch. They were kind courteous helpful...everything you could ever want from hotel staff. They gave great recommendations for dinners and sightseeing. Cudos to the general manager for running such a fantastic place!

Nicely appointed rooms excellent service and a good location between the airport and the Medina. The property grounds are very pretty and offer pools a spa and restaurants on site. The concierge desk was helpful with recommendations and arranging any services that you might need including tours.

We stayed here for 3 nights we paid for the hotel pick up the chauffeur took our luggage from the arrival hall and told us we could connect to the in car WiFi to check our mail after our flight. Check in was relaxed we were told to take a seat on the sofas and a staff member came over to check us in and then took us to our room on a buggy.    The room was huge gorgeous immaculate faultless much like the rest of the hotel really! The food was delicious they would make you any cocktail you desired we loved the rooftop bar simply a beautiful place to stay.    We also went on a tour of the souks which reception organised for us this was great to get out and about and see it all.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Graet hotel with so much to do.
Review_Text: Luxurious resort is a fantastic escape from touristy and busy Marrakesh. Rooms are comfy and service great. Resort is rather big suitable for families friends and business. I like little details like red roses traditional sitting ares fantastic art works hanging on the wall. In the evening there is a great dining experience set in luxurious Arabic decor with live music. It just feels like being in Afrina. During the day there are so many things to do for all ages. What makes it suitable for longer stay. There is a swimming pool kids pool and club tennis court very well equipped gym and cardio room more dining options and spa. You can pop in spa anytime you like and just chill and relax before experiencing more adventures in Marrakesh.

Review_Date: Sheila O wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Title: Beautiful hotel and very comfortable rooms!
Review_Text: Having spent four nights there in September I would say it is a wonderful respite from the crowds in central  Marrakech. Beautiful pool are that the breakfast buffet is wonderful! The only downside is that it doesn't seem  as authentic as staying in a riad. However it is truly beautiful and restful.

Review_Date: Barry H wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: The Four Seasons at Marrakech offers very friendly service very comfortable and spacious rooms with good amenities and an excellent set of pools and spa services. The staff is highly attentive and remembers personal preferences all with an amiable and competent attitude.

Marrakech is fantástic . And Four Seasson is the best in Marrakech The staff and the service were excelent  The pool and spa the garden all are perfect  I remember allways my stay in the hotel and recomend you
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Wow.....talk about me not wanting to leave. When we got there our rooms were not ready. We decided to go to have lunch at the hotel. When we were about to pay one of the guys from the reception came to let us know that our rooms were ready and that since we had to wait we didnt have to pay for lunch! He put on my backpack and walked us to our room. During lunch Pierre the resort manager come up to us and introduced himself. He gave me his business card and told me to call him if I needed anything. When we would see him throughout our stay he kept asking us if there was anything he could do for us.  The suites were very comfortable and clean. Food at the restaurant and the breakfast buffet was delicious. Customer service all around the property was top notch. I got a hamman at the spa. What a great experience. The pool and the jaccuzi area were relaxing. I can go on and on. If you can stay here you wont regret it. About a ten min ride to the airport and the middle of everything. Very safe.

We arrived from a previous stay at the Royal Mansour so expected a ‘step down’. However we couldn’t have been more wrong. Following a very warm greeting we were given an upgrade to one of the large and well furnished pavilion terrace rooms. The beds are very comfortable turn down was always well done and coffee always replenished. The breakfast buffet was very good if perhaps a little expensive. The grounds of the hotel are stunning - it feels more like a resort. Both the family and adult pools are stunning. The pool service was excellent - try the pizzas as they are delicious. The hotel kindly provided a Range Rover to whisk us back to the airport. This is a superb hotel. In fact we couldn’t fault it. Thank you four seasons for a wonderful stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: It was a short getaway but would go back in a heartbeat
Review_Text: The location of the hotel is just perfect. Well situated. We asked for a tour guide whilst we were out there. He was very nice and knowledgeable. The food throughout our trip had been incredible. From their buffet breakfast to the couscous tajine... delightful.  I would strongly recommend this Four Seasons hotel and cannot wait to return.

Although we were staying in a smaller boutique Riad in the town in Marrakech we decided to book a pool day with lunch on one of the days during our trip at The Four Seasons and we were't disappointed. From the minute we arrived the service was second to none. The attention to detail is completely on point and we were made to feel incredibly welcome even though we weren't actually staying in the hotel. We booked the package with lunch and the food and the service was absolutely suburb and exceptionally good value. All the staff were fantastic - explaining where the facilities were including complimentary suncream and hats! We enjoyed ourselves so much that we booked a second day two days later. Thank you to the whole team you were all fabulous and we will most certainly return.

We spent three nights here celebrating our 40th anniversary. We had a few minor housekeeping snafus that were immediately addressed and the staff spoiled us from there on and made our stay memorable for all of the right reasons. We had an upper pavilion room looking out over the pool with a private sunning patio a nice sized bathroom and excellent amenities. The hotel location is not necessarily within walking distance of anything but a nice public garden but is a short drive from the Medina and most of the key sights. The staff are wonderful--well trained professional and polite. The pool is amazing with comfy loungers and attentive pool staff. The restaurants are limited with one primary breakfast/dinner option and a bar area with food options as well. We ate at both and found the food to be excellent. The breakfast buffet is very good as well. It is a very large resort-style property with beautiful grounds. All in all a great experience.

Review_Title: Fantastic stay - beautiful hotel and attentive service
Review_Text: I booked this trip as a surprise birthday gift to my wife. From start to finish the service was fantastic and the attention to detail provided by the hotel surpassed my expectations despite having stayed in many 5* hotels around the world.    Prior to arrival I emailed to request a cake or similar for my wife to which I received an email back the same day. Upon arrival we found a table complete with flowers rose petals cake and a bottle of Prosecco on ice - all complimentary.    The remainder of our stay was perfect the pool areas were beautifully kept and service by the pool team was fantastic. They asked to clean my sunglasses provided ice cold smoothies and chocolate ice cream pops (these are addictive!!)    On our last day our flight was in the evening so hotel kept our luggage whilst we relaxed then took us and our luggage via buggy to the fitness suite to shower and freshen up before our flight.    Food wise breakfast offered a fair variation and was tasty. We only ate in the hotel restaurant on our last day for convenience however the sea bass Tajine with chermoula and couscous was probably the best thing we ate whilst in marrakech. Fish was flakey and soft and the chermoula marinade and sauce was fantastic - upon telling the waiter how much we enjoyed the dish he asked if we wanted the recipe and returned with a list of ingredients from the chef!    Overall I can not recommend this hotel enough - service was diligent and unobtrusive the app to request services is also handy the hotel is beautifully maintained and rooms are comfortable and well sized (nice bed linen too!)    Do not hesitate to book here!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Flemming L wrote a review Oct 2019
Review_Text: To celebrate my 50th we wanted to do something special and the choice was Four Seasons in Marrakech. The experience was fantastic in terms of staff friendliness the room and the restaurants. I even got a surprise birthday cake in the room. We also found the pool facilities and pool service great.  A very impressive experience.

I stayed in a Garden Patio room room and garden area lovely however the noise (moving furniture) from inconsiderate guests from the room above was frustrating to say the least. Would have been better off paying less for an upper floor room and having a little more peace and quiet. All other elements of my stay were perfect....

Four Seasons Marrakech is a beautiful hotel. It was very relaxing staff were superb and catered for my difficult dietary requirements. Overall an excellent stay in a lovely city. I highly recommend the Four Seasons.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Makysha Barksdale wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: Our stay at Four Seasons was amazing! It was our last day /night in Marrakech and we were so happy with our choice to stay there.    The best part was our service from our arrival until our farewell! While my friend and I were waiting for our room to be prepared we decided to have lunch in the bar. Our server Adbelmajid gave us impeccable service! He took excellent care of us and made us feel at home. After engaging in conversation during our meal he was able to make great suggestions of things to do. As the first person we encountered once we checked he really took great care of us... We wanted for nothing.    He really set the tone for such a great experience. We will definitely return when we visit again!

Review_Title: You won't find a better hotel in Marrakech!
Review_Text: This property was stunning in every way. The grounds are lush and gorgeous. The rooms are exceptionally well appointed and up-to-date. The staff was outstanding - across all areas of service. This is one of if not 'the' top hotel in Marrakech.

Review_Date: Dana in LA wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Title: Majestic Grounds. Great Service. Spacious Rooms.
Review_Text: My best friend and I recently stayed at the Four Seasons Resort in Marrakech as our first visit to Morocco. The grounds of this resort are absolutely breathtaking. We were in awe as we were greeted at the front desk by their polite staff. As we made our way to the lounge area we were welcomed by a young man named Abdelmajid (hope i spelled that correctly) who I could never forget. He was so polite and catering to us. We felt like we were having a royal experience. We had so many questions and he took the time to answer our questions as well as serve us these delicious wine drinks and pastries. Seriously they were a treat! At the end of our stay he even helped us with taking much needed Instagram photos. LOL! It was such a dreamy experience. I will surely return and I highly recommend this resort for anyone going to Marrakech. It is a quick 10 minute taxi ride to the Medina and City Center but also tucked away so perfectly that you feel away from the fast pace movement of the city. If you visit please say hello to Abdelmajid and tell him Yardana said thank you!! I absolutely loved my stay here.

Review_Date: Troy B wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: I might be biased as I stayed at the Four Seasons with people I loved (we had 6 rooms) but really the place is truly a premiere respite from the heat the assault and the hectic madness of Marrakech tourism. The breakfast buffet is excellent. The pool well one can spend an entire afternoon there. The staff incredibly helpful and friendly made our stay memorable.

Review_Date: Harpreet B wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: Just stayed at the Four Seasons Marrakech with my wife for our anniversary. The hotel is set in lovely grounds service was fantastic and room was amazing.    I wanted to arrange a few things in advance and the staff were great and helped me get that all sorted without any fuss.    The hotel is beautiful well looked after and the rooms are lovely.    Loved every minute and didn’t want to come home.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Stay at the Four Seasons Marrakech made our visit even more enjoyable
Review_Text: Exploring Marrakech can be mind blowing... assault to one’s senses indeed. But experiencing all that and coming hone to a super relaxed zen type of environment just makes you give the Medina another shot to sick your senses! Our stay the this resort made Morocco more palatable to our taste of travel and adventure! It got us ready for more of Moroccan adventure because a great stay with a great style take you a long long way!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: What a beautiful resort with highly helpful staff fantastic food  Thank you again for this experience - we felt relaxed and special  Great location and overall services with flexible professionals 👍🙏

Review_Title: The Best of Marrakech!! Location Luxury Space Green Food Safety
Review_Text: Stayed at the marvelous Four Seasons Marrakech for my 7th year in a row. We absolutely love this place. The peaceful beautiful green grounds full of beautiful diverse plants and birds everywhere. What a team!! They always coordinate with eachother and inform eachother all your wishes.  How about a lovely room with a small private plunge pool? you got it no problem.  The swimming pool with the amazing restaurant next to it is the place to be. Love the Food and their specials like the famous fresh pizza with truffles.  Spa? yes yes yes. Everyday i visited the Spa for a Treatment. Amazing team. Highly professional. Cannot reccomend them enough.  Dinner at Quattro is incredible. The Tagliata di Manzo and how about a bottle of Chianti Villa Antinori?. love it. They also have a Moroccan Restaurant upstairs which is really really fun and authentic. Both with Live Music.  Lunch outside is also loads of fun for example 5min Taxi to Cafe de La Poste. Amazing French style Brasserie with many locals and foreigners.  Visit the Medina & Shop? 10min by Taxi.  Do not forget to ask the Hotel to book you the VIP Fast Track at the Marrakech airport. The best spent money.  If visiting the Fairgrounds Palais de Congres the Hotel is only a 300m walk from the Hotel.

Review_Date: Mary Jean T wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: This hotel is definitely a 5 star experience! From the Concierge service the Reception the restaurants and all of the staff it truly was an exceptional experience. I stay here personally every year and we send our clients all of the time.    Mary Jean Tully  Founder & CEO  Tully Luxury Travel

Review_Date: Jessica VM wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: After a long 5 day tour throughout Morocco I was so pleased to know that I was coming to this hotel. Everything is just fantastic. The adult pool is right in front of the bar and literally has anything you could ask for. There are only two restaurants but both are very good. My favorite however was the Italian restaurant which had italian but also moroccan food with a twist. The staff was beyond accommodating and so nice. Nizar our waiter was fantastic!! had the best recommendations for food and even after we couldnt eat any further he rushed our leftovers to our room. They were there before we even got back to our room. The rooms are honestly very large clean modern with a moroccan twist and the A/C is fantastic. My husband a true gym junky went to the gym and was pleased with all the equipment they had along with supplied bottle waters in the fridge fruit tea towels etc. Their breakfast was AMAZING. Had everything you can think of and their detox juices the best. I think every hotel should have these. They have a fair amount of security personnel which was great because i felt so safe. At the entry there is a security booth a metal detector before you walk in the hotel and security staff at the doors.Beautiful hotel in all only lacked a bit in the SPA area. It could use a bit of renovating and updating but other than that the four seasons was a great stay. Highly recommended. 5-8min away from the Airport however a little bit ways away from the Medina.

Review_Date: Debbie C M wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Title: The most perfect place to relax and unwind .
Review_Text: Absolute paradise with the most attentive of staff  nothing is too much trouble . The most amazing food lovely restaurants and relaxing atmosphere. The perfect get away from it all .. thoroughly recommend ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Service exceptional - the staff made our stay nothing was too much trouble. The staff were fantastic from the cleaning staff trough to management all accessible and all wanting to help. Can’t rate them highly enough.  Great kids club  Lovely well kept grounds within easy reach of the hustle of the medina

If your’re looking to stay at a luxury resort that offers a traditional feeling of Morroco with amazing attentive staff who go out of their way to make your stay more enjoyable then look no further.    Typical of four seasons hotels this hotel is really beautiful. The lobby was filled with beautiful roses and the gardens were a delight to walk through. The hotel grounds are spacious enough so even at full capacity it doesnt feel like its full.    We were warmly greeted upon arrival and decided to have a welcome drink which was delicious. The room was spacious and had a huge balcony to our delight with sun loungers if we decided we wanted some privacy from the main pool.    As usual the customer service was spot on. Everyone was polite and helpful and we had a very friendly waitress at dinner who was so passionate about her job it was a delight to see.  On one night we had Moroccan style food at the restaurant next to the lobby. The food was divine especially their chicken tagine which is also a traditional dish of Morroco.    I had an amazing stay at this hotel and would recommend anyone going to Marrakech to definately visit this hotel.

What can I say. A perfect mini break. This hotel is sublime. They even bring you slippers to get out of the pool fantastic children and adults pools. Food is first class and the staff are the best I’ve ever had in the four seasons

Review_Date: Astrid Anglofil wrote a review Sep 2019
Review_Text: Went there for a business trip and immediately fell in love with it!  Even though I went there on a business trip the company and colleagues still enjoy the usual services. Some of us took a premiere swim in the outdoor pool while others had a friendly tennis game and in the evening before dinner we all gathered in the spa and wellness center. For me personally one of the highlights was that the restaurant served vegan as well as vegetarian meals.    Prime location just 2 minutes away from Menara Gardens.

If you want to be pampered and cared for in delightful surroundings looked after by an exceptional team then this is the right hotel for you.    This hotel is very worthy of the Four Seasons banner and is such a lovely place to stay. The staff are very helpful and keen to deliver whatever you require. They are so flexible and happy to accommodate your desires.    It is a very reasonable taxi drive away from a number of good restaurants so ideal for you to venture out and try other dining too.    This is our second visit and we will certainly be coming back again. Thank you Four Seasons Marrakech - you did a great job!

the best hotel in Morocco great for family and business great foodso much luxury every where from the linen of the bedroom to the coffee bar ...well connectedfor laptop and all wireless hookups..nice kids club..

Review_Title: Dont trust them for booking any excursion through the hotel
Review_Text: On Reccomendation of a staffmember named Jihan (guest experience) we booked different excursions trough the hotel.  We booked a citytour guide included history/monuments of Marrakech. The guide who was linked to us brought us only to shops and we didn't get a lot to see of the city Marrakech. Afterwards it looked like the guy was working with the shopowners who was trying to sell us a lot. The sellers were very pushy we spend more then $25.000 on carpets jewelrycaftans and more.  We also booked trough the hotel (Jihan) a deserttrip including camelride en quadbike and that was a horrible experience. The quad had 2 times a breakdown and as if that wasn't enough we had to wait 1hour for fuel to continue our ride. We arrived in Agafay Anari Camps for dinner. The host that night was the owner of the place a French guy who was very cold and absolutly not friendly. The hospitality that we are used to get for the amount of money we paid was far to find.  Arriving in the hotel we discussed our experience with the staff of the hotel and they told us that they would give us discount on the trips but at last they let us pay the full bill without any discount they promissed.

I just spent four amazing nights at what is now one of my favorite places in the world (Marrakech) at this large Property. It is extremely well located literally within eyesite of the airport. But you wouldn't know it. It's serene peaceful and you don't have to leave (but you do because Marrakech is so amazing). This is a Property with residences rooms and villas built on 2011. Rooms are large with spacious pools (one for adults and one for families though I recall seeing kids at the adult pool). The Property does show its age. And some may state that it could be anywhere and that's a fit assessment IF you're comparing it to its legendary competition which is La Mamounia Royal Mansour The Mandarin and The Selman but you should not. Outside of the Mandarin and the Selman the other two are legendary grande dames where if you aren't dressed up (ie. No shorts trainers travel bags hats...which you MUST have when it's 110 degrees) you will either not be allowed in or feel a fool. It's more relaxed here and I liked that. Also it's not a riad experience. This was my first time to Marrakech and I stayed here because I wanted consistency and knew that I'd come back from the 110 degree heat and not want to care about being sweaty and exhausted. The service was awesome. Had a superb tour of the Medina and sites thanks to them. The bellman and those at the entrance are incredible. The generous bottled water shows mercy in the heat. It's close to everything but still it's own sanctuary. Finally the security was great. Loved it. I'm sure it'll get a touch up soon considering all of the competition. But this is my top choice and recommendation outside of said grande dames.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A trip to Marrakech and the Four Seasons was a treat from my son. We travelled together. From the minute we stepped out of the car at the hotel to the minute we left - the service was above and beyond. Each and every staff member made us welcome and went out of their way. Politeness attention to service was exceptional. Four Seasons Marrakesh - you have a winning team. Thankyou. Will be back.

Review_Date: riyanan s wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: This is my second visit here at this hotel and I always have an incredible time the staff are amazing and the hotel is breath taking and they made my mums birthday very special thank you very much ❤️❤️

Review_Date: Sarah D wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: We had an absolutely fantastic 2 night stay here a few weeks ago. We stayed in a Premier Garden-View Terrace room and it was absolutely stunning. The room was huge and beautiful even better than the photos online made it look. My favorite part of the room was the terrace it had a really cool couch built into the side of the wall set back in an archway. I spent most of my time in the room in the evenings laying out there. Although the room was the most basic type of room at the hotel it was far different than your usual basic hotel room. There was a ton of space in the living area even with the dining table there. Forget about your typical tiny hotel closets this one was walk-in. We stored all our luggage in there and had room to open all our bags and leave them open so we didn't have to unpack all the way. The bathroom was also not your typical small hotel bathroom the toilet was behind its own door double vanity sinks incredibly huge soaking tub and separate shower with pretty tile work. Seriously words cannot describe how much space the room had both in the bedroom area and the bathroom and the terrace was huge. The furnishings were all comfortable and beautiful with definite Moroccan touches. I could have stayed in our room all day and I wish I had booked an extra day for us to do just this. Our favorite part of our stay was actually the room service breakfast. We are not room service people it's usually stupidly expensive and not good at all so we only order it when we're desperate. While in Morocco we decided we didn't want to bother having to find breakfast out in the city we wanted to just be able to start our touring plans early as we only had a couple days there so we decided to give room service a try. I am so so glad we did it was the highlight of our entire time in Morocco which sounds ridiculous but it was just so lovely. The food was excellent and they went above and beyond with the entire meal. It arrived on this cool rolling table thing (was basically a table on a cart base but looked like a normal table) at exactly the time we specified on the card and they asked us if we wanted it inside or out. We decided on out and they set it up so one side of the table faced the couch on the terrace and they pulled a chair up to the other side. It was so luxurious feeling and the presentation was beautiful. Between the two days we were there we tried the pancakes french toast eggs tagine scrambled eggs and sausage fruit plate oatmeal yogurt and mint tea and each breakfast came with a basket of yummy breads with jams and butter. Everything was fantastic it didn't taste like room service food it tasted like it was fresh from a nice cafe. We also enjoyed the amenities around the hotel we spent a few hours one afternoon cooling off in the adult pool. They have 2 pools: A family pool and an adult pool that is very quiet and calm. Service at the pool was excellent the minute we walked up towards the chairs we wanted someone came right over and put towels on the chairs and brought us a cooler full of bottles of water. They also came around with popsicles! It was the best way to cool off in the summer heat. The common areas of the hotel are luxurious and beautiful as are the grounds and gardens. The lobby even has cute little birds in it that I really enjoyed going to visit. Service all around was excellent. The bellmen were always handing us bottles of water when we arrived and left and they were very helpful in telling the taxi drivers where to go and ensuring they were going to stick to the quoted price (it was 50 dirhams everywhere we went from the hotel not sure where the radius of that price point ends but to get to the Medina Majorelle Gardens and the surrounding areas it was always 50). The front desk staff were also very helpful they provided some great recommendations around the city and exchanged some money for us. When we arrived at first our room wasn't ready so they put us in a golf cart and drove us back to the changing rooms at the gym pavilion to freshen up and change clothes. Then they drove us back around to the lobby stored our bags and we were off for the day. There was quite a line at the check-in desk when we arrived and they weren't the fastest but when you're providing excellent service and going above and beyond you're bound to lose some efficiency in the process so it was understandable. The location is great as well it's very close to the airport but not so close that the airplane noise is a bother and it's close to town yet still feels like a total escape from the city. You will need to take cabs from the hotel as there's nothing really in walking distance but that's the price you pay to have a bit of space and seclusion from the craziness of it all and it's well worth it. Even if you have to take a cab two round trips to and from the hotel each day it's typically only around 220 dirhams total for those 4 rides (gotta negotiate with the cab drivers when you're catching them in town we were usually able to barter down to around 50 by threatening to walk away at their quoted prices). This was just an incredible resort experience all around when our time in Marrakech was up and we headed back to London we were ready to leave the city but not the hotel and we missed it a lot! Will definitely be staying here every single time I return to Marrakech. You cannot go wrong by choosing this resort.

Centrally located great amenities pool fitness center rooms outdoor space were all just perfect. On top of all the resort amenities the staff made the stay even more special each day. My 7 day stay was amazing and the Marrakech Four Season's is well worth the visit as well as a repeat visit. Thank you.

Just spent the most remarkable 5 days at the Four Seasons resort MARRAKECH  The hotel is beautiful the staff are very attentive food superb service very good and the adult only pool was so relaxing  we will definitely be back .

The four seasons is an amazing hotel for relaxation.  Great service from the Pool staff especially Mehdi who is very attentivepolitefriendly and caters to everyones individual wants and needs through out the day :)    Candice
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Luxury hotel away from the chaos
Review_Text: This is a fantastic hotel which is a lovely retreat from the chaos of central Marrakech - but it also close enough to easily go into the centre for food and exploring.    Highlights;  - Breakfast is delicious lots of choice and fresh.  - The adults pool - the service is great even in the heat the staff are running around making sure everyone is happy (bringing complimentary treats topping up your water etc.) and the pool is a great temperature in the Marrakech summer heat.  - The rooms are very spacious and comfortable and the cleaning staff were always very efficient twice a day. The decor in the room was stylish but in keeping with Morrocan style as was the entire hotel.  - The staff in general were extremely friendly and helpful. They were also all willing to provide recommendations and chat about Marrakech in general.  - The gym was great and modern - as a nice touch it had infused cold water cold towels etc. for once you had finished your session.    To be honest the whole experience of staying here was fantastic - the only slight negative is that they food and drink prices were high so we chose to eat out every evening (don't pay more than 50dhs for any taxi to / from hotel).

Hotel - beautiful hotel situated just 10 mins from the airport. Set in superb grounds full of palm trees olive trees and planting. Looks stunning and 2 big pools. Free WiFi in all rooms and at the pool.    Location - Only 10 mins from the airport but you only hear the odd plane now and again so that’s not an issue at all. If you get a taxi from the airport it should cost no more than 100 dirhams (£10) so don’t get ripped off. I wrongly assumed the hotel was fairly central and that we could walk to local restaurants so went B&B which was a mistake. With a young child getting out is in fact a short taxi ride into Marrakech. Was planning on eating out most nights but we only managed two night time outings. If you don’t fancy getting a taxi every night then suggest you go half board but only 2 restaurants to choose from.    Tour - We did book a half day tour through the hotel and the guide Mohammed was superb taking us to the Bahia Palace souks and main square. It was just right if you’re looking for a brief history of the city. Interesting place but if I’m being honest the old town and souks and main square was a bit of a dump dirty smelly and hot. Maybe I just saw the bad/wrong parts wasn’t that impressed!!! Expected a lot better.    Room - we booked a pool view terrace room and it was lovely a good size the terrace was large and really nice views of the pool and gardens and mountains. The bathroom was large and the shower was superb.    Pools - 2 nice pools. One is adults only so we couldn’t use that (we have an 8-year old) but it looked fabulous. The family pool is nice and big split into 2 but only 1.25 metres deep. Ok for little kids but would have preferred a deeper pool. Lots of sun beds and towels and the staff around the pool are great.    Restaurants - a great looking poolside restaurant next to the adult pool (we never used it preferring to order at the poolside instead). However only 2 main restaurants at the hotel I was expecting more than this. Both OK but pricey ... usual 5* hotel prices. Breakfast is brilliant a buffet style with lots of choice. The orange juice is the freshest I’ve ever tasted and health smoothies were great.    Reception - the only real complaint I have was with some of the reception staff. E.g. I asked them to book us a table at one of their recommended restaurants in Marrakesh to be told later it had been done however when we got to the restaurant they didn’t have any booking! E.g. on the last night I enquired about a late check out the next day to be abruptly told by a lady (I won’t mention her name!) that she will come back to me later (why couldn’t she check immediately for me?). I knew she wouldn’t bother to come back to me when she asked my room number but didn’t bother to write it down. I was right. No call back. Had to go back later that evening and this time they sorted it out and we were given a very nice room next morning (no extra charge) and our luggage was transferred for us and we were able to check out 3pm.    Overall I would recommend this hotel for a quiet relaxing stay for couples or families. It needs another dinner restaurant to give more choice. Location not great if you want to get out and about into Marrakech you cannot walk anywhere.

Review_Date: Simon S wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Title: Beautiful hotel and wonderful, spacious grounds and gardens with excellent service
Review_Text: Four seasons is a quality brand and this hotel is no exception. We had an upper pavilion room which was clean and spacious. Service from the staff from the reception to room to the pool and the restaurants was impeccable. This included being good English speakers although the majority of the guests were French.    We're not totally convinced about the Moroccan wines the hotel offered; quite expensive for the quality but we did want to go local. The restaurant food was excellent; and when we asked for something that was listed on the online menu but not the one we were handed they made the meal for us anyway; a nice touch.    The breakfast buffet was very good with a wide selection of cakes and pastries; it was included in our package.    The gardens are beautiful and spacious so you aren't aware of other guests except at the quiet pool and at the restaurants.    The hotel security seems very thorough. Be aware that it seems impossible to get to the hotel from the airport for less than a hundred dirham even though it's a shorter journey than to the city. (seventy dirhams)    We got a good deal going through British Airways holidays; August is not high season due to the heat. It is very hot in the day but the nights are cool; after 8pm and before 11am the temperature is quite bearable.

We took a last minute break here for a few days and wished we could stay longer. Everything about this place was excellent. Staff could not do enough for us breakfast was great as was the food by the pool. Our room was well appointed with a huge bathroom opening out on a terrace with sun beds and only ten paces from the adult pool. It made for a really relaxing and pleasurable break. Something we will repeat.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tom A wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: We had a great experience. Had a really relaxing time. The food and service was excellent. Our room was superb and had a perfect balcony view. There were two pools. One for families with children and the quieter pool for adults.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Alex Mackey wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: breakfasts .. gym .. cocktails .. detox smoothies .. and staff!!!  My wife and I have just spent a week at the Four Seasons Marrakech and we are already suffering withdrawal symptoms!!  The breakfasts were the best I have ever found anywhere in the world (and I travel up to 100 each year!)  The gym was superb extremely well equipped for all levels of guests .. from the very occasional visitor - to twice daily gym bunnies like me!  The rooms are sumptuous and very Moroccan in style.  The food is fantastic (check out the pastas and pizzas in Quattro and the tagine in Inara).  The cocktails are superb and every evening the hotel has excellent live music.  I've been lucky enough to stay in Four Seasons hotels from Dublin to Dubai and Toronto to Tokyo. But this is one of the best .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Heaven in the form of a hotel
Review_Text: My boyfriend and I recently stayed for a week and wished we had booked for longer. From the moment we arrived we were treated like royalty.  Location : 10/10. 15 mins in car from airport. 15 mins to Médina. 10 mins to new city. The four seasons have fixed price of 50 MAD (<£5) for any taxi ride to these areas.  Food:  Four seasons offer 2 great restaurants; Inara and Quattro. The food for both is great if a little expensive. But ideal as an alternative to going out and eating. The breakfast buffet is similar to that of any 5* Hotel.  Amenities:  Two fab pools amazing spa 2 clay tennis courts with optional coach (extra cost) state of the art fitness equipment young adult centre including basketball hoop table tennis snooker etc.  Service:  This Is what really sets apart the four seasons above any other hotel we have been to. All the staff ranging from the cleaners to the front desk went above and beyond to ensure we didn’t have to think about anything whilst on holiday. They have a fantastic concierge messaging app who will deal with any query. E.g ice buckets sent to room booking a dinner reservation outside of hotel guides excursions. There really wasn’t any query that left unsolved.  We didn’t manage to get everyone’s names but Hanane at the front desk was delightful.  A huge thank you to all of the four seasons staff and we 100% recommend this hotel to anyone looking to book a holiday in Marrakech!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed at the Four seasons Marrakech from the 11th July for 4 nights in the Pavilion Room we emailed the hotel few months in advance for early check in which they managed to adhere the hotel is extravagant with great hospitality. Our room was very spacious for family of three the bouquet of roses and cookies which were left for us on the first day was a nice gesture the bathroom was very grand and the outside balcony (pavilion) was great to sit out in. My daughter was provided with a roller bed which she said was very comfortable too our bed was so divine and we were guaranteed a good night sleep. The breakfast was nice but they could have extended the hot menu and the omelette station was a bit slow at times but overall we enjoyed the special dishes and the fresh drinks every morning. Four seasons location is away from the hustle and bustle but just a short taxi ride to the souk and gueliz area. The hotel does provide a service to the souk in the evening but we never used it. Four seasons provided an excellent service  they listened to all our needs and also on the day we were leaving I asked for late checkout which they were able to extend. I would definitely have no hesitation to book this hotel again.

Review_Title: Can't wait for our next visit
Review_Text: Four Seasons Resort Marrakech is perfect in every way. A short drive from the airport you are greeted by attentive delightful staff and the most wonderful scent! All our rooms were fabulous with welcome treats and all facilities that were required. Every member of staff could not have been more helpful or welcoming. The resort grounds are beautifully maintained. There are two pool areas a quiet pool and a family pool. There are three restaurants to choose from and all the food was delicious. It is a short drive from El Jemmaa Fna Square.  We loved every moment of our stay and will definitely visit again.

This was our first stay at a four seasons hotel we had great expectations but sadly it’s not that great we have may been spoiled we have stayed at jumeirah mandarin oriental shangri la & kempinski hotels and others this hotel do not not offer the same level of service we stayed four 9 nights only 2 members of staff remembered our names and not once did they know our room number our room was a ground floor garden room which was nice the house keeping was very good also the Italian restaurant was good but the upstairs restaurant was not we had to complain but the did deduct it from our bill also on a one occasion they didn’t know what drink we had they had to ask to put them on our bill that’s poor the hotel & the grounds & pools are nice would we stay again no
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Neel Bhattacharjee wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Title: Classic FS service, food and resort experience
Review_Text: I stayed here for a few nights with family who were staying at an FS resort for the first time. All of us loved the stunning grounds of the property typically larger than expected rooms and (in our experience contrary to other experience) high quality food across cuisines. Breakfast was a highlight every day - overlooking the water and trees if you can get a spot in the shade outside. The Morroccan restaurant we had on the first night and was probably the best meal we had in the city. The Italian restaurant too was a surprise - comparable to high end establishments I've been to around the world. Great gym and pool facilities too which we used daily backed by friendly and attentive service by the team. We all can't wait to go back - thanks to the entire team and Blaise for running such a tight ship.  Cheers  NB

Review_Date: Ramez R wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Text: Very Nice resort Just outside of the crowded areas but still a 5 minute drive to all hotspots. Amazing service especially by Mehdi at the Pool side. Always taking care of every Little details keep up the good work my man ;)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Oxana C wrote a review Aug 2019
Review_Title: Five stars service, but not five stars food.
Review_Text: Hi we stayed at FS with my husband for four nights in the end of July.  👍🏻The hotel is very big very clean and very quite. The garden is gorgeous. The breakfast is just delicious with an immense variety of food! The room is spacious the bed is like a cloud.  The bathroom is very beautiful in marocain style.  👎🏻The adult pool 🏊🏾‍♀️ is too shallow for swimming only 130m of depth. The water in the pool is too hot when the air is 38C the water in the pool should be much cooler to give a refreshing feeling rather than a hot feeling.  The jacuzzi is not working very well.  The food served at the pool is of low quality.  There’s no Matcha Tee or Matcha Latte in any of hotel restaurants.  In comparison with the Four Season on Maldives this one is rather mediocre.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Four seasons Marrakech good but….    my daughter and I stayed at the four seasons Marrakech the first week of July. We stayed in a superior room with a nice balcony. The grounds and gardens are beautiful well kept and a pleasure to walk in. The smell in the hotel is wonderful we bought a bottle to use it at home     When we arrived at Menara airport in Marrakech the hotel pickup did not show up and we had to wait and after several calls the driver arrived It’s a short drive from the airport tot the hotel. At check in nobody seemed to know that we had to call several times for the airport pickup so no explanation at all.  The room layout is somewhat peculiar a small hall with a minibar and coffee and tea making facilities just at the door into the bathroom.  The furniture is a bit dated; one chair on the balcony was damaged the tiled floor in the bathroom has stains that will never come out and the bathtub is a bit dingy.    Food at several restaurants is decent wine is expensive but fine service at breakfast is a bit hit and miss. Breakfast spread is rather small but tasty and fresh orange juice is served at the table. Moroccan oranges and other fruits are the best!    The hotel had a high occupancy and that showed at the pools. Rather busy at times. The lady at the spa is a lovely lady and as we had a late flight home she let us use the spa facilities before leaving.    All in al we had a nice time. Marrakech is a beautiful city. The government invested a lot in the infrastructure of the city and it turned out to be a very good investment.    FS Marrakech is not completely up to FS standards; that is why I can not give 5 stars.

Review_Title: Top Notch Service and Kids Activities
Review_Text: Everything about this hotel is fantastic! My family visited in June and I look forward to going back. We enjoyed the pools and the staff even walked around with free treats poolside throughout the day.    The grounds of the hotel have beautiful vegetation and we loved just walking around the paths. The little sitting areas were a nice retreat to sit and talk.    Our youngest child loved the Kids for All Seasons childcare that the hotel offers for free to guests. The childcare staff were so kind and had a great schedule of activities.    We are thankful for the time we spent at Four Seasons with our family the beautiful accommodations and the delicious meals we ate at their several on-campus restaurants!

Review_Title: Amazing stay in the Four Seasons
Review_Text: We stayed in this beautiful resort for 4 nights from the time we arrived the hotel could not do enough for us. The girls on reception were so helpful in booking any tours restaurants and dealt with anything we asked them to do in such an efficient manner. We had our own driver Youness for the few days who made our whole experience to Marrakesh a wonderful experience we felt very safe for the whole trip and for us he made our trip a much more wonderful experience we also had our own guide for any of the excursions we went on ie. The Atlas Mountains & a trip to the Old City which included the Souks. The hotel recommended some restaurants which we tried and we could not fault them we tried the breakfast in the hotel which was really good and the food was very good in the restaurant beside the pool and the Italian was excellent too and such a beautiful setting overlooking the garden. We had a suite beside the family pool and it was beautiful. We are a family of 5 so we had loads of room. We really enjoyed our stay in Marrakesh yes their culture is very different to ours but the people we met made us feel very welcome. Thank you to all the staff & especially Youness for looking after us so well x Aishling

Exceptional hotel caring staff and attention to detail! I celebrated my birthday and they surely made it special. Superb decor and the whole hotel is so welcoming. Cannot fault anything. This is a luxury hotel and it is! Will plan to visit again soon.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: It was so great staying there with my lifetime CEO together. I will never forget and recommend to my prospects going forward. Maybe we will visit another Four Seasons Hotel in other countries sometime again soon. We had satisfaction!

Review_Date: percy d wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: The vast majority of tripadvisor reviewers agree that the Four Seasons Resort Marrakech and all the people working for this luxury hotel earn an "Excellent" rating.    I would even go beyond that: The Four Seasons Resort Marrakech ist one of the best places to be in order to discover Marrakesh and its local region. We loved our large rooms the wide garden areas the breakfast buffet and the wonderful pool areas. We were really happy that the hotel is not directly in the Medina but bee line 2 kilometres outside of city's center. A little bit like an oasis. The good thing is that most places you will typically like to visit are only 5 to 10 minutes away via taxi (and taxi rides are really inexpensive in Marrakesh).    Some people are concerned that the airport is only 1 to 2 kilometers away. However first it is worth noticing Marrakesh airport is pretty close to the center of the city. So the fact of having an airport close to you is true for about 50% of Marrakesh. The good thing is that this airport is beautiful but pretty small. It has only one runway that is perpendicular to the bee line between the Four Seasons and the airport so the noise of starting aircrafts is directing away from the Four Seasons. Landing aircrafts aren't noticable at all.    Lastly a big compliment is going to all the people working for the Four Seasons and the hotel's management. There are so many outstanding friendly and perfectly organized people anticipating your wishes without being intrusive.    We as a family couldnt have enjoyed our stay in Marrakesh more.

Review_Title: Gorgeous Resort, Most Frustrating Service I've ever Experienced
Review_Text: I am a person who NEVER writes reviews. While the facilities were very beautiful and quite well maintained the service was the worst that my husband and I have ever experienced at ANY hotel we've ever stayed at. We ate once at the Italian restaurant and twice at the pool-side restaurant and each time we waited 15-minutes before a waiter came to take our order. Twice a menu item that we ordered was not received. Also twice the drinks we ordered did not come until we had finished our meal. Each time we had to ask a MINIMUM of three times for the check. At the Italian restaurant we waited over 20-minutes despite asking THREE different servers for the bill. We eventually just left knowing that they could charge it to our room. The pool-side service was even more atrocious. We asked for an umbrella to be moved three times each time we were told they would do it for us right away - we sat at the pool for three hours and no one brought our umbrella. The second time we visited the pool we requested a pool basket with water as we walked in and waited ONE hour (after three additional requests) before it was delivered. We waited 45-minutes before waving down another server to order wine. We told what seemed to be the pool-side manager how long we had been waiting - he finally went and brought the drinks however it was another hour before he "stopped by to check on us" which I thought was very much lacking after we had expressed to him our strong frustration earlier on. We were just shocked that we could experience service that we would consider terrible at ANY establishment be it a local bar or neighborhood taco shop at the Four Seasons. This was literally the worst service experience I can remember. Very very disappointing - to the point that I would not recommend this resort to others as it significantly sullied our stay. So much of the time that we should have been relaxing we just spent feeling frustrated.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Amazing service real kindness shown by all the staff. The concierge service was brilliant recommend excellent places restaurants spa etc. Ended up just asking them and not needing to research ourselves. Will definitely be back. Great place to really relax unwind and occasionally venture out to the medina. Although it is not very far 50dhm by taxi a few minutes drive.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: We were not Happy with our guide Zaki
Review_Text: We were there in June  the hotel is beautiful but we had a Terrible Tour guide who was recommended by the hotel front Desk he took us to very expensive shops and tried to push us buy expensive things we loved Marrakech but not our experience with this scam guide his name was Zaki .  We complained at the hotel and they give us another good one who was Fantastic tour guide  but we thought we need to review this guide like this people who are sta9in future there don't even get close to him.    Morocco is a beautiful country!

What an oasis! This was the most wonderful stay I've ever had. The staff and amenities were incredible. The pool spa fitness center and rooms were amazing. The concierge helped to plan an unforgettable excursion for us as well. It was a trip of a lifetime.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Victor V wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: Unfortunately we will leave soon this awesome resort in Marrakesh. A warm welcome from the first minut. And a room upgrade without asking for it. The hotel and rooms are very nice decorated stylish and clean. Wonderful pools and lush gardens. And as always in a Four Seasons Hotel outstanding service. Staff were great. A once in a lifetime experience we had and are still having a great time. Thank you all staffmembers and management! We will meet soon again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Harmony L wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: Comfortable clean great service beautiful pool spacious rooms excellent breakfast stunning resort dinner is outstanding and waiters friendly and caring. Highly recommend this place- excellence has been achieved here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jordan R wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: Stayed a week at Four Seasons Marrakech and loved everything about the experience. Service was amazing staff extremely helpful our suite was terrific (loved the plunge pool!!!) and pool was outstanding

The hotel is beautiful well located if your are not looking to be in the Medina and the services is excellent. People are extremely friendly. The pool is very nice calm and the staff are really nice. The prices of the food and beverage at the hotel are reasonable and the quality is good Excellent breakfast. There are many details that make you feel very well. We you travel a lot during the year the the difference is on the small details and at this hotel they are very careful with small details.

Review_Date: Rajat S wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: Absolutely top notch! We just got back after 3 nights in a Patio Suite with a private pool. Everything ranging from the welcome drink at check-in to the room appointments to housekeeping to the restaurants was among the best hospitality we've experienced worldwide. My favorite part was the service and decor. They have a beautiful and welcoming Inara that soon became our favorite dinner spot as well (don't forget to try the sheesha at the terrace - fantastic ambiance and service!). Don't also miss touring the property. I really fell in love with the lanterns placed all around.    The location is central and is 50 MAD away from any spot in the city (though you can negotiate a bit when riding back to the hotel) - Marrakech isn't a very big city.    We can't wait to be back and to take our extended family and friends.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Food grounds and room fabulous . I never experienced a bad moment at any Four Season Resort. When looking for luxury style and great food enjoy this resort. This particular resort had the old and new charm of the Moroccan culture. I just loved it.

Review_Date: faye a wrote a review Jul 2019
Review_Text: Don’t hesitate to book here the staff make your trip so special and they really do look after you in every way! Comfy loungers clean throughout close to everything!  Breakfast is beautiful with a great range! Great heated pool and the rooms are so spacious and wonderful!  The pool bar has great waiters Ahmed and Samir are fantastic and make you feel very welcome everyday and always have a great smile!  Thank you FS Marrakesh 💖
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Hi  Just got back from a great stay at this Hotel and I can highly recommend it . The accommodation facilities and above all staff are great . If needed there is a courtesy car the will deliver you to the Médina and will collect you when ready to return  at some stage we will stop again.

Warning: do not stay here nowhere will ever be as good again!  From the moment we arrived and we smelt the glorious fresh flowers blooming in reception we had the best time here. From the private tour to the incredible service beautiful grounds etc we really were spoilt rotten.    I’m not sure I have stayed at a Four Seasons chain before but after the service I have received I wouldn’t hesitate to do so again.    We did have a few small issues with the otherwise great service to WhatsApp/message concierge and reception. Also we had a slightly disappointing evening meal on the on site hotel. Perhaps because the places outside of the resort they had recommended for the nights previous were too good!    But these did not overall impact on what was what otherwise an exceptional hotel. I hope to visit again.

Review_Title: Top Service, Wonderful Swimming Pool and Tranquility at its Finest!
Review_Text: To the Rooms: The rooms very big and spacious. The bathroom are a dream. Since we were travelling with a disabled child the hotel was friendly enough to reserve a handicapped friendly room with a very big bathroom! The view was very nice as well (Garden View Room).    To the Restaurants: There are in total three restaurants at Four Seasons Marrakech.  Our favorite was Inara and Azzura. Inara's chef makes very good food and compared to all the restaurants there Inara had the best quality of food.  A very big special thanks to CHEF MOUKTHAR at Azzura. He was able to cook special food for my sister and he understood our needs.  Quattro which is the Italian restaurant is also very nice. It has a good atmosphere and an interesting choice of food. A very special thanks to server KACEM BELGANA he was very friendly professional and willing to offer the best only.    Housekeeping: Wonderful lady named HANANE a big thank you to you as well for great service and special care.    Family Pool: The pool of Four Seasons Marrakech was most probably my FAVORITE part of our stay. Wonderful pools great service and good quality of sun beds.  Employees who took great exceptional care of us during our stay were:  ABDERREZZAK ISMAIL AND ABDULLAH.  Lifeguards IMAD AND MOHSIM were always friendly and willing to help if my disabled sister wanted to take a dip into the pool. Amazing guys!    Thank you for the exceptional stay!

Review_Title: Front Desk outstanding + Support personnel make this hotel a MUST STAY
Review_Text: BEST service we've experienced in over 30 years of traveling! Front desk hotel-assigned drivers and tour guide were the best! A bit on the expensive side for most but what price is your comfort worth? Making you feel like family the Four Seasons Marrakech should be experienced for as long as possible!

Review_Date: Anne-Marie D wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: We stayed at the Four Seasons for our family-room. Beautiful pool area with fabulous poolside staff. It was an oasis of calm and luxury with first rate dining. The bed was the most comfortable I ever slept in. A wonderful hotel in a wonderful city.

Review_Title: An exceptional hotel with an incredible staff
Review_Text: magnificent hotel pool was large and yet felt private spa was luxurious with a great variety of services concierge went above and beyond o get us access to the best restaurants with the best tables.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: these guys get it! wonderfully well run hotel with a great location if you want to relax and avoid the chaos/crowds of the inner city. the food at the restaurants in the hotel was an unexpected plus. excellent food quality and outstanding service at all restaurants. nice to have an alternative to traditional Moroccan food after a week of enjoying the local cuisine. Shout out to Badr and Marwan at the hotel. You guys really get hospitality!

Review_Date: Judy Z wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: Marrakech is as they say a very 'touristic' city - even during Ramadan. We were amazed at the dedication and service of the staff during this holy time when people are going sunrise to sunset without food or drink.  The Four Seasons is always a great choice for a hotel but this one really excels in its location and its grounds - gigantic gardens that are beautiful and peaceful to stroll early morning before the heat and crowds settle in.  Rooms are lovely. We had one with a huge terrace and though the food is excellent in the restaurants we often had room service on the terrace. It was lovely to hear the extra (and extra long) call to pray in the evening sung beautifully from a nearby mosque.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lauren G wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: I stayed here for a wedding and the hotel is amazing with amazing staff! The foo is great and the grounds are so beautiful. Medhi by the pool is the best!!! So helpful and attentive. Would definitely return!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This hotel was an absolute highlight for our trip! We loved the location outside of the Medina allowing a comfortable and relaxing place to return after busy days inside the Medina. As experienced travelers I can say with confidence that the staff were some of the best we’ve ever come across! Everyone was friendly accommodating and eager to help!    The concierge was excellent too - providing incredible recommendations for dinners and planning an excellent desert camel riding excursion for us with no hassle.    Each restaurant at the hotel was great - especially Quattro which provided a surprisingly delicious Italian dinner. For a long trip to Marrakesh the pool amenities service and restaurants were the perfect home for our group.

Four Seasons Marrakesh - The property is located about 10 minutes to the Medina (old gated city) and probably 15 minutes from the airport. The hotel has a traditional Moroccan style with all the modern amenities. There are two very nice restaurants a family pool and an adult only pool teen club kids club a great gym tennis courts and a luxurious spa. It’s a great retreat from the hustle and bustle of being in the medina when you would like to also enjoy some sun and relaxation in between seeing the sights of a marvelous old city. Service is excellent and it’s a great option when traveling with kids.

We had a marvelous time at the Four Seasons Marrakech. The staff was friendly and accommodating and our room was gorgeous. We took advantage of the free shuttle to the Medina at night and recommend you do the same. The hotel booked all of our dinner reservations and it went smoothly. If you are planning an excursion (like a day trip or hot air balloon) we recommend you book through the vendor yourself. It was more expensive to do it through the hotel. We'd love to go back someday.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Kevin R wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: Stayed here for a week with my family in June. Great location and beautiful hotel. Just 10 mins form the airport and 15 mins into the centre of Marrakech. All that you would expect from a luxury hotel. We had a premier garden view terrace room which was spacious and well furnished with a large bathroom and walk-in wardrobe. The grounds of the hotel are very pleasant with palm trees and extensive gardens. Two lovely large swimming pools with lots of sun loungers as well as shade from the sun if required - and a supply of chilled bottled water. Great air-conditioned gym facilities and two tennis courts (- great fun for a knock around!).    Several restaurants on-site all serving a good mix of international and Moroccan food. The breakfast buffet was the best I've ever come across and the Moroccan buffet in the Quattro restaurant (when available) was excellent with a huge range of food from around the world. And of course there are great restaurants all over Marrakech which is only 15 mins away.    Staff were very friendly and helpful throughout. A very relaxing place to stay in Marrakech highly recommended.

Review_Title: A rather perfect stay at this much improved hotel
Review_Text: This was our second visit to the FS Marrakech. We stayed in 2016 and it really seems to have improved in terms of FS standards. It’s prettier the service more attentive and we had a wonderful week here all-in-all.    It was my birthday and we were very kindly upgraded to a suite from an Upper Pavilion King Room. I actually preferred the latter as the room dimensions and views were stunning (highly recommend this level of room!). All-in-all all staff knew us by name they knew our preferences and we met Pierre (the GM) who was at pains to meet us after a little issue we had.    The BEST thing is the 24hr conceirge by chat message! Download the FS app on your phone and you can simply ask the conceirge anything by text message. We were ordering ice buckets for the room when at the pool asking them to book/change evening reservations while in a taxi and they even went out and picked up some pain killers from a pharmacy for me - all done by instant messenger and all done with ease and a very friendly nature - nothing was too much trouble. This is GOLD DUST especially if you’re new to Marrakech.    We LOVED it here and will return for a third time. Well done to GM Pierre for elevating this hotel to TRUE FS status.    Clientele was - surprisingly - mostly British with Americans French and Middle Easterners following in that order.    Thank you for a wonderful early summer treat!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Caroline L wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: Our holiday at the Four Seasons Marrakech was wonderful. We'd go back in an eye blink.  Our stay started with a welcome from the GM as we got out of the car from the airport.  Overall staff were incredibly kind and attentive.  Food was good particularly breakfast. Only peeve was having to somewhat compete with non-residents for a dinner table particularly for a table on the terrace. But staff did their best to accommodate.  We spent so much time around the family pool: large 2 parts with diff. temps nicely configured poolside so there were distinct areas and you didn't feel on top of each other. As soon as you approach pool staff find you loungers (even when packed) then bring fresh towels and an ice box with bottles of water.  Our room - Upper Pavilion - was perfect for the 3 of us (couple + 8 yo boy): spacious very well appointed very comfy beds large terrace with view of the pool/gardens.  Haven't had such a relaxing holiday for quite a while.

The hotel went above and beyond to make us feel special during our stay. We were greeted warmly and for my birthday I received a bottle of champagne and cake. What a nice touch. Thank you for making our stay so lovely.We will be back!

Review_Title: 5 star resort all the way. Highly recommended.
Review_Text: General    Stayed here for 7 nights in May 2019. Good location about 10 minute drive from airport and without airport noise pollution. 10 min taxi drive to medina. Best asset of the hotel is their staff who are always friendly and nothing is too much bother for them. Definitely will return as the place is so relaxing.    Location  Edge of City near airport. Beautiful gardens immaculately maintained and fantastic pools - one adults only which was great.    Service  In all respects excellent. Starting with the excellent security then the Front Office which was highly efficient and incredibly helpful. Housekeeping very good. Restaurant pool and bar staff excellent who looked after us incredibly well. I would particularly like to mention Kamal who looked after us at breakfast Ms Matilda in the bar area and the boys at the pool Hamza and Amen.
