Room  Excellent in size but then we were upgraded to patio suite with pool which was a beautiful surprise. Kept immaculately by housekeeping.    Food and Drink  Breakfast buffet one of the best we have had truly excellent. We also had two evening meals (both Iftar) which were very good too. Bar drinks were good if a little expensive.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Marta K wrote a review Jun 2019
Review_Text: fantastic weekend away great service and spa staff  would recommend Taric as I had best massage in my life. Food was lovely especially dinner buffet breakfast also full of choices. nice light menu at the pool as well

Our stay at the Four Season's in Marrakech was wonderful. Our rooms were beautiful and our service was great. The property is gorgeous especially sitting on our balcony looking out over the pool area. All of the food we had on-site was delicious. We did try the gym twice and it has a fully equipped cardio room as well as a weight room which I really enjoyed.    There were protestors outside the resort yelling every time we came or left and from what I could gather it was over some labor issues. They also had security look under our buses with what appeared to be a mirror before we entered through the gates.

Easy flight to Marrakesh. Lovely pool and good selection of restaurants allows you to stay and relax if you don’t feel like exploring. If you do want to explore suggest you get a cab into town and wander around the bazar.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Hard to have a relaxing vacation with such poor service
Review_Text: I stayed here May 29 2019-June 1 2019 and had an awful experience with the staff and service. Upon check-in I was not given the option to select whether my bill would be charged in the local currency MAD or USD. Upon checkout I signed my bill which indicated the charge in local currency. At no point was I asked whether I wanted the bill to be charged on my credit card in local currency. I was in a rush to get to the airport so I did not have a chance to review my bill until arriving at the airport. At this point I realized that the hotel charged my entire bill in USD and charged a 3.5% currency exchange fee. It would be an understatement to say that I was shocked - I have an international credit card and like most other places and normal practices I assumed the hotel would charge me in local currency instead of charging me a conversion fee to charge my bill in USD without asking.    Here is where the situation gets even better. I called the hotel and explained the situation asked that they re-do the transaction in local currency as I signed on my bill. They refused alleging that I agreed to be charged in USD upon check. Nope. Totally false. The lady upon checkin took my credit card away from me and I not given any option or opportunity to decide how my bill was going to be charged. After 10-minutes of back and forth the lady said she will "speak to her manager." This is complete nonsense - this needs to be fixed or I will escalate this via my credit card company to void the entire transaction.    Other notable highlights from our stay at the Four Seasons Marrkech:    One of the days at the pool we placed a drink and food order. Our drink order was served. We waited ~60 minutes for our food order yet nothing arrived. Upon checking with the staff about our food we were told that the waiter that took our order never actually placed it with the kitchen. What?? It's not that hard to put in a food order and no one should have to wait 1.5 hours for 2 sandwiches.    The next day we had a similar awful experience again at the pool. Given the 105 F degree temperature we requested an umbrella by the pool. We were given an umbrella however while we were enjoying the pool it was taken away from us. I requested that our umbrella be replaced and was told ok. After my first requested I has to ask not one not two but *three* more times for an umbrella over the course of 45 minutes for the staff to actually bring me an umbrella. It was the worst service that I have ever experience in my life. No apologies for the delay or anything. I requested to speak to a manager about this awful poor service and he did nothing to redress the situation.    I've stayed at many different resorts and this has been the worst experience of all. I have a booking at the Four Seasons in Boston later this year which I am going to cancel after this awful experience. The Ritz and Shangri La provide much better service - take notes Four Seasons.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mr. V wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: First time in Marrakech and they made our trip wonderful. From being picked up at the airport to having the hotel tour organized we really felt like home away from home here. We loved it so much we literally came back a week later to Marrakech.

This was a family vacation in Marrakech so I'd booked this Four Seasons resort as it was child friendly and had plenty for my daughter to do including a large children's pool. We were upgraded to a larger room upon arrival which was a pleasant surprise and then ferried to our room on a electric buggy. We ate the poolside restaurant which was good. All the restaurants served a variety of quisine including an Italian restaurant and a more traditional local Moroccan dishes. My daughter absolutely loved the hotel kids play area and large kids pool where the staff were very attentive and served food and drinks by the pool side. Overall our stay here was fabulous and trip to remember with our horse ride back to the Four seasons from the main Medina in town. Would highly recommend for families looking for a luxurious escape.

This complex is an excellent place to relax and unwind. A huge gated secure site the staff were polite and attentive. A taxi ride ( reasonable cost) into the city and its famous markets and labyrinth of back streets make for an interesting insight to local life. If you were minded to you wouldn’t need to leave the complex as everything you need is there. Not cheap but you get what you pay for.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We have stayed at many luxury hotels including Jumeirgh hotels etc and other four seasons and regarding this hotel its very nice and would well recommend anyone to stay here....    It is also well positioned near the airport and has east links into the city which is a short distance away.

Review_Date: Mark C wrote a review May 2019
Review_Text: Amazing staff and service!  The chef and general manager went beyond the call of duty to make our stay here special. I would recommend staying here during Ramadan to experience the feast of a lifetime!

Review_Title: Most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. Stunning property!
Review_Text: Just returned from fabulous 5 night stay and wish I was back there !  It was my 50th out there and the hotel gave me champagne and cake which was very nice.    This was my fourth visit and I really noticed a great improvement in the service.    Spa nice but too expensive!  The pool is lovely and the guys working by pool are hard working and very friendly.    There is limited choice to eat in the evening so would be great if they opened another restaurant. Maybe something more casual?    I shall definitely be back !

Review_Title: Pool help & front desk excellent- it’s the little things that mean a lot
Review_Text: Badr C at the front desk & Medhi at the pool were two of the stand-outs in a legion of excellence. From the kind waitstaff at the AM Buffett to the room service (Osama)  and again & again — even the tour guide they arranged Aziz — we were impressed by the hospitality. It’s genuine from the heart help.    We will be coming back next year ....it’s a bit of a trek from West Coast USA but if we lived in the UK or Europe this would be a must-resort.

The property is stunning the grounds are remarkable and so well maintained. The staff are polite helpful and thoughtful. Security is tight upon entering the hotel which is reassuring. The property is 10 mins from the airport and 10mins from the Medina…it’s a nice oasis from the chaos of Marrakech.  The rooms are very nice and come with all the amenities you would expect. The pool is remarkable my advice would be to use the family pool rather than the adults only pool as it is quieter! The spa was also a spectacle.  MY only negative was the pool side restaurant menu was limited with very average food. The waiting staff at breakfast also seemed a little inexperienced.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Beautiful Hotel. the facility is well maintained the staff was friendly and very accommodating there were two separate pools one for family's and the other for adults. Great spa and restaurant. I would stay here again. Overall a wonderful experience.

The Four Seasons is a great property in the new city convenient to the airport and the Medina as well.  I have nothing but praises for the location the staff the amenities the hotel restaurant services and spa. All were as you would expect from the Four Seasons franchise but with a Moroccan flair.

This is a stunning and beautiful hotel. Room are clean and well stocked everything you need. Service and food is incredible. You feel very relaxed and looked after throughout the trip. Definitely the place to stay in Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: thoroughly enjoy my stay here food was excellent and service was quick and considerate. The pool area was really nice and service around the pool was good. They thought of everything even small insulated containers to keep your water cold

We have just returned from a 4 night stay and loved it so much that we have just rebooked again for July! We have been going to Dubai for many years and the standard of 5 star hotels there are falling each time. Was so nice to visit the four seasons in Marrakesh and experience 5 star service and surroundings again.    The service and experience was absolutely amazing. We would have trouble finding fault in anything.    Our first night we ate at the Italian Quattro - the service was second to none. Attentive waiters and very friendly. The food and wine was fantastic.    Breakfast was perfect  a great selection of foods. In particular the selection of fruit  freshly made juices and the Bircher stood out for me. We both looked forward to breakfast each day! The waiter brought us  Over a Moroccan dish to try one morning which was a nice touch.    During our stay we experienced the gym which was very well equipped with water and fruit available. We also had a 45 minute back neck and shoulder massage and used the spa facilities which were fantastic and very relaxing.    Housekeeping was particularly impressive! Rooms serviced to a very high standard twice a day. Even when we left to go out at 9pm we would get back to find we had still been turned down.    We used both the adult pool and family pool. Lounges are all set up ready to use with towels. Thoughtful extras like sun lotions straw hats are available to use and sorbets and lollies are brought around at certain points of the day.    We ate at the pool restaurant for lunch twice. The food was gorgeous and the drinks are reasonably priced for a 5 star hotel. We usually stay in Dubai where a glass of white wine would be £15 but it was just £7.50 here.    We had a pool view terrace suite and were really pleased we have chosen that room. The room was large with a separate dressing room and a bathroom with a deep bath and walk in shower.    I also have to mention the roses - there are fresh roses everywhere! Even in the bathrooms - a great touch!    We can’t wait to go back in July and experience more of this fab hotel!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Bunnie Khan wrote a review May 2019
Review_Title: Made our first time in Morocco memorable
Review_Text: This 5 star hotel truly lived up to it's name! we were treated like celebrities. The front reception  room service and resort staff were very accomodating & polite. Everyone was friendly and pleasant. we felt very safe and stress free! Thank you for a great vacation !

Review_Date: Konstantina Marina Nikolaidi wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: · Food and beverage department pool staff concierge and front office were exactly what you would expect in a 5* hotel.    · Our trip was going great until my mother realised after our first dinner in one of their restaurants that someone from the hotel's staff (most probably from housekeeping) took one of her lighters and her chocolate. As it was something small we decided to let it go. Our last night in the hotel as we started to pack my mother again realised that the cover of one of her bags was missing. Which was placed INSIDE HER LUGGAGE and the luggage was CLOSED while we were out touring around Marrakech. After looking for it everywhere and I could not find it I went to the reception and I explained what happened very politely and they said they going to have a look. Long story short they didnt find it while we were still there and when I came home and I unpacked everything I noticed that one of my rings is missing too. Again I send them an email to let them know and now my ring still cannot be found.  It is someone's choice to stay in a 5* hotel and paying all these money as we want our comfort good facilities cleanliness good food and drinks feeling safe secured and the list can go on and on but we are not paying all these money for someone to steal things from us! I admit that my mistake was not to keep it on the safe but I trusted a FIVE STAR HOTEL like Four Seasons which in general is a great company! It is ridiculous and disappointing. This ring not only was expensive but it was the first gift that my partner gave me and it is GONE! because someone from a 5* hotel decided to take it either by mistake and decided to not return it or by choice.  Their reply after all this was: "Sorry for the inconvenience".

fantastic hotel to relax great setting. The hotel is clean and service is good. The Italian restaurant is good with a great service. We enjoyed the pool althout the weather was not great  would recommend without hesitation

very friendly. Hotel is nice and clean. There are Kids Pools and adult pools. Good service! The breakfast is good with a nice terrasse. In the evening it‘s a delicious italian restaurant. Also the Concierge Service is good organized.

Review_Date: Jen L wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: We came here for a girls trip (3 of us) and we really enjoyed our stay here! The hotel was very safe clean modern all the staff were very friendly helpful and always made us feel very welcome.    From check-in to room service to dining at the hotel restaurants to lounging by the pool to check-out everything was amazing and we had absolutely no complaints! Which is quite impressive coming from 3 women haha...    We especially enjoyed the pool area there were lots of seats available to lounge in sunscreen and towels were provided the menu had a good selection of wines and drinks I think there was food as well but we didn’t order any.    The hotel staff were all so very nice they all always greeted us with a smile and a genuine warm welcome. Hassan was our favourite! He brought us to our rooms the first night and we bumped into him a few times during our stay he also recommended two restaurants and they were absolutely fantastic!    We will definitely be staying here again when we come back to Marrakech!    Ps. We did go to the Royal Mansour and La Mamounia for lunch and spa and although the hotels were very beautiful but we were definitely glad we picked the Four Seasons.

Review_Date: richard b wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: i expected high quality and that was exactly what i got. the front desk staff on check in were very professional and sorted a minor inconvenience with no fuss. the food and drink offer in the hotel is of the highest quality and delivered with very very high level but relaxed service

Review_Date: Paul DuBois wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Title: Unique Experience & great introduction to Morocco
Review_Text: This hotel is like an oasis away from the hustle and bustle of the night markets and tourist stalls of Central Marrakech. Hotel staff are discreet and very helpful. Pool and gym facilities are fantastic and I could have spent the whole week just soaking up the sun.    The Concierge Team were fantastic in organising a car to take us through the Atlas Mountains and a lunch in Asni.    Large and private bedrooms rooms ours had a small balcony perfect for watching the sunset. Large grounds make it excellent for a leisurely stroll after exploring the mysteries and delights of Marrakech.    Wonderful memories here and warmly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nicholas H wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: Great experience - wonderful hotel well worth the visit. Extremely comfortable with highly accommodating staff. Certainly check out the pools and Spa experience. Also the lounge bar and dining os one of the best I have experienced.

Review_Date: Julia H wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: A big thank you to everyone at the Four Seasons Marrakech. We had a wonderful week and are definitely coming back to this very friendly and generous hotel. Our rooms were fabulous the service friendly and the food very tasty. In particular we loved our lunches at the pool restaurant. Grilled lobster a glass of very delicious local wine and live music - it doesn't get much better.  Best wishes from Julia & family

We are coming back! Thank you everyone especially Medhi for his incredible service around the pool. We had such a fun time! Everyone looked after us so well and the hotel is beautifully clean and well set out. Happy holiday!

We had a great family break in 4 seasons Marrakesh. It was perfect for a short break with the kids and we’d highly recommend. The staff were a huge plus...so attentive and amazingly patient with the kids. Mehdi and his team by the pool were great and the staff on reception so helpful advising and organising trips. Our room was fantastic and the food from breakfast to dinner to room service was top notch. All in all a great stay...thanks to all at 4 seasons! And for letting the kids pretend to work on reception and as security guards!

Was our first time in Morocco and we really want to enjoy the 6days we have in this amazing country. We booked this hotel for 3nights and we really loved it and the team who is working in that hotel.    Our room was great and very large including private shower and toilet. The food was great and the hotel is not far from the airport and the old city of Marrakech.    I really recommend this hotel

Took my daughter for a sweet 16 trip to Marrakech and was pleasantly surprised at how easy it was to get around and how much we loved the Four Seasons Marrakech. It along with the FourSeasons Ko’Olina (Hawaii) are now my favorite. We are coming back next year and bringing my son. Great family location so close to the city and great cultural experiences !

Four Seasons hotels come with reasonably high expectations so with that in mind my review -    Rooms are terrific. We had two interconnecting Upper Pavillion rooms. Excellent all round lovely terraces. We also had a garden patio room which was also very nice.    Lunch and dinner are great - both in food and value.    Service is also great. Lovely friend people. Happy to help.    Grounds are lovely and very well looked after.    But as with all hotels there are a few niggles. Breakfast is not great. The buffet room resembles a motorway service station and is dark. It needs to be re-done. The kids pool is half heated and half is a cold pool - forces everyone to be in the warm pool which is then crowded. The tennis court is old and is overlooked by a building site (four seasons residences). The young adults club has a table tennis table which is not level and needs replacing which shouldn't be the case - especially during high kids easter season.    They will fix most of the above I'm sure. The biggest issue for me they can't fix. The actual hotel size. It feels a bit small - especially for Marrakesh. Unlike some of the others that have large space it feels like its a 30second walk from your room to the pool to the hotel borders to breakfast to lunch. It should be stretched by around 30metres in every direction which obviously they can't do.    So in the end if you are looking for an easy 3hr flight from London a 10min taxi ride to a nice hotel with lovely staff and food it does have it - but its not the best Four Seasons property and possibly not the best in Marrakesh. But its nice so remains a good option for a family break.

Review_Date: Amy H wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Text: Lovely hotel in a great location. Great staff and very relaxed with a separate family and family pool. Highlights were the bar/ restaurant and concierge service. Good gym too. Will come back with kids next time
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Liz E wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Title: Marrakech made better by our stay
Review_Text: An oasis in a wonderful city with staff that were exceptional. Rooms were incredibly comfortable and the service we received was commendable. The concierge team were spot in in recommendations and organisation which made our 4 days a seamless and fun / energetic adventure. The spa was heavenly and was easy to book. The four seasons always deliver in my opinion but this specific resort exceeded all expectations.

We are very regular customers of the Four Seasons Hotel in Marrakech. We come for 3 to 4 days with family friends or both. The reason why we are not tempted to experience another resort of a similar category is simply because we have found here exactly what we were looking for: A beautiful Hotel with splendid gardens and 2 large swimming pools a quality of the management that shows in the attention of the staff  the quality of the service and the extremely well maintained hotel. We like to go out in the morning after breakfast to enjoy the shopping in Marrakech then we go back to have a lunch by the swimming pool and we enjoy the afternoon there. In the evening we go enjoy to enjoy the night life in Marrakech.

We stayed there for a week in 3/2019 we got the room with private small diving pool the room is spacious and loverly.  The staffs and the front dest as well as at the hotel entrance are wonderful and helpful.    We have arranged a few tours with hotel they were all great. The camel ride in dessert are of a lot of fun especially with a bunch of kids. It is almost like glamping in the dessert. I personally think the fire man show during the dinner in the dessert is a must see with the wonderful music playing the background of dessert.    We took a number of trips to Medina with the tour guide provided through the hotel. They are all wonderfully helpful.    There is ATM in the hotel so it is rather east to get cash except it was broken one day I did exchange some $ to cash at the front (the exhange rate is not great) so ATM is the best way to get cash.    We left kids in the kid club one day the kids had a lot fun in kids club the staffs in kids club are great.    We even got baby sitters through the hotel one night without any problem.    It is east to get rider with taxi or hotel car to any of the restaurants in town although I suggest you need to ask the hotel staff how much the taxi cost when coming back to the hotel.    The pool is also heated in 1/2 of area.    The only place slightly less than ideal is the food in the morocco restaurant at the hotel it is obviously expensive and not up to par.  However the breakfast is great with extensive selections. All the staffs are wonderfully helpful.

Review_Date: aisha a wrote a review Apr 2019
Review_Title: Not four seasons quality - EXTREMELY DISAPPOINTED -
Review_Text: We were extremely disappointed by the quality of service. We faced some issues before arrival as we had booked a room in the upper pavilion unaware that it was a separate building. Once we had discovered this mistake it became an absolute nightmare trying to change the reservation. We had spoken to everyone without any progress and were left with no other option than to speak to the secretary of the general manager to try to quell our problem who luckily was able to help us.    This should have been an indication of what was to come. The concierge failed to get back to us on numerous occasions regarding the reservations that we tried make.    The hotel is unusually noisy with doors slamming at the break of dawn. Airplanes can be heard flying overhead after my sister had complained they offered to upgrade her to a suite. There were insects crawling all over the suite and despite her complaints she returned night after night to find insects.    The biggest trouble was that the staff were unable to understand us despite speaking both English and Arabic. We visited Riad’s in marrakesh who had a better grasp of both languages.    Our phone calls often went unanswered which again is quite unusual for a hotel of this ranking. The concierge and the reception simply do not answer the phone! We had to call room service/spa in order to have our call transferred to someone who could help us.    The TV did not work upon arrival. This is a strange for the four seasons.    The only saving grace of the hotel is the lobby area which has a nice ambiance. This is not the four seasons.. !

The hotel is an excellent facility / resort. Landscaping is amazing. The hotel staff are excellent and will know you by name and are very helpful. The rooms compared to the rest of the facility look a bit dated. But this in no way tarnished our experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: From the moment we arrived to the moment we left the hotel the customer care and service was exceptional I don’t think words describe how good it was. We were made to feel special from the moment we entered it was so genuine and not forced. That is a skill in itself! The concierge arranged our trips with such ease and they were truly unforgettable especially the camel trip to the Agafay desert we will never go through travel companies again. Nothing was too much trouble. The hotel arranged a private transfer on the evening to the Medina. He was there to collect us at the time we had asked for. We had booked our own private transfer with the airline normally we see our name displayed at arrivals but couldn’t see anything. We found a man from Four Seasons who straight away made calls and helped us find where our transfer was so very kind. The room was beautiful so clean and I slept like a baby. The resort is so tranquil I loved ambling round the gardens the flowers were so beautiful and listening to the sound of the birds. We had a lovely day by the pool again looked after like royalty but I didn’t want to abuse it or take it for granted like many others. We ate every evening in the Inra restaurant I loved listening to the Moroccan man playing the traditional music. As for the food I have never tasted food as delicious in my life and we have eaten at Michelin star restaurants they don’t come close. They treated like celebrities which I find so humbling. Breakfast was fantastic my husband is going to miss the freshly squeezed orange juice so much. To celebrate 25 years of marriage in a Hotel like this is incredible and the memories will stay with us forever. Thank you to all of you. One day we might be lucky enough to stay again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Just returned from a week's stay at the Marrakech with family. 3 rooms. OUTSTANDING in virtually every way. Number one- the people. I cannot say enough about the care we received from absolutely everyone- from the moment of arrival to the instant of departure. Abderrahim greeted us upon arrival and attended to all our needs at the front desk/concierge throughout the stay. He is an absolute gem as is the entire front desk team. He set us up with a most amazing suite where everything was clean and of the absolute highest standard. Food at all 3 restaurants was superb. I want to mention Osama in particular at the casual "Riad" restaurant where music played daily. Osama didn't go the extra mile for us- he went the extra 10 miles. One day we were in the rec area playing pool ad he found us to deliver snacks and drinks. He always had a great table for us and personally picked some great wines he knew we'd enjoy. Loved the guitar in the evening as did my 6 year old. A special time. All of the excursions were arranged by the hotel and they were so much fun safe Fabulous guides and educational as well. The pool was great- although on the kids side there are some sharp edges on the stairs and walls into the pool that you must be careful not to get cut. Loved the very large property with ample areas to take walks. Not much to comment negatively about. Wish I could name the countless people who made our stay the best.

We visited FS Marrakech back in February 2018 last year the hotel room and grounds were beautifully presented and as always with FS the service and welcome was top notch. Our short stay was dominated by bad weather so it was a shame we didn’t get chance to use the pool area but we hope to return in the hotter months in the future and make use of it :)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple
Reviewer_Location: The Royal Town of Sutton Coldfield, United Kingdom

Review_Date: Chan M wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: Only a short cab ride to the medina; but inside the grounds you felt 100 miles away from the hubbub and crowds. The rooms generally have spacious balconies and were well appointed as you would expect from Four Seasons. The staff could not have been nicer or more helpful - maintenance even repaired my suitcase with a broken wheel and flat refused a tip. Lunch by the pool was relaxing. Overall this was one of the nicest properties I have ever visited.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We travel quite a lot and stay often in "normal" 5 star hotels. Usually we always find fault with something. Nothing to complain about just nagging between us.  Four Seasons Marrakesh is one of the very few places we have spent a week and there was absolutely nothing to whine about. Nice place nice rooms nice people nice atmosphere nice location even though the weather wasn't nice. Great pools with really great people (much nicer than just nice...).
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Steve C wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: I went to Morocco for the first time with my daughter and wanted an absolute safe bet for a place to stay. The Four Seasons property and staff did not disappoint. The staff was incredibly courteous and attentive. Our room was beautiful. The food was superb. Great work out facility. Very good value too. The concierge got us dinner reservations at a place that was fully booked. We would go back again for sure. One thing to note is that you may want to book certain activities directly. The hotel has a pretty steep mark up. We booked an ATV excursion for half the price the hotel quoted.

Hotel with fantastic grounds located just a few minutes from the medina. The pool areas are great for relaxing and you can easily spend a whole day there just relaxing. Rooms have excelent conditions and staff is very attentive. Hotel meets Four Seasons standards.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Bad recommendation to Agafay desert, very disappointed customers.
Review_Text: The reception recommended us a trip to Agafay desert. Let me start by saying that we had a really bad experience. The driver who took us didn't speak a word English and that made it very difficult for us to communicate. Arriving at the camp we have waited very long for the camels and also this guide didn't speak a word English either. The manager of the place was absolutly not friendly he was very cold and we didn't feel welcome. The hospitality was far to find and you dong expect that if you know what we have paid for this excursion. We had a very bad evening. We also were very disappointed in the transportation and that for an exclusive hotel as Four Seasons you expect more luxury and not a Renault. We felt like sitting in a schoolbus. My husband had notice this because we are used being transported in luxury cars like the first day they picked us up from the airport in a luxury car (Mercedes).  The stay at the hotel was good beautiful place good service and nice rooms. I would recommend the hotel to everybody but the recommendation to Inara camp from the reception was very bad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The staff at the hotel went beyond what you would normally expect at a luxury resort. Problems we experienced with the travel agent we used for excursions in Marrakech were handled with by the Four Seasons concierge staff with aplomb. We travelled with our children and grandchildren and upon arrival their accommodations were immediately upgraded to what can be described as Villa status.

Highly recommended hotel and resort to discover and appreciate Moroccan savoir- vivre.  Families are welcome couples are surely pampered and well taken care of.  The decorations of the hotel are very stilish and in line with new modern Moroccan style.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Beautiful property outside the old town
Review_Text: After spending 10 nights in Morocco staying at riads it was nice to stay at a resort property with all the amenities at home. We needed a break from Moroccan cuisine and Quattro the Italian restaurant was the perfect answer. We stayed in a king room with a terrace and it was easily big enough for a rollaway for our daughter. The huge bathroom and walk in closet gave us plenty of room to spread out.    The service was great but all the security gave it a more intimidating feel versus the warmth of the service and reception at the riads. However it was perfect for a time to relax and enjoy the luxury.

Had a great time at the Four Season Resort They upgraded us to their Best Royal Villa and it was just amazing. We were travelling with friends and having out private pool and all the villa made much more fun. We travel a lot and I'll always keep Four Seasons in mind now.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Just returned from a family trip to Four Seasons Marrakech pure luxury. We celebrated my daughters 30th Birthday and they went out of their way to make it special. Staff were great resort amazing will be returning soon

We stayed at FS Marrakesh recently. The property was beautiful rooms nicely done and the price was reasonable considering it was the peak season. Some of us were upgraded to the Royal Villa which is spectacular
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Wish I could give it 10 stars!
Review_Text: We just returned from 4 nights at this magnificent resort. We were traveling with our children- ages 4 6 and 9 and chose this hotel because of its family friendly reputation. Besides being absolutely gorgeous (rooms and grounds) this hotel truly goes above and beyond in every way imaginable. My husband and I are avid travelers and have stayed at many luxury resorts and hotels around the world but have never experienced service like we did at the Four Seasons Marrakech. Before I go into smaller details I want to give an example of the level of service that you can expect at this resort. We had booked our stay through our travel agent who also booked us various tours and experiences in the city. One morning we were booked (by our travel agent) for a private family cooking class (that also included my parents who we were traveling with). When we arrived at the “cooking school” it was clear that our travel agent had been duped. It’s not worth going into details but I’ll leave it that we were in a remote location in the middle of the Medina and it was pretty scary. I texted the hotel through their app on my phone and explained the situation. They told me to sit tight and within a few minutes had us booked for another private cooking class and said that someone would be there to pick us up within 15 minutes. Less than 15 minutes later a gentleman arrived and escorted the 7 of us to the new cooking class (The Lotus Chef School) which was exactly the type of cooking experience we were looking for. The hotel truly saved the day! The concierge also arranged transportation back to the hotel for us after the cooking class and contacted the camel ride location that our travel agent had booked us on for that afternoon to make sure that it was legitimate and to also move the time back because of the delay we had in the morning. Because our day got pushed back it was too late to bring our children out for dinner with us that night. We asked the hotel if they could arrange a babysitter for our kids so that we could put them to sleep and go for dinner on our own but unfortunately all of the English speaking babysitters through their babysitting agency were taken. When I told the concierge to please cancel our dinner reservation because we couldn’t leave our children with a non English speaking babysitter he told me to give him a few minutes because he would “find a solution.” Again like the magic of the morning experience within a short time the hotel had arranged for one of the kids club staff members (the wonderful Fatima) to babysit so we could still go out. Moreover when they delivered the room service dinner we ordered for our children they also delivered a lovely dessert tower for us because they were so sorry for the bad experience (that was absolutely no fault of their own and that they miraculously fixed for us!) we had in the morning!  Other things worth mentioning- We had the hotel book us a guide for the souks and the guide was a million times better than the guide our travel agent booked for us for sightseeing around the city. Next time we will have the hotel book all excursions and activities for us because everything they booked was amazing. We were surprised with a generous room upgrade that provided us with incredible space for our family of 5. Our children’s room had multiple kid friendly touches (including an age appropriate toothbrush for each of them- showing us that management/staff actually took the time to look into our kids ages). The staff could not have been nicer or more accommodating. Whether we were in a restaurant on the grounds at the pool in a golf cart being transported- every single staff member we encountered was wonderful. There is a huge family pool where your children can splash and play without fear of disturbing adults (half of the pool is heated). Although my kids didn’t have time to spend in the kids club we checked it out and the staff was lovely and we are sure our kids would have enjoyed it if we had more time. There is very tight security to enter the resort which also gave us comfort. It was truly hard to say goodbye to this resort and the phenomenal staff and management yesterday morning. Our kids are already begging to go back and even though it’s a long trip from the NY area we hope to return next year!

My family and I just left The Four Seasons Marrakech a few days ago after a four night stay that was absolutely wonderful!    As our first trip to Marrakech and Morocco for that matter I had a difficult time trying to decide between La Villa des Orangers La Mamounia The Mandarin and The Four Seasons. I am so happy we chose to stay here. Truly the best decision.    Less than 10 minutes from the airport and the center of town. I originally thought it might be disadvantageous not to be located in the Medina. After touring we realized it was a relief. As exciting and lively as the Medina is; and as beautiful as some of the riads are the Medina is kind of gritty. The Four Seasons was a refuge from it all and a beautiful property at that. Not generic or void of a sense of “place.” Very well done. Great balance of Moroccan style with modern elements.    We arrived very late at night and yet we had a complete team waiting for us with big smiles. Not the “night shift.” We had a long travel day and being made to feel so welcome even at such a late hour was incredibly nice. Not surprising since this was a Four Seasons but all the same it was a great first impression.    We needed some items from housekeeping and my family asked if we could still possibly order room service despite the awful hour. Everything came quickly and was delivered beautifully. The rooms we were given were very nice but we were curious if an upgrade might be possible. The next morning we were told there would be a much better option available for us after exploring Marrakech. We returned from the Medina and the door was opened to our own...The Presidential Suite. There are upgrades and then there are UPGRADES. This was beyond spectacular. Huge gorgeous with views that were pure magic. However this was just one of many highlights of our stay. Relaxing poolside in the afternoons was a treat. Just heaven. Superb service throughout. I mean truly spot on. Warm personal polished and efficient. Our only gripe was that we wish we were staying longer in Marrakech to enjoy this incredible suite and the other amenities of the hotel. It was a real oasis. Loved it. A big thank you to the Four Seasons in Marrakech for an outstanding stay!

All round great hotel! Staff are really friendly and the service is great too. Would definitely stay here again when returning to Marrakesh. Would recommend to friends and family. 10/10 service! Doesn't disappoint.

The food was outstanding and the staff was over the top polite. Will definitely go back for this kind of service !!!! We have never been disappointed staying at the Four Seasons and this was no exception!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This hotel is one of the finest in the world. The rooms are all fantastic the staff extremely attentive and what you would expect at a Four Seasons. The grounds are impeccably maintained. The pool is an oasis. Amazing spa great workout area with tennis courts. Restaurants are all wonderful. Great kids room with hoops court. Really has it all.

Review_Date: Michiel huysmans wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: Our holiday at the four seasons resort in Marrakech was great!! The services in this resort are impeccable!! My family and i enjoyed every minute we spend in this resort!!! We will return for sure and hope to enjoy the services and luxurious facility's of the hotel very soon again!! Very childfriendly hotel!!!

A true oasis in the midst of a diverse city that overloads the senses.  It’s calm tranquil carefully thought through. Beautifully maintained inside and out.  The rooms are spacious comfortable French Moroccan interior with clean lines.  The food is impeccable from dusk til dawn.    By far their best asset is the staff. The most incredible people all of them! You feel as if you’re making friends it’s not forced or contrived. It’s totally genuine they care. It’s simple.  We would go back in heartbeat.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: One of the best Four Seasons
Review_Text: This hotel is beautiful. Everything from the terrace area overlooking the beautiful fountains and grounds to the adult pool. Restaurants are also very nice. The standout here is the hospitality and service. Even above four seasons standards. The entire staff were so helpful enthusiastic and polite. This stay could not have been improved in any way.

Review_Date: Sieffre Scott Josif wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Title: Wonderful escape just a stone's throw from old city
Review_Text: At first this property seemed a bit isolating to me but soon realized it was a welcome reprieve from the chaos of the old city. I stayed in one of the bungalows which felt like our own private house. Standard Four Seasons quality & service.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This Four Seasons is a beautiful hotel with wonderful service and attention to detail. The rooms are modern and spacious with comfy bed walk in closet bath shower toilet sitting area outside lounges etc. Moroccan Italian and Mediterranean restaurants complete hot and cold breakfast buffet beautiful lounges and bar two large swimming pool one for adults and one for families with children spa etc. It is very relaxing and not far from the old town and the airport although you will need a taxi. ATM on the premises and very helpful staff.

I stay in Four Season Marrakech with my boyfriend. I love this places. It is perfect.. everything details And so on are perfect.  We also had Dinner at Quattro’s restaurant and it was a beautiful experience!!! every course was very good I loved the parfait.    I hope very soon to return in Four Season!!!!  Thanks so much for all.  Love Giorgia.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We found the service excellent. Beautiful ambience great food. Facilitues spa pool and fitness were luxurious. The rooms were very comfortable and we had a great view. All the restaurants offered variety and high quality food. I will definitely go again.

Review_Date: Natalia D wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: Amazing service resort food! Everything 5 stars(as usual standard for FS)! My family really enjoy every day spender in Resort. Stuff was friendly and helpful. Food very tasty. Resort impress the beauty.

Review_Date: Mike M wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Title: There aren't many 5 stars, but this is one.
Review_Text: This is a magnificent hotel in a beautiful setting and the staff is amazing. I have absolutely nothing in the way of a critique only plaudits: The food is amazing - if you eat in one night try the Veal Chops in Quattro amazing! The rooms are well laid out and conceived. Ours was a garden view room. It's a little hard to navigate the hotel because of the layout but once you get the hang of it it's fine.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Planet Deeps wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Title: A great Hotel with exceptional customer service.
Review_Text: We arranged hotel pick up through this hotel. The driver was late and the hotel kindly reduced the cost of this pickup on request without any difficulty. The hotel itself was situated about 10 minutes from the airport so not very difficult to get to. In a great location in the city of Marrakech.    Overall the staff at the hotel were exceptional and felt they did go the extra mile. The customer service was fantastic. The hotel were aware that we were celebrating my wife's 30th Birthday and they kindly provided a complimentary room upgrade which was a nice touch. They also decorated the room and provided a delicious cake. The room service team were fantastic. We were able to easily order food in without difficulty which was great - we opted for Kech burger which was very tasty! I would highly recommend this hotel and would stay again. Thank you to the team at four seasons marrakech for your kind service.

Review_Date: lizzie C wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: The four seasons hotel in Marrakech is a total delight. The design and floral displays in the main reception areas are simply stunning. It’s a treat to sit and relax in such a chic yet relaxing atmosphere. However it’s the staff who make the four seasons so very special. Such warm friendly and attentive service at all times.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed four nights in this hotel  it sets in acres of beautiful gardens  our room have wonderful views of the Atlas Mountains the hotel is near to the airport where you can hear the take off but it’s not loud. Breakfast is very good. Staff especially the valet parking are very helpful.

Review_Title: Half Term Getaway at Marvellous Four Seasons Marrakech
Review_Text: The hotel is wonderfully equipped for children. There's a great kids' club plus my daughter spent hours in the children's pool. The location is perfect being not too far from the airport and also very close to Place Jemaa El-Fna.

Review_Date: Arlene B wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Text: The Hotel is large set in beautiful grounds. The bedroom is comfortable with very poor lighting. You have to turn on every light in the room. The pillows are too soft and you need a firmer pillow. There are plenty of drawers and storage space for clothes and Toiletries and the room is spacious. Nice balcony. The air conditioning works well.The housekeeping needs attention as they often do not replace the bathroom shampoosgels etc or the capsules for the Nespresso machine. The Wifi could be improved as you often need to reconnect. The service in the restaurants is reasonable but the waiters often need to be summoned. Quattro restaurant for breakfast was very good and the chef made a good omelette.The food in Inara restaurant was average. The lighting on the terrace was so poor you could not see what you were eating.The Hotel merits 5 stars because of the lovely grounds but otherwise it is 4 star. Staff are warm and friendly. The signage in the grounds is good but needs attention in the Hotel. It is a large Hotel and you have to ask directions when you first arrive as the signage is non existent.

This was another excellent FS property. The resort was located in a large sprawling compound. The gym spa pool were all top notch. Restaurant services were excellent. The rooms were large well furnished. There was attention to detail evident and all one had to do was to call housekeeping if something was not up to scratch.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: stig l wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Title: Heaven of tranquility after a day in the Medina
Review_Text: Hotel cover a very big area with parks and two big pool areas. Well protected gateway to enter. We had a very big room with large bathroom facilities. Service superb with 2 restaurants on the premises. Only negative no reading lights on the beds.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: manuel L wrote a review Mar 2019
Review_Title: Amazing stay at Four Seasons Marrakech
Review_Text: Property is amazing. Beautiful gardens with an adults only (heated) pool as well as a large family pool. Conveniently located within 10 minutes from the airport and the Medina. The staff is amazing and nothing is too much trouble.

My wife and I made no plans prior to arrival. We just talked with the concierge and our entire stay was planned within minutes. However there is more to the magic. Each of the activities were executed in a fashion fit for royalty. Never for a moment did we feel unsafe. Instead we always felt the staff was concerned with where we were and always happy to see us return. Cannot imagine staying anywhere else.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A beautiful 40 acre property. Lovely gardens. The rooms were very nice. There are two restaurants. Both average. Both disappointing. Gym facilities are excellent. Tennis courts. The main shortcoming was the staff. Not trained in the Four Seasons tradition. You couldn’t help but feel that everyone was new at their job and at times didn’t know what they were doing. Also a bit of a language barrier if you don’t speak French or Moroccon.

We celebrated my birthday in Marrakech and the Four Seasons was luxury! The staff were so attentive and lovely everyone went the extra mile. The hotel is in a perfect location not too far from the center but still far enough to relax. My husband booked us the Hammam Spa and a couples massage both were amazing and I would highly recommend making the most of the spa facilities. The hotel overall was AMAZING. We would definitely come back to relax and enjoy the luxurious surroundings.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jonathan M wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Title: Lovely Resort and Great Place to visit
Review_Text: This was an exceptional property that is as beautiful as it appears in the pictures. Hope to be fortunate to return in the future. The setting is nice because it is a bit outside of the city and the property feels exceptionally secure.

Review_Date: Sheri B wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Title: The best hotel we have ever stayed in
Review_Text: We are currently staying at this wonderful resort hotel.  The hotel is simply outstanding.  What makes this such a special place is the staff.  The service is beyond anything we have ever encountered having travelled to many countries and experienced a number of five star hotels this really has to be regarded as the best.  Everything is perfect but it is costly breakfast is out of this world.  If you are visiting Marakesh and would like an oasis near the city do not hesitate to book this beautiful hotel.  Perfection a special thanks to Jihane who made every effort to make our stay so special.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Paradise in the most unlikely of places
Review_Text: Four Seasons Marrakech creates an ambiance that preserves the local identity of its surroundings food and culture while providing the highest level of service an international hotel can provide to a demanding clientele. The food was fantastically presented and flavorful. The staff and management were attentive beyond words to the last detail of our requests. The property was immaculately cared for and the family pool area is the best we've seen anywhere in the world. Highly recommend Four Seasons Marrakech to any traveler looking for authentic Morocco in an international envelope.

We are there for a 5 day / 4 night break. The staff at the Four Seasons made us very welcomed. They were all friendly and seemed happy. Their attitudes create a really good atmosphere around the hotel. We loved our stay. The hotel gardens the swimming pool breakfasts on the lower terraces evening meals on the upper terrace were all thoroughly enjoyable. Walking up each morning and looking out from our balcony over the gardens was so relaxing. We didn't get to use the Spa but had a tour of the facilities and it looked good. The hotel is located in the new town area so it is out of the hustle and bustle of the old town but sufficiently near that getting to the old town is really easy. Also really easy to get to the airport.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Claudia M wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Title: Peaceful respite in a beautiful city
Review_Text: I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Marrakech. The rooms are lovely. I had a West-facing balcony so could enjoy the sunsets every evening. The balcony was spacious and could accommodate a room service meal. The dinner at Quattro was authenticly Italian.  The birdsong was beautiful as were the grounds.

Review_Date: Private Morocco Tour Guide/Driver wrote a review Feb 2019
Review_Text: In a city known for culinary richness Four Seasons Resort Marrakech puts stylish fine dining restaurant choices at your door. Enjoy the flavours of Mediterranean cuisine at Azzera savour South Italian gourmet dishes at Quattro or share cocktails and Middle Eastern mezze in the comfort of Inara Lounge.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We have just got back from FS Marrakech and I have to say we had an amazing time. We travelled with our 21 month old daughter and was impressed by how much thought FS had put into accommodating families.    We stayed in a garden room which had a lovely little terrace and plenty of space for the three of us. The rooms was modern and clean with Morrocan touches.    We were impressed by the fact the hotel provided us with not only a cot but also a baby bath baby products (shampoos and wash etc) and a special diaper bin.    We loved the fact that the hotel didn’t feel crowded. There are three pools in total too. Adult pool Family pool and a little baby pool. The family and baby pool were both heated too.    There was also a separate jacuzzi area.    We absolutely loved walking amongst the beautiful gardens around the hotel. Our Toddler daughter loved running along pathways and kept her entertained.    The kids club was definitely a highlight. They transformed it into a mini Kasbah. Our daughter went there every day. It had both an outdoor and indoor area with plenty of toys and entertainment. We were very Impressed!!!    We didn’t dine at any of the restaurants as we mainly stuck to in room dining and we really enjoyed the varied tasty options. The breakfast at Inara was great and had mixture of both continental hot and local breakfast.    The service was of a very high standard and staff was always on hand to help and assist.    I recommend you download the Four Seasons App. This app gives you so much information about the resort and we used the app daily to order the food.    We enjoyed the calmness amongst the hecticness of the Red City. The ambiance and setting was very relaxed and tranquil.    This was our first stay at a Four Seasons resort and based on this experience I don’t think it will be our last.

all in all an excellent stay  the private pool patio was superb and very comfortable clean  housekeeping was very attentive  the garden is amazing as well as the pools  the staff in general is very helpful

The hotel is situated Far away from the buzzing town but yet close enough to it. The hotel is fantastic has everything you want. The place is quite and relaxing. We loved our stay and we will be back soon. Highly recommend
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Large spacious hotel with nice rooms and fabulous grounds. Good location near the arirport although slightly out from the centre so you need to get taxis to and from. The restaurant was OK and breakfast was fine the bar was a little dull with little atmossphere although the outside bar is a nice space. The spa is wonderful I had a hamman expericence which was fun. Overall enjoyed our stay
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is undoubtedly the best hotel in Marrakech - from the moment of arrival we were treated with fantastic professional service and hospitality!!. Security on entrance to the hotel is really good and was really professional and courteous. Our room was great and the pool area a real wow!! The grounds are so extensive and you could spend ages going from area to area. We tried the spa and spent a day in the relaxing area following our treatments. We spent every night at the Quatro restaurant where the the wonderful Piero as Head Chef was resident. He came out to us each occasion and delighted to serve us whatever we considered we wanted. I had one of the best risotto's ever two nights in a row. Specific mention has to be made to Tariq in the Quatro bar who delighted in making the most wonderful concoctions for drinks - he had smoke machines and all sorts of things creating a real theatre in all he did. He had me addicted to the Lemon sherbet Prosecco's - I cannot have anything else since trying them- I loved it!!. The pool area was a real wow and the most beautiful heated outdoor pool with wonderful sunbeds. The attendants very keen to offer water hats and suncream at any point and a fabulous pool restaurant serving wonderful food.In all I cannot wait to go back - we loved it and missing it already!!

Review_Title: A lovely 5 day stay at the Four Seasons in Marrakech!
Review_Text: A truly excellent resort hotel in every way. The property is gorgeous our room was spacious and overlooked a lovely private garden. The staff were all very kind and helpful and there was so much attention paid to detail. We received a complimentary bottle of Moroccon wine the day before we left and were also given a bottle of prosecco and a cake for our special occasion.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The Four Seasons Marrakesh was our first encounter with this luxury label. Expectations where high. Especially since the nightly rate stands out from almost any other accommodation in Marrakech.    The travel company arranged private transportation from the airport to the hotel. Transfer time is a maximum of 10 minutes.    After the “magical” Four Seasons gate opened we were very impressed with the wonderful driveway to the lobby area. Our bags were taken care of and we proceeded towards the reception for our check-in.    We were not offered welcome drinks or any check-in delicacies that are usually offered in this five star range. Check-in was very quick and we were guided on a golf cart to our pavilion patio room. The friendly receptionist firstly gave a tour of the resort making sure that we would know our way around. The grounds are quite magnificent and well kept.    Our room was spacious and the private terrace is a big plus: plenty of sun sun loungers and a big wall that provides a lot of privacy. There is a large bathroom with both a rain shower and a tub with extra depth separate toilet and bidet and a double sink.    All facilities were there but we thought there were not enough amenities provided. If there is a bath you would expect bath salt and/or enough shampoo conditioner and wash gel that would make it possible to shower and bath if you want to (especially for two people).  The amenities provided are not the same as the amenities provided in the Spa. The Four Seasons branded products and amenities in the Spa are of a higher quality and more luxurious.    On arrival there were local pastries and a fruit-bowl on the table in our room. We highly appreciated these welcome gestures. However the fruit-bowl was never replenished during our week. Staying at a five star resort of a premium brand you would expect (at least) daily fresh fruit. Especially since the entire garden was full of orange trees. Coffee and tea however is complimentary. The Nespresso coffee was also highly appreciated and was of better quality than the coffee that was served at breakfast. There is a daily turn down service but no extra's (or news papers) that you might expect when staying at the Four Seasons. A small gesture like a chocolate / or treat (or even a weather report) is usually the standard in most five star hotels.    Overall the room is very spacious very clean and provided much comfort but it did not have that luxury feeling that we were expecting: it was rather basic. *please check the bed in room 90 (it does not level out/ crooked to the top right).    We also recommend to have a resort guide in the room explaining all facilities and all options that are available to the hotel guests. There is an option via the TV for information but this is very limited.    We also recommend to adjust the timers of the lightening at the resort: if you have an early breakfast (7 in the morning) it is pitch dark outside and the hotel lights were already turned of. It would be best to have some light when navigating through from your room through the garden.    The breakfast was very good buffet style with an egg and pancake station. From a full English breakfast to fruits it is all available. One morning we encountered a large group that made breakfast quite a hassle. We recommend the hotel to host groups for breakfast in another section (for instance: upstairs). Also on the buffet is a tablet stating "ask your server for our Moroccan specialities". It would be best to have a menu stating all options including the marvellous juice options. Breakfast was included in our rate however we needed to sign the bill every day. I understand it serves the administrative process but it feels a bit strange signing a bill of approx 70 EUR a day for breakfast if it is included in your rate.    On the day of arrival we checked in quite late and decided to stay at the resort and have dinner in the Italian restaurant. The service was excellent. The staff made an effort to address you by your name and were most polite and excellent with their service: what a great team! We were hoping for pizza's but the menu stated "pizzolis" basically some sort of calzone pizza's that were the signature of this restaurant: our advice to the restaurant stick to regular pizza's.    Since we visited the hotel in January it was rather chilly. We used the outdoor heated hotel pool once. We were provided with water in a cooler and received a pear with cocos on a stick. These are the extras that you would expect when visiting a four seasons our compliments!    The spa was also wonderful. We received a tour and were guided to the locker room. Men and woman have their own facilities. There is a Haman a sauna a cold bath and a hot bath with whirlpool and waterfall. Tea and nuts and dry fruits are provided. As mentioned before the amenities and products in the Spa are more luxurious as the amenities and products that are provided in room. The gym is located at a different location. Basically all equipment is provided for a good exercise.    To travel from the resort to the medina you need a taxi. The concierge and security team were most friendly interested and correct. Excellent service! On our first trip out we received advice on the normal taxi rates; this was very helpful. When getting back to the resort we were friendly greeted by security with a smile and a friendly "welcome back". The hotel offers a complimentary car service in the evening. Use of the car is based on availability. Great service!    Check-out was prompt and correct. We stored our luggage for the day since we had a late flight out. Both security and concierge service were most friendly on our departure and provided us the departure cards that we filled out at the hotel.    Overall this hotel has an excellent and friendly staff. The resort is spacious has a wonderful garden and plenty of facilities to have a great holiday.    Did it meet up to our expectations?    If it comes to the staff: yes. However it did not meet up with our luxury standards that is usually provided at the Leading hotels of the World (LHW) SLH SPG Westin or W brand. It is all in the details but the details are the difference between a regular 5 star experience and a exceptional experience that we were expecting from Four Seasons.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Amazing kids club - but no atmosphere
Review_Text: We stayed in Oct during half term for 3 nights. The hotel was very expensive like 800 euros the night approx.  I was shocked at the breakfast buffet put in a side room and so small. I was very disappointed.    Unfortunately we could not use the pool as it was raining for 3 days.    Our son loved the kids club so this was amazing.    The food in the restaurant was not up so much. For the price they could do better.    The evening entertainment was very poor no bar where everyone can come to listen to a band or a singer. There was just 1 person playing quietly in a corner some maracas that one one would care. Very boring.    The bedroom was great but I would not go to the pavilion again as too far to walk especiallly when it’s raining.    For the 3rd of the price you can go to Sofitel Marrakech in the center with better rooms nice pools of course the kids club is something at Sofitel and no one can beat this. But everything else better elsewhere in Marrakech. The prices should be reviewed and the entertainment.

Review_Date: Yvonne G wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Title: If you choose to stay in a hotel, this is the one.
Review_Text: Stayed at this hotel in October 2018. shared a room with my husband and teenage daughter The room was a good size with our own closet for our clothes suitcases etc. the bathroom was large and spacious with lovely toiletries and fluffy towels.massive bath and good shower. There is a kettle in each room so you can make your own drinks and sit on the large balcony.I loved sitting and relaxing on our balcony at the end of the day or early morning with a cup of tea!! Breakfast was included in the price when we booked our holiday. The buffet was delicious and high quality and I would definitely recommend that as part of the holiday they have a pancake station my daughter had fresh pancakes every day which she loved.I asked one of the chefs if I could have Khlea tagine with eggs it was cooked to order and absolutely delicious On several other occasions I requested mesemen pancakes with honey they were also freshly cooked and the best I have tasted.We ate in the restaurants a couple of times and also ate out at various restaurants/cafes in Marrakech so it was a nice mix. Swimming pool was fabulous there are two to chose from. The hotel was furnished to a high standard it was light airy and relaxing but what made the hotel were the wonderful staff who were so warm helpful professional and friendly without being formal. I loved staying hereThe hotel is a fourty minute walk to the souks or a fifty Dirham taxi ride away this maybe a consideration for people. For me this is in my top two hotels I have stayed and I would heartily recommend it to fellow travelers.

Review_Date: Andrea Zacarias wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: This hotel is very close to the airport and also near the attractions.  The staff as in every four season i’ve been is amazing and kind.  The building is very beautiful and elegant.  The restaurant has very nice food the tea was the best i had in al Morocco.  Our room was splendid and our view was to the fountain and the palm trees that was lovely.  Very good place to stay in Marrakech.

Review_Date: ana k wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: Staff provides excellent service and personal attention. The hotel is physically impeccable and every aspect of one's stay is micromanaged to perfection by the hotel staff. Hotel staff is very helpful in planning tours and other activities

fantastic service and incredible facilities in a good location in the city. The room was great with all the amenities you expect in a Four Seasons hotel. The personal was very attentive and pleasant everywhere. The food at the restaurant was exceptional with a great wine selection
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Befuddled Otter wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: Room: Ground level with a beautiful garden that led towards the pool. It was quiet private large and very comfortable. Also CLEAN. One of the most important factors to me and there wasn't one day that I felt the place needed another run-through.    Food: My first meal in Morocco was here! Perhaps not the most local setting...but it was very very good. I also had breakfast twice and couldn't help feeling satisfied with the food and beautiful view. The alcoholic drinks were understandably diluted so there was some want for a little more kick but what can you do?    Pool: You gotta check out the pool.    Resort: I felt completely removed from the hustle and bustle of the city which is what I was looking for on this trip. It was quiet and relaxing. I did do many trips into the city and the surrounding nature (e.g. Atlas Mountains) but being able to come back to a place like this brought peace of mind.    Service: Top quality friendly and helpful. It was a little strange to me that the front desk agents also doubled as concierges. Still I got the information I needed without hassle.    NOTE: I did up sick on this trip and I believe it may have been in part from using the water to brush my teeth. My body couldn't handle the new kinds of germs!

I was in this hotel for 1 week in December.  Great room very wide and stylish.  Great hotel park fountain and pools.  Wonderful breakfast with even pommegranate already prepared and ready to eat. Price adequate.

Review_Title: A Place to Stay in Marrakech!
Review_Text: Absolutely friendly and charming hotel! The excursions with private guides and drivers recomended and organized by the hotel have proven to be a treat! The "Jardin Majorelle" will make you love one Color: Bleu Majorelle!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Everything about this hotel is outstanding. And the location is delightful as it gave us an oasis to escape to before we headed out on the next day's adventure. The staff made us feel like family from the moment you step out of your car until check-out. We really can't wait to return. A not to be missed hotel.

Review_Title: Top Notch in every way and for every service
Review_Text: Unbelievable experience. Everyone was very caring sincere and attentive.Food ( even room Service) was served fresh and ready cooked uo to the Minute. Quiet Relaxing athmosphere and the huge and beautiful garden.We had terrace room and unique privacy

Another amazing expereince in this beautiful hotel getting better and better with time. You can see that this hotel is well managed and that the staff would do anything to please you. I highly recommend this place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Illumiknow Cape Town wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: This was a return visit and once again the team exceeded all expectations! Johannesburg and Mohammed of Guest Relations were outstanding.When we arrived earlier than check-in time we were accommodated on the terrace which is always a stunning place to be.Not too long after we were located in upgraded rooms by the most apologetic staff.We had three rooms so this is quite a feat!The F&B offerings and service is unsurpassed! I would definitely return and highly recommend this propertyit’s people and services.Other Four Seasons could learn a thing or two from this team.

This Fours Seasons needs to be updated to the same standards as other Fours seasons hotel I have been to. I will say the standard and ambience is just average to compare with other Four Seasons hotels. Staffs where really great and friendly and the food was good.  We had insects crawling around the bathroom floors which was irritating. Ambience and decor was not up to a 5 Star standard.

Review_Date: Blake C wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Title: Couldn't have been happier with the service
Review_Text: Guest Services went above and beyond to make my stay a great one; they picked up my train passes arranged transportation and had impeccable recommendations of places to eat. The food on property was great well priced and the morning breakfast was expansive. The home made peanut butter was tops.    The room was large clean and comfortable and had an large private patio. Each day I was welcomed with new amenities from; fruit to wine and every day the room was cleaned thoroughly    I would definitely enjoy staying here again.

Review_Date: Roman K wrote a review Jan 2019
Review_Text: We came with high expectations and the Four Seasons Marrakech delivered in all areas. My highest marks go to the overall service level reliability consistency and competence of the team. Everyone we encountered during our 8-night stay performed to the highest level one would expect and they did so with confidence efficiency and with a smile. The property itself is gorgeous with 3 different pools one for adults only and the other 2 for families. Needless to say there is a gorgeous spa area with all services one could ask for a beautiful gym steam room etc. The three restaurants are excellent and serve a variety of different cuisines. Considering we were there for 8 nights I would perhaps have liked a bit more variety at breakfast with perhaps a couple of rotating dishes. Our room was perhaps not quite at the same level as some of the other Four Seasons I've been to but the overall service more than made up for that and essentially we spent little time in the room. The bed is amazingly comfortable the bathroom is huge and well-lit the shower is perhaps a bit basic and it would have been great to have a desk vs. a small dining table but that's a matter of preference. We did enjoy the large and sunny balcony with sitting area. Overall we had a fantastic stay and plan to return in the not too distant future. I want to take this opportunity to thank the entire team for their amazing service and hospitality.

Review_Title: Wonderful time at Four Seasons Marrakech.
Review_Text: From the moment you arrive at the Four Seasons Marrakech you know you're in for a special experience. The entrance to the property has a double gate that once you're past leads to a special entry with pools and a wonderful atrium. Our family was there during Christmas week and beautiful decorations were at the entrance and in the main foyer - adding a festive note. All staff members at the resort are warm and genuinely friendly. Everyone from the Bell Staff restaurant waiters & managers maid service are intent on making your stay a wonderful experience. Each interaction with the concierge staff was outstanding - these folks know how to arrange things big and small . Service at the pool was great too with setup for food & drinks always well presented. After a long day touring the Atlas Mountains which we recommend we ordered room service as we were too tired to go out - well it was wonderful - they come in set things up and then take it all away so your room is clean. The resort itself is very pretty and well maintained - we loved the fountain area just outside the main restaurant Quattro - where you can have breakfast. The upstairs restaurant is a wonderful place to have a light meal drinks or dinner - we loved eating outside. The room was tastefully decorated had a wonderful outdoor patio with a view of the mountains and the resort. We loved our stay and are now fans of the Four Seasons. We highly recommend the Four Seasons Marrakech - we have wonderful memories of the city the nearby country-side - all enhanced by our stay at this resort.

Review_Title: Poor experience at the 4 seasons Marrakech
Review_Text: Honestly the hotel service or accommodations do not rise up to the 5 star hotel label. Be it service or accommodations there is a lot to say compared to hotels of a lesser classification and which are offering a much better service.

We stayed at the Four Seasons Marrakech for 5 days over the Christmas holidays. Every member of the staff I encountered during our stay was polite attentive and eager to please. The manager was present nearly every day making himself available and greeted guests during breakfast. We were greeted by name by many of the hotel staff as we encountered them throughout our stay. I found this to be quite impressive considering the size of resort. We stayed in an upper-level suite overlooking the pool with a large balcony with two lounge chairs and a reading nook. We had an adjoining room for our family which had two terraces. The rooms were well appointed the beds were very comfortable. We found an adapter plug in our night table which was a nice added touch as one can never have enough adapters! The toiletries were Atelier Cologne which were lovely. I enjoyed the Nespresso machine in my room which reminded me of home. We enjoyed the spa pools fitness room young adult center and Quattro the Italian restaurant all of which were enjoyable. I found the daily buffet breakfast to be generous and plentiful with a hot chocolate bar daily smoothies as well as items which could be ordered off the menu.
