The concierge desk arranged many things for us both in advance of our stay and during our stay. The staff expertly packed and boxed our oddly shaped purchases to make it easier of us to bring home. I found the grounds and main areas very clean and well maintained. I found the location to be very good not too far from the main sights we visited. Overall an excellent stay & I'd highly recommended the Four Seasons Hotel.

beautifully maintained hotel just out of the city but convenient. lovely gardens. service provided by staff could not be faulted. occasional aircraft noise but not distracting. concierge service was excellent whether organising trips taxis etc

Part of a tour group. Generally attentive but only after I had to approach the staff several times. Lunch one day took 45 minutes to serve and the hamburger was not properly cooked. Alcohol content in drinks is weak.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed with our family for three nights (two suites with private pools).    The grounds were above average and on par with a typical Four Seasons resort. Pools were nice (seemed new) and the fitness center / tennis courts were as expected (Four Seasons quality). Spas were also excellent quality. Would have been nice to have outdoor hot tubs that weren't split by gender but it was fine.    The rooms were spartan and a little stale. Now bear in mind I'm comparing these to other Four Seasons. We expected more luxury for the price tag but these were equivalent to an above average hotel in the U.S. I would expect to pay $200 - 300 / night for these rooms but we were easily paying triple (or more).    The service is hit or miss but this was consistent with our entire Morocco trip. There is certainly no rush or hurry when you're being served. You really have to go out of your way to get someone's attention (again consistent throughout our trip). The staff on average was friendly.    The food was decent at best. For a Four Seasons we were expecting to be "wowed" but every meal was bland small portions and expensive. Not a single meal had us wanting to go back and we ate at every restaurant. Just weird cuisine. We tried different types of food at each. The Moroccan Italian American food just wasn't very good. Portions were small and all meals were expensive. We were really eating at the hotel out of convenience when we didn't want to venture out. Our meals outside the hotel were all significantly better and a fraction of the price. I would say meals get better as the day went on. Breakfast is plain bad. Lunch is OK. Dinner is decent.    Back to the rooms. We stayed in one bedroom villas with private pools (on the ground floor obviously). These villas are two levels so if you're on the ground floor I was shocked by the footfall noise you hear above you. There's zero soundproofing. When someone walks you hear it LOUD. One morning housekeeping began cleaning the room above us at 8:30am. It was like a rock band playing above you. Good luck sleeping.    Back to the service. Compared to most of the people we interacted with throughout our trip the staff at the Four Seasons was more professional. When you go to Morocco be prepared to be on guard your entire trip. The moment you step foot in Marrakech you're a target. Mostly everyone is out to rip you off. We didn't get that sense at the Four Seasons (thankfully) but there were a couple times when we were very annoyed. We bought expensive rugs in the market that we checked in at bag drop. When we were loading our car to the airport the rugs were missing. The staff apologized after we caught the mistake but it seemed very convenient that this was the one missing bag. The transport doors were closed so if we didn't double check who knows what would have happened? This epitomized our trip to Marrakech. From taxi drivers to airport handlers everyone has their hand out. You really have to be ready to argue / negotiate constantly. We pre-negotiated every transport ride and haggled everywhere we went. It's just the way of life there but it's off-putting for sure.    Overall the hotel was OK but not Four Seasons standard. The food coupled with the room noise left much to be desired. I've stayed at probably 30+ Four Seasons properties and this was in the bottom 10%. Just not worth the price point.

Very well designed and executed property with the service you expect from the four seasons to match. Could not be happier with our stay here. We stayed at another property in Marrakech previously and this is a far better experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great pre-Christmas break with the family
Review_Text: Amazing stay at the Four Seasons Marrakech. Weather was great - sunny warm enough to sun bathe and swim. Staff were amazing - especially Medhi and Said S at the family pool who were hugely attentive and helpful. And Karima and Fatima in the kids club who made a lot of effort to look after our 7 & 10 year old during our stay taking them on a behind the scenes tour of the hotel and decorating Christmas cookies being a highlight. After just a couple of days everyone knew our names and treated us like family. Thank you. See you in 2019!!

We didn’t stay but used the facilities at this hotel. The staff was wonderful and helpful. We checked in the children to kids club and enjoyed watching a movie at the mini cinema and then had a lovely lunch. Took a tour of the resort and enjoyed the poolside. The kids were very excited and we will definitely visit again

Review_Title: Great stay at Four Seasons in Marrakech
Review_Text: the staff were very attentive to our needs and very helpful and pleasant. The restaurants were great. Hotel was beautiful inside and out. Great pool area. Would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Marrakech!

Review_Date: sandy l wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: Nice and new resort  A relaxing place after a day of touring and shopping at the Médina  Walking distance to Menera mall  Quick taxi transport to shopping museum and airport  Hotel is nice new clean  Most staffs are helpful and friendly  Food at international restaurant are highly recommended

Review_Date: andrew b wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Title: Should you stay or should you not?
Review_Text: Marrakech is a city with many luxurious hotels so it becomes a difficult choice in deciding which one is going to be for you. My recent stay at the four seasons Marrakech introduced me to an outstandingly beautiful property well-maintained and with well finished rooms.    The staff overall are extremely attentive friendly and soon recognize who you are.    The big negative is a poor front desk and concierge service. Your first impressions of the hotel are often centred around how you are greeted and the check in process.unfortunately the front desk of the Marrakech four seasons fails to live up to the standard of this iconic chain.  Even though I had pre checked in with the 4 seasons app the process was repeated.  The guest relations manager (Janine) was angry that she had to deal with my requests and in no uncertain terms let me know about this throughout the stay in the hotel. Although I had asked them to book restaurants and tours they could hardly find it and never produced any hard copies of The reservations.    Touring the other iconic hotels of Marrakech leads me to believe that location is also important and that the four seasons is situated a little out-of-the-way which is not a problem if you are chauffeur driven or are taking taxis.    Overall the dilemma of having to stay here again is unfortunately in my case going to be decided upon the poor treatment the front desk hands out.
Stayed here for two nights in December. Resort staff service food facilities all excellent. Attention to detail is second to none. Would highly recommend as base for exploring this beautiful city.

A true luxury experience the hotel and facilities are fabulous the staff is truly helpful and caring.The rooms are very spacious and the view on the Atlas mountains is just breathtaking. Will go back and recommend it to all.

Fabulous 5 start Hotel great rooms and service! Here to celebrate my fathers birthday and the staff went beyond to make his day special. Also consiege very helpful in arranging guided tours. Special note is 2 swimming pool areas one for adults and one for families that is heated. Also a complete gym with most heavy weights and ultra modern cardio machines. Highly recommended!

Review_Date: Louis L wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: Large hotel  Located outside old town though  so u must walk  Rooms large and modern  Service was top from rooms breakfast porter and reception  One issue...not a lot of restaurants for me within hotel  Breakfast options and quality also very high

We stayed for 4 nights at the FS Marrakesh. The hotel was what you would expect from a FS hotel. We were in a decent sized balcony room on the third floor with a nice view of the snow --capped Atlas mountain. The service was attentive professional and flawless. Our daughter went to the kids club several times and asked to go back every day. It was a bit rainy and chilly when we were there and the heated pool was godsent. There's a children's menu with quite a bit of variety. Would recommend families traveling with children.

Been in Marrakesh for the first time and we were very impressed. We were a group of hotel managers. Marrakesh is on fire. A lot to see great opportunities for shopping. Avoid the touristic restaurants trust the reviews and choose the top ranked restaurant.  Nice room and Hotel is very well cleaned good breakfast buffet excellent adults pool. Good location. Great service from staff especially from the maid of room 305 Sonia at the reception is an angel.  Improvement in lighting and in safety in general of the building( balcony rails for example).  We strongly recommend the hotel.

Review_Date: John S wrote a review Dec 2018
Review_Text: We came here with a business group!  What to say about this hotel? The service is very good it is always clean the rooms are very well sized!  The swimming pools very clean and with a nice service from the staff!  The gym is super considering that is a hotel gym!

The hotel staff makes everything so easy for a relaxing stay. The service was personalized and our room was clean with amazing amenities. We couldn't have picked a better hotel for our trip and would recommend it to anyone.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Another Four Season resort of the highest possible standard. The resort itself the food the spa are indeed great but the level of service is simply outstanding. This is what makes Four Seasons the most prestigious luxury chain. Their "receipe" is magic and does make you to feel indeed special with no trace of fakeness or artificial enhancers. Thank you and please do not alter/ change your special "formula". It is simply the BEST!

The Four Seasons exceeded all my expectations as a luxury hotel. We expected it to be good but every aspect was outstanding. As a family with 2 young children (5yr old & 2 yr old) we were a bit anxious but this hotel took care of everything.There seemed to be no request they wouldn't fulfil. They even sent someone out to get McDonalds for us one evening!

I had the signature massage. I was so relaxed afterwards and melted into the loungers overlooking a beautifully groomed courtyard. My friends and are were very happy with the professional and friendly service provided by all of the spa staff. Highly recommend booking in advance to start or end your trip to Marrakech.

the hotel was amazing and the service exceptional. Slightly far away from the main square but close enough if you dont want to stay in the middle of the action (10 mins by taxi). The food was great and the common facilities very good. Highly recommend
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We visited Marrakesh in March 2018 and enjoyed wonderful weather and great morrocan hospitality in this splendid FS resort. The pool area and seperate kids pool are outstanding. Staff are generally very friendly. The breakfast buffet was very good with mutiple options and outstanding viennenoiserie as good as in Paris! Our room was spotless. The hamam was a bit hit and miss with mostly friendly staff. In one treatment room in the men‘s hamam there was an eletric lamp right next to a shower alas no barrier. I survived luckily. This needs urgent addressing for security and safety reasons. Other than that this hotel is hard to fault. The selling point is its 40 meter olympic size heated outdoor pool. The property is located a 10 Minute drive by taxi from the city centre and is safe and quite. I can recommend this property and we have just booked our next stay here in 2019. See you then.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Good hotel but expected better from Four Seasons
Review_Text: It really is a lovely hotel. The lobby grounds and rooms are all great. The pools are also great to relax and enjoy some downtime.    The service is what was a bit of a miss for us. It could have been we had high expectations from a Four Seasons or we just stayed at a wonderful Riad in the old city where service was impeccable.    A few examples of this being - went to concierge to ask for dinner recommendations and they just handed us a list of 20+ recommended places for us to read through (that’s what I’d expect from a Best Western in Topeka) to when ordering a taxi to dinner they didn’t tell the driver where we were going and the. having to try and explain to the driver who spoke no English (when they could have done it in seconds).    The room was lovely but little things like not giving us new shampoo and soap when we were almost out to taking our water glasses and not leaving new ones are the little things I’d expect the Four Seasons to be completely ahead of.    The other drawback for us as a couple with no kids was there were quite a few young kids staying here and running around the lobby etc. Which when one of the restaurants and bar is in the beautiful lobby it was a bit distracting to hear kids running around being rather loud.    I know I’m being rather critical as it really is a beautiful hotel but the lower rating is based on my expectations of the Four Seasons brand along with the price point for the hotel.    I’d recommend staying at a local Riad (many which are rated highly on TripAdvisor) instead.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The Four Seasons resort is only 20 or so minutes from the airport in a taxi and 5 minutes from the Medina so it’s in a great location.  The staff were attentive without being intrusive and the rooms are beautiful and clean.  There are two swimming pools both very nice. The three restaurants are have great food and wine if a bit pricey.  We had a wonderful time.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great room, great view, great stay, great service.
Review_Text: Stayed 3 nights at end of our Morocco tour. As requested we had a top floor room with view in a quiet location. Room was upscale roomy and designed for comfort with balcony large bathroom and coffee table with chairs. This hotel is not your Moroccan Riad but rather a top of the line western design with Moroccan themes.    Hotel is located outside of the main city tourist spots and if you walk its not particularly pleasant. So take taxis at maximum 100 dirhams depending on where you want to go. One morning we wanted to walk to the nearby Carrefour (20 mins) and hotel security suggested a golf cart ride to their staff entrance then walk. It was still a ten minute walk using your navigation skills. We walked back to staff entrance and they called the cart to pick us up. We appreciated their effort.    We ate dinner twice in their Quattro restaurant. Both times the food was great and service fantastic. Their breakfast buffet was the best we experienced in all our tour hotels around Morocco.    Weather was a bit cool during our stay with some rain (snow in mountains) so we did not experience the hotel pools and grounds. The view of the grounds from our room balcony was stunning.    Despite the location away from the inner city we will stay here again on our return trip to this wonderful city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Grant R wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: This hotel has it all: good situation attentive service opulent decor and great facilities.    The staff were extremely welcoming from the first moments of arrival the communal areas are stylish and comfortable - I loved the log fires in the cool evenings - and the pool for grown ups is probably the best I’ve seen being full size for exercise but avoiding looking functional and keeping up luxe.    Spacious rooms are extremely comfortable too and the walk around the lush grounds is very relaxing.    I loved it.

We really enjoyed our stay last week. The concierge services were great and the manage Jihane was excellent. We booked a two day trip to the dessert and restaurants in town through the hotel and we were very pleased with all their recommendations. The staff was friendly and very helpful. The pools work out facility and hotel grounds were lovely. The hotel is a bit far from town so you do need to take a taxi or the hotel car but we didn't find this to be a negative.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We enjoyed the most amazing service at this fantastic resort. Staff are amazing food was great and we could not have had a better trip! Thoroughly recommend this resort. From the pool staff to those at the restaurants and on reception it was amazing!

Review_Date: Frederik Scherpereel wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: Probably one of the best places I’ve stayed so far. Excellent service. Friendly people top accomodation ... really loved this place. Not far away from the City centre. Amazing environment. We’ll definitely come back...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This was the first time staying at this hotel chain and our 4th visit to the city. The hotel location is not great and you have to take taxis everywhere even if you want to go for a walk! The reception is nice and room well designed. However the vibe in the hotel was not so good. The clientele was generally elder couples and it lacked the vibe found elsewhere in Marrakech. The restaurant choices are limited and food was not to a good standard. It’s a shame  as most 5 star hotels allow you to eat in but still get good food. Positives are great pool and nice gardens. Gym was well equipped. However would not rush back and would not be in a hurry to stay in this chain again!  We had previously stayed at the Sofitel Marrakech a few times and we would rate that hotel head and shoulders over this one. Better vibe better food and better services!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Adam S wrote a review Nov 2018
Review_Text: I am due to travel to the hotel tomorrow. Yesterday morning I sent some questions and requests to book activities to the concierge. Tonight despite a follow up email and two telephone calls I have still not had a response from the concierge. This is not what I expected from the Four Seasons and it does not bode well for my trip. I wanted to organise some excursions before my arrival but they have not responded. Very disappointed.

Review_Title: Superb service under acute medical conditions
Review_Text: Arrived hotel requesting ground floor accommodations for guest experiencing medical issues. No problem escorted to comfortable rooms and room service expedited. Unfortunately medical issues worsened requiring physician assessment and plans to curtail travel and make immediate arrangements to return to USA. All hotel staff available to help us through an extremely stressful experience...including how to use the phone to contact family members in USA. Many thanks for helping us navigate all we needed to safely travel back home. What I saw of the resort was lovely. Wish we could have appreciated your lovely resort. Can’t thank all staff enough for their kindness and concern extended to us.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This resort has everything we needed - the kids club was excellent with parties and activities to keep our two little girls entertained and a games room for the two older boys. The Spa is very well equipped and suer relaxing and the choice of pools and restaurants is great. The most impressive aspect to this resort is how friendly welcoming and naturally charming the entire team are - it makes a big difference.

Four Seasons provided an excellent retreat from the exciting madness and business of the Medina. We enjoyed staying in the hotel and dipping into the Medina as and when we pleased - taxis to the Medina were 50MAD one way so fairly reasonable. The hotel feels spacious - the gardens are beautiful and our room was one of the most spacious rooms we've stayed in. Hotel staff were always very proactive to help with nothing being too much bother. Senior hotel staff were very visible throughout the hotel chatting with guests.  Only slight downsides being the lack of light snacks being available and whilst it is fine to walk from the hotel there was no where really to walk to and it was alongside a major busy road.  But we would love to return it was a great experience and I would not hesitate to recommend.

The hotel is decorated fantastically with lots of space to wander. Adult pool was quite and inviting. Moroccan restaurant served great traditional foods with wonderfully balanced tastes. Wine menu has some great moroccan choices.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed at the Four Seasons in October and had a wonderful stay.    Service is excellent and we were upgraded to a King Suite on arrival. The rooms and facilities are as you would expect from the Four Seasons and are all high quality.    There a range of pools if you have a family or want some quiet time. You also have a Kids club and Young Adult centre to keep children occupied.    The spa and treatments are excellent although note the spa is split into two sections male and female so it’s not possible for couples to use the same facilities together.    The gym is excellent and has a cardio and weights area along with tennis courts.    The restaurants are ‘ok’. Breakfast can get very busy and cramped (particularly when children are there) which is a bit disappointing given the size of the resort. Our main gripe was the quality and variety of food available - it’s fine but we just expected more from the Four Seasons.    That aside we highly recommend the hotel and would go back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We spent a fabulous 5 nights here. Without exception the staff were all so professional yet friendly and helpful & were very kind to my 7 year old daughter. It is a little piece of calm on the outskirts of bustling Marrakech.

Review_Date: Christine M wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Title: Lovely time as one expects with Four Seasons
Review_Text: The Four Seasons Marrakech is an absolute oasis. Some reviews here comment on the proximity to the airport and what that entails- but that was one of the reasons we chose to stay given our travels. F&B was fantastic- very fresh light and inventive cuisine that one associates with Four Seasons. Some dramatic design moves in the public spaces- very clean sophisticated design and the landscaping contributing to create a relaxed and serene atmosphere. Service was very thoughtful and on point- Hassan in particular was a total delight- intuitive and friendly. Cannot wait to return!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Very friendly staff - terrible location - massive airplane noise
Review_Text: Our family visit here started bad since the night before arrival the Four Seasons Marrakesh - finally after weeks responded to our emails for airport transfer restaurant reservations etc. and informed us that our reservation was non existing or cancelled. Only next morning after a sleepless night they informed us that this was an error and on arrival we received a bottle of cheap Prosecco.  We are normally big Four Seasons fans and this was our 4th stay in a FS in 2018 but the fact that even very loyal customers are treated as first timers in every resort and those hiccups make us think twice. Even they recognized my wife’s birthday at check in there was not even a card etc.  The resort in Marrakesh is at a terrible location very close to the airport and you hear the planes from early in the morning till evening. The resort overall is ok but lacking some warmth and color.  The service and food is great and the staff very friendly - esp Ismail at breakfast was amazing.  We had an amazing Dinner at the Royal Mansour and were very impressed by what we have seen.

Review_Date: Ruth B wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: Had a fabulous time here used almost all of the facilities and found much to like. Ate in Inaro and Quattro and the food was very tasty and the staff fun chatty and relaxed but efficient. Tried the shisha one night in Inaro and that was great too. Breakfasts were excellent with many high quality choices.  Played tennis on the clay court excellent.  Had several spa treatments which were professional and of a high standard if pricey.  Our room was very well attended extremely clean and the staff did a fantastic job of keeping us in order. Our teenaged daughter was sharing our room on a rollaway bed so this did put a strain on housekeeping but they were 100% brilliant and it was a joy to come back to our room after a day out and about.  Some slight down points -  I had emailed concierge in advance with some requests restaurant reservations etc and these were confirmed only when we arrived we found they hadn't been made. This was disappointing but remedied by mixing things up a bit.  Getting the courtesy car taxi or hotel car from the front of the hotel into the city in the evening is frenetic and tiresome with so many movements. A taxi should cost about 500 dirham.  After a mishap the hotel sweetly arranged to collect us from a golf club but then their car didn't come for 90 minutes! This is very typical of so many many things that happened. Everyone apologises eagerly and they make up for things with kindness and gifts - but these things shouldn't happen in the first place.  A lovely hotel in the modern part of the city where you will need taxis/transport to go anywhere but where there is lots to keep you busy on site.

Review_Title: Not what I expected from the Four seasons.
Review_Text: We stayed here in October. It was quite pleasant but the room was not clean. The bathroom still had obvious signs of the previous occupants which made my skin crawl. I reported some of the dirt to the turn down staff and received an immediate apology and some comp bits the next day. The offending dirty items were removed and replaced. There were a few other dirty bits in the bathroom which I didn't mention as it was the first day and I was tired. I thought as I had complained the whole area would be deep cleaned but that was not the case. Only the dirt I pointed to was cleaned. The rest was left untouched. I had to go through each bit and point to it and then it was cleaned. The staff were polite and attentive when I complained but its not really how I want to spend my holiday. Otherwise the food wasn't bad by hotel food standards. The pool was lovely. The staff in the restaurants were keen to please and polite especially the lady who runs the breakfast and pizza restaurant. She was super efficient and just the right amount of friendly which is a difficult balance to master. If I were to stay in Marrakech again I would probably give the place another go but would email ahead to ask that the room receive a deep clean. I watched a documentary on the hotel industry which said cleaning staff don't get enough time to clean. Maybe its something all hotels should consider looking at.  Otherwise the hotel is a great oasis and retreat from the chaos of Marrakech. It's minutes from jma el fna and the cost to get to the centre is €5. It offers all the usually 5* services.

Overall I was blown away with everything from the service to the detail in the upkeep of every square inch of the resort. Check in was our only issue as it was A disaster BC we requested connected rooms and ooh well I won't get into it. Mandi (I think the name was) did help finally fix this after a few strenuous hours! 😫

Review_Title: Lunch in the lobby restaurant was really disappointing
Review_Text: The worst meal experience over a six night stay in Marrakech was at the Four Seasons. We went there for lunch before leaving for the airport. The simple order of a few club sandwiches and salads took over an hour and half to arrive and even then they got the order wrong. When we complained we were always told the food was on its way. The offer of a 50% reduction on the bill was appreciated but not nearly enough to make up for the rush to finish lunch and rush to the airport. Really disappointing for a hotel with such a great reputation.

Exceptional stay in at the end of August and returned at the beginning of October.Travelled as part of a girls trip and a solo traveller and I will definitely return.Fantastic food cocktails/wine and more importantly service from Maroune Moussa & the security doorman to the Lounge.The 3 hour flight from London will deem Marrakech my second home. See you soon Four Seasons!

Review_Date: Carlos P wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: Very very nice. In line with expectations of a Four Seasons. Lovely bar with a loungy guitar singer. Perfect pool for relaxing. Great gym. Close to airport. Incredibly friendly staff. Very nice rooms.

The property is beautifully designed!! The lighting at night was incredibly romantic!! Breakfast was delicious!! Lunch by the pool was perfect!! Dinner had many great choices in both food and wine!! I found myself taking photos of the design elements inside & out of the hotel!!

Review_Date: PDS S wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: I had a wonderful stay at the FS Marrakech. The staff were very helpful and pleasant. Upon check-in there was a problem with my card that was resolved in a professional manner.    I was there as part of my birthday celebration and they provided me with champagne and dessert as a token. I ordered room service several times and was thoroughly satisfied with my meals (dinner and breakfast). One of the gentlemen that had removed my room service items from my room saw me walking from the lobby area after shopping in the Medina. He quickly offered to drive me back to my room because of the bags in my hands. Very thoughtful indeed.    If I return to Marrakech I will definitely place this property on a list of places to possibly stay.    A highlight of the trip was hearing the call to prayer several times per day. A nice reminder to take time to acknowledge our Higher Power.

I stayed my last day in Marrakech at Four Seasons Resort Marrakech. It was my first visit to Four Seasons Resort. The FS staff service and the facility were amazing some of restaurant staffs seemed to get more training though. I was a bit disappointed when I had dinner at Azura but the staff who was willing to listen to my complaints tried to do their best to recover. I was very satisfied with their prompt action. I will definitely visit FS Marrakech again if I go to Marrakech.    마라케시 포시즌스 리조트에서의 경험은 백점만점에 백점이었습니다. 리조트가 워낙 넓어 뒷문으로 잘못 찾아갔음에도 친절하게 응대해주었고 GS직원분이 체크인부터 리조트 소개까지 아주 상냥하고 친절하게 책임있게 해주시는 모습에 감동받았습니다. 스테이 하는 사람만 리조트안에 출입이 가능해서 마라케시 메디나와는 달리 조용하고 맘편히 지낼수있었습니다. 아 수영장 시간이 저녁 일곱시까지인것만 빼면 아주 완벽한 스테이었습니다 :)

Review_Date: Grahame S wrote a review Oct 2018
Review_Text: Having been to at least 14 Four Seasons Hotels throughout the World one expects the best of everything. This hotel did not disappoint. It is set in grounds of walled flowers fruits and spices so walking down the lanes and atriums the estate is in itself a joy. A huge adult pool for serious swimmers or those cooling off a separate family pool two superb restaurants  and staff who couldn’t one more helpful and charming all adds up to a strong recommendation.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The resort is lovely luxurious and absolutely live up the standard of Four Season. It is so comfortable that we had room service in our terrance every night.The kids club is brilliant for children and give parents some space of own time. The service is top top quality and you can't ask for more. Highly recommended.

Review_Title: A perfect stay, could not have been better
Review_Text: We stayed for four glorious nights last month and we are missing it already. The hotel and grounds are lovely a perfect oasis of calm in the city. We had a pavilion room overlooking the pool which was perfect so quiet peaceful and comfortable. The staff were fantastic we had some very specific requests for help with transport and they always helped graciously. They also arranged a few day trips for us one to Essaouira and one to the Atlas Mountains as well as a guide for a half day in Marrakech who showed us around the Medina and took us to the Garden Majorelle. We dined at the restaurants a few times and a few times in our room only left the resort one night for dinner because you really don't need to. When we left we felt like we were leaving behind new friends and we will certainly return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: To celebrate my mother-in-laws birthday we stayed here for 3 nights and it was amazing.    I contacted the hotel by email in advance and they quickly responded and helped immensely. From arranging a chauffeur to collect us from the airport with water to upgrading us to a villa and providing cake/cava and delicious dates/sweets to being escorted around on a golf cart we felt like royalty.    At the beautiful pool the cabanas are free and there is poolside service.    On checkout there was an error on our bill which was quickly resolved and didn’t feel awkward.    The staff are amazing I can’t praise them enough.    This truly is a little bubble of tranquility in a hectic city.

Clean lines lush gardens & I can hear the birds chirping outside my room. This property lives up to the Four Seasons standards. Very spacious room separate walk in closet huge bath with soaking tub & shower compartment. Toilet & bidet separated from bathroom which is great if you are double occupancy.    Desk table & 2 chairs & large balcony overlooking gardens. Balcony has a built in settee/lounge placed in a shaded niche plus a table and two chairs where one could comfortably enjoy room service breakfast or cocktails.    Only ate at the breakfast buffet which has anything one could wish for including my beloved greens & raw veggies. Also the first authentic buttery croissant I’ve had in Morocco despite its French influences.    Warm & welcoming service as expected at a Four Seasons.    One small point—odd that there is no full length mirror in the room. But there is a lighted makeup mirror in bathroom.

Review_Title: Stunning resort hotel in an oasis type setting
Review_Text: Gorgeous chic boutique style hotel within a lush garden setting. Beautiful pools one for family and one adults only. Over the top friendly staff made our stay even more enjoyable. Just a cab ride away from the Medina. Would highly recommend
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sacha N wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Title: A paradise base for exploring the medina
Review_Text: This is a large and serene space.    The pool (adult) and weather  - Large and peaceful and a beautiful temperature all day (though especially pleasant in the afternoon).  - The pool-side restaurant does good international food.  - very friendly staff who really do look after you  - it was consistently above 35C while we were here (4 days) but not humid at all... so very comfortable  - September is a great time of year to visit for hanging by the pool    The rooms and check-in  - we we upgraded to a pavilion upon arrival  - staff at the front desk were just pleasant they really went out of their way to make us feel welcome  - nothing was too much to ask during our stay (plenty of tips and tricks)  - if there is one area for improvement it would be the recommendations that they make for restaurants in the medina... we ended up at a tourist trap the food was ok but by far the worst restaurant we ate at    Cabs / travel  - during the day nothing should be more than 50D  - on the way back you may get pressed into 100D for night fare. It’s up to you to decide how much you want to barter    I would recommend this place without hesitation.    Thank you to the team for making it such a pleasant stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Derek H wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Title: One of the best hotel resorts we have stayed at
Review_Text: Friendliness and helpfulness of staff was overwhelming.  Provision of Doctor within 45 minutes when my wife had a problem was outstanding.  Superb Quiet Pool with great service.  Restaurant food quality very good and staff very helpful  Beautiful gardens all in a very safe and secure environment  Good organisation of trips.  Lovely rooms.  Plus wonderful weather  What more could you ask for?
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Alain L wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: Hotel is in top shape and staff is helpful and gracious. Amenities are plenty. Love the grounds with beautiful landscape garden pool is beautiful as well is the spa. The breakfast buffet is fabulous but the restaurant is just above average. They need more and bettet wine choice. Overall a great place to relax and explore Marrakech

Four Seasons Marrakech is a vast property which sits close to the airport. It has lots to offer for couples families and business executives. What drew us to the Four Seasons was the Instagram famous fountain pool and we were not disappointed. Although it would've been great if the weather was less gloomy.  It has two pools one for family/kids and one for adults. Magnificent gardens which are well maintained a spa which also has the traditional hammam and a tea garden for both men and women. If staying fit is your focus they offer a gym as well as a tennis court.  They have three great restaurants to choose from. The main one is Inara that is located in the lobby and provides classic Moroccan and International dishes and afternoon tea and cocktails throughout the day. We had our last dinner here in the patio overlooking the beautiful fountain pool and the sweet staff made it more memorable by going above and beyond.  Our favorite restaurant was Quattro where the ambiance was laid back and romantic. With its dim-lit charm Quattro offers fine Italian dining.  We had lunch once at Azzera which is their poolside restaurant and they serve lunch from 12pm to 5pm. They also have the cutest ice-cream bar where you can get ice-cream until 5pm. The deserts are to die for and our favourites were the Creme brulee and tiramisu.    This was an amazing experience and we look forward to returning here!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: There can be no finer address to stay in Marrakech!
Review_Text: During a recent family trip to Marrakech we stayed at the stunning Four Seasons.    Although it is only located about five minutes by taxi from the medina it is the ideal silent oasis to relax in when not out exploring. From the moment we arrived we were treated with the usual Four Seasons excellence by all of the attentive but not intrusive staff.    Our suite was wonderfully appointed with ample room for a family of four and the private plunge pool was ideal for cooling off later at night. The spa and fitness facilities were perfectly equipped and the treatments we booked were very good.    Breakfast served outside overlooking the peaceful garden and fountains was a sumptuous buffet with great variety – the main chef whose name we unfortunately didn’t get but who made excellent omelettes introduced us to some delicious local delicacies including Msemen - shukran.    On the nights we didn’t venture in to the Medina or Gueliz for dinner we enjoyed fantastic food and service at Quattro and Inara – a special thanks to Youssef at Inara for all his hospitality.    Although all of the staff were excellent an extra thank you to Abderahim and Soufiane both of whom were stationed at the front arrival/valet area and Belhassan at the door (apologies for any spelling mistakes) who all expertly co-ordinated our travels as we left to explore and greeted us warmly like family returning home. Lastly a massive thank you to Jihane R whose assistance in making reservations and arranging extra special touches at the hotel was greatly appreciated.    Thank you Four Seasons for making our stay so memorable and relaxing and we look forward to our next stay.

Review_Date: Steven L wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: For the second time we had a wonderful stay. All staff from driver to doormen to waiters remember your name and make your stay very personal. Rooms are very nice and very well maintained. The breakfast is great especially sitting outside looking at the fountains in the morningsun. We compared with other luxury hotels / resorts in Marrakech and it was very clear that the FS crew is much more friendly and attentive compared to others. We definitely come back!!

Review_Date: Samantha S wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: We loved everything about the Four Seasons Marrakech. The property is stunning the staff was most accommodating the food outstanding and the rooms spacious and beautiful. Our poolside room was comfortable quiet and the location convenient. We spent a couple of afternoons by the pool enjoyed the attentive service as well as a great meal at the poolside restaurant which had a fairly comprehensive menu. We ate at Inara on our final night at the resort and loved it. We dined on the patio and had an exceptional experience both as to the food as well as service. We had one hiccup upon check out related to the price of an excursion we had booked in advance which the staff handled professionally and with the exceptional level of customer service we have come to know of Four Seasons properties. We utilized the properties app 'chat' service several times with great success and found it to be a convenient way to communicate with the concierge. We considered some of the other well-known luxury properties in the area when booking this trip (and visited a couple for meals during our stay)but we very pleased with our decision to stay here. It was a fantastic experience and we look forward to returning!

Review_Date: Daniel A wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: We stayed here over Christmas for 5 nights. We had excellent interconnecting rooms and had a great stay. Staff are very obliging and really went above and beyond. The hotel was very expensive due to the period we stayed so value not the best but that said the stay was great. Some standouts were Mounir’s faultless service at breakfast and Karim’s brilliant expertise as a trainer in the gym. Great place!

Just stayed at the Four Seasons for a week in early September 2018. The Hotel is lovely and is very well maintained and clean. Staff are very attentive helpful and polite.    The Hotel is in a gated secure beautifully manicured grounds that is approx. 10 mins by Taxi from the heart of the city.    My only criticism is the lack of facilities for this class of Hotel. Very limited Restaurant options and no outside evening bar which is a shame as they have the space and physical facility to operate one. Also the cost of drinks is very high circa. $9 for a 25cl bottle of Heineken and $35 cocktails.    The two swimming pools which are really lovely are not heated so not for the faint hearted!

The hotel itself was such a wonderful place. It was well maintained and staff were amazing! Everyone from the doorman the housekeeping to the gardeners always say hi with a smile. I love how the staff have been trained very well on the job. They are hardworking people. Kudos to the housekeeping department who did a great job above and beyond! They delivered everything that we needed without an attitude. They deserve a recognition!

This was perfect from arrival to departure. If you have never stayed in a FS then I recommend you do. It is worth it. The service was the best we have experienced. The food from the restaurants was first class and the beds were very very comfortable. The gym was well equipped and they even have free classes. Nothing is too much to ask and they treat you as part if the family. You feel like you are in your own little world for a few days. Thank you FS we will be back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We came back from the Four Seasons yesterday and after a couple of initial niggles which were dealt with in a professional sensitive and understanding manner by hotel management particularly Pierre and Badir. We have felt our expectations have been exceeded and we have returned from the holiday relaxed and recommending it to our friends and family.    Pros  Breakfast has choices amazing coffee and freshly squeezed orange juice and the pancakes made to your specification  Rooms are cleaned thoroughly and there is a turn down service in the evening  Good exchange rate  Aircon is not noisy in the rooms  Balcony’s are large  Security coming in to the hotel is great 2 gates and someone with a bomb alert device going over all cars coming in to the hotel  Standard WiFi was very fast for a hotel with good signal  Men can wear shorts to the restaurants  Beautiful pools  Wonderful staff throughout the hotel always striving to meet your needs  Pool bar and room service offered the best meals at the hotel in my opinion  Complimentary cold bottles of water and cold desserts brought daily to sunbathers  The spa treatment my partner and I had was extremely professional and relaxing I would recommend using the hot jacuzzi before or after  The hotel is close to the airport    Thank you for looking after us 4S and making our holiday a wonderful one.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Absolutely amazing resort located a bit outside of the Medina
Review_Text: LOCATION: The resort is located very closely to the airport (max. 10 minutes by car; luckily there’s no aircraft noise). It takes you 15 minutes by car to the Medina (old town incl. souk) and maybe 10 minutes by car to Guéliz (modern area of Marrakesh). If you’d like to go to the Medina by foot the Four Seasons is not the best choice. We did it several times but the walk is not especially beautiful.    RESORT: Absolutely beautiful!!! I loved it from the moment we arrived there. The resort is very spacious. It doesn’t feel as if there were guests of 300 rooms. Every morning I went running through the resort – that’s when I realized how big it actually was (one round was more than 1km).    ROOMS: Very comfortable beds nice balcony very big bathroom incl. shower and tub. Our room was very spacious.    SERVICE: The staff is wonderful! All staff members (front desk breakfast dinner restaurant pool garden etc.) were absolutely amazing and very helpful. Thank you so much for making our stay so comfortable and relaxing. We enjoyed our four days with you very much!    BREAKFAST: Excellent! There was everything you could possibly wish for from müesli lots of fresh fruit nuts nut butter bread croissants patisserie egg dishes freshly pressed juice smoothies etc. Every morning when I woke up I was looking forward to the breakfast (good thing we always did a 1 to 2 hour work out first …)    VALUE FOR MONEY: I was invited so I can’t judge it this time :-)

Emailed hotel prior to arrival requesting connecting rooms and this was confirmed before arrival. After long drive from the coast was underwhelmed by the arrival with family having to stand around behind me at the desk with no chairs or welcome drink and kids ignored. Check in experience was a disaster with reception insisting they hadn't got any instructions for connecting rooms. We were then led to a waiting room and promised the rooms for 4pm. Come 4pm no one bothers to call us. After a number of calls over the next half hour someone turns up to escort us to the rooms and then tells us only one is available whilst the other is still being cleaned due to a late check out. Again we are left not knowing whats happening and told it will be "ready in 5 minutes" a number of times until I enter the room myself and inform reception it seems ready. I am then asked to check all the amenities are in the room which is not my job and not something I want to be doing after a 4 hour wait! We are then told the stock response to the problem "the hotel is full" which is not the type of response expected when at a Four Seasons. Complained to the duty manager Magdi who to be fair was very apologetic and offered us a meal as compensation but to be honest would have preferred a smooth check in experience as it totally ruined the day.  Other issues arose at breakfast where the teenage waiters did not write down our orders and tried to remember them. This resulted in mix ups and non arrival of dishes which when we told them we hadn't received they tried to convince us we hadn't ordered them! A similar issue arose at Lunch where the waiters confused the dessert order but by then we were resigned to this and just laughed with them about it. Not sure if this is laziness or poor training but not writing down orders is just not acceptable. Other irritations were late cleaning of the rooms (around 2pm) and safety boxes not working at various times.  To top of the stay I asked for a check out at 1pm but then had to enter into a long debate to negotiate to keep one room until 12.30 which was annoying when our check in wasn't until 5pm but were told " a big group is arriving" so the room was needed! Sure enough check out was shambolic with the bill being printed 3 times with various mistakes.  Maybe we were unlucky but something appears to be going wrong at this place.

Review_Title: Incredible Staff & Activities, but Room Maintenance was a Let Down
Review_Text: My wife and I (along w/ our two little ones one being a toddler and the other a baby) stayed here for 4 nights over the summer and were really impressed by the hotel staff's friendliness and engagement with us throughout the stay. From the moment we checked in played at the pool or dined at the restaurants (we particularly loved the Italian restaurant) the staff was incredible friendly and engaged with our family. The kids club was also well put together with tons of activities snack time and was generally a great place to site and relax to beat the heat and watch our daughter engage in dance and craft building. The pools were great and the hotel was located far enough from the city center you didn't hear the noise but was also close to the airport and other locations it was easy to get around.    However the overall room quality was a let down based on other Four Seasons we have been to and similar luxury hotels. The first time we entered the room and flushed the toilet the button on the wall fall off and as we opened the curtains the rod fell and broke of. We then noticed the the baby sheets were not being changed even though it was obvious they needed to be and there were bugs all over the room. So many ants entered the room (our doors were always closed) that we noticed they were in the baby's formula powder so we had to disregard it. It also took a few phone calls to get more then 2 water bottles but every time we called the hotel immediately responded. As we were staying in the garden bungalow they mentioned bugs do happen but after staying at luxury hotels in the jungle i've never had this happen especially at a luxury resort.    We would stay here again as it is a great family option with 3 kids clubs but the room maintenance could be improved especially based on the number of issues we had when compared to staying at other luxury hotels.

Visited here for 4 days with my boyfriend and completely loved it! The hotel had a luxurious and spacious and airy feel and the rooms were huge with beautiful balcony’s and views. The pools were stunning and so well maintained with so much land - they are as amazing as they look in the pictures  Don’t go expecting the modern and contemporary designs of the Four seasons in LA/NY/London the hotel has a more morrocan traditional feel and fits in so well with the city!  The service was superb both by the pool in the restaurants and the reception and greeting guys. They can’t do enough to help! The small touches by the pool made it extra special - free water sun cream ice creams handed out. And the bottle of wine and macaroons left for us on our last night was so thoughtful.  The fitness centre was enormous and was really utilised by most of the guests  It’s also only 10 mins drive from the airport and the central square and old town. I stayed in a Riad last time but way preferred to be a little further out of town at the FS this time.    The only small downsides ...  The alcohol is pretty extortionate (I appreciate it’s an Arabic country) but charging £15 for a glass of prosecco and £20 a cocktail is a little extreme!  If you say to taxi drivers you are coming back to the four seasons they automatically double the cost of the taxi ride home - be forceful and say you will only pay 50 dirums (standard charge) otherwise walk away and find another taxi    I really recommend this hotel - we will definitely be returning! Thank you FS!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Faraz R wrote a review Sep 2018
Review_Text: Everything from the hotel was perfect. Service was incredible always providing you with cold waters when sunbathing by the pool breakfast was nice with fresh juices & the waiters in the restaurant provided fast service.    Amazing experience and by far the best hotel that I have stayed at will definitely visit 4S again in the future!

Review_Date: Daniel W wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Title: The best hotel in a bustling city
Review_Text: We stayed at the 4S for 4 nights while in Morocco. The hotel was amazing and most importantly provided an amazing santucary and escape for the days when you need it after spending time in the Médina. The staff was incredible and the level of comfort on all levels was through the roof. The crew up front always made sure the taxi drivers had the full detail of where you needed to go and the concierge at the front desk was among the best I’ve ever dealt with! Thanks to everyone who made our stay unforgettable!

We had just spent 3 days/2 nights on a desert excursion so we knew we wanted to follow that up with some R & R. We decided on the Four Seasons over La Mamounia because we knew what we would get. Happy to report they did not disappoint. From the moment we arrived all the staff was so friendly. We had a premier garden room on the 2nd floor looking over the main fountains it was perfect. It also had a great outside alcove couch which was awesome to lay down in the afternoon. We spent a good amount of time at the beautiful pool which is adult only. They have a separate kids pool. Our man Mohammed took great care of us with food and drinks and we were totally able to relax. We only ate at one of the restaurants which was the poolside restaurant. The food was fine and if I have a critique about the hotel I would say the service there wasn’t very attentive. We did stop over at the La Mamounia and it was gorgeous. If we came back to Kech again we might try staying there since it’s inside the Medina. Overall if you are looking for a great stay the Four Seasons won’t disappoint.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Poor Service and a let down to the Four Seasons Group
Review_Text: Having stayed in 5 or 6 Four Seasons around the world I felt compelled to write a review on this resort. I found the service shocking should you wish to request anything by the pool be prepared to ask 3/4 times before they action your request when they do it's like they are doing you a favour. I rang the hotel reception requesting something and four times I had to call them back 3 times the request was not actioned. This location does a dis service to the Four Seasons Group the staff are not interested in guest’s welfare or experience. Ordering a taxi is another issue no queuing system staff change over so they don't know who is waiting it’s a mess.  I can honestly say the only good customer service I experience was from Jaharn (Guest Services Manager) other than that sorry zero service. Considering you have such a selection of hotels in the area I am surprised that the staff are not up to par. If you want a luxurious resort and excellent customer service I would avoid this hotel. They don't have a patch on the Dubai For Seasons now that really is world class.

Not the first time we stay in this Four Seasons and well looks like it’s better and better!  Service is just GREAT everywhere from the reception to the swimming pool and finally the bar and restaurant. The staff is very kind always greeting and never impose too much.  We’ve had a great service throughout the entire stay we were helped both via the Four Seasons chat and classical service. Cleaning standards are very high and definetly help making an enjoyable stay.  We were provided some medicines requested by us directly by the swimming pool where we were in that moment isn’t this taking care of your guests?  Absolutely nothing to complain about I want to go back there ASAP!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Best hotel seevice very good staff amazing room was perfect next to pool breakfast little high price but worh it my wife and her famiky enjoyed it cant say more but definitely will come back again thank

Beautiful hotel and grounds located within 10 minutes of the airport and 10 minutes of the Medina. You can pre-book the hotel to pick you up at the airport in a luxury vehicle for 400MAD one way or 600MAD return. There are plenty of taxis but you have to negotiate with them before you get in their taxi. It should be a 100MAD taxi ride to the hotel from the airport. However after a long fight and first time to Marrakech I wasn’t up for taxi negotiations. Next time maybe. The hotel has a Moroccan flair with a Four Seasons feel. My room was spacious and well appointed and had a lovely patio that over looked the pool. They have 2 pools - an adult pool and a family pool. The restaurant for breakfast offered a nice buffet or you can order off the menu. The breakfast service was good although it depended on your server - some were much more service oriented than others. They have poolside lunch service which was very good too. The front desk personnel were helpful. Communication via email with the hotel was easy and effective. If you want to walk out of the hotel and explore the Medina choose a hotel in the Medina. The Four Seasons is outside of the Medina although a lovely hotel. It’s a 50MAD taxi ride each way to/from the Medina. Very satisfied and happy with my stay at the Four Seasons Marrakech.

Review_Title: A must stay with family and friends! Even the prices are resealable keeping in mind the busy season of August
Review_Text: Great stay! The resort is beautiful the staff is awesome! We really enjoyed our stay  the restaurants are great!  It was very convenient for us as it is close to town and general attractions .  We will definitely be back we were very attracted to the pricing as well as it was pretty reasonable for a 5 start and a four seasons standards

We stayed 4 days at the hotel. Beautiful ground floor room with plunge pool. The staff were very attentive ( but not annoyingly so) and curtious and would always spare a few minutes to ask how our stay was going. In particular the staff on reception and at the entrance were very helpful and friendly always on hand to make suggestions re where to go and give advice when needed. The staff around the pool couldn’t have been more helpful- they even cleaned my sunglasses for me! We went on a half day tour of the city with Mohammed Berdai a fantastic guide suggested by the hotel - he was so knowledgable about the monuments we visited and was fun to spend time with. It was really really hot so I appreciated the fact that he kept checking if we were ok to keep walking. I would definitely recommend this hotel and look forward to a return visit soon.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Beverley P wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Text: I stayed at the Four Seasons for 5 days with my daughter and granddaughter and found the hotel absolutely divine. Could not fault this hotel at all. Our room was spacious clean and well maintained. The pool area was lovely baskets of cold bottled water was handed out at no extra cost together with ice lollies. The hotel is located in a quiet spot with taxis at hand. You could get to just about anywhere it seems for the same price 50 Dirhams but beware the taxi prices double at night. This has no reflection on the hotel whatsoever. The only grey area I'd say that could do with a bit of improvement is that 2 chefs are needed each at the omelette & crepes stations to avoid queues at breakfast. Other than that I have no qualms recommending this hotel. The staff and concierge were delightful and went out of their way to oblige. Will definitely return.

Review_Date: Marcin I wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Text: Great City great hotel great food great atmosphere great room great service. Everything there is great. Really recommend!!! If you ever will have a chance this place is worth to visit. One of the best hotel I have ever visit.

I was for the second time at the Four Seasons in Marrakech and I found incredible hospitality.  I tasted in the typical Moroccan style "Inara" restaurant and the "Quattro" restaurant is perfect Italian style.  The pools and the SPA are fantastic.  All the staff are always friendly and helpful with style.  The bedroom is always perfect.  I'll be back!

Review_Date: Vanessa E wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Text: We ended our 2 week trip to Morocco with a heavenly 2 days at the Four Seasons in Marrakech and I would highly recommend it. The hotel is a haven from the hustle and bustle of the city. The staff are amazing - nothing is too much trouble. The main reason for staying though has to be the wonderful swimming pools: one for children and one without. Both are beautifully kept with great sun beds and staff on hand with ice cold water sun cream sun hats. Didn’t want to leave.

I would like to start by saying this hotel is probably the best family hotel we have ever stayed in it has thought of everything from baby’s right up to early teens. We have 12 yr old son who didn’t complain once in the two weeks we were there so for me that is testament to this hotel. I can’t write this review without mentioning the staff they are simply outstanding from the doorman with the biggest smile to the maid that looked after our room every single member of staff you come across is both helpful and friendly nothing is too much trouble. I would like to say a big thank you to all who made our stay so memorable especially Sophia and ever member of her team in the  Inara restaurant the food and service we received was exceptional we love Moroccan food and although we did go out of the hotel to eat in the la soltana and the la Maison Arabe which were very good the food and service in the Inara was by far the best. If you are looking for a family holiday in Marrakech and don’t want to compromise on your luxury then I can not recommend this hotel enough. I should however say If you don’t have children this is definitely still a fantastic place to go the kids pool is completely separate for the adult in fact you would hardly know it catered so well for children they have kept it all very separate so it works for everyone I don’t want to put anyone off going that is looking for a relaxing couples holiday because you will certainly get that at the four season Marrakech. I am looking forward to returning in May with my whole family for another amazing holiday.  Thanks guys  Mr Smith Victoria and Travis x

Review_Date: Aisha R wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Title: This was the most magnificent stay!
Review_Text: We spent 3 nights and 4 days at the Four Seasons Marrakech and did not want to leave. The stay was exceptional! The service by all staff was superb. From the time we checked in to the time we left we were treated well. The morning breakfast was delicious with various choices. The family pool area was beautiful and my girls spent a lot of time there. The grounds of the resort was beautiful and we had a wonderful ground floor room with a private courtyard. I plan on going back to Marrakech and the only place I would stay is at the Four Seasons.

The staff were delightful and ensured that our every need was accommodated. The whole experience has been one of my best stays in any hotel worldwide and I don't say that lightly. I'll definitely be looking out for Four Seasons on my next trips.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Antonio A wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Title: Dream your days as a royal couple
Review_Text: We spent here only three nights while visiting Marrakech and recovering strength for the following part of a long journey. This resort is simply perfect. Nice smiling and efficient people (everything you need after a day in Marrakech Marina). Beautiful suite where you are lulled by the sound of the fountain water. Superb breakfast and restaurant food. Very nice pool. What else to say? Come here and taste it. We surely will come back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Good place to stay quiet adults pools which seemed to be unlike some places just adults.    Rooms are ok although the cream rug is far from cream any longer and cleaning or replacing.    Taxis are so cheap with most trips locally being around 7dhs and the airport run is fixed price at 100.    Breakfast is pretty basic but covers the usual cereal fried omelette fruit. Great orange juice.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Beautiful hotel, Only a short car trip to the old medina
Review_Text: Beautiful hotel. Amazing service and a free upgrade to a room with our own unge pool made this a very memorable stay. Free shuttle into the town in the evening made it easy to eat out in Marrakesh. Cannot fault this place.

Review_Title: Wonderful resort, fabulous service, disappointing decor.
Review_Text: The website sells this hotel particularly well and reality doesn't disappoint - it's on a grand scale it's lush and tropical the outdoor spaces are wonderful enormous palm-lined courtyards and the pools and pool service are up there with the best anywhere...    On top of that the service is just fantastic. The best of Four Seasons. Over our five day stay we probably had at least five incidences where the service offering exceeded our expectations by a country mile. Such a joy really.    If you're coming to hang out around the pool which we kind of were then you couldn't be in a better place in the world almost. A proper size adult and kids pool so the adult pool was perfectly relaxing all day with the most attentive pool-side service you could want a lovely pool-side restaurant close by and a setting where you can comfortably spend a good portion of the day.    The thing that disappointed us was the quality of the interior environment - primarily the soft furnishings and fixtures and fittings. It's just not up to Four Seasons standards. We travelled from here to Four Seasons Casablanca and that hotel is perfectly on point which just reiterated how off the mark they are here. It feels like the budget ran out after the landscaping and before they could finish furnishing the hotel so they had to settle for a cheaper decorator and lower quality furniture and soft furnishings. A pity because otherwise it's just a great place to come and enjoy Marrakech.    Close enough to the medina to be a quick 10min cab ride but also far enough away to be a peaceful oasis to come back to after the craziness.    If we went back we'd be tempted to try the Mamounia or Royal Mansour - but they're substantially more expensive with less spacious gardens/pool areas. So this really does have it all just not quite the Four Seasons we've come to know expect and love.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Laura O wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Text: I stayed at the Four Seasons in Marrakech July . Aug 2018 and it was a hotel ill never forget the people the décor and facilities were EXCEPTIONAL. The staff were all so friendly welcoming helpful and happy! We had a fantastic holiday and would recommend going to the Four Seasons! 5 star service in a 5 star hotel

Review_Date: Shameela A wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Text: My husband and I have just returned from a fantastic stay at the FS.    The property is absolutely stunning and very well maintained; what you’d expect from a premium property so no surprises there. However for us it was the warmth & hospitality we experienced from their brilliant team. Special mention for Ahmed (and team) in house keeping who really went above and beyond; Ismail at breakfast & Belhasan’s beautiful smile as he welcomed us back from our evenings out ... we were debating between FS and a more “authentic riad” experience. I’m so glad we chose the resort ... it’s an oasis from the hustle and bustle and the Morroccan influences certainly are not lost.    It’s location is perfect. Just a 10 min taxi ride from the airport and the same to the Old Town.    If you’re considering this resort absolutely go for it. You won’t regret it. Thank you for a fantastic stay. We will definitely be back soon.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Spread out on 16 hectares of lush and Moorish gardens and refreshing pools the Four Seasons in Marrakech is a sanctuary in the middle of the city. Perfectly situated between the city’s ancient swirling medina and the cosmopolitan neighbourhoods of the Ville Nouvelle the resort welcomes you with a blissful and luxurious retreat.    On every step in the most beautiful decorated resort traditional values and contemporary comforts unite. The splendid and most comfortable rooms with private terrace all have a view to the pool side of the hotel. You are not going to miss anything here - best comfort with high end service awaits you. A family and a adult pool invite you for a swim or just sipping a cocktail. Three restaurants will be open for your convenience offering all kind of foods - from Italian to Moroccan. Best quality and outstanding service can be awaited. Life music and wonderful entertainment (changing daily) as well as great art disposed around the resort are installed for your pleasure and enjoyment.    A wonderful spa invites you to experience true relaxation and outstanding treatments. A fitness center and two floodlit tennis courts are available to all sport enthusiasts.    For all conference planners and event agencies at the Four Seasons you can choose from five elegantly appointed multipurpose rooms. Each has its own unique décor and all are equipped with state-of-the-art audiovisual equipment. The meeting space is located on the lower level of the Resort with a separate driveway parking area and entrance for added convenience.  A own event space right on the large beautiful pond with amazing roof to terrace is the perfect venue for any event such as weddings anniversaries or product launches.    The Four Season Resort Marrakech is a stunning property with a great hospitality and awesome service. I can highly recommend this place.

Review_Date: G C wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Text: This hotel deserves a lot of praise: attentive genuinely friendly staff. Spacious clean well-designed rooms. Great adult pool and large enough for comfortable reading and relaxing. Spectacular greenery and resort lay out. The gyms are also very competent for any workout. At night it is very romantic. The only disappointment was the food which we found rather plain and slightly expensive for what it was at $22 a main. We enjoyed eating out at restaurants in the city a lot more and only ate at the hotel when we too tired. Strongly recommend and would love to return.

Review_Date: Norbert A wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Text: Our group of 12 spent a couple of days at the resort in July.    Predominantly occupied by couples a few families and some business delegates but the property size meant even at meals there was no rush.    The rooms and suites are only outdone by the service standards of the staff.    Interestingly the staff here were fluent in English vs Casablanca where French and Arabic were the preferred choice.

Wonderful hotel with amazing services very good in room dining and lovely pool restaurant/service. Very clean hotel extremely nice staff available in fulfilling all requirements. Superb location close to everything. Cant wait to go back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Aaron M wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Text: We had a fabulous stay here - looking for a little luxury and some down time while exploring Morocco. It was a welcome break.    An amazing property that is very well kept. The housekeeping team were wonderful as was the food and beverage which was excellent quality and we enjoyed numerous meals with a very good selection of choices each time.    The stand out for us however was the fantastic kids club and fast become a favourite with our son who insisted on attending on multiple days during our stay. The team at the kids club were 100% amazing and went a very long way to making our sons and by extension our stay outstanding.    A fabulous property and one that we will continue to recommend when staying on Marrakesh!

Review_Date: Pravin A wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Text: where do I start?  we are presently at the four seasons and this hotel has the best customer service we have ever come across. From the reception to house keeping to the pool it’s impeccable.  would not hesitate in visiting here again.    Simply brilliant

Review_Date: Ushma P wrote a review Aug 2018
Review_Text: I don’t normally review hotels like the Four Seasons as service is meant to be exceptional! However I’ve stayed at many Four Season resorts and the Marrakech resort was disappointing for my family and I.  Day 1 was really good  Day 2 the restaurant service at Inara was terrible ... with children we started dinner at 7pm and still at 9pm no main course served . Asked for water and did not get any so my son went back to room and got a bottle from there and still when he returned no water served . When kept asking staff what was happening with main course no one could tell us. In the end we left and then the manager Sofia came running to us saying sorry but she thought we were having a relaxed evening and in no rush . I told her you should not assume and secondly the point is there is no mains at 9.30pm which is unacceptable  Day 3 as being doing for last two days previously setting out towels and stuff on sun beds getting the umbrellas ready then going back to room to get the kids ready for swimming and sunbathing however this day we came back to our spot and our stuff was thrown on floor and umbrellas given away. When we asked the pool attendant he told me the policy is they wait 2-3 minutes then they give away your spot ... I said but last two days your the one who set up things and not mentioned this before he said well this is policy   Then lunch at Azzara pizza comes we ask for plates all waiters are walking around but still no plates in the end I got up and found where the plates were and got them myself ...  Day 6 time to leave called reception twice to come get our bags and still no one came in the end we took our own bags down    Worst stay in my life at the Four Seasons . When we complained we were told we will do something for you ... nothing came off that comment and in fact paid my full bill for the week including Inara where it was the worst experience in my life !!    Do NOT VISIT THIS RESORT IF YOUR EXPECTONG EXCEPTIONAL SERVICE !!!

Review_Date: Graham W wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Text: Superb staff: check in pool area door opener restaurant....all the happiest people work here. The guide we had whose name is Mohammed was fantastic - only our return visit to The Souks today confirmed how good he is. The front of house guys arranging taxis were on the case....all in all a great experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The place was 5 star all the way. Amazing staff all extremely friendly and welcoming. STUNNING room and hotel layout with a luxury feel while keeping a true moroccan palace theme.    Special shout out to Marouane at the Inwar lounge who provided amazing service and to Sami (Kassam) at the valet who always welcomed us with a smile.    Worth every penny - Would definitely go back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This resort is beautiful.    We were upgraded to a lovely room upon arrival.. thank you......    The rooms are large clean good views and good location.    Staff are excellent. Very helpful and polite.    There restaurant and in house dining is superb. Food was lovely.    The property is located in the new town which is a fair walk from the old town however very close by taxi. Can cost between 70-100 dirhams to get to the city centre    Airport is also close by prices can vary was charged 200 dirham to the resort and then only 100 dirham back to the airport    Overall great property great service good location and well worth the visit

We had an absolutely lovely stay at the Four Seasons in Marrakech for our “minimoon” after our weeding. We were looking for rest and relaxation after the wedding and the hotel provided that in abundance. It was perfect and we couldn’t have wished for a better stay. We made them aware that it was our honeymoon and they really made us feel special. The staff throughout were fantastic.    Close to the city centre but in a quiet location. The spa was lovely (my wife went for a massage) the pool area was fantastic and the breakfast was really good.    Highly recommended!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Dream vacation at Four Seasons Resort Marrakech
Review_Text: We had a wonderful and amazing stay with my family at the Four Seasons Resort Marrakech. Everything was perfect and the staff extremely helpful and attentive to our needs our daughter loved the Kids Club. We are already looking forward to going back.

Review_Title: Like walking onto a movie set
Review_Text: The Four Seasons Marrakech is a truly wonderful hotel experience. The amazing setting and property has probably my favourite swimming pool of all the hotels I have ever visited. Staff are impeccable and friendly and the food and drink are excellent. Rooms spacious and comfortable.
