My one reservation is that they could use expanding the wine list a bit although it does have many new and interesting Moroccan wines. Altogether a wonderful time for my family and I and I would recommend it to anyone.

We have been coming to the Four Seasons Marrakesh for a number of years and have always found the entire team working there 101% committed to making our stay as good as possible.-Each time we drive up to the entrance- It feels like we are coming home and very much look forward to returning in September.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Yes they are not call Four Season if they are not up to it.  The property is very well kep and the service is the level which you expect from them.  We really enjoyed our stay in their 2 bedroom Villa.

Review_Date: R E wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Title: Great hotel with a horrible kids club experience
Review_Text: I ll start my review with the positive things about the Four Seasons Marrakech.  Our room was big clean with fresh flowers super nice and comfortable.  The breakfast was good with super nice and friendly service.  The two pools for families and adults are good as well.  Now the bad part for us was the kids club. The people who are working there looks and act very unprofessional. My son got kick on his head (I know kids fight sometimes but adults are the to prevent this type of situations). My son was crying and totally lost when my husband went to pick him up. The person responsible for the kids first lie to my husband saying everything was ok and my child was only miss me. My son told me my husband he was kicked on his head by a boy who came with his private nanny to the kids club and finally the lady who worked for the kids club decide to tell the truth and she was laughing about the situation. This attitude make our family very upset. For us the safety of our little one is super important. I personally was very excited about the activity on the kids club but they dont seem to happen... At least when I asked my child he said we only watched a movie or played with other kids. We talked with the manager he was very friendly and send a nurse to our room and also give a goodbye gift to my son which we appreciate a lot. I truly wish the kids club gets better because is the only thing missing for a 5 stars in my opinion.  Another positive thing about our stay was the cab driver called Said Nacif. He help us a lot with all our tours. I highly recommend to request his services at the hotel.

I’ve travelled to many hotels in many countries around the world and my stay at the Four Seasons with my two teenagers is in my top 5. The hotel setting is amazing. The service is great all around especially if you download the FourSeasons app to communicate with the concierge. They organized many activities for us. The food is great whatever by the pool the outdoor terrace or at Quattro (Italian).

Not only is this property beautiful it is immaculate. All credit to all the smiling and hard working staff who make it a truly special place to stay. The smell of the lobby and public areas is divine and the place is filled with bowls of roses. Two beautiful pools (never any trouble finding sunbeds at any time of day). Fantastic and speedy housekeeping and a lovely big room with a gorgeous bathroom and terrace with inset alcove seating with moroccan cushions. Delicious food - expensive yes for what it is - drinks too - but if you don't like the prices there are plenty of places in town to choose from. You're paying for great service convenience and five star premises here. The spa was exceptional and we enjoyed lovely massages and a traditional hammam experience (again you'll get cheaper in town but this was all about relaxation for us).    The hotel is 8 minutes by car into the centre of town. A complimentary shuttle operates one way from the resort between 6 and 10pm every day ask at reception. If not immediately available you only have to wait a few minutes until it's back. Or the door staff will call a taxi - flat rate of 50 MAD to anywhere in town with 100 MAD to the airport. Prepare to pay the same coming back - agree the price before you get in the taxi and if any driver asks for more wave them away and find another one (there are hundreds).    A couple of tips: Prepare to get lost in the souks but try and resist taking up the plentiful offers of help to get you out - your helpful "guide" will want a hefty tip and it really isn't hard to find your way out to a proper street. If you love Moroccan furniture and decorations then head to the warehouse of Mustapha Blaoui just outside the souk - it's an Aladdin's Cave of wonderful stuff. Google it - it's well worth a visit if you want to buy things to take home and make your humble abode look just like a riad!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Excellent stay at Four Seasons Marrakech. First time staying here and throughly enjoyed it. The hotel was amazing with excellent amenities and very professional staff who made us feel very welcome. The hotel restaurants and spa facilities were fantastic. Our room was very spacious wiith 2 balconies overlooking the hotel grounds. Wish we had stayed for longer! Already planning our next trip to Marrakech and will definitely be staying here again.

We loved our hotel the design is incredible and everyone was very nice to us. We really enjoyed the pool and the restaurant. It is one of the most beautiful places we have stayed in. We will go back for sure.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My review is long overdue and I keep meaning to write. We dealt Magdy who handled guest relations and my friends and I couldn’t rave about him more! He and his staff were just so helpful and made our time in Marrakech so much more enjoyable! The facility the food the room the staff -everything is absolutely exquisite and perfect. They arranged drivers tours reservations etc just seamlessly for a group of 7 girls. Highly recommend staying here when in town!!

Perfect (really!) staff and very nice hotel area. We spent only 3 nights and we would like to come back as soon as possible. From our perspective the best hotel in the town. Highly recommanded! Thank you :)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: From the staff to the grounds to the concierge this was an excellent Four Seasons and a beautiful place to stay in Marrakech. Located just outside the Medina it offered a place of tranquility and rest amongst a lively city.

This was a return visit to the Four Seasons and we were very disappointed. We had just stayed at Palais Namaskar but due to limited availability we booked the four seasons for our last couple of nights.  The hotel is now extremely busy unlike our first visit and despite the hotel being busier the rooftop bar with views over Marrakech is no longer open and neither is the restaurant below. Both we had looked forward to going to so a real disappointment that they are now closed and only open for functions.  The service and food at the restaurant at the pool is very good but other than that everywhere else in the hotel wasn’t good enough.  The final nail in the coffin so to speak was on our departure the man doing our checkout tried to insist we had had a massage which we had not. Our astonishment wasn’t enough and he had the nerve to question us if we were sure in a very rude manner ! Not just any massage but apparently £350. Worth of massage. This was unexcepatble from a Four Seasons and I honestly do believe we would have been happier staying at the Sofitel down the road.  We have since Christmas stayed at fours seasons in Dubai and Easter in their Mauritius property so I know the difference and this hotel may be a four Seasons by name but that is where it ends.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jennifer H wrote a review Jul 2018
Review_Title: Paradise away from the busy city center
Review_Text: My daughter and I loved this hotel. The Four Seasons does not disappoint. The spa was fabulous as was the restaurant Quattro. Ismail remembered our order every morning and in the evening Eunice and Mohammed made our meal that much more special. The staff went out of their way from reception to security pool staff spa and restaurant staff. If we didn't have so much to see outside of this resort we never would have wanted to leave. The room was very spacious with a large bathroom and closet. We had a private patio with a cozy nook and chaise lounges. The adult only pool was very quiet with a beautiful restaurant at the end. The grounds were equally exquisite. I highly recommend this resort. Book extra time so beyond the activities of Marrakech you have time to enjoy the pool and spa here.

For a hotel of this caliber the reception desk serving as the concierge is unacceptable. They are unresponsive when emailing. Also don’t book tours through the hotel. They provided French speaking guides when we specifically asked for English ones. They pressured us in changing a tour we had booked privately & do it through the hotel for much more money.

The people at the hotel are very pleasant friendly and gracious.  I have the Patio garden room vey nice room and spacious.  The gardens are the best most beautiful gardens.  Breakfast is very pleasant.  Location is convenient.  Room service is very good.

Review_Title: A little oasis of calm in a busy city with exceptional service
Review_Text: I was contemplating whether or not to stay here but then I bit the bullet and booked 7 nights for my wife 4 year old boy and myself.    We got a standard garden room which was huge with more than enough space to put a roll away bed in for my son. The main bed was a super king.    Everything is immaculate and your room is cleaned 2-3 times a day. once in the morning when you go for breakfast/pool and then again to dress down the bed and change towels etc in the eve.    I never got much time by the adult pool but when I was able to sneak away for 10/15 minutes from the family pool it was gorgeous. The family pool is just as amazing and the kids will absolutely love it. There is always constant bottled water left in ice boxes for you free of charge by your sun beds. All the pool staff are amazing.    Breakfast is good to very good. They have what you would expect of real 5 star hotel breakfast buffet + you can order from their al a carte menu if you want.    My wife had a gluten allergy and the hotel set up a meeting with the F&B Director Suhail to sit down post check in and ensure her stay was stress free. I need to stress that Suhail has far exceeded our expectations. He ensured EVERY chef and restaurant manager were fully briefed before we walked into any of their restaurants. He gave us his phone number so that my wife was able to whatsapp him anywhere in the resort in case she needed him which he was EVERY time! IF you have a food allergy and are worried about being looked after you need not worry one bit. Thank you so much for everything you and your team did. We truly appreciate and commend your highest level of professionalism.    The front desk will ensure anything you need/want is arranged. They do not know the word no. Thank you to Ghihan (not sure if I spelt that right) but she was amazing. She even arranged for me to go to a local Hamman to experience how its done by the locals (at my request). She arranged for a driver to take me explain what I wanted wait for me and bring me back. This is just to give you an idea of their service.    Food at all their restaurants were really nice especially the one by the pool and the italian. Children under 5 eat free which was amazing and something we didnt even know before going there!    Thank you again for continuing to make our experience with the four seasons group exceptional. Looking forward to staying with the group for our 4th time in the near future.    Yours sincerely family of three - visited 16 June to 23rd June 2018 staying in room 227.

This resort exceeded my husband and I expectation. From the staff who went out of their way to make our stay great!!! To the beautiful facilities of the resort! FS Marrakech keep up the great work! Will be back! 💕
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Stéphane C wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: Excepted having this complex slightly outside the Medina comparing to La Mamounia the hotel is really great with a very nice team  Can be less classic in color for all places including bedroom being “beige” in majority but restaurant are pretty good (and able to serve you after the limit time in the lobby-really appreciated ) and the bedroom globally well organized and a very good bed.  Garden and pool fountain also giving to the place this Moroccan caractère .  Enjoy the place.

This hotel was simply perfect. The staff couldn't be more helpful whether it was to switch a room for my kids or to arrange transportation to the medina. The pool was gorgeous as were the grounds. Breakfast was fabulous in a beautiful setting. The rooms were stunning and large including a special closet for changing and storage of luggage. We didn't want to leave! HIGHLY recommend on any visit to Marrakech!

Review_Date: Fritz H wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Title: This Resort is NOT TO BE MISSED
Review_Text: The Four Seasons Marrakesh is a world class resort. I have stayed in 5 Star hotels all over the world and I would rake this Hotel/Resort in the top 5%.  The staff is warm friendly and responsive. The rooms/Suites make you feel right at home. All of the finishes are chosen and installed with perfection.  This hotel is a MUST when visiting Marrakech

We spent a long week and at the Four Seasons Marrakech as a family and although we're used to luxury hotels we rarely experienced such a level of perfection throughout our stay. The pool was at a perfect temperature and depth for young kids kids club activities were fun they even had small cutlery at the restaurant for our youngest. Basically we got to not care about anything but enjoying ourselves while on vacation with our kids which is priceless !

Review_Date: michael m wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: After visiting this wonderful hotel in Marchwe returned in early June and found the amazing staff and services to be just what we had in March.  Four Seasons is a great place to go if you want to have the peace and quiet of being just outside yet only a short taxi ride into the centre.  All the staff from front desk to pool guys and cleaners and the folk who keep the grounds looking great are so nice and friendly.Well done we will return
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Fantastic property - needs some work for the pool service
Review_Text: The hotel property and staff overall were excellent. The only real issue is that the service at the pool was very bad. In a course of several 8 hour days poolside we never were approached by anyone trying to take an order - we had to run them down or flag them down - this is a 5 star (or should be) hotel and this should not happen. The restaurants - especially the Italian one was phenomenal.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mia E wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Title: Don’t listen to the other people
Review_Text: I’m still staying here with my mum and my brother. When we arrived we were blown away by the service the places offered. We walked in the front door and had mint tea (Moroccan special) waiting for the three of us.  Before arriving I had read loads of negative comments about the place and Marrakech. When I arrived I quickly found out that they were all wrong.    The Four Seasons Hotel Marrakech is a MUST to stay in as the service could not be better and they are always there to help you. I was a bit nervous arriving of the souk and the Médina (apparently it was hectic). The hotel made sure we knew where we were going at all times and made sure we felt safe around those areas. The people here all speak English and all get you what you want when you want it. (Even as far as washing your sun glasses while at the pool)    The Médina is not hectic and not as scary as reviews make it out to be. I’m only a teenager and please trust me when I tell you that it is not crazy it is actually a really fun shopping experience for kids up to adults.    The main message I want to get across is pleaseee don’t read the comments under “terrible” or any others because they are wrong. I had my doubts but I will never again read those (only for enjoyment ;))    Thank you Four Seasons for literally everything!

We love this resort so much we are tending to make it a yearly trip. Typical Four Seasons hospitality - impeccable as always. Just one request: please consider the evening poolside buffet as a permanent arrangement and not just during Ramadan.  Thank you.

This was our first time visiting Morocco and after going thru countless hotel reviews we decided on Four Seasons.    We had such a great time at this resort it was incredible. From the time we were picked up from the airport the staff took care of our each and every need. Food was great rooms were clean attentive staff and very courteous.    Hahnane from the concierge desk was a delight and took care of us.    I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone visiting Marrakech.    Also would like to thank the bellboys security guards and all the people that made our holiday memorable.    Can’t wait to go back.

Just got back from Marrakech and the Four Seasons. Pick up at airport in hotel black Mercedes 300 well worth it as taxis in Marrakech can be tricky. 10 minutes to hotel. Big security at hotel I guess important. Check in seamless although room was not ready for 10 minutes a short wait in the lobby. We had a patio suite with a private pool. Room is very large with excellent fixtures mini bar coffee maker (Nespresso) and beautiful patio. Bedroom is very comfy with additional doors to patio. Grounds are sprawling groomed and easy to walk. Restaurant in main house serves both Moroccan and continental dishes. We had dinner there the first night after drinks in the Medina. Food was excellent and plentiful. Service was slow by NYC standards but that is often the case in other parts of the world.  Spa is beautiful with a large locker room excellent jacuzzi cold plunge and sauna. Showers clean and well stocked.  Front desk full of good recommendations and was able to arrange tour of the Atlas Mountains three valleys and Casbah Tamadot with a private guide.  They also arranged a private guide for the Medina which was a must as it is full of twists and turns and one can easily get lost and miss the fun areas.  The lunch at the pool before leaving was yummy.  Check out also seamless and the ride to the airport was again comfortable.    I found the entire staff friendly and helpful. There are many choices in Marrakech. If you are looking for a luxury resort with all of the amenities of a western hotel the Four Seasons will suit your needs. It's proximity to the Medina without being in the constant hustle and bustle will provide the relaxation one looks for on vacation.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Taylor F wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: We visited here for the day whilst we were staying somewhere else in Marrakech. Upon arrival we were treated amazing staff were polite helpful and welcoming. The pool we were shown to was an adult only pool which was lovely. Our lunch was delicious with a good variety of food and good portion sizes. Through out the day staff would bring round samples of smoothies and fruit which was a nice touch.    Not sure what it is like to stay overnight but we will be definitely looking to go back for a long weekend.

Review_Date: Denise P wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: Thank you to Blaise and his team for making our five day stay so relaxing and enjoyable.  The resort is in a beautiful peaceful garden setting. The rooms are very spacious  cool and with every amenity .  All staff are very friendly and anxious to accommodate your every need.  Excellent buffet breakfast and extensive evening buffet during Ramadan.  Lots of choice in eating places including snacks and cocktails around one of the two pools.  We shall be back next year. Thank you

It has to be said that our stay didn't start particularly well. On arrival rather than being met with a welcome drink and hot/cold towel we were instead met by a large check in queue and no one to assist with luggage. We were told that the main restaurant was closed for Ramadan and on top of that the weather was freakishly cold for Marrakech. Despite this however the front office manager was extremely helpful and managed to turn around our initial impressions. The room was large (we had a pool view terrace suite which was more than large enough for 2 adults and 2 kids) and the design of the hotel was great - a mix of modern but with Moroccan hints. Breakfast was done very well and the spa was excellent - I would definitely recommend the hammam.

We experienced the wonderful city of Marrakesh by enjoying the paradise of the Four Seasons. The warm attentive kind and enthusiastic staff were discretely there when needed and very helpful. As first time visitors to the country we appreciated the attentive security and safety of the grounds. However our hésitations quickly melted away as we ventured into the city and nearby mountains. The guides were arranged by the hotel and were quite knowledgeable and reflective of the gentle spirit of those who live in this gracious country. The restaurants were excellent and without exception the staff are superb.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ali VK wrote a review Jun 2018
Review_Text: My daughters and I stayed in this amazing hotel and enjoyed our stay immensely. My birthday occurred during our stay and the hotel provided a cake champagne and flowers in my room - along with decorating the room with roses and balloons!! Our hotel room - Pool View Terrace Suite -- was amazing with a fold out couch in a separate area from the bedroom. We had two spacious bathrooms in our room too. Our room faced the family pool. The breakfast served daily was off-the-charts AMAZING! And the staff catered to everything that we needed. We loved our days relaxing by the pool and under the umbrellas. I highly recommend this hotel. The staff is wonderful and the property is luxurious.

This Hotel is a 10 minute drive from the airport and a 10 minute drive from the main square/market place Jamma El Fna.    The staff are absolutely amazing probably the best I've ever come across. Helpful friendly always smiling nothing was too much trouble.    We had a Pool View Terrace Room which was a very good size large bathroom and a lovely walk in closet.    Breakfast was delicious and had a great variety to choose from.    Pool areas are immaculate adult only pool and a children's pool are both available here.    Highly recommend this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Beautiful hotel nice pool area very kind staff close to the Medina and to the airport but no flights noises that disturb. Excellent breakfast. We had a junior suite with view to the pool really spacious and elegant.

Review_Title: Our favorite hotel during our Morocco tour
Review_Text: Now this is a Four Seasons Hotel!    Try the spa as it is large with a hamman sauna steam room showers with nice amenities dressing rooms and a few different relaxation areas. Be sure to bring a swimsuit that you'll also be able to use in the heated outdoor pool.    While most of the service was as expected at a Four Seasons Hotel - top notch friendly and very helpful the service in the bar was a bit slow.    The room was clean comfortable and nicely appointed. We particularly liked the step in shower with a rain head.    The buffet breakfast was outstanding.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Last year was the 1st time I took my then 5-year old goddaughter on our first trip together to the FS in Marrakech. This year I discussed several options with her but she definitely wanted to return to the FS in Marrakech. And again it was such a treat. All the staff outdid themselves in making her (and me) feel so welcome. Family pool and kids' club are such great places to be for the young ones! Both of us felt spoilt and pampered all the time. We got a great suite with lovely outdoor space. The hotel is still improving itself for example there was now a fresh juice bar at the breakfast buffet. Concierge service is excellent as is their spa where we had a mother-daughter massage. We might be back next year.....

Review_Title: Short break to Four Seasons Marrakesh
Review_Text: Fine example of a Four Seasons Hotel just three hours flight from London and ten minutes transfer from the airport. Marrakesh shares the same time as the UK. This hotel is well positioned for short breaks in the sun.    The lounge and dining areas are good as are the two restaurants and two swimming pools; adult and family.    As expected the staff are friendly and helpful. We had an issue with the room at check-in which was dealt with very well by the Guest Services Manager (I think); Jihane. Jihane remained very attentive throughout our stay to ensure we had no further hiccups.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Avi Vach wrote a review May 2018
Review_Text: Stayed here with my family and loved every part of it. The staff makes you feel like royalty. The rooms are very big and gorgeous.. Food and overall hotel atmosphere is great! I was a little worried to go to Marrakech with my family but the staff made me feel comfortable every step of the way! we will be back!

Unlike the Casablanca 4S the Marrakech 4S is a “true” example of the 4S style of quality friendly service ambience food and attention to detail that they are known to specialize in.    We selected their desireable garden room that opened out directly onto the vast garden views and walkways.    The Marrakech 4S serves alcohol and international as well as Moroccan food fare with a choice of two restaurants. Both restaurants have a photogenic night-lighted view of their landscape pool.    If you are a 4S fan you won’t be disappointed...if you’re not look elsewhere.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sam D wrote a review May 2018
Review_Text: This is my idea of a terrific hotel from the porters to management everything works well. We had a suite booked but on arrival we were upgraded to the Presidential Suite for our 3 night stay. It is HUGE and terrific vies from the balcony overlooking the sparkling pool. What a beautiful oasis. Food and beverage outlets were of the same high standard. Breakfast Crepes were to die for. Highly Recommended!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Fantastic stay very friendly & attentive staff very beautiful hotel grounds. We felt very welcomed there everybody at the hotel was very helpful. Beautiful flowers everywhere! Amazing smell in common areas
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: S D wrote a review May 2018
Review_Text: If you are looking for superior facilities service and food than this hotel is for you. From the moment you arrive after going through a brief security check you feel assimilated into the beautiful exclusive ambiance. As someone who travels to 5 star hotels around the world I have to say that this is among the top on my list. The service by all employees in the hotel is impeccable. They will know you personally from day one and attend to your every need. The food in restaurants is delicious. The breakfast spread is amazing. I had a suite with an additional attached room for another family member. We had big wrapping terraces overlooking beautiful view. It was heaven! There is a wonderful spa and Hammam. The 10 minute drive to the Medina was fine. It was nice to be separate from the hustle and bustle of the city and souks when returning to the hotel. This hotel is definitely my pick over La Mamoumia which is a 5 star hotel in the Medina that is beautiful but touristy.

I've been at the Four Season for work. All the staff is highly professional and very kind. the rooms are fantastic in every profile. The restaurants offer dishes of the highest standard. you must go to have an unforgettable experience ...

Review_Date: Maaz R wrote a review May 2018
Review_Text: I have stayed in luxury hotels in London Greece and Dubai but was completely astonished at the amazing level of service we experienced. Especially for the price! We were treated like royalty throughout our stay breakfast was amazing the Spa and Hammam was an extra treat we didnt realise was part of our package! Our whole party loved the whole trip and this was seriously one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in.  The exclusivity made it ever more special and the staff were beyond outstanding.

I was to a Conference for 4 days.The hotel it is very nice with all the facilities and good service.Location it is not the best one but it is 5 min by car to the city center and near to the airport and Menara Jardin.The food it is nice.The swimming pools large with all facilities.Spacious rooms having all the confort

Review_Date: Tamara A wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Title: The best experience, hotel and service you will ever get!
Review_Text: First off - lets talk facts.  I stayed from 16th April - 24th.  This hotel has nivea suncream by the pool for you to apply. It also has sunhats at your dispense by the pool.  There is a spa with a hammam thats free for all guests to use. I repeat - no added cost. (just so were clear it has a beautiful sitting room with coffee herbal tea fruits and dried nibbles. It has a sauna a steam room a hamam shower a jacuzzi a cold pool and an outdoor pool! Ladies and men seperate :) )  There is a seperate pool for kids and adults.  The breakfast is divine.  I bought something fragile from the market and asked staff for spare bubble wrap to protect it. They took it and wrapped it 6x over with ribbon and four seasons wrapping paper haha. Everything they do they do it perfectly.  Theres a games room with board games playstation Xbox basketball 1/2 court pool table football and pingpong.    This is THE best hotel i have stayed in (second would be the Westin in dubai!)  There are so many beautiful riads and nice hotels. But at the four seasons you are 10 min drive from the airport. 10 min drive from the medina and centre where the souks are. 20 mins from jardin majorelle and other beautiful sites. This is really a no brainer    Book here and don't look back!    I'll be posting photos soon

Review_Date: Katalin R wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Title: Very expensive but worth the money!
Review_Text: Awesome garden and pool area a dedicated adult pool. Breakfast did not offer a huge choice but in general it was amazing. Fresh orange juice all the time! Rooms very beautiful and staff very helpful and nice.

Review_Date: Emma A wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: Stayed at the FS Marrakech for a week in March. The property is splendid and very much in keeping with other FS venues. The gardens and grounds are superb and offer a beautiful location to stroll and just enjoy the ambience. The pools and terraces are gorgeous - and so spotlessly clean. The adults only pool is a real treat for those travelling without kids and is magical first thing in the morning when the dark slate finish makes it look bottomless. The food is great - but as usual the vegetarian options are a bit limited. The restaurants do accommodate though and will prepare something bespoke if you request it. The rooms are lovely great standard and again spotlessly clean. The biggest draw of this property though is the staff. Everyone is amazingly kind friendly and helpful. Room allocation issues were sorted out for my friend and I (we had booked a twin and were initially offered a double with a sofa bed as the second bed). We ended up in a gorgeous terrace suite with pool - and the staff transformed the living room into a second bedroom for me which was utterly fine. On my birthday the staff in the restaurant made such a lovely fuss which was very unexpected and thoroughly delightful. I would recommend this hotel and it’s excellent spa as a great option for anyone looking to relax unwind recharge and enjoy that bright light in the sky that we don’t seem to have in the UK. A really great choice and I would be happy to revisit.

Was here for a week on business + break. Being the deep tissue massageaholic I am I booked into spa first day with Tarik. He was so exceptional I booked a total of 3x80 min massages in the 6 days I was there. The team at the spa (and much of the resort) were exceptional. Evaryone on resort was determined to make us feel like royalty.    Will return in a heartbeat

We have been to this hotel 4 times these lasts years either in Carnival holidays or in Easter or May. The rooms are extremely nice spacious and comfortable with a nice oriental touch Marrakech style. The gardens are sumptuous and kids can safely go alone all around. The two swimming pools are fantastic and the bar and restaurant service offers good treats if you want to fully profit the sun and the water all day. The area for adolescents/young kids is a must with games and videos. In many occasion we have eaten local tapas in the main building and we ave also tried the Italian restaurant. All good. The best is the breakfast. Although it is expensive it is probably one of the best offered in a hotel of such category. Just gorgeous! It allows us to take enough time to get back together and exchange in a relax manner while tasting all local and international food offered. We miss the Moroccan restaurant which was opened initially and then closed for a while. This is not a major issue though as there are extremely good in Marrakesh worth eating. The hotel is very well situated near the center and not far from the airport in the calm. Ideally located to visit all touristic spots or to go the desert or the Atlas. The fitness area and tennis court are very modern and impressive too.  However the top of the hotel is without any hesitation the staff always very helpful and professional even if in some cases there have been little concerns or confusions. Their readiness to come with a helpful solution is an example of how to treat the clients.  Just try this hotel if you can. You will become addicted to this resort!!

Review_Date: Alena Z wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Title: service level doesn't match the cost
Review_Text: Terrible service. You need even ask for every bottle of water which is supposed to be provided during thr room cleaning. if you faced with problem it would remain just you problem. the staff would be very sorry but could not help

Review_Date: alex c wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: Always Faultless fantastic service. This is the 5th time we have stayed here and the second with our three boys. The kids club and young adult centre are excellent and keep the boys entertained so we can relax. Staff will always go the extra mile regardless

we had a great stay- the hotel is beautiful a paradise the staff is very smiling helpful and competent.  Excellent breakfast. The Italian restaurant is worth a visit it serves very good food. the hotel is very well located quiet
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I’ve been to this hotel twice three years apart and both times were wonderful. Like any Four Seasons experience the space and service was wonderful. The rooms were comfortable the spa space was fantastic and the food delicious. I would suggest arranging tours with the hotel as well especially to the Atlas Mountains. I’ll be sure to visit again!

HOTEL APPEARANCE & FACILITIES:  Great appearance upon arrival. Nice facade and hotel overall very nicely done. Facilities were excellent. Adult pool was great nice and quiet. Pool staff were very attentive. Lunch area can get very busy and you may have to wait for a table.  The hotel has 3 restaurants and all 3 were brilliant. Great service and excellent tasty food.    LOCATION:  Great location outside the Medina close to the airport but only 10/15 mins taxi ride into the Medina.    BREAKFAST:  Breakfast is good. Not very big but has most continental food as expected. A nice crepe station. They do have an a la carte menu but we only found this out on our third breakfast as we asked so would have been good to know from the start.    INTERNET:  Speedy Wi-Fi    ROOM:  Room is great. We had a garden view terraced suite as there were 3 of us. 2 people in the main bedroom and a bed was put in the lounge for the 3rd person.  The only thing we were missing was a full length mirror in the lounge area/bathroom leading off the lounge.  Ample lighting throughout the rooms.    BATHROOM:  The suite had two bathrooms one main ensuite leading off the bedroom and another bathroom leading off the lounge area so that was handy having two bathrooms between 3 people.  Bathroom nicely decorated and especially liked the robotic Toto toilet with remote controls on the side.  Shower power is not great and on occasions would take a while to heat up.    SERVICE:  Absolutely excellent service from all staff members we encountered. They really were attentive to our every need as expected in a 5star resort such as this.    OVERALL:  Would highly recommend and would definitely return for future visits.

Spectacular property; spacious and elegant room; delightful pools and grounds; a genuine oasis just a short distance from the Menara Mall. We enjoyed three spectacular nights here and would return. Our room had a lovely outdoor patio with views of the reflecting pool [which I attached]
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Michael R wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Text: I've been all over the world and few places have provided the level of concierge services that we enjoyed at the Four Seasons Marrakech. They were able to schedule guides cars restaurant recommendations and tours. On top of that the rooms were spacious and the pools were beautiful. The overall attention to service was second to none. Everywhere we turned someone was asking if we needed anything. Be aware that you are a 10 minute taxi from the Medina.

Beautiful hotel and wonderful staff. So attentive to our needs. Loved the rooms and the balcony. Front desk staff was so helpful when I had a cancelled flight that needed to be dealt with. Love hotel.

Review_Title: A very nice resort, but could use a dedicated concierge staff.
Review_Text: My wife four daughters and I stayed here for three nights. The property is very nice. The food was good - both restaurants catered to gluten free diets. The staff in the kids club was super friendly - even coming out by the pool to play with our children. A classic Four Seasons service example - our daughter was bit by a mosquito and needed itch cream... so the pool attendant searched the hotel for cream; when he couldn't find any he left the hotel to go buy cream and brought it to us for free. AMAZING! It is not quite at the same level as some other Four Seasons Resorts but for Morocco its excellent. Our one complaint is that the reception doubles as concierge. As a result half the time the staff is not well informed or even give inconsistent reviews. My recommendation is that they have one senior reception staff assigned to cover concierge questions or requests - when we had a senior member fo the staff we received excellent guidance. Thank you for a wonderful three days!

Review_Date: Andrew D wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Title: One of my favorite Four Seasons'!
Review_Text: The Four Seasons in Marrakech was an amazing stay! We were on vacation for a week half in Marrakech half in the Sahara. We stayed the first half of our late March vacation at the Four Seasons. The grounds are beautiful everything is pristine and makes you feel like you are in paradise. The staff is incredibly pleasant and willing to help you with anything. The hotel is situated a little outside the center of the city but is nice and quiet and offers you seclusion. If you have stayed at a Four Seasons before you already know what you're getting. A wonderful experience on all aspects. I cannot wait to visit FS Marrakech again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Beautiful property for a winter break
Review_Text: My husband and I spent 6 nights in this hotel in February. The property is very convenient to the airport so you aren't travelling for too long after flying.    Upon arrival reception was a bit confused and they seemed to be understaffed. This continued for the rest of our stay. However this was the only negative aspect of the entire property. They definitely need to have a better concierge service. We ended up asking the bar staff to make reservations at restaurants for us which they kindly did on several occasions.    Our room was on a higher level overlooking the main adult pool. The room was spacious very comfortable and well appointed. We enjoyed sitting on our terrace too.    We LOVED the bar staff. The manager and her team were amazing. Full of helpful information and really great service. Absolutely faultless!    The pool guys were AMAZING too. Such great service consistently.    We ate once or twice in the hotel and the food was good.    We loved relaxing by the pool in the afternoon.    I wouldn't hesitate to recommend this hotel to anyone looking for a luxurious break. We had considered staying at the Mamounia instead. Thank God we didn't! We had lunch there and you cannot compare the two hotels. Mamounia is dark and old fashioned with heavy carpets everywhere. We are so happy we chose the Four Seasons instead.

Review_Date: cazza p wrote a review Apr 2018
Review_Title: Fabulous !!! What a treat 5 star Family resort
Review_Text: Just had a fabulous Easter week in Marrakech with our family. What can I say great rooms service fantastic kids club spa welcomed kids amazing massages and gym again kid friendly this suits teenagers and younger kids. My daughter made so many friends here she spent whole time in pool or kids club Service is excellent around Family Pool and in Quattro restaurant. We also Had a tour in Marrakech Old Town after recommendation from Concierge could have ventured out more but this place is so relaxing. Amazing security always feel safe and so well looked after could come here with girlfriends too as there is an Adults only pool.One more restaurant in evening or a Pop up restaurant would be good addition for 7 night stay but honestly cannot fault this place Kids loved it .

The children didn’t want to leave. Neither did the adults. The staff were so friendly and helpful and the hounds and pools beautiful. Food was good ambiance was relaxing. The rooms were lovely - perhaps a bit of maintenance upkeep would have been good (screws on hinge to shower door loose loo roll holder coming out of the wall a bit) but overall hey rooms were very comfortable and clean. But it really was the staff that made the holiday especially Adnane at the front desk. The hotel also organised an excellent guide to take us through souks. A wonderful stay and we would have no hesitation in recommending the hotel.

Review_Title: Oasis close to busy center in Marrakech
Review_Text: We were very satisfied with the hotels facilities and rooms. The swimming pool side was very nice with adult only pool and bigger pools for  families. On top of that there’s a kids play area right by where it had a nice smaller swimming pool. All swimming pools were nicely heated. The days we stayed were about 17-20 degrees during the day so the outside jaccuzzis by the pool felt really nice. Spa area was also very nice and clean so would be a nice place to chill if you want to get away from the sun. All staff were friendly and services were great. Room was large and we had very large terrace area as well. Only one thing would be about the food quality. They are fresh and of course have no problems whatsoever  but think for the price it can do much better.

We went to Morocco for our daughter's birthday treat and stayed at the Four Seasons Hotel. The hotel was immaculate with very friendly staff we got upgraded from on our room as soon as they found out why we came over to Morocco. We had a pleasant surprise birthday cake and champagne delivered to our room. Pierre & Jhane were extremely helpful in making our stay at Four Seasons an amazing stay

Review_Date: Teddy O wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Text: From the moment the cab pulled up to the property everything about the stay was a 10/10. The concierge/front desk people were amazingly attentive. The people who worked in the restaurants were personable and attentive. They upgraded us to a suite without us requesting and they allowed us to pay for an extra night's stay on very short notice. They even provided us with suggestions for things to do in the city. Best stay I have ever had in a hotel.

Review_Title: Does Not Meet a Typical Four Seasons Standard
Review_Text: We've been fortunate to stay in amazing Four Seasons properties around the world so came into our stay with high expectations. Had this not been a Four Seasons property I might have given the property a three star (the saving grace here is the wonderful pool service staff) but with a strong brand name comes particular guest expectations.    The room: Over the course of our stay we killed dozens of ants in our bathroom; the bath tub had rust in it but was still used by my children daily. What is most disappointing is that the drain didn't work. Housekeeping drained the tub for us daily but it was not fixed over the course of our six days at the property. There was an old Red Bull can that was in the garden outside our room from the day we checked in to the day we checked out. These are things you just don't see at a typical Four Seasons Hotel. Also it was not uncommon to return to the room at 4PM in the afternoon and find the room still had not been made up for the day.    Food: We had many amazing meals on our visit to Morocco but none were at this hotel. Food and restaurant service at the FS Marrakech is underwhelming. Just about every order (with the exception of the pool restaurant and staff) had issues to the point we stopped letting them know about the problems. If heading to Marrakech and want a sure thing definitely head to La Mamounia or the Mandarian Oriental's Ling Ling. The service and food at these properties was out of this world.    Service: As I said we found the pool and outdoor restaurant service to be fantastic. The team went above and beyond like a typical FS does. Where things really go wrong is with the front desk and concierge.    While a FS concierge is typically the best in the business this FS has the front desk staff double as the concierge team. Leading up to our stay they were very unresponsive until my husband reached out to corporate for help. For those familiar with the brand you know that the FS concierge is typically reaching out to guests leading up to a stay to help with plans. This property does none of that.    Once at the property there is not an itinerary of booked activities or even a summary of activities happening at the hotel (though I asked for both multiple times). This lead to much confusion and morning calls from reception for tours we didn't know we were booked.    All that said although I asked the concierge to make an itinerary that followed the recommendations on their own website they indicated on multiple occasions that these itineraries were impossible. I later discovered it was because they prefer to book guests on canned group tours with outside companies that start and end at the hotel as opposed to curate private experiences.    As for activities below is what we tried:    Sunrise Hot Air Balloon Ride: Beware there are two morning times for this experience. One at 5:30 and one after. I discovered the hotel booked us on the second tour (which is not a sunrise ride). We were picked up by a driver that didn't speak English and brought us around to other hotels to pick up others for the ride before getting lost. We were up in the balloon for about a half hour before coming down (was supposed to be 45 mins - 1 hour). In the end the shorter ride worked out since the balloon operator didn't speak English well enough to provide any context about what we were looking at or how the balloon worked. Also I wouldn't recommend this tour for families with younger children as they insisted on splitting up our family for weight / balance issues and this is NOT a private tour so your little ones could be crammed into a compartment with strangers. If you are looking for just a pretty view and don't mind being crammed into a balloon with strangers it is probably okay.    Atlas Mountain Visit: We wanted to do this right after our balloon ride but the FS said it was impossible (despite the website suggesting this). After our experience with the balloon ride we asked the concierge / reception to ensure we were on a private tour advised that we wanted to follow the description of activities outlined on the website (see the waterfalls cooking class in local Berber village make mint tea etc.) and requested lunch at Sir Richard Branson's property.    While we went to the mountains in a private car the driver was not a registered guide and therefore did not provide the deep context and insights about the culture you come to places like Morocco to gain. We were also told that there was an event at the Branson property and it was therefore impossible to have a meal there. What's odd is that my husband reached out partway through our day and learned they would be happy to receive us for lunch. It makes one wonder if the Four Seasons even tried to secure the reservation...    In the mountains we had a lovely hike with a local guide and enjoyed the Berber museum tour. We didn't make tea we didn't have a cooking class - these things were not even offered as possibilities (though they were called out specifically on the FS website which we requested to follow).    Sahara Overnight: Leading up to our trip I asked them to help me with a helicopter ride to the Sahara for an overnight at a luxury tented camp. They indicated they wanted to speak about this on site where they proceeded to suggest driving 10 hours instead. We just didn't have enough time to warrant driving that distance and we continued to ask for a helicopter and also what camp they would book us in (I wanted to be sure my family would be comfortable with the accommodations) but there was no follow-up.    In short we stayed at this property as we have younger children and wanted to be sure we had a predictable property to return to at the end of an active day. For those in our similar camp I would plan to stay the the Mandarin Oriental. We actually would have moved to this property part way through our trip but they were fully booked.    Of note the desk manager reached out to us the day before our departure but by then it was far too late to rectify the issues with the booking of activities. The hotel manager also pulled my husband aside and offered him our last night free (equivalent of a $1000 USD credit). While that is all well and good when time is precious a hotel credit cannot come close to making up for lost time.    All in all I would recommend a visit to Morocco to everyone but advise all to stay at a different property.

The real reason to stay at the Four Seasons is for service. You're not just getting a room you're getting a team of people to make your stay great and this property is no exception. They were there for every detail and it was seamless. In fact I'm always amazed at how they can train everyone so well. That alone makes this a great place to stay.    The grounds were as beautiful as the pictures. We had two of the least expensive rooms and they were really good. Perfectly designed and spacious. The view was very nice to the mountains. I can't imagine that it was worth spending more for a room upgrade. As always bed linens pillows etc. are excellent.    The location is not really near the old town Medina. The taxi ride was perhaps ten minutes without traffic and 15 or 20 with. If you want a resort in Marrakech this is the place. If you want an authentic Riad near the Medina this is not what you want but having a resort to relax at was just what we needed. Excellence expected and delivered.

Bringing together a whole range of ingredients and making the sum of the parts seem more than each individual is an art rather like composing some fabulous piece of music.    The Four Seasons in Marrakech does this really well.    We had a 5 night stay and enjoyed every moment. Yes it's not cheap and anything you add on is pricey but it takes a lot to keep the whole show on the road.    Service is key and while we found a few issues at breakfast time they were fractional and probably seemed slightly magnified because every other area was so good.    Little things like local musicians playing in the main lobby each evening. Very talented and well produced with good accoustics all made for a lovely interlude.    I'm not very good at handing out 5 stars and generally feel that has to mirror perfection. No it wasn't perfect but as near as makes no odds.    Other people have written more than enough about the facilities and they are as good as they have described. The adult pool was the only one we used and it was superb with wonderful service.    So would we go back? That's the ultimate test. Yes we would.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: richard R wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Text: We finished an 11 day Abercrombie and Kent Morocco Tour here. A gorgeous hotel with superior and caring service. Spacious rooms with large terraces and a beautiful open to the sky lobby. As close to perfect as possible.

Review_Date: michael m wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Text: This is one of the best hotels we have ever had the pleasure to visit.  All the staff are so attentive and politewith real knowledge of all the local surroundings.  We also were upgraded to a premier pavillion room which was just lovelywith a chocolate cake and prosscco for our anniversary really great touch!  We dont normally return to hotels but have rebooked for june .  We also through the hotel booked a great driver called Charath who took us to the atlas mountains where we stopped of at Richard Bransons hotel and had a look arround his beautiful hotel and had a drink at the bar where we glanced over to see the man himself sitting 10 feet away having lunch! very surreal so all i can say is visit this oasis in marakesh you will not be disappointed!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Barry C wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Title: A couple of days of luxury
Review_Text: We stayed here for 3 nights as a short getaway break. From the moment you arrive you realise that there is nothing to small that they can do for you. Reception staff sorted early breakfast excellent restaurant recommendations and reservations. We had booked a balloon trip (worth doing) and a guide for the city before leaving and both were excellent on time and a must do. Individual staff at the bars restaurants and the spa were always accommodating friendly and helpful. The room was very comfortable bed sheets and pillows amazing. Pool was lovely with glasses cleaned complimentary sun cream hats towels books and anything you wanted in food or drink. Spa was a real luxury pamper.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Unusually I found it hard to fault this hotel where we just spent 5 nights with our 2 year old. Excellent service all round. A few of the best features for us were:    - The friendly staff  - Excellent kids club  - Lovely pools - one for adults one for kids  - The quality of food - a special mention for their meatball 'Crackpot'  - The superb breakfast buffet and dining area.  - The high speed wifi.  - The airport transfer (big Mercedes vans)    We went to Dubai for winter sun at the same time last year (One&Only Royal Mirage) and preferred Morocco - not least because you don't get a nose bleed when it comes to settle the bill!    Well done Four Seasons.    Only one slight negative - the sofa and chairs in our suite were starting to look a bit tired and the telly was a bit old. Probably time for a refresh.

Review_Date: Nasir H wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Text: One of the best resorts we have ever stayed in! We stayed in the Villas had a suite and had a fantastic time! The Moorish Gardens all around was very pretty!  The staff at every level were outstanding!  Everyone went out of their way to make us feel very special and make our stay very comfortable! The rooms were impeccable and the decor impressive. The quality of the food was outstanding.  The guide given to us from the hotel Mr Aziz Elmansouri was brilliant in every way.  He is extremely knowledgeable very well connected and got us into excellent restaurants that require reservations weeks ahead of time. His attention to detail including making sure our children were well taken care of during the tours in the Medina was commendable !  Overall there are not enough stars to rate this hotel!

Review_Date: Andy J wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Text: I had the pleasure of staying at this lovely hotel this week. The facilities were excellent and the stay were extremely attentive. It was 5/6 minutes in a taxi to the medina. After a terrible experience at the Riad Africa it was so refreshing to check in here and finally relax. I would highly recommend the fours seasons in marrakech to anybody.

Review_Title: Excellent service, incredible resort, beautiful setting....
Review_Text: My husband and I flew to Marrakech in February for a short getaway from the London winter...If you want to get away and have a worry free vacation we would highly recommend the Four Seasons Marrakech.    Our room was beautiful- with a wonderful view of the hotels gardens and pool. A personalized welcome note from the General Manager Mr. Montandon was on the table upon arrival with a lovely fruit plate- it was a wonderfully warm welcome. Mohammed the Duty Manager greeted us upon arrival with a smile and whenever he saw us ensured to ask about our stay.    While at the hotel we met the Director of Operations Pierre- he introduced himself to us as he wanted to ensure that all was going well- throughout our stay he continuously greeted us when he saw us in the different outlets. I noticed he was constantly introducing himself to all the guests- at the pool at the restaurants in the lobby... he did such a wonderful job at making all guests feel welcomed and special.    The housekeeping staff did a fantastic job not only in cleaning the rooms but turndown. The rooms were beautifully appointed as well as serviced.    We had dinner at the Italian restaurant and both Tarik our server and Fernandino the restaurant manager were incredibly attentive and the dinner service was wonderful. Our glasses were never empty and at one point Fernandino noticed I was having trouble cutting my food- he instantly brought me a sharper knife without my needing to ask.    Our overall experience was relaxing and wonderful- a big thank you to the entire staff.    We will definitely be returning!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Eduardo Machado wrote a review Mar 2018
Review_Text: From the arrival at the hotel including reservation in restaurants (suggested by them) and even the transportation everything just perfect. I would Suggest YACOULT Café POST Jad Mahal a visit to the souks and if you wnat to go to desert (3 days) you must use the services of Morocco Private Tours (google Hassan there). Good luck
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Luxury Retreat. Short of Perfect, but Good Recovery by the Hotel.
Review_Text: It is a gorgeous resort located about a 10 minute drive from the airport and about 10 minutes by car from the Medina. A nice escape from the busy center and it really feels a world away from the city and definitely delivered on a relaxing luxury vacation. There were a few misses by the hotel but they recovered quickly and to our satisfaction. In the end we had a wonderful time and the hotel catered to our every need and wish in true Four Season's style.    Communication with the hotel in advance of our trip was confusing due to some inaccuracies and inconsistencies in the messages from the hotel related to transportation and fast-track service options. We were very diligent to follow-up and clarify which I would recommend in a similar situation. It did lead to some moments of anxiety in advance of the trip. I highly recommend requesting the fast-track service for arrival and departure through immigration as the traditional lines were very long and the fast-track allowed our family to go through a private line and reduced waiting times by approximately 90 minutes. Even with fast-track it is still required to wait in a line to have bags scanned after baggage claim but this line moved quickly. The service is also available on departure which is also recommended. If you have lounge access from an airline or priority pass the lounge option is not necessary. We had one issue on arrival that the driver was late and had the wrong carseats but he was able to fix the carseat situation in less than 3 minutes which was a nice recovery.    The hotel is beautiful and the lobby area restaurant is built to feel like a Rhiad with removable roof over the center courtyard. There was mint tea upon arrival at the entry and beverages (hibiscus in 1 room and cold mint in another) dates local pastries and a fruit bowl in our rooms. Check-in was completely painless. The room was fully stocked with necessities for our family including a baby bathtub children's toiletry items and child sized bathrobes and slippers. The room was large and the outdoor terrace space was very nice. The fruit bowl was refilled daily and there was ample tea and coffee in the room (and available in the lobby) each day. The pools (adult and family) were both lovely with very attentive staff. The family pool is very well designed with multiple sections of different depths (including a section where toddlers can stand) and includes heated section (covered at night) which made late winter swimming possible. We didn't use it but there was also a slightly warmer family area (hot tub like area) heated to approx 30 C where many families were relaxing. Child-sized lounge pillows were available at the pool as well. The Kids Club is for children 4+ but younger children are allowed with parent supervision. The schedule varied each day but it seemed that most of the activities were in the afternoon. Children <5 eat free in the restaurants and at the pool (with the purchase of adult food) but this was inconsistently applied at the restaurants and we spent time at departure to remove charges that shouldn't have been applied. In the end the hotel removed them without a fuss but they shouldn't have occurred and we shouldn't have needed to bring it to the attention of staff.    The hotel is relatively isolated so you will need to plan to take transportation if you would like to leave the hotel. The hotel restaurants are lovely but expensive as you would expect. Items are available on the dinner menu for >190 MAD and breakfast is 350 MAD. The breakfast buffet includes a wide variety of European/American options local pastries omelets and pancakes. A full menu is available as are local specialties. We particularly enjoyed the 2 types of tagines breakfast soups and mint tea. They were thrilled that we were interested in local specialties and more than happy to bring anything we desired.    Overall a very special and wonderful resort for our visit to Marrakech as a family. The staff were responsive and lovely and although there were some small flaws the hotel recovered quickly and we would definitely visit again.

We have just come back from a 6 night stay at this hotel and whilst we thoroughly enjoyed it there were a few niggles which prevented us from having the expected 5 star experience.  First the good: the hotel is beautiful all the common areas the rooms the grounds all understated Moroccan style very tasteful and very comfortable. We stayed as a family of four in a lovely two bedroom suite with a plunge pool. The surroundings were calm and tranquil no intrusive noise from anywhere despite the fact it is a large hotel close to the main road and just ten minutes from the airport. Quiet and effective air conditioning and a ceiling fan meant we were very comfortable at all times.  On checking in we were greeted in our room with drinks plates of traditional pastries and sweetmeats and a large bowl of fruit. A kitchen area provided tea coffee and plenty of complimentary bottled water.  Breakfast was included in the rate and was a superb buffet every day with plenty of choice - pastries fruit cold meats and cheeses egg bacon etc. plus a pancake and crepe station and omelette station.    Now the not so good:  Service was very erratic. Some of the staff were excellent others not so much. Although the breakfast buffet was fantastic what they don't tell you is that there is also an a la carte menu available with items such as Eggs Benedict. Not once were we offered this menu and it was only because on the second morning I saw a couple on a neighbouring table being served Eggs Benedict that I realised this menu must exist. I asked and one was produced however when my order arrived it was almost cold so I stuck to the buffet after that. The first morning we were offered juice and I asked for one of their "detox" juices. I was told that I could get one from the bar inside. After I'd returned to my table I saw the same juices being delivered to another table by a waiter. Another morning we asked for three different juices and they brought everyone orange juice. Tea was requested a couple of times and just didn't appear.  There are three restaurants - Inara (multinational cuisine) Azzera (pool bar open for lunch until 5pm) and Quattro (Italian and where breakfast is also served). Apart from Azzera where we had two really excellent meals the food was decidedly average most of the time. We did have a couple of good meals in Quattro (pork belly was good as was the ravioli) but chicken legs with crispy skin turned out to be flattened leg meat topped with (soft) breadcrumbs and linguine a la vongole was bland and swimming in cream (which doesn't belong in a proper vongole). The other thing that rankled was that when we asked for a red wine recommendation the waiter gave a name and said he would get it for us to try. When I asked him which one it was on the menu he pointed to the most expensive bottle there (about £70).We refused it and made our own choice. In fact the best wine we had there was a local vin gris (rosé) which was organic and once of the cheapest available at less than half the price of the one recommended.  Other niggles - when we arrived there was a leaflet listing the week's activities. We arrived Saturday night and the list went up until the next day (Sunday). The list was not replaced with the updated one before we left (despite the fact that I saw current ones behind the desk when we checked out). There is no book of hotel information - i.e.. services restaurant info etc. which is common in almost every hotel I've ever stayed in.  When we checked out the bill had all sorts of charges on it that were incorrect. On our first morning at breakfast a waiter brought a bill over which had full charges for 4 breakfasts. I queried this as I'd thought that breakfast was included. He confirmed that it was so I said that the bill should have zero charge and that we weren't going to sign it as it was. He brought a supervisor across who said that was just how they did it and that we wouldn't be charged. To be certain we crossed through the charges every morning before signing however when we got our final bill on checkout breakfast had been charged every day. After a conversation the charges were removed and a new bill printed out. We then checked it again and discovered that there were other charges to room services and restaurants on a day that we had been out of the hotel all day. These were subsequently removed but the whole checkout process took longer than it should have done. Particularly as I had called ahead to let them know we would be checking out and asked them to get the bill ready...In fact in every other 5 start hotel I've stayed in (and I've stayed in many all over the world) the bill up to that point is usually delivered to the room the night before checkout so that it can be checked at leisure.  There were other small negatives but this review is already long enough! So in summary a beautiful hotel and with more staff training and better chefs in the two main restaurants it could be exceptional but it's not quite there.

Four seasons hotel    A truly magnificent hotel with everything that you hope for from a four seasons hotel.    The accommodation is excellent comfortable beds and good facilities the adult pool is good with a nice pool side restaurant serving good food  service always good.    The gym has new modern equipment with a full service spa.    Restaurants on site are good with the Italian  offering a good menu and generally excellent service   Breakfast service is a little weak but overall a great place that I will be back later in the year .

Review_Title: As a family we all enjoyed it.
Review_Text: we liked it because us parents could have peace while the younger kids can have fun in a nice kids club and the teenagers also have a nice place with pool table  wii computers to use at their leisure older kids dont need to check in or out. If you happen to stay without kids  you wont have any issue as there is an adult only large pool with loungers. The place is large and calm never noticed a city outside... service was everywhere top.

We’ve just returned from a 6 night stay at the Four Seasons Resort Marrakech. Overall it was great but I can’t give it a top score because there were a few failings that are unacceptable in a ‘Luxury Resort’ (their description) and considering the cost.    First of all our pre-arranged transfer to the hotel did not turn up. They put this right immediately and we didn’t have to wait too long as the hotel is very close to the airport. Housekeeping was a little inconsistent and I had to resort to leaving notes to make sure they left what we needed. I had to call them twice before they finally delivered something I had run out of in the room. On at least 2 occasions we did not have our room prepared for the evening. Our fruit bowl was not topped up daily and on the last night they seemed to give up completely and we ran out of bottled water. Given that we were recommended not to drink tap water this was a bit of a disaster.    However the staff were absolutely delightful and did go above and beyond to help especially at the pool and at the concierge desk.

Review_Title: Outstanding service in oasis of calm
Review_Text: Here for 3 night break to thaw out from cold / rain / mud in England. An oasis of calm and 10min taxi back into the souks and cultural mayhem that is Jemaa El-Fnaa. Expensive but wonderful service nothing is too much trouble. Rooms are large and immaculate Pool is beautiful not at all busy and great little snacks and drinks keep appearing. Temperature perfect in the day cool in the evening. Thank you for a lovely relaxing break.

Review_Date: susan j wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Text: Our first visit to this Hotel - although we have been to Marrakech many times. It is a gem. It’s five minutes by car from the centre of Marrakech but as a result it is very tranquil.  From the moment we stepped out of our Taxi we were treated royally by every member of staff we met.  Hanane on the Concierge Desk was our main contact (although her colleagues were all brilliant too). She took care of all restaurant bookings Taxis advice on tours etc etc. Extremely efficient. Pierre Kermanac’h was a hands on Director. Lots of good advice. Also great welcome from Jihane Barehmi (or Jane as we called her). Lovely welcome card from the General Manager Blaise Montandon and Brahmin Aboumounir in our room 210 (corner location overlooking pool).  Youssef the IT person was very helpful in setting up our iPad/iPhone. A very patient person.    The facilities at the Hotel are great. We spent time at the heated “ quiet pool” - there is a family pool too. The pool staff come around with delicious goodies - smoothie lollies fruit etc. Iced water. Just what you need.  The Gym is well equipped and peaceful. Lovely outdoor area if you want to stretch or practice Yoga on your own.  It was chilly our first day so we sat by a log fire in one of the sitting rooms drinking Moroccan mint tea. Reading their lovely books. Perfect.  Hanane organised Youssef to drive us up to the Atlas Mountains in the Range Rover one day. Wonderful trip. A good driver and a good guide.  It’s a very efficient Hotel with a calm relaxed atmosphere. Tranquil stylish decor.  Breakfast out on the Terrace is a great way to start the day. Lots of cooked breakfast choices including pancakes omelettesetc. - all cooked to order but the cold breakfast lacks exciting choices. It is a bit basic. More fruit choices and cereals yoghurts etc would be good.    We loved our stay and felt really refreshed by the time we left there. Nowadays “service” isn’t something companies seem to value but the Four Seasons has nailed it. Fabulous holiday.    Places to visit - the new Yves Saint Laurent Museum. A wonderful display of his work a lovely Cafe and a chic Shop. Buy a combined ticket with the Jardin Majorelle.    See inside the Theatre Royal. Looks finished from the outside but the Caretaker will show you the inside which is taking 2 years to renovate. Very interesting.

Review_Date: Allison H wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Title: Beautiful hotel with a couple of issues
Review_Text: Just returned from a very enjoyable stay at the Four Seasons. The hotel is gorgeous and our suite (330) was lovely and big with ample room for a family of four - two bathrooms large balcony and the most comfy bed ever - pillows like clouds. Breakfast was great - try the crepes and pancakes and the omelettes and the juices from the bar! Five stars also for the pools kids club and young adult centre with its cinema and bank of computers - it gave me time to head off into the centre to do my shopping without having to worry about my kids disappearing off while I was haggling. I loved that they also thought of details such as providing factor 50 suncream and hats.    What really got at me though was that the hotel colludes in a taxi scam of ripping off its clients. Taxis charge 50dirham from the hotel to the medina as a flat charge (even if they have just dropped someone off) and won't put the meter on. This is illegal - taxis are required to use the meter ("le compteur"). When I took taxis from the djna el fnaa back to the hotel with a meter it cost me 15 dirham in the day and 22 at night (night surcharge). When I challenged the staff at the security/drop off point why they collude with this practice they couldn't see the problem. Four Seasons shouldn't encourage this scam. Once I knew what it was meant to cost I just gave the driver the money - which caused a lot of unpleasantness from them. I know that I'm only talking about being ripped off by about £5 or so but it's the principle that is wrong.    My other gripe is that there is no guest info folder in the room telling you times for breakfast pools check out etc. I found out from reading reviews of the hotel on tripadvisor (on our last day alas) that the hotel provides a free shuttle to the medina every day from 6pm. Would have saved me a lot of grief and money to know this.    The shop is a total rip off. I bought a bracelet for £130 that I found was £65 online (Loel & co).    Check your bill when you check out - I was charged 65dirham for ordering a small jug of fresh milk to my room for a cup of tea which is a real cheek when I'm paying £4000 for a week.    I hope I have saved readers some money. Apart from these very annoying rip-offs it is a gorgeous hotel and we had a lovely week there. It's a perfect place to stay if you have children. If I wasn't travelling with the kids I'd probably stay in one of the posh central riads instead.

Review_Title: The perfect Winter Sun break for families
Review_Text: I stayed at Four Seasons Marrakech with my daughter in the February half-term and loved everything about our stay here. The staff are all fantastic particularly the Kids Club where my daughter was kept well entertained with a variety of different sporty and arty things to do each day plus kids only parties in the evenings.    The heated outdoor pool is brilliant for February when it's still too cold to swim in the unheated pools.    The room was spacious and the bed was incredibly comfortable. Breakfast had an amazing choice of freshly squeezed juices cooked breakfasts and fresh fruit bread etc. We dined one evening at Inara which was great and we loved the musicians that played each evening.    The hotel's courtesy car is handy to get to and from restaurants in the evening. We visited the Buddha Bar which is very nearby at the Menara Mall and well worth a visit.    Very much looking forward to staying here again soon!

Had a great stay here. Located 5 mins from the airport and 5 mins from the old city.  Nice rooms and pool.  The breakfast could be better it felt a bit small.  Staff very friendly. I recommend doing the Atlas mountains tour if you visit during jan/feb as they are snowed.

Review_Date: S C wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Text: Our choice for staying here made our trip much better. The service was amazing with the most friendly staff in all areas. Highly recommend. It’s a beautiful resort and the food was excellent in all their 3 restaurants.  One of our most favourite hotels now.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Villy J wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Text: How many Miles can you Drive in a golfcar and how many high fives can you get when you is 3 years old - more than you ever Dream of when you are at Four Seasons in Marrakesh. Best week for our soon. Kids Club  heated Pools very Child friendly staff.

Review_Date: Puneet J wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Text: We stayed At the four seasons to celebrate my sister in laws 40th birthday. There were 10 couples and the hotel was perfect for us. The pool was exceptional with great service to match. Breakfast was also good with a great celebration. The best part of any four seasons though is there beds and in particular their pillows!!! Look forward to coming back here again!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Russell N wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Text: Simply stunning hotel with beautiful rooms which have great views of the Atlas Mountains fabulous service  great facilities and superb food ( the breakfast is superb ) and the Italian restaurant is exceptional ( if you are visiting Marrakech and love Italian Food this is the place to eat)....Doesn’t get much better than this!RN

Review_Date: Yon S wrote a review Feb 2018
