Review_Title: On top of all the quality and warmful service
Review_Text: Marrakech surpreended my wife and myself by the clean of the streets and the safety feeling.    The Four Seasons offered a such level of service outer its premises such as tour guides concierge advisoring and transportation that made our stay phenomenal.    The hotel by itself is just spetacular.    Leila Aziz the tour guide the Azuzi driver and other members of the staff deserves to be cited.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Joey P wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Text: Me and my boyfriend went for 5 days and stayed here and it really does keep you away from the hustle and bustle of Marrakesh. The staff were amazing all the way from checking in to getting picked up to go back to the UK. The staff were very helpful polite attentive. They always asked if there's anything else they could do for us. Our rooms got cleaned 2-3 times a day which I've never experienced before. Overall the service is FIRST class which was expected from Four Seasons. We were treated like VIPs!    The rooms were very spacious and had everything you need. Only thing I didn't see was an iron and ironing board maybe you needed to request for that. The beds were very comfortable and the bath was very deep which is very good for relaxing in.  The coffees and teas were topped up twice a day which is great as both of us love coffee and tea. When we went the weather wasn't very hot but we still managed to get a tan because of the balcony in our room and the sun was always facing us every morning and it felt like 25 degrees when outside is only 13. I think we just got lucky on this one. But yeah it was quite cold so a jacket was needed!    We had breakfast included in our room and I would say that the breakfast is very good. There was a good selection of food for everyone to enjoy. A lot of nice pastries as I could imagine that its influenced by the french they are very tasty! The fruit was so sweet and can I just point out that the freshly squeezed orange juice is just amazing there!    The pool was heated but was still a little bit too cold to go swimming but the jacuzzi was fine.    The ate at all the restaurants the food was ok wasn't too bad I think that's what they need to improve on. Otherwise me and my boyfriend had a lovely experience! We would definitely recommend this hotel and we would consider to stay again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Brian M wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Text: The hotel was first class and we were treated like royalty by the friendly and highly knowledgeable staff. They provided us with great restaurants and tours. They make sure you have fun but ensure that you are always safe.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: we were there for a friends birthday if you are going in a group then you need to inform them that you need rooms together.  the breakfast is good one should always get it included in the package value for money.  Spa is also a must try.

We booked this hotel through British Airways holidays and sadly missed our UK flight out therefore arriving a day late . The hotel extended our stay by an extra night ( it was low season ) free of charge so we all could enjoy our original planned 4 night break  The hotelis just over 6 years old and is only 5 minutes in a taxi outside of the Old City . The grounds are stunning ( feels a little like the Jumeirah Al Qasr hotel in Dubai ) with a lovely entrance and arrival  The hotel has three pools and a fabulous pool restaurant where we ate most days outstanding food with great service  We visited the traditional best hotels at La Mamounia ( poor ) and the Royal Mansour and although beautiful old traditional buildings  The Four season resort is better more relaxed informal yet smart and impressive . The bars and restaurants are lovely and the support team are superb throughout  Our rooms were on the first floor with great balconies overlooking the adult pool and are lovely  A problem with our water supply to the rooms was quickly compensated by Jihane our resident manager with a complimentary lunch around the pool and hotel car into the city one night which was very kind of the hotel  This is the best hotel in Marrakech from our experiences and strongly recommended for a luxury break with 4 out of 5 days sunbathing in late January !

An entrance that lets you know you have arrived and it continues through your entire visit. The staff was incredible. Flowers amazing. Breakfast was scrumptious. I was sorry that we left to visit Marrakesh - not really.

Review_Date: Sasa N wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Text: My last stay at Four Seasons Prague was major disappointment so I was really looking forward to this stay and Four Seasons Resort Marrakech for sure did not disappoint. Excellent service and hospitality. Nice spacious and clean rooms with lovely and authentic Moroccan toiletries. Two large outdoor heated pools and hot tubs are great spa is also very nice with all the amenities you need. Breakfast was very good as was the food in Quattro and Inara restaurants. If I have to complain about something is the price of beverage... especially alcohol prices are very steep but this is obviously quite a common thing in Morocco.  Highly recommended if you are looking for luxury retreat in Marrakech.

We decided to go to Four Season because is always a guarantee!  And we did a right choice!  I do not remember the name of all the people who work there but they were all very nice.  Starting from Magdy and Leila at the reception desk that upgrade us in a Garden view room at our arrival to Badr who help us with all the excursions.  Housekeeping was exceptional!  Room always clean neat and tidy.  The door man always kind and with a smile!  Breakfast buffet very well assorted! Must try the pan cake!  The hotel is not in the very center but is 5 minutes taxi away...maybe better for those who like to stay in a quite place.  If you want to have a tour guide ask them for Aziz! They work with him and he’s the best!!! Fun prepared fast honest and very good photographer!  The only thing if I can say it is that the ambiente of the hotel were a little bit cold.  Even in the room the heat was not warm as I like...  Anyway highly recommend!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sally M wrote a review Feb 2018
Review_Text: Peace and quiet away from the old city bustle. There is a courtesy bus service which can drop you inside the old city walls so you can go and discover the sights sounds and smells of this wonderful place.  Ground floor room 115 is on a corner very close to the main building in early February when it’s quiet this is fine but I would think it could be noisy when the hotel is busy. Beds are comfortable and the rooms spacious and well equipped. The staff are absolutely fantastic and very helpful and courteous at all times especially poolside and front of house. Breakfast is a buffet service with delights for all everything you could wish for and very tasty. Beautiful freshly squeezed juice cooked to order pancakes crepes eggs omelettes what more do you need? It is a little pricey but you do get what you pay for.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is a truly 5* hotel!  Great staff nice atmosphere. Very clean rooms. Nice pool area one suitable for kids and another for adults only.  Pretty pricy to get a drink...  Great staff!  The driver we had for 2 days was fantastic!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: j h wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Text: This is a lovely place if only the food would be better. The best food is served at the Pool Side but they close at 5pm that's a shame. They used to have a roof top bar but unfortunately they have closed it. Staff is very very friendly and the place is well managed .....but the food could and should be better!

Review_Title: 5 Star Luxury with still an Authentic Moroccan Experience
Review_Text: The Four Seasons Marrakech never fails to disappoint. We have stayed in numerous Four Seasons around the world and the standards upheld by the property are exceptional. Fantastic service was provided by Hanan and Pierre both whom were incredibly helpful and an asset to the Four Seasons. An incredibly personalised service with great attention to detail.    Rooms: We had booked two rooms both of which were located next door to each other. The interior was decorated very tastefully with a seperate walk in wardrobe a large bathroom with his and hers sink. The shower was also great and a number of branded toiletries are provided by the Four Seasons. The bed pillows mattress and linen was incredibly soft and great to sleep in.    Breakfast: The breakfast was beyond our expectations. The juices on offer as well as the selection of buffet options (including authentic moroccan breakfast dishes) all tasted great! More importantly the eggs were cooked to perfection (not over done and rubbery). For me the breakfast is the most important meal of the day and I could not be more happy with the selection put out by the Four Seasons.    Spa: The spa facilities were real 5 star luxury. The most soft slippers and bathrobes provided with exceptional staff who make you feel relaxed and calm. It was one of the best massages yet! The jacuzzi and steam rooms were immaculately clean.    Pools and Grounds: Most pretty and scenic views around the hotel with views of Atlas Mountains in the distance. An open log fire around the hotel in the evenings lit with candles and fresh roses. There are numerous pools with amenities provided such as fresh soft towels sun cream and great pool side food and drinks.    Thank you Four Seasons Marrakech for another memorable stay!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sheelagh K wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Text: Outstanding service in a peaceful environment. Staff are the best of any Four Seasons we have stayed at. Lovely choice of pools and while the distance to the Medina is a little far they do offer complimentary transport into town for dinner one way.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: What I believe sets apart this hotel for me is the level of service afforded. No usual misunderstandings of the requests or delays in delivering them. Staff helpful at all times. Reception area at times understaffed and welcome drinks patchy but as we settled we didn't notice any shortcomings. The hotel could do with a facelift but generally four seasons standards still apply.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Great place heated pools kid friendly and the spa is amazing! It’s also right outside the city walls only a 10 minute drive into the Médina but still far enough away to have a quite night. The food at the restaurants were amazing!

Review_Date: lee g wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Text: Stayed in December for a last minute getaway. Me and my partner stayed for a week. The hotel and grounds are impeccably clean. Food offerings are good but slightly limited for the size of the hotel. I know it is a quiet retreat but my only real downside is the lack of any 'vibe' in the bar area. The complimentary car service took us to more lively venues when required and I would be more than happy to return to this lovely hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Cornelia M wrote a review Jan 2018
Review_Title: Magical Marrakesh - and wonderful Four Seasons Hotel
Review_Text: My husband and I and our adult daughter spent five days in Marrakesh in January 2018. Our stay at the Four Seasons was great and made our short holiday really special. From arrival to departure the hotel was simply a pleasure. We had a comfortable Suite (312) in the Main Building with great views of the gardens and the Atlas Mountains. Our large terrace was nice to sunbathe and read to have family chats or to enjoy breakfast or tea. The living and bedrooms were beautifully furnished and comfortable. The swimming pools were excellent for long swims and the lush gardens very inviting for leisurely walks. The hotel has a lovely spa. The hotel lobby has a welcoming ambiance. We enjoyed the meals at the pool restaurant with international and local cuisine. The hotel staff were superb without exception. We found them professional competent and polite.  On the day of our departure we had evening flights back to Geneva and London. The hotel offered us complementary late check out which allowed us to fully enjoy the last day of our holiday.  We will be back in Marrakesh and we will be back at the Four Seasons.

A good hotel with friendly staff. The hotel was fairly quite although we had been told it was fully booked. Exactly what you expect when you book to stay at a Four Seasons Hotel - friendly staff good facilities & good food. This hotel is well situated for the airport and central  Marrakech. However having stayed in this city previously (in a Riad the heart of the Medina) I’d recommend that if your looking for a spot of luxury in a busy city then this is a good option but it does lack a certain something that the Riads and hotels within the walls have in abundance - the true feel of This wonderful city.

Our stay was fantastic. We traveled with our 8 month old son and the hotel surprised us in our room with a great baby crib a baby bath with all bath products even diapers and a baby changing mat. The staff was always smiling and wiling to help. The room was gorgeous and the food fantastic. We will for sure come back!

We had a great time thanks to the wonderful help of the GM and the Deputy GM. Both are very much present throughout the day and they try their utmost to make your stay flawless. I much appreciated their help in finding special restaurants beyond the list of "usual suspects". A big thank-you to the staff as well all were really friendly and service oriented which may seem obvious for hotels at this level but unfortunately this is not always the case... here it was. Thank you again we will return!

The team at Four Seasons Marrakech did an excellent job making our stay a remarkable one during the very busy NYE tourist season. An excellent job done by all and a special nod to Rashid and Mohammed at the pool!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Excellent service. Especially the staff at pool side. We enjoyed our stay in Four Seasons Resort Marrakech very well. The breakfast is good maybe more selection could be provided. During the Christmas it is a good place to relax.

As two women travelling alone the Four Seasons in Marrakesh was the perfect choice. The service particularly the concierge and front office staff were excellent. Restaurants tours and guides were arranged and tailor made to suit our needs. The hotel is an oasis of tranquility in the buzzing city of Marrakech with beautiful gardens a lovely pool and excellent restaurants. Highly recommend it.

One of the unforgettable moments I had in Morroco is my stay at Four Seasons. I have been before in Merrakesh but different hotel it was really bad memories. This visit was amazing because all the staff at the four seasons are AMAZING. The priorety is the guest satisfaction. All are working to keep us happy and satisfied. I would like to thank MsJihan Yasmin Fatima khadija and AbuAlhassan.

We took a five day break at the Four Seasons in Marrakech for Christmas. Our overall experience was excellent.  On the down side the prices for food and drinks are a bit on the high side. During our stay the hotel was a little on the quiet side which had its pluses. However it lacked some real festive atmosphere.  But overall excellent.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Amazing hotel great service. good food.  best hotel by far. best location.  private.  you get what you pay for.    Benn in many 5 start places but this is brand which is by far at the top.    Breakfast was great and rooms were lovely.    comfortable slippers and great bar.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Lovely hotel good facilities and very helpful staff. Nice to have a quiet pool and a separate children's pool. Spa was also very good albeit a bit expensive (like the hotel however it was the Christmas period).

The minute we walked into the Four Seasons we were instantly impressed. The property is stunning...the pool was the most beautiful we have ever seen. The weather was mild enough to sit out and take in the sights of the property and Atlas mountains. A must is a trip to the spa. We all had excellent massages and enjoyed the hot tubs steam room and saunas. The staff are true professionals. Their attention to detail was superb. I've stayed at other Four Seasons over the years and this is the most impressive. Many thanks to Pierre Kermanac'h Hanna and Souheil. We could not say enough about how kind and professional they are. Our sincerest appreciation.

We really enjoyed our stay here very relaxing. Lovely hotel clean spacious and the staff were very hospitable. Great buffet breakfast and nice restaurants. I would definitely consider staying here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Excellent stay, close to Medina but tranquil and peaceful
Review_Text: We stayed for 4 nights with the children. Our room was enormous plenty of space for 4 of us to stay comfortably. The family pool area was great with attentive staff and nice treats served through the day. The spa was very good. The restaurants served a good mix of different cuisines and went to great efforts to keep the kids happy. We toured the souk with a guide provided by the hotel who was extremely knowledgable and made the experience very worthwhile. We also enjoyed a camel riding excursion.    What really set this place apart was the management. We had a few problems - mix up with an excursion booked through the hotel some towel cleanliness issues and a temporary nasty smell right by the room (blocked drain). The manager personally dealt with us and couldn’t have been more helpful and accommodating. His professionalism shone through and it clearly permeates all the staff we dealt with. It makes a real difference and we appreciated it.

Review_Date: Danielle B wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Text: It was a very good hotel and excellent service. The only average thing was the location. It wasn’t in the center but the hotel itself is beautiful. Has everything you need the staff was very helpful and very secure hotel

The resort is huge but you don‘t feel or recognize this.  The meeting facilities are equipped fine internet could be bit quicker but was fast enough.  The service provided during my meeting was excellent very quick reaction to changed agenda every need was served immediately big thumbs up.    The standard rooms are ok a bit of dissapointment is there‘s only nespresso machines provided in the suites. Normal rooms offer water kettles only.  Turn-down service is good only because the provided water bottles decreased from day to day. The cleaning was done every day at the same high standard only on the first day I could recognize that it was done by an especially dedicated person who arranged my cosmetics in neat groupings. Very nice welcome this put a big smile on my face.    The breakfast area is beautiful the breakfast buffet offers all you could wish for. Only the coffee needs to be improved. The cappucino is served at such a hot temperature that one needs to wait at least further ten minutes to be able to drink.    I‘ve only visited the adult pool which is beautiful. The sunbeds and umbrellas are provided immediately. The bar service could be bit quicker - you tend do be thirstier in the sun.    All in all perfect stay for my group but honestly I don‘t consider the official room rates reasonable.

Review_Date: Beata C wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Text: I visited with my daughter in July and had a fabulous time. Despite a couple of glitches which included a mix up in the turn down service and meals in room service the hotel compensated for these right away. The highlights at this resort a definitely the kids club and spa. The daily variety in activities was thoroughly entertaining for my daughter and I was confident she was very well taken care of. The massages are some of the best I’ve had!  I wouldn’t stay anywhere else in Marrakech.

Review_Title: My stay at the four Seasons Resort Marrakech
Review_Text: The staff at the reception breakfast restaurant and Spa were amazing. The atmosphere of the property was charming and wonderful. The room was very spacious with a large shower and large terrace. The room included everything we could need.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I booked Four Seasons for our first family holiday to Morocco after reading that riads would not be the most suitable choice with small children. A few days before departing some of the negative reviews concerned me a little but there was no reason to be. Having now become familiar with the city I'm very glad I didn't book a riad. Four Seasons was the perfect choice a beautiful resort away from the hustle and bustle of the old city allowing us to relax after a day of sightseeing. The staff were friendly and helpful. The kids club by the family pool is lovely and the young adults room is also a great addition with a pool table table tennis foosbool and vg consoles.    I highly recommend the spa and I wish I had time for more treatments. Access to the sauna and jacuzzi is complimentary which I wish I had known sooner!    We didn't breakfast at the hotel as we preferred to explore the many options in Marrakech but if you want to get out straight to sightseeing and not have to worry about food it would be the ideal way to fill up until the afternoon. We ordered room service on a number of occasions and the food and service are what you would expect from a hotel of this standard. We ate at Inara one evening the restaurant settings are beautiful but as others have said the menu offerings are somewhat lacklustre (this is just a comment not a criticism).  It's a shame that the Zest Bar was closed perhaps because of the time of the year. We went up to the rooftop area to take some photos and it would have been an enchanting place to have a drink if open.    Due to the location of the resort you will need to take a taxi to get anywhere. It may seem like you can walk but it wouldn't be advised if you have children however that's the case in general in terms of getting around Marrakech.    If you can extend your trip a few days beyond what you require to explore Marrakech and tours if you are doing any so you can relax and enjoy the resort itself!

Review_Title: Great Resort but do your own tour research
Review_Text: We loved the resort facilities themselves. It is a beautiful building well maintained and the staff are polite. It was a birthday treat for me and we were upgraded which was very good of the management. Where we would like to give feedback is on the tours arranged by the hotel. Due to them being about three to four times the price of a self arranged tour one has high expectations. We selected the tour of the Medina where the guide showed us the highlights of the Medina area. We found him lacking in knowledge in some areas but very well practised and motivated in taking us to certain shops in the hope of a purchase of a rug or lantern at extremely high prices. We felt as though we were being treated as walking cash machines. Even the restaurant he suggested turned out to be a flop. It served bland Harissa soup and extremely fatty lamb. We let him go after 2 hours out of 4 and made our own way around. We would stay in this hotel again without a doubt but we would do more of our own thing with respect to tours.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Beautiful property and incredibly gracious staff. From restaurants to the pool to checkin to the concierge I am impressed by everything about this resort. I have been to a lot of Four Seasons properties and this meets the exceptional brand standard. It is an oasis when visiting busy Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Gregory P wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Text: If you are looking for a level of heaven in the Kingdom of Morocco enjoy the oasis the Four Seasons offers guests. Escape the hustle and bustle of the old city and relax poolside or on the terrace. Time well spent.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: It is a nice resort but not really comparable to four seasons nyc or other city locations. The location is ok but you will most likely need a taxi wherever you want to go to. Taxis are cheap so  Its not a big topic.

Everything was perfect from the friendly faces the welcoming staff and of course the great atmosphere.  Leaving in the morning to see the Medina with its amazing bazar was amazing but coming back to the four seasons it felt like an oasis.  The rooms were luxurious and comfortable. I enjoy the exotic buffet that is offered every night the pool and of course you can not leave without trying the spa ( hammam treatment) you will feel 10 Year’s younger.    I highly recommend this Four Season.

Review_Date: David L wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Text: A very special place made by the staff. Congratulations to everyone. Rooms great food was wonderful breakfast expensive but very high quality. Nice to be surrounded by grounds rather than just buildings. Minor issues dealt with swiftly and effectively.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: The GM Mr Blaise Montandon made it unforgetaable!
Review_Text: This was my second time in FS Marrakech. The room was amazing. The service was unique - they knew me by name. The Spa was very relaxing (I had a massage). I love tanning and this hotel is ideal for it (in room balcony or on at the pool). I also love their store in the lobby where you could get immaculate items. I will go back to it soon be it for business or for holiday. Thank you every one and espicially Mr Blaise Montandon and see you all soon.

We loved our time there and would definitely go back.  The staff willing to help us with our 6m child even changing the temp of the baby pool when we asked.  The food was also much better than we expected.  Forced to critise I’ld say they should have let us know if they were going to change our babysitter for someone new which they did three times. That said it was totally understandable as we often booked late and our stay was over Ede. Also the airport transfer was over priced.  All in all we loved our stay and would def head back  W

Review_Date: francisco s wrote a review Dec 2017
Review_Text: Very nice hotel well located close to city centre. Beautiful comfortable rooms and the usual Four Seasons good service.  Extensive gardens pools spa etc.  The only downturn in my opinion is the lack of dining facilities. Other than the pool bar/restaurant for day service there is only a bar that serves some snacks and a restaurant used for breakfast (a very good one) and dinner with not enough to choose from the menu.

Review_Title: Perfect location, best service, beautiful property!
Review_Text: Situated a short drive (10 minutes) from the the old city this Marrakech oasis is the perfect resort for a relaxing Moroccan vacation. The property is spacious has gorgeous grounds is totally magical at night because it's all lit up and the service is superb. Upon entering the property everyone is so friendly and truly makes you feel so welcome. The hotel smells divine the rooms are spacious.    We booked through Wedaways (a destination wedding and honeymoon management company that also books incredible romantic getaways) and the Four Seasons was the best choice hotel for Marrakech. The hotel has taxis that are always outside and the prices are better than if you were to get on your own and bargain. They really take care of you!    The food is delicious. We ordered room service and it arrived quickly and tasted as if we were eating in a gourmet restaurant. The breakfast well the breakfast takes the cake. Totally incredible. Fresh fruits and veggies salmon omelet station juice bar and my ultimate favorite- a crepe bar! I will definitely be back on my next trip to Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Superb hotel and very nice staff. Lage pools. Delicious breakfast until 11:00 am. Excellent service - private complimentary car to take you to the center. Good gym. Very large beautiful and confortable room.

Fantastic hotel close to the airport and a short taxi to the Medina. Concierge Badr made the trip even more special with bookings and attention to detail. Champagne and cake for my girlfriends birthday was a lovely tough.Would highly recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: allison c wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Title: A Four Seasons is always nice, but this was magical
Review_Text: The staff here is so incredibly warm and welcoming. This is not a stuffy hotel - they treated our family like family. The excursions and guides were so well planned and allowed us to truly enjoy our time in Marrakech. Wonderful food drinks service and of course the grounds are beautiful. Don't miss the Hammam experience in the spa.    We were here with our teenager and could not have asked for a better stay

Review_Title: Top-notch service and a world-class pool and grounds at this superb resort
Review_Text: This is an excellent hotel / resort. The concierge desk planned high-quality excursions for us including a highly knowledgeable guide for tours within the city (ask for Aziz). The restaurants are excellent and the service welcoming -- at Quattro Laila and Mahdi made us feel like the most special people in the world. We even received small gifts to celebrate her birthday and our anniversary. The centerpiece however is the pool which is one of the most beautiful and relaxing hotel pools I've ever experienced. Pro tip: ask for a chocolate milkshake from the poolside restaurant.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nicola M wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: Loved the visit here we were so well looked after and pampered couldn't fault a thing. From the moment we arrived to the moment we left nothing was too much trouble. The place is stunningly beautiful such a pleasure.

Review_Date: Rajiv P wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: Excellent. Loved it. Staff great. Location good. Large resort.  Will visit again.  Typical for Four Seasons.  Very safe.  Trips were arranged nicely.  Have to rely on hotel to get Taxi if you really want taxi.

Review_Date: Tom S wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: Hi. Well there were no real surprises the Hotel and grounds are very pleasant.    After all it is a four seasons and across the world a successful combination of clean spacious well designed rooms and surroundings. With a similar build scheme to other four seasons. Sharm for example. The gardens are kept immaculately and the smell is amazing.    Staff are five star and the food at the pool restaurant is really good. The tagine most acceptable! We did eat however in the lobby restaurant one night the first. The food was pretty bland and for 130 gbp for two I expected a little more taste....more seasoning!!    Couple of other things that maybe the Hotel should look at. Air con control doesn’t glow when you press the button so you have to find a light if in the dark which is near enough to light the dial and not wake your partner up.    Maybe put an espresso coffee machine in the room? I like coffee and when spending a load of money on a room i don’t really expect to be drinking freeze dried regulation coffee.    Fruit was never replaced and the walls of the room had dirty marks around the switches. Again not really what you’d expect.    All in all an odd one really. Would I go back? I’m not really sure given the cost and the fact there’s a few little gremlins that need sorting. Better the devil you know or maybe go for a similar level of Hotel in Marrakech with a bit more Moroccan influence in the design and layout and see what that’s like.....hmmm. To be predictable or take a risk.......??    Thanks to all the staff. Unbelievable!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Steve G wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Title: Everything you’d expect from a Four Seasons
Review_Text: Visited on my birthday for lunch and an afternoon by the pool. Work in industry so had a show round of Hotel. Grand discreet and elegant. Nice sized rooms and suites.    Beautiful public areas gardens and pools. Food excellent.    Lovely oasis in the middle of busy Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Yvonne W wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: Our last two nights in Morocco and this Suite really luxury Two Bathrooms a bonus and the decor really spectacular. You escape here and the roses are beautifully arranged. We decided to have dinner in house and to be honest we were disappointed in the quality of the food after eating out over the six weeks we have been here. Slow service even though we were the only guests inside
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mark Saunders-Davies wrote a review Nov 2017
Review_Text: A beautiful hotel with excellent facilities and service. A real oasis of peace and quiet. The room was well equipped and decorated with a very good sized bathroom. Staff very friendly and helpful. Great health and fitness facilities too.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed at Four Seasons Marrakech for 4 nights with 10 years old child. First I thought the location was a bit far from main square but the moment we got off the taxi at the hotel my thought about the location had forgotten. Check-in to check-out everything was so smooth everyday. They did not disappoint us at all. We are already talking about going back to Marrakech and staying at Four Seasons.

Went on a ladies long weekend away for my Mother’s Birthday. We were given inter-joining room when you leave the main doors open it is like a suite. There were 5 of us. This hotel is superb in every way. Service facilities cleanliness rooms - everything! I can not fault it. Wonderful.

Review_Date: Alistair M wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: We stayed 6 nights in October 2017 - with 3 kids: 16 14 10. This was our first visit to Marrakech and we had a great time. The hotel is terrific - really well run and everyone is very friendly. They had memorised us - and for example our evening drink preferences - by Day 2. The kids pool is good - with warm and cold options. Although it was UK half-term it wasn't too busy. The weather was excellent. The hotel is a short taxi ride into Marrakech and they arranged a great dinner venue for us in the city. Our only gripe was that we weren't offered a breakfast-included option and the only option on-site was an expensive buffet - so we ended up just ordering room service breakfast for what we needed - which ended up much more cost effective. But overall we had an amazing time and we'll definitely return.

Review_Date: Davi B wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: Lovit was good to relax and enjoy the sun pool food  and good mood. Would love to come again and the shopping and bazaar was exiting and new. Can’t wait to return to this fabulous town. Thank you to all
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Amazing stay at the four seasons Marrakech this month. Staff was extremely friendly and helpful! They made our experience unforgettable! We were given an upgrade to a room with walkout to the pool. Not to mention the beautiful hotel property. The food and restaurants were excellent that we didn’t feel the need to venture out to eat. Thank you for making our stay unforgettable!!!

Review_Date: Isabel P wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: The Hotel is beautiful but is very far the location was not convenient for us  The service was not bad but not what you get in similar hotels  The rooms are very comfortable and the breakfast very good.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Deana M wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: The concierge was wonderful in arranging activities. There were some minor issues that we experienced and they immediately addressed them and made the stay incredible. It was a fantastic trip and beautiful resort.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Lovely resort hotel close to Marrakech
Review_Text: This is definitely a resort hotel and laid out over a large area. They are very family friendly and have a good pool however there is also an excellent adult pool where you are truly spoilt and looked after. The rooms are large and have Moroccan touches but also quite international in flavour although all the balconies and terraces have a Moroccan arbour with cushions. Some of the villas also have their own private dipping pools. The breakfast area has a lovely vista looking down a water feature. There are tennis courts and a well appointed gym plus plenty of space for those who want to go jogging around the extensive grounds as well as a great spa. This is an alternative for those who want to be able to visit the hustle that is Marrakesh but prefer a resort location in a slightly quieter area but still relatively accessible and has one of the best adult pools in the area.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Peter W wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Title: Four Season- there is a reason!!
Review_Text: First of all Marrakech is a fantastic destination. Modern city with culture art colors that are breathtaking. New YSL museum that is a must. Lovely people.  Hotel Four Season is for a reason our favorite hotel chain.  No matter where you are in the world it is like home but it is the home where you are.  Meaning they have the local spirit local decoration and most important of all. The Staff!! Thank your management that everybody working in your place are so nice equal and helpful in a way no other hotel chain could be near to deliver. The Hotel can be used by both families and couples and singles there is perfect settings so no one interfere in their doings. Everything is very peaceful elegant and natural. So thanks a lot for a perfect stay and congratulates to the new wonderful Italian restaurant. We will be back!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Martin L wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: We spend three nights in Four seasons Marrakech. We made trips to the overwhelming attractions of Marrakech - and when exhausted we returned for only 5 € by taxi to the Hotel. Expecially the pool area is great and the selection of Restaurants - because not every evening we wanted to dine in the medina.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Emiliano Joaqui... B wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: Great place and servicethe front desk people is extremely kind and professionals.the architecture is beautiful.We went for a wedding at the hotel and spend two nights there and everything was perfect!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: albert b wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: Bigger name on hotlerie industry in hospitality that's way I did chose four saesons  In my choice who's correct wandrfull hotel with very good views and rooms not to far from the Medina in also offre you breakfast of dreams with selections of Moroccan food  My room who's sow lovely and beautiful
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We spent a week at this hotel and it was perfect from start to finish. On check in we were upgraded to a suite and that made a huge difference to our experience. The pool staff were excellent and made the time we spent at the pool extremely enjoyable. Ice creams  smoothies and other goodies were brought round on a regular basis . Tip - check out the main pool before you settle on the adult only pool as we had it to ourselves most days as very few families were visiting .  The food in the restaurants was excellent but could maybe do with another restaurant to add a bit more variety for those on longer stays .  And finally a special thanks to Sofia who really looked after us on a couple of occasions . She is an extremely interesting lady who is very good at her job . We had a very nice afternoon on our last day chatting to her . On that note I would like to compliment the hotel on their choice of staff . Every one of them that we came into contact with were a credit to the hotel and the four seasons brand. Friendly and also most efficient at all times . From the housekeeping staff to the Gardeners to the pool guys to the management . We have nothing but good memories from our stay .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jeff B wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: We took a short honeymoon here after our wedding in Europe and enjoyed every moment. They also sent a nice treat and bottle of champagne to our room which was a wonderful surprise. Another phenomenal Four Seasons hotel stay they continue to exceed our expectations every time!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jeremy T wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: As ever this Four Seasons doesn't disappoint.    Excellent 5 star resort with specific points which might help other guests as follows:    - heated pools means hours of fun for kids  - kids club has exceptional facilities  - food options are great for all the family  - room sizes are exceptional and more than ample  - staff are always trying to make your stay as comfortable and pleasurable as possible and go the extra mile where necessary    Only criticism is that concierge could be more knowledgable.    We will definitely back as worth a 5 star rating!!

I was here for a conference but will be back for a holiday; every employee every amenity and service was of the very highest standard for any hotel globally. A wonderful hotel for business couples and families - the separate pools and multiple dining areas ensure that you will have the experience appropriate to your trip's purpose.

After a problem with the room that we were initially assigned the hotel manager more than made up for our inconvenience with a room upgrade and phenomenal service throughout the remainder of our stay. The in-room dining team was equally wonderful with excellent service and many additional goodies! Overall we had an exceptional stay!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I was there for a Summit which took place at The Four Seasons' Conference Centre.... May all Summit venues be like this. For three days the schedule was intense but in between there was sunshine palm trees garden paths a beautiful aesthetic pool which was simply a joy to walk past gracious service the best spicy Bloody Mary I have ever had - at the swimming pool cafe - the pool is also very nice and my room was very comfortable. It's a resort hotel that feels boutiquey and then there is the colourful charm of Marrakech.... Looking forward to returning.

We have stayed in hotels in over 40 countries around the world and we would rate this hotel among the best we have stayed in. The entire staff was excellent! We also arranged several excursions through the hotel and were well pleased with each of them.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Hiccup on Arrival Followed by a Heavenly Stay
Review_Text: After checking into a beautiful room and noticing some irregularities we called the manager on duty. Mohammad took immediate action and we were moved to a larger beautiful suite. For the rest of our stay we were spoiled by the staff with complimentary beverages and amazing service. The resort sits on a large beautifully manicured grounds with two pools one for adults only. We had room service on the first night and the food was delicious. There is complimentary transportation to the square. Overall it was a great stay. Thanks to Mohammad and his team!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lindsay D wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Title: A beautiful oasis in the middle of Marrakech
Review_Text: We stayed at this property for 4 nights in late September. It is a fantastic property. While not having the character of some of the Riads or a Kashbah Tamadot you know what you get at 4S and this property is so large you feel like you are in your own world. Security is tight and so you feel safe at all times.    Service is exquisite - staff were friendly attentive and always looking to help. Our son would have a “coffee to go” each morning and the waiter knew to expect him! There was a delightful hostess in the Italian restaurant I can’t recall her name but she was from New Caledonia a new hire at the hotel and she was super friendly and responsive - I think a real find of an employee with much potential.    The lobby is very cool emulating a Riad courtyard with a sliding roof that was open during the day and closed at night. You can have drinks or eat in this area.    The gym was super well equipped with one room dedicated to cardio and one to strength with knowledgeable and attentive staff. There were two clay tennis courts as well.    We ate at the Italian and international restaurants and had room service one night. All the food was exceptional. Probably the most extensive room service menu that I’ve ever seen in any hotel and very reasonably priced.    With the exception of the $35 US breakfast buffet the food prices were very reasonable for 4S. The server didn’t tell us the price of the breakfast buffet before we elected to pick it. The 2nd morning we dined from the a la carte breakfast menu which was much more reasonable priced. The lunch and dinner menu are very reasonably priced...so just beware of the breakfast buffet!    There is a very large adult and family pool. The one afternoon we found that the family pool was actually quieter and hardly had anyone at it while the adult pool was busy. We ate at the poolside restaurant one day for lunch and the food drink and service was excellent.    We walked through the conference centre area which was huge and looked like a great place for meetings or weddings.    The resort is close to the airport but about 15-20 minutes to downtown and there isn’t anything within walking distance of the hotel so you need a car or taxi to go anywhere. There is a mall about 10 minutes away by car. They are building extensively in the area with other hotels and high end shopping so this will be a really upscale burgeoning area in the next 5 to 10 years.    Bottom-line another superb 4 Seasons property! Very much recommend it.

In general the hotel is very nice quite and good services. The continental breakfast provides decent food. The egg and pan-cake station was my favorite. The fresh orange juice is all you can drink. The restaurant also provide kid-center good for family trip. Nice tennis count swimming pools and young adult center are where you can hang around.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: One of the best stay among Four Seasons properties
Review_Text: We spent 5 nights at Four Seasons Marrakech and actually didn't want to leave! It was definitively an excellent stay one of the best we had among Four Seasons properties. We felt pampered at all times. Staff are very friendly and attentive. Food and variety of the same are very good. Location is great. We will definitively go back again.

We have just returned from an amazing four days in Marrakech staying at the Four Seasons. On previous visits we had stayed in a Riad in the Medina and while we enjoyed that experience we wanted to give the Four Seasons a go.  Everything from the welcome to the amazing staff and the room were excellent. The hotel is set in beautiful grounds just a short taxi ride from the medina and close to some great restaurants. The rooms are well designed clean and well kept.  The staff really add so much to this place they go out of there way to make your stay as enjoyable as possible and I can't give them enough praise.  Overall well worth the price and we can't wait to come back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I spent one full week for a business conference. The hotel grounds were beautifully maintained and the pool like a tranquil oasis. I did not make use of the spa but understand from those that did that it was great. Food and drinks were of a high standards as you would expect but my main praise is for the staff who were all extremely friendly helpful and professional. And this goes for room cleaners to front of house staff. I would definitely come back for a leisure trip as most of my stay was "work" but I loved the experience of the hotel. My only constructive comment - put a decent complimentary coffee maker in the rooms at this standard a kettle and sachet of instant coffee doesn't cut it.

Review_Title: Top Drawer, not sure it is worth it!
Review_Text: Stayed three nights for a conference. The service staff and location are great. Not sure the "resort" layout works for a conference as a lot of time is spent finding the way around. The grounds are nice however!  Rooms were laid out well and the bedding and sheets are almost worth the price. But not quite!

Review_Date: Jules W wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: The hotel was the highlight of our weekend away. The pool area was pristine and the restaurant next to the adult pool (Azzera) was the best quality food of our trip - the specials were fantastic. One of the lunch time specials was lobster cooked on the bbq - it was delicious (maybe the best I have ever had).    We used the hotel Range Rover to pick us up from the airport - really nice way to start our holiday. We used the complementary hotel car to take us to the restaurants in the evening - nice touch.    We will definitely be returning to Marrakesh and I would not want to risk staying anywhere else; just in case it did not come up to the same standard as the Four Seasons.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Really enjoyed the ambiance and atmospher at the hotel. There are good conference facilities and a it is a lovely venue for relaxation in the evening too. The room was very comfortable - bathroom as well and the wifi worked well. I missed to have a proper coffee maker in the room to replace a kettle and coffee powder. I would love to o back and enjoy the hotel and Marrakech much more as a leisure trip.

Review_Date: Walter S wrote a review Oct 2017
Review_Text: A wonderful resort hotel in the middle of the desert with all the amenities you could ever hope for. Guest room was big and comfortable and the bed was supremely comfortable. My room had a veranda with an outdoor couch! The pool was fantastic.

We visited the Four Seasons Marrakech for our anniversary and received an amazing welcome with an upgraded suite (with plunge pool) bottle of champagne and a lovely cake. The amazing service continued throughout our stay from beginning to end. Truly top notch. The hotel itself is stunning with beautiful pools landscaping and water features - exactly what you'd expect from a Four Seasons. They have a nightly shuttle to take you to the Medina or to other areas of the city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Wow. This hotel is simply beautiful. The campus is so well laid out with 2 pools a spa and 3 restaurants with different cuisine options. You almost don't want to leave this place to discover the city... I will definitely come back it was perfect. And if you get a chance - definitely have an evening drink or dinner in the lobby and listen to Mehdi the acoustic guitarist!

I would have to say for this town the resort is very modern. It is well laid out and anywhere on the property it is an easy walk to the pools and restaurants. As usual in FS it is clean and the service is 100%.    We enjoyed two nights here and the food was perfect. They have an adult pool and family pool and many of the rooms have their own private plunge pools.    It is about 20 min from the main square where all the shopping and excitement is waiting.

Review_Date: Brandon F wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Title: What more can we say. It’s the Four Seasons
Review_Text: After traveling through morocco for the past ten days what better way could there be to end up at the Four seasons. The same service that you know and love is what is found here. The rooms are huge and the food and staff amazing. Always love the four seasons.

Review_Title: Better than ever, this hotel just gets better and better
Review_Text: This is my second time staying at this hotel. The first time was the year that it opened and I did not like it very much (long story that I will not go into here). I am so very happy with the way the hotel has evolved both physically and experientially. The gardens are a highlight I had so much joy just wandering the grounds at different times during the day.    The best part was the service it feels the same as a S.E. Asian Four Seasons. The smiles attention too detail and genuine care that the staff have for the guests is palpable. I stayed for a week and loved every minute of it and look forward to my return.    What sets a hotel apart from the rest is the way that they deal with unexpected situations. While at the hotel I had an unexpected medical situation. Even as a lifelong expat when you get sick in a foreign country its stressful and traumatic. There is no greater feeling of security and comfort as when you know you are being well looked after. The GM Blaise Montandon was an absolute "rockstar" in handling me and my situation. He went above and beyond the call of duty by personally escorting me to the hospital and staying by my side long into the night to make sure that I was well looked after. Thank you to Blaise and his amazing team for taking such exceptionally good care of me. I am a fan.

A delightful 4 day stay at the Four Seasons Marrakech was blemished only at the check in experience. We were told with no apology that our room was not ready (though it was after check in time) and "perhaps you'd like to have lunch or visit our gift shop" (translation: pay double retail while waiting for our competence to catch up with our standards). We were also told we'd be called when the room was ready . .. we weren't. Regardless the rest of the stay was Four Seasons quality. I'd say the staff (other than at check in) were as friendly and helpful as any anywhere. The pool is a delight and the breakfasts (included) were great (omelette station). Badr is an incredibly good concierge. Restaurants on site (Middle Eastern and Italian) were both excellent without painful prices . . though the wine lists a bit scant.

Review_Date: Theo H wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Title: Holiday with children aged 4 and 9 and grandparents
Review_Text: this is a lovely hotel but far from the standard i expected from four seasons. Having stayed at 3 others in the last few years- the attention to detail by staff falls short of what you would come to expect.  Only staff so far that are a credit to the hotel are those by the family pool. Reception do not seem interested unless you are french or of another nationality.  As a family we do not expect doors to be opened etc but simple things such as correct bills to pay. Correct rooms on arrival ( sorted promptly ) but again not to be expected by the FS. No English papers but lots for other nationalities. Stated 4 days in a row they would get one....still waiting. Plus points are rooms and pools are lovely and quiet. Kids club brilliant and simira is great with our youngest who always refuses to go in to a club but did on this holiday.  All in all great hotel and holiday. Just those extras you'd expect from the four seasons are lacking which is such a disappointment.  Would i stay here again ? Definately but managers need to step up to egypt four seasons standard.

nice staff & atmosphere  delicious breakfast  very attentive staff at pool area & exzellent helpful staff at reception during my wife's sickness !!    to be improved: 2 times turndown forgotten not very attentive in room service with refilling nespresso and fridge ...  for a fourseasons all services should be perfect
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Nice Property let down by Service
Review_Text: Nice property not far from main town let down by very slow service in restaurants and in room dining. Our son went to sleep hungry 1 night after waiting over 1.5hrs for a simple chicken nuggets and chips.

Review_Date: Jennifer C wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: Every aspect of the hotel was absolutely amazing. When entering all cars and taxis go through security so we always felt very safe. The grounds are stunning and the concierge was extremely helpful. They helped us call taxis when going out restaurants to make reservations and even helped us book a guide for the souks for a very reasonable price. The pool of course was beautiful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Incredible hotel have stayed her 3 times without my children over the years. Our most recent trip last week for 6 nights we bought our 4 year old twins. It was the best holiday we have had all together. The hotel facilities are second to non. The staff are so helpful and caring. We will be back very soon.

Review_Date: Joan C wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Title: It's always a great day at a Four Seasons Resort
Review_Text: The entire experience was perfect. The staff was friendly and accommodating. The food was delicious and the spa delivered the best facial I have ever had in my life (the god & diamond facial is worth every penny).

Review_Title: Amazing family holiday, can't wait to come again!
Review_Text: My family and I enjoyed our holiday so much we came back 4 years later this summer. We were treated so well from the beginning from the start until the end. At every step the staff were attentive and the breakfast was incredible especially the juice bar! We also used the gym and the tennis courts everyday the gym classes morning and night proved to be excellent we created a bond with the personal trainer and we had a great time overall. Would strongly recommend the hotel the food and the services we are counting down until we can visit again. The city is beautiful and the proximity of the hotel to the town centre means we can easily explore whilst being away in our villa at the same time. Can't recommend the hotel enough!

Review_Date: Jorge M wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: Staying at the Four Season was the best choice on my Morocco trip.  Hotel is not far from the Medina and is perfectly located considering airport Medina and the other good neighborhoods.  Very good service and pools and spa are very comfortable.  We had to stay a full day for " muslim Christmas " and was comfortable enough to stay all day
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Excelent hotel but not the best for Marrakesh
Review_Text: We moved here after 3 day in a riad to relax and enjoy the luxury services form Four Seasons.  The stay was very relaxing and we enjoyed the room service and workderfull swimming pool.  The hotel is far away form the main city attractions so if you want to find an hotel or visit the city it is not the most convenient location. The shuttle is available only only way to the city and to return you need a taxi.  Our experience was very positive but if you want to visit the city I suggest one of the wonderfull riad in the medina.

Great hotel service not 100% like other FS properties i have stayed at but absolutely wonderful nonetheless. Got woken up by roomservice at 2 am who repeatedly knocked on our (wrong) door. Didn't get much in the way of apology - but property is beautiful and centrally located for excurtions.

We stayed at Four Seasons Marrakech for two nights in August 2017. The resort was simply amazing!! Staff members very attentive and friendly. My kids especially loved the family swimming pool where we spent lovely quality time. Breakfast was great with a wide variety of pastries fresh fruit fresh juices eggs etc. Something else caught my attention that they provide special food for those who have certain allergies; i.e. gluten free cereals and others.  Thank you Four Seasons. We're definitely going to make it again.

Best place to stay with family and friends. Great pool and spa services. Managers & staff are so kind & want you to have a lovely experience. They went to great lengths to make tho vs happen for us and we greatly appreciate it.

Review_Date: Sajit A wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: have stayed in Marrakech on a number of occasions. this time opted to take the family to Four Seasons. hotel was amazing and all staff were extremely friendly and helpful.    i had a slight problem when I ordered lunch but never received my main course despite two reminders. I was also not made aware that a separate charge is made for using the tennis courts.    However Pierre is the most wonderfully charming and accommodating manager. when I brought the lunch issue to his attention he immediately halved the bill. Pierre also very kindly allowed me to play tennis at a very late hour with my.family.and also waived half the cost of the court hire.    the only thing that would make this hotel truly perfect is if it had a very large heated pool for children given the one that is there is modest in size and the family pool although large is a bit too cold for the children to spend a long time in    thank you for looking after me.and my family and I look forward to returning    overall...it was a wonderful experience and I would not hesitate to return.

Review_Date: John B wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Title: Best experience I ever had at a hotel
Review_Text: Well after spending a week at this fabulous Four Seasons Hotel and Resort in Marrakech I am afraid that no other experience will be in the same league. From beginning to end the beautiful surroundings food and service were top notch. The hotel is surrounded by an oasis of plantings--olive trees roses succulents a paradise. There are two pools one a family-oriented one and one for adults. There are several restaurants on site serving breakfast lunch and dinner and live entertainment in the main lobby area (usually a vocalist or someone playing the guitar or a local instrument) of high quality in the evenings. We grew especially fond of the staff at Inara the restaurant and bar in the lobby area. Our friends there included Merouane Youssef Sara Sophia (the manager) and Ayoub among others. These lovely people gave us the best possible service with friendly smiles every time and expressed sincere interest in us and in our experience in Marrakech. We looked forward to going to Inara every evening to have a drink before bedtime and to talk with the staff and listen to the excellent live music (including gnawa a haunting genre that dates to the times when Africans were enslaved and shipped to other parts of the world in chains). A local man with a long list of pop song covers also performed very very beautifully. The bartenders are very talented and the servers and manager at Inara are the kindest most social people I can imagine. I learned as much about Morocco from them as I did from my visits to other parts of Marrakech! The highlight each day was stopping there to interact with them each evening enjoy a perfectly made cocktail and review the events of that day. Thank you Inara staff! You are the jewel in the crown of the hotel. I should also mention that security at the hotel is very good and we felt very safe and protected there. Our morning security man Abdellatif and our evening security man Belhassan always had the widest smiles and friendly greetings for us as we exited and entered the hotel each day. Our housekeeper Laile was efficient and solicitous and provided everything we needed each day to be comfortable in our room. Rachid who works out front substituted for the usual tea man who was on holiday and kindly gave us a lesson in making traditional Moroccan mint tea; thank you Rachid! The lovely woman in the lobby boutique store (which is gorgeous by the way) gave us pointers in how to bargain for goods in the souks; she even wrote down some useful Moroccan Arabic words and phrases for us ("zouine" beautiful!). The rooms manager Pierre greeted us warmly upon our arrival as did the staff at reception (Leila and Shiyue among others). All of these fantastic people made our stay the most wonderful time I have had anywhere. I actually felt deeply sad to leave this hotel. I look forward to going back someday and seeing everyone (and of course Marrakech) again. Well done Four Seasons! And thank you.

Review_Title: Wow! First class hotel and first class staff. Faultless.
Review_Text: We have recently returned from a two-week stay at the Fours Seasons and can honestly say it was faultless. The outstanding feature of this hotel - as many many reviewers have already said - is the staff they are truly outstanding. Everything you ask for is met with a "you are welcome" and you certainly feel everyone in the hotel really means it. They really couldn't do enough to help you. We had one poor experience with housekeeping not replacing the towels and within 5 minutes new towels were delivered and when we returned from a night out we had a bouquet or roses AND a letter of apology waiting for us. Outstanding service. The hotel and service was so good that we barely set foot outside the hotel preferring to spend our time around the adult pool and enjoying the pool service. Ice water is brought round at regular intervals together with fresh fruit ice creams and shots of non-alcoholic fruit cocktails. They'll even clean your sunglasses. Special thanks for outstanding pool service around the adult pool should go to Abdullah who could not have been more helpful and courteous. In fact all the pool staff where great.    It's very hard to find fault with any aspect of the hotel. The guide the hotel supplied for a tour of the Soukhs was also outstanding and in fact booking it through the hotel was cheaper than our tour operator. Special thanks should also go to Sofia and Mousse at the Inara Resturant who looked after us so well during our stay. We also need to thank Kacem and all the staff and managers at the Azzera Restaurant.    We stayed in a ground floor pavilion twin bedded room which was lovely and had very easy access to the adult pool via the patio. The room was well equipped.    There is plenty to do for the children with a great kids club games centre with pool table x box play station wii and great cinema room. Not to mention internet cafe. The children even have their own pool which is well separated from the adult pool a real plus point.    This is a Four Seasons hotel and prices for food and drink reflect that but portions sizes are generous and we found we could share two courses easily between 3 people. Breakfast is £35 per person although you could hop in a taxi for 5dhr and go to Victor Cafe (French boulangerie) in the Menara Mall which is 5 minutes round the corner and serves excellent breakfast brunch and lunch. There is also a Carrefour Market in the Mall which has a good selection of wine.    We ordered room service a couple of time and it was delicious and arrived on time extensive choice of dishes.    The concierges were excellent and more than happy to book restaurants or alter bookings on our behalf.    We really can't express in this short review how impressed we were with the hotel the management and staff. We have already decided to return next year and look forward to seeing everyone. Thank you so much Four Seasons.

Review_Date: Carole B wrote a review Sep 2017
Review_Text: We stayed here for ten days this year. What an experience. Met at the reception by Pierre who seems to work all hours and was extremely efficient and interested in all clients. All the staff were incredible and so friendly. The pool service was great and we spent most of our time there as it was so lovely and relaxing. The rooms are great with lots of space even with an extra bed. Very clean and again room service great. Loved the food especially on the terrace on the evening and the guitarist was amazing. Couldn't have wished for a better holiday and will definitely be back again with the rest of my family. Thank you to Pierre and all his team.

This was and amazing hotel the staff was absolutely outstanding down to everyone was friendly and helpful was best vacation ever they were so nice I was so blown away with how accommodating they were to me and my friend from room to pool to hookah to food I have stayed at many hotels high class and low and this was best staff I have ever encountered please visit morroco and stay at the four seasons you won't be sad

Our fourth visit to the hotel. Most helpful & friendly staff. Couldn't praise enough. Remarkable facilities. Great atmosphere and very spacious guest rooms. Only a few minutes cab ride to town centre. Highly recommend

Review_Date: Miriam A wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Title: Best place to stay! 5 stars, clean rooms and friendly staff definitely recommend!
Review_Text: Best place to stay! 5 stars clean rooms and friendly staff definitely recommend! You'll feel safe here we stayed at an spg riad before we moved here and we were robbed scammed and disappointed!!!!!

Review_Date: Kevin B wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Text: We loved the resort!! Beautiful rooms and pool areas. Ghita Kamal the Head Concierge was just amazing!! We had asked about air sickness pills for my son and she arranged to have some brought to the resort. Great Four Seasons service.

We stayed at the Four Seasons in Marrakech for 5 nights in July 2017. It is a fantastic luxury resort just a short taxi ride away from the Medina. The rooms are spacious with excellent views and I cannot speak highly enough about the staff who make you feel very welcome. The pool is lovely and so too is the breakfast. Look forward to returning one day.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Chose the FS over my regular one (La Mamounia) in Marrakech for my 1st trip abroad with my 5-year old goddaughter. Did so because FS hotels do have a reputation for making the little ones feel welcome. And they delivered far above my expectations. It's not only about having a kid's club or a family pool but the whole staff is trained to make children feel like special guests. Sofie at the front desk took time out every day to entertain my goddaughter. Waiters at breakfast made her special pancakes. One of the highlights for her was our 'pyjama dinner' where we had room service delivered to the terrace of our suite. Our waiter was making this so special for her. On my return there was a hiccup with a spa invoice but this was solved in the end in a very correct manner by management. As a person not being used to travel with a young child the FS made our vacation a very special one for both of us.

Review_Date: Bill C wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Text: Simply wonderful. My only regret was we stayed at the 4 Seasons first and so the next hotel which was fine seemed like a big let down in comparison. The pool was an Oasis on 100 degree days. The staff was amazing. It was like "Cheers": everyone knew your name. They couldn't do enough: right down to the frozen treats at the pool to the young man who cleaned your sunglasses!

Review_Date: D L wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Text: The Marrakech experience is only made more perfect by the Four Seasons location service and food. The concierge planned 3 days of incredible day trips for us leave yourself in their hands. We cant wait to go back!

When you check in to a Four Seasons you know exactly what you are getting---superb service outstanding accommodations fabulous food great locations every possible amenity and then some. The grounds are incredibly beautiful and once you enter onto the property it's hard to believe you are in the city of Marrackech itself. It seems so removed from the hustle and bustle of the inner city. I had a room overlooking the pool grounds as well out into the main city beyond with the lights twinkling at night. I sat out on my terrace complete with table and chairs and a built in sofa daybed to relax in with a drink or magazine. I didn't want to leave.

Review_Date: Celina T wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Text: Brilliant stay and excellent service! We were well looked after and the hotel has great facilities. Would definitely recommend or return in the future! Thank you for the memorable stay we had a wonderful stay!

What an amazing place for singles couples and Families. This has been the best holiday for us in years and would highly recommend to all. The kind nature and great service will blow you all away. The food is amazing and the Kids Club is just an added bonus. The comfort of having 2 pools - a family pool and an adult pool just made it more pleasant.

Super friendly and helpful staff. Barmans' are real wizards! You should try the Cosmomorrocan at the Lobby. Exquisite cuisine with national flavors is real delicious. Special thanks for Salma from the front desk for real useful advices !

Review_Date: Marian A wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Text: We stayed for four nights in Four Seasons Hotel. Check in process was very fast I commend the staff of the hotel for the very warm and personalized service which is consistent all throughout our stay. The hotel offers free car service to the nearest Menara Mall which is a good thing. On our last day since our flight was very early the hotel was considerate enough to brought us some early breakfast in our room. We suggest to widen the selection in the buffet breakfast it is the same thing for the entire four days we stay.

Review_Date: Christina S wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Text: Had just a regular room felt very posh was able to get two full beds. We checked in at 1am and they couldn't be nicer about it. The adults only pool is great for a night swim. The breakfast every morning is great in front of a gorgeous fountain. Every detail was lovely - my friend wanted to steal the colored glasses in the foyer at check-in.

Review_Date: Dipesh M wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Text: Wonderful resort with the most welcoming and friendly staff i have ever met. Coming from Dubai and having stayed at some of the best 5* hotels in Dubai i was surprised that the Four Seasons Marrackech was just as good and if not better. Rooms very well appointed. The pools split into family and adult pools both very nice and comfortable to relax by. Breakfast were great and Lunch by the pool cook wonderfully. Location wise the hotel is not to far from the airport but far enough to avoid the noise. Also not far from some great bars and restaurants and markets that are on offer on the city. What make it even better was the very friendly and helpful staff. Would be happy to return anytime.

Review_Date: Naim K wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Text: this property was probably the most beautiful and relaxing hotel we have ever been to. From the entrance to the check in and all the way to the check out. UNBELIEVABLE...... The staff will do whatever it takes to get it done for you. Sofia at the main restaurant made us feel right at home and took care of us like family. She was so great that we made sure to stop by every night even if we had dinner else where. The pool staff will make you feel like you have your own butler and so will room service.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Karim M wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Text: I spent few days with my mother in this amazing resort I have nothing to say just that it is the perfect place for vacations with family. All the staff are friendly and they offer a five star service from the staff by the pool to the restaurants I was impressed by the quality. I was staying in a twin room the room is really big (might be a suite in an other hotel) well equiped and beautiful offer a nice view.  I really recommend this hotel.

The warmth of Morocco comes not just from the shining sun but from the kind-heartedness and hospitality of its people.  The Four Seasons Resort Marrakech embodies that warmth and makes you feel like a family member. A beautiful resort in a beautiful country.

Review_Date: Mona J wrote a review Aug 2017
Review_Text: My husband and I stayed at the four seasons for a night and we were completely amazed by the exceptional service!    At the time of booking we mentioned that we will be bringing our 9 month daughter with us and to our surprise when we entered the room the baby crib was already set up along with a changing table and all baby mustela products. Unfortunately we decided last minute to keep the baby home so we never used the baby services but we are definitely coming back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: a magic stay in Marrakesh - no snake charmer's story
Review_Text: In July 2017 I had the pleasure to stay at the Four Seasons Marrakesh with my daughter as a college go away present to her. I am a frequent stayer with the FS chain both for business and pleasure. On this tripe we came from George V FS in Paris and from the Casablanca FS to Marrakesh. The property is amazing lined up with palm trees and villas and the Mediterranean/desert combo vegetation. The property sports both an adult pool and a family/children's pool. We stayed away from both because be enlarge the staff planned for us off premises activities. If you are a privacy seeker and do not like self important phone loud talking individuals in various languages of the world I suggest to frequent the adult pool after hours and get a seat away form the crowds. I highly suggest Inara for fresh Morrocan and specialty Marrakesh dishes. I confess I did not go to the other restaurants on premises simply because Inara had it all: the lounge the outdoor dining the welcoming service hovering over you and the freshness of the food. The room was spacious comfortable and cool considering the 108F degrees heat during the day. The gym was adequate (my daughter body builds and has to work out every day) but the air conditioning was lacking and after working out a sweat my daughter felt very fatigued from the heat. Special tanks to Blaise Montandon hotel manager and Pierre Kermanac'h and to Rita for the personalized attention given to us on this trip. Overall I highly recommend staying at this property.

Review_Title: A great place to spend a birthday
Review_Text: Wow! First things first - don't hesitate to book a stay here!  My daughter turned 6 whilst me my daughter and wife stayed at the resort. Ahead of our stay we were concerned about the reviews that were being posted on trip advisor - so I contacted the hotel ahead of the visit to let them know that my daughters 6th Birthday was a very special occasion that we had chosen to spend it at four seasons. I do not regret coming and in fact I'm already planning on visiting again at least twice in the next year.  We booked via British Airways and landed at marrakech airport on Thursday 27th July. When we landed we had issues (along with other European travellers) using our visa cards to withdraw cash for our taxi ride.
