So I rang the hotel and they arranged for a car to pick us up from the airport within 10 minutes. This was the first moment of truth - the hotel did not let us down from this point.  The check in was very smooth in fact when we got to the room there was a card for my daughter to welcome her to the kids club (great idea). We then settled down to eat food in the morrocan restaurant. I must say that the food was lovely - I had the sea bass tagine.  Each morning at breakfast the heads of departments would be very visible and get to know guests. We got to know Nabila (good luck with your labour) Abelsaf and Nila. Abelsaf was very useful in organising a birthday cake/surprise for my daughter at the family pool - thank you. The staff went to great lengths to ensure that it was special for her including making sure that everything was Scooby Doo themed - thank you.  My daughter had a awesome time at the kids club and the guys there really do a fantastic job of keeping the kids entertained. Not only do the kids clubs staff keep the kids entertained but also the lifeguard team too. The lifeguard team are like no other - they get involved in interacting with all guests at the pool side / including facilitating water based games.  After speaking to Nabila - me and my wife decided to go to the spa for a hammer. Oh my God was it worth it! I had a guy called Zohour and he spent an hour with me and I must say that my skin glowed at the end. I'm not sure who my wife had but she was also glowing too. Readers - must check out a hammam in Marrakech whether at the four seasons or elsewhere. We decided to do it at the four seasons because we did not want to be too far from out daughter in case of anything. However there were parent who were comfortable enough to leave their kids in the kids club whilst they went to the atlas mountains. This is a reflection on the quality of the kids club at four seasons.  Everything about the four seasons marrakech was perfect. I may have missed something but in summary - Staff - great helpful HAPPY and polite. Staff are obsessed with excellence.Rooms - large and cleaned regularly. Food - good quality made on demand - not buffet. Spa - unmissable. Kids club - awesome (according to my daughter).  Thank you four seasons for a great experience👍😎

We stayed in this hotel in July 2017. It has been a dream . Excellent service excellent rooms excellent pool excellent breakfast. I would recommend this wonderful experience to everyone who wants to feel like a prince or a princess for a while. Thank you Four Seasons!

Last month we stayed at the Four seasons Marrakech. The staff were very nice and polite. The residence room was very spacious and comfortable. The bathroom had a jacuzzi shower toilet and 2 sinks. There were 2 balconies with a Moroccan architecture. The breakfast had many Moroccan dishes. The general manager stopped by everyday to talk to us.    The only drawback was that the breakfast was served outdoors. It was 50 degrees centigrade and we would have preferred an indoor dining. They brought us a fan to cool us.    The receptionists were very courteous. They ordered us taxis to go to various places at a set price of 50 dirhams which is about $5.50.    We have stayed at many resorts all over the world ad we found this place to be one of the best resorts we have stayed at.

Review_Date: Stephanie R wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Text: Unbelievable experience !!! Clean safe and courteous. Definitely going back. The pool was amazing. My 7 year old didn't want to leave. Food was absolutely delicious. Rooms were very spacious and sunny.

Review_Date: Arnie H wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Text: Incredible hotel. Was supposed to stay 1 night but quickly extended a 2nd night. The pool and facilities are spectacular. The manager and staff were extremely helpful. My only complaint was that I did not have a week longer to stay.

It was a very relaxing stay. Staff was cordial. The food was very expensive and I will not recommend the spa. The location is a bit further but it worked out well for attending the conference. Staying in a riad will be more fun in Marrakech.

Review_Date: Judit J wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Text: It was a true experience staying at this beautiful property from the nice welcoming to the running path around the resort through the great spa experience the pool the rooms the breakfast the service - this hotel has everything to impress.  Thank you for the whole team to Pierre Kermanac'h and Fatima it's been a pleasure staying with Four Seasons Family can't wait to be back!

Review_Date: Shane H wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Text: Where to begin... the staff was incredible!! Warm friendly inviting and anticipated our every need. I have traveled a good deal and never encountered such a fantastic group. It is like the Ritz without the pomp. We were celebrating our 25th Anniversary and were surprised when returning from dinner our first night and they brought a cake and champagne. Their food recommendations were spot on as well as the other activities (Hot Air Balloon Ride The Berber Experience and Guides for Souks/Historical Sites).The grounds are impeccable well manicured and beautiful. We did not want to leave!! The rooms were very spacious with perhaps the best shower I've had in a resort (perhaps from the long flight??). Our room had a great terrace and sitting area large enough for my wife and I to nap.. Seriously this was AWESOME!! Also security was the tops... inspected every vehicle that entered went through two check points.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I feel like a new person after recharging my batteries at this hotel. We were travelling with my daughter (7 years old) and the staff ensured that we had a lovely time. Everyone was kind and lovely and super engaged with children. I would recommend this place and we will definitely be back.

had the most relaxing vacay ever! beautiful grounds and service. amazing food spa and service was unreal. the rooms are oversized and beautiful. convenience of having private drivers with luxury cars is a huge plus.

Review_Date: Abeer Al Dosari wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Text: I stayed the weekend at this perfect hotel. I loved the spacious rooms and its amenities. They catered for all the details like the electricity adapter and even direction for the qibla. Miss Safea from front desk provided excellent service with regard to the check out and Misss Jehan from concierge with regard to the restaurant reservation and selection. You won't regret paying every single penny.

Review_Title: Excellent Hotel and Most important Excelent Service
Review_Text: I have been to many 5 and 7 stars hotels in Marrakech. Four seasons for me is the best. They have the quality customer service professionalism and work knowledge. The staff are very professional all from the entrance reception bar men pool staff etc.... they are all kind helpful and professional. Rachid Said in the pool side Younes...Thank you for the lovely Cocktails. I Just love and admire your work. A big thank you for the Manager of the hotel his management style reflected on the whole team.  Four seasons is the hotel where I love to stay They do little things but make change and prove how their upper management is good !!!!    Thank you

Review_Title: Professional and friendly well run hotel
Review_Text: We spent 7 nights at this hotel. Spacious and luxurious rooms and suites. 40 hectare site so lots of room for everybody. We were there in July - plenty of room at both of the large pools and at breakfast. We have been to plenty of good hotels around the world but this is one of the best. Everything simply works and if something needs attention it gets taken care of immediately. The staff is friendly helpful well educated and well trained - all fluent in several languages. Often it is the small attention to details which make a difference for instance free iced water fruit drinks and ice creams served to you throughout the day! Dinner tends to be a bit over priced and the portions small and here we recommend guests simply jump in a taxi and go downtown - Marrakech only comes alive at night anyway and the experience so unique it would be a shame to sit around in the hotel. We for sure will be back.

We spend two wonderful days in this excellent hotel with my family .. the rooms was big and the service was fantastic .. the facility was perfect .. in general I fully recommended this hotel for families ..

Review_Date: World T wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Title: One of the best resorts I have ever been to
Review_Text: Honestly I loved this resort. The rooms are a bit pricey but worth the spending. If you get a room in the main building or upper pavilion (bungalows) they are both great. The pools were fantastic. The food was amazing they had fresh lobster and all sorts of options at the pool and restaurants. They had so many amenities that we never left the hotel! The city does not have much to offer. We took one day and went and saw the city and medina but the hotel was honestly so relaxing and wonderful we would go back instantly. While at the pool they serve water ice cream refreshments complimentary etc. would highly recommend it!! The four seasons Casablanca was NOT like this at all. Marrakesh was amazing. The Casablanca four seasons lacked so much from amenities to service.

Review_Title: My beautiful oasis , beautiful hotel , amazing staff , great food and what a memorisable holiday
Review_Text: This was the first time we left our son and came on a couples holiday for my birthday    I'm so happy that I chose the four seasons to do that on the minute we are right we felt looked after and thoroughly spoilt    The rooms are lovely and big they have a very beautiful Moorish decor and the colours used are very calming  huge bathroom section with shower and a separate bathroom separate bathroom  They have a whole walk-in wardrobe style closet which is amazing and one of the most fabulous balconies.    That's grounds of the resort itself is outstandingly beautiful palm trees everywhere beautifully maintained we saw from morning tonight having it maintained by different types of workers nothing was out of place now rubbish lying around all plants and trees were looked after and really clean    As it was my birthday we were surprised with a birthday cake  bottle of champagne  flowers and a birthday card so thank you to the four seasons for making me feel special    Nipple area is the best part of the hotel and as we didn't have our child with us we were in the outdoor pool which was so calming and so zen from the minute to go to the pool the waiters the workers would not let you think that they would arrange your shade it would bring your towels they will arrange your bed the way you wanted it make sure you had cold glass of water and frat the day they would bring your ice cream or water and whatever you asked... a special thank you to saeid ...    As the weather was very hot we had our lunches by the pool at Azzera restaurant  lovely fresh seafood great quality of food it was on the more expensive side but you were at the four seasons.    Staff was super attentive and anything you asked what was never enough and they would make sure they would do everything to make you feel comfortable.    We had dinner twice at Inara and it was not bad I still preferred the Azzera lunches in general I found the meat in Morroco on the dry side . Their mint teas and Shisha was great  ambience was 100%    Breakfast was on a super expensive side and worked out as maybe £35 per person for an breakfast buffet style  as I'm not a big water especially when it's an buffet for us it worked out expensive for the amount we ate so the next day we had ordered A la Cart which I believe was better quality and the food served to you warm.    If you want to workout there is a 2 km trip made around the grounds of the around of the hotel which is amazing to run and the gym is very up-to-date    Do you to all the palm trees and the lash grounds when you came back form the stuffiness of the Medina there just a was fresh air and oxygen to breathe and it made you appreciate the hotel even more    This is the first holiday that my husband sat down to relax all the four days we were there due to the fact that the hotel the grounds the staff everything was perfect and if we do ever go back definitely we shall return    I already miss my holiday and wish I was back
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I alway stay in FS whenever I go away. Wanted a change from Dubai. Seemed close to UK and authentic so wanted to give it a go. So pleased I did.  I took two of my children and we had a FAB stay.  There was great young adults centre for them to use as well as a gym.  The restaurants were great especially the poolside one.  The concierge recommended great venues to eat and the hotel felt very safe and secure. Plus just 10 mins from airport and 10 mins to town. And the market was great fun especially watching my children try to haggle in French!  A very convenient location.  The main pool is an absolute stunner. Very long and the temperature was perfect. I swam all day and evening too. Great.  Pierre the Director of Rooms has recently arrived for Paris FS so knows his stuff and was attentive and welcoming.  Can't wait to go back. Highly highly recommended.

We loved everything about this resort. Our room was a large suite with it's own private plunge pool and a small garden. The food at the hotel was very good. The workout facilities are very good. They have a couple of clay tennis courts and had everything available that you could need. Beautiful pool and grounds. The spa was wonderful. The staff was very helpful and friendly. We also felt completely safe here as they seem to go to great lengths with their security. It felt like a calm oasis compared to the rest of Marrakech.

Review_Date: Marine S wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Text: THANK YOU KACEM! the four seasons pool staff is amazing all of them are so in touch with the customer need.  Merci à KACEM pour sa gentillesse. Cet endroit était devenue notre grâce à lui...  Marine et Gary !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This resort is the top of the food chain in every aspect of quality and service. Every detail is covered and the customer service exceptional. Was one of the best hotels we ever stayed at. Enjoy the heated toilet seats and many amenities available in your room. The bed was amazing and we hardly left it!

We loved it- beautiful surroundings. Fab kids club and very stylish the staff were extremely helpful and always went the extra mile... amazing hotel if your looking for culture and a little R&R.  Great gym with fab classes every morning.

Review_Date: Joelle S wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Text: I absolutely loved this hotel. Great service beautiful grounds beautiful rooms great food.  Unfortunately I was only here for two days but could have stayed much longer. This hotel offered perfect luxury after a hot day exploring the Medina. I cant wait to go back.

Review_Date: Issa E wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Text: This the second time I stayed at this hotel and I had an excellent experience from staff to service to food to location and so many I strongly recommend this hotel for families or couples specially if you want to have a fabulous honey moon or celebrating anniversaries

Review_Date: Fernando M wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Title: Great place to visit, great people to meet!
Review_Text: Kind people very well attended the spa service is poor for such a category of the hotel. Nice place to visit. Please avoid from Jun to September. Nice period in April. The food in the buffet it's incredible.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We booked the four seasons for our honey moon online and added a cot for our 13 month old baby.  Landing in the airport we hadn't booked a lift and went to the taxi rank to be set upon by the drivers. It was pretty scary to be honest and they all wanted 200 Dirham. I went into instant haggle mode and stuck to 100. Eventually we got a lift. Hotel security is very visible. The taxi got searched at the gate and we were met at the door my a concierge and 2 more security. It was very reassuring.  As expected the hotel is immaculate the staff are incredibly nice and they all loved our little boy who toddled around the halls and the security guards broke protocol to coo over him and make him laugh. It was lovely to see. The family pool was really nice with varying depths and areas. (There's an adults only pool too.) make sure that you book your breakfast inclusive. Although delicious is was about £58! So later we walked to the minera gardens and mall about 15 min walk and got an equally nice breakfast at la table du marché for bout £8 total.  I generally offered 50 about dirham for any taxi ride anywhere. It was usually accepted with great gusto. We only had one death ride but the 4 a day we took were fantastic. Speaking some French goes along way with Arabic thankyous thrown in too.  We went to the market square jamaa el faa most evenings putting baby in a sling on one of our backs. The locals LOVE babies. They would cross the road to say hello and would often kiss or try to kiss him. Took a day to get used to this. But they genuinely love babies. We never felt threatened. But obviously kept a close eye on everything going on.  Eat in the bars around the edge of the market for great views and food.

Four Seasons Marrakesh Hotel offers excellent facilities and service. Perfect location near to the airport and 10 minutes from the Medina. Rooms are great. Amazing pool and beautiful spa. Delicious breakfast. Excellent experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Manny A wrote a review Jul 2017
Review_Title: Love the Four Seasons Resort in Marrakech!
Review_Text: Great service attention to details amazing food beautiful adults pool nice rooms. Waiters were very friendly. One thing only we have to push our request for the free transport to the Medina as they wanted for us to take a taxi. It did not make any sense we got no help from the people in charge.

The hotel is new elegant and comfortable. Good service however there was only one person In the reception so waiting time increased easily if more than two guests arrived at the same time. We would have liked more ambiance maybe live music at the lobby during the evening.

we got in early though i had informed them earlier the rooms were not ready but Salma had solutions up her sleeve . she sent us off for breakfast and then arranged showers at the fitness center . she then had our city tour ready . what a fantastic experience of the Mediana with our guide Ahmed  when we got back the bags were in our Suite  the staff has been receptive and more tan welcoming  we leave tomorrow and return in 2 days  the cons ....  the property is huge and the signs are not exactly the most informative  the staff struggles with English  their TV page is not updated i went up to the zest bar only to be told they have been shut for a week  .... the week unfolds more to follow
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: suzy h wrote a review Jun 2017
Review_Title: An unbelievable hotel for visiting this magical city
Review_Text: We had a fantastic weekend in Four Seasons Marrakech. I have lots of dietary requirements and the staff were amazing and really accommodating nothing was too much trouble. The rooms were stunning and it was only a five minute taxi journey to the walled city. It was great to be able to have the luxury of a five star hotel but also be close to the city itself for exploring the heart of Marrakech. Can't wait to go back!

The staff at the Four Seasons Marrakech are by far the most courteous and competent I've ever encountered in all my years of travel. The general manager Blaise is involved in all aspects of a guest's experience knows each guest by name ensures nothing is overlooked and all guests are completely satisfied with the hotel.

Sad the bar wasn't open yet when we were there but the building is beautifully designed and the whole hotel has all the understated elegance of a Four Seasons but with really exceptional service. The breakfast is a must thanks to Mohammed for taking care of us!

Review_Date: ali s wrote a review Jun 2017
Review_Text: Very special place in the middle of Marrakech 5 minutes from the airport like a little paradise the service excellent the pool is nice And the hamam is amazing very luxury and quiet with a lot of activities

I spent a week here over Easter and I regretted it. Something has changed in the overall atmosphere. They gave me a mediocre room with a really dirty dehors even if I am a returning customer. The garden is still enchanting probably the most interesting garden I've seen in a five star hotel. The food was a disaster the magic lost. Some mornings the mediocre bread with which to make toasts was even missing. The head of service at breakfast kept brutally reprimanding the waiters while you drank your coffee. The pool is wonderful most employees really friendly but this hotel is now severely overpriced.

A three night stay at the Four Seasons is always a pleasure and the resort in Marrakech does not disappoint. It is approximately a 4-5 euro can drive from the Medina which means it has a little more fresh air than the stifling city centre. Cabs are readily available and we were quite content with the location. The resort is beautifully kept with a clean nod to the location in design and architecture. The rooms are spacious and superb as always the pools are spectacular. The food was average I would say and mostly international. I would have liked to see more variety in local dishes but we only dined there on our last night as we were exhausted. All in a lovely stay.

Review_Date: Roy M wrote a review Jun 2017
Review_Text: Isn`t it a minefield when you travel away from home and have to take a chance? We were so pleased we chose the Four Seasons. We are used to staying in good hotels and our recent trip to Florence would be hard to beat.    We were truly pampered. The welcome to the goodbye was sandwiched with fabulous service. We always felt that the staff were genuinely interested in our comfort. From the reception to the swimming pool the restaurants and the drivers. All were exceptional.    We stayed during Ramadan and they had a locallly inspired buffet each evening in the main restaurant. Problem was that they had the same singer every night. I do question that unless it was always going to be a different set of diners expected. We found that very repetitive.    There is a wonderful balcony restaurant though I would rather see a different menu and better standard of cooking.    The salads in the pool side restarant were way below par. I did mention it and they were very apologetic and made amends with a free dessert For me the food did not match the fantastic surroundings and they really are. We did get out and about each day and this was our oasis in the madness of Marrakesh.    The hotel arranged our excursions and did a good job. It was always seamless and the lovely reception staff handed us over beautifully to who ever we were going on a trip with.    Recommend using the hotel Range Rover for the Atlas mountains and eating at Richard Bransons hotel. Lovely driver and great trip.    The spa although not cheap is amazing! We had the Hammam or as I call it "vertical waterboarding" first then later in the week a fantastic massage. Its not just the treatments though. Linger a while afterwards and enjoy the tranquility of the facilities.    Thank you Four Seasons. It was our formal honeymoon although you didn`t know it and you made us feel special. Particular thanks to the reception staff who are so absolutely charming.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Excellent hotel, excellent service, excellent food
Review_Text: Very nice hotel with extremely attentive and friendly staff. Quality of food is outstanding. The hotel manager personally greeted the guests during breakfast and asked if we like our stay. Very gracious pool area.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Compared to other Four Seasons and to other top end hotels in Marrakech the decor in the main areas is not up  To scratch ; the food service is slow and it's a very spread out hotel- is decided not to come back as I've stayed at other much better hotels in Marrakech- I visit 3 times a year- but I have changed my mind! The people are charming willing and helpful the rooms are large  comfortable and kept beautifully by room staff and although I have weekly massages wherever I am- this was the best ever! Tariq in the Four Seasons Spa is absolutely brilliant and I would stay there again simply to use their spa!

Review_Title: A luxurious calm and serene place to unwind
Review_Text: Second visit and we were not disappointed. Every need is catered for and no detail is too small. The staff without exception seemed genuinely pleased to look after us - and all (whatever their position) greeted us with a smile and 'hello'.  A separate pool for the youngsters made the adult pool a calm and relaxing environment with pool boys periodically coming round with fruit/ice creams/smoothies etc. We met some very nice people around the pool on this trip.  We shall return soon.  My only suggestion would be for the installation of underwater pool lights so that evening swimming is more enjoyable.

There are three best hotels in Marrakech: Royal Mansour Mamounia and Four Seasons. Because it was our first time in Marocco we visited all these three hotels before check-in. All of them are amazing but If you travel with kids do not hesitate - stay in Four Seasons and...go to Royal Mansour and Mamounia for delicious dinner (and to see amazing architecture and gardens).  Four Seasons is not so centrally located as the other two but just 10 minutes (5 USD) taxi ride from Medina (old city). Comfortable rooms (pavilon ground floor close to the pool) delicious food and perfect huge swimming pool for families with kids - completely separated from adults's pool. Exceptionally friendly staff very helpfull with organising trips like shopping desert baloon flight. Definately worth recommendation.

My husband and I had accidentally booked a horrifying riad experience in the middle of the worst part of The Medina. Each night we were dogged by motorcycles flying past us with no care as we tried to make our way to dinner and the souks. After two literally terrifying nights I moved us over to The Four Seasons and didn't leave the property for two days. Great location for planning excursions into the souks and to Jemma al F'na. The food and service were amazing. Great entertainment at dinner. The spa was first rate. I enjoyed a massage and spent several hours in the jacuzzi and cold plunge pools. So quiet and peaceful. The antithesis of the previous two days in the Medina. Don't be a hero you're not Indiana Jones. Just book Four Seasons and have a safe quiet and luxurious home to go back to after exploring the city.

Return trip for a family was better than the last trip. Same high standards bigger kids club better young adult centre and never too crowded in fact not even close to busy which make life at the resort easy. Main restaurant is currently undergoing refurb which means less choice to eat for the time being. Took the garden suite on this occasion and plenty of space for a family of 4 2 bathrooms fold away bed 2 TVs large outside area and exit at the rear which handy for quick access to the pool. Wifi worked throughout property in general and there is a premium service too for extra money. 5 mins to the airport which can be booked independent of the hotel for 10EURS each way..

I recently stayed at the hotel with our two young daughters (<5). I can't speak highly enough of the service we received from absolutely everyone in ensuring we had a enjoyable stay. Baby amenities are provided and its nice that children under 5 are not charged at the restaurants. Its an easy 15 minute transfer from the (brand new) airport and also easy to go into the medina via taxi which we did a few times. A horse carriage is well worth a go to explore the town. The kids club is well run and a nice escape from the sun even if you just want to pop in for an hour to do some painting etc. Just two suggestions for the hotel to consider (1) There is a separate family pool which is good so you don't feel self conscious about disturbing other peoples quiet vacation. But it would be good if they had a slide or fountains in the pool area to keep the kids amused. (2) staying during Ramadan is fine although the dinner buffet is exactly the same every night and became tiresome - I think this was also because one of the restaurants was closed at the time for renovation. I would happily recommend this hotel to any families.

Beautiful hotel fab service clean friendly would definitely return if back in Marrakesh. My only disappointment was Breakfast buffet overpriced and underwhelming. pool area is great lovey to have adults only.

Loved the delightful grounds the gardens the flowing waters - beautifully authentic. Staff are discrete but everywhere - we even had our glasses cleaned at the pool!! All the staff were attentive and engaging. Good security all round: hotel has a car to take you to the old town and back after dinner. Our breakfast waiter Mohamed was terrific too. Coming back for sure.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Alejandro S wrote a review Jun 2017
Review_Text: Four Season in Marrakech is decorated with a local touch with taste. The hotel is what you expect in a Four Seasons big rooms superb bed and good bathroom. Service outstanding and all the staff is very professional.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The rooms are very good. Modern with Moroccan decor. Kept very clean. Bathrooms spacious and modern.    The hotel is magical at night. It really comes alive.    Service was very good. Very personal. I had a few issues (see below) and they were resolved promptly and beyond expectations. Rita on the front desk was awesome.    Security was amazing.    The food was very good. I travelled during Ramadan and the ftour buffet was great with awesome nightly live music.    Concierge organised a few tours. All ran very smoothly. Marrakech is an astounding place to visit.    Gym and fitness facilities also very good for a hotel. With great seperate cardio and weight rooms. Plus tennis courts and coaching.    The pools were very nice. The quiet pool was really nice. I was lucky enough to have my own villa with plunge pool.    Issues: I checked in and was put in a suite near the children's pool which was noisy. Which is expected. It's a resort that caters to families. I rang and asked to change rooms. Within 2 hours I was moved to a huge private villa. So quiet. Also I lost my camera and the kind security staff found it for me. I felt quite embarrassed:)    The response to the issues raised was so fantastic. It made the stay even more enjoyable.    I will definitely return.

Four Seasons in Marrakesh was amazing. The hotel grounds and room were beautiful. The staff was very accommodating. The spa was spectacular and very relaxing. The pool was great. The restaurant and lounge had a variety of alcoholic beverages. Highly recommended!!

Review_Date: Kia O wrote a review Jun 2017
Review_Text: We chose to go to the Four Seasons because a friend recommended it for its pool & kids club. From that point of view we were not disappointed. The building garden pool etc. are beautiful. It is a great place to rest & relax provided that neither service or food bothers you. Service in particular is erratic & bad. All started with a chaotic check-in a few other guests complaining the fact that the 3 times I wanted them to book a restaurant it was a joke they do not pick up the phone at the reception and if they do they will not really book for you. Ahh and in one occasion i wanted them to book a particular place and they told me they advised against my choice because it was not on its 'recommended list' sending us to another one instead. I explained to them that we wanted to eat good food. Their 'recommended place' was certainly not good and we ended up not having main course. So... even that was a failure. Service at their own restaurants is also hit & miss. You may get your food but no cutlery it takes a v long time to get served and do not be surprised if they bring you what you did not order or that they forgot completely about your drinks...the list continues. The Italian restaurant had loud 'rave music'. The food is also hit & miss. Ah... and if you want to leave the hotel be prepared to wait up to 20 mins to get a taxi. They have the grand total of 1 courtesy car for the whole hotel. And it is impossible to walk anywhere. We have been to many Four Seasons around the world mostly because you can rely on having great service and a good experience. This one is certainly the one we will not go back to.

The staff on the front desk are rude in particular Abraheim. If you would like to be mocked/laughed at whilst paying for a 5 star hotel then this is the place for you. The pool is dirty and no clean towels were available. Lunch/drinks were cleared away at the end of the day only. Food orders were constantly forgot and you would have to repeat yourself 5 times before getting what you needed.

Review_Date: Tiffany M wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: My husband and I decided to splurg and stay at the Four Seasons Marrakech for the last night of our honeymoon thinking we'd get the ultimate attention and service! What we received was a true let down! To start we had to wait over 2hrs for our room even though we filled our a survey stating our arrival time. We paid a hefty sum for airport transfers upon arrival because the hotel didn't offer complimentary service. The staff did nothing special for us because it was our honeymoon let alone even say congratulations! We felt pushed aside and disrespected. A luxury resort should know better and offer personalized experiences based on the type of stay...maybe a complimentary honeymoon drink? Hardly! The staff by the pool forgot our drink order completely and nothing was taken off the bill. Needless to say we will not be back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I had a miserable experience with Air France no luggage for 5 days and not one offer to help. However the hotel helped to make it a better experience and your food is fantastic and your help very pleasant and helpful Thank you so much.

Beautiful hotel that feels intimate even though it is a big space. Friendly and thoughtful staff who always have the best recommendations on where to go and what to do. Two big gorgeous pools with perfect temp. Three restaurants with great food. The rooms are bright and beautiful and spacious. All have a little outdoor space the best part of it being a little reading rook. Cleaning of rooms is impeccable especially Sana who is so sweet and kind and does the best job of making your room fresh every time.

Review_Date: Michelle G wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: A wonderful oasis close to the heart of Marrakesh. The resort is superb beautifully maintained with lovely gardens and incredibly attentive staff. Our room was luxuriously excellent and had a private sunny garden. The restaurants with their friendly efficient staff and excellent food ( the breakfast buffet is to die for!) made the whole experience totally enjoyable we will definitely be returning!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Been in El Mamounia The Pearl La Sultana ...  Four Seasons Resort M only looks great the service is POOR. Behind the sweet smiles ZERO. Only ladies&gents at the front desk speak English. Personell: If you don't speak FR you are lost.  The resort is poorly organized to find a SPA or GYM (which are located far away from you walk without NO directions written nowhere...impossible to find without asking the hotel stuff running around 2-3 times. Did you guys ever heard of the signpost with the directions???    Food: the worst I ever tried in Marrakesh no taste at all presentation ZERO but the prices like in El Mamounia. Ordered a breakfast to the room: the stuff brought the eggs with NO cloche on it cold and disgusting. Fruit salad: not fresh with lot of water cheese: dry...Bred: two prices of toast like tomorrow is a war!!! The birds began immediately to eat this as there was no protection at all at the dishes. Also no protection at the "yesterday's freshly made orange juice"...Service: ZERO! No need to say that the moving table stayed at the terrace the whole day after B.    The pool: very dirty water beware of swimming. As I use waterglasses I saw lot of white paper dirt hair dead insects...Food at the pool: small untasty portions "yesterday's fresh pressed orange guice"...    If you forgot a comb at home be prepared to wait at least for ONE HOUR for a hotel comb. The room service said : yes ma'am. No reaction after it. Called front desk 3-4 times the guy said: A... COMB??? Yes a comp or peigne please!!! Apparently no this words in his lexicon - no ENG no FR. No reaction after it. Room serviced arrived: nice smiling lady I even showed to her how to use it - barely played brushing of the hair - she did not understand nothing....After 30 mins a European manager arrived immediately got what I need .... After the poor breakfast dirty pool water low-quality snacks at the pool and long-term waiting of the comb I was completely destroyed.    Room cleaning service: the bell is ringing. A woman comes inside asking "service?". Yes please - my answer. The woman goes back the door slashes. She never returns. That happened in Four Seasons Resort Marrakesh to me at least 5-6 times during 4 days. Another variation: 9pm - me&my bf are sleeping on the bed. The door bell rings a man immediately comes into the room after 2 seconds. My bf says: No! Thank you we don't need nothing. The guy leaves. After 30 seconds the bell rings: sevice??? We say: No!!! Another guy runs into the room....    I can strongly advice you: stay away from this place will save you time&money. The beauty of the Resort can not cover the terrible service AT ALL

Gorgeous large property with amazing service. You could drop this property anywhere in the world and it would be among the very best. Suites have private plunge pool & lounge chairs nightly music on the terrace lovely continental restaurant.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tere A wrote a review May 2017
Review_Title: Outstanding and overwhelmed by the orientation to details
Review_Text: Entering the place alone you can relate to a dream from an arabic story book. The decoration and the vegetation from the lobby to your room is breath taking. Staff is 100 pct making sure you have a good time trying to anticipate your needs.  Food ambiance it is all top class.  Fantastic breakfast lovely pools to relax. Spa is superb

Review_Date: Claudia D wrote a review May 2017
Review_Title: Four Seasons Marrakech unique retreat after a day at the vibrant city
Review_Text: Excellent resort with most friendly and thoughtful staff. I loved to explore Marrakech and come back to my retreat. Great pools super friendly staff which is important when you travel solo. Excellent food. Loved the marrocan breakfast and the tea. The tea is wonderful. Will come back with friends.

I can not say enough about the hotel and it's staff. They arranged a guide for us to get around the first day really a must. The hotel is really a quiet oasis on the edge of the city that you need after the craziness of the Medina but still just a very short cab ride. Marrakech is one of the most fascinating places I have been.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A beautiful hotel for a relaxing and luxirious break. We are regular customer of the Four Seasons in Marrackech and we usually go there with our 2 children for the New Year oir Easter. This time we went in May (the days are much longer and the sun much stronger!) with 4 friends. The place is approaching perfection although the pool area is not cleaned regularly which is a pity. Apart from that the staff the rooms the atmosphere are just great. We will definitly return and this will be our 6th stay!

Beautiful hotel great lobby great pool at perfect temperature with chilled fruit and other treats. Above all staff fantastic - unfailingly polite and nothing too much trouble. Trip was was for my wife's birthday and could not have been more perfect.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I 'ce been with friends in Marrakech and we got accomodation in Four Season Resort . After some strange expirience in other hotels in Casablanca and Fez we enjoy this place and we find comfort . Prices according to the hotel quality  nice brekfast  clean rooms  nice staff . Liquers beat expansive  but this is in all hotels in Morroco ( where you are able to find it )  So generaly speaking it was a pleasant place to stay in !

Me and my husband spent only 3 days in this hotel but we will never forget this stay. The atmosphere was really magic  all the staff so kind and service so excellent. Everything was really perfect. We will be back as soon as possible.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lizz C wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: We stay at a 4Ss once a year or so we got married in one. We have always left beaming and happy even with the 5-star prices. However this time we felt a bit cheated for 4Ss. Yes it's all relative but for its branding price etc you start to expect above and beyond quality and service. The cons: Check-in was ridiculous. We were not even greeted once we got to the reception as the one person was on the phone and did not even crack a smile. Once we checked-in we went to get lunch as we arrived early 1:30pm. We were told that they would come get us when the room was ready. Mind you I checked-in the day before online so they knew we'd be early. We of course knew that the room may not available until 3 pm as that's the check in time but hoped for an earlier one given the advance notice. Anyway we got lunch and it was 3 pm with nobody coming to us. We did not have a room number to sign the meal to our daughter was annoyed that she could not go into the pool or rest and after a 2 hour drive from the coast we all felt cheated. We asked the restaurant manager to call reception and een after 3 calls could not get a hold of anybody. Finally at 3:30 pm we were taken to our room. Overall calling reception was a pain we would call over 3 times to get a hold of them as nobody would answer. Dine-in service was a joke. They were always late and again this is crucial as we ate in our room often as we did not feel comfortable leaving our daughter asleep. This meant that timing was important. Either we would be left hungry they would ring the bell once she's asleep and the worst was half the meals itself were terrible. DO NOT ORDER PAD THAI. Why would anybody order that in Marrakech you may ask? I'm pregnant so don't ask what my fetus is craving. That's beside the point. It's in the menu it's the 4S I thought it'd be safe. It was awful and it was a stew! Anyway order food with caution as you won't be getting the value. The pros: It is quite perfect for kids. The pool has floating toys smoothies and ice creams (complimentary) are given out and if your kids are old enough the kid's club is nicely set up. The service was nice and good by everybody else aside from the reception.

Marrakech has a good combination of short flight from London hot enough to swim outside in April and loads of culture. The Four Seasons is nice and the staff friendly and charming but there are a few things that they're still fixing. We were really pleased to find a hotel with decent pool just 10 mins from the airport and the city and we swam every day over Easter. The menus were ok but not exciting though we understand they're revamping them. Having said that the quality of preparation was amazing - the chefs are really talented. Lunches by the pool were especially good.    There are 2 pools one for adults and another for families; the family one has a heated section which is great if you're with small children and can't swim around and there is a kids' club right by the pool - wonderful for parents who need a rest and still want to be near the children. (We didn't use the kids' club so can't comment on its quality.) The adult pool has little tent-style shelters with moveable curtains so you can have sun or shade. We had drinks including tea/coffee brought to us as well as lunch on a lap-tray so we didn't have to leave the pool at all. Late afternoon there was free icecream poolside - a nice surprise.    We had a pavilion room which was close to the pool and had a nice view partly of the hotel and partly of the city roofs beyond. It was a huge room with plenty of space even for our teenager's extra bed and unlike some 3rd beds at hotels it was full size and comfortable. We didn't like the toiletries and regretted not bringing our own. Room service breakfast was good (and 1 continental was enough for 3 of us).    We got totally ignored one meal - couldn't place our order the food didn't come and then the bill didn't come. But the restaurant manager duty manager and hotel manager swung into action and made a lot of effort to make us feel better. We had champagne and macaroons sent in apology and I had a charming email - we felt that we were being listened to.    The wifi is quite good (sometimes you can't get it but the coverage was better than in a lot of hotels we've been to) including at the pool. Reception staff were super-helpful advising us on taxi charges and attractions/restaurants in town.    The gardens are stunning. I went for a walk along the jogging track every morning and the scents of the flowers and the dawn chorus were a joy. Everywhere you go in the hotel there are beautiful and scented plants. The trees are full of birds. We saw butterflies and dragonflies skimming the swimming pool.    So all in all we are confident enough of having a good time here to be looking forward to a return trip. The things that matter are in place (room pool nice staff who knew our names facilities managers really focused on guests). There are hundreds of amazing restaurants a short taxi ride away so if one doesn't like the food one has plenty of choice. And there's so much of Marrakech and beyond to explore.

Review_Title: Four seasons is Not A Four seasons.
Review_Text: Not a good experience. services take ages and when it is delivered it's not accurate. staff need to be trained to work under pressure properly. For the value of money the hotel doesn't worth to stay in.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: W Fredric G wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: ideally situated in Marrakech for shopping-----Menara mall-----Koutoubia mosque Majorelle gardens etc........lush property with fountains and date palms everywhere and two fabulous swimming pools.........great restaurants and fit shop........superb service
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The service was exceptional. Nothing was too much trouble. The property and grounds are stunning. I also was very impressed by the spa and had several treatments. If I could have stayed longer I gladly would have.

Review_Title: Still lovely hotel but need more choice in evening .
Review_Text: Ok  So I'm  Going to come across as a diva here but a few things which were not great.  I have stayed in some amazing places in Dubai and the service here Just doesn't much up.  This was my 4th visit and they never acknowledged that. You normally get nice welcome drink but had to pay for coke.  Was not informed they had moved the breakfast so  Was wondering around in the morning.  Service very good at breakfast but did not find the choice that inspiring.  Room  Was lovely but had ants in bath and they had yo come twice to get rid but I was mot offered another room  It took ages to get hold of reception and room service . You had to call at least 3 times.  The pool area is lovely but find it annoying that people can leave books there in morning and not return till afternoon!  Amazing spa !  I would stay here again though but just wish they had much places to eat in evening.

Review_Date: Megan H wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: My husband and I spent four nights here experiencing two different room categories. The Pool View Terrace Room was first. We liked it's close proximity to the main building and view of the pool. The room was very comfortable. Our second room was an Upper Pavilion Room which I loved. The high ceiling and double balcony made it open and airy. So beautiful. We wish we could have spent more time here. We had a lot of tours and activities planned so we didn't have a lot of time at the resort. I will say that the security here is top notch so you really feel safe even though I felt safe everywhere in Marrakech. The people are so warm and welcoming. I was really blown away. We will definitely return probably in later spring when it's warmer. It was cool and rainy when we were there. We did get to enjoy the spa which was fantastic and ate at the restaurants which were all beautiful with delicious food.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nita W wrote a review May 2017
Review_Text: We couldn't have enjoyed ourselves more for a short stay. The food and amenities at the Four Seasons were stellar as was service and attention to details. The location for perfect for what we needed to do every member of the staff that I encountered were more than hospitable. Thank you for a great stay!

We've been lucky enough to stay in some good hotels in recent years in Dubai and elsewhere. When visiting Marrakech we were drawn to the Four Seasons brand name we knew it would be expensive but expected it to deliver a 5 star experience. Sadly this was not the case. It falls short on many levels.    Pros:  - The rooms were kept meticulously clean and we were very impressed with this.  - Pool staff. The pool staff went out of their way to engage with our kids and always had an eye on what was going on in the pool area.  - Free ice creams around the pool in the afternoon.  - The hotel is generous with drinking water.    Cons  - Levels of service. There are two levels of staff. White shirts and those in blue suits. We found that those in white shirts weren't of the standard you'd expect from Four Seasons e.g. when we asked for a glass of wine one guy bought us an empty wine glass. When we asked about where the wine was he just assumed we wanted white. We have too many examples of dodgy service to count here. The guys in the blue suits were amazingly attentive though.  - Variety of meals - There are only really two supper spots here so after two days you've maxed your options out.  - Managing the guests - There were drunk and rowdy guests around the pool who ended up running around the hotel later at night. You'd expect the hotel to intervene but they didn't.  - Bodged booking - Our rooms weren't ready for checkin until after 4pm.  - Quality of room fit - The rooms are of high specification but are dated.  - Wifi - Frustratingly slow.  - Kids club - overly geared to little ones so older kids ended up getting bored.    We spent half the week complaining which was exhausting. We eventually complained to the GM who was receptive and accommodating. If you're considering booking here manage your expectations about value for money. The staff are friendly and everyone does their best but this does not compare to a Dubai hotel.

Beautiful hotel. Messy breakfast. Good service. Good food. Tennis is expensive. 5 star welcome. Nice staff.  I recommande this hotel but the rooms were very expensive. It's morocco not New York City for God's sake!

From our pre-trip planning with the concierge to the warm good-by from the general manager we could not have been more pleased with our stay. Our suite was spacious well appointed and more than all the comforts of home. In keeping with the Four Seasons tradition of 'sense of place' this hotel and amenities brought out the best of Moroccan culture and Marrakech hospitality. The most remarkable part of our stay however was the warm friendly and genuine hospitality we received from every member of the staff that we interacted with--from the general manager to the housekeepers-- this was a flawless and gracious stay for us. Our only regret was that we did not have longer to stay and enjoy this most remarkable hotel in a most remarkable destination.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Lovely way to spend our anniversary
Review_Text: We wanted to come to Morocco for a long time and Marrakech was only a short flight away from us.    The Four Seasons is a great place to relax and escape the busy streets.  Great pools (adults only) services is good. Food ok good gym facilities and I'm sure the spa is good also.    Small things missing like being informed one of the main restaurant was closed and where breakfast was moved to rom services menu no in room.    Found out there is a very handy Four Seasons app but would of been better if I was told about it.    Great place to stay for a short break good facilities and location small tweaks would make it amazing
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Lovely hotel. We are here three days. Outside of town. Tight security. Food is good. Service at meals a little slow. Courteous attentive service. Rooms are great. Large property. Swimming pool and workout facility. Italian restaurant was s good respite from tagine.

Where do I begin from... a Reception that you have to ring 4x to get a reply. Fruit in the room that stinks of fish. Absolutely terrible service at the lobby restaurant. It took forever to get served and the food was simply mediocre.    The garden furniture (mattresses and cushions chairs) are very dusty and have dirt stains from bird crap.    There are way better hotels in Marrakech and the Four seasons has definitely lost its standing.    Positives: polite staff

Review_Date: Salvador H wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Title: A real resort in the middle of the city
Review_Text: The accommodation in this hotel is extraordinary. Organized as clusters of 4 rooms in each this hotel has everything to claim that is a resort. Luxury bedrooms and very ample. Breakfast is really a banquet. Great choice.

Review_Date: Alan C wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Text: When heading to Marrakech consider the Four Seasons as an option. The resort offers all the amenities on par with all the other top resorts in the city without the extremely high prices some charge.  The rooms are very comfortable with very large bathrooms. There are several restaurants to choose from and a nice buffet set-up every morning.  The adult pool is a nice touch not having to deal with all the children at certain times of the calendar year.  Put this hotel on your list of options when visiting the city.

Review_Title: Very nice !! Great hotel just search before some tips as concierge has limited options.
Review_Text: Very good hotel and time of the year to join I didn't like the visit to Atlas mountain given the hours to stay in the car so just organize and research prior. Hotel is great and aligned with pricing of other luxury hotels there
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We decided to return to this hotel after having enjoyed it so much last year . We were not disappointed. We were upgraded to a fabulously spacious one bedroom apartment with a huge balcony overlooking the pool and gardens. This is a very pretty property and the gardens are constantly being maintained and tended .  The family pool is where we spent all of our time with our very active seven year old. The feeling and atmosphere is very friendly and the kids very quickly interact and find friends.  The staff are very friendly and helpfulbut we chose always to have lunch in the super Azzera restaurant. Here the food is freshly prepared and to a very high standard. We were never disappointed and I enjoyed many vegetarian inventions from the chef.  In the evenings we tended to eat at Inara and enjoy the view from the terrace over the gardens and ornamental pools. The service was mainly very good although sometimes a little slow but the waiters are never short of a smile especially Moosa who was particularly friendly and great with my daughter and her little friends. What was also a great improvement was the introduction of live entertainment. This is largely background music provided by two fabulous guitarist/ singers and a Russian Jazz singer playing a wide variety of Spanish classical music through to jazz and popular covers.For me this made a massive difference. We ate in the Italian restaurant which was superb. I like others would love a permanent extra eating option and the upper terrace on the top of 'Bleu d'orange would be a lovely place to have cocktails and tapas style food.  My husband was impressed with the gym and used it daily.The rooms were serviced beautifully and we found all of the staff to be very helpful and polite .The Manger Blaise was very present and introduced himself . He was very friendly and keen to know how our stay was going and whether there was anything he could help us with. I have a feeling that this hotel will continue to iron out any problems and continue to strive to provide a top quality experience.Having totally relaxed and thoroughly enjoyed ourselves for the second year running I suspect that an annual visit here could definitely be on the cards.

Review_Title: Not what you would expect for Four Seasons
Review_Text: Tired property. Reception staff unhelpful  Restaurant staff didn't speak/understand English and got orders wrong.  Property was tired overall and in need of a major upgrade.    I have to think that the Four Seasons brand has gone downhill since Izzy left.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: priscille E wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Text: confortable hotel but very laxist management which means the employees do as they please and you have to tip everybody to get some service a table at the retaurant or or a chair at the pool even people not staying at the hotel have priority ! some customers put a magazine on a lounge chair early in the morning and might show up in the late afternoon nobody cares even if the houses rules stipulate that you cannot reserve a seat for more than 30mn! no supervision! the adult pool is occupied by kids again no action from the hotel...not the level of service we expected from a 5 star hotel the situation is not ideal either you have to wait a lot for taxis. the garden is nice and there is a good fitness we won't be back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Good hotel but a "B" for Four Seasons
Review_Text: We have been here for the last week. Nice complex good location. Reasonable food prices (for a 4S). Housekeeping excellent. Internet is good. A/C is good. Rooms are spacious and well-designed.    Lots of small problems though that indicate this place is not well managed. Some examples - first night we had to ask three times for crayons for our kids at dinner several times it took extremely long for simple things like coffee or tea to arrive at breakfast lots of the silverware in the restaurants is bent and/or has dried food on it often when we call the front desk or concierge there is simply no answer (at other 4S hotels it always transfers the call to the operator). Our bed is quite worn out has big depressions in it. The restaurants really struggle when they are more than half full. There are lots of employees but they don't have good operational systems so the service drops quickly. Lots of workers on site claim to speak English but don't really so we frequently had language barrier issues. Kids club not really staffed all day like at other 4S locations.    One bright note was Kacem a server at the pool bar. Like many folks at other 4S hotels he really put out an effort to get to know us and customize the service.    We may come back here but after having lunch at the Mandarin where the food and service were much better we think we will try that or the Mamounia next time.

Having been here briefly once before the family were unanimous about where to stay for a five night Easter break. Overall we had a great experience. The grounds are secure substantial and very well maintained. The pool area is beautiful and doesn't feel too busy. The staff make this resort. They are well trained efficient plentiful and very friendly. The rooms are excellent although just beginning to show the tiniest bit of wear and tear. If there is a disappointment it is that the resort could do with more restaurant options as the evening is limited to two. A temporary solution is in place during renovation of one of them but even after reopening there will still only be two. They are good and family friendly but I feel a hotel of this size and standard needs a proper third option.

We've just returned from a 10 night trip staying at Four Seasons throughout. We've been Dubai visitors in the 3 preceding years during the Easter holidays. Last year we felt the cost of Dubai had become ridiculous and that was before Brexit hammered the pound further. So we looked for somewhere offering Easter sun quality accommodation easy flights but less extortionate.    Marrakesh and Four Seasons was what we chose. Going into the holiday I was nervous that despite it costing less than 50% of our previous Dubai trips we'd made a mistake. Holidays with our young kids are precious as these years will be passed in a flash and I don't want to mess any of them up.    I shouldn't have worried at all. It was an absolutely superb holiday. Easy flights from London no jet lag no time difference hotel 15 minutes from airport. People of Morocco incredibly nice welcoming and very keen to encourage tourists as they recognise how important it is to the economy. Marrakesh for the most part very pretty and outside of the city when you go into the mountains it is exceptionally beautiful.    With respect to the hotel I agree with all the positive comments you can find in other reviews. I have very few negative impressions - more on site dinner options would be great but that would stop you venturing out so much which would have been a great shame. Once in Marrakesh you do not feel at all unsafe with the possible exception of the Jemaa el-Fnaa famous square. My advice is don't bother with it - it's just a horrid tourist trap with animal cruelty on show and constant pestering from merchants. If you go to the mountains you can find all the same stuff on sale in far prettier and far less aggressive environments and without monkeys on neck chains and snakes being thrust onto your children without asking.    There are endless restaurant choices across the city; it can be a bit hit or miss on quality and service but that's in part my own fault for not properly looking into it in advance. The two restaurants at the hotel are excellent.    The four seasons family swimming pool is superb for the children. The pictures on the web site make it look very pretty and well designed but a little austere. When you're there and its full of kids playing with one another and with the excellent kids club staff its a very different area all together and better for it. One half of it is unheated and not surprisingly isn't used as much. Perhaps they should heat it too if only is it gets used a bit more.    Lifeguard wise around the the pool it is safe enough and adequately monitored such that you relax. Where we stayed in Dubai it was too but excessively so where the lifeguards stopped even the lightest of horseplay amongst the kids. At the 4 season they let the children play and jump in and mess around and that made for so much more fun for them. Ayoub is a fantastic lifeguard and amazing at entertaining the kids. Service round the pool from Rachid & Marouane is fantastic.    Nothing is too much trouble for the staff at the 4 seasons and we are intending returning next year at the same time.

We stayed at the Four seasons for 5 days in February 2017! One of the best hotels and resorts we have ever stayed in!    Our room was gorgeous the staff were amazing! 5 star service all the way!!!! Can't wait to go back ❤️❤️❤️❤️
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I sometimes wish there was a sixth star or a half star to use on the tripadvisor rating. This hotel is a good case in point  compared with other hotels ive been lucky enough to stay in  it shouldn't rate as high as some of them but giving it less than a five wouldnt be fair as the hotel is pretty good. The grounds and staff are lovely. The hotel is about 5/6 years old and our room was looking a little little bit tired not really a problem at the moment but could be if furnishings are not kept an eye on. For me a true judge of a hotel is would i go back to it and i would. The position is very good being quite close to the Medina and really close to the airport . When i first started staying at Four Seasons properties many years ago they were heads and shoulders above the rest. I feel that many hotels have now overtaken them  maybe not in service but room technology has really moved on with sophisticated AV  lighting and other conveniences  not a pop here just more an observation.

We had a wonderful 4 days at the Four Seasons. We were a family of 4 with 2 children ages 6 and 8. The resort caters for everyone really. The children can make as much noise as they like in the amazing family pool. There are life guards food and drink service by the pool. They come round with complimentary ice creams and smoothies during the day. The kids club was also amazing and staffed with professionals.  For the adults there was a gorgeous spa where I had a great massage. The food at the resort is good and there is also an adult pool away from the noise.  The hotel dealt with a minor allergy incident with my daughter (my fault not the hotels) and were excellent throughout the trip - I can't thank them enough.  They arranged restaurants in the evening for us and were generally great. Would definitely recommend and will be back. Thanks to all the staff!

Review_Title: Practically perfect as perfection does not exist!
Review_Text: I thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the hotel. The staff makes all your wishes come true with smile and kindness - I will be back and highly suggest you too book without any hesitation if you want to find haven in this beautiful town

This clearly is a super popular resort (full over the week before Easter 2017) with a well heeled clientele. I had stayed at Amanjena once before.    I had a bad trip getting there (15 hours rather than the planned 5) and my luggage was lost and in the event didn't turn up for 3 days. The hotel staff led by the Head Concierge Ghita recognised my plight and that I wasn't so happy on the first day and they went out of their way to help me. It felt to me like they had assigned staff around the hotel to make sure I had a great time throughout my stay (e.g. they all knew my name) which they succeeded in doing.    I stayed in a one bedroom suite which is very large inside and out and well appointed. The only point I would note given I was travelling solo is that my room faced out onto the children's pool so it had consequent noise during the day. I personally spent my time during the day when I was there at the adult's only pool. The flip side of this is that overall it appeared to me to be a very family friendly place.    As an experience I strongly recommend a trip to the Atlas Mountains. I took a drive in a Range Rover with a chap from the hotels's recommended car service named Sabre and he took me on a tour of a Berber village and then up to the Mountains to meet a local guide nicknamed Obama as he looks like the former American President. A walk on the rough trail up to the waterfall at the top is both challenging and rewarding not for the faint-hearted. Sabre also took me to his mother' house in the town at the end of the walk to see how the locals live which was very interesting.    Finally the hotel has one of the best Spa's I have seen anywhere both aesthetically and also in terms of the treatments offered.

Very impressed with Four Seasons Marrakech. Relative to other high end destinations like Thailand Maldives Carribean etc this offers much better value for money. Will go back for sure and April was a great time to visit.

Review_Date: Paul W wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Text: Just simply superb: Outstanding Hotel Design and Decor Excellent Service and Great Food.  Not too mention the lovely grounds- Good location to Old City as well.  Nice Pool and Fountain views.  Highly recommended particularly when the weather is pleasant.

Everything is fantastic. Only less than stellar aspect is food quality and selection but it is still fine actually very fairly priced for the level of property and also very child friendly for families.  I will be staying here again with my family.

Review_Title: Another wonderful experience at the Four Seasons
Review_Text: We came to Marrakech for yet another April visit and came back to our favourite place to stay - the FOUR SEASONS resort. As usual the level of service was fantastic - always friendly and helpful without being too obsequious. The staff at the Four Seasons do everything they can to make your stay the best it can be. After an initial issue on the first day the management were able to resolve the problem and go that extra step to make the visit a very special one. The resort is spacious with amazing gardens and two large swimming pools - one for families and children the other pool for a quieter experience.  There is a really good lunch time restaurant at the pool side and two other places to dine. Room service is superb and the breakfasts are always something to look forward to. Thoroughly recommend - we have stayed there four times to date.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We have just returned from a wonderful five night stay at the Four Seasons with two of our three girls (4yrs and 13yrs). We were upgraded without any fuss to the Presidential suite due to a confusion with our booking - this was a wonderful treat. the room was immaculate as was the whole of the hotel and grounds. The dining options were great and the atmosphere at the hotel was relaxed for guests ie not too formal despite the luxury nature of the hotel. Free snacks around the pool during the day were a lovely touch. The only thing I would recommend is that if you want to go on day trips tours to the medina you will need to ask as there is no literature in the rooms about what you could do while in Marrakech and no mention about things to do outside the hotel. We made our own arrangements to go to the mountains and zip wiring. Kids club was great - well stocked with games and activities. Overall a fantastic visit.

I feel fortunate to have stayed here. It is four star in every respect. All of your wishes are granted before you even know you want them. The staff here is so kind and accommodating. They are always arranging activities they think guests will like and will make any arrangements you request outside of the resort as well.    The rooms are beautifully appointed and the restaurants are top notch. There is a variety of styles to suit your mood from the elegant cocktail bar in the lobby to the tiki style bar at the pool.    It is also family friendly including a pool for families so your children can play freely without worrying about disturbing other guests who are looking for a more peaceful environment.    I will return and highly recommend it.

Review_Date: Alberto C wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Text: Nice hotel  close to airport clean  comfortable ! the SPA and Gym are modern but the hammam and sauna not functioning correctly ! the room is great but no reading light when in bed ! the two restaurants offer limited program
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The french restaurant at the hotel was superb! Our waiter Tarek was so incredible it made us feel like we had a friend. Very proffesional and you could tell he loved his Job. All the personnel at the hotel was well trained and willing to accomodate all your needs.

Review_Date: Hanna W wrote a review Apr 2017
Review_Text: A lovely week staying in one of the amazing villas. Beautiful resort. Have to say the restaurant was absolutely fabulous also. Excellent food and the service was outstanding. We were very well looked after by Tarik who arranged for a birthday cake for the birthday we were celebrating and some wine on the house whilst waiting for the buggy to take us back to our Villa. Great experience all round!

Would highly recommend this hotel it was immaculate the staff were friendly really enjoyed our stay which was only 3 nights could easily have stayed longer. Only 15 minutes from the airport and close to town they arranged transport when needed and a guide to show us around an excellent choice of hotel.

Review_Title: Away from the Medina and Souk
Review_Text: After visiting several cities in Morocco we ended our trip in a most pampering way -- a stay at the Four Seasons Marrakech.    The location is away from the medina but a short drive to the center of the old town.    The room upgrade was most welcome the huge room and bath were elegantly furnished the bed so comfortable.    The staff was very helpful attentive and friendly.    Truly an experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The staff at Four Seasons Marrakech are most welcoming and helpful. The expansive property and amenities are first class. We ate in the restaurant one evening and the food was quite good. The Hammam experience is a must try. Lunch by the pool was delicious and well prepared. My room was on the ground floor and had a private patio that led to a garden walk.

Wanted a special long weekend for a special birthday for my wife. The resort was beautiful and the staff went out of their way to make her celebration special. Flowers cake snacks and recognition from many staff members. They also helped with activities in the town.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Honestly the best hotel I have stayed in. The food the people and the grounds were all incredible. Nothing was too much to ask. The entire staff were so friendly and wonderful to us you felt like you were old friends! The food was delicious! the grounds were beautifully kept and just gorgeous. I loved my stay here.

Review_Title: Fantastic hotel. Amazing staff. Wifi not great!
Review_Text: We had a fantastic time here and everything was lovely. Great breakfast amazing staff. Especially reception! The pool area was lovely. Did not like the shampoo and bits in the rooms. Fab food by the pool restaurant.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Leave the craziness of the Medina and the throng of tourists behind! Upon entering this lovely oasis you will be pampered in a most lovely fashion. Everything is top notch from the rooms to the service. And do not miss out on a personal hammam! Ooh la la!! You will never regret staying here.

Review_Date: Claudia C wrote a review Mar 2017
Review_Text: Excellent experience in every aspect. Great pool area wonderful breakfast lounge excellent and personal service and spatious bedrooms. Location great in a nice garden only 5 minutes by taxi to the center.

Review_Date: Queen Aqu R wrote a review Mar 2017
Review_Text: This was hands down the best vacation I ever had I will be back the hotel was beautiful inside and out.........and the service was out of this world. I loved every minute of my vacation only wish it was longer.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My husband and I stay at alot of hotels but this Four Seasons really stood out. The resort is absolutely beautiful and serene. The service is personalized and outstanding. Rooms are great and pristine. Already wanting to go back to Morocco just to stay here again. Restaurants are great and the grounds are well kept.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: J migd wrote a review Mar 2017
Review_Text: Impeccable. Can not fault in any way. Everyone went the extra mile to make my birthday stay 5* and memorable. The grounds are beautifully landscaped and the pools beautiful. It was a delight to sit on the veranda and just admire the grounds. Despite being fully booked the hotel manages to achieve privacy through its clever design and great use of tree planting. The staff at the four seasons are super nice and friendly and were a delight to always deal with. The staff made our stay even more special. Highly recommend and will definitely return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: "If you don't leave, you can't come back!"
Review_Text: My Aunt used to always say "If you don't leave you can't come back" to my young daughter when after an action-packed visit she didn't want to go home. Well after a recent week-long action-packed stay at the lovely Four Seasons Resort Marrakech my wife (now older) daughter and I did not want to leave! And we definitely want to come back!    You know a resort has been a success when you are sad to depart not just because you will miss the beautiful setting the relaxing room and the fantastic food but also because you feel as if many members of the staff have become personal friends! That was the case for us. We were particularly impressed with the front desk and concierge staff -- including Badr Salma Safia and others -- who took care of every request promptly accurately and with good cheer. Likewise the food and beverage team responded to my wife's special dietary needs with professionalism and a genuine interest in her well-being. We owe a particular debt of gratitude to Chef Marco in the main restaurant who came out each night to greet my wife personally and then prepared a different dish and dessert based on the limited list of ingredients that are safe for her to eat. As a result dinner became an eagerly anticipated event each day!    A few more highlights of our stay:    We took two day trips arranged by the hotel -- first to Essaouira on the Atlantic Ocean which was a nice change of scenery and then up through the Atlas Mountains to visit Ouarzazate and the ancient kasbah at Ait Ben Haddou which was simply incredible. Charaf -- our driver/guide on the 4-hour-each-way drive to Ouarzazate -- was an expert driver a knowledgeable guide and great companion for the day.    We stayed in a two-bedroom villa with private plunge pool. It was a splurge but very spacious beautifully decorated and very serene. My only minor complaint is that the huge outdoor patio is not as private as might be expected.    We made multiple visits to the Medina and newer sections of Marrakech and the location of the resort could not have been more central and convenient.
