Everything was within range of a ten to fifteen minute taxi ride including the international airport.    We usually stay in Four Season hotels and resorts when we travel because we know the service facilities and food will be exceptional. That was certainly the case in Marrakech. We were very sad to leave but we will come back!

Review_Title: Worst service ever experienced at a four seasons hotel
Review_Text: I was excited to stay at this hotel as it was a brand that I knew and loved for it's excellent standards however having booked a short 4 day visit I ended up experiencing such a stressful week having to demand the bare minimum from this hotel. First off the A/C in my room was so weak that it was practically boiling in my room it took them 2 days to fix it . Secondly I demanded a four season driver with a Mercedes to drive me to dinner golf ect...the driver would negotiate with me a time to come pick me up instead of actually waiting for me to be done ( and I specifically asked for the package where the driver stays with me all night) then he ended up being 25 mins late ! And this is supposed to be a premium service. Another issue was there were a few things in the room service menu that were missing for example the fois gras. Also I have always been used to hotels calling me when there was an issue however this hotel whenever there was a problem they would avoid calling me and would assume otherwise for example I was expecting a friend and she kindly went to the reception to be guided to my room or to the restaurant instead they attacked her and treated her as if she was a criminal for wanting to know where my room was and the problem is instead of calling me and asking me if I'm expecting a friend they just ignored her and left her in tears and I had to rush down to look for her. Horrible service definitely not a relaxing stay and will sadly choose an alternate 5 star hotel.

Review_Date: Debbie C M wrote a review Mar 2017
Review_Text: We Would thouroughly recommend this hotel it is precisely 8 mins by car from the airport. A beautiful hotel where the food is excellent and the team take great care to make your stay truly relaxing . Thank you.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Nice hotel, but really average food & ambience in restaurants.
Review_Text: Nice family hotel super for kids. Pool boys did everything to make our day. Nice location for everything. However the food and the generel ambience in all restaurants needs a serious upgrade in order to compete with what Marrakesh has to offer; e.g other lovely 5 star hotels top restaurants and beautiful riads ...

Awesome ! Our family spent four nights at this terrific property in Marrakech. The concierge Safia was proactive before our stay and arrange two rounds of golf multiple dinner reservations and tour guides. Requests were always met with a smile and helpfulness. Concerns about language barriers or safety in Morrocco are way over blown. The Moroccan people are kind and thoughtful. The Four Seasons is a great home base - close to the Medina and other interesting tourists destinations. We highly recommend Blue Orange the restraunt by the pool - ask for El Habib and his recommendations for food and wine - you will not be disappointed. My wife and daughters enjoyed the spa services. This was one of the best vacation stays we have ever had. We will be back !

Spa was devine pool and palm trees picturesque staff and service incredibly friendly. Staff called me by my name regardless where i was on the property. Landscaping perfect. Roses in the bathroom. Bed was large and comfortable.

I had to remember. My passport. Absolutely everything else was at the hotel from sun cream and hats to slippers and clothes. Very relaxing service impeccable and food healthy and delicious. I hope to come back same time every year for sun that England is so shy of in the winter.  However if there was one thing I would make better I would like to see more toiletries in the bathroom and when I use  for example cotton buds it is replenished with lots more.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Stayed here for a long weekend for a friends 40th birthday. Resort was quiet and not too busy. Staff were extremely friendly and helpful but not over the top. Genuinely nice people with no agenda. I.e only after good tips. Shopping mall cafes and restaurants a short 10 minutes walk away. We are out most nights as we found the hotel restaurant lacking in choice. We did however eat there one night and the food was traditionally Moroccan and very tasty. Smaller resort than where I have stayed in the past ( Kenzi manara resort ). Staff provided a shuttle bus to a local restaurant and have lots of good recommendations for eating out and shopping etc. Nothing was too much trouble. Already planning a return trip.

Review_Date: Alli D wrote a review Mar 2017
Review_Title: Gets the small details right, but sometimes misses the bigger picture
Review_Text: We have just returned from a wonderful stay at the Four Seasons - the room (Upper Pavilion) was large and roomy with a huge bed and the bathroom had the deepest bath I've seen. The terrace was beautiful and had table and chairs as well as Sun loungers and a lovely shady nook area. My one complaint was that I returned to the room at 2pm one afternoon and the room hadn't been cleaned. A quick call to housekeeping though and they sent someone immediately. The staff are friendly and will greet you with a smile as well as helping out - nothing is too much trouble for example I'd left a book by the side of the bed and when I returned a bookmark had been placed there and whenever we went outside the hotel we were given a bottle of water. It's these little things that make all the difference.  The food choice in the restaurants was a little small - one of the restaurants on the property was closed during our stay and being a taxi drive away from the Medina meant that there was a limited choice in an evening. There was also a limited choice for snacks during the day although when drinks were ordered they did come with small bowls of nuts and pitta chips. The food though is a good quality and was enjoyable.  The adult pool area is lovely and again the details such as iced water and small complimentary juices bought to the loungers are very welcome as well as the staff moving loungers and parasols to suit meant that a lazy day by the pool is exactly that.  The breakfast has a choice of buffet or a la carte - I can't comment on the a la carte but the buffet had a good choice of hot and cold dishes and breads with omelettes and fried eggs made to order. Unlimited orange juice and coffee is available and very good. My one complaint however is that the waiters forgot requests for additional coffee and juice as they seemed to cover all tables rather than concentrate on specific sections so this meant that we occasionally had two waiters turn up with the refills. This is the reason for only 4 stars rather than 5 as with a little more effort and organisation this issue could be resolved.  We did have the hotel organise a guide to take us around the Medina Bahia Palace and the Madrassa - this was a half day trip with Aziz who gave a detailed trip around the old city and the souks. It was a little expensive but we did see areas of the Medina that we probably wouldn't have seen without his guidance and he recommended a lovely restaurant for our lunch.  It was a great trip overall and the resort does get the small things right but does need to work on the breakfast service especially.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jennifer H wrote a review Mar 2017
Review_Text: We spent three delightful nights and four fantastic days at the Four Seasons Marrakech and it could not have been better. From the reception security and all the restaurant and pool staff we were treated so well in every exchange. Our three children thoroughly enjoyed hanging out in the teen center and of course playing by the pool. Two of the restaurants were being refurbished during our stay so we stuck to pool service for lunch room service and the Italian restaurant for dinner all I highly recommend. Buffet breakfast was delicious but pricey for a family of 5. I recommend all Americans traveling to the area to stay here you will have a bit of luxury and then you can pop into the Medina for the culture.

Spent 2 nights here with my boyfriend during a long weekend getaway to Marrakech. We both wanted somewhere where we could relax with quality service and we were not disappointed!    The resort is beautiful with spacious grounds 2 large outdoor pools one for adults and one for childrenwe were in awe from the moment we were driven through the front gates. On arrival at reception staff were very attentive and extremely polite.    Our suite was very spacious clean and the views of the pool did not go amiss. We visited two of the three restaurants and used the gym and spa facilities and we were not disappointed.    Room service was impeccable with staff catering to our every need.  Breakfast in the morning was in a spacious room with extraordinary decor and natural lighting.    Although we travelled as a couple it is very family friendly!    We were extremely sad to leave this small paradise which is a getaway in itself from the hustle and bustle of the main square in Marrakech.    Overall a fantastic stay and we would definitely stay again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: When I travel I only stay in four season because of services of this big brand . Never get disappointed. Unfortunately four season marrakech shocked me . I don't know why !! Poor service in room service  if you rented pavilion need to call for baggy to pick you up they never answer they phone . Not much restaurants in the resort only 2 restaurant actually one is inside the lounge . I really struggled with them :( . When I check out I asked for my extras bill to be send by e mail no one did . Had to call back after I waited 3 days to ask them to send it . Accept four season in city call Casablanca they are superb .    Will never go back again to four season marrakech 👎

Fantastic place to stay in Marrakech  Great location near city centre and airport  The service is faultless  I wish I could point out anything to improve but I can't  Our stay has been perfect from start to finish

Review_Date: Dmitri T wrote a review Mar 2017
Review_Text: Really oasis in the desert. Very good authentic rooms. SPA facilities incredibly good. There are two pool zones - one is for families with children one "quite". Restaurants and bars with friendly atmosphere and good food. There are rooms in main building and big variety of villas which are very convenient for big families. Staff is very friendly.  Love to be back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed 4 days in February. Lovely resort and fantastic large rooms with private terrace. Great service as expected. Beautiful pools one for adults and one for kids also nice spa.    Perhaps the only thing to consider is that the resort is about 2 miles from town. Do not try walking but a taxi to the square is only $5. I was a little disappointed that the 'courtesy' vehicle was not available as promised.    Overall we enjoyed our stay but if you want a more authentic experience stay at a riad in the souk. Better yet do both as we did.

super lovely property (very well located)...with great hospitality. I loved the pool and spa facilities (it is nice to have an adult pool completely separate by a decent amount of space from the kids pool.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mitchell D wrote a review Feb 2017
Review_Text: A relaxing and elegant escape from the hustle and bustle of the Medina offering amazing service complimentary car shuttles around town and perfect restaurant recommendations from the concierge. The rooms are generous the architecture and the grounds are photo worthy and at every turn we were made to feel at home by the ever pleasant staff. The hotel organised excursions for us including a day trip to Essaouira and everything during our stay was effortless. Compliments to our driver Badr.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mmejetsetter F wrote a review Feb 2017
Review_Text: Stayed at Four seasons Marrakech and was blown away by the resort!    We were welcomed and assisted by the guest services team. Upon check in we were given a traditional mint tea. Samia (not quite sure her name) at the reception succeeded our expectation by giving us GREAT room. Her gesture was truly appreciated!    We love the modern Moroccan architecture of the hotel and the room. It was made with exquisite taste.    The resort is about 5-10mins away from the airport and close to every tourist spots.    The spa facility was relaxing. The massage was good but I noticed a tiny changes in terms of their standards. The therapist was very adorable and did a great job as I asked for full & hard massage however I felt that there was something missing.. the ambiance and the typical ritual was quite different from the last time. On the other hand my daughter enjoyed her treatment. Her therapist was so accommodating and took care of her very well.    Our children absolutely enjoyed the kids club and the heated pool! The staff at the kids club and the recreation manager are all helpful and amazing with the kids! Big thanks to Nabila Samira Mehdi & the other lovely lady whom I forgot the name.    Breakfast facilities are awesome! Variety of traditional Moroccan and international breakfast. The staff are very helpful!    All in all we had an amazing stay! Everyone from security personnel down to their gardeners made us feel welcomed! Their professionalism friendliness and attention to details are why Four Seasons stands from other hotels.

It was our first family holiday with our little one and we're unsure of travelling due to all that we will need for baby. To our amazement the hotel had equipped the room with everything crib changing mat baby bath diaper bin diapers! Everything! They looked after us so well and made our stay and entire trip so pleasant and enjoyable! The restaurant was delicious breakfast was delicious and the room service food was delicious. The staff were extremely friendly and ensured we were having a good time. The location of the hotel is fantastic as it is close to everything and the hotel grounds are so beautiful you almost don't want to leave anyway.

Review_Date: Stephen O wrote a review Feb 2017
Review_Text: Probably the most exclusive family resort in Marrakech the Four Seasons offers luxury amid 40 acres of landscaped Moorish gardens.  Located on the edge of Hivernage overlooking the royal Menara Gardens the Four Seasons is a 10-minute drive and a 25-minute walk west of the medina.  The highlight of the resort are the luxurious guestrooms and suites of which there are 141 dotted around the gardens in large multi-room ‘pavilions’. All of them have private balconies with sun loungers set towards views of the Atlas Mountains.  Between the three restaurants – Solano Bleu d’Orange and the Azzera Pool Grill – and two bars you can sample a bewildering array of well-executed world cuisine ranging from a sumptuous Moroccan buffet to à la carte Italian and French fine dining and American-style burghers and salads. Most evenings kick off with cocktails at Zest a romantic rooftop bar with impressive pink-hued views of the High Atlas.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I thought long and hard about this review because up until checkout we had a lovely stay with only one or two minor things that I would comment on. Checkout however was a disaster and this very nearly became a one star review as a result More of that below. The resort itself is nicely laid out on the outskirts of Marrakech quiet and peaceful apart from the occasional plane overhead. It is a little sprawling. Our suite was not in the main building and there was therefore a bit of a trek from one place to the next. This will be annoying when it is really hot but also when it is raining as it was when we were there. It was a 4-5 minute walk up to reception and this had to be completed outdoors. Compensating for this and the reason for the 4 star review is that the rooms are spacious and beautifully clean as you would expect of Four Seasons. Service charming breakfast buffet excellent and the spa and fitness facilities top notch. The pool areas are huge and there is a separate adult only and family pool which gives people greater choice. On the whole I would therefore recommend and we would probably stay again. On checkout there was an issue in relation to the package we had booked. We had booked a spa package which was advertised as including a 50 minute massage per day. On checkout they tried to argue that this was for only one person which would be the most bizarre offer when you are booking a double room. In any event I had confirmed all of this beforehand so had the e-mails to prove what had been agreed. This all took 20 minutes and was not without a certain beligerance from the reception staff. There were other errors on the bill such as trying to charge 3 times for our airport transfers. It was annoying and very much spoilt the last day of our break. I also found that communication with the concierge prior to arrival was more difficult than it should have been having to double check that things had been done. And there is a hotel car shuttle service into town in the evening but it is one car and availability seems to be non-existent unless you are prepared to wait for long periods.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Amazing attention to detail with care taken at every opportunity by the staff to make us feel special and welcome.
Review_Text: The spacious and comfortable room was within the hotel. Whilst it rained the staff even apologised for the weather! The care taken for our two children and us was immense. There was even kids' toothpaste for our children in the bathroom. Well done Team Four Seasons.

15 to 20 years ago Marrakech was a city for the more adventurous traveller. People would return from this mystical city with tales of being harassed and harangued at every turn of a street corner. Talk of children being dragged into shops so parents would follow were everyday occurrences and the best option for accommodation was something with a heavy duty lock on the door...    But things have changed... And Marrakech (in fact Morocco in general it seems) have woken up to the vast income there is to be had from tourism it is no longer a place to fear or worry about it is now a place to explore and become involved in.    For the more adventurous traveller Marrakech may well have lost some of its charm as you no longer need a good grasp of Arabic or French a sturdy back pack the map reading agility of a cartographer and the cunning of a fox to get yourself around the city but on the other side of the coin it has made the city much more accessible to the average tourist... I firmly put myself in that bracket!    With the income from tourism it's clear to see the changes whilst the old city and main square remain largely untouched newer developments are springing up all over and shops like Louis Vuitton and nightclubs like Buddha Bar can easily be found a 10 minute taxi ride from the old town. Indeed don't be surprised by shiny new Mercedes and Audi's driving past you there is an air of money around the suburbs.    The type of accommodation here is vast. Everything from the basic Riad to the very upmarket La Mamounia Palace which was the favourite place to stay for Winston Churchill and still has a bar bearing his name... A favourite haunt for celebs whilst filming in Marrakech and the place to have a suite... If of course you have a spare £6000+ per night.    Unfortunately La Mamounia was a little out of our price range but that's ok I booked using British Airways holidays and enjoyed 4 nights in the City!    A couple of facts to note first. On arrival into Menara (the airport at Marrakech) I was stunned by the lovely new airport terminal. Having flown to places like this before I had my sights firmly set on walking across the tarmac to a small building with a couple of unfriendly guards but no another sign of its new love of tourism is the shiny new terminal complete with air conditioning full passport control and open spaces for you to wait for your luggage which arrived promptly. On the return leg only a small queue for security and a comfortable waiting area with some duty free shops awaited us a point to note here is that the vast majority of duty free shops only accept Euros not Moroccan Dirhams so don’t think you can spend you left over currency at the airport.    Drivers and waiting relatives are not allowed into the terminal building they have to wait outside so you will have to exit the terminal in order to find your airport transfer but again I was not approached once by anyone trying to grab my bags or push me into a taxi there was an order to the numbers waiting outside and we easily found our transfer who arrived 5 minutes after we had stepped outside the building (even he was caught out by our flight arriving a little early). A tip here is to make sure you do book a transfer although a little more expensive than a local taxi after a flight its always nice to just be picked up and whisked off to your hotel. Again I booked ours via BA to the tune of £22. However do be aware that if you are staying in the old town (Medina) part of Marrakech a lot of the streets are too narrow to fit a car down so you may end up walking part of the way and having a good map and a light suitcase will be a big help!    If you do get a local taxi then you need to remember 2 things. Make sure you tell them exactly where you want to go and I mean by street name or hotel name and set the price with them before setting off. Very important to remember this as there are some drivers who won't use a meter and then charge you a silly price at the end of your journey. From the airport to the Medina should cost around 50-60 MAD (about £5-£6).    Interestingly enough the old town has building regulations much like we do in England so all the Riad's and homes have to be the same colour they also cannot put anything on the outside of the buildings so that you can see how wealthy a person is therefore poor moderate or wealthy all the buildings look the same from the outside so don't be alarmed if you pull up outside a Riad that doesn't look like the photos in the brochure. Once you step through the door the difference is quickly established. We were lucky enough to be shown inside two Riads and once through the door an open courtyard greeted us with a small pool bathed in sunshine. Smart and clean rooms were set around the main courtyard and a full range of facilities was on offer. Most Riad's have between 5 and 15 rooms and were former palaces or wealthy homes so a conversion into a hotel didn't take too much but the facilities on offer do vary so make sure you check and scour around for one that suits your needs (not all of them serve alcohol for example). Whilst on the subject of accommodation that leads me nicely to ours the Four Seasons Resort and Private Residences.    The resort itself is a 15 / 20 minute car ride from the Airport and sits about 15 minutes away from the old town of Marrakech. It's facilities include 2 restaurants one Italian and one Moroccan / Mediterranean (with outside and indoor seating) It has a bar 24 hour room service 2 pools one for families and one for adults a spa (although you need to note that women and men cannot use the same spa facilities so there are separate saunas and jacuzzis etc) a spacious lounge tennis courts and a pool side restaurant and bar. There is free WIFI across the resort you can pay to upgrade to a faster connection but in all honesty I streamed movies and did all the usual social media using the standard connection.    Firstly let's get prices out of the way. If you don't have breakfast included then it can be quite costly. A breakfast is 350 MAD per person (approx £31). As for drinks well a bottle of local beer will set you back 90 MAD (approx £8) and a Grey Goose vodka with lime and soda 180 MAD (approx £16). On average dinner for 2 is around 1000 MAD (approx £90) without wine you can easily add on an additional 800 MAD (approx £72) if you do have wine. But that said it is certainly no more than dinner out in London would be and Four Seasons do have a reputation for good food and service and this is no different.    Upon arrival to the hotel we were greeted and shown around before being taken to the room. When we got there our luggage had been already placed in the room and we were made to feel very welcome.    So the room. We had a Garden Terrace room which I have to say was huge. A king size bed sitting area private outdoor terrace with sun loungers and a bathroom that could accommodate a football team were standard. The bath could easily double as a children's plunge pool and the shower came with all the usual nice shower gels and shampoo etc. A hairdryer bath robes and slippers are also in the room as standard along with bottles of water and a minibar. The water is free the minibar is not. A turn down service is given every night and the room is fully air conditioned. There is also a walk-in wardrobe if you happen to travel with a little more luggage!    We ate 3 times in the hotel twice in the Moroccan and once in the Italian restaurant and all 3 times were impressed. The food is well presented tasty and we were not rushed at all do try the Tagine and the fresh bread that comes with every meal. Drinks in the bar were very pleasant and the outdoor seating area means that breakfast in the morning can be taken on the terrace of the Italian restaurant with the sun beating down... A great way to start your day and the buffet at breakfast caters for everyone. Pancakes omelettes cooked breakfast fresh fruit salmon pastries you name it its on it!    February is low season in Marrakech but the weather we had (all 4 days were beautifully sunny and reached mid twenties during the day) meant we tried the pool facilities which again were lovely. The family pool was closed (due to low season) but to be honest there was more than enough space around the adult pool to accommodate everyone and fresh pool towels are readily available along with service from the pool bar which included some nice touches of a fresh fruit skewer iced water orange sorbet and a chocolate milkshake shot all delivered free to everyone at different points throughout the day.    A point to note on the weather is that whilst it is warm and sunny during the day because of Marrakech being on the border of the Sahara desert and at the foot of the Atlas Mountains it will go cold at night. So at this time of year you get 23-27 degrees in the day and then 7-12 degrees at night so make sure you bring warmer clothing for the evening. The dress code seemed to be smart casual for dinner shorts and T-Shirts for breakfast.    The service. In a word superb. We were made to feel very welcome from check-in to check-out. Nothing was too much trouble everything was accompanied by "you're most welcome" even by the pool we were shown to our sun beds given towels approached by the waiter with ice-cold water made to feel like our comfort was their top priority. During dinner the service was again slick but not over bearing and everyone we met from the doorman to the housekeeping staff said good morning and welcomed us back from our days out. It just felt like a Four Seasons should do polite friendly and a team of staff on top of their game.    The hotel itself is clearly looked after I tried to find fault looked for the cracked tile in the bathroom etc but I couldn't find it. All the public areas were scrupulously clean and even though it was low season with the exception of the family pool everything was open. There were enough staff on all the time and with it being set in nice grounds the whole place felt like an oasis.    The hotel can also arrange day trips for you but we did ours via Holiday Taxis who arranged our transfer. We toured the souks and palaces of the Medina and also ate out just off the main square one evening. I would highly recommend a guide whilst you do the tour not to stop you being pestered (we only got briefly approached twice during our half day) but because there is a lot of history in Marrakech and without a guide you would easily miss most of it. Walking around some of the monuments and palaces there aren't a lot of signs describing what the place is or does and those signs that are around can often be in French and Arabic only so having a guide gave us a much better view of the city. Whilst walking around it is easy to see why people can get lost but there are now signs about the City pointing you in the direction of the main square where snake charmers and food stalls can be found a plenty. The best time to walk round the city is between 9-3pm between 3pm-6pm it can become very busy and with the heat especially in the mid summer a little uncomfortable. That said at 10am it is quiet and very pleasant to walk through again having a guide gives you so much more of a better understanding and ours spoke very good English.    The evening time bought a different vibe and during our horse and carriage ride around the city walls it was clear to see the new money coming out to play but again the Medina keeps its charm and becomes a mecca for people watching the sun go down at the roof top bar of the Cafe de France or going out to sample some of the local delicacies.    Other trips you can do (although we didn't partake) include a day out to the Atlas Mountains or Camel Trekking or to visiting the film sets of Gladiator Game of Thrones and Lawrence of Arabia but again if you are coming in low season you can pretty much make your own itinerary someone will accommodate it!    Would I come to Marrakech again? You bet. The city is great and you don't need a huge amount of time so it is perfect for the 3-4 day getaway. Some winter sun is always welcome and if you are staying at the Four Seasons you can easily loose track of time lounging by the pool we certainly did but the main difference is the fear factor is no longer here this came across as a City that knows where it's money lies and frightened tourists seem to be a thing of the past. I can only go on my experiences with my other half (we didn't travel with children) and those experiences were ones of a friendly welcoming city where lots of people speak very good English and where you can loose yourself for a few days. In the whole time we were here we never once felt like it was a dangerous place to be. Well worth a visit!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We spent 4 days in Marrakesh for an alumni reunion. The hotel is comfortable and spacious. Staff very professional and helpful.  The breakfast buffet was a little bland ( to my taste) but that is very personal.  I was just disappointed with the hammam. Though i got a great scrub the turkish bath was cold and not steamy at all...  Its a great hotel for business and leisure.  Two thumbs up... but Four Seasons always are 😉

I was there with my family. The experience was fantastic. Rooms are very comfortable. It is not far from the old city and very ease to go there. Near the airport.  Recommended for families and/or business. The staff was extremely kind with our daughters with a special recognition to Mohamed who was our waiter when we have dinner at the restaurant!

A luxurious location for our two nights in Marrakech. We travelled with our toddler son and they were prepared (bed bath toys all waiting us). Their kids club was a great place for our son to play. Breakfast buffet is above average but that's not why to stay here. Our suite was spacious and comfortable. The location is a bit outside the medina but completely accessible (10min taxi or 20-25 min carriage). No complaints.

We had three rooms for seven of us including five teens. The Four Seasons resort is a lovely oasis with fine dining and everything a traveler would expect from a FS property. While it's a little removed from the central tourist area of Marrakech the best sights are actually outside of town making the Four Seasons' location ideal for those seeking an active itinerary.    Day 1: Hot Air Balloon and Souk. Start your first morning with a hot air balloon ride floating over the foothills of the Atlas Mountains. After lunch take a guided tour of the old town including Jemaa El Fna Square and its snake charmers. Photo Tip: Jemaa El Fna Square. Pose with the local dancers in their costumes at the entrance to the square; pose with the snake charmers holding a charmed cobra around your neck.    Day 2: The Sahara. Hire a Four Seasons driver to go over the Atlas mountains and descend into the Sahara. Lunch in Ouarzazate and then travel on to the ancient fort and World Heritage Site of Ait Benhaddou. Climb through the earth and clay towers of six Kasbahs and fifty palaces. You’ll instantly recognize it as a setting used for Game of Thrones Prince of Persia Alexander and Sheltering Sky among others. Photo Tip: at the overlook approaching Ait Benhaddou with the ancient city in the distance behind you.    Day 3: Ourika Valley. Hire a Four Seasons driver and spend the day in the Ourika Valley. Take your time and hike up the seven waterfalls of Seti Fatma and visit a Berber home.    Day 4: Morning: Camel Ride in La Palmeraie. Ride your camel around the palm plantation. Photo: Sitting on your camels and surrounded by palm trees. Afternoon: Churchill’s Marrakesh starting with lunch at La Mamounia Hotel where Winston Churchill often visited proclaiming “It is the most lovely spot in the whole world.” Then stroll through its gardens.    Day 5: Shopping in the Souk. Buy local clothes smaller carpets and the lovely ceramic vases (that you can carry back yourself). Afterwards spend your last afternoon lounging around the Four Seasons' pool.

We stayed here for a conference and are accustomed to good service. This hotel was amazing. Beautiful facility efficient responsive and kind staff. Everything about our room and the property was comfortable and elegant.    We loved the twice per day room service and I was pleased that they accommodated my environmental sensibilities and let me use the same towels for a few days.    There was a visit from a senior public figure while we were there and unlike our experiences with this in New York we were not inconvenienced at all.    The staff graciously accommodated us using the staff entrance and exit which enabled us to walk to our conference center rather than take a taxi.    Would definitely return here if given the opportunity.

Stayed for 4 nights in a 1 bedroom suite - extraordinary in every sense of the word. From check-in until check-out hotel staff were incredibly friendly and repeatedly went out of their way to make certain that our stay was near perfection. Room was spacious service was impeccable. Will definitely return to the best resort in the Red City!!

The hotel is well situated as it is less than 15mins from the airport.  The grounds are huge and well maintained.  There are 2 pool areas one for the kids and one for the grown ups.  It has 3 food outlets pool side which only does lunch reception area where it does local and international dishes and the Italian restaurant open for breakfast and dinner. The Italian has superb food.  There is a SPA and a gym. The equipment at the gym is modern and well maintained.  The staff are professional and speak english.  The rooms are well laid out and comfortable. It has a separate dressing room to the bedroom. There is also a balcony.  In room safe fridge tea and coffee making facility dvd player many outlets and multi plug adapter is provided.

We stayed in a lovely room. It had a wonderful balcony with a relaxing view of the hotel gardens.The bathroom was excellant. The bathtub was big and very deep. Shower was ggod too. Room was large. Had complimentary use of spa and had breakfast included in my stay. The hotel itself was a holiday within a holiday. Swimming pool is beautiful !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Fred S wrote a review Jan 2017
Review_Text: Stayed there twice in April and August. it might not be the cosiest and typical arabic hotel but it is still the best in marrakech as far as I am concerned. Stayed there with the familly in plunge pool apartment and it was an incredible experience. room was spacious and very premium. food and restaurants excellent. Overall service was great whether in the pool area or the kids club (kids are 13 and 5 years old). So yes it is not cheap but you get what you pay for.

Four Seasons Marrakech was the perfect ending to our Moroccan adventure we couldn't get our 5yr old to leave the kids club! Beautiful scent throughout the hotel we didn't want to leave! We will be returning for another Four Seasons experience.

Review_Date: Tony C wrote a review Jan 2017
Review_Text: One of the next four seasons I stayed in room are very nice and large world classes service restaurant was just wow pool amazing can't tell you every thing just go and visit you will love it close to city cinter  I love the beds you will sleep like a baby

The service was superb.  We went with children of 8 and 12 years old and they had activities for small children but also for teenagers.  The hotel also catered for adults without children since they had a separate pool for families.  New Year's eve party was top!  Highly recommendable!

Review_Date: Nicole N wrote a review Jan 2017
Review_Text: I just came back from a trip to Marrakech and stayed 2 nights at Four Season Marrakech. As soon as you enter the property you can feel the luxurious touches and warm welcome from the team (lots of security as well which is appreciated). The pool area the restaurants rooms views public areas are really relaxing and it really gives you sense of beautiful Moroccan architecture. Every detail is looked after - as expected in a Four Seasons hotel. I would love to come back and would definitely recommend it!

Review_Date: Mita Dally wrote a review Jan 2017
Review_Text: Beautiful city and beautiful hotel . Limited rooms and perctly design and lay out. Service is great and people are nice. I used day transportation with driver and the driver was so helful. Took me around the market and wakled with me along the way. Make things easier for us to go around l. The branding proven.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Spent four days here on a business trip and enjoyed every minute of it. The hotel has every amenity you can think of from thick robes and comfy bedding to cozy fireplaces near the lobby and absolutely gorgeous views from every room's balcony/terrace. As expected from this chain every inch of space is gorgeous and well maintained. The staff is extremely attentive and friendly. Kudos to Rita at the consierge desk who called in a bank technician on a Saturday to retrieve my husband's "eaten" ATM card. The food at the hotel is moderate - I enjoyed meals outside the hotel better. However their desserts breakfast and cappuccinos are amazing. On location boutique has a wide variety of beautiful and unique items but they are pricey. Tennis pools spa meditation-all on site. Everyone should stay here at least once in their life to enjoy the luxury.

Review_Date: Rob M wrote a review Jan 2017
Review_Text: Beautiful room incredible attention to detail as expected from a Four Seasons Resort. Blaise Montandon the General Manager was outstanding and helped make our stay a truly memorable one. Fitness center and clay tennis courts were excellent. Beautiful pool areas with one for families and one for adults. Staff was attentive to every detail and remembered our names after the second day.

Review_Date: Miles C wrote a review Jan 2017
Review_Text: Four seasons never disappoints huge rooms for our family close to a stunning pool complex international and local cuisine. One could believe you are on a resort holiday yet only minutes from Marrakesh old town and the Medina. Guides and excursions provided by the hotel were of an impeccable standard.

Relaxing and select with great open space and wonderful pools. Very friendly staff both in and outside the hotel. Great hotel for children with access to the gym for teenagers. First class Spa with top and friendly staff. Great pool restaurant as well as buffet room. Top grilled meat at the Middle East restaurant ! Usual 4 seasons extra size rooms making it a unique stay. Particular recommendation for families with children.

We stayed here for 3 days between Christmas and New Years. The rooms are beautiful very spacious and extremely well-appointed. The bathrooms are also huge with plenty of counter space large rain showers and tubs. There were also two large terrace areas - one with chaise lounges and the other with chairs and recessed seating. The grounds are extensive and lush - it truly feels like a resort and not just a hotel. There is both an adult pool and a kids pool. The al fresco pool restaurant adjacent to the adult pool has a great menu - it was actually one of our favorite meals. The staff are truly wonderful - Salma was incredibly helpful in arranging airport transfer setting us up with a very experienced guide for a tour of Marrakech including the medina and souks and recommending and booking several dinner reservations. Everyone we encountered was gracious and truly attentive to every detail.    The spa is also outstanding - we tried the Hammam Ritual - what an experience! We also ate several times in the Inara bar - the traditional Moroccan food was very well prepared and Hajar was our server on every occasion - she was terrific!    There are also some very nice added amenities - on-site ATM hotel courtesy car to help with transportation to dinners  etc.    We loved it and our only complaint is that we wished we could have stayed longer at this Marrakech oasis!

I'm just getting w I understand to catching up on many overdue reviews. So I'm going to keep this short and sweet and try to hit the main highlights of this hotel that impressed us.    First off - the grounds are gorgeous. The lush flora fountains and several pools are all set upon the backdrop of the mountains. Stunning.    The rooms were huge and appointed with every luxury and amenity imaginable.    The staff was extremely friendly. Especially family friendly. My kids played in the pool and when I apologized to the pool staff for them being a bit loud they said not to worry - this was the family pool and pointed out that the adults had their own pool - so play away!    Our kids found a few others from the United States and England to play with and they had fun playing with the balls and floaty toys provided by the hotel.    The food- we had a buffet that was set to break the Ramadan fast at the end of the day and it was bigger than you could imagine. I loved all the vegetarian options! So grateful for that being a vegetarian.    The entertainment during dinner was so fun. Genuinely Moroccan with unique horns percussion and string instruments.    We also were grateful to the concierge that set up a pick up at airport as well as a private guide that toured us through many historical points as well as through the maze of the medina.    Prior to booking here I really struggled with which location to pick for a hotel. I knew we wanted to go 5 star but also considered a few hotels within walking distance of the Medina.    I'm really glad we picked this hotel The Four Seasons for so many reasons!    The security was over the top. Behind a gated entry with guard for entrance with the car and then additional personal security detection gates at the entry.    Everything here was top notch. Housekeeping concierge front desk bell man in fact we were walked to our room to check in rather than waiting at the front.    Lovely all around.    If this was helpful please check the little "helpful" button. It makes me feel good to know I'm actually helping people.    Thank you!

Review_Date: Christian R wrote a review Dec 2016
Review_Text: From the moment you are picked up at the airport to the moment you leave you are treated as a Sultan. I can't tell you how much these guys went out of there way to help.    Everything else is typical four seasons so it's amazing but the service this time was exceptional
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is a beautiful Four Seasons and while it is not on the ocean it does feel like a resort. The hotel is very nearby the airport and outside the old city. It is in a very quiet location and away from the hustle and bustle. There is a large and beautiful spa located centrally in a separate building offering many luxurious treatments. Our room was quite large with a separate entryway and an extremely large bath room with a long and deep soaking tub separate shower and separate toilet with bidet. The bedroom was very comfortable and had a table and chairs where breakfast was served by the room service staff. The room service was always prompt food was very hot and it was delicious and graciously and professionally served. We also had a very nice private outdoor garden area just outside our room with loungers and table and chairs. There was a gate we could exit from to walk around to the pool. The staff was very friendly and quite attentive. Everyone truly was focussed on delivering an amazing experience for us. They handled many requests for us and none too small (like shredding papers to going to the train station to buy tickets for us to take the train over to Casablanca to bringing us bath salts to take a hot soak in the wonderful bath tub). Ahhhhhhh! We will definitely return.

Review_Date: Benoit M wrote a review Nov 2016
Review_Text: The hotel offers everything one can hope for. Restaurant is amazing atmosphere is relaxing level of service is second to none easy commute to the médina and palmeraie and very convenient location not far from airport

Beautiful hotel. Big spacious rooms. Excellent food and service. Top class facilities. Nothing to fault. Manicured landscaping. Lovely heated pools. Great staff. 10 mins from airport and 10 mins to the city. Could not ask for better.

A fabulous experience with every need catered to whether it was a surprise cake and sparkling wine for my husband's birthday or catering for my vegan daughter's dietary needs. Kids under 5 eat free but she literally had no limits as to what could be made for her and for this I am very grateful. The grounds are immaculate the rooms are spacious and clean.  All the staff are so friendly and we were treated like royalty. My 2 year old was treated like a princess. So glad we chose the four seasons!!

I had the best traditional hammam treatment at the Four Seasons. It was expensive but worth every penny. From when I made the reservation to when I got out and have dinner at the restaurant everything was as one would expect perfect service beautiful setting greatest spa facilities ever. If you like spas and traditional spa treatments this is the best you can get. Merci Four Seasons fro being always a reliable place to be the most pleasant hotel stays of my life have been in your hotels.

Review_Title: Excellent hotel in a magnificant city
Review_Text: A great place to relax you feel at home from the first moment of your arrival. Spacious rooms tastefully decorated. Extremely friendly and professional staff. Perfectly located at abt. 15 minutes from the airport (without disturbing noice) as well as the centre of the old town of Marrakesh

I enjoyed it you can be lost it is wonderful and very big I liked the flowers and gargen everywhere.    People are very welcoming there too.I liked hearing birds each morning from the balcony.  Amasing very very clean too

Review_Date: Michele B wrote a review Nov 2016
Review_Title: Perfect for relaxation in an exotic location so near to Europe
Review_Text: A lovely quiet hotel conveniently located ten minutes from the international airport. Perfect for a relaxing long weekend.  Nothing was too much trouble. The service was great.  .....and the spa experiences were beyond wonderful !    Meals at the hotel were finebut there is room for improvement.  Likewise the room was fine - and - importantly -quiet - but not exciting.  Thank you to them all for looking after us.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Utterly remarkable personal attention to every wish with superbly run hotel. Top class Recommend maximising use of Concierge services they are most knowledgeable and can save heaps of time finding places to visit etc
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Andreas R wrote a review Oct 2016
Review_Text: We are a family of four and we love this resort and the wonderful (service-) team all around us. The kids are 11-13 years old and like the family pool where normal noise while playing around is not an issue for everybody - If you are affected by this noise you can use the "adult pool" where it´s really quiet!

Fantastic Italian Restaurant. We stayed at the Four Seasons Marrakech in 2015 and Solano was excellent. This year we returned to Marrakech (Mandarin Oriental) and we went back to the Four Seasons for dinner there were changes to the restaurant however it was still exceptional. We received excellent service the food was great and they are incredibly family friendly (travelled with our 3 year old son). We returned to Solano twice during our stay the second time my husband was undecided on his selection so the restaurant sent both of his choices and only charged for one. Very friendly and considerate service and a special thank you to El Habib for making our evenings so special and diverting a couple of over tired toddler tantrums. Overall we highly recommend Solano for excellent food and service which guarantees a pleasant evening.

We visited with my 8 year old. Hotel staff were friendly and helpful  We had a lovely villa room by the pool  Great Pool area which was nice and warm  My son liked the young adults room which had table football ping pong and video games  Excellent spa with hamman  We would definitely go back

Review_Date: caroline c wrote a review Oct 2016
Review_Text: your search is over from the moment we arrived the hotel captures you. This was our first visit to Marrakech & while I had a perception of what it would be like nothing prepared me for how peaceful and tranquil this hotel is.    Celebrating our Wedding Anniversary we were upgraded to a Pool Suite the room was perfect 2 bathrooms 2 dressing rooms a living area and a four poster (room 121). Truly amazing and I've not mentioned the plunge pool and private terrace.    We ate the first night of our 3 night stay in the international restaurant at the hotel fantastic food and amazing service. The service was impeccable everywhere in the hotel and everyone we met had such enthusiasm for their role.    The hotel is spacious with 2 pools sunbeds nicely spaced out for relaxing after the experience that is the Medina!.    Breakfast was plentiful with lots of choice. Happy Anniversary cakes were waiting on a table - a lovely gesture.    Taxi from the hotel to the for a pre booked "Walking Tour of the Medina" (see that update if you're looking for a good trip). Less than 10 mins to the main square and around 50 Dir depending how good you barter. (under £5)    Some 5 hours later back at the pool having learnt a lot walked a lot and shopped a lot. The pool was cool the attendants attentive cold drinks ice cream melon olives all served free of charge and at regular intervals.    Saturday evening saw us dining at Maison MK (see that update fabulous roof terrace). upon returning to our room a bottle of Prosecco and chocolate cake awaited us.    I've stayed in many hotels all over the world and this hotel has something special. The style décor the commitment to customer service are all significant in creating our wonderful experience.    Staying outside the Medina was the right choice for us giving us an escape from the noisy but magical Medina and it's enticing souks. My first experience of Marrakech I describe as a vibrant mix of interesting history and a cultural crossroads and a truly amazing place.    We will return to explore more and will definitely stay at the Four Seasons.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Much improved since my last visit a year ago.................
Review_Text: I was in Marrakech in September 2016 on business. I stayed at the Four Seasons for a week with other business associates.  After finding the Four Seasons rather disappointing in 2015 I was very pleasantly surprised by the improvements in staff attention to detail customer satisfaction and the overall welcome I felt throughout my stay.  Most notable among the staff was Abdessamed Akhmassi my driver. He drove both my Wife and I to various locations in and around Marrakech and acted as an informed and knowledgeable tour guide to my Wife during my business meetings.  The head concierge Ghita Kamal was also extremely helpful in many ways and nothing appeared to be too much trouble for her. She always appeared professional and competent and never lost that lovely welcoming smile. Truly an asset to the hotel.  My group ate at all of the hotels restaurants on several occasions. The poolside terrace restaurant "Azzera" was our favorite. Welcoming staff and prompt service. No mean feat when you have a hotel full of other hoteliers travel agents and tour operators from around the World on a tight schedule.  Our suite was very spacious as was the lovely bathroom. Nice balcony with pleasant private and quiet view out over the gardens.    Good job to all. See you in September !

Review_Title: Perfect resort to explore the magic of Marrakech
Review_Text: We stayed at this Four Seasons property in September 2016 and couldn't have asked for a better place to experience the bustling city of Marrakech.    Because it's only 10 minutes drive outside the main medina and 5-10 minutes from the airport the location of this hotel could not be better especially to use as a home base for visiting the souks and hectic market square. What makes this FS property an ideal place to stay however is that the 40-acre resort becomes your quiet and luxurious sanctuary the minute you return a calm oasis to relax by the pool have a workout or enjoy the spa. If you're into yoga ask for a session with Manoj the resident instructor who was born and raised in Rishikesh - the yoga capital of the world.    We spent a good portion of our stay working on our laptops and I'm happy to say that there are several areas around the resort that are convenient to work in the wifi is quite good and the constant service of Moroccan mint tea and small treats is an added bonus that makes the time 'in office' much more enjoyable. When we weren't on our computers we were shopping in the souks and one of the amazing offers that Four Seasons presents is the ability to ship your newfound treasures home so you can say yes to that intricate brass lamp and the camel bone tea set without worrying about your return-flight baggage weight :)    All-in-all the experience was everything we hoped for from a five-star Four Seasons property: refined professionalism an inviting ambiance and delicious food with natural beauty all around. Be sure to take in the sprawling view from the Inara lounge terrace... and for a real Moroccan treat experience it with flavoured shisha in hand!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Filip N wrote a review Oct 2016
Review_Title: Everything you would expect from a four seasons hotel. Super.
Review_Text: Very nice hotel with super friendly staff from the reception right to the pool staff. Ideal to relax especially at the adults only pool (there is also a family pool on the other side). Very nice rooms with very comfortable bed and pillows. The concierge was very helpful in recommending restaurants in Marrakech. We also used the courtesy car that the hotel kept available every night from 18.00 to 22.00hrs on a first come-first serve basis. We often had lunch at the pool side restaurant and the food was excellent. In the evening there was the restaurant in the lobby area. We actually only had drinks there as in our opinion you didn't really get an experience of going out and being in a separate restaurant. So an extra restaurant would have been nice. This is an ideal hotel if you want to discover Marrakech. Everything was perfect except for 1 thing : during the day there were construction works in the villas near the adult pool and at times that was rather disturbing.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Poor Aspects and Very Good Aspects
Review_Text: We visited this hotel a year ago and it became one of our favourite four seasons resorts. There have been some changes - some good some bad - since we last visited (when we gave the hotel 5/5) but the resounding issue was a huge drop in quality of service in the food and beverage outlets.    My only complaint on our first visit was that the wifi was poor with no reception around the pool. They have clearly fixed this and I didn't even need to bother with the premium wifi we got with our suite and just used the complimentary wifi the whole time.    Turning to the issues they have switched up their restaurants to remove their only good restaurant and the service at breakfast lunch and dinner was very very poor.    Firstly they have removed their fine dining Italian (Blu D'Orange) and replaced their Moroccan restaurant with a more casual feeling Italian. We dined at the casual Italian and the food was very average and the service was terrible - endless mistakes cold food missing main courses and I had to get up and hunt for a waiter when we wanted a bill as they were all busy out the back of the restaurant for ages. It didn't come close to the stunning meal and service we had the previous year at Blu D'Orange and the service did not resemble anything we've come to expect from this hotel or any four seasons hotel. We did get a complimentary bottle of sparkling wine due to the problems.    Service by the pool and at breakfast was also fustratingly poor. We had four breakfasts and every single one my father-in-law's coffee and tomato juice was forgotten the waiter kept giving the wrong people drinks and we kept having to ask again for items. Worst of all our last breakfast there were no cooked items in the buffet and a whole section was missing that was out the other days. So we all had pastries pancakes and cereal. When our plates were being cleared and we'd finished our coffees/tea the waiter decided to offer us cooked breakfast menus and let us know that on Tuesday's you ordered cooked food from the a la carte - I mean seriously to wait until 45 minutes into our breakfast? It was a joke.    Poolside food was good and there is no doubting the quality of the produce but again it was lazy chaotic service. I had to ask for a missing items several times and at our final lunch the deserts took 30 minutes to come out (no apology) and the pancake and waffles which were meant to be freshly cooked were cold. In addition the "pancake with lemon and sugar" came with orange pieces on it and no lemon. It's just frustrating at these prices.    We dined out at La Comptoir Trattoria and La Palace Club (all recommendations from the hotel) - each one was superb in terms of food and service and if we return we wouldn't eat dinner in the hotel - which isn't a big problem but it's unlike any other four seasons I've visited in that respect and detracts from the "resort" nature of the hotel.    Overall things were not as slick as last time. My parents in law requested a wake up call which was inexplicably forgotten and it took three calls over a 24 hour period to get someone to fix our sink which was broken on arrival. On check in I was told I'd been upgraded to a pavilion room which was the room I had booked.    On the plus side is the concierge and front of house service is generally exceptional we had an itinerary put together and it ran like clockwork and check in and check out was very good. Service from concierge before the stay was impeccable. The rooms and facilities are faultless and the pool area and poolside service is the best at any hotel we've been to. The SPA is also stunning.    I left the hotel relaxed but also slightly frustrated and embarrassed that I'd gone on about how great the four seasons chain and this hotel in particular is to my parents-in-law for it to then let us down with poor service at nearly every meal to give a distinctly average impression. Maybe we were unlucky this time round.    I personally would return but my wife would prefer to try the Mandarin Oriental next year. One thing is for sure when dropping around £5000 for two couples in 4 nights there shouldn't be so many issues and the excellent work and service delivered by the front of house teams and poolside team was really undermined by the food and beverage team on this trip.

Review_Date: Vidjin K wrote a review Oct 2016
Review_Text: Stayed 4 nights at the Four Seasons in Marrakech. We did have some challenges during our stay but I could definitely recommend a stay there since the staff has been superkind and very helpful. A lot of details in this hotel have been carefully thought off! A special thank you goes out to Said servicing us at the pool and the very warm and new General manager who personally came to check upon is during our stay!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sandy L wrote a review Oct 2016
Review_Text: A delightful place to stay. All conveniences and friendly staff. We arrived after a long hot day in the out country. We were tired and dusty. What a pleasure to come into this clean bright lounge and sit in a soft armchair. A true oasis

I cannot add anything to what has already said about this hotel staff service etc.  My only complaint being about the caged birds. Personally I find this truly upsetting. Please set them free.  I've recently discovered that these birds are never let out of their cages to be exercised.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Just returned from 4 night stay. My second visit and they greeted me by name.  Was exhausted as had very early flight from UK  And we were greeted with cold towel and mint tea.  The place has such a calm atmosphere and the service is wonderful.  Special mention to Said by pool. So nice and he even called the IT chap  Down to pool as my wifi was not working!  The pool is huge and just so nice and beds are very soft.  We were upgraded to a pavilion room and it was huge!!!  The only downside of our time was the digging and construction work outside our door so make sure you ask about that and get a room  Away from that.    The evenings are very dead here . Shame as the Italian was lovely.  We went to an amazing Lebanese place called Azra which is close to hotel and a fun and lively place is Comptair Darna with belly Dancing.    Oh and the spa is lovely too!

Review_Date: sarah k wrote a review Oct 2016
Review_Text: We had a great dinner at Solano and our waiter El Habib was so lovely. He speaks 6 languages and is a lot of fun! I had the octopus salad which was tender and delicious and a filet tenderloin that melted in my mouth. The truffle flavored mashed potatoes were incredible too! What a great time we had and we learned so much about Moroccan culture from El Habib. 😀
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Superb location spoiled by continuous construction
Review_Text: An excellent resort with more or less everything you could ask for and the staff in particular are friendly helpful and true professionals. We used the gym adult only pool ate breakfast each day and dinner twice in the solana restaurant and asked the concierge to assist us with trip/restaurant bookings. Every service and ask was executed flawlessly and with a smile.    The only downside was some continuous and irritating construction work ongoing near to our room and close to the adult only pool (large generator and pneumatic drilling!). Normally we'd expect a small card with an apology in our room and some mention when we checked in. But there's be no recognition of same which is disappointing. Perhaps no one know whose responsibility it is to communicate this to the guests?!    All in all an excellent resort but suggest you check on construction and room/suite location when you book.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Antonio M wrote a review Oct 2016
Review_Text: The Four Seasons Marrakech is everything you would expect from this brand. Well located but just far enough away to feel like you are in a peaceful place. The rooms were really good with a great balcony and the sheet quality was really high up there. Room service was great and the staff were all great class.

The staff cannot do enough for you! The most amazing hotel i have ever stayed in. Thank you Four Seasons you have out done yourselves here.  The poolside the mojito was incredible!! Plus the spa is so amazing you must treat yourself!

Review_Title: Peaceful stay, five stars all the way!
Review_Text: We came here after we were married in Casablanca. This was the perfect setting to rest and recharge after so much fun with family and friends. We spent a lot of time at the pool which could not have been nicer - Truly elegant. Loved the staff the food and the peaceful setting of this resort. Thank you!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Dina D wrote a review Sep 2016
Review_Text: The location of this hotel is perfect as it is outside of Medina and you need to be outside of Medina as Medina is hectic! This hotel is very calming. Upon arrival my husband and i were greeted with delicious Moroccan mint tea. Our room was wonderful I just wish it had more of a Moroccan charm but at least the bed was comfortable and the bathroom was huge! The pool staff were out of this world great! They came around with water watermelon other drinks consistently checked in remembered your name and even cleaned your sunglasses. This hotel offered some of the best service I have ever experienced. The hotel offers a complimentary car ride into the city after 6 pm however they do not pick you up but taxis are plenty and pretty cheap. There were two pools one was just an adult pool and another was a kids pool which was great as the adult pool was large and quiet and relaxing. Be prepared for the heat as it was super hot in August!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I stayed in the 4 seasons Marrakech with my daughters for 4 nights in September 2016. the service and welcome was absolutely fantastic. I really couldn't fault a thing. while obviously pricy my room had a free 4th night which helped. breakfast is a sumptuous combination of buffet and a la carte table service. the restaurant serves Moroccan and also Lebanese dishes a la carte- very good as it means you can order a few mezze if you are not hungry or full dishes like tagine if you are more hungry. alcohol is pricy but not outrageous - a similar property in Dubai would be 30% more expensive..  the pool is excellent - constant care from the staff (complimentary water shakes sunglass cleaning) - also the pool café is nice - good combination of mains and starters. concierge was good - organised camel riding for my girls. 3 things stand out for me (1) the service was genuinely friendly and professional (in other words excellent) at all times - and I mean at all times - I met at least 30 staff and they were universally delightful. (2) on the last day we had a late flight and the reception offered us a free late check out for one of the rooms - generous and thoughtful indeed and (3) after we had left the property and were at the airport it transpired that my daughters had left their purses in the room safe. I called the hotel and in less than one hour I had the purses in my hand delivered by the security team. amazing. I will definitely return. what a fabulous advertisement for the four seasons and for morocco

Review_Title: I felt like an Arabian king right out of the fairy tales.
Review_Text: What can I say about this place other than I felt like an Arabian king right out of the fairy tales. Everything was perfect from the fine dining for lunch and dinner to the views facilities pools bars rooms and the staff. Top notch all the way around. Added bonus being right around the corner from the Palis de Congress. I'll be back for the next convention for sure!

Review_Title: What you should expect from a four seasons
Review_Text: Just like any other four seasons it did not disappoint. Great handy tip is that most of the luxury restaurants have free car service back to the hotel. Which really worked well for us as our driver finished at 9 and the taxis in Marrakech were not that comfortable. Also each driver has different prices for the same journey.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: One of the most luxuries hotels I ever been to the rooms the lobby the swimming pool the restaurants and the main thing is the staff 7 stars all the way we were there for a week and didn't want to leave this beautiful relaxing property.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Stay here - amazing Hotel, Staff and Property - not to be missed!
Review_Text: Our first stay at Four Seasons but won't be our last. What a stunning hotel and grounds the security was so tight and excellent - we felt so safe as all the guards checked the cars coming in and all visitors walked through a security/airport type entrance and had bag checks. The Hotel wasn't even half full and our room was upgraded to a gorgeous large room with fantastic bathroom and terrace with sunbeds. There were two large pools - one for children and one for adults. Lots of sunbeds with cushions and towels and excellent staff. I have never had so many pool snacks drinks etc anywhere - they were charming they even came round to offer cold towels and clean your sunglasses with spray and cloth. Well recommended to families and couples it was perfect for us with our teenage daughter and I noticed a number of couples or parents with older 'children'. I can't wait to go again it was an oasis of luxury modern but traditional fittings in a very exciting city. Also great fitness centre which the daughter enjoyed!

Stayed here four nights in September. The service and food was on par with any other Four Seasons. The room was set up perfectly for a family of four. It is located about a five minute walk from the Menara Gardens and about a 7 minute ride to the main square. It is only 5 minutes from airport. The pool and service there was excellent. The hotel sent up a cake and bottle of Brut since it was my birthday. Nice touch without me or my wife mentioning it to anyone. I would stay here again. Well managed property.

Review_Title: Paradise deserving more than a five star
Review_Text: I stayed at the FS Marrakesh with my 16 year old daughter for 3 nights and what a beautiful experience we had. From the time you walk through the door to the time you leave you feel the warmth and welcome of the staff at this hotel. The staff were always smiling and being helpful asking how your stay was going or if you needed anything! For families with limited or no French or Arab language skills you will feel welcomed and taken care of here the staff are multi lingual and I mean all staff making communication easy and effortless which can sometimes be challenging in Morocco.    The rooms are beautifully done and not over the top. We were upgraded to a villa that was beautiful and impeccably serviced every day with everything a guest needs. The grounds and pools are immaculately taken care of and the staff at the pool are just wonderful! The breakfast room is simple but beautifully and the food was fantastic! We both had our first Hamamm experience at the spa and I was impressed both by the professionalism of the spa staff and beauty of the spa facilities. I wish we could have stayed longer! Four seasons Marrakesh you are doing a fantastic job I will be staying again and thank you for giving us a warm welcome to Morocco and Marrakesh! Just a beautiful resort with amazing staff!  Definitely deserves more than a five star!

Review_Date: William B wrote a review Sep 2016
Review_Text: Beautiful facility attentive staff and a quiet setting are the hallmarks of this world class resort. It doesn't get better than this. Nicely self-contained there are several very good restaurants on the property. Great for couples and families in alike.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This was our 3rd stay at Four Seasons. Excellent facilities most helpful staff. Rooms are spacious and furnished to high standards. A perfect break for the families. This place is highly recommended.

spend 6 days at the hotel with the family the hotel Is well equipped and rooms are terrific it sits on a large site and is well secure however the restaurant staff lacked experience as they kept mixing up our orders the only downside would be the lack of variety at the restaurants based at the hotel

Review_Date: Lynette A wrote a review Sep 2016
Review_Text: The Four Seasons is a peaceful contrast to the beautiful chaos and action of the city itself the perfect place to return to relax after a busy hot day. The hotel and grounds are spectacularly beautiful and the staff are friendly attentive and helpful as you might expect from the Four Seasons. The room (a deluxe) was quite spacious with a balcony perfect for a private breakfast. I recommend Marrakech as a destination (just WOW) and Four Seasons is the place to stay when you're there!

Review_Date: Mehdi K wrote a review Sep 2016
Review_Text: I've stayed with my wife at the Four seasons marrakech and we had a wonderful stay.    Comfort / luxury / morrocan hospitality.    Being a hotelier in Dubai  I can say that Four seasons marrakech is one of the top 2 hotels in Morocco.    Thanks for your hospitality and we look forward to visit your hotel next year.    Mk
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We did not sleep at night since there was party every night at second floor.  Otherwise the hotel is fine the waitresses are harrible to serve. They will not follow up on there order.  The spa is very good the hotel atmosphere at night is very romantic and nice.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: One of the 3 best hotels in Marrakech
Review_Text: Lovely and quiet hotel in Marrakech.Pool area is quite big to have rest and have a swim.Breakfast is not the best...and they must improve it because the room rate for this place is not cheap.Lobby area and restaurants are confortable and good looking.

Four Seasons never disappoint us. This beautiful resort combines the design of both Moroccan and morden style. It's beautiful in both day and night time.    Great service. Great breakfast. Everything is all what luxury means.    By the way I really lost count how many swimming pools are there in this resort. Got pool speicalising for adults one for families one for kids.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The most amazing hotel in Marrakech  this is our third time at this resort and the whole experience is beautiful very child friendly and the most amazing staff  in particular Safia at reception and Maha at the boutique who advised us of some brilliant places to visit  A really beautiful and amazing place  we love it and thank you again to Safia

Review_Date: MR MOHAMED J wrote a review Aug 2016
Review_Text: I went for Four seasons signature massage which was just amazing on last day before departing    It included the oil massage which was worth it and paid 775 Morroco Dirhams £65.    It normally cost 1550 but got 50% discount.    It was my second treatment at this Spa within the last 8 months.    The same male did my treatment and will definitely use it if I return back.    Highly recommended and relives all the pressure and tension before returning home.

Review_Date: haroon s wrote a review Aug 2016
Review_Text: What can you say about this place it was absolutely beautiful. It ad two swimming pools one for adults the other for families the food was great the service excellent and the brooms were massive with a king sized bed. We could not fault the place.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ron H wrote a review Aug 2016
Review_Title: Very Nice, Friendly, and Secure Hotel...
Review_Text: The property is really pretty and nice pool and spa... Restaurant food is excellent and the staff has good customer service. The workout gym and tennis courts are in excellent condition. There are two pools one for adults and one for families. Both are very nice to be at.. Good A/C in the rooms to accommodate the Heat outside.. lol

Perfect family vacation. Wonderful stay. Staff and attention to detail extraordinary. Room was of the highest standard as you would come to expect from a four seasons.  Management team highly visible and extremely welcoming

My husband and I enjoyed a terrific stay at the Four Seasons Marrakech. We were looking for a short getaway prior to attending a wedding in London and are happy that we chose FS Marrakech. The resort is beautiful and quiet - understated and yet luxurious. We found the staff were very helpful rooms comfortable service good and relaxing location outside the medina perfect. Our luggage was lost/stolen upon arrival in Marrakech Airport and the front desk staff were very helpful empathetic and understanding which was much appreciated especially after a long journey from the USA. I wish I could transport the lobby decor to my own home - so beautiful! We'd love to come back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: One of the best resorts in Marrakesh...The team is very friendly and helpful...The room is big clean and comfortable. If you have kids Four Seasons resort is the best place...All kind of food is available at Four Seasons restaurants (Italian Mediterranean...).It was an excellent experience and for sure Four Seasons Resort will be our choice when visiting Marrakesh for a second time

We stayed here in April as a last minute get away. It was totally worth it.    The location is excellent close enough to the airport and main Medina (either walking or driving). Service as always was second to none and very personal being greeted from the very start by our names.    We enjoyed the food and evenings eating outside when then temperature dropped. The pool was terrific children's facilities very good and the staff very attentive. Our room with views of the Atlas mountains was stunning!    Fabulous time! Thank you.

Review_Title: great but can be better customer recognition (it is 5 star resort!)
