Review_Text: resorts was nice.  beautiful property  nice welcome from staff  Reception need more training on customer service:  -check in should be faster  -more flexible and less argument with customer  -ATM must be more reliable. current one withdrew money from account but never dispensed cash to me.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: matt c wrote a review Aug 2016
Review_Title: Wonderful place, Spcial thanks to MarrakechDayTrips,com
Review_Text: Like so many earlier reviews our experience at the Hotel Four seasons was excellent. We also booked this Hotel based on tripadvisor reviews. From the moment I started email communication back in the UK to the day we left Marakesh we couldn't fault the service. It was a special Anniversary treat for four nights and all the staff at the Hotel made us feel special. It's hard to describe the level of service can expect as a guest of the Four Season. It's an unbelievably gorgeous property with white glove service you won't soon forget.  What more can I say other than this hotel is utter perfection. We had a VIP pick up at the airport which was superbly handled (reverse on the way out). It took 20 minutes from walking off the plane to checking in at the hotel. Everyone knew our names as we arrived and throughout our stay. It felt very personal.  Every aspect of the hotel is decorated in a very ornate tasteful Moroccan style..    Rooms : spacious the best air-conditioning system since so silent ! Great for such a hot place and I can never sleep well if there is sound. Very peaceful could not hear anything from any other room nearby and also very quiet outside.  Comfortable beds. Lovely bathroom and a great wardrobe area...somewhere I can finally fit all my clothes in without any issue !  Wifi all over the hotel was great strong and no signal problems at all. Very impressed and its very important to me.  There was a wide breakfast choice and all was cooked and presented well. This was a la carts not buffet style.  We got quotes for a day trip Atlas Mountains from other agencies but we took one of the stuff recommendation to go with MARRAKECHDAYTRIPS which was actually cheaper than any of them and all organised so professionally. A day trip to the Atlas Mountains is well worth taking although the roads aren't for the faint hearted! Having a guided walk is also a pleasure as is lunch overlooking the beautiful scenery    Thank you to the staff for making us so welcome and for giving us such a wonderful experience of a vibrant city.

Review_Title: As always, Four Seasons at its best!!
Review_Text: The hotel premisses are as beautiful as you can expect the staff everyone helpful and always smiling. Near the city and yet so peaceful.  The only regret are the inexperience they have as a country not only here but in general in prepare and serving alcohol drinks nor even the wine. Here they show you an long list of drinks and i hit 2 thet they do not have: prosecco and tequila !!what were the odds!  2 big pools spa fountains palms sun what is more to ask?

Review_Title: Perfect place for a quick get away
Review_Text: We had an amazing time here and it was perfect for just what we wanted. We spent the day by relaxing by the pool and then went out in the Evening. Local small taxi's are not expensive and it was not far from the Medina.    The service by the pool was excellent.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Perfect place to relax away from everything but close enough to the Medina too
Review_Text: We had a lovely relaxing week here. The weather was good and we spent most days around the pool where we were looked after well. The staff are very attentive and helpful.  Our room was huge with an enormous bathroom too which was lovely. Four Seasons remain on of my favourite hotel groups. My only gripe was that we were in the adults only pool and for 2 days there was a family with a toddler there and in the pool. Despite other guests complaining the staff seemed unable to deal with t which led to an awkwardness for the rest of the guests. Another family were turned away with a child so I found it a little wrong that a different family were allowed to stay. If it's billed as an adults only pool t should be an adults only pool.

Review_Title: Nice resort but food could be improved
Review_Text: Stayed at the suite and regular room    Pros:  - Room and bathroom is spacious and has Moroccan look and feel with a large balcony and a ceiling fan  - Resort main area is large with family pool and adult pool  - Plenty of restaurant choices but see note below  - Friendly service    Cons:  - Wifi was spotty and slow  - Tried the breakfast lunch by the pool Italian restaurant and they were all so-so.  - Must be an echo effect cause I could hear when people are walking or opening doors outside our rooms.

Review_Title: Gorgeous resort, but very sleepy & dead at night
Review_Text: This resort is absolutely gorgeous. The grounds are expansive with mature palm trees and lush landscaping. Excellent and well thought out lighting contribute to the beauty of this resort at night. We had a premium king room which was on a higher floor with a large balcony overlooking a pool and the fountain. Here are the pros and cons:    PROS:  - Beautiful grounds  - Good sized rooms with large bathrooms with separate showers and tub  - Excellent room service. We arrived fairly late and ordered room service at 1 am. The food was delicious and the nighttime room service staff (the same person whom we got to know over our several nights at the resort) is excellent. He was friendly and by the second night would refer to us by name or ask if we wanted the same order from the night before. There is no additional charge for room service (prices appeared to be the same as the restaurant) nor was there an automatically service charge. (We always end up tipping the same but it's nice when a hotel doesn't force it on you especially when the room rate is already so high). We also loved that when asked for a wine recommendation the gentlemen who worked the nighttime room service suggested to us the local Moroccan wine which happened to be the least expensive on the menu. (I'm skeptical and often think people are trying to upsell you.) Turns out that it was really good and we ended up ordering there more bottles of it over the course of our stay.  - Huge gorgeous pool  - The food was pretty good. Dinner at the Moroccan restaurant on the terrace was excellent. We got a few mezzes fatoush salad pride with cheese and peppers (sort of like calzone) and chicken skewers. Lunch at the poolside restaurant was less remarkable. We opted for salad and pizza so it may be our own fault for straying from Moroccan cuisine.  - Felt very safe. We had to go through three different security checkpoints every time we entered the hotel (guards check the car/taxi before the gates are opened for entry onto the grounds a second check at the guard gate and then bags are checked as you enter the lobby). One time our taxi driver for whatever reason had a friend in the front seat. The hotel security guard asked him to get out of the car and wait outside the gate while the taxi circled through the hotel to drop us off. The staff is extremely polite and quick so we never felt that it was obtrusive. With everything going on in the world we preferred knowing that precautions were taken.  - Concierge is excellent. She gave us several great recommendations that we really enjoyed. (See my separate reviews for La Maison Arabe La Sultana and Jad Mahal.)  - Valet/bell staff was also excellent. Called taxis for us and gave us waters every time we left the hotel. The taxis called from the hotel charge you a fair price (50 dhm into the Medina) rather than those on the street trying to swindle you.  - Housekeeping did a great job. Very nice and friendly.    CONS:  - Very sleepy and quiet at night.  - Bar closes earlier than advertised on website. We like to option of staying up late on vacation so it's important to us to have the option of a cocktails or drink late into the evening. We specifically checked for this option on the hotel website which says that one of the bars is open until 1 am. Perfect! Turns out that's just plain wrong. Everything at the hotel closes at 11 pm including the bar. So our only option was to order wine from room service (but at least there was no up charge! See above).  - The pool hours are very short. The pool closes at 7 pm which seems odd given that the sun did not even set until around 8:30 pm while we were there.  - We did have one issue with housekeeping. This was our first stop on our trip so we were very jet lagged. As a result we put our "privacy" tag on the door each night and often slept until 2 pm. (After all it is vacation right? There are no rules! You get to do what you want.) Notwithstanding the privacy tag housekeeping telephoned us every day at 2 pm and woke us up to see if we wanted our room cleaned. It would be one thing if say reception called for something not knowing that we had the privacy tag on the door. But in this case housekeeping saw our tag and knew we did not want to be disturbed but called anyway and woke us up. Doesn't make sense.    Overall I would highly recommend. I would definitely stay here again the next time we're in Marrakech.

I love the signature palm tree feature the interior deign the view from the rooms and the spa was the most incredible one in marrakesh. It works in perfect harmony with the surroundings.. Its such a exclusive in the beautiful gem marrakech!

Wonderful place to stay about 30m outside of downtown Marrakesh. Gorgeous grounds amazing breakfast buffet great service and fast internet. The pool is also really really nice. It was our wedding anniversary and they really went the extra mile to make it special. Overall I highly recommend this as a place to stay!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ash S. wrote a review Jul 2016
Review_Text: This hotel is absolutely amazing and has impeccable service. It is located a mere 10 minutes from the airport and about the same time to the Medina.    The hotel has two extremely large swimming pools. One for Family and the other for Adults with an adjacent restaurant    The prices are very reasonable especially when compared to other Four Seasons Hotels around the world.    Four seasons is known for it's quality and unsurpassed service but this Four Seasons takes the cake. The Moroccan staff were exceptional from the grounds keepers all the way to the top.    I would come back in a heart beat.

Review_Date: Peter V wrote a review Jun 2016
Review_Title: i only visited the spa- heavily overpriced.
Review_Text: I asked the reception of my (expensive) Ryad for a "hamman" spa. They sent me here. It is a beautiful location clean and comfortable but still taking all of that into account it simply is too much money for the services offered. Nothing remotely like the typical Hammans in Marrakech so I would recommend asking the right questions to get the names of well run  clean Hammans to experience the "real thing"

Hotel pick-up in a Mercedes from Marrackech airport whisked off to the hotel arriving in less than 15 minutes. Slick check-in via the Four Seasons app with notification that our room was ready (by e-mail) before we even arrived. Didn't even have to go to Reception we were taken straight from front of hotel to our room in a golf buggy. Absolutely what was needed after an early start!  We were looked after from start to finish in a professional and expert manner. Pool staff at the adult pool and breakfast team deserve particular praise nothing too much trouble. Given this was Ramadan and most staff probably weren't eating or drinking between sunrise at 3.30 and 19.45 sunset this kind of service and dedication to role is astounding.  We have been to the Four Seasons Marrakech before but everything seemed that little bit sharper the team really seem to have kitted together. Loved the addition of the Lebanese restaurant in Inara. Our Pavillion room was fantastic bright and sunny with two glass walls a large balcony and great views of the family pool. The highest praise I can give is that we re-booked whilst we were there!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Beautiful hotel gardens and pool. Excellent service. Great choice for breakfast. House keeping service in the rooms very attentive. All staff very kind friendly and helpful. The pool area is stunning restaurant serving pool side service and light meals. Everything perfect but you do have to get a taxi to visit anywhere else in Marrakech as not in walking distance.

Review_Date: Francis B wrote a review Jun 2016
Review_Text: Four Seasons is everything you would expect from a luxury hotel experience. The staff is exceptional and the grounds are stunning. The pavilion room overlooks the pool and is tranquil and serene. There is a great balcony to enjoy a peaceful night after getting back from the crowded medina. Overall a great hotel to stay while in Marrakesh!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Steve B wrote a review Jun 2016
Review_Text: Lucky enough to get a four day break here for our anniversary the relaxation was instant the staff attentive kind and good fun. The food was varied and amazing the spa in particular was great and a special mention to Tariq who's 'magic hands' and passion for his craft resulted in two of the best massages I have ever had. Thanks you to everyone at the four seasons for making our trip so special.    S&J
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Paula D wrote a review Jun 2016
Review_Text: My family (fiancé and three brothers in law) all stayed at the hotel. We took three rooms and never regretted our decision. The hotel is 10 min from the airport 3 min from the Medina and its the epicenter of Moroccan hospitality. Beautiful grounds beautiful rooms and despite intense heat and fasting (we went during Ramadan) some of the most beautiful gracious smiles imaginable.    When you stay make sure to meet Rita (Concierge) Mohamed and Fatima (Breakfast) and El Habib (dinner). Incredible staff!

Review_Date: sandra facchi wrote a review Jun 2016
Review_Text: good facilities and food as always our seasons does not disappoint. The bar at this hotel is really nice and serves good food. I wasn't able to try other restaurants at this hotel. Also I used the guide recommended by the hotel and it was one of the best tour guides I've ever had!

I spent last weekend here and loved it. The hotel has fantastic security and our bags were checked every time we entered the hotel and every taxi coming in is also scanned before entering the hotel so I felt very safe here. The service was faultless. The bedrooms are so luxurious with massive bathrooms. It has beautiful pools and fountains. It really is first class and I will definitely come back.

We had a wonderful stay at the Four Seasons and I think this hotel is amazing. Everything was pretty much perfect with excellent food and service. The grounds are great too and the whole place has a very relaxing and tranquil vibe.    Our room was lovely with a great balcony and a nice big bathroom. The view was of the gardens but I was hoping to get a glimpse of the Atlas mountains but I’m not sure if you can see them from the hotel. I did ask to see another room to compare and this was arranged very quickly however I decided to keep my original room.    We had breakfast at the hotel every day and it was excellent. We also had lunch and a few snacks by the pool and they too were excellent. We really loved the adult pool it’s a great size and we were very lucky that it wasn’t too busy. Throughout the day you are offered complimentary snacks – all very tasty and exotic! The only thing I found annoying was that sometimes people were a bit noisy and I thought as an adult pool people would respect the peace and quiet. Maybe management could review this?    As our first time in Marrakech Concierge were very helpful and also arranged a guide who took us on a half day tour of the sights. This was very useful and informative.    Bear in mind if you are visiting in the next few weeks it is still Ramadan however this did not affect our stay.    One other thing the hotel is only 10 minutes from the airport. I arranged a Range Rover transfer via the hotel which was very nice but looking back now was probably a wasted expense.    We had a great time and will definitely visit again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great rooms and grounds but food and service lacking
Review_Text: The title says it all really. The rooms were gorgeous and are the grounds. We were planning to go sightseeing during the 4 days we stayed in Marrakesh and enjoy the evenings at the hotel.    Didn't seem to be much going on. One restaurant was closed and the other only served Turkish food which was good but you'd expect to have some local dishes when in Morocco. As a result we would extend our sightseeing and eat outside before coming back though room service food was good.    On the last night we decided to play it safe and eat at the hotel but were told the ovens were not working and they couldn't serve any food. Eventually they said they could serve us a limited menu and so we waited. It was not very nice and in fact gave me stomach trouble which is not what you want on your last night. What they should have offered was complimentary transport to/from another hotel or restaurant but when we enquired that was not on offer.    Another sore point was the level of service and attitude at the spa. They simply did not know what they were doing when it came to the manicure service and then pulled a face to boot. Was not impressed.    Final gripe was when we asked the price for a transfer to Casablanca Airport. We expected it to be a little higher but the price quoted was a complete rip-off and was in fact more than the cost of a flight from Casablanca to London! I can't believe anyone would ever consider using their transfer services. Instead we negotiated a reasonable price with a taxi driver and all went smoothly.    It is a crowded market in Marrakesh and unfortunately through no fault of its own tourism is suffering in Morocco. Four Seasons need to address a lot of issues if they want to become a destination of choice in Morocco. It is a shame as we thought 4 nights at the Four Seasons was a banker to ensure a relaxing end to our holiday but in fact it scores lowest of the four places we stayed at in morocco.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great Location For Business Travelers and Centered In The New Development of Marrakech
Review_Text: This hotel has one of the nicest grounds out of any Four Seasons I've stayed at. A huge gym and yoga room two traditional Red Clay Courts with a former World ClassTennis Pro  Talal Ouahabi who I got to hit with. The rooms are nice. Our room had a balcony but it faced the restaurant which provided no privacy. The room were very clean had huge bath tub and separate shower toilet. I really enjoyed the service at the pool which is standard at any Four Seasons but the staff here was very friendly and attentive which we appreciated so much. The restaurant Inara has some of the best fusion of Turkey Moroccan Mediterranean food I have ever had. They cook and season most of the dishes in a wood fire oven. I highly recommend it it's the type of food that belongs in SF or NY. Overall I'd give this Four Seasons a 4.5 star. The Spa which I used everyday is awesome hands down an amazing Spa you have to use it while being there it's a must. One day I couldn't find towels not sure why. Also the Azzera tower restaurant wasn't open. I think if they would just have the bar open with the views it would have been perfect and every guest would be even more impressed with the layout of the hotel and views of Marrakech. I spent most of my money eating and drinking at terrace restaurants Riad's with terraces etcc... so it was disappointing that we could appreciate the Azzera. The Four Seasons is really hurting itself without this restaurant. I would definitely come back here to stay for a few days its still one of the best hotels in the area.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I totally agree with previous travellers that the gardens pools and pool service are fantastic at this hotel. The staff are mostly excellent extremely friendly and helpful apart from the concierge service. I am not sure if it was a language barrier! My granddaughter has coeliac so must have a gluten free diet but this was barely catered for in spite of the hotel having had advance notice of this! One of the managers did apologise for this on the last day but it was rather too late then! Rooms are kept spotless but look quite tired and need updating. The curtains in our room were falling off the runners and letting light in at night - something that needs to be checked more thoroughly by housekeeping or maintenance. The rooms are beautifully spacious with large balconies and lovely bathrooms (although somewhat lacking in toiletries for a Five Star hotel). The hotel was kept beautifully clean however the birds in the dining room at breakfast were somewhat off putting! It is a great shame that the rooftop bar has been closed along with the restaurant below it as several friends commented on how good it was - there are now only two restaurants in the resort open in the evening - one upstairs in the main lobby with a bar and the other is the one used for breakfast which is an Italian in the evening. The choice of food was not that good for a hotel of this rating and the Italian restaurant lacked any atmosphere. The resort should advise travel companies that the rooftop bar with views of the Atlas Mountains has shut down as there is nowhere to go after dinner. Our family has stayed in several Four Seasons hotels and apart from the staff and the gardens this one is not up to their usual high standards.

Review_Date: Will E wrote a review Jun 2016
Review_Text: The reason we will be back is because of the incredible gardens pools and the pool service. The hotel itself is beautiful - but it's clearly part of a global chain and this shows a little in the rooms and room facilities which are basic. However the gardens and pools are quite stunning - and the service provided by the pool staff is outstanding. Lots of iced water with lemon treats and sun glass cleaning!    We had a deluxe room - and if they could have provided a coffee machine more teas and a better turndown service with a chocolate perhaps bath and basin plugs that weren't broken - then this would be a top hotel in my view.    Overall a great holiday and lovely staff who would do anything to make your stay enjoyable. Looking forward to returning!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The Four Seasons Hotel was the best hotel I have been to so far ! The balcony was amazing  the room it self was fantastic and the bathroom was extremly clean ! The hotel has an amazing welcome and the staff were very friendly

There is something about a Four Season's that stands out above any other luxury hotel. From being picked up at the airport to being dropped off at the airport the people that work here are like no other. They make sure everything they do for you is always above and beyond. They know your name every place you go in the hotel whether it's the restaurant or the bar or on the grounds. On this particular trip out of all the places we visited Marrakesh was the best and the Four Season's made it that way for us.

Review_Title: Good Hotel, but some major improvements needed!!!
Review_Text: We have just got back from a weeks holiday at FS Marrakech.  Check in was swift and easy (although no drinks were offered which considering I am 5 months and obviously pregnant isn't great!).  Our rooms were Pavillion rooms overlooking the family pool. Very spacious Lovely big bathroom and terrace with good views. The only downside was extremely hard and uncomfortable beds!  The grounds of the hotel are stunning- we have never stayed somewhere with such beautiful gardens which are constantly pruned and kept nicely. The hotel itself is lovely and kept immaculately.  Whilst the resort isn't huge so easy to walk around the buggies are on call and were there within a few minutes of calling for them.  The spa- a tranquil place to come and relax out of the sun and have treatments with a nice chill out area to sip Moroccan tea afterwards.  The Family pool is very cool (literally-it's not heated  it's so icey cold at the start of the day until the sun warms it up!) and the pool staff are fantastic-constantly bringing glasses of iced water cleaning your sunglasses bring fruit sticks/cocktails/ice creams etc. and shaking out your towels neatly when you can peel yourself off your sun lounger! ;-)  Breakfast- there is a good variety of food but service can be a bit slow.  Lunch-we ate in the restaurant next to the Adult pool everyday(which I think is the only one open!) which was sheltered by gazebos and a nice place to get out of the sun. There was a great variety on the menu and staff were friendly and efficient.  Dinners- with ONLY 2 RESTAURANTS as the one next to the Roof top bar and the bar itself have both closed to guests and apparently are only available to residents dinner choices are therefore limited to either the breakfast restaurant which lacks serious atmosphere or the Lounge restaurant near reception which is better. WHY?? one of our friends said how great both were when they came last year- the bar had a DJ which gave it a great atmosphere (that the hotel now lacks in the evenings!) and had stunning views and the restaurant next to it apparently was great too! If we had known this we would not have booked the hotel with only two choices of restaurants-it should be stated on your website! Which brings me onto two BIG negative points unfortunately...  THE CONCIERGE- quite honestly towards the end of the week I gave up! She kept booking restaurants that were no where near what I was asking for which we then ended up cancelling and eating in the restaurant in the hotel anyway! I clearly explained that my daughter had to eat somewhere with GF options and that I was pregnant and wanted a good standard of food clean restaurant to eat in and she kept trying to book cafes with slow service and where people had recently had food poisoning!!!(as I read here on Tripadvisor!) If you only have 2 restaurant choices in a hotel then you should have more information and a better concierge to recommend outside eateries!!!  THE FOOD IN THE HOTEL- in our opinion the food was just not good enough for a Four Seasons resort let alone a 5*!!! Every meal time something got forgotten or messed up-I don't know if it was a language barrier but sorry thats just not a good enough excuse.  THE WORST part was- my 9 year old daughter has Celiac Disease-it means she has to have a very strict Gluten Free diet or she gets very sick! Our Fantastic travel rep at Elegant Resorts in the UK emailed the hotel twice to explain prior to our journey and ask that alternative Gluten Free foods be arranged for our arrival. The only gluten free available to her was pasta and a very odd cake like bread. It took until halfway through our holiday for them to get GF flour to make breakfast pancakes the chips were not GF there were no cakes or biscuits or snacks made for her-like we requested either. I find this disgusting and not nearly good enough quite honestly. I'm sure if someone had a nut allergy their needs would have been met?  So the big question is- would we stay here again?? The honest answer-Probably not! They need to sort out their concierge and standard of Food massively plus re-open their bar+restaurant before we would even consider it! What a shame as the rest of the hotel and staff are fantastic!  We are repeat Four Seasons guests at a different hotel which is incredible which now leads me to wonder if this hotel is a one off or should we expect this at some of the others? If I had the option I would rate this average-Good as the food situation really lets it down!  A big thank you to the staff by the pool the housekeeping the gardeners and the staff in the Lounge restaurants in the lobbyand poolside restaurant for making the majority of our stay good-we really appreciate everything you did.

we had stayed before in the Four seasons in many countries so we were sure of the high quality of service .  Staff were friendly.  For dinner I would recommend the Italian restaurant A real Art of Culinary and the atmosphere is very classy. For the Service I will say : Chapeau :)  We had to check out after 2 night and move to another hotel since I was not allowed to book a room for my family members who are living there since they said it is the police rules. If you are Moroccan National and living in Morocco you are forbidden to be a guest in the hotel .so Wired....  we had stayed earlier in Al Mamounia which is a luxury and we didn't have such issue.  As I said earlier a Luxury Hotel  Great Service however due to discrimination I don't advice to stay overnight but definitely spend the day and try the F&B Outlets..

Review_Date: Gohar A wrote a review May 2016
Review_Text: Perfect place to enjoy a great vacation. Excellent service everywhere. Very nice outdoor sitting area  Where you can relax after a long day of site seeing. Nice pool and spa. Great breakfast . And our tour guide Aziz was also great . Would highly recommend this hotel.

We stayed at this Four Seasons for 3 nights and found it to be one of the most beautiful Four Seasons we've had the pleasure of visiting. And of course the service was impeccable. The rooms were huge and the property is spread over many acres. Everything was beautifully landscaped and the spa was spectacular. We only wish we had more time to spend on the property since there was much to see in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Heather E wrote a review May 2016
Review_Text: We had a lovely stay at this hotel and I would recommend it as it is close enough to the Medina to discover it's treasures but in it's own world to feel relaxed and on a decadent spa break. Our room was large with a private terrace with the most comfortable beds. The hotel grounds are stunning and well kept. The spa was excellent and the team were all very friendly especially the restaurant teams who went above and beyond to look after us. However there were a couple of areas that could have made our experience 5 stars rather than 4 which were; there is a roof top bar is shown on the website but not open to normal residents restaurant/bar needs to serve more local dishes of quality our room was missed cleaning on one day and service was slow compared to the expectation when staying at a Four Seasons.

Review_Date: Eric L wrote a review May 2016
Review_Text: This is truely a wonderful hotel. Spacious colorful great gardens quiet nice rooms beautiful swimming pools nice fitness tennis courts but most of all a very helpful generous and kind professional staff. That's is what makes all the difference! You can have a great vacation here  visit the busy city and come back to this hotel and completely relax and reenergize .....they really understand what hospitality means!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Four Seasons with a local touch
Review_Text: I will echo others in that no this hotel is not "central" but agree that that's very apparent in research. It's a very secure estate of hotel and private residences you will have to take a taxi to explore. Get over it.  Typical of a four seasons the touches ate there so you know it's a Four Seasons but they are as always sympathetic to location and the hotel had gorgeous more can touches everywhere though modern as only 5 years old.  It's an epic property with the hotel areas in the middle and private residences around the outside.  It was quiet when I went and I travelled alone. I didn't find a comfortable or lively area to eat or drink in the evening but that may be more with timing of the visit.  Pool areas are excellent split into family and adults areas and far enough apart to really be separated. Attentive pool staff and a mix of regular beds and cabanas makes for a relaxing day by the pool.  Staff and friendly and kind. Food was excellent bar one tagine which I think was personal taste.  If you are with children they have an excellent kids programme for all ages so you can get space.  For the grown ups great gym and tennis. Also a fabulous spa with hammam.  Recommended but you may feel a little Isolated if you were planning on walking into town.

Review_Date: Kelly S wrote a review May 2016
Review_Text: Four Seasons offered a Family Retreat Special (4th night free) & included breakfast. We booked two Pavillion Rooms which were huge impeccably clean fabulous bathrooms and each room had large balconies with lounge chairs overlooking the adult / quiet pool. Decor was gorgeous modern Moroccan decor. We were traveling with our three adult daughters and this layout was perfect. The staff was professional very friendly and if we were in need of something out of the ordinary their response was "we will find a solution." The concierge Selma was extremely responsive and professional. She managed all of our pre-arrival requests: a surprise birthday cake upon arrival airport transports tour guides cooking classes and restaurant reservations. All of her recommendations were right on target. The grounds are incredibly beautiful it is definitely an oasis and a 5-10min drive to the Medina. Everything was wonderful; we all hope to return.

Review_Date: Richard C wrote a review May 2016
Review_Text: Having heard much about Marrakech we finally made the trip there last week for a 5 day holiday. It exceeded my expectations.    The hotel is located about 5-10 minutes by taxi from the city centre. It is about 15 minutes to the airport too - very easy to find and everybody knew where it was (taxis Tec.) So NO it. Is not centrally located with walking distance of market. We were well aware of location in advance having done our admin - would think this would be normal practice these days given ease to do so and general cost considerations. At the same time we chose the hotel for its gardens and peaceful vibe. There are 2 pools one for families and another one for adults. I find it extraordinary that people complain about the distance. Taxis are plentiful and we never paid more than 50 dirhams to get anywhere.    We saw food and menu online in advance and felt that prices were reasonable given that we booked this many months ago as a special treat to celebrate our anniversary. It is an extraordinary place and we were ready for this in advance...on this note I find it surprising to see people shocked by the prices (if you want something cheap and cheerful then don't go to a luxury 5 star hotel and perhaps go to McDonald's?) Food was superb.    I was blown away by the gardens. Photos do not do justice when attempting to capture the lighting detail and lawns. It compares with the most beautiful that I have ever seen.    We had a garden suite close to the pool with two large terraces. We never get room service normally but it was too tempting not to have it here (great room service from Jamal)... sitting with a view of palm trees and birds and subdued lightingwatching sun go down with call to prayer in the distance... extraordinary.    I used the health centre. The masseuse Tarik was outstanding. Highly recommended and would definitely go back.    We look forward to returning here one day again for another special occasion. Faultless friendly service... everywhere we turned there was someone waiting with a smile and suggestion.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: If you want to know things will be well run relaxed but with attentive service.. This is a great Hotel!  The Pools are large with segregated areas for tots children and adults.  Food is good - not outstanding. Breakfast... really good!  The gentleman ' combing' the hallways to ensure pristine condition was impressive.  Nothing too much trouble for poolside staff and a small maintenance issue was fixed within minutes...  Rooms are impressive and clearly inspected regularly.  If you are nervous about Marrakech..this place will help you relax...!

Four Seasons are perhaps the most upmarket hotel chain on the planet.  Staffing levels are very high. Their properties are always immaculately maintained. I always try to stay their if possible.    The Four Seasons Marrakech is no different.    The resort/compound is massive beautiful and feels very safe. Security at the front gate was akin to getting into a military base (quite rightly)    There are 2 huge swimming pools on opposite sides of the resort (one for adults only). Both are heated and so great for swimming in the off season.    There are several restaurants on site (we ate at all of them and the food is fine without being memorable).    If booking a suite with a plunge pool be aware that most are not heated.  This may be fine in summer but in early December despite outside temperatures of 25 degrees the plunge pool was way too cold to use.  We changed suites to one without a plunge pool but with a 3rd floor view of the Atlas Mountains.    Marrakech itself in my view is a dreadful place.  Third world poverty shops selling the same tourist tat (metal teapots tatty leather goods carpets slippers spices) and lots of European students/tourists.    I have no idea why it rated so highly on trip advisor.    However the Four Seasons Marrakech is wonderful.    I would go back as its only a 3hr flight due south from London and great for some winter sun on a long weekend.    Next time I wouldn't leave the Four Seasons compound though!

Review_Title: Way outside of town. Have to taxi everywhere.
Review_Text: This is not the best location there is. And not that impressed.    The grounds are very nice and employees are good but you are not close to anything. You'll have to depend on taxis overcharging you for every trip. You should never pay more than 20 dirhams to go anywhere but the bell guy and parking staff will tell you 100 and I'm sure they get a cut. Even the hotel staff is in on it. Cannot stand that. They should be looking out for their customers not trying to assist with the shady taxi drivers.    Food and drinks in the restaurants are grossly over priced but you are stuck at the hotel in the middle of nowhere so the price to take a taxi and back getting overcharged each way makes it a dilemma. 190 dirham ($20) for some pasta and tomato sauce seriously? Already paying an extreme amount for the rooms why try to milk you for more. Just not right.    I was told 2 times at check in that breakfast was included but unfortunately in reality to was NOT! Very costly mistake at over 350 dirham per person. Extremely disappointing to be told one thing then charged.    I won't stay here again as I like to be able to walk around on my own without having to rely on others. Make sure you do a bit of homework on location and proximity to what you like to do and where you would like to go.    The staff is quite friendly and the beds are extremely comfortable. So they have that going for them. Cannot understand the little pottery bottles in the shower filled with something. Is it shampoo? Conditioner? Body lotion? Shower gel? They aren't labeled so who knows????? Sometimes places like to be too cutesy and functionality suffers. This is one of those areas. No labels on the liquids. Also there is no small store for drinks sundries or other needs you may have. Such as not in the mood to pay 80 dirham for a Coke! Seriously? Usually both Africa and Middle East hotels provide complimentary mini bar for customers paying several hundred dollars per night. Seems cheap and petty.    It's a good hotel with private residences also located on the property but won't be staying here again. No way. Was kept up all night one night due to mosquitos buzzing around my ears and biting me.    On 2 separate occasions the front desk and reception told me they would get right back to me in regards to my questions. Never to they get back to me and return my calls as promised.    It's not all negative as that would be unfair. The entire property and rooms smell wonderful. And music is always being softly played throughout the grounds. But still you are near nothing at all. Even the driver from the airport couldn't find the hotel.

Review_Title: Great hotel, beautiful decor, ok service
Review_Text: As a corporate meeting & incentive group planner I have good taste a passion for beautiful hotels & a requirement for top-notch service especially at this price point. This hotel is lovely but the service was quite slow unresponsive and a problem at times. The bar and restaurant staff were slow and the front desk interactions were challenging regarding check in rooms and bills.    Overall I would stay at this property again if in Marrakech but would lower my service expectations from the norms of a Four Seasons.

We visited Marrakech for a very short weekend to attend a party and wished we had been able to stay longer. The welcome at the Four Seasons was superb. We were escorted to our room which was spacious comfortable and beautiful and had a lovely terrace with subbed beds and a table and chairs.  We ate in the Lobby on the first night and had what is probably the best Mezza I have ever had. A wide variety of Arabic snacks with warm bread and very attentive service.  Breakfast was lovely and consisted of a large choice of pastries fruits and hot and cold breakfast items and again he service was very attentive and timely. In fact everyone at the hotel was delightful.  We arranged a private guide to show us some of the sights of the city which was a great (and not too expensive) way of seeing a quite chaotic and difficult to navigate city. We appreciated the guide and his knowledge and think it was the best was to see as much as possible in a short time. The city is well worth a visit.  The concierge were very helpful and we had no problem with the bell staff arranging taxis for us and agreeing fares with the drivers before we left. Taxi's in the city are sadly always trying to rip off tourists so we refused to get in unless a fare was agreed before hand.  The pool areas in the hotel were stunning The peace and quiet was amazing and only the sound of the many birds was to be heard (a great relief after so m any recent hotel visits are spoilt by terrible music being played everywhere......). It was so much nicer to have some peace.  We can't wait to come back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: mark v wrote a review May 2016
Review_Text: I stayed here for a long weekend with my family and a friend (7 persons in total). We stayed in three different rooms next to eachother (125 126 and 127). It is expensive (we paid about Euro 400 per room per night excluding breakfast) but the rooms are very spacious very well equipped and the hotel offers all facilities you would want. Above that the staff is very helpful and friendly and made us feel very much at home. The only comment I have is the location: it is more than walking distance from where ever you want to go in the city so you always need a cab. However it is easy to find a nice taxi driver who will bring you everywhere you want to be not too expensive.

It's a wonderful hotel very centrally located and yet very open.it has lot of open place with two large pools one of them is heated the hotel is very tastefully decorated.the lobby and sitting areas are very comfortable.the bar is on the terrace with a view of the garden and fountains.the garden with fountains is beautiful.the staff is very good with excellent service .food is very good .breakfast spread is excellent with plenty of fresh fruits and wonderful bakery products.food on the whole was very good. It's very close to most of the attractions I can very highly recommend this hotel
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed here for three nights on a mini break and can't recommend it enough. The staff were helpful and attentive without being intrusive. The hotel is well maintained and the grounds and pools feel like an oasis from the heat and bustle of the city. It is an ideal hotel for both couples and families. We were staying there over our wedding anniversary and the hotel had decorated our room with red roses wine and cake - a lovely touch. This hotel is a credit to the Four Seasons name.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tom G wrote a review May 2016
Review_Text: We spent four days here with our 7 month old son and the main reason we booked this hotel is because it sounded by far the most child friendly.    We are very glad we did so; the food was first class with a few different restaurants of excellent standard all with their own character brilliant service from helpful and happy staff beautiful grounds and swimming pools and most importantly for us excellent and attentive childcare. We enjoyed it so much we are planning to return next spring. Three hours from London with no time difference makes it a very attractive option with children. Highly recommended on all levels.

Review_Date: Barbara D wrote a review May 2016
Review_Text: Amazing trip. Everything you could ask for in a hotel. Attentive staff. Best concierges of any Four Seasons I have ever had the pleasure of enjoying. Our room was large and comfortable. The spa was beautiful.

I was debating staying in a Riad like last time as it's more authentic but very happy I came here.  They make you feel like a princess and lovely warm welcome.    Adult pool is lovely and they bring you lovely fresh juice and water all day.  Had wonderful massage in spa!  I will be back for sure!  Oh and it's spotless too!

This is the most stunning hotel with the most amazing staff. Suitable for families or couples as there is a separate area for each. The rooms are amazing gorgeous and huge. I had both a balcony and a terrace. The grounds are impeccable and so pretty with all of the flowers and fauna. A MUST....A PERFECT HONEYMOON SPOT.

Review_Date: Karmen S wrote a review Apr 2016
Review_Title: fantastic service, one feels like a queen/king
Review_Text: First time in Morocco and it will not be the last.  If you want to relax this hotel is definitely the place!  I almost felt like staying at the hotel / garden / pool ALL the time (which would be a pity with such a nice city and surroundings). Suggestions by the concierge were great (e.g. a short trip to get an idea of the Atlas).

Really enjoyed our stay - everything was fantastic: food room service. And Marrakech itself is very impressing. We did not miss anything and would like to go there again one day. It was a wonderful stay.

Review_Title: Calm, Relaxing, Nice breakfast and rooms
Review_Text: Our room was very comfortable and it had a very good view. You must have a walk at the garden and swim in the outdoor pool(The pool is shallow though). The breakfast was my favorite meal because it had a very big combination of fruits sugars and breakfast classics(eggs e.t.c). Loved the kids club staff as a child. The design of the hotel is asian and it's very very nice!!!

We only came for a short visit but within seconds felt very welcome. A very child friendly place and a great sunset on the terrace with an amazing customer oriented service brought it home that we need to come back properly and enjoy this amazing place for longer.

well from where ı start with the huge expectations ı have booked my room through FOUR SEASONS web site after reading all reviews that some of them indicated their dislike some indicated like naturally I always look through the full sıde of the glass but upon check in ı realized that what I looked was the empty side of the glass. By the way I had no problems with the staff and during check incheck out all went smooth and staff was very friendly and helpful core of the problem is the management well if you consider to pay reasonable amount of money for a room which is triple charge of Le Meridien's delux room and double of its executive room you should have expected something different after all both hotels locates on the same avenue.  we had stayed at four seasons BALİ UBUD it was great like a magic world and thought it would be the same but failed. hotel was quite very few customers there no attraction was in not like UBUD Four Seasons no attractions ( dancers musicians )nothing that is why I called pensioner's house thanks god there were two famous classy clubs PALAIS JAD MAHAL and COMPTOIR DARNA now management may say this is non of their business attracting the people letting them enjoy during their stay  I think that is wrong if a customer pays that amount of money per night that customer is classy and look for something different than the other resorts or hotels may offer them . after all hiring belly dancers and musicians for some time while having drinks on the terrace is should not be very costly.  time to think over dear management better not to leave everything on staff you should be creative so that you may fill your resort with lots of charming people not like what I have experienced during four night stay.  by the way i am a loyal customer and member of FOUR SEASONS as well as other group of hotels HHONORSSHANGRİ-LASPG and MARRIOTT that is why I myself obliged to write this review for the sake of group and resort itself .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Exceptional service lovely room and great amenities. Perfect recovery spot from lengthy travel. Not walkable to the medina but a beautiful place to unwind hit the gym and enjoy the quiet before exploring the chaos of Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: As a family friendly hotel this is a truly lovely place to stay. We stayed here with our 8 and 11 year olds. They had a wonderful time around the pool in the kids club and the teenage centre and we were able to relax.    As you would expect from Four Seasons everything was very slick and well maintained. The staff were extremely professional and friendly. The facilities were fantastic - great gym lovely pools nice spa etc.    Our room (Deluxe Pavilion Suite) was spacious and easily accommodated our family.    Indeed everything about this hotel screams high-end international resort. So as destination to go to with a family you won't really go wrong but as a result it also kind of lacks character and becomes a bit bland and sterile.    In conclusion we had no regrets in coming here with our children and would certainly endorse it as a great place to stay as a family. However in a wonderful City like Marrakech there are some far more interesting and unique places to stay so if we were not with children we would probably have chosen another hotel/Riad.

Review_Title: Very relaxing stay outside of the medina
Review_Text: The location is close to both the airport and medina. The staff was wonderful and the rooms were large and had big balconies overlooking the pool. For those that don't want to be in the thick of things near the medina this location is wonderful because it is close enough to the medina without being in all of the chaos! The buffet breakfast was terrific but my only critique would be the lack of options for food for dinner. We ate at the hotel more than we had planned. I wished that there were more dining options. The spa was nice and the pool was great for my children.

Review_Date: Johannes A wrote a review Apr 2016
Review_Title: very convenient location towards the Medina, beautiful gardens
Review_Text: I liked especially the location - only five minutes by taxis to the Medina.  beautiful gardens. Architecture and decor are neutral there are other ones in Marrakesh which recently have been opened. but those you can also visit for a lunch or dinner. also great - it´s not to far from the hotel.

Review_Title: Just got back from my friends wedding at the Four seasons
Review_Text: I travelled to Marrakcsh last week to attend my friends wedding being held at the Four Seasons hotel.  What can I say it's beautiful. The resort is stunning. I highly recommend the hammam spa treatment!!!!  The adult pool is delightful.  The grounds are immaculate the staff as expected were really helpful and attentive.  The service was excellent the beds are the most comfortable I've ever slept in!!!  I would highly recommend this hotel.

Review_Date: Leo K wrote a review Mar 2016
Review_Text: I first stayed in the Four Seasons back in Feb 2013 and it was great coming back here again. The staff are excellent food choices are great service is amazing the pool is great and the hotel is located close to the Medina (center) and the airport. The air is so fresh and clean. Best rooms are Premium rooms as they have a balcony with views of the Atlas mountains. Nothing better than waking up to a sunny day with a view of snowy mountains on the horizon.    Perfect place to stay if you want peace quiet great choice of food and amazing service. The staff are the best bit of the resort. Everyone is extra nice and friendly. They make the stay feel very personal almost like it's a second home. One of the staff members offered to move a palm tree out of the way as it was keeping me in the shade. I still can't figure out if that was a joke because these guys really do go the extra mile to make your stay feel perfect.    It is expensive in comparison to other places but you do get what you pay for!

amazing atmosphere from the Arabian nights makake this hotel within the top five hotels i used to visit around the world. Special mention to the consierge service and the "pavillion" rooms is simply outstanding.

Review_Title: This is an oasis of calm, relaxation and luxury in Marrakesh!
Review_Text: This hotel as expected is beautiful elegant and luxurious! the staff is extremely helpful and will go out of their way to help the guest if you stay at the Four Seasons you just know nothing can go wrong. Pure perfection!

Stunning the word of another reviewer best summarizes the grounds and experiences of the Marrakech Four Seasons. We arrived perhaps not in the same fashion as other guests (black luxury SUV private limos). In fact we arrived in a dusty van that we'd just been in for four days of mountain to desert nature adventuring and the night after sleeping in a tent in the desert. Disheveled unwashed and with dirty hiking shoes and random clothes spilling out of camp bags- we were immediately welcomed like royalty into the best accomodations that Marrakech has to offer. They had already upgraded our room and unlike large resorts nearby of this caliber this setup is more like a series of private two-story buildings with amazing landscaping and private balconies (meaning two balconies to our single room). This meant we still had an amazing view of the Atlas mountains but an even bigger space to soak in this super deluxe amazing hotel experience. The king bed in this hotel was simply the best bed I've ever slept in and it (and likely the very private/quiet surroundings) was the best and most restful sleep we've ever had. The staff is world-class trained in customer service and they excel at every opportunity. Finding out it was our honeymoon meant we came back from the souks one night to a bottle of champagne and "Happy Honeymoon" cake they set up in our room! The next night we witnessed them surprising an elderly couple (about 80 yrs old) with a "Happy Anniversary" cake through room service too. These generous amazing staff go well out of their way to make sure guests have an outstanding experience whether it's poolside (gorgeous heated pool and jacuzzi btw!) or when we left in the taxi for the airport and the bellman remembered that I like The Telegraph and tucked that newspaper into my carry-on. I couldn't have imagined or dreamt of a better experience in any way for our four nights. We had room service breakfast one morning... you simply need to see it to believe it. Also to get basically anywhere we wanted to go around Marrakech it was a pre-negotiated 50Dhm rate and they have their own subset of taxis that arrive for you on-demand. The only tradeoff about this hotel versus a hotel within the medina is the need to take a taxi into the medina. It would be possible to walk if you weren't shopping as much as we were perhaps. :)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Visited this beautiful resort on a day pass to use the pools. It included a lunch at the Azera Grill starters main and dessert. Fantastic value for money. Overall the service was really good staff were hospitable and attentive. They were very caring. The food was delicious and lovely drinks. I would come here again any day! I recommend a day pass to anyone in Marrakech for a peaceful relaxing day away from the hectic main centre. Best part of my trip!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Me and my fiancé had a great time in Marrakech and mostly because of our stay in Fours seasons hotel. Huge property and very welcoming staffs nice pool location is very accessible to everything and comfortable rooms. We enjoyed every minute of our stay and I highly recommend this property if you will be staying in Marrakech! Hello to the guy from the reception I think his name is Ahmed not sure but he wears eyeglasses very friendly and helpful all through out our stay!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The three days we spent there were the most memorable ones. The hotel is near Marrakech yet it has enough distance to be in a quiet neighborhood. If you really want to go to the souk everyday (which i don't recommend) the hotel provides good shuttle bus on regular schedules.    The breakfast is delicious and the ambiance of the restaurant is simple but luxurious. I call it the Hermes restaurant since the shade of orange they use is the famous Hermes orange. Orange is the happiest color. The best of all is the heated outdoor pool which makes the stay in late January and early February a truly enjoyable experience.    We made a mistake of leaving the city and went to a desert camp which the owners claim to be luxurious. We spent two whole days on the road to get to that camp only to realize the camp is very basic. The establishment is outdated especially the beds the floor carpets and the so called bathrooms. The desert wasn't really special since the sand was not as red as it is from other parts of Sahara. Strangely we spent a lot more of our budget on that desert camp than on the Four Seasons resort. I wish i had done differently.    My advice is that you stay in this hotel or similar luxurious hotels near Marrakech. Then hire a car with a driver for a day or two so that you can see the mountain and a bit of the desert nearby. Go to the souk for a day just to get your curiosity satisfied. But don't spend too much time there because you can get exhausted from what seems to be a whole city of people who want to sell you something. If they had used fixed pricing we would have bought more things. It's an ordeal to buy anything from that city. Get your peace and peace of mind at the Four Seasons.

wonderful resort had a great time and was treated like a Queen! our meetings went well and our participants were fully satisfied with the venue and its logistics. the staff is great and the resort itself is very attractive and well-maintained! congrats to the whole team!

Review_Date: Mike D wrote a review Mar 2016
Review_Title: Great hotel, one of the Best getaways in many years.
Review_Text: The hotel is a great getaway from the hustle and bustle of the Medina and the Old City. Yet close enough to get to the Old City quickly.  Excellent spa and restaurants and property. You feel like you are coming home rather than to a hotel/resort. The views around the property matched the pictures a really beautiful place.  The Solano restaurant was excellent visited it twice for dinner. The staff for breakfast was good at introducing you to new items which quickly became favorites.    A tip for a new visitor Relax and enjoy the slower pace at the resort. Leave the hustle and bustle the horns blowing scooter whizzing by and what seems like the hectic pace of the Medina in the Medina! Enjoy life and the Four Seasons Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: emily k wrote a review Mar 2016
Review_Text: Beautiful resort amazing staff. Took great care of me. My personal favorites: the room service the on resort dining the pools and spa with an amazing steam room sauna and cold and warm tubs the 40 acre grounds that I spent days walking. Everything you would expect from a 4 Seasons Resort.

Review_Title: STUNNING HOTEL away from the hustle and bustle of hectic Medina!
Review_Text: From the moment we arrived we were treated like royalty. At the time of booking I did request a Twin room but was given a Double room upon check in. In their defence I had not booked direct but through BA so it's BA who probably didn't communicate this to the hotel.    Anyway this wasn't a problem we checked in went to the Double room to relax until they found a new room for us. Not only did they find us a Twin room but we were upgraded as well!    Both hotel rooms were BEAUTIFUL with plenty of room huge room with table and chairs balcony (Double room had a garden view with two sun loungers) upgrade room had table and chairs and a lie down area. Walk in closet in both rooms and both had a HUGE bathroom with separate toilet.    The pool staff were great so was everyone else we encountered all polite helpful and friendly.    I will definitely be returning! I loved my birthday getaway.

We stayed at the Four Seasons to celebrate my grandmother's 70th birthday in the beginning of March. This was her first time staying at a hotel let alone a five-star hotel / resort and it was the best option in Marrakech we could have possibly booked. The service was outstanding and the best any of us had ever experienced. They treated her with the upmost respect and anticipated her every need and desire. My grandmother is Moroccan and even she was impressed by the Moroccan decor and Moroccan cuisine the resort. I've stayed in five star hotels around the world including the Chicago Four Seasons hotel and this resort by far surpasses all. The resort is in a good location next to the Jardins a la Ménara and a short car ride away from the Jemaa el Fnaa and the Jardin Majorelle (YSL gardens). Down the street there's a location for the popular horse carriage rides around Marrakech and camel rides.    Highlights:  * Moroccan tea during check-in  * Top Notch showers  * Hotel entrance smelling like roses burning fireplace and the sound of parakeets  * Complete breakfast buffet at Solano including freshly pressed juices and traditional Moroccan selections. A special thank you to Achraf for taking special care of us and preparing a dish just for my grandmother  * Attentive pool staff. Upon arrival we were greeted with ice water and lemon. At the Family Pool the staff threw in some pool toys to make the pool even more fun. While doing laps at the adult pool the lifeguard supplied hand paddles and flippers.  * Heated adult and family pool.  * Straw hats and quality sunscreen available by the pool.  * Clay tennis courts. Thank you Talal for welcoming us.  * Visit the Young Adult Center for foosball pool/billards darts outdoor ping pong basketball video games (Mario Cart 8) movie theater and Tech Center. Thank you Mehdi for your assistance.    The only problems were the closing of the rooftop Terrace for construction which sacrificed views of the mountains. However we understood because we stayed during the off-season and it was nice having the Resort quite vacant. When we expressed our disappointment the staff made it right.    Recommendations:  Keep the young adult center open later than 9 p.m.  Have the pool open earlier than 10 a.m.    Overall this resort comes highly recommended and I will certainly return.

We were here for a convention. It was really perfect for this - to have all the participants and meetings in one area. The place is massive yet also remarkably quite charming. I think the big advantage to the grand scale of the place is that it allowed all of us to be on one campus without feeling like we were under each others' thumbs. So from a business perspective - excellent. Our suite was also splendid. Lovely cushioned areas on the patio overlooking the pool and gardens. Architectural details that felt authentic to Morocco. The staff was professional and cheerful. the food was A+. Best of all however the Hammam. This was my first - and wow! The hotel also has a fabulous roof-top bar/club with shisha that is a lot of fun.

We had a very enjoyable stay in February. The weather was unseasonably warm so we were able to enjoy the pool. The heating didn't work on the first day but it was fixed by the end of the day. However I still found the pool a bit too chilly at 27 degrees. The gardens are big and very beautiful. We enjoyed an early morning jog. The kids loved the young adult centre with its computers video games pool table etc.  We had lunch at the grill by the pool which was most excellent. Kids enjoyed the food from room service. The staff were wonderful & very attentive. A special thanks to Ghita Kamal who provided a hotel limo to take me to a golf course when she discovered that the local taxi was unable to go that far out of town. Highly recommended.

Review_Date: Andrew C wrote a review Mar 2016
Review_Text: I stayed here in the 4 bedroom Royal Villa in October 2015 to celebrate my 30th birthday with family. The hotel organised the perfect surprise (for everyone else in my group!) birthday party including a live DJ local band local outfits for dancing shisha (with the coals prepared in our villa garden next to the pool!) and a very tasty BBQ and we all had the most memorable and amazing evening eating around the pool in our own huge private villa. This was all organised by Karima who really did the perfect job in ensuring everything goes smoothly and has my complete appreciation! Everyone had a great time.    Other nights we were in the hotel's rooftop bar and had a great time with excellent service from Youssef every night - we felt like he was genuinely pleased for us to be there and that we could ask him for anything and he would help us.    Thank you very much!

Review_Date: John D wrote a review Feb 2016
Review_Title: Generally good but a some issues
Review_Text: We stayed for 3 nights at around £214 per night (excluding breakfast). We were upgraded to a deluxe room on check-in in the main part of the hotel. It appears that there is little difference between superior and deluxe rooms except for the view. The staff at the hotel were very courteous and professional. The room itself was comfortable. I was expecting slightly more from the rest of the property however. The restaurants and bars were a little lacklustre the heating was broken in the thermal pool in the spa and one of the pools was out of action for maintenance. However what the hotel lacked in resources was made up for by the level of service which was excellent throughout. The concierge organised a private tour of the Medina and surrounding area which we really enjoyed and the service at breakfast was prompt and efficient. Overall a pleasant stay but nothing to write home about.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The Four Seasons in Marrakech is well positioned only a short drive from the airport and the centre of Marrakech. It occupies a large compound which contains the main hotel and rooms villas and the Four Seasons Private Residences. These are set within gardens which are pleasant but not spectacular. Security is good and there are plenty of staff at the reception. We were not shown around the resort on arrival.    Main parts of the hotel are clean and comfortable. In February the hotel seemed almost empty apart from the last day when the hotel was hosting a large conference - this changed the atmosphere from a vacation hotel to a crowded convention centre which was not nice. There did not seem to be a different part for delegates and the lobby and lounges became noisy and busy.    The room was adequate but there is not much more to say about it. The bed was comfortable. The iPhone station is outdated and does not work with iPhone 6 and the English TV selection is very limited. Toiletries that are provided are cheap.    Breakfast and service was good. Other bars and restaurants lacked atmosphere and food in these decidedly average and quite expensive.    The larger pool was closed when we visited which we were not informed about and was not explained. The smaller pool was fine but cold.    Spa was a disappointment and could be much better. Jacuzzi was broken. Similarly the gym (which is large) was missing several pieces of equipment that I would have expected (e.g. rower Bosu PowerPlate).    I would return to Marrakech but probably not the Four Seasons.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Four years after its debut in 2011 this property is among the favorite one for luxury hideaway in Marrakech. Located just a short ride from downtown Medina It is a perfect hideaway from bustling Medina.  Under the new guide of Mr. Félix Murillo (who joined FS back in 1993) - this property still maintain its high standards of Service.    As my local taxi pulled in to the hotel - the assistance with the luggage seems a bit slow and no smile or warm welcome as I expected . Well I guess I should try a limousine next time :-)    The check-in went fine agent was able to process it quickly. Welcome mint-tea was offered during arrival. Agent was friendly. As it is a trip to celebrate my father birthday. Our room was a bit far at the end and as it is a trip to celebrate my father birthday - I asked nicely if there could be another room available closer to the pool area - Unfortunately the request was kindly decline.    Room was booked under Virtuoso - upgrade was provided along with welcome amenity and personalize card. House keeping agent is very attentive an extra hotel postcards were delivered upon request.  Birthday amenity was delivered in the evening... Many Thanks    The property is beautiful there are two pools available.  Pool service attendant are very friendly and attentive. Water and glass cleaner was provided during the stay.  Gym and Tennis court are well maintained.  Spa is clean and well presented.    Main Concern:  Spa Menu price need to be well printed and informed.  The price from.... to .... is very unclear.  I learned after that there is a High season price and Low season price for the spa.  I guess it is a new trend ...  will we anticipate in the future a restaurant also offer a menu with high season and low seasons price ??    Upon check-out I did address my concern regarding the spa.  The agent was professional and able to solve it.  Luggage assistance and transportation arrangement were provided upon departure.    Suggestion for improvement:  Room:  Luxury standard meet.. but nothing is special.  Ex. Why not provided an authentic handmade marrakech straw bag in room for guest to use during their stay... great option as pool bag to carry books etc.    Breakfast:  The selection is ok.. but hey this is Four Seasons.. people expecting WOW...  La Mamounia & Royal Palm Marrakech... have better presentation and selection..  and not to mention the newcomer Mandarin Oriental is eager to impress...    It was a short stay but we did enjoy it.  As people says.. getting to the top is hard but to stay on the top is harder.  I hope FS Marrakech will be able to maintain its reputation among all the savvy traveller.    My sincere thanks to all the front line agent at the FS Marrakech who made our stay enjoyable..

If there was one criticism I'd levy at the Four Seasons it's that its buildings and decor are mildly bland in appearance compared to its category for Marrakech. It's very pretty but you could almost believe you're in Scottsdale!    The ambience of the room and terrace could be greatly improved with some more locally themed artworks in the rooms and some plants and climbers and maybe wall tiling on the terraces. Now for a self-confessed fusspot like me if that's all you're hearing about after 5 days you know it is a good hotel!    Other than that the Four Seasons is perfect. The flip side of its being an international chain and thus a bit under-decorated vs the fancy local competitors is that the Four Seasons sure knows how to run a hotel and therefore you're not leaving good hospitality working amenities etc to chance.    The entire staff was amazing the adult pool is lovely and large (and heated in winter!) The room is extremely spacious with a dressing room massive soaking tub and the most comfortable bed I can remember sleeping in since the Park Hyatt Toronto c. 2000!!    It's not cheap but it's definitely value for money. Will go back. I almost didn't go here because the photos make it look so dull; almost like a conference hotel. It's not like that at all in reality. A very peaceful oasis of Bougainville and birdsong butterflies and greenery - and lovely sunsets.

Review_Title: wonderful place to relax with your family!
Review_Text: Very peaceful place with a very beautiful garden and different fountains kind and very attentive staff beautiful pool area and open air restaurant and bar. very different choice of rooms - suitable for all sorts of needs - children are very welcomed and all their little needs will be taken care of - pampered from start to end but also plenty of opportunities for mum and dad. We all loved it and will certainly return!

We spent Valentines weekend 2016 there and everything was more than perfect.  Resort itself is located close to the airport (hotel provides free pick-up) taxi ride to the center takes no more than 10 minutes.  Rooms are very well equiped and quiet. Resort is huge and provides all sorts of facilities - gym well equipped pool tennis court spa 3 restaurants with great local and international cuisine.    Staff is extremely polite and attentive literally guessing your needs before you express them.    It's a pleasure to stay in this resort and I'd definetely come back here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: gorgeous property, comfortable on the eye
Review_Text: Hotel was excellent. Concierge was terrific. Can't recommend enough the gardens decor people. I will now focus on the few minor things we didn't like: limited choice of restaurants inside the hotel mostly Italian or eating in the lobby. Bathroom supplies were not labeled clearly and no bath products. Would expect more from a four seasons.    The Gym is very nice and well equipped and the spa is fabulous. Views from Sky Bar are very nice and the setting is fantastic
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Everyone was extremely friendly and professional. We stayed in one of their larger rooms that looks like a bungalow which had a great plunge pool and terrace. We highly recommend the Italian restaurant
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The Four Seasons was a great way to wind down and relax after a hectic few hours in the Medina. HIGHLY recommend the spa treatments - hamam is a must! Oh - and the beds will be the best thing you've ever slept on.

Review_Date: Luke M wrote a review Jan 2016
Review_Text: Checked into the Four Seasons after an unfortunate (hour) stay at another hotel. I called up made a booking and a car was outside my current hotel 10 minutes later.    As soon as you enter the grounds it feels like your totally out of the city even though your not! Grounds & gardens are very well kept very quiet lots of birds chirping the rooms are very well thought out the depth of the bath is truly amazing and the terraces of the rooms offer beautiful views.    As a Vegetarian my usual issues with most hotels (especially in Morocco) is the lack of Vegetarian options or having to ask for substitutes. I travelled alone this time so only made use of the room service menu which was fantastic. A wide range of choice both Moroccan and international at great prices. Presentation (both plates and table layout by waiter) as well as taste was great for all meals!    My flight was not until 5pm and the hotel offered me a complimentary late check out which was great. I did book a transfer to the airport with the hotel at first its 600 MAD fee (around £45) seemed crazy considering the airport is 10 mins away however the service provided was great. Instead of the car dropping you off at departures they take you to the check in desks help with your bags and see you off through security. Allot more easier than previous experiences and would use this service again!    I appreciate allot of people come to a resort to relax and get away from life and internet however I am not one of those people. The wifi needs to be sorted! Very slow even on the premium service (Around £15 which I had taken off the bill) It is usable however for a premium price resort it should be allot better.    Overall I would say this is my favourite hotel in Marrakech so far and look forward to coming back in the Summer!

Review_Date: Peter B wrote a review Jan 2016
Review_Text: A refuge from the sensory overload of the Medina!    The resort is situated on lovely serene and expansive grounds. All sorts of amenities are available including spas swimming pools tennis courts and a young adults center.    The airport and city center are a short taxi ride away. I found this location to be ideal as one can explore dynamic Marrakech at will but return to a peaceful environment. In the evenings the hotel offers a complimentary ride to the Medina.    The rooms are spacious and well appointed. The room's terrace is a pleasant spot to start and end your day.    Cheerful and helpful service from the entire staff particularly stands out. I found the concierge desk especially useful as they addressed all of my arrangements.    I have not a single complaint and enjoyed a delightful stay - truly excellent and highly recommended!

The four seasons hotel Marrakesh is superb! A tranquil and beautiful place for all the senses. Me and my wife stayed for two nights to celebrate my wife's 40th birthday. We made the booking through Grand Luxury Hotels and we were given a Guest Experience Manager who was there to help with any quires. When I made the booking I mentioned in the notes that it was for a special occasion.  When we arrived we were given a room upgrade from a Delux room to a Premier room.  Inside our room was a lovely bouquet of red roses and a hand written card from the general manager.  During the whole stay we were made to feel special.  Besides the outstanding beautiful setting of this resort the staff really made the difference. Both nights we received a complimentary limo to our restaurant in town. The second night Rabiaa from the hotel Concierge made us a reservation at the La Masion Arabe restaurant (I highly recommend!). Again a complementary limo and a fantastic greeting at the restaurant with a lovely romantic table.
