Rabiaa had also mentioned it was my wife's birthday and to our surprise the waiters sang my wife a song and presented her a cake.  We felt special that we came from the four seasons hotel and were given a driver back to the hotel after our evening meal.  The facilities spa pool the breakfast were all above expectations. Most of all the friendliness and service of the hotel staff is what I will remember the most from our lovely stay. Especially Rabiaa who went the extra bit to make sure my wife's day was a success.  Many thanks and we will be back in the future.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A late review but felt I must write. My family visited this hotel for our October half term break we really didn't know what to expect as our preferred property at this time of the year is The Residence in Dubai. We really were very impressed the pavilion suite was great for our family. Food service (especially poolside) was fantastic. We most certainly will return.

Review_Date: Ramesh D wrote a review Jan 2016
Review_Title: Excellent place to stay at Morocco
Review_Text: Stayed here with family in the Pavilion Room (family retreat package). The room was excellent with large patio/balcony with chairs lounge chairs.    The staff was very friendly and concierge set us up with private tours.

Fantastic piece of luxury in Marrakech. The resort itself is wonderfully appointed and beautifully decorated. Small touches make it feel truly luxurious such as the flower displays everywhere chirping birds in reception and the various herbs on display as you walk around the resort. My Premier room was lovely albeit a bit small considering the resort is so large. Nice decoration and layout with a luxury bathroom deserving of its 5 star title and the highlight was the private balcony which was a good size and had an unbeatable view of the moroccan sunset. A problem for some is that rooms facing this way also face the airport where it can be noisy. Not an issue for me but may put some people off.    There is a lot to do on the resort. 2 large pools a spa tennis courts a gym and several restaurants and bars. The Italian restaurant seemed a little out of place in Morocco but was excellent. The rooftop bar at the centre of the resort was nice and the breakfast offering was plentiful. Service throughout the resort was exceptional but I was lucky to arrive at an extremely quiet time of year where at times it felt as though I was the only one.    I paid a visit to the spa which was truly 5 star. The prices seemed high for Marrakech but the service surroundings and products used went some way to justifying the cost. If you want to try a Moroccan hammam this would be an excellent choice especially for a newbie such as myself. The gym is also well equipped with separate cardio and resistance rooms.    Location is also good and makes everything very accessible. Overall a lovely resort which deserves the Four Seasons brand name and provides a luxurious oasis amongst the somewhat hectic Moroccan city.

Review_Title: Former Glory standards slipping at spa!
Review_Text: I have been coming to the spa from when it opend and its not been maintained upto the Four seasons standard had a massage this week the masaage was superb but the i got a electric shock from the spa pool as one of the buttons was exposed! also the products in shower seemed cheaper then other years maybe some cut backs in place and also the steam room was dirty! until they fix the standards i would advise people to try the Mandarian Oriental or the Royal mansour!    the standard did not meet the four seasons name

I stayed for three nights on what was primarily a business trip but the resort offered a great opportunity to swim walk and relax: truly replenishing and an oasis of tranquility. To make it even better they need to enhance the dining experience and offer more choices.

Review_Title: Very nice 5* but not the Four Seasons experience at all
Review_Text: The idea when staying at the Four Seasons is you give up on the charm and location of luxury Riads (or La Mamounia) for a top-notch “resort” experience with well-known standards.  Working in hospitality like the friend I was staying at I know the “brand bible” of Four Seasons very well and surprisingly this is the first hotel of the chain which doesn’t respect it.  We got a discount on the rack rate which is way too overpriced vs competitors if you have to pay it.    For a little more La Mamounia offers a much better and memorable experience and a myriad of Riads intimate warm personalized service. Then the Mandarin or the Royal Mansour are quite a few levels up.    In short this resort simply does not respect Four Seasons standards and I’m very surprised Head Mgt don’t fix that.  For sure it’s really not horrible at all no serious issues at all: the one star is harsh but you pay for the “Four Seasons experience”.    GENERAL    Staff is efficient but really cold esp by FS and Moroccan standards. While everyone speaks perfect French in town they persisted addressing us in English and just never ever greet you.  They should at least say “Sir” or “Monsieur” in French (very impolite not to do so) and not just “hey” “Black coffee". Arriving at breakfast all we “got” is “what room number?” and while breakfast was included they still insisted on us signing a bill.  No: they need to check period. Had to email reservations to reconfirm again. No greeting at the pool or when you pass by staff. While the hotel was virtually empty.  Waiters would pass by not offering any drinks and literally grabbed the bottle of water from me when I had to help myself.  Those are major no-nos at Four Seasons in every country they train their staff to greet be friendly and speak politely and adapt to clients.    RESERVATION / RECEPTION    Quite a few emails and a 30 min check-in bc the guy had decided to put us on a different rate than our confirmation.  Showing the emails just led to lengthy phone calls (and the staff insisting we were mistaken) and I eventually chose to help myself with the tea which (while we were alone) was not offered.  The hotel is 5 mins away from the airport and the hotel offered a 60€ transfer which is absurd and more than any of the luxury hotels which are much further.  We never managed to get a metered taxi and the 4 guys at the entrance never bothered to speak with the driver about directions.    LOCATION    Location is definitely out of the way and there is nothing within walking distance. You do hear very loud airplanes.    ROOMS & SUITES  Great bed. Large but not impressive too generic. The only difference on room categories is the floor you’re on I would for sure not pay the extra.  By 7 am the room is very bright I know hotels gave up on proper shutters but the curtains are really inefficient.  2 mini tiny bottles of water per day in a country where you can’t drink tap water.  Small bathtub only 2 large towels and we always had to ask for bathrobes.Products in little ceramic bottles which they make sure you know they’ll charge 20€ if you take one.  No hotel guide room service menu spa menu…  View on Atlas advertised while the Premier room faces the opposite direction.  Teas were not refilled.  AC had to be fixed when we arrived and doesn’t go below 75°F.  Again these are just is not FS “basic” guidelines. You should absolutely be able to choose what temperature you like in fact I have never been in a hotel that “regulates" your AC.    RESTAURANT  Only one open very good but .. the bar and the 2nd one were simply closed. May be “off season” but this is a huge resort.  Breakfast is good but you really need to insist for cutlery refills.    RESORT  Beautiful “new” grounds very large but pool water was barely heated and was loaded with chlorine. No one ever came to see us.  Great gym but we were kicked out at 9pm sharp. All FS I know are 24/7 and if they have to add one staff bc you want to stay longer they are supposed to do it. Low season or not.  We were left to figure out where things are no big deal but signage is almost non-existent.    ATMOSPHERE  Empty and cold esp compared to La Mamounia which was bustling. Not sure about the point of going to Marrakesh to end up in an international rather non -descript resort. The only “local” touch is the subpar service. Was woken up from a siesta to ask if if wanted service. No! Do not disturb is here for a good reason and if you want service at any time they’r supposed to do it.    WIFI  The “fast” one is 15€/device/day this is just preposterous. The free one is fine but we’re in 2016.

Review_Date: Adam T wrote a review Jan 2016
Review_Text: The Four Seasons Marrakech is a real oasis in Marrakech. Clean large modern and beautiful. The rooms are not amazing but are very nice and clean with nice balconies. The outdoor courtyards are magnificently laid out and candles surround them by night. The staff speaks all languages fluently and are very friendly. There is enough going on that you would not have to leave but of course you should to go explore.    We got a Hammam treatment and massage. Very clean and great spa with friendly staff. I would recommend brining your own bathing suit unless you are very comfortable wearing what they provide.

Review_Title: Excelent, but with very few dinning options
Review_Text: The hotel is excellent as you expect when staying at any Four Seasons resort. Hard to compare with other branches as they are all very different in terms of size and structure. For me the key comparable things are the high service standard and maintenance level.    The hotel is located far from key touristic destinations of Marrakech but you can easily access all but a short and not very expensive taxi ride (normally €5 each way). The hotel could offer a complimentary day transfer to the Medina though. That would be very useful and customers would be very thankful.    Service was great everywhere in the hotel. Special thanks to Youssef from the Zest rooftop bar. He was great!    The hotel does not have many dining options. They have only one restaurant open for dinner during 6 days of the week... and the place is small and with no options of local dishes. Also the restaurant hostess was not very nice (only service issue we had was at the Arancino restaurant). For lunch they had only the pool restaurant open (something that could be a problem in case of rain or a cold day...). The lobby lounge was closed for renovation.    Our rooms were very nice big and with great bathrooms! It was not very easy to get located in the hotel in the first day but then we got used to the complicated building layouts. There is a serious acoustic problem as the long corridors do not have carpet. Also during the last night we noticed a strong cigarette smoke smell in the room.    Pools and SPA are beautiful and very well maintained!    Four Seasons APP was very useful and worked very well for almost everything (except for laundry and SPA).    Looking forward to get back! Highly recommended!

Review_Date: Akshay A wrote a review Jan 2016
Review_Text: We had a wonderful time at the resort. We spent 5 days there over Christmas break. Special commendation to the hotel for finding us a doctor and going out to get medicines when our 18-month old fell ill.    Pros: Great service from all the staff. Kid's play centre & events organised by that team. Huge heated family pool (important when the day's high temperature is around 20 C!). Nice rooms.    Cons: No variations in the menu (e.g. daily specials) especially in things like breakfast buffets and so meals got very monotonous. Poolside menu limited as well. Can hit considerable traffic trying to travel back from city sights.

Review_Date: Tarek D wrote a review Dec 2015
Review_Text: We were staying at a local riad and decided it would be nice to spend a day by the pool. This was one of two places we tried (the other being Sofitel). We found this expensive but of a quality you would expect of four seasons - free sun cream water provided and as many towels as needed. Nice heated pool which the kids enjoyed and very attentive service. The place was a bit quiet compared to the Sofitel so one day was enough for us. We were quoted 800 per adult including 3 course lunch - children half price.

Review_Date: MR MOHAMED J wrote a review Dec 2015
Review_Title: Amazing holiday at Christmas with family
Review_Text: We had a brilliant family holiday.  The breakfast at hotel was just fantastic and we all enjoyed it and were great and welcoming.  The kids club was just great for the young ones and left them with friendly staff.  Me and my wife had great massage treatment.  It was so great my wife also got a pedicure and facial as a treat from myself.  The Spa was great with relaxing facilities together with jacuzzi.  The hotel was not as busy.  The Kids menu was great.  Had a deluxe room which was spacious.  The Menera mall and the Jemda fana Square was about 10 mins away from hotel.  Used different methods of transport horse carriage richshaw and also taxi.  Will definitely recommend the hotel staff and it's facilities.  All staff are welcoming friendly always smile on face happy to help you and you treated as a family and you don't miss your home.  Had TV  DVD player and allowing to play movies from USB memory stick.  Even managed to get great Indian food at Le Jardins Koutoubia and we all loved the atmosphere and the food there although relatively expensive costing around £60 for 2 adults and 2 young children.  Hopefully come back in the next few months.

Review_Title: BEEN HERE TWICE AND WOULD GO AGAIN
Review_Text: My favorite hotel for sure. The rooms are large so perfect when you are traveling with your young kids. The best part -- the staff -- they were so unbelievably warm and welcoming. I fell in love with the scent they had in the Lobby and throughout the hotel and wanted to but it. They didn't sell it there during my first visit but when I went back they sold it and now I use it throughout my own home.    The food was okay -- not the best but we went out to eat for all meals except breakfast so it didn't matter.

Review_Date: Adam H wrote a review Dec 2015
Review_Text: You stay at the Four Seasons for the Service and quality. The Marrakech resort will not let you down.    The driver organized a baggage handler to help with our bags at the carousel. The baggage fellow took us to the driver (exchange some cash at terminal so you can tip- and don’t forget to get some small bills.) The driver whisked us away in a Land Rover (we had golf clubs plus bags) and in 15 minutes we were checking in. Love that arrival after an overnight trip from America to Madrid layover and flight into Marrakech.)    Off to room and a week of golf and sights. This is a great resort. They organized a guide for 3 trips including the medina and Essouria. We had the same driver for all our dinners out our longer trips and even up the Ourika valley — where he organized our trek up the mountain to the waterfalls.    Honestly every dinner every trip the concierge made our time in Marrakech incredibly easy. And every night our suite was simply fantastic - clean cool appointed easy to use. Great.    Traveling in the “low season” of America’s Thanksgiving week we even received 2 free nights after buying 5 - but nobody seemed to care we had a special package.    Yes a Four Seasons is expensive. But they make your life incredibly easy. For example every time we walked into a restaurant the hostess would ask “Reservation?” I would say my name and there would be a sort of blankness as the language gaps showed.    Then I would say “Four Seasons” and it was like light bulbs came on. Suddenly it is back to me “Oh Four Seasons. Right this way.” We always were taken immediately to our table. We always had a FANTASTIC table that was well placed not near a door or inconvenient yet clearly one of the best tables in the restaurant. And the staff was immediately there asking if we wanted water something to drink etc. The service was great because the Four Seasons called ahead made the reservation and the restaurant knows to treat you well so they get more business.    Now what is that worth? You can’t buy that extra service?    You are in Morocco and have to buy a rug or some spice or some silver. Do you really think you will get the good stuff? Will you know where to find the best merchants from the tourist trade? Could you know how to distinguish the good stuff from the chaff when sitting in some shop? Why not have the Four Seasons set you up with a guide and for $100 you KNOW you are in the right place and you know the pricing is not some long-winded negotiation.    Now what is that worth?    Yes everything costs more. But really you have a great room. The entire facility is safe (they bomb check every entering car.) They arrange all your details. And it is beautiful.    My one tip - at this particular location if you do not have breakfast included I recommend you eat in your suite. The room service breakfast is incredibly good and it is priced attractively ala carte. We found we preferred it to paying $30/day each for the breakfast buffet.    If you aren’t staying at La Mamounia you should be at the Four Seasons. And it is VERY family friendly. Just email them about their daily children’s programs.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Roberta Hug wrote a review Dec 2015
Review_Title: Very nice hotel but beware of extras
Review_Text: The hotel is very nice lovely rooms swimming pool bars. Watch out for all extras that would normally be free in similar hotels for example the tennis court will cost £17 per hour. The food was ok but not great and it costs over twice the most expensive restaurant in Marrakech...better take the taxi and go to the Medina to Nomad...  One great feature of the hotel is the free kids club it is really a beautiful place super well equipped open most of the day.

Review_Date: Rosamaria P wrote a review Dec 2015
Review_Text: Although I didn't stay at the hotel I had the wonderful opportunity to try their spa and it was a most memorable experience. Both the personal hammam and massage were exceptional just what one would expect from the Four Seasons brand but given it was in Marrakech the friendliness of staff and the extra touches were above and beyond. Tour the grounds before you leave as the hotel is very beautiful and known for their beautiful flower arrangements throughout their grounds.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Beautifully built luxury hotel with slipping service
Review_Text: The facilities in this hotel are just great - as in all FourSeasons hotels .  But the service - despite an extremely friendly staff - is appalling - slipping in every corner - not up for a 5 star hotel. After 25 minutes wait you get the wrong food drinks at dinner are served when you´ve already finished the meal ( depute reminding them again and again .  The room we were given was completely dusty from a terrace refurbishment - apart from extreme noise from those building works. As the hotel was half empty - we could have been given another room easily from the start.  The Spa is good but only one male masseur employed who on top does not have the skill for a good massage. Staff s chatting among themselves and forgetting the breakfast service - also you feel watched like in aquarium by too many staff at all times .  But the moment you need something they look away or are overly slow and complicated in their response..  There seems to be no management and certainly no one to train staff on a 5 star service level.  Maybe the reason for such bad service : Members of staff asked me to tip in cash - as the hotels keeps the major portion of their tips ( which everybody adds generously on every signed for bill). Of all tips only a small portion is paid out to the staff. I think in Europe such practice was not even allowed .

We are big fans of the Four Seasons and this resort didn't let us down; it was wonderful!    The service was great but could be better if a few small things were tweaked and improved - it's the small things that make all the difference.    Visit come and enjoy but don't expect to much - it's great but not perfect.    When leaving the resort consider your safety and soundings - we didn't feel safe outside of the gates!

This is a great hotel and I am not giving it 3 stars because I think it is a 3 star hotel but because for amongst five star hotels it is average at best. My review is also colored by fact I spent the preceding days at Kasbah Tamadot so comparing the two is like night and day.    The staff facility and rooms are great as others describe but there were some aspects of service that really didn't meet expectations for a Four Seasons hotel. For example I was shocked to take my 8 year old son to play tennis and was told we had to pay 220 Dh to use the tennis court - seems real tacky to me and not seen such an expensive hotel charge to use a tennis court. Also having to call to have toiletries replenished or have tea restocked in room is not what I would expect. The hotel arranges city tours but our tour guide was no more than a salesman and all he was interested in was conning us into buying commodities from his allies in the souks. Really for an official guide being arranged by a four seasons hotel such side marketing should be prohibited. Indeed he spent more time trying to have us convinced to buy goods from 'his' shops than he did showing us the city. Frankly the tour was a waste of time and money and we later had to find our was round the attractions.    There were some very good aspects. The Young Adults Centre was great as were its staff - anyone with Children should check it out. The staff there were always willing to engage anyone who visited and kept the kids occupied. They would also engage adults and I played few games of ping-pong pool and table soccer with the staff. Miriam and others at the gift shop were also great.

High points-a beautifully laid out and landscaped resort hotel especially the adult pool area; a fantastic room with a generous balcony spacious and well equipped bathroom and very very comfortable beds! superb breakfast; attentive and lovely staff who made our stay memorable; excellent and reviving spa experience; giving us complimentary late check out-much appreciated. Thank you. The only negative was the ongoing issue with what appeared to be 'defective' air conditioning in our room although staff very responsive to our concerns. We will definitely be back!  Many thanks to all at Four Seasons Marrakech for making our trip so enjoyable.

Excellent stay would highly recommend and would come again the staff were very friendly and the location was excellent the hotel itself was beautiful and the spa was amazing can't wait to come again xx
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: After a couple of days at a traditional Riad in in the Medina area we checked-in at the Four Seasons for a few days o splendor. The Four Seasons for me embodies the concept of of a 5-star hotel. Always cordial and willing to assist with genuine smiles on their faces my first praise goes to the staff of this property. Amazing! We had a few special requests for playtime and work reasons and all of our needs were met in a timely and graceful manner. The room was classic Marrocan luxury and full of special details. High ceilings that made it spacious and grand. Terrace area with mature trees and plenty of lounge areas. The first day we had lunch by the pool restaurant and it was delicious. Service again rocked. The grounds of this property are well manicured and rich. The common areas were incredibly designed to a tasteful decor. While located outside of the Medina transportation to the Souk is readily available and it took us just a few minutes to reach the area for some craft shopping. On one of the days we requested a car service to take us to Richard Branson's retreat up in the Atlas mountains which is a must do trip if you don't mind winding roads. Our driver Semed was personable played excellent local music and took pics of us along the way - ask for his services and you will be very pleased. Enfin another amazing Four Season experience... this time in Marrakesh.

We arrived last night and have already fallen in love with this resort! Already thinking of returning!!  We are staying in a Pavilion Deluxe Suite (34) which was kindly upgraded before our arrival from our deluxe suite and is very grand and beautiful.  There is a handwritten welcome from the manager in the room.  Our in room dining experience was amazing with our dining table set out with a fresh rose cutlery - the full works.  The buggy service is excellent and available anytime we need.  I have booked a spa treatment for tomorrow - it looks so luxurious inside. I am very much looking forward it.  The breakfast was excellent and very filling.  The staff have gone out of their way to welcome us and our little baby. They even prepared baby changing facilities high chair travel cot baby bath and lots of baby essentials in the room.  The bed is so comfortable I felt like I slept on a cloud.  I will have to write another review once we leave but seriously - so far so good!  Well done to everyone for being so helpful and attentive to our needs.

Review_Date: Kai K wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Title: Luxury close to real life in city centre
Review_Text: Beautiful place with friendly staff and Four Season style Service.  Unfortunatelly very unflexible regarding cancellation. I had to leave 1 day earlier and had to pay fully even with letting them know at Arrival.

Review_Date: Adam S wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Text: Beautifull and amazing place to visit but something happen with one of the employers there got me a little be in shock .his name was jamalhe s a waiter at Inara bar after i finished my drinks and was ready to leave asked him for the check and i want to pay with my credit card he said the credit card machine is not working and we only take cash and that he cant give me a receipt because i need it for my record and reinbursement from my job .this was weird and i think the place is wonderfull and fun to visit but they have to put the right people at the right place ..

luxury hotel rooms secluded calm and serene.Hotel is next to palais and was few steps away to palais so it was easy to reach congress . It has detoxifying bathing ritual to experience after tired day at work .inara Bar with intimate outdoor and indoor settings has exotic drinks .the resort has a beautiful in house shop for souvenirs.After meal at italian or moroccon restaurant don't miss to have night cap at romantic library bar

Review_Title: Good, but probably not the best of the Four Seasons group...........
Review_Text: My group and I were in Marrakech on business for a week in November. As a Hotelier and someone who travels a great deal I am probably more critical and harder to please than most. However as I know only too well what it takes to operate a hotel I hope that I am also realistic and compassionate at the same time.  I chose the Four Seasons primarily because of it's close proximity to the Palais de Congres . Somewhere where I was going to spend most of my time whilst in Morocco.  As with most hotels in Marrakech the grounds are extensive and beautiful. The scent of orange blossom fills the air and there are lots of little hideaways where one can find shade.  The hotel obviously caters to families with children. There are two pools and a children's club. There were no issues with children although that might be more of an issue in the high season ?  My suite was part of a Villa (25) and it was spacious clean and had everything I required. I especially liked the sizeable balcony on which I could escape the air conditioning and enjoy a pretty good view of the grounds. It was on the first floor and I'm not sure the ground floor suites would be quite as good as you are close to and on the same level at the pathways that traverse around the property.  My suite had a very large bathroom with tub shower and separate toilet cubicle. There was a walk-in closet  king sized bed and T.V. Altogether very comfortable.  I used the laundry service several times and it worked very well. My clothes were always returned the same day and laundered properly. My only gripe was that they didn't replenish the laundry bags and forms when they had been used without the need for a phone call.  My group and I ate at the hotel almost everyday and we experienced all of their restaurants and bars. "Zest" was my personal favorite. A roof top bar that serves light meals. Great atmosphere and interesting décor. Very friendly and convivial staff making it a good place to chill or network.  Breakfast was by the fountain pool and it was extensive and covered all dietary requirements. The service was good but not great. Sometimes confused and slow.  We usually ate lunch at the alfresco restaurant "Azzera" . Casual and well laid out with more capable staff and quite an interesting menu.  I highly recommend Moroccan wine. I had two very good reds while staying at this hotel and they compared very well to the best Napa reds.  Outside of business hours I frequented the hotels spa on a couple of occasions. While not as good as the spa at "The Mamounia" I found the staff capable and friendly.  If you don't want to venture into the chaotic world of the Medina there is a good boutique run by a very friendly and helpful Swiss lady named Miriam right on the property.  All of the reception staff were very friendly and helpful. I found the same of the numerous drivers that I used during my stay. All are multi lingual and capable.  On a side note it's well worth exploring Marrakech if you have more time than I did. I made it to the mountains on two occasions and they are beautiful.

Review_Date: Simo I wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Text: We had 1 night but it was amazing night with an adult heated pool and awesome breakfast with everyone has smile in thier face and bed OMG very very comfy like sleeping on the cloud but food is expensive so i decided to go eat at jamaa fna so i can watch the viewwhile im eating the cheaper food :p

Review_Title: A peaceful,luxurious place to stay, only a few minutes from the Medina.
Review_Text: Lovely spacious typical four seasons room. Luxuriously furnished but in keeping with the overall Moroccan aesthetic. Quiet environment but within a few minutes taxi ride to the hustle and bustle of the Medina (old walled city) and the souks within. Also Gueliz the more modern area of Marrakech is close by. The staff were very helpful and anxious to make our stay comfortable and enjoyable. We ate out most nights but breakfast at the hotel was excellent with a mixture of international and traditional Moroccan dishes as well as fresh eggs. Our favorite item was the delicious freshly made flatbread served with wild honey - addictive! A highlight was a nightly cocktail (or two) at the rooftop bar over the Italian restaurant. The only downside was the gym which is outdated and a little shabby. But this was not a deal-breaker; we would definitely stay here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sam A wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Text: Beautiful property and ground. Great room service and food. The only drawback is it a distance from the downtown for those who might want to walk around the Medina in the evening. We were there for a conference and it was a great venue.

Review_Date: Andrés R wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Text: I stayed at the Four Seasons for the first time. Previous stays in Marrakech have been at La Mamounia or other five star hotels but I found the 4 Seasons both pleasant and an excellent hotel. Although I was there for a large conference the hotel made me feel welcome from check-in to check-out. The food was excellent and the conference facilities were first-class. The hotel is a 10 minute taxi ride from the main square souks and other interesting sights. French is the language of choice if you don't speak Arabic. All in all a very pleasant and well-recieved stay.

Review_Date: Helen T wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Title: An oasis of tranquility very near the centre of Marrakesh
Review_Text: We had a lovely 3 night stay over the October half term. Very good location and a lovely spotlessly clean Hotel. Everything is catered for in terms of children's play areas teen chill out area quiet pool for grown ups spa boutique etc. Beautiful gardens to walk around sit & listen to waterfeatures & the beautiful scent of roses in the public seating areas near reception so lovely. We were a little disappointed with the food it was perfectly fine but didn't blow us away as 'foodies'. Our first night in the 'Italian' restaurant was pleasant but the staff were flapping and lots of noise coming from kitchen & waiting staff..... didn't make for a quiet meal we were distracted by this. We stayed in a luxury pavillion suite which was huge and ideal for my teenage son who had his own sleeping area in the lounge we had our own outdoor plunge pool and lounge area perfect! I would certainly recommend staying in this hotel perfectly located for the old town.

Review_Date: Stacey S wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Title: Perfect for family with small babies and children.
Review_Text: We've just returned from our first vacation with baby twins and a three year old and everything at this hotel was perfect. Our room was equipped for our babies with high chairs cots bottle warmers change tables… anything we could need. Even the little pool on our patio had barrier gates put up for safety. We called housekeeping because the glass top to our coffee table was sliding a bit when our three year old was playing and they quickly came and took it away to avoid any injury. We thought the food was delicious at all the hotel restaurants. The pools are all heated so perfect for babies. The concierge arranged a driver and guides to take us around the city and souks - all wonderful. Our daughter loved the kids club and the fitness centre was five star. It was the perfect short getaway and we couldn't say a bad thing about the great service at this hotel. We especially thought the poolside service at the family pool was wonderful. The food always came quickly. The staff there was friendly and helpful and would bring over "dark" umbrellas to protect our small babies. The hotel is close to the airport and is a very secure hotel (they even check under all vehicles before allowing them through the gates of the hotel).

Review_Date: Neil F wrote a review Nov 2015
Review_Text: only 10 minutes from the airport but it doesn't feel like it. Acres of beautifully manicured grounds surround the hotel with its varied selection of accommodations. Two superb outdoor pools and plenty of loungers and Cabanas. Service throughout the hotel is top notch. It's a wonderfully relaxing and enjoyable place to stay.

Review_Title: the least favorable fourseasons for me
Review_Text: i was there during new year and was really upset. its called four seasons resort and spa where it had no relation to that. the spa was in a very bad shape and maintenance  no towels available  if you put your towel outside and take a shower someone would literally steal it since there are no available towels over the shelvs  kids move in the spa when the sunsets thinking its an indoor pool when its a jacuzzi and no one asked them to leave or atleast be quite and stop splashing water. one insident where my friend booked a massage and he went on the time however the reception couldnt find the masseur and couldnt reach him on time so he cancelled the spa did apologize but i mean this is not a thing that should happen in fourseasons. if i go to marrakech again i will not choose fourseasons taking into considetation im a very loyal customer to that chain.

Review_Title: Not a cheap option but worth it if you can afford it!
Review_Text: Wonderful experience great staff made it unforgettable. A haven to return to after the madness of the souks or a trip to the Atlas. Close enough to all the main Marrakech attractions. But be aware its a premium hotel with associated rates and food and beverage services.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The Four Seasons is a beautiful hotel both inside and out the rooms are spacious and our private terrace was a nice area to relax in and get out of the sun. The quiet pool was very peaceful and I had no problems with service nice extras include free sun screen lotions and iced water. The Solano restaurant was under going renovation and only reopened towards the end of our stay but overall the choice of restaurants was a disappointment and menus were limited  however the concierge was very helpful in suggesting restaurants and helping us make reservations. We really enjoyed the pop up restaurant 'Bombay Cut'  the food was excellent and very good value.It is a shame they did not do this type of thing more often but given how quiet it was perhaps the hotel expects guests to eat out most of the time.We enjoyed the canapés offered during the Aperitivo evening but were surprised that management did not use this as an opportunity to meet guests and again it was very quiet so perhaps the hotel could do more to promote itself.We made regular use of the courtesy car which is available in the evenings and found all the drivers to be helpful and very informative about Marrakech however it was only through reading another review that I knew the car was available so this is something else that could be promoted  Many other reviews mentioned that service is poor  we had a mainly positive experience and found the staff to be one of the hotel's best assets however if the hotel was busier they might struggle.  There are a couple of reasons why I gave only four stars and said almost perfect firstly breakfast my husband likes a hot breakfast and found the bacon potatoes etc offered in the buffet to be consistently cold credit to our waiter he noticed that my husband had left most of his meal and when he became aware of the problem made a member of the management aware although the manager apologised nothing was done to rectify the problem.  My main issue however was on checkout I noticed two overcharges on our bill and although they were deducted no explanation was given for why they were there in the first place . On our first evening we arrived late and ate at the Italian restaurant we had a couple of pizzas  one pasta dish  two glasses of wine and a Coke so when a bill for over 3000 dirhams (approximately £200) we checked and could see we had been given another table's bill the waiter took the bill away and we signed the correct version however the 3000 dirhams reappeared on our final bill as a charge for lunch the next day as we had indeed had lunch and dinner in the hotel that day and could show them the bills we had signed and they had no signature for the disputed amount they reluctantly accepted that we had not had lunch twice. The second overcharge was much smaller and was a charge for pool service for our final day as I knew there should be only one charge which my son had signed for I questioned the second charge and although they could not provide a signed receipt we were repeatedly asked if we were sure we didn't have something extra. As I mentioned they did deduct the amounts but I wad left with the feeling that they were doing us a favour and giving us the benefit of the doubt they didn't seem to see the connection that the only two charges I questioned were the ones they had no signature for.  I would still recommend this hotel but would say check your bill carefully and whilst I might stay at a Four Seasons again could not say it would always be my first choice.

Review_Date: Andrew F wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Title: Classic Four Seasons excellence in an engaging environment
Review_Text: I've stayed at a couple of Four Seasons over the years and this one measures up. The hospitality was exceptional-- always available never overbearing. Lovely rooms views food amenities. Free Wi-fi. It's a Four Seasons and it is everything you would expect. And Abdulazziz's mint tea and smile were a treat.

Review_Title: A lovely hotel away from the hustle & bustle of the medina
Review_Text: Stayed in a deluxe room for my 25th wedding anniversary. The hotel and staff were wonderful and could not do enough for us. Spent many relaxing hours around the pool with complimentary iced water and other treats.  The roof top terrace was a welcome place to have a drink and start an evening in Marrakech but we choose to eat in the town on our three evenings. The hotel was refurbishing one of the resturants at our time of staying.  Totally recommend this haven away from the main town but only a short and cheap taxi ride into the medina to discover the souks gardens and nightlife.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I stayed here on a 70th birthday trip with my mother because I wanted something a little away from the hustle and bustle of the city. I had a car pick us up from the airport and from the first moment I was happy that I made this choice. The service was excellent and the rooms were comfortable. My mother used the spa and thought it was fabulous. The concierge was extremely helpful and arranged for guided tours of the souk and Essaouira. All of the staff were extremely solicitous and pleasant.    The hotel is about a 50 DAM cab ride to the center of town ($5) and close to the airport. The car that the hotel arranged for airport pickup was expensive ($60) but to me totally worth it. After flying 15 hours it was nice to be immediately in the lap of luxury. We also ate in the hotel restaurant (I think the Azzera Grill) which was decent but not particularly memorable.

Review_Date: stefaan v wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Text: This is one of the best hotels we've done. We had a truly spacious room with its own dressingroom and a large terrace. The staff is very friendly and helpfull to recommand you the must do's in Marrakesh. The garden and pool area's are very relaxing: there's even a separate pool for families with children! We visited Mamounia and were glad that we didn't go for that hotel: oldfashioned and dark stiff staff & not cosy at all.  We had only breakfast (very well stuffed) at the Four Seasons: Marrakesh has so many good restaurants to discover. The spa is good but not excellent. I admit once you get in this hotel your desire level gets higher every day.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Wonderful relaxing tranquil place to stay.
Review_Text: A very relaxing stay everything was catered for we especially enjoyed the afternoon relaxing around the pool. The staff looked after us very well always greeting us with a smile. We just wish we could have stayed longer.

Review_Date: Sheila J wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Text: Unfortunately we did not stay at the resort but did manage to have a luxurious afternoon. We started with lunch at the Azzera Grill down at the end of the pool. The service was exceptional as was the food and cocktails. After sating our hunger and thirst we were escorted to the spa for an afternoon of pampering. I personally believe that the spas located within any Four Seasons Hotel anywhere in the world provide the best spa services Ever. And the spa here in Marrakesh was no exception. We were treated like princesses. The premises are beautifully appointed and the staff were very professional courteous and endearing. By the end of the afternoon we did not want leave. It was an amazing day of indulgence. I loved it so much I contemplated repeating the afternoon again the next day but did not make it.  I look forward to my next visit. Thank you Four Seasons Marrakech!

Stayed here for five nights on business in the Pavillion Suite check in was very smooth and done prior to my arrival. I found the staff very attentive during my stay and nothing was too much trouble. They have carts to transport you around the grounds but it is as easy to walk. Nicely presented pool areas and very good restaurants. Room was wonderful with private plunge pool and terrace.

Meets the expectations of a Four Seasons Resort. It is very close to the tourist attractions but a taxi is a must. It takes about 10 minutes and $5 for the ride. The gardens at the resort are well kept. The adult pool is very nice but very cold for October when the temperature is only 22 C. I guess that in July when the temperature is 40 C the cold water may be welcomed. The lounge at the roof is very nice. Nice breakfast buffet.

Review_Date: Anna C wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Title: A luxury resort with every whim catered for and every time you think you need something, someone is there ready to help!
Review_Text: There are many things to recommend about this hotel the rooms the staff the pools the restaurants the WiFi reception.....but the one worth a special mention is the Concierge - Salma. She made everything go so smoothly so that even before I arrived in the hotel I was relaxed in the knowledge that Salma had helped me to sort everything out and her list of restaurant recommendations from which I chose one to host a dinner for 14 people was stunning (La Sultana) with very welcoming staff and excellent food.

All in all a great resort and a great service.  We had a deluxe suite which was great.  Things to improve:  Breakfast buffet is very delicious but a bit limited.  The food and the wine selection (only 2 red wines) at the Inara Bar are not up to the standard of the hotel.  Also the service team there was not up to the level of the hotel.  The overall stay was great and we would go back.

Published hotel rates are extremely high and if I had paid the €1000 + per night I would have been disappointed but the package deal we took was fine. The hotel is well maintained but I would have appreciated advance notice that the breakfast Resturant was under renovation. Noise from the constant drilling was a pain. It's due to be finished by 15 th oct. This said the staff and management were fantastic and nothing was too much trouble including a late checkout and arranging food that wasn't on the menus. The fact that staff remember your name is a nice touch and not unnoticed!  Pool staff are very attentive with nice touches of water and attention through the day.  Food and bev prices are a little high but quality is good. Would definitely recommend for a relaxing break.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: It doesnt get much better than this
Review_Text: Spent a week at this fabulous resort hotel last week. Our room was spotless spacious and special. The whole hotel is immaculate with vast pool areas I particularly like the quiet pool (adults only) with a lovely pool restaurant. The Italian restaurant served food as goos as any London restaurant but overall tyne thing that makes this hotel stand out is the staff. Without exception they are all terrific from the managers to the pool boys I cannot speak more highly of them all. I must single out however Sammi in the restaurant and Adnane on reception both charming helpful and extremely personable. If you want a relaxing week being pampered this is the place for you. Although 5 minutes cab ride to the main square its just far enough away to be at peace.(we walked one day it took 25 mins at a stroll)

The hotel and staff are magnificent!  Tarik at the Spa has hands of gold the Four Seasons Moroccan Massage is absolutely fantastic!  Give yourself a well deserved treat!  The accommodations are superb and everyone in the staff is helpful professional courteous and very nice.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Pamela C wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Text: Arrived early evening we had booked a premier room which didn't disappoint. The hotel provided us with a guide to explore the Souks he was great and gave us some good tips.The staff were all really helpful and nothing was too much trouble.Would definitely like to come back as didn't have time to explore everything.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Tacky resort in the middle of nowhere
Review_Text: If I closed my eyes and opened again I would think I was in Miami....it's in the middle of nowhere and you have to take a taxi everywhere.  Full of loud Americans and can't get the feel or the beautiful country. Not worth the price.

Review_Date: ben a wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Text: Fab service and very well maintained. Lovely gardens and pools. Room was quite business but high quality nevertheless. Perfect for a relaxing sunny break with our 1 yr old daughter. Would stay here again

Firstlydon't believe all the negative reviewsI'm gobsmacked anybody can utter anything but great words for this place.I took my wife and 9 month baby with me and we were treated to the most amazing experience from start to finish.The staff were all so humble and warm.We were literally treated like family.From the maidsto reception to our driver-this place is a military operation run with love and hospitality.Anybody who says anything different is lying.    Would recommend this place with no hesitation.    My new favourite Hotel in the world.

Review_Date: avneet a wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Text: Thank you for your wonderful treatment at the spa all the staff were all nice and friendly. I also enjoyed the service and the food at the Indian pop-up.The bar staff in both bars were all friendly as well. I feel that the restaurant options could be improved as there were only two restaurants for dinner.

Spent 7 amazing nights at this beautiful hotel. From our arrival to our departure we were made to feel as special guests. We booked a deluxe pavilion suite more than enough space for our family of 5. The large living area was converted into the second bedroom at night and an extra bed was provided for our 5 year old. Our own plunge pool which we didn't use as the water was too cold; a little sitting area with table and chairs where we had breakfast delivered to a few mornings to avoid the chaos at Solano. We had villa 34 which is ideal is you are looking for privacy. Even though being opposite the kids club it wasn't as noisy as one would expect.  Upon arrival the dining table was laid with cookies and candy awaiting the kids. Since we had a long drive from Casablanca to Marrakech these treats were really welcomed by the kids. The concierge found out that my husband and I would be celebrating our anniversary the day after our arrival we were sent a small cake and our table at the Italian Aranciano was beautifully decorated.  Few people complained about the service but we didn't experience any such thing. On the other hand the Four Seasons is what it is thanks to its staff. Ahmed took extra care of us during Breakfast at Solana and Marouane will also greet us in the morning even though he only served us once at dinner. The girls at the spa Malika Soraya and Beda are just amazing people. They couldn't do enough to make me feel at home. Wished I found out about the spa earlier during our stay. It actually became my haven when the hotel got busy during the Eid holidays. The family pool got packed and my daughter and I would take refuge to the small indoor pool in the spa. Would have loved a bigger pool though. I had a hammam and massage during the stay; was quite disappointed with the massage and when Malika heard about it I was offered a complimentary half an hour massage. It really made up for the disappointing experience.  The ladies at the concierge the other Soraya and Salma also welcomed me with a smile and were patient to answer my questions and giving directions to where to go for shopping.  A few things which could be improved upon is the fact there aren't enough eating options. The kids club was a big let down to my daughter. Not enough activities and they close at 5pm. Most of the time we would be out during the day and when coming back to the hotel around 4pm it would be too late for her to go to the club.  I booked a half day guided tour through email before our arrival but it seems they didn't receive the latter. So we were left to wonder around the old city by ourselves. Probably a blessing as we got to see what we wanted to see and spend as much or lesser time. Regarding activities I've done my research prior to traveling to Marrakesh and found out about two great companies for Atlas mountain day trip and hot air balloon ride. The Four Seasons do offer similar activities probably at similar prices but for us we wanted to experience a bit more than just the usual touristy stuff and we did!  By the way the hotel boutique is ridiculously overpriced. Their products might be at the high end in terms of quality and local brands but similar items can be found in the souk for a fraction of the price. Haggling is a must and start with a fifth of their asking price. Leave the designer bags at home when you go shopping.  We just can't raving to our friends about our experience at the Four Seaons. We chose it because of the family atmosphere compared to the Mamounia and Palais Namaskar. Thank you again for making this a memorable trip. Will definitely visit again.

Review_Date: kareninlondon s wrote a review Oct 2015
Review_Text: I stayed here a year ago but I thought I had added a review but clearly not so.....    I LOVED this hotel. The rooms were HUGE as were the bathrooms. The beds were like sleeping in giant marshmallows (very comfy) and the pool area and grounds were lovely very well kept.    It was my birthday when I arrived and there were flowers sparkling wine and a delicious choc cake waiting for me - its the little things. The breakfast is to die for too and in a beautiful settting too    As with the other Four Seasons Ive stayed in I also like that thre is a plentyful supply of water and sun cream as the heat is unforgiving at some times of the year.    I didnt think it was close enough to walk to the centre of Town but I think I went the wrong way. However having said there taxis are plentiful and there is a car which you can use from the hotel    I would def go back again

While driving into the city I was worried but the minute we drove into the hotel I was amazed.  Beautiful land scape and a huge resort with nice 2 pools and less restaurants than expected in such a huge place.  We were booked in a pavilion suite which is ok in size and a nice plunging pool but you would expect more amenities in the suite when booked in a nice resort.  Food was average and would give it 6 out of 10 but was very disappointed with the service received during breakfast…very slow reply and there was hair in the food and no one even apologized when I informed them.  The waiter was very rude and while he thought I did not understand the language he was saying bad things to his colleague about us and other guests of the hotel.  A beautiful resort that missing the touch of good service

Review_Title: Two annoying events but overall, great stay in stunning property, made special by the exceptional team
Review_Text: The Four Seasons Marrakech is a fabulous extensive property with stunning landscaped gardens and water features equidistant from the airport and the Medina. With a two year old we didn’t venture much into the old city but there was a shuttle service and an excellent concierge desk to sort out any request. Our suite was very comfortable with an enormous bath-cum-dressing room and a terrace with its own plunge pool a stone’s throw from the wonderful family pool and the kids’ club which looked super although seemed very Francophone and so we didn’t use it? The food & service in both the main Solano restaurant and the Azzera next to the adult pool was varied and delicious and the staff particularly kind and indulgent towards our lively daughter. She particularly enjoyed the Moroccan musicians playing every evening. Sadly we had a very unfortunate experience at the Bleu d’Orange Italian restaurant on our first night in the hotel. Asked by manager Federico Colombo how our food had been we replied truthfully that one pasta dish had been very poor and not at all what was described on the menu. This was met not with an apology but with a disagreeable shrug and the suggestion that it was our palate rather than the kitchen which was at fault. The next time we visited Bleu d’Orange we were made to feel distinctly unwelcome and did not patronize the restaurant again for the rest of the week. Another member of staff told us that Sr Colombo was under a lot of pressure hosting two top chefs for the Settimana Italiana week; however that is no excuse for the poor way in which we were treated. Another quibble was the fact that my iPhone 5 left in the Solano after dinner one night never reappeared with the loss of several special photographs of our holiday. We cannot fault Mehdi the head of hotel security who mounted a comprehensive search for the phone but quite frankly a misplaced smart phone or other device should simply not be stolen at a hotel of this calibre and standing. Mehdi was just one of the wonderful team of staff at Four Seasons Marrakech who really made a difference to our holiday. They also included Yassine and his wonderful team at the roof top Zest Bar with its view of the Atlas Mountains Lina who oversaw the Solano breakfast all the pool team including Abdulatif and last but not least the lovely Jihane and the fabulous ladies of the conciergerie and the guest relations team. Overall despite a couple of unfortunate experiences very highly recommended for a wonderful week or weekend in the stunning Marrakech climate.

Review_Title: Best experience. Can't wait to be back.
Review_Text: So glad I chose the Four Seasons over my other options! My friend and I stayed here our last two days in Marrakech (prior to checking in I was staying at a Riad in the Medina and then a Berber tent in the Sahara Desert). My friend and I were treated with EXCELLENT customer service... when I got back from my trip I could not stop raving about this hotel. Everything was clean our room was amazing the bed was comfy and the staff went above and beyond. The adult only pool was peaceful– I really miss it! We did the Hammam at the Spa which was divine. The touches of rose petals all over the hotel was beautiful. We ordered room service which was priced a little high for Marrakech (30 euro) but oh well! Worth it. The fitness center was nice as well. Wish I could have stayed longer... but I know I'll be back.

I'm going to keep this short and sweet. This place had the best customer service I have ever experienced. They surprised us with roses and desserts for our honeymoon. The place was breathtaking and the food was the best. Everything about this place was amazing.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is a wonderful hotel. The gardens are lovely and the food in the restaurants was fabulous!  We were a family which included a three year old who had a great time in the children's pool.  The staff couldnt have been nicer

Great service in a great hotel.  Extremely helpful when my colleague fell ill couldn't do enough to help and the after we was amazing too.    Free water handed out at the pool which was very welcome as it was extremely hot.    Absolutely beautiful hotel only 15-20mins from the airport.    Is about 5 mins in a cab from a Carrefour sjouke you wish to stock up on snacks or drinks for the room as the mini bar prices are quite steep.

Review_Title: Not the usual level of Four Seasons service
Review_Text: Let me begin by saying that the hotel is beautiful and its shiny and new. It could be top hotel in Marrakech however the service is in dire need of improvement. When I arrived I was told I had been upgraded only to find out that I was placed in the handicapped room (the same category room as I had booked) with no bathtub. Since it was just my small son and I this absolutely would not work. It took hours to rectify and no real apology. Service by the family pool was totally inconsistent actually nonexistent. The spa was always booked so impossible to use that. Room service mixed up my order several times requests forgotten the list goes on..... Just too many slip ups for my liking in one weekend. I have tolerance for mishaps at less established hotels but not a Four Seasons. I would definitely return with my son as the kids club was fantastic but I do hope they can iron out some of the issues they have.

Review_Date: soniya v wrote a review Sep 2015
Review_Text: Had an amazing time at the Four Seasons. Great service lovely grounds and a lovely spa! I enjoyed my stay here and would recommend going to the spa! I was so pleased with my treatment I came out and booked another hour later in the day. It was my therapists first day which can be daunting however she made my experience exceptional and I hope to visit again in the future.

I Stayed in that hotel beginning of September 2015 with my brother just for vacation  the hotel is beautiful amazing staff  amazing service !! They took good care of us as we arrived and made us feel gone even though its corporate ... The Zen pool is amazing and they even clean your sunglasses while you sun bathing ...Amazing  Only minus : no music at the pools at all so it's missing some young and stylish spirit  For all the rest JUSTGO THERE you will not be disappointed    Thank you    Philippe B

As all Four Seasons hotels this hotel is perfect: perfect staff perfect service perfect offers. The room was quiet and spacious. Breakfast is rich and of high quality. The swimming pools are spacious and relaxing and we really appreciated the separation between "adult pool" and "family pool". Highly recommended.

We have just returned from a great 10 day break in the Four Seasons at Marrakech. The hotel was excellent on all levels and we would thoroughly recommend it to anyone looking for a really relaxing break where there is great service and food plus lovely weather. Compared well to various Oberois One and Only etc we have stayed at.  Reception/concierge very efficienthelpful and friendly.  Adult Pool great not to have kids aroundstaff extremely helpfulefficient and courteous.  Italian restaurant service and food quality first class(better than the La Mamounia Hotel)  Pool restaurant food very good.  Spa professionalvery friendly.  Rooftop bar great view and service.  Buffet restaurant good service.  We had a Pavilion roombut it faced away from the afternoon sun so depending on your sun preference check this out before you book. Also it was on the first floor and we thought it would be a stones throw from the pool as suggested on the hotel website but actually was the other side of the hotel. We would question whether the extra space is worthwhile unless you you spend a lot of time in the room.  Groundspool and gardens are all very lovely.

We staid 5 nights at this wonderful resort. Even though it is huge you still get a private feeling because of the riad architecture and the lush greenery surrounding the different buildings. We ate at the restaurant by the pool and found the food delicious. We also tried the Italian restaurant but that was average.  It is a great place to come with children. They have a kids' club and a huge kids' pool with inflatable toys.  The service is excellent.

Review_Title: An amazing resort, fabulous staff and location perfect
Review_Text: First time in Marrakesh and first time staying at the Four Seasons. The entrance alone and you knew you were going to relax but also enjoy the new placeThe decor was beautiful Morroccon Elegance. The staff were so accomodating and friendly. Always with a smile. Rooms were comfortable

It is really a FOUR SEASONS resort. We had a wonderfull time there. Staffing restaurant spa gym club pool breakfast .. everything is perfect!  We liked to stay out of the noise/busy medina. Some visitors prefer to stay inside the medina in a Riad...We had the two experiences in Marrocos (riad and the resort) and I can say that I prefer better to stay in the hotel. It is better to arrive and leave with luggages. (that's is truely a very personnal opinion). Riads can be more typical and traditionals but won't give you the confort we will find in Four Seasons.    Only single improvement point... Taxi in the lobby.. it is a mass in Marrocos and the hotel didn't help enough. (maybe share common fees and have dedicated taxi drivers waiting inside the hotel).
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This was my first experience at a Four Seasons property and I can say that I would not want to stay at another resort again. The service was exceptional in  all aspects from the valet to the receptionists and the staff at the restaurants pool and spa. I would want to special mention the receptionist on duty at the  early morning of August 30 2015 Abdelaziz who helped me get the medicine for my daughter who got sick that morning after having too much to drink. He got a taxidriver who looked around for an open pharmacy at 2:00 am and got the medicine for my daughter. He was so concerned about my daughter's well-being that he even asked if she would need a doctor! Again this property deserves an overall rating of 5/5.

The four seasons is a beautiful property however the service leaves much to be desired. I have stayed in many four seasons across the world and this was just a horrible example of services. We were constantly waiting for things and were never given great service. It would often take 30 mins for the staff to clear a breakfast table in order for us to sit and another 10-15 minutes for a waiter to come over to the table with water. The room service wasn't delivered to our room at all on a few occasions as they "forgot." The property is beautiful but they really need to work on four seasons level services.

Review_Title: Your average family of 5 (2adult and 3 children ) staying 6nights
Review_Text: Your average Family of 5 (2adult and 3 children ) staying 6nights    This was our third stay at the FS marrakech and once again we had a memorable stay. The room was very nice (room 21). Right next to the pool and easy access from the entrance (good if you go out every evening and want to go straight to your room). However it was a ground floor room so you need to ensure the doors are all locked before you go and no veiws but still nice. We did have minor issues within the room (ie sink blocked toilet running and slidding door not correct size). After notifying staff at the front desk this was all sorted.    Free WiFi for WhatsApp and snapchat etc so the teens are well connected and works near the pool area too. Faster speed you need to pay    Breakfast is always good if you get bored ask the staff to make something different which may not be on the spread. Ie pancakes coffee drinks mango slices etc. We had Indian night one day which was good but would have liked to see more options on the menu rather than fixed meal. We had Moroccan night too with music and bellydancing. That was really good as we danced. Thinking about it they could have done something like that for the Indian night too ??    We had the fullboard (morning lunch and evening excluding drinks). To be honest this could have been a lot better. The kids menu is limited and not all healthy. Even adults menu is very limited. I don't think you can have it everyday for a week. Dessert was very limited which was disappointing. Two days we ate out and 'My Thai' was really good place to eat. We got the complementary hotel car (6pm-10pm) to there but you have to make your own way back. Be careful with the local scammers as they recognise the four seasons car and come up to you pretending to work for the hotel. This happened twice and I went with the story just to string them along lol. RE: food. I would like to mention that my daughter found a long piece of plastic in her icecream and a hair in her fruit. I recommended that they check their suppliers and have more control on hygine as the plastic could have been dangerous for younger kids. Hopefully this was 1 in a million ? I only mentioned the hair incident as it was badly handled. Ie the senior staff took the bowl and started to talk to another guest. My poor daughter had to get herself another bowl. On reflection I should have said something but was keeping the peace. So don't hold back as you are paying good money for the best in a hotel experience    My partner and daughter had a spar treatment. We kindly had a 25% discount voucher which helped with the cost. However for some reasons what's on their list was not available. Personally I didn't care but you can imagine what the ladies are like in the family :). Anyway the guest manager (Mohammed) was very tentative to our needs and without him sorting and listening to the issues we would have had a below average stay. We appreciate all his hard work and thank him personally.    We went to the Aqua fun water park which the kids loved. We took towels from the hotel (worth doing). The drinks and food are expensive there but OK. This was recommended by the concierge which again Thankyou FS    There is no English entertainment on the TV so either get DVDs from the market or bring your own. And Google translate does help when ordering something from room service :) . Overall room service was brilliant and no issues    Overall FS is a great hotel for a family. Its safe relaxing and all the staff are friendly. Especially the new guest relations manager Mohammed. Would I go with the full board? Yes if they increase their options ie Thai night Indian night Mexican night etc and more options for kids/pool lunch menu. Adding basic soft beverages would be good too Otherwise just stick to breakfast and eating out.    Also they have cut back on little things like nuts at the front desk fresh cold towel on arrival and no lemon water at the spar. However they are building a larger kids club which is even better for a family of our size. So you win some and lose some???    Ps - enjoy the market place and don't get putoff with some more of the aggressive sellers. We went everyday and had no major issue. Just be dominating (but not rude) and flow with the other tourist around.    hopefully we will come back once the kids club is developed and also combine it with the new FS at Casablanca.

Review_Title: Not the usual four seasons standard
Review_Text: A real paradox; lovely buildings & grounds smashing pools & no lack of trying from the staff but somewhere it goes wrong & the hotel overall really misses the mark. Eg there seems to be confusion around their own menus restaurants and amenities; the Concierge is very hit and miss: sometimes you get a quick response sometimes you need to call several times and sometimes a request goes into a black hole; housekeeping are generally confused and couldn't seem to leave our daughters amenities in the room ignored Do Not Disturb signs and didn't understand their own services. The restaurants aside from Arancino are weak yet very expensive; uninspired bland food prevailed sadly. However the team by the kids pool and the Kids club staff are excellent and they saved our stay from disaster. The kids club is a godsend and our daughter could not wait to go each day. The pool team were thoughtful and really looked after everyone! Overall this experience is not what we would expect from the Four Seasons and the value just was not there. Very disappointing.

Review_Date: mehtab k wrote a review Sep 2015
Review_Text: I have many positives about this resort:  Great location  Beautiful grounds  Fantastic pool and spa  Great breakfast buffet  Lovely and friendly staff  Incredibly helpful    However we were here for a friend's wedding and the hotel was pretty much at capacity with not enough staff so the ball was dropped.    I'm not sure if it's because they had no more firm mattresses left but basically our mattress was rubbish and when I requested it to be changed (three times) for some resin it wasn't. This resulted in my husband suffering significant back pain which ruined the rest of our holiday.    The hotel was very professional and lived up to their reputation when it came to trying to make amends following our complaint when checking out. The best part was when they sent a driver to take us to the station and help us with our bags - which he did very proactively and it really was a huge help.    Everyone makes mistakes so I don't hold this against them (even though it did ruin the following leg of my holiday) and I would definitely go back knowing it would be even better.

Review_Date: lindsay b wrote a review Sep 2015
Review_Title: if you have 4 days to spare, you must go there
Review_Text: If you want a hotel that offers enough luxury and peace to not actually want to go out of the hotel grounds then this is the place. Plenty of very well maintained space fragrant gardens large pools beautiful outdoor and indoor areas and a service level that is hard to beat. The outdoor Italian is the place to be for atmosphere great salads round the pool  Handily close to the airport but very little air traffic.

Review_Title: Very good...but service needs to be fixed
Review_Text: Having stayed at many Four Seasons most recently in Orlando this version fell short of the expectations that I had. It is though a very nice resort with beautiful gardens and water features.    The area if fell short was on service which in my experience at other resorts has been exceptional. Service at the restaurants and pool was very slow and in some cases non-existant in other words drinks not turning up at all. Otherwise here is my general review.    Rooms - I had a premier room which has pool views. The room was not as big as i would have liked but the balcony area was very generous. The rooms are not high tech but otherwise comfortable.    Pools - There are 2 pools a family pool and a adults only pool (did see a few kids in there though). The family pool is in 3 sections with 3 different depths for all ages. The only thing that I was disappointed with was there was no zero entry for small children. The pool for small kids also had a number of steps in the pool which I though was hazardous. There is also a pool in the kids club which was rarely used.    Restaurants: Innara - Moroccan/International - This restaurant also does an Indian night on Mondays which was very good. The lighting outside is very dim so much so we had to use our phones to see what we were eating and service was very slow and some items from the set menu did not appear.    Bleus - Wonderful outdoor setting around a central water feature serving up italian. Food was good pricey and portions small. Again service very slow and waiters almost never ask if more drinks are required when your glass is empty.    Azzera - Mainly used for lunch by the pool again good light options on the menu. In the evening they run a set menu with a choice of burgers. Didn't try that and never looked busy in the evening.    Solano - Breakfast is served here and they run a moroccan theme twice a week (fri and sat). Breakfast is ok but they do not have control of the flies in the restaurant. On one occasion there were about 20 flies over the cereals and I had to tell the waiter to do something about it.    Zest Bar - Rooftop bar that serves snacks did not eat here but visited occasionally for drinks. Again nice setting for sunset drinks.    Kids Club - Used on most days and they keep the kids entertained from 9-5 and also run a 7-9pm themed party 3 times a week which gives mums and dads a chance to eat in peace. Nabila from the kids club was very enthusiastic and made our kids feel very welcome.    Young adults centre - Away from the kids club which was a minor inconvenience but I believe they are joining the 2 together which will help families with older kids.    Wifi - the complimentary service does extend to the pool area which annoyed some people    Location - 5 mins from the airport and about 10 to the main square and about the same to the new town.    I did speak to the Guest Experience manager regarding my concerns and he took note with the service at the pool improving immediately but I fear the problems will persist. Service is a problem across the board and needs to be addressed for this to be regarded as a top Four Seasons.

Review_Title: A Four Season Hotel worth visiting
Review_Text: Just arrived back from 3 nights here. The staff were faultless and the hotel is just on the edge of the city so a 5 minute drive. The hotel provide a car in an evening but taxis are very cheap too. The rooms are as you would expect in any 4 seasons as are the facilities. We enjoyed the city being so near but also the chance to escape it. We stayed in suite very near the pool so it was excellent.

Little I can add to many other reviews. Stayed for a week beautiful place fantastic staff lovely rooms slightly down by the food (limited menu average quality). Sort that out and it's the perfect place.

Review_Title: A Fantastic Place to Stay in Marrakesh
Review_Text: Everything was perfect with our stay at four seasons marrakesh.    All staff were very efficient and friendly. Our accommodation was very confortable with great views to the pool.  Both pools were beautiful but we particularly enjoyed the quite pool.  We tried the internationally restaurant and the food was great.

Review_Date: Ali Mak wrote a review Aug 2015
Review_Text: Four seasons    The staff here have done the Four Seasons brand proud.    Check-In: We were a group of 8 (part of a bigger wedding group of 90+) and were received with a very warm welcome. We were seated in the lobby and served delicious Moroccan tea whilst the resort manager checked us in. I didn't even realise this was a check-in process. Within no time we were shown to our rooms whilst being shown where to go for breakfast and where the pools were located.    Room: The room was fantastic. Well lit with great finishing and a large outdoor space for lounging. The bathroom area was huge with a great bath and shower with a further segregated toilet. There was plenty of storage so I didn't have to battle my wife for space for once.    Food: From breakfast to room service to poolside food...absolutely amazing. The chef(s) nailed it. One of the best Pasta Arabiattas I've had and I was always spoilt for choice at breakfast. It was a little pricey but expected at a 5* resort.    Service/Staff: Friendly polite efficient and carried a smile.    Check-Out: Swift and remedied all issues superbly which leads me to...    There were a few problems that did occur but the manner in which they were resolved should be of focus. 1) The service by the pool was fairly slow often only two staff members available. 2) Cabannas were being unofficially reserved and left unoccupied for hours at a time which was a bit annoying. 3) My bed mattress was very soft and upon three requests had not been changed. This led to a bit of a back problem and required treatment at the spa. 4) Other guests had signed my room number with their name and signature on two occasions for f&b (a genuine mistake)    Upon bringing this to the attention of the check-out clerk this is what happened:  1) All F&B was removed from my bill  2) All Spa treatments removed from my bill  3) Escorted to the train station with a chauffer to carry luggage all the way to my cabin.  4) Resort manager personally came to apologise and see us off.
