In fairness I was only expecting an apology and realised the wedding was unexpected in the "off-season" so the hotel was admittedly understaffed. But to have made amends the way they did left me pleasantly surprised and made me feel valued.    I will most definitely be back at the Four Seasons in Marrakech...worth every penny/cent/dirham    Nb: My wife's review may be a little more grim as she feels she should not have had to put up with my aches and pains. *tsk tsk* Some women!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I've been to a lot of exceptional hotels this year. This should have been rated as exceptional but I couldn't.    When you call for things they don't happen as they should. I think having whatever whenever as a benchmark at w hotels sets an expectation for excellence.    The food in the restaurants isn't good. And it's expensive. There is far better food to be had outside - though it's a pain getting outside with the hussle and rubbish taxis. We went to mai-Thai on our last evening which had good food at a fair price.    The rooms are lovely the grounds are lovely the staff try hard and it is almost there. Out other option was la mammonia and I'm glad we chose here.    Money and food aside it was a good stay. I think with a few changes it could be a world class hotel.

Review_Title: Cannot fault it....Your relaxed and happy before you even get your room key!
Review_Text: Just returned from my second stay at this amazing resort.  The highlights for me were the warm welcome you are seated in the gorgeous lobby and the tea man makes you a traditional tea as you wait.  The signature rose infused scent which fills the rooms! OMG its so good they are constantly sold out of it in the hotel shop i was hoping to stock up on this trip...but i guess its a reason to go back!  You feel relaxed as soon as you get there and the hotel is so well built that even at 95% occupancy you barely feel crowded.  Then there is the staff So lovely and thoughtful. and they are amazing with kids. Which brings me to the next highlight....the kids club! Lets just say your kids wont want to leave...ever!  A definite favorite cannot go wrong with this place.  Enjoy!

Review_Date: Habib R wrote a review Aug 2015
Review_Title: A good hotel for relaxing holidays
Review_Text: We stayed for a week from 14 Aug.2015. in this resort. It is a welcoming and relaxing place. Facilities are good and staff is helpful. Restaurants provide good quality food. Gym facilities are excellent.

Review_Title: Amazing hotel with lovely staff - food needs improving
Review_Text: I stayed here for four nights on a trip with my sister and we had a lovely time. The staff could not have been more helpful recommending restaurants booking day trips etc. They are always smiling and very friendly!    Our room was very spacious and spotless with our own terrace. Beds were comfortable.    We spent a lot of time by the pool they make a great Tom Collins at the pool bar!    The only thing that lets the hotel down is the food. We ordered the room service breakfast which was nice. But when we ordered lunch to the room it was really poor. My sister ordered chicken skewers which were overcooked dry and very bland. I had some tempura prawns which were soggy and again bland. They didn't taste like fresh prawns either so that was disappointing.    Other than the food this is a great place to stay!

Review_Date: Tom S wrote a review Aug 2015
Review_Text: After arriving in Marrakech we checked into a much smaller couple orientated riad. We soon realised this was not for us so moved to the four seasons resort which is great for couples or families. From the moment we arrived we were blown away it's beautiful in every way and the service is great. Would highly recommend staying here and when we come back we would never stay anywhere else.

Review_Title: Not nearly as perfect as it should be
Review_Text: Let's face it staying in a Four Seasons is an expensive exercise but one I was happy to try. I'm more of a Hyatt and Sheraton customer normally but for a long weekend in Marrakech I decided to try the Four Seasons. My expectations like the prices they charge were very high. The good bits are many; incredibly well designed rooms the most comfortable beds you will ever sleep in very attentive and faultless service an excellent spa and yet the little things that were so avoidable and wrong really infuriated me.  One day a beer for my son and myself ordered by the pool took 20 minutes and arrived warm in 37 degree heat. The crisps that accompanied them were stale. The replacements took another 15 minutes and then only because I'd asked yet again where they were.  A request for a pepper mill at the pool restaurant led to six attempts including a pepper mill arriving full of ground white pepper. Three were given to me empty.  The service at lunch by the pool was incredibly slow.  At breakfast we had two peppers on our table one morning and no salt. I asked for an Americano and didn't get any hot milk with it. Small things but not what you expect in a hotel chain of this cailbre.  My son's bath plug didn't work even after repeated attempts by both of us to get it to do the job of keeping water in.  The bathrooms don't have small bottles of branded toiletries which are so lovely but big bottles which were re filled daily with who knows what something I think is so penny pinching and usually only seen in cheaper chains.  There were no pens in the rooms by the phones only pencils which everyone hates using. All going to show even in one of the most expensive hotel chains in the world costs appear to be being cut.  Outstanding satisfaction for the high price this wasn't I'm afraid.

Just returned back from this wonderful hotel in Marrakech. The hotel decor was beautiful the staff were soooooooo helpful and friendly extremely welcoming and the food was delicious! If anyone is thinking of going to Marrakech then there is no other hotel choice for you this is an absolute must stay! Thank you to all the wonderful staff and an extra special thank you to Armig whom made my husband and i's holiday so memorable!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Stayed here for 4 nights in July. Everything about the hotel was 5* service was prompt and breakfast had so much choice. I didn't eat in the restaurant at night but room service was excellent promptly delivered and nicely set out with white linen. Lunch at the pool was also superb with plenty of choice. It was very hot when we were there the pool staff were going around with iced water during the day and checking that we had enough shade. I can honestly say I had the best night's sleep ever. The bed was incredibly comfortable and the pillows were duck and down feather which plumped up beautifully....absolute bliss. Wish I could have taken the bed and pillows home with me!!!!  I hired a guide for the morning to take me around the medina and souk which is advisable as it stops being hassled by sellers and also he knew where to go.!! All in all a luxurious stay in Marrakech.

Review_Title: Good in many respects, but not perfect...
Review_Text: This is perhaps one of the more difficult reviews to write; the bottom line is that a lot of things were very good indeed here but a few niggles and some experiences of bad service make me reluctant to give it an excellent rating. I think the stand out feature was the time effort and energy the staff expended in trying to put things right when problems occurred and this is to their credit. However in a 5 star hotel these problems should not occur in the first place.    There were many positive elements to this hotel. It is smaller than other Four Seasons resorts I have visited and as it was low season the hotel appeared to be fairly quiet. Our bedroom was pleasant and the beds were exceptionally comfortable. We heard no noise at all from our room despite overlooking the outdoor terrace of the restaurant and the air conditioning was effective. I also appreciated having tea and coffee making facilities.    The public ares of the hotel are beautiful and as mentioned in other reviews the flower arrangements are stunning. The hotel itself felt welcoming and friendly and as a mother and teenage daughter travelling without the rest of our family we appreciated this relaxed atmosphere. A significant number of staff were very pleasant indeed and one or two people really went out of their way to make us feel at home. On returning to the hotel after trips out we always felt a sense of calm and comfort.    However all too often the excellent service was in response to a problem. Unfortunately the service at the pool restaurant was poor but to be fair to the management we were not expected to pay the full bill when problems arose.    Most of the time we spent at the hotel during the day was spent by the pool and this was perhaps the least satisfactory part of the hotel experience. Firstly it is worth noting that there are 2 pools one a family pool and the other what I believed to be an adults - only pool. We based ourselves at the 'adult' pool but on our last day there were a few children in the pool. When I asked a member of staff about this I was told that it is in fact a 'quiet pool' and can be used by families if they are not noisy. However this does change the atmosphere I believe and I think an adults only policy would be better. By the way the conduct of a number of adults did leave a little to be desired. A particular group of women fuelled by bottles of wine were very rowdy indeed and seemed oblivious to the looks of other guests. I did find some days quieter and more relaxing than other days and I don't know what it must be like during high season.    Another issue at the pool was the lack of umbrellas. For maybe 30 or 35 beds or so I counted a total of 6 umbrellas which was completely inadequate. On one particular day it was extremely hot and as there were 2 umbrella bases next to my bed I asked for an umbrella so that I could have some shade. I was told there were no more available and when I asked why there were 2 empty bases next to the bed I was told that the umbrellas were broken. If they are broken then why are they not replaced? I was told to go into a cabana for shade but they are airless and stuffy and I did not want to do that. Eventually a malfunctioning umbrella was positioned next to my bed. This really is an area which needs to be addressed.    On our first trip down to the pool we arrived about 5pm to find a lot of beds covered with used and discarded towels which had not been cleared; this gave the area an untidy appearance and did not create a great impression. On subsequent days used dirty glasses were left at the pool edge. Having said this the staff often greeted me by name and were helpful and pleasant. I did not feel that there was much of a feeling of outdoor space. The pool areas were a little crowded with rows of beds alongside each other and there were no lawns on which to have sunbeds.    I had arranged for a transfer from the airport provided by the hotel. It was ridiculously expensive compared with the cost of a local taxi (£40 each way compared with £5 for a local taxi) but it was nice to be met by someone from the hotel and to travel in an air conditioned Mercedes.    Breakfast was another disappointment. I usually enjoy 5 star hotel breakfasts and believe them to be good value. However the breakfast here was more than £20 per head and yet one had to pay extra for items which are usually included as part of the buffet for instance pancakes. There is no option to have just a continental breakfast although there is if you order room service. On our first morning I had a small continental breakfast and my daughter had 2 pancakes and the bill was about £31 which I thought was particularly bad value. We therefore chose to go out for breakfast the remaining days and spend the money on lunch at the hotel instead. Le Cafe de la Poste was particularly nice and much better value.    We ate at Arancino the Italian restaurant which was pleasant although the menu was a little limited (excellent service however). We ate out the remaining evenings the best evening spent at Le Comptoir. I wasn't keen on Bo Zin which tried too hard to be cool and La Trattoria De Giancarlo which was recommended by the hotel was not great.    By the way if you are intending to visit Jamaa el Fna do read the reviews on this website and take time to research online the most common scams in Marrakech.    I began by saying this was a difficult review to write. I don't think I would return to Marrakech in a hurry and the hotel while nice is not enough to entice me back. Yet again I end up drawing comparisons with the Emirates Palace in Abu Dhabi; as a destination Abu Dhabi is not the most exciting place to visit. However it is the hotel which entices us back again and again. I feel inconsistency is the main characteristic of this Four Seasons property; there is much which is excellent but other areas let it down.

Just returned from a long weekend celebrating our daughters 21st. Amazing time. Hotel was just spot on. The staff could just not do enough and whilst there we lost a bank card one day and an iPhone the following day! Must have been too relaxed! But both were returned by staff and we were really happy to get them back. So defiantly no bad experience - note the lady who lost her scarf - and staff were excellent. Pools are absolutely gorgeous some of the best we've visited. Rooms really comfortable and spacious. And the smells and aromas around the gardens and the hotel just magical. We couldn't have asked for a better experience for our daughter. Thank you four seasons Marrakech and all the staff that made this special occasion magical.

Review_Date: Stacy S wrote a review Aug 2015
Review_Text: Wow what a beautiful hotel and I could not fault the service either.  I was away with work and a large group of us arrived at the same time however they coped really well and got us all into our rooms promptly.  I found the staff the be very helpful and nothing was too much trouble. My room was beautiful.  Very much recommended !

From the night before of our arrival the hotel called my husband to confirm our rooms.    The moment we arrived at our hotel we felt very relaxed. The Four season were very organised we had booked 3 deluxe rooms and they had all our rooms next to each other on the ground floor.    When checking in the staff took us directly to the lobby area to sit down and they would bring any papers that needed signing to us there was no standing or waiting around. We were served Morroccon tea with nuts dried fruit and dates.    The rooms were cleaned daily staff were very helpful and clean.    I did not book a treatment in the spa but did use the jacuzzi and sauna which I really enjoyed. The only thing that disappointed me in the spa was the the steam room it did not steam up. The staff said it automatically goes on & off but while I sat there was nothing. The spa was clean and very relaxing.    The kids enjoyed playing tennis. The gym had all the basic equipment for cardio. I liked for those who wanted to do weight training it was in a seperate room and there were many different equipments to use    The hotel was peaceful calm and relaxing I would definatly go back there again

Review_Date: Laura K wrote a review Jul 2015
Review_Title: Lovely hotel but beware of some staff
Review_Text: We visited the Four Seasons for four nights in July 2015.    Firstly an expensive scarf/shawl disappeared from my suitcase during our stay – this is not something I would expect to happen at a hotel of this standard. I emailed the hotel and they responded as if I had lost the scarf even though I didn't take it out of my suitcase for the duration of our stay. They said they had checked lost property but they did not say they would look into the theft.    Secondly we had a disagreement with a taxi driver at the entrance to the hotel – a member of staff was standing by but did nothing. As two girls travelling alone I would expect the staff to help guests in a situation like this (we had pre-agreed a price but this didn’t seem to matter to this particular taxi driver).    If it wasn’t for these incidents I wouldn’t have a bad word to say about this hotel. The majority of staff are attentive and friendly. I requested to change the room from a double to a twin and my request was fulfilled. We did have an issue with the card entry system to our room during our stay but this was promptly resolved. We ate in the pool side restaurant a few times and ordered room service – all the food was lovely. We used the hotel to exchange currency and the exchange rate they offered was very good. The pool area was beautiful the staff would walk around a few times a day offering water tasters of fruit juices and asking if you’d like your sunglasses cleaned.    We got a taxi to and from the airport – it’s a 5-10 minute drive and shouldn’t cost any more than 70 dirhams but the taxi drivers can be very stubborn. When we arrived the taxi driver initially wanted to charge us 150 dirhams to the hotel and wouldn’t budge.    Before visiting the medina I would advise you research scams in Marrakech as we saw it happen.. A LOT! We were scammed on our first night by a henna lady they use intimidation and can be scary after this incident we researched scams and didn’t let it put us off.    Overall I enjoyed our stay however it’s a shame that a member of staff can ruin our first experience of the Four Seasons. As a result I wouldn’t return.

I stayed at the Four Seasons Marrakech for 5 nights from July 23rd with 2 girl friends.    Upon arrival from the airport (which took 10 mins by hotel arranged car for 600 mad - although a taxi would have cost us about 100mad it is worth doing as the taxis are so old like clapped out tin cans and you probably wouldn't get your luggage in them anyway) we were warmly greeted by reception and whisked to our room without having to deal with boring check in admin. (we had an hour long wait at border control in the airport at arrivals as the systems were down) so we were grateful to get to our room quickly and refresh. The day we arrived it was 52 degrees!    The hotel was quiet due to it being the low season but we did not mind as we wanted a relaxing holiday - however people watchers may be a bit disappointed as there was little action around the hotel all holiday.    The hotel was beautifully decorated with modern and Moroccan theme with fresh pink roses everywhere.    Our room was large on the 4th floor overlooking the centre of the hotel with 2 large singles and an extra bed for our third guest. We had a walk in wardrobe large balcony big bathroom with bath tub and separate loo and shower. We had a table and chairs in the room which was nice as we ordered room service breakfast on some days. The only downfall in the room was the tv channels were not great but we did not spend any time in the room other than to get changed.    The cleaning service was excellent and they turned our beds down every evening giving us fresh bottles of water and slippers. The whole room was completely tidied with all our clothes folded. They even left us book marks for our books!    Breakfast offered a large choice of fresh fruit and croissants with some hot food as well although I was not that fussed about this (there are no pork sausages so watch out boys!) The breakfast although very high quality I felt was extremely expensive at 30 euros per day and not worth the money. I often just ordered a la carte which is more reasonable. Breakfast for 3 daily was 1050 mad.    We visited the Italian restaurant twice. The menu was a little limited I would have liked to have seen more options however the food was good. (you have to bare in mind that the food is never going to be top level London restaurant but perfectly acceptable - I have very high standards). The actual décor of the restaurant was good - we ate outside both times. We would have liked a bit more ambience -it was very quiet. Music would have helped and in general we noticed everywhere around the hotel there was no music including the pool area. This would have much improved our experience.    The pool was excellent. The sun loungers very high quality and they give you fresh towels. There is a bar service at your sun lounger and they bring complimentary water and little treats such as mango juice and strawberry milkshake which were nice touches. Our waiters at the pool were exceptional and really made our stay! The hotel pool I believe is the best I have seen on my many trips and certainly the best in Marrakech. Cocktails were approx. 160 mad which is about £10. There is a pool restaurant which serves pizzas burgers salads and lots of other options- all good quality similar to a Bistro restaurant like Cote Brasserie.    I visited the spa with a friend and had a full body massage. This was a good massage and worth doing. If you book through Expedia you get 25% off all spa bookings.    I would definitely recommend this hotel if you can afford it. When I say that I mean the restaurants and drinks are fairly pricy so you need to be ok with that - it is Four Seasons after all.    In summary service was exceptional cleanliness exceptional décor and facilities exceptional food and restaurants nice - a little expensive. Best hotel in Marrakech.    Extra tips- we visited Jad Mahal and Bo Zin for dinner. Jad Mahal average food very dark difficult to see what you are eating but excellent live entertainment whilst eating so worth the experience. They also have live band for after dinner. Bo Zin was an exceptional looking restaurant with good menu a little out of town. Worth a visit but don't order red meat unless you have a strong stomach. We also had lunch outside at the Mamounia which is quite a famous hotel. You should visit the souks around 11.30 or late at night eg 8pm. Be careful at night often very crowded and you will get bothered by shop owners. Do NOT wear expensive things dress down and keep your shoulders covered.    If you can afford it take private cars ordered by hotel everywhere. Local taxis readily available but not particularly safe. 50 mad to the medina from hotel instead of 400 mad by private air conditioned car - mercedes. Most don't have seat belts.    To see photos of my trip to Four Seasons you can see them on my instagram pip_mills

Review_Title: Extra ordinary service even during stress
Review_Text: Room: pavilion suite. Stayed: 6-13 July 2015  The resort is excellent and I don't need to say that as it's been said many times in other reviews. I want to mention some special stuff we experienced  1. The care and attention of people and there service culture is the best I have seen till now.  2. The main Moroccan restaurant is awesome. We went during Ramadan and the Iftar dinners were too good. We all put on weight.  3. Service under stress. We had an accident when a wax candle tripod fell on our little ones hair. The reaction of the staff and the attention given were first class. The star of the show was Lina. Her attention to our little one and solving the problem was outstanding

Hi just would like to thank the team of the pool area for adults (no children zone). We came as 'day guests' and were truly treated as VIP guests. Such a great hospitality strategy that we will visit the Fours Seasons for sure again. We were welcomed by 'Rachid' who was taking care of us from the start but also the other members from the restaurant made our 'one day experience' into something very exclusive. We felt spoiled. See you again!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Wonderful stay in the hotel as we were there on Business with L'Oreal.    The staff were very accommodating and always around for any questions or queries.    I would definitely recommend this hotel to other companies for Business.

Review_Title: Super break, a few hiccups, but we will be back.
Review_Text: We were unsure whether this hotel would live up to the usual four seasons standards having enjoyed some of our best holidays and special occasions with the chain in some of their flagship resorts.    We only had one issue which nearly resulted in a loss of a star - that was the internet. The Wifi (the premium one not the slow one) was terrible in the resort in particular around the adult/quiet pool where my fiancee and I just couldn't get strong enough signal to pick up work e-mails. We ended up racking up about £120 in phone data fees to save us having to go to and from the room. They really really really need to ensure their Wifi coverage is sufficient across the resort.    The staff were generally superb and in line with other four seasons hotels we have stayed in Ali at the front desk in particular was brilliant. Management were hands on and whilst the Italian meal we had was about 6 times the price of the superb Trattoria it really is reflected in the polished manager led service which you just can't find elsewhere in Morocco.    We went to Richard Bransons resort in the Atlast Mountains (Kasbah Tamadot) on a day trip (well worth doing - take your swimming and tennis stuff and enjoy a full day there) - and whilst it is stunning in a more natural quirky way the facilities staff and food just doesn't compare to the four seasons.    The hotel was pretty safe a very secure compound and the only hotel in the city (so we are told) which checks each car for bombs.    As others have said the hotel taxi pick-up is extortionate 6 minute drive from the airport made it the single most expensive taxi ride I have had anywhere in the world by a long way (on a £/mile basis). We will pre-book with a separate company next time.    The SPA was probably the nicest I have ever seen the first one to better The SPA at Pennyhill Park. Male and Female facilities are completely separate. My partner had a very disappointing massage she wasn't informed it would be with a male masseuse and was a bit surprised and felt uncomfortable during the treatment (even though he was very professional) had it not been mostly complementary we would have complained - they really ought to advice this in advance.    The rooms and facilities were faultless and the breakfast was very good service around the pool was perfect. We enjoyed 5 very relaxing nights here and enjoyed having a stunning hotel resort and being able to dip in and out of the busy city whenever we wanted. With cheap flights from the UK getting us there in under 4 hours we are sure we will become regular guests for short stays and are already planning a 30th birthday there for next year.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The hotel is very nice as are all personnel. Our room was upgraded and we had a wonderful time enjoying the facilities offered. Sometimes organisation between reception and concierge were a bit hectic and ran into some minor difficulties but none were of the kind to impact our stay. The rooms are well serviced my compliments to the personnel of the room service which did everything to satisfy us.

Review_Title: Pool and spa day at Four Seasons
Review_Text: We visited the Four Seasons to use the pool and spa while staying in the Medina in July when it was over 40 degrees. It is not a cheap option but you get what you pay for and I cannot recommend this hotel enough! It is only a short distance outside the Medina (less than 50dh in a taxi to get there but charged a premium to get back so would be worth arranging a pick-up rather than using Four Seasons taxi). The pool pass includes lunch spa is extra and quite expensive but also worth it as you can use the facilities before and after treatments. We also paid to use the pool at Les Jardins de la Koutoubia and the experience was very different. Although we were not hotel guests the staff were exceptional. Mahdi had no problem in arranging iftar instead of lunch (as we were fasting Ramadan) and Houda in the spa was delightful and attentive. I can't remember the names of the therapists but both my friend and I felt the massages were the best we'd ever had staff were ultra-professional and the spa facilities are excellent. Towels loungers and sunscreen are provided by the fantastic large swimming pool which is situated in beautiful grounds. Public wifi was not usable by the pool but good in other areas. Quality of food (buffet) and service in the restaurant was high. I obviously can't comment on the rooms but I hope to return as a guest at this hotel in the future - definitely a 5* experience which can be variable in Morocco.

I truly loved this beautiful resort. The service is impeccable in terms of genuineness and attitude. People are always smiling and willing to assist you.  Maybe they should improve the concierge service: the lady that booked a table for us at the club said us to get there too early and no one was there at that time.  Apart from this little particular the whole experience has been an unforgettable one!  Wery well done!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The resort is set on beautiful grounds with exceptional scenery and beautiful pool areas. The bar views at the Solano bar is also gorgeous.  The rooms are a little on the dark side even the luxury level rooms have very little open view which makes them a little dark. The condition of the room was ok but I wished the carpet and furniture were a little more modern. Overall experience was good with an exceptional concierge service. The resort gave us a good break from the hustle and bustle of the city of Marrakech since we did wonder off to the city using the recommended Abercrombie and Kent service from the hotel  The wifi by the adults pool was very slow so this is something hotel needs to improve on.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Rob Jupp wrote a review Jul 2015
Review_Text: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at the Four Seasons Marrakech. I am a regular visitor of 5 Star Hotels around the Globe and would add that this is a contender for the very best hotel I have ever visited.    It all started badly. The Hotel arranged driver wasn't at the airport to meet us on our arrival. I phoned the hotel rather angrily and within 10 minutes a replacement driver was there. When we arrived at the hotel a team was waiting for us to take us directly to our room to prevent any further inconvenience. The hotel insisted on taking the transfer off out bill. Things will always go wrong however good the hotel but it's what the hotel does about it that shines through good or bad. Their response was text book out of the good customer service book.    We booked a Pavilion Suite which came complete with a good size plunge pool.the rooms was fantastic. The bed was so comfortable.    We eat in the three restaurants. Italian very good Moroccan (Buffet) ok but no labelling on much of the food so you didn't really know what you were eating and anyone with food allergies would struggle. On the final night the hotel arranged for us to have our own table on the balcony with rose petals and candles. So romantic and so thoughtful and a lovely way to spend our anniversary.    We had breakfast in our room every day and it was amazing. A table on our balcony was laid and it felt like the most perfect way to start a day.    The grounds of the hotel are simply beautiful. So many herbs creating a rich bouquet of smells. The hotel has 2 swimming pools one for adults and one for families. We spent the day in the family one as it was bigger and seemed really quiet.    Our stay could have been effected by a large L'Oreal Conference with lots of young people who it appeared were not use to such surrounds. The hotel did a pretty good job of protecting the non conference guests but some of their behaviour may have proved too much for some.    Overall this hotel should be on a 'must visit.' The customer service experience was fantastic and we will defiantly return again. Thank you Four Seasons Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Exceptional service, beautiful and peaceful hotel
Review_Text: Not only is this a beautiful property well maintained and appointed the service and helpfulness of all staff is better than we've ever experienced anywhere. We stayed for five nights for my husbands birthday and were treated to cake and champagne delivered to the room while we were out which was a very pleasant surprise. We stayed during Ramadan and thus enjoyed the most amazing Iftar meal at the resort -- what a tremendous treat and an amazing value. The food at the hotel is superb and the staff make this hotel experience the very best it can be.    We were very happy they have a very large and beautiful adult pool (we prefer peace and quiet). The property is so peaceful green lush and a perfect retreat after the hectic nature of being in the Medina. The doormen were incredibly helpful with taxis and making sure we didn't get overcharged which is so common in Marrakech.    We chose a Premium room with king bed. The room was very large with a huge bathroom (with separate toilet room) tub large shower double sinks. We also had a nice walk-in closet with plenty of hanging and drawer space.    The room had a very large balcony with a view of the adult pool and the fountains if it weren't so hazy we could have seen the mountains but only saw a slight outline. The balcony had two chaise lounges plus a table with two chairs and still plenty of extra room. The bed was incredibly comfortable the climate control was quiet and perfect. We slept very peacefully there.    What will stay in our memories is how perfect the staff are. This was the best service we've ever experienced and were so impressed by everyone. Whoever is running this resort is tops!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed here for 4 nights and were not disappointed at all.  Beautiful hotel with lovely grounds2 superb swimming pools and a wonderful spa with an authentic Moroccan Hammam.  We had several spa treatments including the four season hammam ritualwhich was superb and very thorough.  The Italian restaurant was very good but Monday night pop up curry club in the Inara lounge was our favouritesuperb location and the food was exceptional.  Breakfast was very good and the service throughout the hotel was first class.  The room we had (premier room)was good lovely view of the gardens and a good size.  Very close to the Airport about 7 minutes transfer but you would never realise inside the hotel that you were so close to the citya real oasis.  We will return to this hotel without doubt.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The Four Seasons Resort was one of the best hotels I have ever stayed at the staff made us feel welcome from start to finish. The room was very big and had all the modern technology you require the wifi quality was the best I have seen in a hotel the signal strength even around the pool was great. The pools are excellent with an adults pool and childrens one the gym was very well equipped with a big cardio room weights room and tennis courts and the gym staff were always keen to help whenever possible even making sure you drank enough water. The only down side for us was the food but generally in Marrakech we did not find the food to be great. The hotel is around ten minutes from the airport but you wouldn't even know you were near the airport. Taxi's to and from the airport was around 500 MAD around £4 and the same price into the city centre.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We have just returned from a 4 night stay at this lovely hotel that is so peaceful and relaxing outside the madness of the Medina.    From my initial contact with Reservations they were extremely helpful and accommodated my requests perfectly. Communication was excellent with emails arriving instantly to confirm arrangements.  We stayed in 2 Pavilion Rooms which were interconnecting.    Unfortunately on arrival (we had booked a Transfer through the hotel) we came through and there was no Driver to meet us. Luckily the Driver from La Mamounia came to our assistance and called the hotel to sort the problem.  We then had to wait 15 minutes for our car - When it did arrive we were absolutely horrified at the state of the Range Rover Sport that collected us - It was literally falling apart broke down twice on the way to the hotel - luckily this is only a 10 minute journey...  The hotel were very apologetic for the situation but in my experience staying with other FS Hotels this did not go far enough . The charge was removed for the car as it well should have been.    We were welcomed nicely in the hotel and provided with refreshing Mint Tea during the check in process which was seamless.    The rooms were excellent - very spacious modern and clean. 1 Room had a balcony and the other room had a lovely sun terrace with loungers plus a balcony.  In room amenities were good but lacking a nespresso machine or alike - just an old fashioned kettle and sachets of instant.  Beds are very comfortable and rooms are air conditioned plus a ceiling fan.  Wardrobe space plenty housed in a walk in closet.    Breakfast - Buffet - Nice selection laid out and plentiful and things to satisfy most nationalities.    Pool - we used the adults pool daily which is large with plenty of sun loungers. Everywhere is clean and the pool area also offers cabanas should you wish to stay out of the searing sun.  The Pool service is efficient but very different to other FS stayed in. The Pool man greets you and arranges towels as you would expect but then you are delivered a glass of water . All other FS I have stayed in bring you a small cool box with bottled water iced flannels and some evian face spray.  It was not a problem to get a new glass of water - when you could find the pool attendant to ask ...  I will however mention it was Ramadam whist we were there so this may have had an impact on the service levels.  The whole hotel was very quiet.    Inara Bar& Lounge - Very pleasant area just off the lobby that serves good cocktails and will seem to make anything you ask for. Very pleasant staff who were very attentive.    Rooftop bar - We tried to go for a drink here after dinner one evening to find it was closed.    We did not eat in the restaurants within the hotel but they looked good.    The hotel is about a 10/15 min ride into the square/Medina so is well located and taxis are cheap.    If you are looking for a relaxing hotel with good levels of service you will not be disappointed in your stay here.

I spent the new year vacation at Four seasons Marrakech after a 5 days trip into Sahara!  The hotel was perfect And we really enjoyed our stay but The room is far from the entrance so we need to use the club car and its not always ready.  The room service and in room dining were great. We tried the italian restaurant for the new year brunch the crowed was good.  The pool fantastic even the sport center is nice.  I faced a miscommunication with the spa reception and they apologized and offered complementary massage and Hammam. The hammam experience was one of the best in Marrakech.  I highly recommend it. Wish to be there now!

The thing that makes this hotel great is the staff. What a wonderful experience and place.    The concierge suggested some excellent places and tours. The only negative I would say is the steam rooms where not up to the standard I would expect from FS but it could be because Hammam Spa do not get as hotel as regular steam rooms.    The roof top bar is a must the views are great and they even provide complimentary snack.    It's not necessary to go a room with a view as all views are good it just depends on what you like! We visited other hotel (la mamunia and royal mansoor) for drinks / dinner. The mamunia was great and felt like a Moroccan palace but the four seasons was still our preference. The grounds are great for walks and the adult pool was perfect for a swim or just relaxing in the sun!    Thank you to all the staff at four seasons for making our stay so great!!!

Review_Date: Kyera S wrote a review Jul 2015
Review_Text: First time we have stayed at a Four Seasons Hotel and will not be the last. It's a brand you hear a lot about and we were not disappointed. Flight from Gatwick to Marrakech with BA was just over 3 hours and the 10 minute car transfer means you are very quickly and officially 'on holiday'. This Hotel was faultless stunning design spotlessly clean discreet yet attentive staff. Beautifully furnished interiors and exteriors (not so keen on the caged Love Birds in the lobby) there was a lot of lovely bird song from the wild birds outside. The room we booked was a deluxe double and it was spacious with a huge super comfy bed a walk in closet wonderful bathroom and lovely balcony. The aircon was quiet the lighting was really well designed and everything was of a high quality. Lots of luxury bathroom supplies and of course lovely robes and slippers. Our room was on floor 3 over looking the gardens so very quiet and pretty view. Room service was great we used for breakfast mainly served on the balcony. It was my 50th birthday while we were staying and some nice treats were left in our room on the afternoon roses fizz cake and cards a very nice touch although I was unsure who to thank for this - but 'Thank Your' Four Seasons! We spent most of our time relaxing around the pool which was blissful great pool service and the water was perfect. The spa treatments we had were fabulous. The gift shop is lovely if a little pricey. The Zest roof top bar is perfect for sundowners I recommend the 'Medina Fizz' and my husband loved the 'Casablanca' bottled beer also the Sports bar was superb a total 'man zone'. The restaurants were lovely great locations and furnishings. Food was superb at every meal and plenty of it however I didn't eat meat on this trip in order to avoid eating Halal. Although we stayed during Ramadan our visit was pretty much unaffected by this. We had a guide 'Feta' who took us into town a short taxi ride away and showed us the area. Old palaces back streets new developments the souks and medina etc. It was good to have him or we would probably be wandering around lost still! We came away with a couple of things but our lack of bartering skills meant we probably paid way too much. Although it was June the heat was a dry heat so it never felt oppressive or uncomfortable and no mosquitos maybe the season or the spraying that's done? We have stayed in some amazing Hotels and have pretty high expectations so we would really recommend this Hotel for a luxury trip to Marrakech it's away from the chaos of Town you really won't want to leave. Looking forward to our next Four Seasons stay already!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Shelby N wrote a review Jul 2015
Review_Title: Best part of my visit to Marrakech!
Review_Text: This hotel was a dream. We booked our trip to Morocco but were uncertain as to where to stay and weren't quite ready to stay in a Riad. I am SO glad we chose the Four Seasons. We did a couple of recommended tours that were great through the hotel. We also spent one day at the pool and it was just lovely. The service can be a bit slow but I think that's just the way things are there. I would definitely stay here again!

Review_Date: Richard M wrote a review Jun 2015
Review_Title: An oasis away from the bedlam
Review_Text: We have just arrived home from the Four Seasons Hotel and what a great place it is.  Let me start from the beginning. When you arrive at Marrakech airport make sure you keep your boarding pass for customs. You have to fill out an entry form for customs and show them the boarding pass as well. Everyone was greeted with a surly look no please thanks or kiss my butt. Awful procedure and very haphazard. Nevertheless you are through and on your way to the hotel. We opted for the safe pick up from the hotel which we pre booked. Yes it is expensive but the driver is waiting for you with a board takes your cases to the Range Rover or whatever you have booked aircon on and away you go no hassle. The choice is yours. You could come out of the airport and be accosted by waiting cabbies all desperate for your business and I know some are not real either. If you do this make sure you say 'how much to the four seasons?' and whatever they answer suggest 50 or 70 dirhams no more. If they argue move to the next one. Do not get ripped off. It is just a ten minute journey. We paid for the cheauffeur option as I say maybe next time and now we are aware of the downside we may go for the non aircon non seatbelt cab!  We arrive at the hotel. Stunning. As you are driving along you pass a lot of dirt dust and un finished buildings and then come across this gated and high security hotel The Four Seasons. Then you think how lucky you are to be staying there. As you are taken from the car the cases are taken from you and you are checked in whilst sipping the mint tea. The corridors are all lit with lights and lanterns (at night) all air con and beautiful smells and aromas everywhere. Once booked in you are taken or driven to your room/ villa by a golf buggy depending on how far (though you never need it again). The rooms are large and comfortable bathrooms beautiful with a deep tub as well as a rain forest shower. We paid extra for the pavilion room very near the pool and a lovely balcony overlooking the pool with sun beds on. There are two pools one for family and the other adults only. We resided in the adults only daily. Sun cream on tap along with some magazines helpful and courteous staff around the pool for drinks and snacks no problems getting a sunbed when and where you want it and the pool awesome large and similar to indian stone tiles not the standard neon chavvy blue thus a feel of quality and luxury. there is a restaurant open until sunset at the end of the pool great drinks and food. yes a bit more expensive but at your feet no need to go anywhere.  They have three other restaurants the italian a tall building in the middle of the complex. Beautiful italian food. No side dishes were mentioned but we asked for a salad and that was no problem. Sometimes the food lacked a bit of spice but this seems to be the norm in Morocco. (I will be reviewing two restaurants outside of the hotel Cafe de la poste and Le Foundouk both of which you could only describe as edible nice but bland food). My own opinion is that the menu seems limited but when you ask they say they will cook what you want. Maybe hotel management should make this clearer and could possibly encourage further diners. Then there is the Moroccan buffet nightly. A great feast set out overlooking all the fountains and lanterns at night. I am not sure if this is just for Ramadan but seemed to be a crowd pleaser. Above this and near reception is a small international restaurant/ lounge. Sit outside or in good selection of food and lovely views. Again there was a 'pop up' restaurant one evening for a Bombay night which we only found out about on the night maybe management should look at promoting these events at turn down in each room or other ways? All of the food we had was lovely everyone so polite a far cry from eating outside the hotel. Yes it is more expensive the drinks are quite dear to but you can choose to get a cab elsewhere like we did on occasions (concierge more than happy to supply a list of good restaurants) but when you eat out you realise how happy you are to come back. It is an experience not to be missed outside of the hotel but I cannot say whole heartedly that we felt safe all the time especially having cab drivers who put their seatbelts over the back of their seats so it doesnt get in their way no crash helmets on a lot of mopeds and on children too a lack of road sense and signs I could go on. And as for the souks and main square an eye opener!!  My last thing about the Four Seasons was the Spa. My wife had the Hamann treatment day one and thought it was awesome the best ever. I had two massages over the five days and both sent me to sleep at times. A fantastic experience.  The staff everywhere seem to want to help you and look after you. Everyone is very polite and courteous from Salma at Concierge to Mohammed at the pool to name but two. The 'suits' also mingle with the guests but could possibly do that even more.  All in all this hotel is brilliant. In any city you would be pleased to stay there but in Marrakech you realise you have hit jackpot. As the saying goes you get what you pay for and I honestly cannot praise this high enough.  Will we go again yes. Same hotel yes.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed at the Four Seasons while on a visit to Marrakech and taking a break from the Medina area. We loved the hotel the opulence and the gardens were beautiful. We also enjoyed the spa and I experienced a traditional moroccan bath. My Hamman was very relaxing and I felt refreshed. The grounds are well maintained and a nice place to stroll and get away from the hustle and bustle of the city. The breakfast was delightful especially since you can ennoy the garden and pool view while enjoing your breakfast. Nice place to get away but you are secluded.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: relaxing counterpoint to the medina mayhem
Review_Text: As with other 4 seasons beautiful property with top class staff who are obviously well trained and happy to go the extra mile to meet guest needs.  Excellent breakfast buffet al fresco by a lovely water feature.  Good gym facilities and outstanding pool. Special mention to the poolside staff who made us very welcome with daily name recognition and great attitude.  Was a lovely relaxing contrast to the bustling old town and souks.Would definitely stay there again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: From checking in up to checking out we felt so welcome in this fab resort. We stayed in room 227 the room was big enough for 3 people the bathroom was big had a big deep bath and a big shower room. The toilet was an intelligent one: heats up the seat a button to lift the seat washing and drying buttons. And if you forget to flush it it flushes itself afterwards.    Anyway location fantastic lots of trees/plants and when you open the sliding door to the porch all you can hear is birds chirping away which was lovely.    If you wanted to use the mini bar for your own food they'll be glad to empty it for you.    The swimming pools and whirlpools are beautiful and pretty quiet in the mornings. The staff at the swimming pool are very helpful they will get parasol for you if your sun bed doesn't have one they will go around offering to clean your sunglasses.    Food is quite expensive - we only had breakfast there and there's a good selection of food so it caters for everybody's taste.    Standard Wifi is very good so no need to upgrade.    Concierge is very helpful will do all the bookings you ask them to do. Mind you they seem to try to dissuade you from booking a place which are not on their "list" but if you tell them that's what you want don't let them stop you.    If you could help it don't use the hotels airport pick up service it cost a fortune and the hotel is only 10 minutes away if that. There are plenty of taxis at the airport and they'll be happy to take 120 dhs    If we come back to Marrakesh we definitely stay here again.

Review_Title: A tranquil spot in a strange city
Review_Text: The 4 seasons was a nice place to stay for a couple of nights. We had suites with private pool. In my opinion no real advantage out of that. Pools were good and nobody bothers you. The general layout of the area needs a bit too much orientation and I do not want to study hotel geography. The belly dancers show was one not to be proud of.  If I go again to Marrakesh returning visit is 50/50

We recently stayed at this hotel for 4 nights at the end of May. When we arrived we were welcomed with a refreshing mint tea and informed we had been upgraded to a Pavilion Suite which was spacious and clean with a terrace area with its own plunge pool.  The adults only pool at the hotel was fantastic  very quiet and the pool attendant kept us supplied with complimentary drinks and nibbles.  We ate twice at the Italian restaurant  Arancinos  and the food on both occasions was excellent  if a little on the pricey side.  The cost of alcohol in the bars was very expensive  for example a bottle of beer and a glass of local wine would set you back £14.  On the last night we decided to eat at a local Riad and asked at reception for their advice they gave us details of a number of restaurants organised the reservation for us with a taxi taking us straight to the door .  We also needed a late check out which was organised with no problems  and was much appreciated.  We would definitely return to this hotel  everything about it oozes quality.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Excellent introduction to the hippest city in Morocco
Review_Text: On our first trip to Morocco there was no better introduction than a stay in the Four Seasons resort. The hotel was everything we have come to expect from the chain - luxury with a local twist very responsive and knowledgeable service and courtesy that goes beyond the call of duty.    We loved the little touches - Moroccan mint tea on arrival the chirping birds in the gardens and the exotic local touches without being over the top.    They took care of everything - down to getting nano SIM cards for us and topping up the value. The spa was also a lovely experience.    If we had one grouse it was that the weather was too hot in early June and walk from the room to the spa seemed too long in the heat. But even the Four Seasons cannot control the weather.    Nailed it again. Thanks!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Alexia R wrote a review Jun 2015
Review_Text: After a very long & tiring week touring Morocco my husband & I chose the Four Seasons as our final destination in the country and we did not leave the grounds once....... it really is just that perfect. Our room was huge with the typical elegant clean & comfortable Four Seasons signature decor. Awesome bathtub and amenities superb room service spacious terrace dreamy pools perfect spa & unbelievable dining options..... we don't for a moment regret that we spent our entire time in Marrakech oohing & ahhing over every design detail every meal & every romantic & dreamy moment that we experienced at this resort. We departed feeling renewed and fresh out of heaven. Cheers to each & every hotel employee we had the pleasure of meeting ~ what a tremendous top-notch staff!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tim M wrote a review Jun 2015
Review_Title: THE QUALITY YOU EXPECT FROM A 4 STAR HOTEL
Review_Text: I have had the privilege of staying in several Four Seasons hotels around the world and am delighted to say that the standard seems to be getting higher if their Marrakesh Hotel is anything to go by.The moment you walk into the lobby you are hit by the fragrance of their signature floral display. The lobby is not cluttered by check-in desks and concierge counters They are in a separate area. The rooms offer a large bedroom and very comfortable bed off which is a large bathroom with twin basins separate shower and toilet. The dressing room / walk-in wardrobe offers more than enough space to satisfy the most fashion concious travellers. The balcony is big enough to relax on in comfort and has an attractive brick built-in lounging seat as well as table & chairs. The buffet breakfast offers a wide choice of well prepared food.

I can't thank enough the Four seasons' team for their warm welcome their help whenever needed and their courtesy at all times. From the start smiles were all around. Starting with the very courteous valet and bell man who escorted us to the lobby where we were greeted with a nice cup of tea and had a very smooth check in the lobby's living room (which actually didn't feel like a regular hectic check in).    The fragrance in the lobby was just right subtle but really good.    The room was pretty spacious with a nice balcony a large bathroom and the best.... a walk in closet with an easy to use safe.    We interacted with the front desk room service valet and concierge on a regular basis and I can tell you that we had the best experience ever. They were always ready to help!! I actually do not remember ever hearing a "NO" when we were there.    By the pool a gentleman by the name of Abdel (I believe it was Abderrazk) helped us a great deal. He managed to get us two cabanas brought the long chairs and covered them for us in no time. He was also very handy with the first aid kit when I scratched myself (really minor) which I appreciated. I just had to say that I hurt myself and next thing I knew he was there with the first aid kit.    We also had an amazing time at the spa very relaxing and the service again was impeccable. We tried the Hammam and got a massage after we weren't rushed at all and we had a nice tea after the Hammam (while waiting for the masseuse) and when we were done.    Bottom line I highly recommend this hotel as we really felt like we were in a friend's place rather than a stuck up and intimidating hotel.    Thank you for making our memorial day weekend in Marrakech memorable!!    Special thanks to :    Abderrahim Badr and Ali from Reception  Aicha and Houda from the spa  Mouhcine at the door  The room service team    We definitely plan on making the Four Seasons our spot in Marrakech!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Paul S wrote a review May 2015
Review_Text: I returned to visit this hotel after a really good trip last year. Hotel was excellent but felt the service was not as good probably because the weekend was so busy and then on the Tuesday a corporate party meant the main bar was closed for residents but the hotel did not tell us as guests!    Spa are really good but limited choice of restaurants the italian is good but a limited menu.    Would return again as very relaxing and its beautiful resort and superb weather.

Review_Title: The Four Seasons at Its Best
Review_Text: The problem with staying at the Four Seasons is that you never want to leave and explore and that was the case here. The food the service the pool the gardens the bar -- all are perfect.    Our room/villa was especially amazing with our own small patio and plunge pool. Loved it!    A special note about the service... We were there on a group trip and my husband missed lunch because he was working. We went to the kitchen about 30 minutes after lunch had finished up but we were hoping my husband would be able to get a small bite to eat. He explained the situation to the manager and asked for a small plate of hummus and tabouli with some bread. The manager would not hear of it! He sat us down and served my husband plate and plate of amazing kabobs and rice and salad and vegetables and... on and on. I told the manager he had to stop treating my husband so well because then he'll expect that from me at home :-)

Review_Date: Jonathan P wrote a review May 2015
Review_Text: Just returned from this hotel - very pleased the staff couldn't do enough for you. We stayed in a deluxe room which was great very peaceful with large bathroom and lovely terrace.    After long days on trips we ate at the hotel compared to eating elsehwere in maracech It may seem expensive compared to london it was good value !    Pool was wonderful and staff fantastic - came round with complimentary small drinks and even offered to clean my sun glasses !    We had a late flight and they did everything possible to keep us in our room a small touch that was really appreciated    Overall fantastic !    If I was to make a negative comment and give some feedback I would say the Italian restaurant is really under selling it's self - the weather wasn't great with a few showers - all the other restaurants got back to business and opened up outside - 3 times we tried to sit outside the Italian and they were only open inside so we went to one of the other bars on site and sat outside !
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Parker C wrote a review May 2015
Review_Title: I wish I could give it more stars
Review_Text: This was bar none not only the best Four Seasons I've ever experienced but the best resort I have ever stayed out. The first thing to note was the extraordinary level of service. From Assistant Manager Sophia to the lovely gentlemen helping at the pool nothing was overlooked or unanticipated. Everyone working in the resort from the gardeners to the housekeepers to the wait staff the front desk the pool men - were all friendly courteous and kind. Calls for more towels or something forgotten on the breakfast tray were responded to immediately.  We stayed in a Pavilion Room near the adult pool which was incredibly spacious with a marvelous bathroom with double sink and separate large tub and shower.  Restaurants are excellent especially the Italian restaurant Arancino and don't miss breakfast at Solano with its expansive buffet. Also GREAT pizza at the poolside restaurant Azzera Grill.  Can't wait to go back.

Enjoyed a fabulous few days in this amazing hotel. An oasis away from the hustle and bustle of the busy town!  We ate in the poolside restaurant twice and the food and service was first class very good wines too!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My mother and I had been thinking about Marrakech for years but never got a chance. So when the opportunity came we snapped it up. We were looking for a short relaxing holiday. This hotel was amazing from the moment we booked it. I received a phone call the day before we left London to confirm all was still ok and who was coming. As soon as au said its a mother daughter holiday they gave us a beautiful situated room with two separate beds. I couldn't recommend this hotel enough. We will be busting every year. The only down fall is that the food if you haven't got a bed&breakfast package the food generally at this hotel is expensive.    I could not thank the hotel staff enough. They were amazing. The pool guy was very on the ball.    The concierge team are to die for. Very helpful and knew exactly what to recommend.    If you stay here worth having the hammam it's an experience. A little above what you would probably pay in town but I guarantee the treatment wouldn't be as good.

Review_Date: andre c wrote a review May 2015
Review_Title: super Ascension long weekend in Paradis
Review_Text: From 14 to 17 May in appartment 30 at the resort we enjoyed the best of Marrakech in that splendid 40 acres paradis. Food services comfort are really exceptionals. We thank them for their professional attitude.  Breakfast prepares you to handle quietly the Souk visit in town and dinner makes you ready for an amusing evening in the resort bar.

Wow - I don't say that very often. Trying so hard to come up with complaints. Can't find any. Even the heat feels less hot in this hotel. 2 die 4. Have to come back very soon. Even thr little things are being taken care of. Relaxing thrilling as YOU like it. Thanks for having us as guests. 😎
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The best hotel in Marrakech and best service GM flexi very nice and great guy other staff including Sophia Mahdi suriya amina very good people I had my best holiday thanks to four seasons and flexi nice food clean and high class rooms

Review_Date: Suki H wrote a review May 2015
Review_Title: Perfect in everyway - Service beyond expectation
Review_Text: We stayed at The Four Season Resort Marrakech for our family holiday 3-10th May 2015 and WOW what a wonderful week!  Where do I start? The Range Rover Sport that was sent to collect us from the airport fully equipped with carseat and cold bottled water!  The Check in took place in our room after we were taken there by a golf buggy car!  We had booked the Deluxe Suite and asked for a cot for our toddler and a gate to be put up around the private plunge pool - all was done when we arrived along with a changing mat nappies wipes baby shampoo/lotion etc  The bed and pillows were so comfortable it was if sleeping in the clouds the room was spacious with an amazing walk in shower wet room big bathtub separate loo and double sink vanity area! Outside the bathroom there were double wardrobes and appropriate luggage storage. We had our own outdoor area with sun loungers etc.    Whilst the suite was amazing what made this holiday perfect for us was the hotel staff. I have never experienced such excellent customer service. Every member of staff we came across would say hello and interact with our toddler they would give him balloons play peek-a-boo and by the end of the trip he would look out for his favourite people! In particular Mohammed at the Azurra Restaurant was so brilliant in every way - so special thanks to him!  Someone else has mentioned the French Food & Beverage Director I was also impressed at his interaction with all guests at breakfast lunch and dinner - very friendly and interested in guest feedback.  We had an incident where my toddler's pjs were probably taken away with the bedsheets/towels by housekeeping. We asked if they had been found and the hotel looked into it extensively and kept us updated (not that we were precious about the pjs) - They were not found but the next day a Moroccan pj suite was left in our room with a handwritten note from housekeeping apologising the inconvenience. It certainly was not necessary but we were touched by the gesture and service which went over and above that of so many other hotels we have stayed in.    All the restaurants served great food again excellent service very attentive - if the slightest thing was not right like a frozen margarita instead of a classic the manager would personally come over and fix it - again not necessary but astounding service. At breakfast every morning when we arrived there would be a table ready for us with a high chair and plastic tableware for our son the waiter would know our coffee order after only 1 breakfast - a little touch which just makes such a difference.    There are 3/4 swimming pools Adult Family +baby Kids Club Pool - we only used the Family and Kids Club Pool but didn't need anything else there were water toys there a lifeguard the staff would intermittently arrive with glasses of iced water and various juices (carrot and orange mango etc) to keep us refreshed - so very attentive they know what you want before you know it!    We did utilise the hotel's babysitting service booked through the hotel concierge - we had a very sweet lady called Saira who watched our son while we had dinner - we would recommend this service to any parents.    There is a kids club for 4+ which I was able to take my son to play in their specific pool and soft play area as long as I stayed with him as he is only 20 months old - he enjoyed it as did I! Again wonderful staff!    I could write an essay on how beautiful our trip was in everyway we were all so relaxed and happy and would definitely come here again and indeed to any Four Seasons Resort. (I have already been telling everyone I know to visit!)

This was my fifth visit to Marrakech and I have always stayed in more intimate accommodation but because I was coming with my Mother who had not travelled for many years and quite frankly was a bit nervous about the whole trip decided to come to a larger well know resort style hotel. The hotel and all its staff really cannot be recommended highly enough. Gardens just beautiful pool area stunning with really excellent service. We both had the trip of a lifetime. I must mention that the beds are the most comfortable that I have EVER slept in. I cannot wait to go back and most certainly will Inshallah.

Review_Title: Four Seasons are the best - this is the best of the best!
Review_Text: We spent a week here last year on holiday making it maybe the 9th Four Seasons hotel we have stayed at. This one is the best.    Four Seasons rooms are always so well thought-through bags of space super beds and beautiful bathrooms - plus a walk-in wardrobe. We asked for a quiet room and got one over looking the adult pool but sufficiently far back to be peaceful.    Overall the hotel is stunning and this one in particular was special for the beautiful lobby with the most amazing rose displays and décor with pops of stunning colour (often Four Seasons can be a bit neutral).    We received a warm welcome and spent a fab week here. Loved the adult pool and the fact kids/families area was separate!! very important for romantic couples.    All the restaurants were excellent as were the management and staff in each - probably our favourite was the Italian.    But what made the hotel was the staff firstly the French F &B Director who was always present checking things were running smoothly (I already wrote to him at the time) but in particular I would want to thank Sami and Zak at the adult pool both excellent but Zak was excellent I never saw a guy work and run so fast. He was onto every detail nothing was too much trouble and he should go far! Thanks to the both of you.    And thanks Four Seasons Marrakech I hope we can get to stay with you again soon.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A good resort for family. Many facilities and some swimming pools. Away from the city centre can watch the airplane landing and take-off without noise. A shop near the lobby seems pricey.  Service good.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I really can't rave enough about our recent experience at the Four Seasons Marrakech. From the moment we booked we were treated to the high level of customer service that is akin to the Four Seasons Brand. Safia and Jinan at the Concierge Desk arranged a variety of activities (and airport transport for us) prior to arrival and everything was flawless. The hotel staff were wonderful and treated our 5 year old daughter like royalty. Mohammed at the Azzera Grill was amazing and our daughter looked for him every day because he was so friendly and fun. The Kids Club was out of this world. The tennis club was super and the quality of the lessons were top notch. The spa was lovely (especially the Hammam ritual - not to be missed). And the quality of the onsite food was great (which isn't always the case) particularly the Indian pop up restaurant. A five star experience and we can't wait to visit the hotel - and Marrakech - again!!!

Review_Date: Simon C wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Text: Anther four seasons offering quality and good service with a well trained smile. If you go enjoy snacks and drinks in the library with the fire blazing. What's not to like - you are going to get exactly what you would expect of a Four Seasons Hotel. I'm a fan.

From the moment that the gates open to let the cab enter to the facility to the end of the day calm promenade in the herbs garden you are in a paradise.  There is a big contrast between the buzz of the streets and calmness of the property gardens fountains etc.    We stayed in the houses/villas by the pool and it was wonderful. The rooms are huge with walking closets  mini Haman and beautiful balcony.  The food is excellent the facilities are beautiful the pool and service are wonderful- the yoga on the roof with astonishing views was a bonus.  There are kids clubs and separate kids pool and adult pool area.    The resort has many small and large buildings on the ground. One is an Italian restaurant another is the SPA then the GYM Moroccan restaurant etc. you can walk between them and smell hundreds of well maintained herbs and flowers or you can ask for a gold carts.  You can order food by the pool the stuff is so well trained that they don’t ask unnecessary questions and seems can read your mind and do exactly what you want.  Housekeeping is excellent. Although wee were further in the gardens but it was not taking long time to get us room service or anything else.  You would not really want to leave the hotel as there are many things to do there wine testing cooking class gym classes even drawing class and Arabic language class        The service is what makes Four Season Four season- very happy and thankful for your outstanding service.    Will definitely will come back. If you are planning to go to town take some cats and dogs food with you as you will see many poor animals on the streets and they enjoy a little attention.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Although we prefer family owned boutique hotels the 4S in Marrakech might the best example of Resort which works in the best possible way. 'the hardware' is best in class. Rooms are amazing. 2 Swimming pools and a a rooftop terrace with a fantastic view on the High Atlas Mountains.    All the staff of 4S Marrakech really runs the extra mile. This made our stay very comfortable (Ali front office staf might be the best example). We never visited a a resort with a staff which is so dedicated.    Great WIFI connection (streaming possible all over the resort)    Improvements? The lunch menu is a little limited. Only two restaurants are open during the afternoon.    Hopefully we will come back soon

Review_Title: About as perfect as a hotel can get
Review_Text: Lovely and spacious rooms . Great beds and service. Quiet and serene luxury. Superb breakfast. Fabulous grounds. WiFi was a bit spotty at times but this is not a first world country so some allowances should be made. Breakfast was just lovely. Dinner was excellent as well with good service in the restaurants.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: alexandra s wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Text: My boyfriend and I stayed at this hotel for a long weekend and we LOVED it. The rooms were beautiful and spacious the two pools were stunning. The breakfast buffet was delicious with a wide selection and we ate at the Italian restaurant one night and really enjoyed it as well. The spa was beautiful we both received excellent treatments and the fitness facilities were well equipped. However by far what stood out the most was the service there wasn't anything they wouldn't do for us! We will definitely be going back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Rob L wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Text: The Four Seasons Marrakech sits on a stunning property. The public areas and rooms are both pleasing and modern. Great bathrooms. The staff was exceptional-well trained and most anxious to please. The breakfasts were excellent with many Western and Moroccan food offerings. This hotel certainly meets if not exceeds the high standards of the Four Seasons properties.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Perfect place. Location is awsome. Staff is really good. Rooms are spacious and views very nice. Hamam is really good.  Special pool for children. Kids club: kids loved it. Staff super nice and activities are great.  Would refommend this as one of the best hotels in marrakesh

My family and another family came to Morocco for the first time during our children's school break. We are all discerning travelers that have stayed in the best boutique and corporate hotels/resorts around the world. This property by far is now one of our favorites. Why? The staff is incredibly attentive to detail and service. From the reservations manager who worked miracles for us (Ms. Amina) to the concierge staff (Ms. Soraya Mezian and the Cocierge Supervisor Ms. Jinan Ait Ali Oumensour) to the housekeeping staff and room service staff...I could go on. The facilities allowed both adults and children alike (ages 9 and 11) to equally have a wonderful time together and independently all the while knowing our children were safe. The grounds are gorgeous with Moroccan touches and a modern feel. The fresh flowers alone throughout the resort were simply stunning (and I am not a fan of roses). We planned 4 nights here and then went to a traditional riad. Although we really wanted the experience The Four Seasons was so amazing that we checked out and went back to the hotel for our last 2 nights. When we came back we felt like we were home when the staff came out to welcome us back! I cannot say enough. We fell in love with Marrakech and this Four Seasons. We will be back.

Review_Date: Sue C wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Text: Stunning property and the staff were exceptional! The Four Seasons made our stay in Marrakech. We planned a 4 day holiday and it was a wonderful sanctuary after the craziness of the Medina. ( wish we had stayed longer just to enjoy the property more). The gym facility was wonderful the breakfast Buffett was a wonderful place to start our day and our room was beautiful. The property and the gardens were absolutely beautiful!! We wanted to see La Mamounia after reading so much about it and while it was a beautiful property we were really glad we chose The Four Seasons. Highly recommend this property!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: bert r wrote a review Apr 2015
Review_Title: Beautiful resort, great architecture combining local elements with modern twist, lovely personnel.
Review_Text: This recently built hotel is a great example how perfect achitecture should be. It it combines the local Morroccain elements and gives it a modern twist. Rooms are very nice. More importantly the staff personalized the stay with utmost friendliness and many little attentions we did not expect. The Four Seasons hotel in Marrakech is a top location.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Stayed for an all too brief 4 days at the end of March 2015. Hotel is beautifully laid out rooms are exceptionally comfortable. Great gym tennis courts and pools. Nice restaurants (the Italian one even let us BYO wine). But best of all are the staff; polite helpful and they can't do enough for you whilst also very thoughtful and not in your face. Probably the best hotel in North Africa.

Always clean well managed excellent service.  Food was good pool clean. I didn't like the back patio we looked at nothing really.  the Italian restaurant was amazing and the best part of the hotel.  beautiful in tranquil in a crazy city.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Markus M wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Title: Great experience and hospitality !!! The staff very friendly and helpfull.
Review_Text: Great experience and hospitality !!!  The staff very friendly and helpfull. Specially the resaurants staff (Solano Manager - Moroccan Buffet) the concierge and the SPA Team. :-)  We will come back and will recommend the hotel at any time.  MM Switzerland

I really enjoyed my stay at this hotel as it provided exactly what I was looking for. Good service nice rooms and an oasis of calm from where I could dip in and out of the medina. This is a large resort hotel with nice gardens and a lovely heated pool with great service from the pool attendants. The buildings themselves wouldn't win any awards for great architecture but its all very functional and never feels busy. I had a suite on the 1st floor with a very large terrace and all the normal mod cons.
