The service was all very good as you would expect and the hotel provided a great base from which to explore its about a 10 min taxi into town. I tried all the restaurants in the hotel and they were all satisfactory although the expensive Italian wasn't as good as it should have been food or service wise ( I visited twice). The pool side restaurant was probably the pick of the bunch for a simple lunchtime bite. That said breakfast is great with a huge choice and sets you up well for the day. The standard of restaurants in the town are high and the choice is huge and the values even for the top end are good. Marrakech is a really good place to have fun testing out lots of good quality interesting restaurants. The one thing the hotel does miss is a proper bar for people to meet there is one but its small and apologetically tucked away a proper bar gives a hotel soul and this one could be missing a bit of that. In summary of course it's expensive but if you want a discreet get away from it all bit of luxury in Marrakech I'd start here.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Alanna B wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Title: Great authentic stay with Moroccan touches
Review_Text: Hotel was perfect and offered many authentic touches. Rooms were super comfortable. Great views. Expansive grounds. Great pool with stone bottom. Room service was great. Buffet breakfast was delicious. Hotel was quiet. Staff was available for every need.

Where can I start? Most of us who have stayed at any Four Seasons know the quality of these hotels.    I have stayed at many high end hotels including four seasons Ritz St Regis Banyan Tree and Mandarins. After staying at FS Marrakech it has become my favorite hotel in the world.    It is a beautiful property very well maintained but staff here are the best in the industry. They go out of their way to make sure your stay is pleasant and comfortable.    My personal thanks to Asst Manager Sophia who even called our hotel in our next destination (Casablanca) to make sure everything is taken care of and made the dinner reservation. A special thanks to Safia in the concierge team who helped tirelessly to make our stay very pleasant.    Overall It was amazing

Review_Date: Wendy S wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Title: Long weekend break with a friend
Review_Text: Customer service with a smile everywhere we went! The weather was disappointing on our 5 day break but the hotel couldn't have done more to make our stay relaxing- with log fires wonderful food and wine and general calm to make our stay restful and memorable. We took a tour with their recommended guide which meant we saw the best of the city in the shortest possible time. The spa was lovely and the poolside experience ( when the sun did shine!) second to none-we'll be back!

Review_Title: Simply the best Hotel Company in the world. It`s their people, who really make a big difference
Review_Text: We have seen many very beautiful Hotels in the world - this is one of them.  But only Fours Seasons assures the most personal and attentive care and service  we are all looking for.  Thank you very much to Mr. Murillo and his wonderful team for this outstanding and memorable stay.  We will definitely return soon.  Christoph Kraushaar
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Arriving here was like stepping into an oasis of calm after a chaotic start to our trip at the airport. The hotel is beautifully decorated with lanterns and red roses and the lovely scents fill the air. The rooms are fantastic - the bed was one of the most comfortable I've ever slept in and the bathroom is spacious and luxurious. Our room had a large balcony with a table and a Moroccan-style lounging area overlooking one of the hotel restaurants. There are a few swimming pools at least one is a kids-free zone which was a plus for relaxation. The swimming pools are beautiful and the water was the perfect temperature. There is also a luxury spa with numerous treatments the massages were wonderful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: alex b wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: Fantastic Hotel great staff amazing Kids Club. Great also for couples with no kids : 2 swimming pools are reserved for them 2 others accept kids! It is a luxurious experience so of course you may find food and beverages too expensive. Breakfast for instance is fantastic but cost 35€. It is worth the price. Great gym also.

Review_Date: Elaine S wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Title: Beautiful, relaxing and great with kids
Review_Text: This property is beautiful. The room are spacious bright quiet. We were upgraded upon Arrival after a warm friendly greeting with local mint tea. There is an ATM machine right off the lobby so you can easily and reasonably get local currency. There are three restaurants on the property which are all lovely and again reasonable. We ate in the morrocan restaurant the first night which was perfect since the food was excellent and the staff gave us a tutorial on local dishes.  The hotel is a short taxi ride from town but they are inexpensive. There is a curtesy car at night that can take you to local restaurants. The Italian restaurant on the property is beautiful but kid friendly...as is the whole hotel and staff.  The gift shop on the grounds Is beautifully curated and made sure I left happy with my purchase.    The spa is worth a visit for the unique Hamas treatment .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Amazing place to stay the service is absolutely impeccable everyone on the staff from the manger Felix on down is here to help you and genuinely gets to know you and cares about your stay here. The grounds are amazing the bars and the breakfast buffet are incredible and they can arrange for anything you might need or want to do during your stay in Morocco. The prices frankly for the luxury experience you're getting are very reasonable actually. The only thing I will say is it's not easy walking to say the medina if you really want the experience of being right in the medina but if you want to treat yourself to a relaxing resort experience this is the place.

Review_Date: Nasser AbuTaleb wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: this is one of the best hotels and great rooms the staff is super friendly and have great concierge service as they booked and took me everywhere i wanted to go. they all speak great english and great at communication and easy to understand. they have 2 pools one for kids and an adult pool for more quiet relaxation.

Review_Date: Hesham H wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: Best four seasons I have been to! Amazing grounds welcoming staff great kids club and a wonderful spa. I would recommend Tarik if you ever need a spa treatment! I visited with my wife and 2 kids and we all had a wonderful time!

We couldn't fault this hotel an absolute delight! Restaurants good but are a little pricey.  Beautiful gardens! Excellent attentive staff couldn't do enough for us. Many thanks to Sophia for making our stay so good. Would definitely return.

Four Seasons resorts are known for their high level of service and this Marrakech resort is no exception. I was very impressed with the private car and driver that met me at the Marrakech Airport and even more delighted with a concierge that accompanied the driver. He provided wonderful commentary on the short drive to the resort and upon arrival took me to a delightful patio area where I was offered drinks while being checked into my room. From there I was taken to a beautifully appointed court yard room and given a description of the features of it. Beautiful roses traditional Moroccan tea and snacks were waiting for me in the sitting area of the very large room. Thoughtful items available in the room included an iron and ironing board along with a safe plush robes and slippers and a soaking tub. Staff was very attentive throughout the resort especially the concierge staff. Room service was excellent and the breakfast buffet was a combination of Moroccan European and American cuisine. One of the most impressive things about the resort were the immense displays of stunning roses in all public areas. Most stunning use of flowers I've ever seen.

This resort has almost anything you could ask for. While there is not necessarily a lot to do without leaving the grounds this was the point of our visit. The service was impeccable. Not only professionally but there was a real personal touch with many. We were ridden with flu during our stay and on more than one occasion we were brought lemon tea with ginger and honey without even asking for it. There is a tranquility pool (i.e. no kids allowed!) and an outdoor resto just next to it. The Spa is top even down to my masseuse handpicking herbs from the garden and making me herbal tea.    While there was little or nothing to complain about (the worst perhaps being an over-attentive waiter) there were a few things I thought could be improved upon. The food was "good" but not gourmandise quality the exception being the local buffet and Moroccan bbq (don't let the buffet scare you it was only for the local delicacies of which there must have been nearly 100 to choose from). This was outstanding. Maybe the one other thing I found lacking was the shampoo situation. While there was L'Occitane soap in the bathroom the shower had clay bottle of another product which was too thick would not easily wash out and smelled like it had seen better days. A little consistency with the L'Occitane would have been a nice touch. Still not a big deal I usually bring my own anyway (usually...)    The room was spacious and very comfortable with cozy terraces. Noise level was minimal with the exception of the rooftop lounge our first night equipped with a dj who seemed to think he was dj-ing a club. The music was so loud one evening we could not hear ourselves talk. When we got back to the room I could still hear the whump of his bass in my room. But this was only one night. Other than this there was virtually no noise heard while relaxing in the room.    We sat on occasion in the lounge in the main building and were brought mint tea often never lacking a full glass as much as we wanted. Much of the staff remembered our names even without asking for the room number.    As for the getting into the Medina a shuttle is offered from 18h to 22h free of charge but getting back is on you. It's only 10 minutes by car and if you wish to go during the day you'll need to arrange a taxi (50 to 80 MAD).
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Tânia Santos Silva wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: If you love the Arabian feeling mood and senses this is the place to stay in Marrakesh! For me the best resort/hotel in Marrakesh! All the others.. Uff! I was staying at another hotel that the travel agency choose but it was horrible.. On the same day of my check in I took a taxi to Four Seasons explained my situation and the immediately solved it! So I just had to sleep a day in the horrible hotel..  Again Four Seasons knows how to adapt to cultures and environments... Best Hotel in Marrakesh!

Review_Title: An awesome way to visit Marrakesh.
Review_Text: We arrived at our hotel and were immediately upgraded to a luxury suite. The service is magnificent attention to detail; private car and Chauffeur service at your request. The manager Jihane is an absolute gem she made sure our stay was amazing. The staff is friendly and attentive. That is why we always choose The Four Seasons.

Review_Title: This is a must stay hotel .Service
Review_Text: From the moment you arrive to the moment you leave you will be looked after.This place is a class property .Restaurants are lovely .. food excellent ... service superb.The courtyard rooms are amazing pay the money and upgrade.

Review_Date: Catalin Mogoseanu wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: This Hotel & Resort is very nice; there where fresh roses everywhere the rooms are very big and very nice very well kept bathroom is very big; the breakfast room when I entered I felt I had died and reached heaven. The pool area is very big and very quiet very nice green marble; it is a green lush area lots of water pools staf is very very friendly it is close to the airport. I DEFINITELY RECOMMEND IT! Excellent WiFi. I would say it is in the Top 5 hotels in Marrakech!

My wife and i visited for two nights for my birthday. We stayed in a 3rd floor deluxe suite overlooking the adults pool.    The ride from the airport took ten minutes. We took a regular taxi from outside the terminal. It cost 150 MAD. I didn't haggle with the guy.    The welcome & check-in is exceptional. First impressions of the resort were of a chic property with great confidence and personality. There was a small bird flying around in the reception area. Perfectly in keeping with the Moroccan charm of the part open plan reception.    The room was stunning more like an opulently appointed apartment with two bathrooms a dressing room and a huge terrace with dining table and loungers. I have rarely encountered a better standard of amenities and quality of room furnishing. It looked and felt brand new. The only let down was the air conditioner in the bedroom which made a noise but provided no air of any kind let alone conditioning. I expect that was an exception that has now been fixed.    The grounds of this resort are slightly mesmerising. The pools area are the best of any boutique hotel in the world and the calm nature of the adults only pool was incredibly relaxing. The pool is simply huge. And empty. The lounge service around the pool was really good very friendly and every couple of hours we were offered complimentary cold fruit drink or a stick of pineapple. They have an excellent pool service manager.    The (very) seperate kids pool and facilities looked frankly amongst the best I have EVER seen and we will be coming back here with our kids.    At night the resort lights up with fire cauldrons and candles everywhere. It is incredibly evocative and romantic.    As we visited in February the restaurant and roof-top bar was rather quiet but we spent our time on the balcony or visited the Medina which is five minutes away.    The gym room is superbly equipped with the latest Techogym products and is probably the best small hotel gym I have ever worked out in.    The restaurant breakfast buffet is pretty good but the service was a little sloppy on the first morning we visited. I think they were lacking a restaurant manager that morning. Still the food was great.    Although I had not announced my birthday to the hotel we arrived back to our room to find a bottle of bubbly and a really nice birthday cake. This was totally unexpected and a real delight. The guy checking us in (whose name I have sadly forgotten :-( noticed my birthday from the passport date. What a credit to hotel you are!    I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel with a 9/10 rating for both couples and families.  I have read a couple of the "terrible" reviews and frankly these are just stupid and should be completely ignored.    Will be going back ASAP and Marrakesh is a joy.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Lovely hotel, fabulous service but lacks good family friendly food for younger children.
Review_Text: Stunning hotel with excellent service however food and bar is excruciatingly expensive which is I guess what is to be expected from a hotel of this calibre. Food choices for children were limited to a small menu that is used across the hotel restaurants and consists of the standard you see in most hotels i.e. nuggets fish fingers burgers pizza and pasta. Buffet restaurant was nice but hugely overpriced and little variety. This could have been the time of year we visited however. Pools were fabulous great kids club and kids swimming pool the staff in the kids club went out of their way to be welcoming and our son enjoyed a great evening at an organised party. Service around the pool area was sporadic but again could have been the time of year. While we were there the jacuzzi pool was working intermittently but was lovely when it was working. The room was clean and nicely furnished with lots of space - we stayed in a deluxe superior. All in all a lovely holiday apart from the appalling charges for food and drink and the lack of variety for children.

Review_Title: A splendid way to enjoy Marrakech: In Two Words: FIRST CLASS
Review_Text: My family and I (wife nine-year-old son) had never been to Morocco before and were very excited to visit the city of Marrakech. We compared several hotels resorts and riads before deciding to stay at the Four Seasons Resort.    It turned out to be just the right choice.    The staff from the people who greeted us upon arriving (they learnt ahead of time the names of my wife and son and greeted each of us which surprised and thrilled my son who felt very important indeed) the ladies and gentlemen serving us at breakfast the staff in the halls the concierge up to the property manager himself were really first-class professionals. Friendly helpful approachable. The interactions with the staff were no doubt worthy of five-star service.    The property if not a true and "authentic" riad is beautful. Multiple restaurants bars and terraces allow for views to remember. The room we chose was comfortable as one would expect from Four Seasons and the bath was luxurious.    My wife partook of the "hammam" and massage experience; it was one of the highlights for her. Highly recommended.    Because we had never been to Marrakech before we used the concierge to book a couple of day trips for us. The first was a full-day tour of the medina including the souks (markets) the grounds of the Koutoubia mosque the Madrassa Ben Youssef and the Bahia Palace. Other friends had warned us about the aggressive selling techniques in the markets but with our personal guide (Aziz) not a single person hassled us in any way. Aziz navigated the warren of passageways (we would surely have gotten lost) and had stories and comments at every turn. He was obviously very proud of his country and culture as he pointed out tiny details about each place. Aziz was very friendly and helpful and patient to take dozens of pictures without even having to be asked. The 550 MAD (about 55 euros) was an unbelievable value. ASK FOR AZIZ if you book!    The second trip we booked was to the Atlas mountains to visit a berber village hike to the waterfall and see the sights. The hotel booked a driver who was not nearly as experienced as Aziz which was a disappointment. We were hoping for the same level of service as provided by Aziz which was perhaps too much to ask. My wife complained to the concierge who was incredibly kind and helpful. The Four Seasons refunded half of the fee for the booking and arranged a free transfer to the airport for our departure as a gesture. This was in my opinion MORE than fair and in fact quite a generous offer. When we checked out the manager himself came personally to apologise for something that frankly was not the fault of the hotel.    As I saw it this was testimony to what excellent customer-oriented service is defined by. Like everything else in our stay it was absolutely first-class.    For the actual visit to the mountain we hired a guide for 300 MAD (about 30 euros) who led us for two hours to a couple of waterfalls. Again more than worth the price as he pointed out the various aspects of the mountains the customs of the locals and what to look out for. At a couple of the more slippery spots he helped carry our son across and up/down. Very friendly very helpful.    The trip to the Atlas mountains is something I would also highly recommend; just bring good comfortable shoes. It was the highlight of the trip for our son.    Finally the concierge recommended a couple of restaurants and they did not disappoint. Once again first-class service.    In summary we were nothng short of impressed by the Four Seasons. We expected luxury and they delivered. Plus.    We would go back in a second and recommend without hesitiation

Review_Date: janet s wrote a review Mar 2015
Review_Text: We have stayed here before when first opened. It is still beautifully.    The staff are amazing so helpful polite. My birthday is Valentines day and I received a cake and sparkling wine. My husband said don't touch as sent to wrong room. However it was for me. Yeah!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Andy T wrote a review Feb 2015
Review_Title: Wonderful haven on the outskirts of Marrakech
Review_Text: This is a lovely hotel with excellent facilities (e.g. the spa the pools the range of restaurants) and very friendly and helpful staff. We stayed for a long weekend in February weather was broadly ok but the hotel really comes into its own on warm days. One thing to be aware of is that everything is expensive - hotel meals drinks hotel-arranged transport/tours etc.. so check the prices carefully.    it is a 5 minute taxi ride to the Medina the traditional centre of Marrakech - all hustle and narrow streets buzzing with trade and tourism.

Review_Date: Tiago V wrote a review Feb 2015
Review_Text: One of the best hotels we have ever stayed. Our room was huge and comfortable. Beautiful gardens and pools. The Italian restaurant is great. Just 5 minutes from the airport and the city center. The hotel service was perfect.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Eric G wrote a review Feb 2015
Review_Title: Waited 15 minutes to order a cup of coffee
Review_Text: Waited 15 minutes to order a cup of coffee before we left. I´ld choose La mamounia ten times over four seasons in Marrakech. The interior and design feels a bit old and the service isnt as good at La Mamounia.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Spectacular resort to look at with up and down service .....
Review_Text: We decided on the Four Seasons Marrakech as we wanted to take a weekend away from London in the sun and wanted to stay in resort where if we didn’t want to leave we didn’t have to. This resort is spectacular to look at. The gardens pools lobby restaurants bars and rooms are all beautifully done. I would actually go as far as to say breath taking!    Unfortunately the service here we found was very hit and miss. An example of this was on our first night we asked the hotel to reserve us a table at La Salama restaurant in the Medina. The concierge was fantastic! She made the reservation and took the liberty of arranging the restaurant’s courtesy car to pick us up and take us to the restaurant as she was afraid we might get lost finding it in the Medina! I thought this service was first class and to be honest it’s one of the reasons you stay in a Four Season’s resort!    The service around the pool however was very erratic. The first and second day it was very hard to even get service and if you asked for water it seemed that they only wanted to sell you a whole bottle rather than get you a glass of chilled water which is usually complimentary in any other 5 star resorts I have stayed in! On the last day it was completely different frozen snacks were continually served as well as chilled water offered – we thought it was really strange that service in a place like this would change completely from one day to the next! I also had a situation where we had checked out of the hotel on the last day and were sitting in the lobby area waiting for our car to take us to the airport and I asked for a glass of water because it was quite a warm day – I couldn’t believe that even then they didn’t want to just get me a glass of chilled water the attendant almost insisted I purchase a bottle of water! To be honest I felt a bit annoyed by this as from my point of view if you are staying in a 5 star hotel and paying 5 star rates you should be able to ask for a glass of water if you are thirsty and not be made to feel as though you need to buy a bottle. This in my opinion is “nickel and diming” which Four Seasons say they are against doing to their guests.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: David S wrote a review Feb 2015
Review_Text: I travel a lot for work and I'm spoiled and jaded. I never write reviews with one or two exceptions. So this is by definition exceptional.    We were offered hot towels and mint tea as we arrived bags taken care of. Throughout our stay we were addressed by name - and given it's a big hotel and was quite full I found that extraordinary.    The room was incredible for a family of four and I bet the villas are even more spectacular. It places family right at the heart of the what the hotel does unlike so many places where kids are to be neither seen nor heard. And yet if you want to avoid that you can enjoy all the usual 5* facilities also at the hotel's centre.    The hotel has 4 restaurants each with its own personality and cuisine but all great. It's not cheap but this is Marrakech and there are tons of places to choose from on your doorstep. Tip: order a big breakfast for one in your room and it's enough for four.    The staff are incredible. Attentive is expected but this is another level. One of our sons had a couple of nosebleeds; each time in a public area. No problem no fuss and only great care and a genuine concern that all was well.    I could go on for ages but best I stop. We're coming up with a plan to return because once you've experienced it you'll want another one to look forward to. Everyone else we met there were returning guests.    This place is a one-off and its staff a credit to the business.

We've had the privilege of staying at many Four Seasons properties across the globe and I still maintain that the properties outside of the US are the best. The FS Marrakech is architecturally breathtaking. A great mix of rooms villas and all combining local architecture design and materials. We had a Grand Pavilion Suite that came with it's heated plunge pool and had a garden area that also had a fireplace and an external dining area.The resort is also quite compact and walking from restaurant to the gym to the room isn't a workout in of itself. The adult pool is very quiet and relaxing. BTW the gym is great with a range of machines and weight machines too. The staff bring a special warmth to the your stay and they all try to go the extra mile to make your stay memorable. The Concierge service is quite well staffed and can help plan your day or week at a pace you like. The restaurants on site are excellent -- the Italian restaurant was a good choice and of course the Moroccan restaurant was an interesting experience with live music belly dancers and a henna station. Jamal Al Fnaa which is the square from where the souks radiate is a 10 min drive at best or a 30 minute walk. It's 15 minutes to the airport. All in all very accessible and my first choice in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: We had an excellent long weekend (4-nights for the price of 3) stay. The resort was an oasis of calm and relaxation.
Review_Text: We (my wife and I) had a wonderful relaxing stay. It is a very romantic resort. A short taxi ride (50 dirhams the normal fare) to anywhere in the Medina. Yes you could stay in a Riad and walk but it is a wonderful experience to stay at the Four Seasons. In the same luxury category as the Royal Mansour and La Mamounia (both of which we visited during our stay) the Four Seasons is more relaxed and far less expensive than either of the others. We would recommend dining in restaurants in the Medina and staying at the Four Seasons. Moroccan white wine is wonderful by the way - do be sure to try it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Pandora G wrote a review Feb 2015
Review_Text: We stayed for a week and was very impressed with the hotel in many ways. Service was faultless the lobby had a warm and welcoming fee. The suite was classic and beautiful. I loved the huge stunning bathroom.    Breakfast was amazing as was the service. The concierge staff was knowledgeable and very helpful. The pool staff very attentive but not intrusive.    Overall it was a great hotel and one that I would highly recommend.

Review_Title: was delighted to discover the four season marrakech
Review_Text: very beautiful layout four seasons chain style..big space with green sceneries tasty food and trendy bars.. the pool is amazing as you can choose the family pool which is animated by children or another pool for more serenity and calm if you wish the company of your book or a chat with a partner  the staff are welcoming and joyful the best concierge of marrakech is the lady jihane there who can happily recommend places and give you the best tips of how to spend a magnificent holiday all with a very big smile.  very clean close enough to the center of marrakech and very stylish.

Excellence in every respect the room the food the service and the ambience! Very relaxing hotel where the staff were totally helpful. Great pool area and a gym available if you feel the need for exercise!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Dianne K wrote a review Feb 2015
Review_Text: Our son will be leaving school this year and we were aware that this might be our last holiday with him. Well what a way to go! The hotel is absolutely fantastic facilities are amazing and the food is universally great. Our half term seemed to be a week early this year so there were very few other teenagers but at normal holiday times the resort has the best facilities for teenagers that we have ever seen: banks of computers pool table table football basket ball hoop - lots of games and…..a cinema! However as it happens our son didn't miss young company at all because there is simply so much to see and do in Marrakech. We went out most days and could not have asked for a better hotel to return to.The service was simply outstanding nothing was ever any trouble and every member of staff genuinely seemed to care about us having a wonderful time. With their kindness they helped make this an exceptionally happy family holiday and one that we will always remember. We cannot recommend this hotel more warmly.

Review_Date: Kasia J wrote a review Feb 2015
Review_Text: Great breakfast- a lot of fruits :) rooms are amazing- comfortable a lot of space clean  Fresh and luxury. Very friendly fir a children - they gave us a Toy camel pampers Body oil and milk for the baby any many other baby cosmetics. Everything was there. Staff is fantastic: kind helpful- perfect. Hotel is modern luxury and fantastic - very private. I will be back for sure!

Review_Title: A wonderful place to feel well
Review_Text: It is an amazing resort with huge comfortable rooms with balcony. Excellent service and high quality food made my stay great. Not to forget the Christmas sweets that were mainly there for children ;) The gardens were relaxing (a pity that it was too cold to swim in the pools).

I stayed here with my fiancee for five nights at the start of February and it was a dream trip. From the moment we walked through the door we were treated like royalty. The staff were incredible and couldn't do enough for us but not in an overbearing way.    We got an upgrade and our room was lovely and spacious. There was a real Moroccan feel everywhere and it smelt like incense! Pool area was lovely and spacious but we couldn't make much use of it as it was quite chilly the week we were there. The spa was good as were the gym facilities.    The restaurants were good but one thing we would say is that the meals were very expensive but probably to be expected in a Four Seasons. We ate out in Marrakech 3 of the 5 nights and the staff can organise bookings and also a courtesy car if available. We were provided with a list of restaurants and all 3 we picked were good.    Overall a really lovely peaceful luxurious stay and even though we have now done most of the sites in Marrakech we would love to  return simply to enjoy the hotel especially in the better weather.    If you want to stay in the middle of the hustle and bustle of Marrakech stay in a riad in the Medina but if you want a more relaxing time stay here!

Review_Date: Likes to travel wrote a review Feb 2015
Review_Title: one of the nicest hotel/resorts in Marrakech
Review_Text: Everything was outstanding during our recent stay. The building and grounds are of the highest quality and well maintained and attention is given to every detail in the rooms and throughout the property. All the staff were very friendly and extremely helpful. The location is near the Medina and the main square but not actually within walking distance. The grounds and pools are outstanding but we were there in February and could not enjoy it all. The buffet breakfast was also great with additional specials every day. In addition although pricey the bar/lounge on the first floor is very nice.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: catherine l wrote a review Feb 2015
Review_Text: We have stayed in a few Four Season hotels and always have the most amazing stay. The most amazing hotel in Marrakech. Staff were so friendly and attentive. Beautiful hotel and spa. Cannot wait to go back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Stayed in the Four Seasons for my sisters 21st birthday and I've never experienced anything like it - the staff were unbelievable attentive and knew what they were doing. They noticed from my sisters passport that she would be turning 21 during our stay so when we were at the pool they bought up a complimentary bottle of champagne and a cake iced with her name. We couldn't believe how wonderful and thoughtful the staff were. The hotel itself was beautiful - always pristine and beautifully lit up with candles at night time. Our room was always tidied and it was so peaceful and quiet - we never heard anything. The pool was to die for and pool staff were always on hand to move the heavy umbrellas when the sun changed! Meals are a bit pricey - we ended up paying nearly £80 for breakfast for 3 so I'd definitely recommend travelling into Marrakech to experience the local (and much much cheaper) cuisine. The hotel offer a free car to take you into the centre in the evenings and we had wonderful conversations with the friendly young driver. In the morning and afternoons the staff will phone a taxi for you and give you bottles of water whilst you wait. The taxis only cost about 50 dirhams max - don't pay anymore as they will drive you for this cheap (equivalent to around £5) so the Four Seasons is a perfect hotel on the outskirts of the centre. Honestly this is the best hotel I've ever stayed in it felt like I was in another world and I never wanted to leave - I will most definitely be staying in more Four Seasons wherever I go. Recommend highly.

Iwas there for 6 days with my doughtier and sister I've been to many places but this hotel is in my top 3! The service was outstanding the room (we got upgraded) was perfect. the breakfast which is very important to me was also top notch! the people loved my kid en she had a great time supplied with all the nessecery needs. the pool warmed an good to use in winter time.    Thanks a lot Four Seasons!

Review_Date: Lorne B wrote a review Jan 2015
Review_Text: This was our second stay in consecutive years at a four seasons property. We stayed at the Four Seasons in Nevis in May 2012 and stayed here May 2013. Last year was the nicest resort I have ever seen but this is certainly 1A. This resort I felt was a lot larger and you could literally spend the day walking around and still not see everything. The pool in the middle of the resort is about the nicest I have ever seen. I woke up one morning early and wanted to go to the gym but it was closed. I contacted the front desk and on my way over to the gym someone picked my up in a golf cart drove me to the gym and provided me with a bottle of water a hot towel and a box of fresh dates. That is the one thing that I miss the most the inordinate amount of fresh dates available at different areas throughout the property. They taste like liquid honey of deliciousness. The foods delicious and the staff was very friendly and accommodating. The rooms were ridiculous and each room had its own private balcony (even those on the first floor). I loved this resort. Thank you!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jared S wrote a review Jan 2015
Review_Text: My stay at the Four Seasons Marrakech was a fantastic experience from the moment I arrived. We were greeted by the concierge who offered tea and snacks while we checked in from the couch. He then escorted us to the room giving us a tour of the property on the way. The room was beautiful. Comfortable beds large space beautiful bathroom. Everything a 5 star hotel should be and more. The hotel restaurants (3 total) were exceptional as well. I highly recommend the Moroccan restaurant for breakfast and dinner.    The staff went above and beyond to make absolutely sure our stay was perfect. They did everything from helping with reservations outside the hotel planning day trips into the mountains by private driver and even helped me locate an item of luggage that was lost by the airline. Spa was great too - dont miss it.    Great experience. 10/10.

Review_Date: Ramses M wrote a review Jan 2015
Review_Title: In a class of it's own.
Review_Text: We initially stayed at another hotel close to La Médina since it was the preferred place by the team but during the second night we decided to switch places. Luckily for us we ended up at the Four Seasons.    Beautiful facilities (Gym heated pools game room spa and much more!!)    Absolutely AMAZING staff all around. From the valet staff all the way to the management all I got to say is great things about all. Truly made me feel at home always on top of things making sure the stay is great and looking for ways to make your experience Top Notch!    Special thanks to Mr. Amine Boulhi who REALLY went out of his way and way beyond his duties and responsibilities to accommodate me and of course Mr. André Buldini who stayed in touch all throughout making sure we we well taken care of. To the rest of the staff also my best complements on their superb service!!!    If you are ever in Marakech Four Seasons is the way to go!

Four Seasons is mind blowing full stop. After our first Four Seasons experience in the Seychelles we thought the second would be a tough act to follow. We were wrong. The hotel was lovely and clean had everything you could ever want and was a short (but good distance) from the madness of the Medina. But my goodness the concierge where do they find these people?? They are amazing!! This is why the Four Seasons are the best.    HOT WATER BOTTLE: other than being generally excellent kind and helpful and always knowing your name the concierge pulled out all the stops to help with my back pain. Calling the concierge and asking if they had a hot water bottle late on a Sunday evening there was some delay and some complimentary 'feel better soon' tea delivered to the room. Some time after this a hot water bottle arrived the concierge had especially sent someone out to buy one somewhere across Marrakech late on a Sunday night it arrived... free of charge. I love these people!!    ART: We also fell in love with some art on the walls here after asking the team at the Four Seasons Jinan on reception personally researched and then Whats app'd the artist on her phone for us. She delivered information on the artist printed to our room and arranged for us to have a personal viewing of the artists work on a Sunday.    These people are just incredible!! :) JINAN you are worth your weight in gold thank-you!  Definitely stay here. We loved it! :)
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: If you've never traveled outside the country and are looking for a taste of your local Hyatt then this place is for you. This hotel has the Pottery Barn look that could be anywhere. We had a first floor room stuck between the restaurant and the kids play room and given that it was the holiday our hallway was a children's highway. We asked for a different room and they couldn't accommodate us. Our only choice was to pay $250 more a night for a suite on a higher floor. The room was nice but given the price it was missing the niceties that one expects from a Four Seasons Suite. The only bright spot was the buffet breakfast. So good it's almost worth the $35/per person.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Helen C wrote a review Jan 2015
Review_Text: Excellent facilities and standards. Very friendly staff. Totally luxurious haven - with great gardens and pool that was heated in January to make it feel like you were stepping into a bath. We took our 6 year old and 2 year old and they were entertained throughout - the hotel has a great games room with high quality video games pool cinema table football basketball table tennis. Highly recommended. It is expensive - and the dining in the hotel is very pricey but this is the only thing I can fault.

I had an inspiring experience in this beautiful hotel....once you walk in you feel this comfort and welcoming atmosphere...so classy cosy and exciting place to be. An entertaining lobby with lovely cheerful staff morrocon tea and treats served all day. Lovely seasonal set ups from gingerbread house to Christmas trees...the food was exquisite.  Especially the breakfast buffet.  I would love to oh back again.

Review_Date: Houda O wrote a review Jan 2015
Review_Text: I stayed 2 days in this resort for business. The rooms are very comfortable with a neutral beige and white palette. The bedding is very comfortable and many details refer to Moroccan craftsmanship. I could tell for example going in the adult club that the tables are massive wood and the lanterns are not a cheap brass.  The resort is very large and there are plenty of activities to do so you do not get bored and it caters to different styles from yoga lovers to joggers or SPA enthusiasts.  Yet it's not a big crowded compound the way the pavilions are set is in such a way that you always have the option of having some "me" time when you want more serenity and privacy.  I loved the liveliness of the place for example there are cages with exotic birds chirping all day fresh cut flowers in a glass composition at the entryway.  The one touch I mostly appreciated was that you can have tea and nuts at pretty much any moment of the day.  The food is delicately prepared and the menus cater to all tastes from italian to french to authentic moroccan gastronomy (and special-diet food also).  This is a great place to visit all year but it's most charming in spring when it is not too hot.  Also the place has a new charm at night when candles are lit everywhere and the light escapes the handmade lanterns.  Highly recommend this place.

Myself and my 2 adult children enjoyed Christmas at the Four Seasons Hotel in Marrakech. We were all seeking some peace and quiet and of course a little luxury after a hectic few months with London life. I would like to comment individually on the different areas of the hotel.    Reception and welcome    The staff are quite delightful and very welcoming and check in is very quick and easy. It's always nice to be offered a welcome drink after a tiring journey.    Gingerbread house    A gingerbread house was constructed at the reception area for Christmas I thought it was a wonderful idea containing different varieties of sweets chocolates and biscuits. It was absolutely divine and I visited each day. The small children and large (including my own) were mesmerised by it quite frankly I couldn't pass by without going inside for a little treat.    Room/accommodation    We had a standard room however it was spacious enough for the 3 of us. I liked the separate closet area and the spacious balcony. The bath was hugely deep although I didn't have the opportunity to try it. Having said this I would like to try a different room next time. The housekeeping team did a wonderful job each day and I hope that they received the envelope I left for them upon departure.    Breakfast    Only my son made it down for a full breakfast and reported that it was superb lots of choice and all delicious.    My daughter and myself are light eaters at breakfast and just ordered room service instead. The portions were very disappointing though I would actually make an effort to go down to the wondrous buffet as described by my son next time. However this was a minor thing for us as lunch and dinner are more of a focus for us.    The Grounds    The grounds are immaculately tendered and it's a real pleasure walking around the resort. Very small touches such as if you are walking along and a buggy is coming your way they will stop and wait for you to pass. This is a small thing but all these small touches make a real difference and are noted by travellers like myself.    Adult pool    As a regular swimmer at home it is pretty essential that wherever I travel for a relaxing holiday has a pool large enough so that I can swim freely. This was absolutely superb. I swam for 30-40 minutes each day undisturbed by anyone as the pool is so huge. I absolutely loved the beautiful colours of the pool. At this time of the year you need to time your swims when the sun appears as it can get a little cold however this did not deter me one bit. The separate pools for adults and children are a brilliant feature.    The lovely gentleman who tended the beds and towels did a fabulous job and was very efficient with provision of the towels. It was a nice touch to have sun tan lotion and hats if needed.    Pool bar restaurant    We dined here on a number of occasions. The meat and fish was very tasty and I thought that the cuisine was of a good standard. The staff are very attentive and respectful. It was a little chilly at times for me though and I would prefer to visit when it's slightly warmer next time.    The gym    All 3 of us really appreciated this facility. The machinery is brand spanking new and there is an excellent variety. I do think it's a good idea to have the cardio and weights rooms separate and never would have thought of this myself but I liked it very much. The staff are courteous and not intrusive but are on hand to assist if necessary. We didn't use the shower facilities there but all looked in good order. I think that the addition of some power drinks or juices of some kind would be welcome particularly to replenish a little after a hard work out although the nuts and dried fruits were welcome. It can be a good hour or so before you eat if you are going to make use of the steam and jacuzzi in the spa following a work out therefore one could really benefit from an extra little boost just to keep you going. You have these juices in many of your other Four Seasons properties. Perhaps something to consider going forward. All in all an excellent facility.    Spa facility    Myself and my daughter used this daily apart from our last day at the resort. The jacuzzi and steam room are delightful and it's nice to have the usual loungers to relax on following a good workout steam jacuzzi then shower. I wished that there had been a better choice of tea as it was the same each day. The hairdryers in the changing room are very weak I would take my own next time. The spa facility is more than adequate although I did have an issue with male therapists and cleaners entering at times. This is something I raised with management but I have still not had this addressed. I was offered a meeting that evening but had to decline as we had a dinner reservation then no-one followed up which was disappointing. It has sort of slipped through the loop.    Morroccan buffet    We feasted on the Morroccan buffet twice. It was absolutely divine and the best cous cous we have ever tasted. I don't often have 3 courses but I certainly made every effort on these occasions to try as much as I could. The different salads were so fresh and tasty the tagines were delicious. I would say that this is the best value restaurant if cost is a consideration. Wine is rather expensive though and thankfully I am not a big drinker. The restaurant staff could not have been more helpful they are sublimely supreme when it comes to providing service and we even had live music on our last evening.    Christmas drinks by invitation of Felix Murillo    We were very kindly invited to the Christmas market for Christmas drinks one evening by the General Manager Felix Murillo. Incidentally I do not believe he was there but his staff made up for his absence as they all go out of their way to provide amazing service. It was a lovely atmosphere they had set up various little games on different stalls. I quite enjoyed taking part although was a little surprised at my (adult) children's reluctance. I guess when you pass the age of forty you are more game to have a go at anything. Anyway it was a very pleasant hour spent drinking Champagne playing games and chatting to the ever sociable staff.    Bleu D'Orange (I think). The Italian one    Beautiful relaxing atmosphere with low lighting. Menu was very expensive we felt but even so this was a holiday and I don't mind splashing out when I am on holiday. We were looking forward to some delightful cuisine. We were rather disappointed sadly the portions were very small and the food was mediocre. A couple were placed next to us with a toddler and a baby at 7.30 pm in the evening. We thought that this was more of an adult type of exclusive restaurant with exclusive prices and did not expect to have this company at a table next to us at this time of the evening. We would not have minded at the Morroccan buffet but to have banging and crying in such a beautiful setting with low lighting just reminded me of bed time when my children were young and I certainly didn't come here for this type of ambience. We ate up as quickly as we could and left feeling ripped off and dissatisfied. Incidentally we were offered complementary drinks for good reason. Once again the staff were superb.    Lobby lounge    Not sure what is going on here. It's very hit and miss. Once you get someone's attention you are fine but in between the staff can get a little lost. I.e. You can't find them. I dined here on my last day whilst my children went for a last minute visit to the souk. I had a bad experience which was resolved by the manager and I am sure lessons will be learned going forward.    I believe it's essential to give honest feedback otherwise how can an establishment improve and move forward. In summation the Four Seasons Marrakech is a wonderful resort and I will most definitely return. The brief for my visit was to enjoy a well earned break with my family in order for us all to slow down a little and spend some quality together over Christmas. The hotel delivered we all left feeling totally relaxed and rejuvenated with smiles on our faces and with some lasting memories of our visit. I was under budget for my stay so all in all is was good value for us as a family. The staff make this place alongside with superb facilities. There may be some small areas for improvement but overall you will not be disappointed in my opinion if you plan a visit here.    Thank you for a wonderful relaxing break.

Review_Date: Laura S wrote a review Jan 2015
Review_Title: Perfect! may be too far from everything.
Review_Text: everything was perfect. Luxury hotel very professional personnel good breakfast confortable room.  But I wander why we had to pay for wifi It is free almost everywhere today incredible! Location: too far from everything.

Review_Date: Jolyn M wrote a review Jan 2015
Review_Text: this hotel was amazing...i wish i was still there! that says it all! i stayed with my daughter son in law and grandson for 3 nights and could have done another week easily....it's a beautiful resort...the city of marrakech is fantastic. i just loved going to the medina and the souks...the hotel upgraded me to a fantastic villa...it was huge! a house! living room dining room massive bedroom bathroom and fantastic patio with a plunge pool...my daughter and her husband were in a suite which was really nice also....it was an amazing experience...we also did the hamman at the spa which an experience i'll never forget!

Review_Date: Zainab K wrote a review Jan 2015
Review_Title: Exquisite resort with beautiful gardens and service!
Review_Text: We were welcomed during our stay at this amazing resort in beautiful Marrakech! The spa it's restaurants amazing hospitality and location makes it truly worth a visit!    Mr Charles Lasvigne director of food and beverage was kind enough to ask one breakfast if he could adjust the intensity of the sun! An excellent joke that brought smiles albeit impossible. We believe this resort holds itself up to the promise to satisfy and excel!    Be prepared for thousands of sweet smelling flowers everywhere...

Review_Date: Julia S wrote a review Jan 2015
Review_Text: I had the opportunity in December to have a business meeting here. Room quality is at the Four Seasons standard level- without any complain! Sleeping was great! We could not enjoy the pool as it was cold.  Breakfast food was great when I could find the reastaurant. All together is a bit difficult to find places in the hotel. The map they provide you at the reception is not clear enough. I was always lost searching for restaurant for meeting rooms for my room....  One evening we had Italian food - really top quality. For lunch usually Maroccan food. .. did not impress me at all.

This is a beautiful hotel. We stayed here for 2 nights as part of a luxury tour. The service is impeccable. The rooms were generous and comfortable. The staff goes out of their way to please. We were relaxing at the pool when a staff member came by to clean our sunglasses. Now that's service! The pool lunch was pleasing not Moroccan cuisine. The buffet dinner was enormous with many different cultures displayed. Four Seasons lives up to its reputation.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Not your typical Four Seasons experience-Easter 2014
Review_Text: After I initially posted on travel advisor last April I pulled the negative comments as the manager called me and arranged to shorten my visit by one day. In addition was offered 2 free nights in 2015 (not likely to use ). He apologized for my poor experience and attributed to the Holiday rush. After the apologyI pulled my initial comments before I left Morocco.    On vacation in Tokyo now 8 months later. As I was discussing Marrakech with a friend when I told him avoid the 4 seasons absolutely … not four seasons quality service and noisy rooms. So reposting    Bottom line: Simply bad information/coordination among different areas of hotel. Not prepared for holiday rush like 4 seasons in other locations .. absolutely the worst service I have ever had at a four seasons ( but let's be real bad for 4 seasons is still a high quality problem)    +Lacks proper concierge and front desk communication and follow up for a 5 star.  +Poor pool maintenance ( heating not functionally properly ...dirty water and soiled towels)  +Restaurants not available for booking but somehow empty when dining  + VIP airport arrival service confusing and rushed.. not worth it    4 seasons at following cities are where I have stayed  >>>>Prague  >>>Bombay  >>>Washington  >>>New York  >>London  >>>Hawaii  >>>Milan  >>Paris    Anything good... yes the following    >>> food quality and friendly restaurant staff    >>> rooms were clean and well appointed    The note I sent to my travel agent during the stay    Roger    Hotel is pretty but too much work. I definitely would tell friends and guests to avoid    >>>> Poor coordination with reception/concierge/bell desk    I had booked a tour guide for tuesday am at 10 for the city thru the concierge... I called at 9;45 asked the concierge where we should wait... she said lobby.  we waited in the lobby from 10 til 10:30 no guide.. so went to concierge again  she went outside and tracked down guide....    >>>> Trying to book dinner… restaurants full but tables empty    Yesterday we were told restauratnts were fully booked... so ate in 1/2 empty morrocan restaurant. We made reservation at Italian tonight at 7 again 1/2 empty when we left at 9:30    >>> then when I tried to prepone my departure cancelling with 1 night at tail end they never got back to Sam ( my travel agent )until I went personally to reception who then called him  I offered that I would vacate room in am on thursday…    Very very very poor english skills for a four seasons....    >>>pool… dirty and not heated .. family destination !    I called ahead since we were coming from london to check if the pool was heated. It was not heated when we got there…Pool heat was was not working properly on a Holiday week.  lots of kids shivering....!!! I went in the cold pool…ok but very cold... pool was also filthy ( spoons moss on bottom of pool and trash ) not four seasons pool pool    >>> vip arrival services arranged by airport not worth charge and not efficient VIP services .my fault for not checking number of pieces but horrible communication to resolve problems  + My hand baggage ( wheelie ) was left behind at Airport. I discovered this at hotel. VIP rep did not ask or check how many pieces. then rushed thru baggage claims and car with as dialogue Driver never asked how many pieces and the bags were transfer  1 checked bag was late so the vip rep hunted down the bag. I had placed my wheelie next to his trolley. He had taken Eiko's wheelie. Yes I should have also checked that he had gathered all the bags but assumed. He had everything under control.  Soon we met driver who also did not ask about how many pieces... I understand it is my responsibility but every driver or porter I have had asks how many bags and checks...    + when i discovered the bag was missing. I spoke to 3 different people asking them to call the driver and VIP services rep.. No one could get thru. The reception clerk who checked into room said he would follow up. The concierge called told me to go the airport at 7;30 with my passport and identify what is in bag. I asked specfically if they found my bag she said I do not know. I said ok I will go to airport at 7:30 what time should I leave. She said I will arrange for a club car to pick u up at 7:15 waited til 7:45 in front of my room then walked to concierge area I played client volleyball and "i do not know anything" with 3 people. then the clerk who had ustaken room suggested I go the airport. i asked where to go he said information booth...  I took a taxi there no one was at info booth. the taxi driver helped me get into baggage area.. there at the lost baggage area a smiling VIp rep. i thnked him. i asked him where he found it he said it was found near baggage carosuel. I said we tried calling you.  He said yes I told the concierge that we had the bag.!!! 2 hours of agony could have been saved

Review_Date: Michael D wrote a review Dec 2014
Review_Title: Fully lives up to Four Seasons' reputation for legendary service
Review_Text: The hotel itself is beautiful and pristine. Our room was extremely comfortable - large room overall huge bathroom great bed and fantastic terrace. The location was good in a quiet area but still close enough to the Medina and all the action.    Loved the service. Extremely professional staff and very well trained - they make everyone feel like a VIP. Starts with the General Manager Felix Murillo who was very personable and took the time to say hello and check in on how we were doing.    The Spa was another highlight. Very elegant and the treatments (had a massage and Hammam special) were outstanding.    This hotel has to set the standard for luxury accommodations. I doubt you'll find better service anywhere else in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Like an oasis - A great resort!
Review_Text: My wife and I spent four days at this wonderful resort in December 2014. We used it as Our base for exploring Marrakech and it worked very well. Close enough to the town center to get easily in and out either by the hotels courtesy car or by the many cheap and relatively comfortable taxis.  The hotel grounds and facilities are fantastic. Spacious beautifully laid out and maintained with spa swimming pools and other recreational facilities. Morning and early afternoon by the pool gave us the right inspiration to og into town as of mid afternoon when Marrakech Wakes up and shows its best side.  We will og back to this resort which in addition to being in fascinating Marrakech also is a wonderful destination in its own right.  Being experienced travelers having ad the pleasure of staying at many fine resorts we were still impressed by the extreme cleanliness comfort and friendliness of the staff at the Four Seasons in Marrakech.  Only minor negative observation is that the hotel restaurants are somewhat overpriced which most probably serves to keep the wide variety of restaurant choices at the hotel available.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I stayed at Four Seasons for four days; from the arrival to departure it was flawless... The hotel is 5-10 minutes far from city center by taxi (5 €) within the vicinity of all "things to do in Marrakesh". The most important and memorable thing was the smiling faces of the whole staff...I had to use room service and concierge in many occasions even tough some had to be at the very late hours of the night staff was always positive!  The hotel provides spacious and efficient rooms modern deco with Moroccan touches. Almost all details were thought to give correct flow within the room (easy to control TV no puzzle like light management highly efficient bathroom with necessary amenities etc)... The pool area was utterly clean and neat with a fast service...  The sports bar was almost phenomenal with its cosy decoration and service...  And I should not forget to mention about them spa again definitely unpretentious yet elegant with a beyond definition massage service by Mr Tariq...

Review_Title: Great family hotel and great staff but quite a few hiccups
Review_Text: The FS is a nice resort 5 mins away from the Medina by taxi so you get to be in a quiet area and still very close to the buzz.    The property is nice the room was great the staff in general is top notch but we had quite a few hiccups when we stayed there (car turning up really late for a day trip reservation at a restaurant that got lost 3 or 4 calls by diff people to [re]confirm a booking booked airport transfer which also got lost and finally a food experience at their "international" restaurant which was just not acceptable construction work going on etc.).    They always made up for the mistakes and fixed what could be fixed which is great but these type of things should not happen at a FS (maybe we were that week's black cat ?). Finally after their online survey the hotel manager wanted to contact us but never did.

Review_Date: David L wrote a review Dec 2014
Review_Title: The quality you would expect from Four Seasons
Review_Text: Really nice hotel with a slightly different vibe to other Four Seasons I've been to. This place is realtively recently built I think and the open layout and North African touches in the decor help you have a feel of Morocco. The pool and the spa were really nice and the grounds are big enough for a walk around if it's not too hot. I can't really comment on the food as the town centre was only a 10 min cab ride away but the breakfast was pretty good.

Review_Date: Sandra W. wrote a review Dec 2014
Review_Text: We ended up here when we couldnt get to our original resort due to flooding. The room was beautiful staff fantastic food great. Awesome spa treatments. And we found out that they treat their staff well which for us is important.

We stayed at the Four Season for 2 nights to celebrate our 32nd. wedding anniversary. We received a very warm welcome with complimentary cake flowers and champagne. We had a wonderful room with a huge balcony overlooking the pool. We then received a 2nd bunch of flowers with a personal note from the Manager. Hotel is great with a lovely pool area. All staff were very courteous and could not do enough for us. I would also like to make a special mention to there room service staff as we are strictly kosher and brought our own dinners. They were very accommodating and heated up our food and delivered it to our room. All was set on a magnificent table complete with candles and all. We had a spa treatment which once again was one of the best I have ever had. Once again - great hotel. Highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We were at Four Seasons 2 weeks back to attend a wedding. This place is only 10 minutes from the airport. We spent fantastic 3 days of celebrations in the Four Seasons.    The grounds are vast and become magical on nightfall with all the beautiful lighting and lanterns.    The fare including breakfast was great and the staff all very polite and efficient.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Leon J wrote a review Nov 2014
Review_Text: The staff were very friendly and helpful and the resort had everything I would expect to see.  The resort is very close to the main attractions and the resort is so large that you never feel as though the place is crowded.

Review_Title: Beautiful resort but not in the Medina
Review_Text: This is a beautiful hotel. The service was impeccable and friendly. The food was good. Lunch buffet outside was great. The only downside is that this hotel is not located in the old center of the City (the Medina). Not within walking distance either. You must take a taxi. It is not hard or expensive to get a taxi but it is still nicer to be at a location like La Mamounia.

Review_Title: The Four Seasons Resort Marrakech is The FOUR SEASONS
Review_Text: My son got married last week and we had the whole 3 day affair at the Four Seasons Resort in Marrakech. The hotel was amazing Staff were amazing and the Presidential suiite was like staying in another world. The entire three days of partying were thoroughly enjoyed by our 300+ guests. All catering was done by the hotel and all our guests were all praise for the food at all occasions.The hotel event manager Imane Bhairi left the hotel at 05.00am as she wanted to ensure all was running smooth at one of the events. From guest arrivals on Friday till guests left on Monday the hotel staff were around every minute to help The hotel GM Mr. Felix Murillo ensured us it would be an enjoyable wedding and he was very right. The hotel even organized an Indian Chef to be on hand to ensure all tastes were catered to. Thank you Four Seasons for an excellent 3 days.

I just returned from the Four Seasons Marrakech where I stayed for 5 days while attending a business conference and wish I could have stayed much longer. If traveling to Marrakech or anywhere near Morocco I can’t recommend highly enough that you include this resort as part of your holiday or business travel if only to experience the perfect balance of luxury service and one element I didn’t expect the exceptional food at all of their restaurants especially the breakfast buffet – or room service.    The grounds welcome you to a very private location removed from the hectic but exciting energy of Marrakech. There are loads of other hotels less than a 10-minute drive on a “strip”. While for one second I questioned if I should have stayed in that area only because it was near my conference one evening upon arrival at the Four Seasons property and I knew I had made the right decision. Tranquil and beautiful grounds with all of the services of both a business hotel and a luxury resort. The most difficult part about staying here was motivate to leave the property for work as the spa lounges and grounds could easily keep you from your meetings.    Service was stellar. All of your needs were met and they were quick to respond with any request like an umbrella brought to your room and fast room service.    The Spa. Upon arrival I had the luxury of attending the spa for a couple of appointments I had booked in the weeks prior. Like a typical New Yorker planning a business trip I must have changed all of my appointments about 3 – 4 times as my schedule for meetings kept changing. However thru it all Houda who managed my appointments both by email and just as delightful on sight was so genuinely gracious and managed to work with my chaos. The spa is divine from layout to treatments offered. Again I wish I could have spent an entire day there instead of at meetings. Also at the spa I had a blow dry in advance of my panel the next day. Even in NY with my own stylist the blow dry is never quite right so I figured I could at least just keep the frizz at bay. Enter Samir with his tools needed very limited discussion and off he styled – like an artist. I haven’t been that happy with my hair in ages – and it was effortless on his part.    I do not know when I can come back again to Marrakech but there is no question this will be where I stay. Also having never stayed at a Four Seasons property I would jump at an opportunity to enjoy any other business or leisure stay at any of their properties based on my outstanding experience in Marrakech. It has been a long time since I actually felt sad on the last day of a business trip as I just didn’t want to leave the property. It’s hard to give up feeling like royalty. Thank you Four Seasons Marrakech to management and most important to everyone that made my stay a delight!

We stayed at the Four Seasons Marrakech for 5 nights in mid-November. This resort is absolutely beautiful in every way. From the entrance lobby restaurants pools rooms service food---I can't say enough! It is a contemporary version of traditional Moroccan décor: filigreed silver lamps and chandeliers huge carved chests a plethora of glass lanterns Berber artifacts bright colors of pink magenta and orange - all exquisitely done. Huge rose bouquets were everywhere.The lighting at night - inside and out - is magical. We dined at the main Moroccan buffet the pool café and the Italian restaurant plus bar snacks and drinks in the lobby area. Everything was delicious and beautifully presented. Our room and bath were very large and luxurious. The spacious well-furnished balcony afforded us a beautiful view over the olive grove and pool. We could leave the sliders open so that in the morning we were awakened by birdsong. I appreciated the fact the hotel is a 5 minute drive from the Medina...giving a sense of peace and relaxation. Service is 5 star. Very easy airport access. We hope to return some day.

Review_Title: Excellent hotel and staff. Every little detail taken care of to make us feel very special.
Review_Text: We stayed at the Four Season for 2 nights to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary. We received a very warm welcome had a lovely room with complimentary cake flowers and champagne. We then received a 2nd bunch of flowers with a personal note from the Manager. Hotel is great with a lovely pool area. All staff were very courteous and could not do enough for us. We had a spa treatment which once again was one of the best I have ever had. Once again - great hotel. Highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Stan S wrote a review Nov 2014
Review_Title: Absolutely the Best Hotel in Marrakech
Review_Text: Stayed for 5 nights in November as always the service levels staff rooms and location are all excellent.  I have stayed in other hotels in Marrakech before none compare.  Highly recommended for business and family holidays from the time you arrive until you depart a great experience..

Stayed here for 12 nights from 27th August 2014. The suite was excellent staff were professional and attentive perfect for a relaxing time in the sun. T    he plunge pool was bigger than I expected about 3m x 3m not big enough for swimming but lovely for cooling off. The terrace was very big and had lots of seating and sunbathing. We didn't do much sightseeing (apart from a trip to the Medina - which I found to be pretty underwhelming). Preferred instead to enjoy the service and surroundings of the hotel. Lunchtime at the poolside restaurant evenings spent mainly outside at the Italian restaurant.    Spa service very good (they came to the room for everything I wanted). There wasnt much atmosphere which suited us perfecty. Lots of reading crosswords and jigsaws rather than socialising or dancing.    Extremely relaxing but I wouldn't recommend it if you want entertainment. I'm sure it was just the time of year we went but everywhere was very quiet. Perfect for me but wouldn't suit everyone.    Would definitely go back and thoroughly enjoyed the suite.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: From the time you arrive you will be struck by the luxurious presentation splendid in so many ways. The hotel is so beautiful the suite was elegant and so well decorated without being over the top. The facilities are fantastic. The only disapointment was the standard of dining but the rest was so perfect!

Highly recommend the hotel. The decor is contemporary beds were very comfortable service impeccable and location great! Family-friendly with excellent children's program! The rooms are large with large terrace.

Great place to stay and enjoy a relaxing holiday! Very much kid friendly with all amenities and great food. Our 20 month old son had so much space to move around and enjoy the family pool. The ambience in the restaurants was great room service was excellent and the staff was very courteous. Must stay for a family holiday as it is a huge resort and plenty of things to do.

Stunning resort great friendly staff very keen and helpful lovely large room with all luxuries the chamber maids were excellent in room toiletries were lovely and having tea & coffee making facilities is important to me
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Brian L wrote a review Nov 2014
Review_Text: We recently had the pleasure of staying at this resort in October. What an amazing experience. The rooms are beautiful tastefully decorated and very comfortable. The staff throughout the resort are gracious and focused on excellent customer service. The resort offers an array of different restaurants you could experience every evening without repeating anything during your stay. They have a fantastic gym as well - exceptional for a hotel. The spa is amazing! Be sure to spend some time after your treatment in the herb garden after your treatment.

Review_Date: Marie S wrote a review Nov 2014
Review_Text: great place to stay with friends loved ones or family with amazing pools and loads of sunbathing space. beautiful decor delicious food and location next to many shops bars and nightclubs - makes it a highly recommended destination.

Review_Date: Marc E wrote a review Nov 2014
Review_Text: Set in the heart of Marrakesh is this tranquil resort where nothing is too much trouble. The pool is outstanding.. The bedrooms beautiful and the food exquisite. If you want to see the wonders of Marrakesh and get chance to relax too you won't go far wrong. The resort is also with a 1 hour drive of the foothills of the Atlas Mountains.

Review_Date: Fawzi Musallam wrote a review Nov 2014
Review_Text: The product is of the highest standard  However the service is not comparable to the FourSeasons standard  There was strong knocking at my door at 5:30 in the morning only to find out they sent breakfast to the wrong room  I am in room 121 and since last night till now 5:30 pm despite several complaints the banging and noise is nonstop  It is basically not worth the money  It is a sad experience and wrong choice

Review_Date: Matt B wrote a review Oct 2014
Review_Title: Fantastic service and a relaxing and enjoyable stay in classy hotel.
Review_Text: A fantastic stay in a classy hotel with great staff. Try their recommended places to eat especially the Azar Lebanese restaurant with Belly Dancers!  We had a fantastic time and the staff at the Pool Bar were fantastic as was the pool itself!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A true oasis in Marrakech - style and service second to none!
Review_Text: I have travelled to many five star hotels in my time and this one definitely tops my list…. truly an oasis in Marrakech.    Although my expectations were high prior to my arrival the hotel certainly exceeded these.    The service and personal touches were impeccable you really couldn’t fault their attention to detail and willingness to make your stay the most enjoyable and memorable. For example complimentary refreshments (welcome drink ice cream smoothies) brought to you whilst you relaxed by the pool courtesy transfer into Marrakech centre on your request and completing your departure card for you on your behalf.    The staff were most impressive. There was never a point during our stay that we were kept waiting for anything. In fact they were seldom seen but always there when needed. They were genuine friendly helpful and well trained but never intrusive.    We were allocated a deluxe room which was extremely spacious with a super kind bed large double sinked bathroom walk-in wardrobe and spacious balcony with chaise longue. You couldn’t fault the décor (traditional Moroccan furnishings and handcrafted local woodwork) comfort (home from home feel) or cleanliness (twice daily housekeeping).    Breakfast wasn’t lavish with huge arrays of buffets but more intermit priding themselves on quality over quantity. Service again was second to none and you were never without a drink.  We didn’t actually dine in at the hotel during the evening however I’m sure judging by lunch (poolside restaurant) that this would have been amazing.    The hotel has two pools one for families and the other for couples (the quite pool). There was no scrimping on design between the pools and was nice to be given choice of "activity" level.    I would love to travel back to the hotel again. Fingers crossed I get the opportunity.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My husband and I spent 7 nights at The Four Seasons:    Pros - adult pool was vast and warm plenty of sunbeds pool guys excellent with towels/drinks etc room was adequate (no mirror other than in the bathroom for makeup though but handy walk in wardrobe/storage area) bed was huge and very comfortable indeed maid service twice a day changing towels bedding etc. The hotel staff are all very friendly and the manager is often seen chatting to guests checking on their views.    Cons - the restaurants/drinks areas lacked any atmosphere and are often very quiet particularly the Morrocan buffet however the food at the Italian one was good and the manager very efficient.    The Four Seasons is c10 mins from the airport and shouldn't be more than 100 MAD each way in a taxi. The Hotel is c7mins by taxi from the square in Marrakech (50 MAD each way) there is a hotel courtesy car for your outbound trip (on a first come first served basis after 6pm in the evening) which is a nice touch.
