We were advised walking was possible and that it was nice; not sure I entirely agree there is a footpath along a dual carriageway but it takes almost one hour to walk into Marrakech; save your feet get a taxi and walk around the souk would be my advice (unless you want to sit on a camel for a photograph!).    Yes you are 'pestered' in the square for various unusual offerings (snakes/monkeys/henna tattoos etc) however a firm but polite 'No thanks' does the trick. We ate at two Riads which were both excellent and better value. That said everything looks alittle uninviting from the outside however once through the door a whole new world of pure tranquility and luxury opens up around a courtyard (do your research beforehand). We also ate a L'italien in La Mamounia which was well worth the extra splurge the Mozzarella Souffle was spectacular!    Definitely the right decision to stay at The Four Seasons to ensure peace and quiet when not sampling the hectic delights of central Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We booked in for half term and the whole experience was simply perfect. From the kids club (what a lovely team) the front of house staff (who learnt our names whilst the hotel was full and always smiling and helpful) the restaurant teams and of course our tennis coach who put up with our awful tennis (please note they do need more than 2 observation seats). It was a holliday we will never forget and will certainly be returning ASAP

My partner and I found our stay in Marrakech both bustling and tranquil. Marrakech is a vibrant city with a bustling Medina good shopping in the new town and some excellent restaurants. Our tranquillity was in the form of the Four Season an Oasis just outside of the Medina with excellent facilities and spacious ground and pools. The Staff was incredibly helpful courteous and excellent at look after you. Rooms were exceptional good well designed spacious and confortable. The hotel also offers guests free evening transport to the Medina. Recommend staying at this Oasis if you want to stay in the bustling Medina. Terrence
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: deborah e wrote a review Oct 2014
Review_Title: I got ill while on travel and went to the Four Seasons in Marrakech to recover. A perfect stay on all levels!
Review_Text: An oasis in the middle of Marrakech. The location was only a few minutes away from everything. The hotel had every service needed and the staff in all the departments were well trained and very pleasant.

Review_Title: Can we add more stars for this hotel?
Review_Text: We spent 4 nights in this hotel and it was the best part of our visit to Marrakech. The city can be a little overwhelming and staying here was the perfect balance. It is true to the service you expect from most Four Seasons properties. Our initial room was by the restaurant courtyard. We are noise sensitive and the manager moved us immediately to another room no questions asked. The hotel property and gardens were beyond perfect. After 6 days of hard travel through other parts of Morocco we were ever so grateful to be relaxing in the care of exquisitely trained staff who were genuinely interested in our comfort health and experience. It was our 17th wedding anniversary trip and they had made a cake for our arrival in our room and provided a bottle of bubbles. Wifi is a little slow but it was slow all over Morocco. I only found one thing rather odd. They allow men attendants into the women's spa areas. Being a spa goer in the states and elsewhere I was shocked when a male was showing a woman around to the different pools etc. Good thing swim suits are required. I don't really understand why the spa isn't co-ed if men are allowed to walk around in the women's area. Just an oddity and maybe a custom I'm not familiar with. Sort of blew my relaxation/spa experience though. Other than that this hotel was really really top notch.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Just what you would expect from Four Seasons. Comfortable well appointed and maintained rooms and facilities. Rooms are a bit small and dark (poor lighting) but otherwise extremely comfortable. Mattress gets an A+. Food was excellent both in the buffet and the Italian restaurant. Very nice rooftop bar with great wait staff. Out of town but close enough for easy access to the Medina and other attractions.

Review_Date: AJ J wrote a review Oct 2014
Review_Text: Had the privilege of attending a conference here and tempted to return with the family. Spacious great location nice gardens helpful staff and superb food. Also the rooms are magnificent. A top resort that ticks a lot of boxes.

Review_Date: Linda B wrote a review Oct 2014
Review_Title: Exotic Marrakech in a fabulous hotel
Review_Text: Got back yesterday from a fabulous 4-day break in the opulent Four Seasons Hotel. I want to give this hotel more than the five stars rating. The gardens are beautifully kept and the flowers mainly roses in the hotel are freshly arranged I think every day. These alone deserve 6 stars.    Our room was very clean and spacious as well as the wet room/bathroom. Plenty of towels and toiletries and a "state of the art" loo! The bed was very comfortable and the balcony faced the lovely gardens.    I cannot tell you how gracious courteous and friendly the hotel staff are and I would especially like to say a big "Thank You" to the restaurant's maître'd Frederico (Arancino) the sunset bar's Yassine and the life guard/pool attendant Anas for the amazing way they looked after us and for the celebratory glasses of champagne and the "anniversary" cocktails.    We were celebrating our wedding anniversary and the hotel staff/management gave us a delicious cake which was beautifully decorated as well as gorgeous red roses in our room. Again a BIG Thank You - a wonderful surprise and a lovely gesture - much appreciated.    The people of Marrakech are unbelievably courteous and friendly and everywhere we went we were made extremely welcome. The Souk and the main square are a "must" as well as the beautiful Jardin Majorelle. There is an Yves St Laurent monument which is lovely and after a "heady" walk around the Souk it was very calming to wander around this fabulous garden.    One thing you must be aware of and that is the bikers moped riders and cars in the centre. You literally "take your life in your own hands" when trying to cross the streets! It's unbelievable!! I don't think driving tests are mandatory.    If you're looking for some winter sunshine exotic country full of wonderful friendly people and amazing hotels then look no further than Marrakech. You'll love it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We went to this place as a family the level of service is excellent as you would expect from four seasons. Upon entrance the whole area is covered in flowers and the scent of fresh flowers is beautiful. There were room welcoming Moroccan sweets and the kids were brought muffins and cookies. The baby cots are very high quality and very well padded for your babies comfort.    The swimming pools were perfect with a tented swimming pool for babies. The Bar at the top has sensational views.    The Italian restaurant has a truffle pizza that is a MUST. The barbecue by the swimming pool had such a huge variety of delicious choices. The only thing that I would say they could improve on is the choice of food in the breakfast buffet for a hotel of this price and this rating I have seen better.    But overall no point in going anywhere else in Marrakech this is the top.

Review_Date: Chris A wrote a review Oct 2014
Review_Text: Recently spend two nights in a king room. Although it was a business trip I couldn't fault the hotel and especially the staff with the slight exception of the rather slow wifi. The room was excellent and it's a great setting neat to the airport. We had one dinner which was also very good.

Recently stayed here to celebrate a birthday. From arrival to departure everything was the highest standard from the welcome mint tea and dates to the chilled water in the car to the airport. The staff cannot do enough for you always smiling and friendly. The treats given to us to celebrate my birthday were lovely and most welcome - thank you.    Even a day relaxing by the pool comes with outstanding service as do the bars and restaurants. A very relaxing environment everywhere in the resort. Will definitely be back for more!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: mansour k wrote a review Oct 2014
Review_Text: Very good and personal service . The hotel condition is impeccable . There is only one thing to complain about and thats the meal prices are a bit over-priced . Otherwise all is wonderful and its a great hotel to return to after a busy and noisy day at the Marrakesh bustling markets !!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Karen H wrote a review Oct 2014
Review_Text: Stayed here recently for a couple of nights and was fortunate enough to get an upgrade on our last night to the Royal Villa. I thought the rooms and Suites were excellent but the Royal Villa is in a class of its own most definitely an experience that will never be forgot. The Staff are helpful friendly nothing is too much trouble and they are extremely polite. the grounds of the Hotel and the pools are immaculate. The restaurant is nice and the bars are quirky in an ideal setting. If you get the opportunity to stay here then It comes highly recommended pure luxury.

Review_Date: Mary W wrote a review Oct 2014
Review_Text: My husband and I were married on the rooftop terrace in September. It was absolutely gorgeous. Every detail was perfect. The staff was very accommodating and did a great job with all the last minute things we needed. Imane helped us organize everything and she did a great job! Everything was taken care of so we didn't have to worry about anything. The hotel is beautiful and the ceremony was beautiful! Great place!

From check in to check out this resort is pure joy!! The staff is great the chefs are great the rooms are great and in perfect condition the public areas are great…everything is fabulous in this place…I wish I could have stayed more nights…the quality of the beds is fantastic. You feel the marrakech culture in every corner of the hotel. Of course the price for all this is not cheap but it is worth every penny. Location is not the best since it is not close to downtown but at the same time being outside the hustle and bustle of marrakech downtown is somehow a delight because you can enjoy a peaceful place 10 minutes by car to the crazy marrakech downtown. This is a GEM….I have stayed in several Four seasons and this one delivers everything they promise.

This hotel is like other four seasons but with Moroccan touch. The decor is outstanding.The hotel is conveniently located not far from the city .The hotel provides shuttle one way to the city in the evenings and to get back taxi is not expensive.The entire hotel staff are very friendly and service in the hotel is really beyond five star. We had dinner in the Moroccan restaurant and the food is outstanding. Overall we had a perfect luxury stay in this hotel.

Review_Date: Mark C wrote a review Oct 2014
Review_Text: My partner and I stayed here for a short break and had a wonderful time. The rooms were beautifuly maintained and decorated and the staff attentive to your requirements. The quality of service was second to none.  The pool staff were outstanding and supplied complimentary drinks and refreshments during our stay and though the restaurants have limited menu choices the food and presentation was excellent.  A truly relaxing and peaceful stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Beautiful setting, luxury facilities and incredible hospitality!
Review_Text: We spent 7 nights here for our honeymoon. We were incredibly well looked after as soon as we arrived to the moment we left - nothing was too much trouble. You had complimentary juices and iced water being brought to you regularly at the pool attendants who would offer to "clean your sunlasses" and change your sunbed towels etc. etc. I have stayed at some nice hotels but they certainly go the extra mile here. Our room was slick spacious had quality furnishings and had everything you needed. The room service and its menu were also top notch!  The only concern was when it got busy one weekend (during Eid / Ramadan) the restaurants struggled to cope with the numbers for breakfast and lunch. Standards slipped because of this but we were offered discounted meals / complimentary items to make up for this. All in all an excellent experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: The best experience in Marrakech, incredible and caring staff.
Review_Text: We came to the Four Seasons as part of the recent conference my husband attended. We brought our 2 daughters with us to later tour Morocco as a family. Unfortunately our youngest who is also a type-1 diabetic got sick our first night and needed medical attention that required a doctor visit to our room an ambulance and a hospital stay for 24 hours. The staff at the Four Seasons Marrakech was beyond AMAZING from the assistance with doctors to the sweet notes and flowers left daily by housekeeping and the kids' club to room service to food services which even prepared food for us to take to our daughter in the hospital (via private car transfer). Staff somehow knew who we were and would stop to ask how our daughter was doing by name. While our time in Marrkech was not as fully enjoyed as we had planned the Four Seasons made it possible for us to find comfort and regain health to continue on with our trip. We were deeply touched by the level of care and kindness we received during our stay.  It is also a gorgeous property with beautiful rooms and excellent food!

Just back from 5 nights at this lovely hotel. Went for a quiet break last time I visited Marrakech I stayed at the Sofitel Imperial Palace which is not a patch on the Four Seasons. The deluxe twin room was more than adequate in size with a luxurious bathroom. The breakfast buffet left you spoilt for choice with something to please everyone. I particularly liked the quiet pool which is for adults only and the family pool for those staying with children seemed to me a perfect solution to the issue of children in an adults pool. Food is reasonably priced for a 5 star hotel and the staff are really wonderful. I had a late flight so as I checked out at 11:00am I asked if they could store my luggage somewhere I was immediately offered a complimentary late checkout until 4:00pm which was very useful. I like Marrakech for a short break as it only a 3hour + flight from the UK on my next visit I will definitely stay at the Four Seasons-Oh and by the way the beds are just heavenly

I visited the Four Seasons for my 21st birthday and it was fantastic. From the moment we arrived when we were seated and offered drinks to when we left having had everything packed into our taxi for us the service was exceptional.    Our room was cleaned every day we were given fresh water in the room each day and our beds were turned down every evening when we returned. The bathroom was lovely; two sinks so lots of space a huge tub and a fantastic shower. The shower gels and shampoo were such good quality as well.    There are two pools to choose from a family pool where you can rent inflatables and have ice cream or an adult pool with a bar and food which can be served poolside.  The poolside attendants were great as well they would help with everything including moving those pesky umbrellas!    The food served poolside and at breakfast was top quality. Th breakfast buffet was vast ranging from pastries to a full english to Moroccan dishes.  The bar was also well staffed and they were very good bartenders as they made us our requests which weren't even on the menu!    They made my family and I feel incredibly welcome and like no request was too small or too trivial. They even gave me a cake on my birthday and some cava. Truly exceptional service would stay at a four seasons again without a doubt.

Review_Title: Amex and Four Seasons are a Winners
Review_Text: The combination of American Express Platinum and The Four Seasons once again made for a winning combination. We received a double upgrade to a lovely Executive suite with two bathrooms( each with a shower)  a wonderful full buffet breakfast with excellent smoked salmon  omelettes made by an on site chef and 70 E towards a spa experience. I used mine toward a massage and it was great . We actually used the late 4pm check out as our plane was at 7pm.    Adding to the pleasure was Amina front desk manager who was charming  well informed and professional . Among other things she helped to arrange a delightful day trip to Essaouira  on the coast. Numerous staff addressed us by our names and even pronounced it correctly. That kind of detail is reflective of the entire operation. The hotel is light and beautifully decorated.    We appreciated that you could order a glass of wine for a reasonable price ($(11.00) in the restaurant. We found two other hotel restaurants of similar caliber charged more than double and it seemed like the other hotels were gouging. However Mini Bar prices in the room might be reviewed. 270 Mad ($30) for an ordinary half bottle of wine seemed excessive as did about $ 8 for a Coke. By the way Cokes can be bought all over town for 6 MAD  about 75 cents.    They have a lovely tower bar/restaurant facing the Atlas mountains. There are also free transfers from 6 in the evening to any of the local hotels and restaurants in the hotel’s Mercedes.  They seem to have thought of everything to make for a very enjoyable stay even having reliable and friendly taxi drivers. I really liked Said. His prices were always reasonable and there was no reason to haggle. Haggling can be a sport in Morocco. If you mention his name the doorman can easily call him and he will be there in minutes.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Patty W wrote a review Sep 2014
Review_Text: This is very beautiful property. The rooms are very spacious and very well appointed. The air conditioning works great and the grounds are lovely. The service is top notch. This is about what you would expect for a world class hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Four Seasons Resort Marrakech is an absolute treasure in Morocco. The service is exceptional at the least and property immaculate. The two pools Fitness Center guest rooms and dining facilities are perfect. The Medina restaurants and attractions are all about a 5 minute drive. I've stayed at many luxurious hotels and resorts and this is one of my favorite. Every request was done with a smile and no hesitation. We needed some things that were not available on property and they went out to look for our necessities. LOVE it and will return when we go back to Morocco.

Review_Date: John B wrote a review Sep 2014
Review_Title: Perfect place to stay in Marrakech
Review_Text: The service at the Four Seasons Resort Marrakech is exceptional! From the welcome easy check-in process personalised room cleaning schedules pool staff who move your umbrella to ensure that you are always in the sun or shade efficient restaurant waiters ... they really are amazing!  The hotel is a short cab ride to the main square in Marrakech so you are in the Souk in less then 15 mins yet once back you have fabulous gardens and great facilities to relax and unwind!  We were not expecting to enjoy our stay but the were so pleasantly surprised and would most certainly go back.  We were there for a conference but my wife and I agreed that it would be great as a base to visit Marrakech and take a trip out to the Atlas Mountains.

Review_Date: J Lee R wrote a review Sep 2014
Review_Text: I was just at the Four Seasons Marrakech for three nights for a conference. Our group filled the hotel 100% with another 100 plus visitors from outside the hotel during the talks for breaks and lunch. The hotel managed our crowd with efficiency service always with a smile and amazing food and drinks. Starting with the opening cocktail and ending with a fantastic party in the desert we were treated like royalty. I look forward to going back and spending more down time at their beautiful pools and in their spa. Try the hamman the body scrub is a unique experience.  PS. The rooms are also spacious and well appointed.

arrived at 10.30pm to be greeted by speedy check-in which was really appreciated. The room was stunning - huge bedroom double doors opening into double sink walk in shower bath and separate toilet then a separate dressing room - all with balcony with table and chairs and small day bed - and we were in the cheapest room! - so we would have expected the view to be overlooking the bins...but no - over looked the main fountain area in centre of hotel surrounded by palm trees - very nice.    breakfast was buffet style - but fresh bread being made in front or seated area and fresh omelettes made to order - then any think else you could possibly want. All to superb quality and service was impeccable.    There are 2 pools - the family one being the largest but when we were there we were the only ones around the family pool - and we didn't have children! The adult pool has soft music in the background faces to a casual bar and restaurant which was great to sit and have a drink - or you could ask one of the couple of staff around the pool for anything you wanted and they would bring to your sunbed. Fresh towels aplenty - and when you went for a dip - a dry fresh towel would be folded on the end of your sunbed. The staff would bring round fresh pineapple on cocktails sticks glasses of minted cooled water - you could have iced water in any supply.    They gym was large - not the usual 2 running machines and a rower - but a fully kitted gym with separate stretch / free weight rooms. The showers / changing rooms here were large - with lockers bottles of water apples tea / coffee towels mouth wash combs etc. This also doubles up as the late check-out changing area - which is set on the edge of the hotel grounds - but concierge would drive you round in the electric golf buggy at any time (and pick you up again!)    There are lots of areas to sit sunbathe relax - all beautifully designed and the flow from one area to the other really worked. This is a larger hotel - but the way the grounds are designed it still manages that intimate and personal feel.    The staff could not do enough for us - including getting us taxis into town - and giving us bottles of iced water to take with us.    Highly recommended.    not hotel related - but may be worth noting:  Taxis from the airport were 100Mdh (about £10) and into town from hotel 50Mdh. ALWAYS agree a price before getting in -otherwise you will have to pay what they demand at the end of the journey which could be £50! We were told 300Mdh from the airport but we stuck our ground and after 5 mins they agreed 100Mdh. Don't be put off by haggling for taxis (or anything) - we got there at night and just said 'OK we'll walk' - that's when they agreed 100!  Also - we (2 girls) were not bothered by anyone in markets - dress respectfully - most of the locals are genuine and will help if you get lost in the souks!

This is our final day at the Four Seasons and if you want a relaxing getaway in the sun for a week this is the place to come. It is suitable for both adults and kids having two separate pools for each. The facilities the decor are fantastic as you would expect from a 5 star hotel but what really sets this apart is the staff. Each and every one acknowledges you as you pass many asking how your day has been. I've got to give a special mention to Anas who worked at the adult pool very helpful friendly attentive and a credit to the hotel.    We'd certainly recommend giving this hotel a go well worth a visit
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Myself and two friends spent 7 days at the Four Seaons Marrakech in August 2014. We stayed in one of their Deluxe Pavilion Suites which was a wonderful accomodation with lots of space. The ground were exremely well kept service and staff were excellent and the food was delicious. This is the perfect place to stay if you're looking for a luxury hotel near the heart of Marrakech.
Reviewer_Location: New York, New York, United States

Review_Date: Laura N wrote a review Sep 2014
Review_Text: I have just returned from a 5 night stay at the Four Seaons Marrakech - a very nice hotel set in lovely gardens. The staff thoughout the hotel were extremely helpful and were always happy to assist with any queries or bookings. Both the rooms and public areas of the hotel are kept meticulously clean and tidy. The adults only pool is a real bonus for those travelling without children and the staff around the pool go out of their way to make sure you are comfortable. The hotel has a good range of restaurants all serving nice food. Would definitely recommend the hotel to those travelling to Marrakech.

I have just returned from the Four Seasons Marrakech and cannot praise this resort highly enough. I think it is probably one of the best hotels that I have stayed at and I travel a lot for work. The resort is beautiful with perfectly manicured gardens the rooms are super comfortable and quiet it is the first time that I haven't been woken up by other guests or staff. But what makes this hotel truly special is the staff they cannot do enough for you they really made the entire experience wonderful.

Review_Date: Tony H wrote a review Aug 2014
Review_Text: This hotel is set in beautiful gardens with fountains two pools- one just for adults and a great spa and gym.. Luxury at its best  service is very good and a great choice of restaurants ... Ideally located close to everything that Marrakech has to offer  but a great retreat.

This is my second stay at the four seasons and I am already planning my return.  I was very fortunate again to be upgraded to a beautiful room over looking the quiet pool. The rooms are beautifully decorated and feel very luxurious.  The quiet pool is fantastic and you are supplied with lots of little treats throughout the day by staff who are happy to assist in anyway possible.  Good selection at breakfast and I also enjoyed dinner at the Italian restaurant.  I have been fortunate enough to stay in many wonderful hotels but for me the service at this property is the best I have experienced. Everyone seems genuinely happy to be working there.

While in Marrakech we visited the other 5 star resort hotels and not to in any way diminish them we were overjoyed that we had chosen Four Seasons. The rooms were spacious comfortable and we'll appointed with large balconies. The grounds were beautifully landscaped and there were both adult pools (children not allowed) and family pools where children were happily accommodated.    The pool staff were terrific with no add on charge for a cabana and they came around with refreshing drinks and water.    The hotel concierge staff were fabulous and most helpful in arranging reservations as well as sightseeing. From the front desk to the housekeeping staff one gets the impression that they enjoy their jobs and love giving good service.    Highly recommend this resort.

Overall this hotel is true to the Four Seasons brand. The rooms are spacious the hotel was not too busy (although it was July) and the staff were very friendly albeit maybe a bit laxidasical with a few things (pool staff seemed inattentive at times). No real qualms though. If staying and eating at the hotel for breakfast the choices can get quite repetitive however and is limited to a buffet style. This all being said the property is expansive luxurious and spacious. Certainly the place to stay when traveling to a city like Marrakesh. Overall an excellent stay.

Review_Title: I went to the Desert & I found an Oasis
Review_Text: Luxurious well appointed situated in garden of flowers surounding wonderful pool areas. The SPA experience amoung the best you can find anywhere worthy of spending the entire day. I highly recommend the massage

Review_Title: Lovely stay in an interesting but slightly hectic city
Review_Text: Four Seasons is a fantastic place to relax and 'chill out' as it has everything on offer; two swimming pools restaurants kids club etc. Our double suite was huge and wonderfuly decorated with all the amenities you would expect from such a hotel. However as a family we did agree that on the whole the hotel needs to 'tighten up' in certain areas. We did have a delicious barbecue supper one evening with both fish and meat being offered (the Italian restaurant was closed) however the breakfast on offer does not match the ones offered at other Four Seasons hotels. We wondered whether this was in part due to it being low season. The other point was the service when on a number of minor occasions it could have been improved. For example asking 5/6 times for a shade and fresh towels when we arrived at the pool and multiple waiters asking us for our orders and then mixing up our order. We were also slightly disappointed when after a 1.5 hour wait at customs and arriving at the hotel tired and late in the evening they seemed reluctant to serve us which one would not have expected from an international hotel. However these are very minor points - when staying at most hotels you would note even bother noting these but it just seemed the hotel in certain areas was not quite up to the extremely high standards of other Four Seasons.

Review_Date: Evy V wrote a review Aug 2014
Review_Title: One of the best in service!
Review_Text: Great hotel with a world class service! Nothing bad to say about this hotel. They'll make you feel like a king/queen. Also only 10minutes from the airport yet no noise from the planes. Great food in the restaurants.

My husband surprised me (I didn't know till the night before exactly where I was going) by taking me to Marrakesh for our 20th wedding anniversary a couple of weeks ago. He doesn't normally have anything to do with booking our holidays so I was a little nervous!! I needn't have been this hotel is amazing from the minute we arrived they spoilt us. Our room was ready even though we arrived at 10.30am and roses sparkling wine a 20th anniversary cake were all in our room on arrival.  The service level for the whole 6 nights did not falter we had a fabulous time and I am very grateful to all of them for making our anniversary so special.  We have travelled all over the world and stayed in some great hotels but this has to be the best.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Absolutely faultless the best hotel I've ever stayed at. The place is just amazing the staff are very friendly approachable helpful and always wear a smile. My 4 days stay is not enough I didn't wanna leave the place as I feel so relaxed and comfortable. Every penny I spent is worth it. I will definitely go back in this place and I will make sure that I will stay longer.

Review_Title: World class hotel, world class pool
Review_Text: Marrakech can be quite overwhelming on first visit. We would go to the souk or to the Atlas Mountains and then come back to this very calming oasis. A swim in the pool at the end of the day was just what we needed to feel refreshed and ready to go exploring again the next day. Actually there are two pools: one for children and families and one for adults. Being a lap swimmer I really appreciated the calm of the adult pool. And the occasional free treat by the pool. One day it was coconut ice cream! I also loved the morning buffet especially the omelet. And the Moroccan restaurant made me a love of tajine! Perhaps the most professional service ever. Nice nice people.

Review_Title: Good base for exploring the delights of Marrakesh
Review_Text: Delightful resort with really helpful staff. Lots of personal touches to ensure that your stay is positive. The teens room was really useful for my 2 (1512) as a way to stay out of the sun. All staff very helpful but partially the lads at the family pool who went above and beyond the usual. Always fetch fresh iced water fruit and ice cream to ensure that their guests did not dehydrate. Travel to the main square easy and cheap from this hotel. Really pleasing time was had by all.

Excellent hotel staff are all very friendly and helpful. They really went further than expected to make us more comfortable than we already were. The Italian restaurant was the best! Thank you especially to the manager of the resturant! I will be visiting again!

Review_Date: Juan L wrote a review Jul 2014
Review_Text: Our stay at Four Seasons Marrakech in july has been memorable. The resort is amazing and the staff are even better.  An extensive review could be done on every aspect of this property. Everything is perfect from arrival to departure including rooms restaurants pools gardens spa. Very professional and very warm at the same time. All the Four Seasons we know are excellent and Four Seasons Marrakech is exceptional. Thank you to the whole staff! J and F
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Overall this hotel is true to the Four Seasons brand. The rooms are spacious the hotel was not too busy (although it was July) and the staff were very friendly albeit maybe a bit laxidasical with a few things (pool staff seemed inattentive at times). No real qualms though. If staying and eating at the hotel for breakfast the choices can get quite repetitive however and is limited to a buffet style. This all being said the property is expansive luxurious and spacious. Certainly the place to stay when traveling to a city like Marrakesh. Overall an excellent stay.

Review_Date: Evy V wrote a review Aug 2014
Review_Title: One of the best in service!
Review_Text: Great hotel with a world class service! Nothing bad to say about this hotel. They'll make you feel like a king/queen. Also only 10minutes from the airport yet no noise from the planes. Great food in the restaurants.

Great hotel with a world class service! Nothing bad to say about this hotel. They'll make you feel like a king/queen. Also only 10minutes from the airport yet no noise from the planes. Great food in the restaurants.

Great hotel with a world class service! Nothing bad to say about this hotel. They'll make you feel like a king/queen. Also only 10minutes from the airport yet no noise from the planes. Great food in the restaurants.

Great hotel with a world class service! Nothing bad to say about this hotel. They'll make you feel like a king/queen. Also only 10minutes from the airport yet no noise from the planes. Great food in the restaurants.

Great hotel with a world class service! Nothing bad to say about this hotel. They'll make you feel like a king/queen. Also only 10minutes from the airport yet no noise from the planes. Great food in the restaurants.

Great hotel with a world class service! Nothing bad to say about this hotel. They'll make you feel like a king/queen. Also only 10minutes from the airport yet no noise from the planes. Great food in the restaurants.

Great hotel with a world class service! Nothing bad to say about this hotel. They'll make you feel like a king/queen. Also only 10minutes from the airport yet no noise from the planes. Great food in the restaurants.

Review_Date: Cassie B wrote a review Jul 2014
Review_Title: Other Hotels are better for a true Marrakech experience
Review_Text: I'm a huge fan of the Four Seasons and booked a room here because of their quality service/quality standards. This hotel was fine; it had a beautiful modern lobby and nice pools. But the rooms were a little small and honestly not as authentic as I'd hoped. This felt like a resort erected out of the outskirts of the old city and was a pretty good distance from everything else. If you're a honeymooning couple this might be a good choice if you just plan to stay on the grounds the whole time but I wasn't interested in that and comparative to the other hotels in the area like La Sultana or La Mammounia it lacked.

Review_Date: Karen J wrote a review Jul 2014
Review_Text: The Four Seasons in Marrakech is not only another gorgeous property it is designed to incorporate delightful aspects of the regional architecture and décor. And the gardens. As in many other parts of Morocco there were roses everywhere. EVERYWHERE!  My room wasn't ready on my arrival after 15 hours of traveling but I was made comfortable and cared for while I waited. My first introduction to mint tea and the dramatic serving technique were indeed a great welcome. I needed that.    The grounds are spacious. I loved the separate family pool. No scrimping on design between the adults only pool and the family pool but it was lovely to have a choice of "activity" level.    The rooms were very comfortable. I loved both our private terrace and the spacious balcony our friends had with their suite.    The staff were gracious and helpful but never intrusive. In fact they were seldom seen. But always there when needed.

Hi    We as a family stayed 3nights for the second time and it was great. We spent most of the time by the pool as we already been sight seeing etc last time.    Breakfast was good (PS just ask and they will see if they can make it. I love my pancakes. However they were frequently burnt this time ??). Evening buffet was OK but am not a fan of marrocan food not enough spice. However the grill is good. Deserts again not my taste really. Maybe they could add a little non-marrocan food??    Overall good. Only issue which I had was  1) pool service befor 11am and when the main pool guy is absent (Friday) is terrible. You can not get drinks and genral service. I had to go find someone or even used a phone. Not major issue as I liked the walk with the nice views. However means less drinks consumed ?? Again the pool food was not amazing and slow. Thinking about it we didn't even get regular cold water which they do at every FS. I think this is because Ramadan as the staff could be on a go slow which is why I didn't really voice my concerns    2) I had the feeling they gave use the worse room and then showed us a better room at a small upgrade. Guess it's a good trick lol and it worked. But I requested they give use free high speed WiFi. However this really only worked in the room well. And I notice a lot of restrictions in that country. Ie no blinkbox??    3) A useless life guard. I would not trust him with my kids. He looked fed up lol. Anyway he annoyed me the first day so guess I had a chip on my shoulder. We was at the kids pool. I requested a ice booket and food menu (no one else around to request) . He said that was fine and 30min later nothing. So I went back and told it was coming. Another 30min and my partner goes and asks. She came back saying he being rude etc?? . so I had enough and complained to front desk. But this didn't really change any during our stay. Same life guard no other person around. What can you do??    3). OK before I came to FS I made a promise I will have the best choc milkshake I had before. However even this has changed it was a plain milkshake. No choc chips or almonds :( . little cut backs make all the difference    I guess am moaning about little things but when u had the best before anything else is second best. So let's keep it the best please FS manager as I would like to come back    Thanks

Review_Date: Darren H wrote a review Jul 2014
Review_Text: What a location what service very very top notch best hotel i have stayed in the service was excellent and staff were of the highest quality highly recommend the facilities are excellent the food was amazing made a business trip so much better the Hotel is close to an amazing city well worth a stay here!    Thank you

Some of the best service I've had in a 5 star hotel. Proper attentive staff that make one feel welcome.    Good food great rooms and two wonderful pools.    Four Season's are typically pretty good I've been to a few others. This is the most attentive yet relaxed one.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Eddy K wrote a review Jun 2014
Review_Text: We stayed at the four seasons Marrakech in April. The hotel was fantastic and the service was at a very high standard. The resort was so nice that we didn't want to go out from it.  I Would recommend the hotel to people who are looking for a relaxing resort. They have a top quality spa and several pools.

Review_Title: Nice, but not worth the price
Review_Text: Service was outstanding helpful and attentive. The suite was small and of bland design. It had a large balcony which I would have preferred to have inside the room. The mattress sagged in the middle. "Kid's pool" was not suitable for kids as it has too many sharp edges posing high risk of injury.

We visited for a week in June and almost felt like we had the place to ourselves - it was peaceful and tranquil with just a pleasant amount of guests around the place. This is a stunning hotel made even more amazing by the staff who could not do enough for you whether you wanted a car/taxi down to cleaning your sunglasses for you by the pool! Nothing is too much trouble.    The room we occupied had two small double beds a walk in wardrobe huge bathroom (with separate WC) and the deepest bath I have ever had the pleasure to use. Kettle and hairdryer in room.    There is an adult only pool and that was strictly adhered to. The separate children's pool is also as beautiful as the adult pool. The pools are stunning and with their grey slate//stone tiles makes you feel like you are swimming in a natural pool.    Prices for food and drink are what you would expect from such a hotel. Lots of choice of places to eat within the hotel: at your sun-lounger pool restaurant sports bar Italian restaurant and terrace and main restaurant and terrace with buffet for breakfast and Moroccan buffet each evening.    The hotel is a five minute ride by taxi to the main square and Souks (costing about £3.50) so that works well as you get the hustle and bustle of that but then feel you can escape to the oasis that is this hotel after each trip out. We used the car service offered by the hotel for a day in the Atlas Mountains - not cheap but a very safe and good driver who gave us a good flavour of the area.    I would return to this hotel at the drop of a hat - such a great experience.

Review_Date: Gerrit V wrote a review Jun 2014
Review_Title: The best value and high standard Hotel in Marrakech
Review_Text: Fantastic hotel stayd now for the second time and it gets even better!  Great service and personal attention.  Good restaurants and accomodation.  Checked other 5+ star hotels in Marrakech and this is overall the BEST!  One big remark during our stay 2 groups of conferences were held with very noise and disturbing people not in line with the cachet and quality of the normal Four Seaons guests.  On top the main pool was restricted from us during four days and kept only available for these groups as well as the pool restaurant! This is unacceptable for this kind of resort conferences OK but not to the dissatisfaction of the normal/loyal guests!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A real gem of a place. Rooms are superb as is the service. An oasis of calm although watch the bar prices as a small bottle of beer is expensive. The only problem with the hotel is it is tempting not to go out side of the resort

Review_Date: Kay T wrote a review Jun 2014
Review_Text: Beautiful hotel and faultless service  Reception will help with all your enquiries and arrange courtesy transport to many restaurants so you just get a taxi back  Good food but like all hotels drinks can be expensive but no more than you pay in restaurants  Surprisingly wine is expensive everywhere in Marrakech  If your looking for a hotel in this area book this one  I have met people out and about staying at other 5 star hotels wishing they had chosen four seasons  Extending the room has been simple as we leave late this evening everything is effortless it has the best can do madam attitude I have experienced
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Marc S wrote a review Jun 2014
Review_Title: A perfect stay in an awesome FS Resort
Review_Text: From our arrival until our departure was everything just perfect.  Their moto seems to be:  "Name it and we fulfill it"  If you have a wish or need help it is taken care of before you even say something.  Everybody was incredibly friendly.  Our "angel" Nabila and all of her team took so much care for us.  We wished that we never had to leave but as we had to we were really sad.    Definitely we will come back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This resort is stunning cleverly designed with beautiful features. The gardens are a credit perfectly maintained with flourishing planting wherever you look. The two pools are also beautiful large and spacious with very comfortable loungers. Nicest pool I have come across. The lifeguard is really attentive. Plenty of loungers when we were there.  The breakfast buffet is excellent and very well managed. It is clear that the entire hotel is very well managed.  Our room was large and comfortable with everything you could need a large closet minibar and kettle huge bathroom and loungers outside.  All fabulous - and to save the best until last the staff are ALL AMAZING!  Overall: thoroughly recommended. We loved it. I'm sure you will too. Can´t wait to return!!

Review_Date: Roy H wrote a review Jun 2014
Review_Text: We attended a conference at this Hotel and found it to be up to expectation. The Rooms were spacious and very comfortable. The food was excellent but the real asset of this Hotel is the Staff. What an amazingly friendly and helpful people they are. Every one had a smile and a greeting and if you looked in the least perplexed they were there to try to help. This Hotel is situated on the outskirts of the city and to get anywhere a taxi is essential. They are cheap and plentiful. The facilities at the Hotel are excellent

Review_Date: Lindsay J wrote a review Jun 2014
Review_Text: We visited this oasis just last weekend and I miss it already!  We attended a business conference and it was wonderful from the amazing greeting as we arrived to our departure it was perfect.  We had a pavilion room and I would have been happy to never leave it!  The bed oh the bed! It was sleeping in a big marshmallow pity my luggage wasn't big enough ;)  The setting was so perfect and all the staff we came across were so lovely and helpful it was indeed an oasis of calm after a visit t the Medina!  My only complaint was at our Gala dinner the waiters were not great. Our table was forgotten for starters and at the main course a couple of people had to wait for theirs.  And a seemingly small point but the centrepiece for the table...a bunch of tied roses thrown into a vase?  These were the only issues I had and didn't spoil an amazing trip.  I would really recommend this resort. it is beautiful relaxing and perfect retreat.

Review_Date: Helene H wrote a review Jun 2014
Review_Text: We have stayed in many Four Seasons around the World; this we must say was one of the best. The food was delicious and choice especially for breakfast was superb every member of staff was helpful and could not do enough to answer any questions or guide us to fantastic restaurants or recommend tours. The grounds of the hotel & facilities and general ambiance was incredible as was the attention to detail. The idea of an 'Adult Only' Pool was tranquil. We look forward to recommending this fantastic location and visiting again in the future. Thank you for making our stay exceptional for our special 30th Anniversary.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Norbert B wrote a review Jun 2014
Review_Title: Not a Riad, but an excellent choice in Marrakech
Review_Text: The variety of accommodations in Marrakech is extremely large. Authentic Riads in the Medina Golf-Resorts outside town classic hotels and resorts like the Four Seasons. For us combining the high level of service and room quality with the relative proximity to the city was important. But don't stay here if you are looking for a Riad...    The property is huge virtually 7 minutes from the airport and 5 from the old town (both by cab depending on your negotiation skills expect to spend anywhere between 30 and 100 Dirham). The gardens are exceptional almost like a botanical garden and they offer a variety of restaurants two pools (one "quiet") two bars spa and everything else you'd expect from a FS.    We had an Executive Suite in one of the wings huge bathroom large balcony. The room was very well appointed. One could not stay on the balcony during the morning (no enough shade) however. Additionally the AirCon in the bedroom had to be switched off at night given the draft that was directly towards the bed. Fortunately it wasn't too hot and there are ceiling fans but that is an issue.    Housekeeping was superb with a nice decoration for my wife's birthday excellent turn down. Also we left the in-suite safe open one day and it was closed by security for us and nothing was missing.    One of the few drawbacks: The hotel offers a service to the Djama el Fna in the early evening but is was never really clear how that works. Once they put is in a limousine another time we had to take a cab. Should be sorted out. Also front desk had us waiting almost 10 minutes once as everybody seemed busy with other tasks.    Breakfast ist buffet-style and although of excellent quality a bit rushed and very expensive. Take a cab to "La Place" and have a local breakfast coffee and croissant instead while watching the scene.    The pools are wonderful but can be busy and there a guests reserving a whole row of deck chairs early before breakfast something normally observed in all-inclusive places not in a FS. Although many kids in the hotel the "quoted" pool was really quiet. Families have their own playground.    Good lunch at the poolside restaurant and a first class mediterranean place next to it. The roof-top bar was somewhat quiet as was the bar in the main building in general guests seem to be in their rooms early. So if you are looking for some nightlife go elsewhere.    All-in-all for a day at the pool and then some shopping and dining in the city this is the place to be.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: I just didn't want to leave
Review_Text: This was the fourth time I had stayed in this hotel in a year and this was the big one- my conference. Plenty of things can go wrong with any visit let alone a conference for 130 people. This is not just my view but the view of all that stayed there. There are just not enough superlatives to describe this hotel or the staff and the way in which they worked hard to satisfy every requirement. Front desk housekeeping room service  banqueting bars restaurant spa gym management all just totally committed and dedicated to customer satisfaction so rarely found in any business. It does not matter whether it's business or leisure I wish I could take this hotel with me around the world. It has set such a standard for me to compare similar properties by. Can't wait to find an excuse to come back. Usually I'm champing at the bit to get home but I had now found a place I could call home in Marrakech

Review_Date: Damien G wrote a review Jun 2014
Review_Text: i just spent a week with my family at the 4 season marrakesh. Attention to details cleanliness friendly staff amsing food customised service superior accomodation quiteness... what else does one need?

Review_Title: Wonderful oasis away from hustle and bustle
Review_Text: Having visited Marrakech before we wanted a hotel that would provide a refuge from the chaos. the Four Seasons did exactly that. Beautifully laid out and decorated the hotel really is an oasis. The two swimming pools were beautiful.    All the staff were very helpful and attentive. Be warned though - bar prices are definitely Four Season prices!    I would (and have) recommend this hotel for a bit of luxury and pampering. Just need to try the spa on our next visit!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I visited for a weekend stay recently and had an excellent experience. The rooms are of a good size with spacious balconies to relax on. The environment feels very quiet and relaxed. The food was very good and the service received from all the staff was great. The meeting rooms and conference services were very good.

The Young Adult Club was fantastic. The staff were wonderful and the rooms and grounds beautiful. Amazing planting huge comfortable beds attentive staff. Lovely    We honestly can't fault this hotel and I can't think when I have been able to say that elsewhere.

Review_Title: Excellent service as one would expect with the Four seasons
Review_Text: Another excellent stay at a four seasons hotel. Facilities excellent and service as you would expect nothing too much trouble. Food good but nit exceptional and the choice especially at lunch was a little restricted. we stayed over half term and as you would expect their were a lot of children Which is something that you may need to consider. There was a separate family pool although noise levels from excited children were quite high.    Good location for the airport and getting into centre of town. Taxis don't have meters and you need to ensure that you have agreed a price before setting off. An excellent destination but think a week is enough. But an excellent relaxing time.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mark K wrote a review Jun 2014
Review_Title: What a first trip to Marrakech truly made by our stay here.....
Review_Text: We have just returned from 4 nights from this amazing hotel with our 9 year old son. As one expects from Four Seasons first class service (from the moment you are collected from the airport) fantastic location close to the City Centre stunning and such tranquil grounds and superb food throughout (albeit we did hear that the Moroccan buffet seemed overpriced we did not try this). The staff certainly make this hotel there were too many mention but I will single out Myriam who was superb with tips and recommendations outside of the hotel. We had a lovely Executive Room with an amazing balcony located close to the young adult centre (our son spent a lot of time here - pool table football table tennis basketball Wi X Box etc.) and the fabulous family pool. We loved the roof top Morrocan terrace bar the lobby bar / restaurant the Italian restaurant and the Azzera Grill (at lunchtimes). The courtesy cars which take you into the City anytime between 6&10pm are superb as is negotiating your way home with the local taxi drivers ! We enjoyed our horse and carriage trip around the Medina / City Centre and can thoroughly recommend the Pearl (for roof terrace drinks at sun set one of the best views of Marrakech) the Le Grand de La Poste restaurant and the amazing roof terrace restaurant at La Sultana - you must have a walk around this collection of stunning riads. The hotel is not cheap but it's Four Seasons and you pay for what you get in terms of service nothing is too much trouble. The complimentary wifi is always well received too (unlimited devices) although this may have been part of our room package. The only downside was the old towel problem at the pool it was half term so it was busy and it still baffles / annoys me that people put towels down at 8:30am in the morning and do not use the beds for 5 hours (people next to us) this cannot continue when the hotel is busy and when families are looking for sun beds. Also thought the pool bar service was a little slow at times but these minor negatives will not stop us from returning in the future sometime. Big thanks to all the staff at this Four Seasons our son James wants to return tomorrow.....PS the breakfast is awesome!!!

I have just returned from a wonderful 4 night stay at the Four Seasons Marrakech. Nothing was too much trouble for any of the staff. It is my 3rd stay at this hotel in 12 months. The outdoor pool and gardens are beautiful. I would highly recommend it to any traveller.

Review_Title: Outstanding 4 night stay, exceptional service at this excellent resort.
Review_Text: Having never been to Marrakech we went for 4 nights and stayed at the Four Seasons. We have stayed at other Four Seasons Hotels as we love the high standards. This one met all our expectations and we will definitely go back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Neil F wrote a review May 2014
Review_Title: Fantastic - a beautiful resort that truly delivers a 5 star experience.
Review_Text: Four Seasons has got it absolutely right in Marrakech. A beautiful resort catering for every whim provided by the most charming attentive and friendly staff that you could ask for. The hotel could be crumbling and falling apart around you(which it isn't by any means!!) and you wouldn't care as the staff look go out of their way to look after you so well. The whole resort is beautifully laid and out and kept in fantastic order. being only ten minutes (maximum) drive from the airport is another huge plus too. It's a true oasis of calm and luxury. Going back in July for a week and can't wait.....
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: jamila f wrote a review May 2014
Review_Text: Our stay at the Four Season Marrakech was a memorable experience. The room the food and service were superb. The garden is a paradise with a beautiful varieties of plants and flowers in a very natural way. Nice flower arrangements in every corner. Don't miss their breakfast.  It was a delightful experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sunny traveller wrote a review May 2014
Review_Text: I have stayed in a raid in Marrakech before but as I was coming with my family this time for 5 days we wanted to have a pool and go more 'resort' style. The Four Seasons was the perfect spot. Not only is is 10 mins from the airport making it a very easy destination for a shorter break sometime but it is also a very short cab ride into the hustle and bustle of the centre if town. We therefore had time to lay by pool during hotter part of day and on to the Souks etc later.    The bedrooms were as one would expect from a Four Seasons hotel. Comfortable beds luxurious bathrooms - space and noise free air con.    The food and service in the hotel was in the main fabulous. The pool attendants at your side in the blink of an eye. The Italian restaurant was stunning with morrocan lanterns reflecting on the terrace and creating a lovely ambience.    The main restaurant at similar ambience in the evening however during my visit the service a little disappointing.    In the main however the hotel could not do enough to please us. My daughter was a little ill when we arrived and being there made all the difference to us as had we been more in the centre of town I think it would have felt a little stressful. She was able to relax outside in the spacious pool area and gardens in the shade and enjoy her holiday.    I will definitely return there when I next visit the red city.

Review_Title: Wonderfull and Charming, Service, staff an Premisses are outstanding in a great environement (gardens)
Review_Text: Wonderful and Charming Service staff an Premisses are outstanding in a great environment.  We spent 5 days of relaxing and chilling family holidays.  The arrival was pitch perfect and a baby bed and gifts were prepared for our 3 months son.  The site is stunning it is 5 minutes away (taxi) from Marrakech centre.  The gardens are beautiful.  You have the choice between 3 different restaurants and this is the only small cloud in our stay the food was average and the choice limited even if service was good.  The breakfast on the other side is amazing.  SPA services are good but maybe more expensive than what they're worth.  The fitness is perfectly equipped and yoga stretching and other courses are available.  Rooms are comfortable but beds are far too soft.

Review_Date: Brad O wrote a review May 2014
Review_Title: Beautiful accommodations and five star service.
Review_Text: A very beautiful resort. Was not disappointed with anything. Guest services even went out of there way to send a guy into town to provide us with bouble wrap the evening before our departure and then insisted a tip was not necessary.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: For me a Four Seasons Hotel is like Tom Cruise : it looks good consistently delivers but authenticity is not its forte....    Seriously the resort is huge punctuated by pools manicured gardens and staff always willing to assist you. The resort is a short taxi ride from all the action in Marrakech. It is a new concept in itself : a hybrid between an oasis and a compound. You might enjoy the quiet luxurious isolation or it might give you anxiety. They have courtesy cars but forget about any discount on your "babouches" once you have been spotted stepping out of a monster black SUV at the Grande Place....    The staff I would say are great and are the strong point of the hotel. And yes if you have any non PC colonial fantasies or you fancy yourself as Jimmy Steward in "A Man who knew too much" they will indulge you...The spa is the other strong point of the resort. The therapists are busier than waxers before a Kardashian wedding so do book ahead. The masseurs are awesome: there is nothing like being told by a guy who looks like a wrestling champion that "your chakras need to be opened"....    What is disappointing is that in spite of the enormous space the tables at the restaurants are quite close. There is no dress code so the guy about to propose to this uber glamorous girlfriend can have his moment ruined by some temperamental kid watching Little Mermaid on her Ipad nearby....The same applies poolside : the sun loungers are very close and you might find yourself put off by your neighbour's untidy bikini line...    I would say that if you really want to experience moroccan culture stay away from this plastic but beautiful extravaganza. But if you like the idea of moroccan culture and want to take things slowly this might be your first step...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Pete L wrote a review May 2014
Review_Text: Beautiful resort with a great staff! Memorable experience of a lifetime! Spa food pools and the location was great. Top notch amenities plus so much to do. You just don't want the trip to end.  Will definitely go back to Four Season again. Thank you.

Review_Title: First Class Resort - Nothing to much trouble
Review_Text: I have stayed 4 nights at this resort and I defiantly would class this hotel as outstanding. From the minute I arrived nothing was to much trouble I was collected at the airport and took straight to the hotel in a lovely land rover (lots of room) checking in the hotel was no fuss and I was took to my room with 5 minutes. I stayed in a pavilion with plunge pool. A great suit with lots of space and great to relax. The suit is located in a quite position and close to the large pool also. The bed was extremely comfy also. I was travelling along and felt safe at all times which is important for a women travelling on business. The food in the resort is 1st class. Breakfast had plenty of choice. The spa is so relaxing excellent treatments and friendly staff

There's a reason that this resort is not rated more highly. I was traveling with a group of 30 women we checked in late on a Wednesday night. I was assigned an exterior room on the first floor ( as were several others.). Having read numerous trip advisor reviews I immediately asked for a reassignment to a higher. The only option was a twin room which was unacceptable to me (one of the joys of traveling is sleeping in a king size bed) so for four days I saw no sunlight. The bathrooms are luxurious (however you need to be agile getting in and out if the bathtubs) there is plenty of drawer and closet space but otherwise the room was average. Mine actually was smaller than others in the group. No desk for working. The area rug was spotted and needs to be replaced. The breakfast buffet is adequate for this caliber resort nothing exceptional except for the orange juice. The restaurant by the pool serves a varied menu the grilled shrimp was superb.

Review_Title: Nice getaway but lacks charm of a real Moroccan retreat
Review_Text: Let me first start by saying that we were really pleased with our stay at this luxurious place. I chose it mostly for its pool because that was exactly what we wanted i.e. rest and enjoy some sun! while the rooms are very comfortable and in line with what you would expect from such a chain I have to say it was not as charming as one could have hoped. this was very contrasting with our first night in the "palmeraie" in an hotel very quaint with a real garden. Because that's the only problem of the four seasons resort it is a bit in the middle of nowhere you are dependent from taxis if you want to move around and don't expect nice landscapes around your hotel it's dull...Finally though the garden is lush it still looks too new...the plam trees just look as if they have been put there yesterday there is no grass to walk on. But hey the pools are amazing quiet and the grill by the pull a real treat. Spa is nice but expensive. All in all no surprises there exactly what you would expect which is maybe what it lacks the woooaa factor...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Fabulous holiday experience in beautiful resort.
Review_Text: We are midway through our stay in Marrakech. I chose the four seasons as the group is my usual preference when traveling because of their standard of accommodation and service. We certainly have not been disappointed!  Granted the hotel possibly does not offer the most authentic Moroccan experience in terms of the decor. But the resort is stunning cleverly designed with beautiful features. The gardens are a credit perfectly maintained with flourishing planting wherever you look. The two pools are also beautiful large and spacious with very comfortable loungers.  There is a good choice of places to eat at lunch time the pool restaurant offers a good menu although the addition of a few traditional Moroccan dishes might be good. In the evening there is an Italian restaurant amazing Moroccan buffet and a bar menu. There is also an additional Indian night and Italian offering in the bar. We have tried all and all are fantastic. Breakfast is also very good.  Our room is large and comfortable with everything you could need a large closet minibar and kettle huge bathroom and loungers outside.  All fabulous - and to save the best until last the staff are ALL AMAZING! Right from the mint tea on arrival we have been made to feel welcome and at home with everyone offering smiles and assistance with everything you need. All of the waiters are so friendly and efficient and the pool guys could not be more helpful nor do more for you. Everyone on the concierge desk and reception are lovely and again will do all they can to help you. Housekeeping are thorough and happy too. The manager of the resort shop could not do more to help and inform us too.  A memorable stay and relaxing holiday in a beautiful resort made special by a great team of staff.

Review_Title: Perfect for family with young kids
Review_Text: We are loyal to Four Seasons as they deliver the same quality wherever you go. Compare to Samui or Bali it seems to be smaller and lack of local charm but it compensated itself with great kids club. We spent 5 days here with our 5 & 3 yrs boys. Family pool was heated and only 1 meter deep so we felt very safe. Attentive staff in kids club all food & drink below 5 was free which is easily 500 euros worth. We love Four Seasons with their impeccable service and smile.  Thank you for lovely arrangement in our room thank you all great staffs in Marrakech.

Review_Title: fantastic stay at the four seasons
Review_Text: As a regular guest of the Four Seasons I can say that maybe the Hotel itself and the level of guests is a little lower level compared to the other resorts I visited ( Bali Red Sea and so on) but the staff and the service is absolutely amazing. All the departments have so kind and professional people that make your vacation fantastic. Kids have two cluns where they can have lots of fun plus a huge swimming pool. it was a fantastic experience

Stated here for 4 night break. What I find really annoying is when you make a very specific request regarding your room reservation which is totally ignored. You then waste the 1st day of your break getting the issue rectified which did happen but you really expect better in a Four Seasons. Rooms are very comfortable with every amenity. Service needs tightening up it's all a bit hit and miss - especially pool service. However both service and food in Arancino was outstanding and would return just to eat here again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Lillian C wrote a review May 2014
Review_Text: After 7 days touring Morocco we stayed at the Four Seasons for our last 4 nights. It was a perfect way to end our trip. Our deluxe room was lovely large and comfortable.  Had buffet breakfasts poolside restaurant lunches pizza at Italian. Also had French mani at spa and used laundry service. Totally satisfied with everything. Just what I expect from a Four Seasons.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: When I planned our trip to Morocco and figured out there was a 4Seasons in Marrakesh I had no doubt this was the perfect place  so I booked it for Christmas. As always 4 Seasons did its best and we had the great service and cozy atmosphere  typical of the chain. My mother and I got a terrible food poising (I even passed out and started vomiting like crazy) and the hotel staff was really attentive and cared for us. This is way better than the other big hotels in city and beats the beautiful and charming ryads.  ps: the pools are beautiful so sad it was too cold for a late afternoon swim.

amazing hotel and service . the staff they are so professional I'm sure the managers of this hotel they are very qualified to be manager in four season hotel to choose they perfect team . food is great . room is very nice
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We had a wonderful stay here the staff are all very polite and helpful. The hotel grounds are beautiful and very peaceful and everything is well maintained. The food is lovely and despite receiving the wrong meal due to a language barrier we were not disappointed. The rooms are fairly spacious with a lovely balcony area. My only concerns were some miscommunications from concierge but it was quickly sorted and the very small gym....but then most people would not be visiting the gym on a leisure trip to Marrakech!

This is a beautiful hotel with exceptional service. The staff are wonderful and do everything to make your stay a pleasure. The kids club and young adults club were the best I have seen. The parties in the evening for the children were fabulous and the staff were caring and enthusiastic. There were activities suitable for my 5 year old and 10 year old boys.    The breakfast buffet and the Italian restaurant were both excellent and very well managed. It is clear that the entire hotel is very well managed - the concierge the pool boys and the staff at the spa were superb. Even the hotel shop is amazing and sells the highest quality items made in Morocco.    There were beautiful displays of roses everywhere and rooms and bathrooms were lovely. It is hard to fault the hotel in any way but it could do with one more restaurant. The hotel is so wonderful that it is difficult to leave and the food choice can be limiting after a week's stay. It would be good if the lunchtime pool restaurant remained open at night.

Very good hotel close to the airport and 10 minutes drive from the Medina. Overall a good experience but lacking in Moroccan charm.  Called reception three times regarding a car booking but was never called back - even after being promised i would be. Not what i would expect from the Four Seasons.  Room service was an odd experience as i felt they were haggling me to order more.

Review_Title: Not up to typical Four Seasons standards.
Review_Text: The accommodations were lovely. However the quality of service and the general attitude of the staff was not on part with other Four Seasons properties. In particular my spa experience was quite disappointing. I was rushed in by an attendant and then all but abandoned. On the plus side the hotel grounds are beautiful.

Review_Title: just stayed here for EASTER. A Great experience... but not spectacular one
Review_Text: we ahd a great break in Marrakech and the Atlas Mountains.. never visited Morocco before.. hotel is very handy from the airport only 10 mins transfer. It looks and feels like most 4 seasons hotels I have stayed in.  POSITIVES: Great bathrooms beds great breakfasts and lounges very helpful concierge great front of house staff awesome bars very good pool restarant... and 2 nice pools.. The Hammam spa was awesome.. Lovely Gardens...  NEGATIVES... Not Cheap wifi is charged and pool drinks service is under staffed.

Review_Date: Claudine C wrote a review Apr 2014
Review_Title: Concierge poor, hotel nice but expensive for what it is.
Review_Text: Like the person before me I am 4 days into my stay. The concierge and reception are poor. None of my requests have been attended to. I asked for my spa appointment to be changed. Was told it had been but it hadn't so there was no appointment for me. We ordered a cab for 6 of us for 7.45. It didn't turn up and we had to wait another 20 mins. No one at the hotel seemed to know what was going on. I booked a table at the restaurant and surprise surprise when we got down there it wasn't booked. Shoddy for the 4 seasons and nowhere as good as the other 4 seasons I have stayed at. Saying that the staff round the pool couldnt beogre helpful.

We stayed at Four Seasons Marrakech for 3 nights in April 2014. One word . Amazing. We were for free upgraded to a suite . The entrance with the flowers and the harp player make your arrival something you will never forget.  Surrounding gardens and pools an oasis . Fantastic room . Excellent service  2 swimming pools one for adults only very relaxing  Take your time for breakfast and try their orange juice (one of the best ever) and ham . Food is very good at the pool bar . We also tried the very good Italian restaurant .  Take your coffee at sunset at the entrance bar.  If you travel with children there is an amazing Play Room and yard with Basket Ball  Ping-pong  Billiard  Game Consoles  Games like Monopoly and Cluedo . Everything children need.  That's why Four Seasons is always a must .
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed at this amazing hotel to celebrate our 20th Wedding anniversary last week and I can say the service by the staff was incredible. We have stayed in good hotels all over the world but the service has never been so good. On the first morning at breakfast the mangoes in the fruit section had run out when I asked the waiter about it he informed me they were all finished. Within the hour there was a knock at our bedroom door and there stood the waiter with a plate of cut mangoes for me. Great service beautiful roses everywhere. A tranquil place away from the hustle of the city. The boys by the pool were also really good at bringing fruit and drinks out through out the day. They were also really helpful at finding you somewhere to sit and moving umbrellas. Thank you for a really memorable stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My husband and I spent a couple of days in the luxury of Four Seasons Marrakesh celebrating our  Silver Wedding Anniversary I think we struck "Gold." !!  The service given by every member of staff was of most high courteous standard.  The interior was a treat with lavish bouquets of roses everywhere. Our bedroom spacious with al view of beautiful garden landscaping was a perfect setting for us with the most beautiful swimming pool i have ever swam in (slate lined) and the back drop of the snowcapped Atlas Mountains was the "icing on the cake " !!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed at Four season for a week in late Feb 2014. We bought pick up service from the airport and paid approx. 100 Euro however the hotel lies literary 10 min. from the airport with a taxi. So it is a total rip off - we recommend just paying a taxi driver out side instead.    Our hotel room/suite was faboulus. We stayed in the pavillion villa with own little (cold) pool but I was so nice and ok private. The service and staff was amazing throughout our stay. SPA treatment was good and staff treatment at the pool was also great. Yoga classes was also good. We were really treated well and I felt showered with flowers when we came to the room and ate at the restaurant. We ate at all of the: the best is Bleu d'Orange.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Went only to snoop around and to eat lunch. We ordered chicken curry that turned out to be more chicken than curry. Still very new so needs time to mature. At moment little sense of place few trees lots of cement. Beautiful water features. You can sense it's corporate-owned and expect it to be what it is a safe reliable oasis for the very wealthy. Banker friendly beige tones and plush pinks in public areas. A bit far from town but if you don't mind spending time with golfers from America this is your place.

Four Seasons    We stayed here for a week in late March.    Check in: our taxi pulled up under the covered entrance and we were guided onto a red carpet and into the main communal area. We were given time to relax on a settee with a mint tea while the staff checked us in. Our rooms were upgraded and I was soon in 224.    Room: 224 is a large room with a big bathroom a huge deep bath and a separate excellent shower. Very comfy bed. Table and chairs. A separate dressing room. Wifi. Large flat screen TV with Sky News BBC World & Food Network. Bedside radio/iPod docking station. There is a hub under the TV to connect to the wired internet and charge iDevices etc. Overhead rotating fan.    The aircon had me stumped for a moment but I sussed it. The room had a balcony with settees but I didn't sit on it. The chambermaid service is excellent and I left a good tip.    Communal areas: everywhere is spotless and there's always a member of staff to ask for a coffee or a drink. I'm not into cut flowers but the rose display is special. Log fires are lit on chilly evenings. There is an attractive sitting room with a good selection of books on Morocco.    Food: on the first night we had the Moroccan Feast in the Solano Restaurant.
