Belly dancers appeared. Very impressive but we didn't do it justice.    We ate one night in the Last Call sports bar; beer and burgers are the order of the day here. There are four plasmas showing football and they will changed the channels for you to watch what you like.    Below the Last Call is the more formal Italian restaurant the Blue de Orange. Recommend for one night if you are there for a week.    Breakfast is great and is served every morning in the Solano restaurant. You can pretty much have anything you like. A great start to the day. There is a menu but you'll need to ask for it.    The pool-side restaurant is very nice. The food is perfect for a midday meal and an escape from the -sometimes- overpowering African sun.    Location: quite. 5 minute taxi ride to Jemaa el Fna square. The gardens are lovely and quiet with only the odd plane taking off take away from the near-total tranquility. The staff will get you a taxi and negotiate the price for you.    Facilities: lovely pool! Nicest pool I have come across. The lifeguard is really attentive. Plenty of loungers when we were there. Quite closely spaced but okay.    Two main pools; adults and a family pool. Also a jacuzzi pool with a waterfall adjacent to the adults pool.    Tented beds around the pool provide maximum shade. Lifeguard will position parasols for you.    Wifi is okay but didn't seem towork in the Solano restaurant. The hotel charged me incorrectly for the enhanced wifi service but immediately removed it when I pointed out that I didn't use it.    The Young Adults Centre is cool with pool table football computers (Macs & PCs) XBOX board games and a cinema. The member of staff will play you at pool if you like.    They have an ATM machine next to reception.    The concierge organised a trip to the Atlas Mountains with lunch at Kasbah Tamadot. They upgraded us to a Range Rover which was appreciated.    Staff/Service: A-mazing! We came away thinking this is +the best+ service and staff we have ever come across. The couldn't have been more friendly and helpful. Simply awesome.    Overall: thoroughly recommended. We loved it. I'm sure you will too.

Review_Date: Pascal G wrote a review Mar 2014
Review_Text: This is really one of the best hotel I stayed in. I went for a conference for 4 days and really enjoyed the food sun and bedroom. It is hard to fault anything in this hotel except maybe the price. But then again quality always comes at a price! Overall a beautiful hotel. It is in the centre but not best location if you want to walk around. It is too far for walking to the medina for example.

Review_Title: Luxury in the Heart of Marrakech
Review_Text: Great pool scene. Great service. Great overall ambiance. BEST ROOM SERVICE IN THE GAME. This is the place to stay if you want to visit Marrakech but dont want to feel gross/dirty/crowded/overwhelmed. It is about 5 min cab from Medina (center of town) and the setting of the hotel makes you feel like youre in an exotic country. The restaurants are just ok (food not great/over priced) and the spa is just ok (overpriced). But the room service is ON POINT. The rooms are spacious very large bathrooms great products very clean very quiet and very nice hotel staff. Very reasonable rooms also at about $400/night. Will stay again on my next visit.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple
Reviewer_Location: New York, New York, United States

Review_Date: Richard C wrote a review Mar 2014
Review_Text: Context - we stayed seven nights at the beginning of February - being very lucky with the weather we were able to enjoy the pool area of the hotel most days as well as using many of the hotel amenities restaurants and going on two excursions recommended by the hotel (not pre-booked).    Room (ground floor) classic decor all modern amenities comfortable AC worked well (vital!) and bed wonderfully comfortable. All staff superbly friendly and service was great. Pool area delightful - separate pool for small ones was most welcome.    Restaurant slightly limiting - breakfast menu could have been more imaginative and wide ranging and Moroccan restaurant could have had greater choice - one could get "Moroccan'd out" before too long! And the other restaurant (Italian) had similar limiting menu. But no issue with quality of food and beverages.    Most liked - accommodation and staff and excursion to the Atlas Mountains.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I recently was lucky enough to spend the weekend at the Four Seasons Marrakech and absolutely loved it! More like a small resort than a hotel the property and grounds are beautiful. I was in a Deluxe bedroom which was very spacious and luxurious with a cute balcony and modern amenities. The staff were really what made the experience exceptional though - from the warm welcome as I arrived to the friendly goodbye each member of staff I encountered was warm friendly and willing to do absolutely anything to make my stay perfect. An added bonus is that the resort is only a 10 minute drive from the airport and about the same from the Medina.

The Four Seasons Resort in Marrakesh is a large and sprawling hotel with rooms both connected to the main hotel and in ‘pavillons’ around the landscaped grounds. A map is provided at check in but it is quite impossible to follow and when I asked the concierge to mark where my room was on the map after long deliberation she still got it wrong!    Our room in the main area of the hotel was spacious with an entry hall walk in dressing area and large bathroom with separate toilet and bidet  as well as the large high ceilinged bedroom and sitting area. A sliding door opened onto a terrace with loungers and day bed and a private garden area the perfect setting for work I had to do disturbed only by birdsong. The buffet breakfast was included in our tariff. It was excellent.    The main room was pleasantly unspectacular adequately furnished for all needs with tea making facilities and bottled water supplied daily. It is however inadequately lit. The high double beds were the most comfortable I have slept in anywhere. There is no folder giving information about hotel services restaurants meal times etc. in the room but I have been told it was available on the television. As I did not come to Marrakesh to watch television I did not discover it. Housekeeping was friendly and there is an evening turndown.    The bathroom has double sinks a large powerful shower and a bath so deep and wide my children could have swum in it. There is an illuminated magnifying mirror and a hairdryer. Toiletries are L’Occitane (no bath oil) and all other personal needs bathrobes slippers and lots of towels are provided. A vase of roses was placed on the vanity. Again though lighting was inadequate.    Staff are well trained willing pleasant and smiling. Public areas are spacious and at least while we were there roses were displayed everywhere. There is a very nice indoor/outdoor bar - but check the bill as ours was incorrect. The grounds are landscaped and well cared for and there is a large heated swimming pool. There is a beautiful spa and whilst the girl who did my pedicure was not slickly professional she was very nice anxious to please and did a good job. However about £80 for a basic pedicure did not encourage me to have other treatments.    Several Trip Advisor reports have complained the hotel is not up to the standard of other Four Seasons hotels. Whilst there were slight ‘niggles’ - the terrace door was hard to lock one of the bath taps was sticky one bathroom door sprung open - I’m sure that if I had complained they would have been fixed.

Review_Date: Eric R wrote a review Mar 2014
Review_Text: Our company reserved the entire resort for a company function. Pool staff food beds all first rate. My wife especially enjoyed the spa and the traditional Haman ?? skin treatment. Several bars pools were heated so the water was beautiful. Very close to the airport (5 min).

Review_Date: Kathy A wrote a review Mar 2014
Review_Text: We stayed here for four nights and had one of the most memorable breaks we have had in a while ! The hotel is stunning and every detail has been painstakingly thought of. The hotel is only a ten min transfer from the airport and offers a stunning setting. The rooms are spacious well designed and very luxurious.  The staff are all polite ready to please and clearly take pride in their work. Nothing was too much trouble and everyone always smiled and extended a greeting.  We used the Spa while we were there and had a most amazing massage. The menu of treatments means there is something for everyone.  Highly recommended resort
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: An amazing experience and property! The hotel is stunning and you know you're in paradise the moment you enter the lobby and are warmly greeted with mint tea. The details make the difference and this property knows this!  I can not say enough about the staff and how wonderful they are. The food was great - Bleu D'Orange was outstanding!    Another fabulous Four Seasons experience... Will be back!

We arrived to The Four Seasons Marrakech after spending 3 days in the Sahara. Greeted with cool towels and mint tea definitely put me in a refreshed mood after our 9 hour drive. Our Villa poolside second floor was very gorgeous. The walk in closet was huge and stored all of our clothes and luggage so they did not sprawl across the room GIGANTIC bathroom - with wonderful bath products. Our king bed was extremely comfortable and linens were soft. A sprawling terrace with padded lounge chairs to absorb the delicious afternoon and evening breezes was perfect. We often slept with the door open and enjoyed the breeze and I loved listening to the Prayer Call from a nearby mosque. So beautiful.    We ate primarily at the pool restaurant during the afternoon. And I cannot lie after having many tangines we were "tangine'd out" and REALLY enjoyed the burger and fries!!    Service was top notch concierge always hepful.    Ambiance - fresh roses - EVERYWHERE!!!    I loved the gorgeous light fixtures and lamps - a very romantic atmosphere. In fact we found a local craftsman in the souk who designs for lamps for hotels and purchased one. When it is on at night - you can see a beautiful patterned design from the shade on the ceiling and it makes me think of the wonderful Moroccan nights we had.    About 40-50 dirhams for a 10 minute cab rideto the Medina. Always ask a cab when returning back to The Four Seasons the price - and keep that price in mind. Most likely you will be charged double if you don't agree before hand. We took a tour of the Medina and Souk with a guide and then navigated on our own the next day. There is no rhyme or reason in the Souk - wander and lose yourself inside - you will eventually find your way to the main square.    I would be so lucky to return to Marrakech one day. If you do get there - consider a few days in the Sahara beforehand.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The staff is warm and inviting. The rooms all have wonderful views of the property or the mountains. The central nature makes it easy to see many parts of the city. The sports bar in the center complex has many screens to watch soccer and a well stocked bar.

Review_Title: Not very well suited for a business traveler.
Review_Text: Our experience was just fair. Service was uneven. Food was good but hard to get a cup of coffee in the morning. The workout room does not open until 7AM. The site is not walking distance from anywhere. You will need a bike or car or taxi to get to the marketplace. The last shuttle from the market returns to the hotel at 5PM So you can't stay there for dinner but you can catch a cab.

Review_Date: B R wrote a review Mar 2014
Review_Text: My partner and I did not stay at the Four Seasons we decided to go for lunch on 21/03/2014. Upon arrival we were welcomed by traditional singers and dancers playing instruments and dressed in traditional clothing. It was very nice to see and entertaining something different to make a mark of our visit. The grounds are lavish and large every detail is beautiful clean and full of colour. We were welcomed by staff and sat outside on the terrace were we took photos etc.  Our waiter was great and went above and beyond and said he could arrange meals to suit that were not on the menu.  The food and drinks were lovely and the price was decent. Same as going to any other high end restaurant in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We spent here 3 nights. Hotel is superb beautiful well kept gardens nice pools. The room was big spacious bright with a nice big bathroom.  Hotel lobby is lovely has tens of vases full of thousands beautiful pink and red roses.  We were actually given an upgrade by the hotel as we had booked a deluxe room (situated in the hotel building) and at check-in they gave us a pavilion room this being actually located in one of the villas.  The room was very nice as I said but the walls waaay too thin (one afternoon I wanted to take a nap but the housekeeping next-door was so loud I couldn t sleep). I actually went out and asked them three times to be a bit less noisy but the women from housekeeping didn t seem to care about my request they went on laughing talking and slamming doors…  The bed mattress was too soft not me nor my husband could sleep well. And there were no teaspoons in the minibar (only some plastic sticks) which as a matter of fact is unacceptable for a 5 star hotel. There also was no milk for the coffee.  Gym is very nice also the spa is nice has good therapists. Restaurants serve good food the sports bar was nice good service.  Staff is very helpful smiling and nice but somehow chaotic. Also they do not understand much English and their directions (through the resort) may be misleading. They also may completely mess up your order (bringing you the wrong wine for instance it happened to us in the Azera Grill restaurant). They should simply have said they do not speak English as my French is pretty good…These matters are no big deal of course in a 3 star resort but not in a Four Seasons as their prices are high and they simply do not live up to their name...  Other than these downsides I loved the is hotel and I liked spending time in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The Four Seasons Resort in Marrakech is stunningly beautiful immaculately maintained professionally operated. It is outside the old walled city in a stand-alone resort setting. That is one of its great charms but also its greatest drawback. If you are traveling to Marrakech for the lovely weather and plan to sit by one of the pools relax in the quiet of this lovely oasis and enjoy the fabulous spa this is the place for you. If on the other hand you are interested in experiencing the sights sounds smells and feel of the old city try something inside the Medina. La Maison Arabe is fantastic with one of the finest restaurants in the city. Riad le Clos des Arts is a romantic gem. If budget is not of concern The Royal Mansour is incredible.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Amazing first time experience of Morocco
Review_Text: Hi  I recently stayed here for a work meeting for four nights. On arrival I was greeted with great warmth and friendliness after a long trip down. The tea was a nice touch and I was escorted to my room. What can I say - the level of comfort was amazing i only wish I could have stayed longer in the bed each day!  Food wise the breakfast was great - no complaints. Great service each morning and nice fresh food. Each day we had a buffet lunch which was average in my opinion. I did not find the fish that tasty but otherwise the salads were nice.  Each day the staff were always very friendly and attentive which was a pleasant surprise. I would really like to come back some day in a personal capacity.

Wonderfully close to the airport/city centre but not blighted by noise this is the perfect location for a quiet stay in Marrakech.  In most respects this is a very good holiday hotel only let down by minor niggles.  Our accommodation was comfortable and the linen of a good quality but the room service was very uneven. On the first day the suite was not serviced until early afternoon which got us off to a bad start. A deeply irritating issue was room service tapping on the door to make up the sofa bed and turn down the room every evening just when we were sitting on the sofa to enjoy a drink at 7pm - it took most of the week to instil that after 20.00hrs was our preferred time. Glasses were not replaced when removed and both tea mugs had large chips in them. The other annoyance with the room was the breakdown in wifi for most of our stay and the fact that no one communicated the fact that the service was available in the reception area.  On the plus side our suite had a lovely sun filled terrace and garden the gym and attendants there are excellent the grounds and general feel of the hotel are as you would expect.  The restaurants - Bleu d'Orange serves delicious food and has an excellent manager but what a shame that very young children who clearly want to be asleep are admitted. The pop up Indian restaurant was fun but we felt that the Moroccan buffet restaurant was expensive. Breakfast is efficiently staffed and offers a wonderful range of hot and cold food - sadly it was just a bit too chilly for us to sit outside to enjoy it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We were there for four days. Almost everything is impeccable. We had a wonderful stay. Great location. The pool was beautiful. It really is a fabulous hotel. After some hectic tours definitely it is the sort of hotel you need in Marrakech. Would highly recommend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We had 8 wonderful days at this beautiful resort late feb/early march. The staff were superb always willing to go to any length to make our stay as perfect as possible even to the extent of packing our souk purchases in a well insulated box ready for the flight home! We were upgraded to a Pavilion room in the gardens completely quiet luxurious and comfortable. Having had the buffet breakfast for 2 mornings we would highly recommend the A la Carte option as the dishes are freshly prepared delicious and worked out more reasonably priced. We had dinner in Bleu d'Orange and Inara Bar and Lounge several times and all the meals were very good. The Moroccan Buffet in the Solano Restaurant was disappointing and expensive. Lunch (and regular coffees) at the Azzara Grill were excellent. The adult only pool was wonderful especially as we were there during Moroccan school half term. The pool attendants were delightful extremely helpful and regularly plied us with little refreshments. The location for us was perfect 10 mins from airport and the Medina and although we loved the buzz and chaos of the Medina it was sheer bliss to return to the oasis of calm (and fresh air) of the resort. Wifi is patchy and could be frustrating for those for whom this is vital during your stay. The hotel is trying to sort this out at the moment we had no wifi for a couple of days as they had complications while trying to improve the service. It wasn't a big deal for us and Nick the hotel Manager was extremely apologetic. Any small problems like wine glasses not returned after servicing our room were immediately sorted. We didn't use the spa but fully intend to rectify this when we hope to return next year!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Fantastic relaxing stay - long weekend, beautiful location
Review_Text: Spent a long weekend at the Four Seasons Resort - fantastic place very relaxing authentic didn't feel like a hotel - only 5 minute taxi ride to the medina and comfortably walked back in the afternoon. Great pools fantastic gymn and tennis - great place to relax and unwind for a few days. Staff in particular were superb with great attitude very slick service all round.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Kelly I wrote a review Mar 2014
Review_Text: We recently stayed at the Four Seasons Marrakech with our two sons aged 11 and 13. I see why the hotel is ranked #1 as a family-friendly choice. My boys absolutely loved the 'Young Adults Club'. The staff was amazing and went out of their way to make sure my boys had fun and felt welcomed. They never wanted to leave the hotel! The hotel and grounds are gorgeous. Marrakech is crazy so coming back to the hotel each day after exploring the city felt like a sanctuary. Definitely a must stay if you have children but just overall wonderful if you don't. The restaurants at the hotel is very good and the staff is very attentiive and accommodating.

This is a beautiful facility with 5 star service and great food (esp room service). We stayed 4 nights with the first noisy from upstairs (kids I think bouncing what seemed like basketballs off the floor well into the night) The front desk solution was "well they are leaving tomorrow". Okay so I let it go but then there was dismal internet service throughout the stay despite me paying extra for high speed. I complained and they removed the charge but I still had to leave the facility to send/receive emails from my laptop. The final straw was when I got the bill and they initially refused to honor my confirmed rate for the 3 nights I booked. While in Morocco I called and requested to come one night earlier and they quoted me a higher rate for that one night but when the invoice arrived they higher rate was for all 4 nights and an argument ensued. I was insulted and embarassed by this and it really took the edge off what otherwise would have been a fairly good experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Steve L wrote a review Mar 2014
Review_Text: The rooms are very modern and well equipped the only small issues we had were due to a lack of understanding when we booked some shopping excursions and the wifi wasn't working for the final couple of days. Having read some of the other reviews I find it incredible that people talk about the price of taxis etc if you are paying €400+ per night then you can afford their Range Rover Sports to drive you around at 600 MAD per hour.    Spa was fabulous and restaurants were very good. We raised the concerns with reception on departure and they gave us a small discount as a goodwill gesture which was completely appropriate.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The property is beautiful but not in the center of town. Need to take a cab to and from town and should cost aprox. 7$ each way. Negotiate price before getting in the cab(if not you could be in for a surprise and cost could be as high as 30$ each way). The spa is wonderful although pricey compared to others spas in Marakesh you are at the four seasons and it is expected to be a little pricey. The property is friendly to families and has a kids club and designated pool for younger guests. Breakfast on the property is good but pricey at 50$ per person.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Good but still room fur improvement
Review_Text: Stayed for 6 nights with wife and 13 year old son...overall the hotel is extremely good with excellent facilities especially for our son who was able to get his daily fix of table tennis  pool and IT stuff. Tips....book a table for dinner if you intend to eat on one of the hotel's three restaurants...they get busy especially the Italian restaurant. Check your reservation very carefully as my internet confirmation included breakfast but the hotel's computer system did not....after providing evidence of my booking the front office amended my final bill....slightly strange as you would expect the two systems to run off the same data. Finally whilst the selection at breakfast some of the cooked items were a little on the cool side.....something that can and should be rectified.

Review_Date: arnold c wrote a review Feb 2014
Review_Text: a lovely five star hotel. Excellent accommodation friendly and helpful staff. easy to reach the souk by taxi or the gardens. Beautiful grounds to walk around and a very good gymnasium staff were only happy to help and advise.

True 5 star service from the moment we arrived at the airport to the lovely car that they sent to the moment we departed and our driver checked us into the airport. Other hotels need to learn from the Four Seasons!

The weather what not that gorgeous but just fair enough to use the pool. the kids loved it so much they just long to go back. The welcoming in the room on Valentine' day was brilliant as well as all the attentions the personnel had with us and our 3 little devils. I do recommend the Kids for all seasons club where even the most "bored -I-like-Nothing" kind of kid will be queuing to get there first thing in the morning. And us mothers going solo on holidays without our husband for the fist time we could enjoy the Marrakech sun as well as the visits to the Souk and the spa. Just the best February holidays ever !

Review_Date: Noel H wrote a review Feb 2014
Review_Text: It didn't get off to an auspicious start. Dull weather encouraging guests to decamp to the lounge and light up. I asked the lounge attendant if smoking was allowed and he said it was not hotel policy so when it happened later I spoke irately with Nick the hotel manager who patiently explained that while it is discouraged there are no laws prohibiting it in Morocco. This makes it difficult for the superb staff to balance demands of clearly competing guests' interests which was alleviated when the sun came out as the splendid outside terrace with its lemon trees and stunning views of the Atlas Mountains could be used by smokers. The legendary four seasons service was in evidence all week and even though there are only two restaurants plus the lounge there was real inventiveness about the changing menu themes. I do wish that they wouldn't serve doughnuts at the breakfast platter but only because my children gorged on them rather than the splendid fruits and great egg selection but that says more about my ability to persuade my children to eat what is good for them. The pools where great and when one got fed up with the family pool  a quick swim in the adult pool was like a spa treatment in itself. Talking of which  one the best spas I've been to though the little boutique shop which is along side it is underwhelming in what it stocks but overwhelming in the service it brings including finding me a temporary pair of sun glasses for the many sets I forget to pack. Overall a great week  terrific staff though the ground floor exec suite was rather dark and didn't really invite spending much time except in the titanic sized bath which the children spend ages in.

This hotel lives up to the Four Seasons brand but with an Arabian flavor. Our group of more than 150 persons arrived after 11pm nearly 5 hours after our expected arrival. Even so the hotel staff was waiting for us. We were greeted with delicious mint tea. Check-in was handled efficiently with two tables set up in the lobby (not the check-in area) for our key distribution. By the time we got to our room half of our luggage was already there (and the rest arrived a short time later). Our group was in Morocco for a conference. Because of our size a ballroom was used to serve our daily breakfast which included an omelette station. The hotel property covers a huge area. The grounds are beautiful and need to be explored. Everyone was pleasant and doing all to make us feel very welcome. This was particularly important since you realize that many of the staff did not speak English but they smiled warmly. The hotel was not a long distance from tourist attractions and shopping and hotel staff was very good about arranging transportation. Our standard room was large with a very relaxing seating area outside the sliding doors. The large bathroom contained a deep soaking tub and a rainfall showerhead. This Four Seasons did not disappoint. It is definitely worth a return stay. For a group as large as ours I did not hear of any complaints during our 4 night stay.

Review_Title: Beautiful Property close to the sights.
Review_Text: Great property with beautiful views of the Atlas Mountains. Service was efficient and friendly. We spent a coupe of nights here after spending a couple of nights in a Riad in the middle of the Medina completely different experiences each good in their own way.  Service was great grounds and property are beautiful room was large and had all the confidences including a beautiful balcony. Pool area was great and services was efficient and friendly. Could have had better selection of traditional dishes in the menu though.  It was an easy cab ride to many of the sights but not within walking distance.  Spa experience was superb hamam was beautiful and we really enjoyed our experiences. Don't ever hi k I've been so thoroughly scrubbed in all my life!  Room service was great we asked for Moroccan crepes which were not I the menu and they were delivered with no fuss. This being said prices in the hotel were very high for food and beverage.  We did encounter a coulee of hiccups at check out which were eventually resolved but was rather unpleasant as we tried to make out way to the airport: at first they could not figure out how to apply a Four Seasons gift card towards our charges but finally figured it out then they said their credit card machines were not working. I understands that but it felt like they wanted us to pay cash which we had not planned for (several hundred dollars). As I mentioned they figured it all out in the end but would've been a different experience without nth is hiccup.

Review_Date: Debi O wrote a review Feb 2014
Review_Text: This hotel is amazing. You get a good feel for the Moroccan culture. The service is fantastic and the rooms are unbelievable. The only thing missing is a good gift shop - they only have a small boutique and it only sells a few things. There was no place to buy drinks snacks or toiletries. Highly recommended though!

Maybe there are better located hotels but we would really come back if Marrakesh comes into our travel plans again.  Things did not start well. We were not picked up by a Range Rover as arranged but by a van instead same when we went to dinner that night. The next morning same van was waiting. A quick complain with the concierge was enough to get the Range Rover through the whole stay.  The Pavilion suite is roomy with two full bathrooms but ours was at the end of a long corridor our private garden and sun bathing area facing a wall... The hotel was almost empty so why do that? I did complain the next day but since we had unpacked I told front desk I did not want to change.  The above would normally make me give an average rating but during the stay we noticed how staff made their best to make our stay the best possible.  During our 4 day stay we noticed small things which are important. When going to the breakfast buffet for another round previous plate was quickly removed and a new set of silver was placed on the table. Most of times in other hotels we have to ask waiter for a new set...  We wanted to have dinner at the hotel Italian restaurant but it was closed on Monday (so as Sunday) so since we did not want Moroccan food we had two options either go out or eat again at the hall restaurant with a very limited menu. Since room service had a larger menu I asked to order from that menu. After a quick authorization from the manager we had what we wanted. Waiters were simply fantastic especially because they did know the dishes they kept the chef on the phone so they could explain them to us not mentioning the warm smile of the lovely waitress. My wife and I were really happy.  Bellmen and drivers were all polite nice and helpful. House keeping just perfect. Concierge arranged for a full time guide Abdul a very good and educated guide. By the way prices in Medina are much higher than in the new city stores.  When driving us to the airport the hotel driver like in most Asian countries took us to the check in and handled luggage and boarding passes. I do recommend this hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This hotel is just pure class. You walk in and immediately feel calm. The service is top notch the bedrooms are fantastic - my room had a balcony with the mountains in the background and the food just stunning. Highly recommend this gem.

Review_Date: Yashua H wrote a review Feb 2014
Review_Text: We absolutely loved this hotel! it was simply beautiful and breathtaking. The Moroccan architecture and the riad design is lovely The staff were the friendliest I have seen anywhere else always greeting you with a smile rooms are lovely and clean with great views. We loved the design of the bathroom with the unusual looking bath tub. The hotel premises is huge and there are places to relax everywhere the poolside the garden the cultural center. I cannot say enough about the spa its lovely be sure to do the Moroccan hamman before you leave or just simply enjoy the Jacuzzi and the warm ambience of the place. I would recommend the four seasons without hesitation and would certainly be back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Johnw W wrote a review Jan 2014
Review_Text: The Four Seasons is a truly great hotel with superb staff. The service was impeccable and the hotel all you could ask for. The management were always around which in most hotels is not the case. The food was perfect. Fresh roses throughout the hotel were just beautiful.    Cannot recommend this hotel enough.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed at this hotel as part of a group (50 people) from Jan 10-14 2014 and overall our stay was excellent. The deluxe room we had was very spacious the bed/pillows comfortable and the bathroom extra large and comfortable. The added bonus of a walk-in closet was very handy.    The attention to detail at the hotel was seen throughout our stay from the welcome goodies left for our 3 yr old son on his child bed to the service of the famous Moroccan mint tea served in the lobby area around the clock.    Room service and housekeeping were top notch - fast efficient and very friendly.    The only downside to our stay was the breakfast buffet. Although the food was tasty there wasn't much variety day after day. We had 4 breakfasts at the hotel and the menu was the same for all of the mornings. The spread included an omelet station array of pastries and breads fruits cereals and hot dishes but a bit of variety would have been appreciated.    We didn't have a chance to use the kids center or the pool (since we were on a tight schedule with our group) but I'm sure it would have been super based on the walks we made around the vast property.    I'd definitely recommend the hotel to anyone staying in Marrakech.

Review_Title: Perfect luxury hotel and family friendly
Review_Text: My husband and I stayed here for one week with our baby during the month of January and we had a truly wonderful stay. The service was impeccable delicious food with a very professional restaurant manager - Charles. The staff at the Spa were particularly special in their welcome and after visiting many Spa's around Europe I can say without doubt the Four Seasons Marrakech have a very special team.  The hotel organised an Apero evening which allowed us to meet other guests and staff over some food and drinks highlighting again a very personal touch which we thoroughly enjoyed.  Upon our departure we were waived off by the ever helpful concierge and the hotel manager Nick Yarnell who made us feel so welcome throughout our stay.

I took my mother to the Four Seasons Resort in Marrakech for 4 nights over the Christmas period. It was amazing! The accommodation service and food was all excellent! Everyone was extremely welcoming and helpful. The gardens were beautiful and lying by the pool having a drink in one of the lounges or visiting the spa provided instant relaxation after exploring the city. I honestly could not fault anything.

Review_Date: Anatoly C wrote a review Jan 2014
Review_Text: We have been to many luxury hotels but FS Marrakech clearly stands out for its superior service and unmatched quality of the staff which make you feel so welcomed from the moment they pick you up from the airport. Superior degree of care and a desire to go an extra mile. Highly recommended.

Review_Date: Strasho N wrote a review Jan 2014
Review_Text: By reviewing this particular hotel during my last stay in Morocco I have to say that I regret spending in Four Seasons Marrakech only one night. I find the hotel amazing - the overall architecture and design are so good and the gardens are absolutely beautiful. These are one of the best that I have seen in Morocco.  The service is perfect the staff are helpful and polite the rooms are spacious and beautifully decorated. The breakfast is generous and tasty. I find very important also is the feeling of relaxation even when you're there for work. I would like to extend my greetings to the staff of the hotel for their efforts to make everybody to feel at ease as much as possible. As I said the only problem was my too short visit there. Hopefully I will not make the same mistake twice :)))

Review_Title: Dreamy and immaculate resort and grounds
Review_Text: I stayed here at the Four Seasons for work a few months ago and our conference was also held here. On the business side the facilities were beautiful and the staff couldnt be more accommodating to participants.  The guest rooms were modern and comfortable with gorgeous Moroccan style. The local sweets as a welcome gift were a nice touch and the bathroom with a rain shower large tub and l'Occitane bath products was luxurious. And this is a very small thing but I loved how you could dim the lights in the bathroom and room. A personal patio with comfy chairs right outside our bedroom doors made a great place to sit in the evening or early morning with coffee.  The food was amazing a blend of Middle Eastern Mediterranean and international cuisine such as American pancakes or French macaroons.  One of the other amazing aspects of the resort is the decor and the attention to detail in terms of how the furnishings accents and color pallets were selected. Every other day a selection of fresh roses are placed in all common spaces and it really fills the air. Another nice touch.  Lastly the staff are attentive and very hospitable.  If your priorities in Marrakech are luxury and service this is the place for you. If you want to be in touch with the culture and the core of the city I suggest finding a quaint riad in the old town.

Review_Date: Cynthia R wrote a review Jan 2014
Review_Text: I stayed here soon after it opened which was simply too soon. Two years later I have only good things to report from the much needed rest I found on FS signature beds to the impressive breakfast buffets every morning where attentive staff knew to bring my green tea every day after the first request. I especially LOVED the spa treatments I had a few and the fantastic Indian yoga instructor. I very rarely take a hotel's yoga class because they are just not suitable for someone who practices seriously but this was refreshingly different -- I can't wait to go back for more.    Managers were walking around the property making sure guests were being taken care of and that all was in good order. The concierge made some great dining recommendations outside the hotel and the staff made sure my taxi knew exactly where to take me each time I left the property.    For anyone who wants to explore the exoticism of Marrakech but wants a little certainty in their luxury hotel while they are being adventurous in all other aspects of their stay this is the place for you as well as for any doing business in Marrakech as I was because everything works here so smoothly which can't always be said about everything else in Morocco.

Beautifully kept and maintained property. Stunning grounds to stroll through and to enjoy the gardens. The swimming pools are great. Two very large ones. The first intended to be family oriented and the other called the quiet pool. Both were lovely. Wonderful pool service and opulent sunbeds towels and cabines for sun-worshippers.  Two excellent clay tennis courts and a resident coach The Fitness centre ( free ) was very luxurious with many state of the art exercise machines and a separate weights room.  Housed in a different building in the grounds was the Spa featuring saunas hammams Jacuzzi plunge pools ( all free ) and leading into treatment rooms for every imaginable beauty and massage treatments in elegant surroundings.  The hotel is an oasis in Marrakech in a district/suburb called the Hivernage just outside the centre of Marrakech. A taxi takes you to the main square in 5/7 minutes at a cost of £4. A walk there is 25mins.    Accommodation at the hotel is luxurious. I had a Pavilion room which was incredibly spacious with very large bathroom and walk-in wardrobe. Giving on to a large balcony. The beds are super-comfortable.  Rooms are either in the grounds of the resort ( Pavilion rooms ) or in the main hotel complex. It takes only two mins or less to get to the main complex from Pavilion rooms.    Beautiful and elegant public rooms bars and spaces. Reasonable choice of restaurants serving varied cuisines from Moroccan tagines and couscous and international fare to fine-dining options at the signature restaurant Bleu D'Orange.    Plenty to do and to occupy yourself with at this resort hotel and a great place to unwind after hectic sightseeing in the bustling old souks and main square.    Highly recommended. Of the standard you would expect from Four Seasons. Sophisticated international clientele. Extremely courteous and helpful staff throughout the property.    Not a hotel for those on a tight budget but a truly wonderful resort for a special treat or occasion or a well-deserved holiday.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My husband and I spent 10 days at the FS Marrakech with our two very young children (a pre-schooler and a baby). We have had a fantastic time.  My husband booked a suite in the villas which was perfect for accommodating a junior bed and cot bed. We had plenty of room for the four of us. We were also very well located near to the family pool kids club and spa and within the "green area" of the resort. This worked better than staying in the main building because of the children and the buggy.  The family pool was heated at 28C which meant our children went every single day! it was supervised so we didn't have to go with my eldest all the time and could watch the pool from our seats.    The kidsclub was excellent Nabila and Imane were fun and enthusiastic my eldest had a lot of fun and played within their soccer area and did a lot of crafts and obviously developed some cool friendship during the stay.    The spa was top notch although we are not experts. My husband and I really enjoyed all the treatments thanks to the professionalism and care of each of the therapists. The ambiance of the spa is not spectacular but we didn't mind as the importance resides in the treatment execution for us.    We tried at several occasions both the Moroccan and Italian restaurants and we were delighted each time and when it comes to food we are particularly difficult so it says a lot.    All the catering (restaurant and room service and pool food) was very accommodating with the children offering children menu and also purees for my baby. You don't pay the food for children that young which is very thoughtful.    The pool area was our favourite spot during our stay. We had such a relaxing time. Everytime we needed something we got some help and our requests were worked upon very swiftly and smoothly. By the 5th day all the staff knew our little habits and fads which is so nice when you are on holidays.  And we were very happy to leave our little ones to the kids club whilst enjoying our time off.  The guests were unassuming despite the prices of the rooms at xmas and new year's season and the general atmosphere around the pool and in restaurant is warm and relaxed.    The housekeeping was punctual reliable and smiling and attentive to the baby's items.  I had asked for childproofing before our arrival and I got the full treatment with the little pond completely gated a steriliser nappies supply etc etc. This means we didn't have to travel with too many things. They also offer a daily laundry service for children under 10 you can wash up to 10 items every day for £30 or so....such a good idea.    We are definitely to go back as it is perfect for relaxation even with the children.    The only minor areas of improvement are the wifi (so rubbish but it might be a problem with Morocco in general) and also we hired a nanny for the 10-day-stay for our baby through the concierge and she was mediocre. If you are to use this service (which is very expensive!) do ask for someone with strong references and who can really play with your baby and is enthusiastic. Ours was lame and all the sitters for other families were as lame as her. Such a shame if you compare them to the dedicated child-loving fun team of the kids club.    Also I would consider buffing up the concierge team at peak hours because she was overwhelmed by requests.  But those are minor things our overall stay was a total bliss and cant wait to return and so is the rest of the family.

The best hotel in Marrakech! Service was impeccable!    Day 1: Arrived late at Marrakech Menara Airport from Casablanca and our driver Said is waiting for us. We originally booked the cheapest car available (Mercedes E-Class) but was picked up by a very spacious and clean Mercedes Van. We arrived at the hotel was escorted to the lobby and sat down. While the receptionist checked us in we were served a traditional Moroccan mint tea. When the receptionist came back he told us that we have been upgraded from the Superior Room to the Pavillion Room with direct access to the pool. He then escorted us to the room with the buggy along with our luggage. He room was beyond expectation (wished the view could be better but since I've been upgraded who I am to complain?) it was spacious clean and luxurious. Love the outdoor area the extremely comfortable bed and huge toilet with deep soaking tub. Went to the Moroccan restaurant for dinner it was just okay. Overpriced food. Service was okay and a bit rude (waiters talked loudly and laughed while we were eating)    Day 2: Ordered breakfast and it was amazing. The various pastries are to die for! We went on the city tour with an English speaking guide for 55 euros which I think is way overpriced for the amount of information he gave us. He was only useful as he knows his way around the maze-like Souk. The hotel shuttle service between the hotel and the medina area was definitely a huge plus! We originally planned to have lunch at the poolside restaurant but since it was packed and the hostess was quite rude (we asked for a table of 2 and she just pointed elsewhere while she escorted another party behind us) so we decided to have lunch at the Italian restaurant instead. Again food was mediocre and overpriced but service was good (probably because the manager was there to keep an eye on things.) We order room service for dinner and it was just okay. Laundry service was good (valet picked up laundry at 10am and gave it back by 5pm the same day)    Day 3: We went to the Atlas mountains with Said (our driver who picked us up from the airport) and he was amazing (and cute!) We booked the Mercedes E-Class but was given the brand new Range Rover. We were very very satisfied! We had an amazing day and Said showed us all the good places to see and went beyond our expectations to satisfy us (we gave him a $60 tip cuz we love him!) We ordered room service and it was excellent. Furthermore when we got back to our room I realized that the headset I put on the table is gone so I called the reception to them check it out. Security came to take my statement but my headset is nowhere to be found.    Day 4: We checked out. We asked for the internet fee to be waived because we were having trouble with it (slow and keeps going on and off) - no problem. The manager came to apologize for the missing headset and told us that he would waive the transportation cost of around $70 to make up for it. Amazing customer service! Again we booked the E-Class but was given the Range Rover along with our favorite driver Said to take us to the Taj Palace.    The only thing I regret is that I didn't stay at the Four Seasons longer!  I wished I didn't move to the Taj Palace (I want to see where they filmed sex and the city!) LOL    Thank you for a wonderful stay Four Seasons Marrakech! Say hello to Said for me! :)

Hotel was great. All you expect from the Four Seasons- great food impeccable service and lovely grounds. Make sure to have breakfast at the hotel. The food is amazing. I am not a fan of buffets but this one was a level above the rest. I would highly recommend for a stay in Marrakech.

Fabulous hotel with great staff and absolutely amazing surroundings. The property itself is enormous and great for walks whilst the various restaurants provide a wide ranging blend of food. The kids had a brilliant time at the Kids Club - this was a particular highlight for us as it meant we had some quality time to ourselves!

I think the best feature of this property is the amazing service of the staff. Everything seems to be extremely courteous and helpful. I bought some gifts from the market and went to the gift shop to ask for bags for me to carry on the plane. They offered to wrap these gifts for me! I was extremely impressed.  Overall this property is very high quality. It is very clean and quaint.  I think breakfast could be a lot better. The selection is rather limited and there is not much meat available if that is important to you. The sausages taste quite unusual.  The gym is well equipped but I am not sure why they constantly turn the AC off. The city is hot and the work out room is steaming hot but they just leave the doors open and keep the AC off. I asked the staff once and he closed all the doors and got someone to turn the AC system on. But I felt like it's such a big production for them so I just tolerated the heat at the gym for the remaining 4 days.  The spa is a must go!! I had this treatment by Tarek and he's absolutely fantastic! It's highly recommended.

Exceptional Four Seasons service at a beautiful property. Personnel were warm friendly and very helpful. Very memorable anniversary stay with hotel providing fresh flowers daily champagne and treats for our anniversary. Enjoyed the facilities including the restaurants pool and spa. Hotel also arranged transportation to the city Atlas Mountains and Essaouira. We cannot wait to return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Sarah H wrote a review Dec 2013
Review_Text: We arrived late at night and once through the gates of the resort we were instantly transported into a magical candlelit oasis of calm. Check in was efficient and pleasantly relaxed over a cup of mint tea. The Deluxe Pavillion suite was rather spectacular with a cavernous lounge and spacious terrace with plunge pool. The breakfast was hearty and delicious with ample choice for even the most discerning of tastebuds. We tried the Italian which was ridiculously authentic (i lived in Italy for several years) and even equipped with a wood fired pizza oven! The Azzera grill served healthy fare and was also delicious. The complimentary evening car was a much appreciated service that we made good use of. The resort was impeccably maintained though the defining and exceptional feature of this Hotel is the staff. Without fail they were all professional and friendly always going the extra mile. The only suggestion i could make is that for wheelchair users the accessible room though well equipped with Japanese toilet and walk-in shower could have done with a few more handrails for support and a shower chair).All in all a wonderful stay.

My daughter and I stayed for 2 nights for her 21st birthday treat and I can safely say this is one of the nicest hotels I've ever stayed in. The staff were so helpful and friendly and truly couldn't do enough for us. We were made so welcome from the minute we arrived. We even received a lovely cake for my daughters birthday. We had room service the first evening and it was delicious lots of it and very well presented. The busy medina is just about a 5 minute taxi ride away but it's so nice to return to such a beautiful peaceful place after a busy day out.  Thank you to all the staff for making our stay so special.

Review_Date: Scott A wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Title: Beautiful property with expected 4 Seasons service
Review_Text: Another very positive experience with 4 Seasons resorts. The property is beautiful the rooms the same and the service was excellent. We dined one evening in the Moroccan restaurant and the food was excellent. Each morning we had the buffet breakfast and while a bit pricey was an outstanding array of quality food. The location while in the city is a little on the fringe. We were there on pleasure and so the Medina area was a natural destination. We did use the complimentary car service (6pm-11pm) once and that was fine. A service that ran during the day would have complimented the on-site experience. As it was we used taxis which also meant a haggle over the price each time.  All in all however it is an oasis in an oasis - a vacation within a vacation - while staying at this resort.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Marwan K wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Title: All to try it, it's really amazing
Review_Text: It first time I visit Marrakesh and it's the first time I stay in one of Four Seasons hotels and resorts really I enjoyed my stay the warm welcoming the process of check in hospitality kindness of staff the hotel condition the quality of food service the helpful concierge and more all are excellent really the stay in Four Seasons make you like the place you are visiting for all activities.

Stayed here in November. What can I say absolutely wonderful. Shirt transfer time from the airport speedy check in and shown to our room very quickly.    we stayed in a PAvillion room with direct access to the swimming pool. There were two single beds and ample room for a pull out sofa bed.    There was a huge flat screen tv with English channels although limited. Also there was a large choice of music you could play through the tv.    Massive bathroom with his and hers sinks separate bth and showe. The bath is probably the biggest I have ever seen in a hotel room...lovely and deep.    There was ample wardrobe space and a separate dressing room.    The grounds around the hotel are immaculately kept and all the staff are very pleasant always take the time ti say hello / good morning.    The resort its self is huge and we got lost on several occasions. Whenever we asked for directions to the bar or restaurants the staff would go out of the way to actually take you to your destination whilst telling you lots of information about the hotel. I have never encountered staff with such pride for where they work .    we stayed half board and the food was absolutely delicious. Breakfast there was ample choice of hot and cold options  and the orange juice is to die for the best I have ever tasted.. Our evening meals were most tasty cooked to a high standard.    Marrakech-The resort itself is about 15 mins by taxi to the Medina and the markets of the old town although it wasn't what I was expecting it was still a wonderful experience and I would definitely go back

It's the third time in a row i'm staying at FS Marrakech. It seems training has paid off. The staff have come a long way since my last stay and everything was perfect this time. Staff from Front Desk to Housekeeping are all smiling and very friendly always eager to please. The grounds are beautiful as ever. I had a Deluxe room with a very nice view of the Atlas mountains on a clear day. Breakfast was high quality and consistent but make sure you order the items that are not in the buffet spread (e.g. pancakes and waffles and the detox smoothie YUMMY). A special thanks goes to Felix the new GM of the hotel. His simplicity and attentiveness make him a real credit to the property. If I wanted to be really picky I just noticed that the small refreshments that are usually sent out to guests hanging out by the pool were not available this time but let's blame it on the weather. It was not pool season yet. Also the themed pop-up bar was very cool though it doesn't attract a lot of people. I will be back. See you in a few months FS Marrakech.

Our Abercrombie & Kent tour of Morocco ended in Marrakech. A great place to end a terrific tour. Beautiful and extensive grounds. Very helpful and accommodating staff who made you feel pampered. Great food even the room service food. Very good-sized room. Their freelance hair stylist returned in the early evening in order to accommodate several people from our group. Very nice gift shop with unique items. The colors of the flower arrangements in the lobby and around the hotel were breathtaking.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I stayed here for 4 nights and had a great time. All staff are friendly helpful and professional and make sure you have a memorable stay. The hotel has beautiful gardens a great swimming pool great colours and fabrics everywhere and very stylish and the breakfast is very sumptuous. Loved every minute of my stay! Highly recommendable..

Review_Date: Martin Y wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Text: Having stayed at many Four Seasons around the world Marrakech didn't fail to deliver in any way another memorable trip thank you!    Very clean open fresh feel lovely splashes of rich colours and use of delightful fabrics.    Rooms very spacious offering everything you can require. All positioned very central to the main facilities the only downside in my opinion would be the terraces on the ground floor Pavilion rooms didn't offer much privacy as they are dotted along the pathways.    Lovely spa not badly priced either considering this is a top five star hotel book in advance as though very popular.    Main pool with plenty of loungers cabanas too frequent pool service kids pool that was heated again with cabanas for shade in the hotter months.    Great choice of restaurants from poolside casual dining to elegant settings fantastic selection to choose from and all exceptionally high standards.    Overall you cannot go wrong with Four Seasons ticks all the boxes surprised they aren't ranked higher than they are!!

Review_Date: Tim P wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Title: Best hotel I have ever stayed at. Period.
Review_Text: My wife and I stayed at the Four Seasons Marrakech for four nights and had the most amazing time. From the moment you enter the gate you know you are at a special place. Everything is perfectly manicured the staff are all look genuinely happy to see you and immediately you forget about any stresses from wherever you travelled from.    The rooms are spacious and very well appointed as nice as any 5 star hotel I have stayed at in the world. The facility is breathtaking and the lighting music colors and smells create an amazing ambiance.    The absolute best part is the staff. We arrived 40 minutes after booking and were immediately whisked away to the poolside restaurant to enjoy a complimentary lunch while our room was prepared. Everyone from the moment we arrived was very welcoming and never at once felt like they were after your wallet for anything. Every staff member has a smile they all look very nice and put together and they are always ready to share a laugh about something. You can tell that they want to be there and take pride in providing the best customer service in the world.    After staying at The Four Seasons Marrakech I cannot wait to stay at another Four Seasons property on our next trip.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Kevan L wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Text: this vast complex is situated close to the airport we were only here for a few days but it was a truely great experience the room was huge and very modern the whole place was well run and the staff were amazing the hotel lobby had an amazing smell and I can safely say one of the best hotels I have stayed in

I stayed at the four seasons resort Marrakech for one night and it was one of a kind experience!  The beauty of the resort was so special the service extremely professional and the decoration fascinating!    The pool was large and very clean the special amenities provided there were very exclusive and the staff so friendly. Though more attention is required at the spa and gym.  The room was very spacious and marvelous with its private outdoor set and large bathroom and distinctive amenities.  The breakfast was great but one or two items were not very tasty as they should be (such as the labneh).  Although this is a resort but it was very well maintained concerning the cleanliness of the roads the transportation from the rooms to the main building or the restaurant.    I recommend anyone visiting Marrakech to have a stay at this unique hotel.

Review_Date: fabrice D wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Text: Our stay ( we are a family with 3 kids) at the Four Seasons Resort Marrakech was fantastic. The staff is very friendry and carring the hotel is elegant and is luxuriously decorated our suite was perfectly designed for a family with kids ( a sliding door can be closed between the master bedroom and the living area ( Japanese toilets in the bathroom) the kids club is great ( small pool lovely staff) the 2 main restaurants are good and affordable and the Spa is beautiful. It's pretty rare for me to describe a stay without complaining about something...maybe the very fist time. We will be back soon.

Review_Date: Justine H wrote a review Nov 2013
Review_Text: Great location - 15 mins from airport. Warm welcome on arrival we had interconnecting rooms for my husband and 10 yr old daughter and I. More than enough space. Very comfortable beds and lovely bed linens. Staff very friendly and helpful. Kids club worked well introducing our daughter to English speaking girls and therefore having great fun in the kids pool most of the day. Breakfast good lunch nice too by the pool or restaurant. All in all a lovely break. Hotel felt safe and small allowing my daughter to occasionally walk about hotel without an adult which felt very safe. You can see planes taking off from the airport whilst by the kids pool but didn't bother us as they flew away from pool and not over it. Thank you

The resort is hardly fifteen minutes away from the airport by taxi. It is a very nice resort with total of 4 floors and Riad rooms! Service is fantastic and rooms are brilliant. Especially 1 I was staying in in the main building. It is a good place to hold conferences workshops training sessions etc.

Review_Title: Could have been great but unfortunately...
Review_Text: Before going to the Four seasons Marrakech with my husband we were really looking forward to it because every time we travel we go to a Four season if it's available in that city and have been satisfied since then. However when we first arrived and wanted to check in the front desk manager didn't believe we were married and did not want to check us in which is completely outrageous. People do not usually carry marriage certificate and we have never been asked to provide one. I can understand it's Morocco but we were in Sofitel Casablanca before and when they asked if we were married our answer was enough for them (because that is how you treat your customers). Not believing a customer is treating them as liars and this is completely unacceptable. We don't go to 5 stars hotels like The Four seasons to be treated that way it is not some cheap hotel that can afford to talk that way to customers especially loyal customers.  But after that everything was good we really loved the hotel and the staff was wonderful but this incident really got on our nerves and we couldn't enjoy it as we were expecting. Not to mention that after coming back to our room one night at 1 in the morning the shower wasn't working THE SHOWER and we had to wait for a guy for about an hour to fix it that is really something. But at least they were kind enough to remove that night from our bill (after we requested it of course). What a shame!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Very nice hotel very clean very comfortable bed and room...  Food is nice and clean although a bit slow to deliver...  The gentleman who plays at the lobby is amazing...  The facilities are very good we had a big conference and exhibition it was very nice...

Review_Date: Jon D wrote a review Oct 2013
Review_Title: Superb Luxury, fantastic staff, great location
Review_Text: Went there on a weekend break and WOW we were transported into the madness that is Marrakech. What a great place and the Four Seasons Hotel was fantastic the staff brilliant and the gardens fantastic.    Felt really safe every where we went the Souk is just a mad place and really fun to look around and the hotel an oasis of calm in a balmy world.    Spa treatments were out of this world    All in all fantastic for a short break if you want to spoil your self go for it.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Miki D wrote a review Oct 2013
Review_Title: Lots of Moroccan magic with perfect five star luxury
Review_Text: It is a true Four Seasons resort with excellent facilities great attention to details lavish and very Moroccan interior design and full of positive surprises. Even though our lost luggage somewhat poisoned our arrival this was an amazing experience    Pros:  - Good location a bit farther away from the Medina than many other hotels but given the short distances and the smell in the inner city it is more a benefit. 10 mins on taxi to everywhere  - Outstanding service  - Great rooms ours had a small garden and terrace as well plus a super useful extra luggage room  - Amazing interior design breathtaking halls  - Three huge pools excellent swimming  - Grandiose outdoor design with wonderful palm trees  - our personal favourites: the stylish lamps in the staircases hung from above    Cons:  - despite having 5 restaurants the food is a bit boring few real local specialities - but of course very high quality  - bed is too soft    Alltogether an amazing resort perfect base to discover Marrakech in style.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Choose to stay at the Four Seasons because of friends recommendation. I stayed two nights prior to four seasons at a riad in mid of the medina and thought a break at the four seasons would be relaxing.    Hotel facilities and location:  The hotel occupies a large estate which is out of town. To go to New City or Medina it costs 40-50 Dhs (don't get ripped off some taxi drivers asked for 100). However if you have seen Marrakech the hotel is large enough if you just want to chill out by the pool and dine and drink within the estate. There is hotel cars going to town between 6-10 pm (one way).    The resort is probably the largest in Marrakech. There are two pools (one adult only) which were quiet during my stay. There was also a shop a spa and a gym with tennis court. There are few restaurant including an Italian that occupied its own building an international (with Moroccan food) in the main building a pool side restaurant that open during the day and a bar. In terms of facilities I don't think there is any better resort in Marrakech.    Room:  I was allocated a deluxe room that was of good size and with a garden view. It has a very comfortable bed and well equipped bathroom. There is also a changing room which was handy. Wifi was available throughout the hotel for free unless if you require super high speed connection. There was a media hub and the entertainment provided on TV was good.    Service:  Service was unevent - started patchy but ended good  When I arrived by the car I was disappointed with the service. no one greeted us and I had to find the reception by myself. In the evening when I went to the restaurants and bars again I had to ask for assistance since no one was to be seen to help. Having said that the service at the spa was first class. Very friendly and very attentive (especially a lady in glasses) and service at the pool has been consistently great ( especially Rachid and the lifeguard). The second day experience improved significantly. The manager at the main restaurant during dinner shift was chatty and very friendly. All of his team recognise you and deliver great service. Next day breakfast we were served by Alt who was fantastic and again very friendly. The same level of service was seen at the bellboy desk especially Rachid    Food and drink:  We found food and drink pricy at the hotel but the quality of product was great. We had sandwich by the pool dinners and breakfast and food quality was top notch.    Overall it's a nice resort with good facilities. It's great if you just want to relax or host a conference.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Max Ray wrote a review Oct 2013
Review_Text: I stayed here for one night last week whilst on business. The resort is perfectly located for the airport being barely five minutes journey away. Peaceful and perfectly maintained my suite (bedroom bathroom dressing room and balcony) were impeccably presented with all those little extras you expect of the Four Seasons. I ate dinner in the bar and was well looked after by the staff. Breakfast was perfect as were the conference facilities. The hotel staff was excellent over all. I look forward to staying here again and can't come back soon enough.

Review_Date: Irene M wrote a review Oct 2013
Review_Title: Best hotel I have ever stayed at
Review_Text: This is so far the best hotel I have ever stayed at in all my travels.  The ambience and the staff courtesy all of it was breathtaking.  The driver who picked us up from the airport was great and the car (ranger rover sport) made us feel very important. They had provided water in the car and the driver was very cautious and polite.  The rooms are very very clean and the snacks were changed ever so often I felt like I was having them for meals.  The bathtub felt like a swimming pool :)  I would definitely go back to this hotel.  Advise: if you plan to stay at this hotel please make sure you have enough time to enjoy it. I was sad that I spend most of my days at conference and had very little time to enjoy it.  Very nice place.

Second time and won't be the last for sure. Amazing paradise away from the busy city yet close to all attractions. Staff are very friendly. Kids club is a superb place for kids with 8 hours of activities including lunch face painting pool movie etc... Thank you Imane and Nabila for your care & hospitality. The kids were welcomed by a nice setup in the room balloons cupcakes posters and presents they just felt special:) Quality of service is amazing very cozy and friendly environment. SPA is well equipped with Jacuzzi Sauna heated pool. Gym is good as well.  Overall its the right pace for kids and families we relaxed and kids had lots of fun.

After a hot and crazy day at the Medina this is where you want to go "home" to in Marrakesh. It was like an oasis for my sister and me during our 3 day trip. Rooms and facilities are amazing and customer service was outstanding. Don't miss the afternoon tea at the lobby everyday! Hotel is high end but if you want to pamper yourself... I recommend it!

Review_Title: Beautiful hotel 5 mins from the Medina
Review_Text: If you're looking for a resort hotel just outside the medina in Marrkech then I'd strongly recommend the Four Seasons. The hotel is set on a vast plot with beautifully manicured gardens. There are two swimming pools one which is adults only and is designed as a lap pool and one which is suitable for children with jacuzzis adjacent to each. Breakfast is a well stocked buffet. The rooms are large and well equipped with the signature Four Seasons beds (so comfortable!)  During off peak months only one of the two restaurants are open each night but the hotel will happily make dinner reservations for you in the new town or medina and arrange for a taxi to take you there.  The staff were absolutely excellent during our stay. I was unfortunately unwell with a stomach bug and they were so incredibly helpful arranging everything from doctors coming out to visit to fetching prescriptions from the pharmacy at all hours of the day. I cannot thank them enough for their help they made a fairly difficult few days very bearable. Thank you! We'll be back to enjoy the bar spa breakfast buffet properly soon!!!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: You just have to stay here if visiting Marrakech
Review_Text: I was staying here for two nights as part of a decision making process to hold a major conference here next year. Everything about this hotel has quality stamped all over it. The level of service and attention with a friendly delivery from all employees throughout the hotel overlays a very attractive property that is pleasing on the eye and makes for a wonderful combination of business and pleasure. It seems to me the hotel constantly reviews how to please its guests and i was intrigued by the opening of a themed speakeasy bar to add variety. Apparently themes will change every month or so. I stayed in a Premium Room 320 which had everything you need plenty of space and a very nice balcony with chairs and lounges overlooking one of the pools. Very convenient for the center of Marrakesh and the airport . I just cant wait to go back spend longer there and hold the Conference

Best hotel in Marrakech. Beats the Mamounia in flexibility and customised attention to every guest. Whle not in the Medina it is in a very quiet area of town 10 minutes from the airport and 10 minutes from the center of the city.

Review_Date: Diana S wrote a review Sep 2013
Review_Text: The hotel and staff were delightful.  Apart from the gym I found the beautiful gardens great for an early morning power walk - extensive and very quiet.  The room - which was probably "entry level" was incredibly well appointed.  A bit out of town - but bearing in mind the madness of Marrakech it is an advantage  Would go back
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Stayed at the Four Seasons in mid September. The hotel is perfect if you want complete relaxation in beautiful surroundings. Gorgeous Pool area - two pools - one adults only. The Spa is  really lovely and worth a visit or two during your stay. It is nice to come back to the peace and quiet  of the hotel after the madness of Marrakesh.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The Four Seasons Resort Marrakech is a paradise of tranquility and luxury amongst the hustle and bustle of beautiful Marrakech.    Staying only one night in August 2013 I was greeted by the very welcoming doorman who presented my family and I with cold towels and bottled water much needed after a warm taxi ride under the summer heat.    Then disaster struck. My fiancé had left her phone in a grand-taxi that dropped us off at the resort. After 5 minutes of panic and informing the aforementioned man who welcomed us he rang through to the security team who had tracked the taxi ordering the driver to return. Luckily enough the driver returned the phone after a few minutes thanks to the security team. You would not find this level of security anywhere else in Marrakech.    Check in was smooth. The two love-birds (you'll know what I mean if you have the luck to stay at the Four Seasons Marrakech) are beautifully chirping away as you are presented with mint tea nuts and dried fruit to snack on whilst check in is completed.    The rooms are all stunning with magnificent l'Occitane soaps shower gel shampoo and conditioners. I doubt there are better rooms in Marrakech. They are all modern and contemporary with a Arabesque feel which adds to the Moroccan experience. There are tea and coffee making facilities complimentary bottled water a large walk in wardrobe with a giant flat safe in a drawer. Playing around with the ceiling fans was amusing! Our interconnecting rooms both had a stunning terrace with a plush-pillow sofa to enjoy the views of the resort or Atlas mountains. Housekeeping staff are also attentive. Our housekeeping member addressed us personally and asked us if we would like anything else (more products water etc) as we waited on the terrace for him to clean our room during turn-down.    I was stunned by the level of detail at the hotel. They even offer at a charge a personal trainer to jog with you around the hotel to exercise and explore the grounds of the hotel. I'd have loved to have done this if I had more time.    The pool area (don't forget to try the jacuzzi as well) is like non I have ever seen. Pumps of sun cream is available where the towels are located and we were given small bottles of ice cold water by the pool staff as well as a delicious frozen fruit purée to cool us down.    I was however very disappointed by the slow check-out. I was charged for watching 2 movies on the entertainment system and this was NOT stated they are liable for a charge. That left a bitter taste.    However there is no better hotel or resort in Marrakech.    You will love the Four Seasons Experience.

Review_Title: Lovely hotel to escape and unwind
Review_Text: I stayed here for 4 nights with my husband for a short break without the children. We stayed in a deluxe pavilion room which was spacious with a lovely large balcony with table chairs loungers etc. In the room there was all mod cons you would expect IPOD docking station etc free wifi bathroom products were lovely and the room was well cleaned. Plastic stirrers instead of metal spoons for tea/coffee was below 5 star. We used the gym which was well equipped and the spa. We had treatments outside the hotel Hammam etc (see my other review) as the mark up in the spa we thought was ridiculous. Likewise we didnt get a transfer with the hotel it is only 2 miles from the airport and was 150 dirham in a taxi compared to 5 times that with the hotel for a 6 minute journey.  The hotel is about 10 minutes away from both the old and new town. We loved the old medina it is crazy and frenetic but great fun for a few hours to then return to the sanctuary of the four seasons.  We had room service breakfast very day for us there is nothing more decadent than having breakfast served on your own balcony!  We ate at the pool restaurant and the Moroccan and Italian both were okay ie 4/5 but not magnificent. We found the service great both in the restaurants and around the pool nice treats juices and sorbets whilst on your lounger.
