Compared to other 5 stars we found the prices reasonable the Moroccan white wine was surprisingly good and the prices certainly didn't make us flinch.  The hotel lays on a complimentary car in the evening to take you out which we used and thought it was a nice touch.  We would definitely recommend and would return with the children for a short break. I am a harsh critic so would defer giving it a 5 star as I think they could improve the food but if I was to return to Marrakech I wouldn't hesitate in booking this hotel I would look no further.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: ros m wrote a review Sep 2013
Review_Title: a beautiful hotel, amazing swimming pools, friendly staff
Review_Text: the resort is wonderful good size room extremely comfortable bed and enormous bathroom with gorgeous deep bath. Was very quiet in early September which was good not sure it is a particularly child friendly resort but perfect for adults. Amazing swimming pools with lots of quiet areas to sunbath. Excellent variety for breakfast but the evening meal let the hotel down. Excellent location ask the hotel to organise a guide for you as is slightly intimidating going round all the shops.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A place to relax in luxury after a hectic visit to the Medina
Review_Text: The Four Seasons continues to maintain a five star standard at this resort hotel just 15 minutes by taxi from the centre of Marrakech. The resort is quite large and is set off to great advantage amongst the beautiful gardens and water features. We had a pavilion room overlooking the adult only pool on the first floor and it was a good choice well equipped and of an excellent size it had a lovely large terrace with recliners and was very private.    We only used the complimentary shuttle on one occasion as it is a first come first serve basis so at busy times you will need a taxi if you have a table reserved in the Medina.    Breakfast was good but we had dinner the Solano restaurant which was distinctly average by comparison to the meals we had in the Riads of the Medina.    We are great fans of the Four Seasons brand and I would always mark the hotels at 5 stars and in some cases more however although the staff were very friendly this hotel has not got the personal touch that I would expect of the brand which is why I have marked it lower than I expected.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Ampol J wrote a review Sep 2013
Review_Text: The room is nice -- but shower is slow . The location of the hotel is away from medina so it good for the escape and stay in the hotel . Outdoor area is very beautiful - well made garden . As for the service -- Over all is an Okay -- not thing to WOW about -- and one more thing to added --- House keeper walk into the room w/o knocking the door three times in my 2 nights stay . Need I say more ?

Review_Title: A true Four Seaons Experience - High Recommended
Review_Text: Just finishing an 8 night stay at the Four Seasons and I really only have positive things to say.    I have stayed at many other Four Season resorts and other 5* Deluxe hotels so my standards can be verging on the high side but I can honestly say I would return here without a second thought. The last time I was with Four Seasons outside of the UK was Sharm and although wonderful it did put me off the chain.    We opted for Pavilion Suite in Marrakesh which we’d highly recommend for anyone who wants to spend time around one of the 2 pools with the added benefit of extra living space (I saw the Premier Rooms and they were equally grand but on a smaller scale).    The service as always with Four Seasons is truly impeccable from housekeeping to the Spa. A special mention has to go to Andre Buldini who dealt with any small issues that we had with a level of professionalism that I admire.    We have our next holiday booked in November in Bangkok for the Banyan Tree but after our recent experience here at the Four Seasons we shall now investigate moving this reservation to the Four Seasons Bangkok.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I travelled to Marrakech on business and the group was registered at the Four Seasons. I have to tell you that it was fantastic! So happy to enjoy all of what Morocco is the market place the sights the many local restaurants yet return to such a great hotel to use as base camp. I enjoyed actually staying at the hotel for dinner after eating out for several days - the Italian restaurant on the premises is very good and a nice change of pace from the local cuisine. And for the non-smokers a smoke free room and open areas that allow those who do. I definite must.

Review_Title: The Four Seasons Marrakech is a delight.
Review_Text: Surrounded amongst palms and plenty of greenery the property oozes tranquility. The main pool is beautiful. Pool staff Mohamed and Rachid are stars and are on deck at all times. They both made my stay! In close proximity lies the pool restaurant/bar which serves wonderful fresh and generous food proportions by Chef Marc Tauch. The concierge crew are lovely and provided me with some excellent recommendations. The rooms are well appointed and are equipped with all necessities. I organized a transfer from the airport which I would highly recommend. After all it is nice to have your chauffeur await you and escort you to the hotel. Check-in is practically effortless. Overall a wonderful week. The Four Seasons I salute you. CG

Review_Title: Could be perfect, but little things let it down
Review_Text: Booked in for restful few days and certainly experienced a quiet time where there seemed to be a lower than expected occupancy. The service both in and out of room is faultless. Housekeeping is perfect. By why oh why do we have to have intrusive rock music in all the public areas? There is nowhere outside of the spa where one can have a quiet time. By the way the staff at the spa are amazing! Go for hamman and the excellent massage from the inhouse team. Otherwise the weakness is with the food offering. Despite two restaurants open in the evening the menu was uninspiring. What is needed is a small bistro offering a variety of light meals. Sorry to be picky but this would convert a very good experience into an amazing one. Don't forget that there are two swimming pools one child free! Bliss! Some fellow guests felt that as they were advertised as heated they were too cold in which to swim. Try the sea!! A great break thank you Four Seasons.

Review_Title: Beautiful hotel amidst the hustle & bustle of vibrant Marrakech
Review_Text: Our family of 5 spent a fabulous 7 days in the beautiful oasis of calm that is the Four Seasons Marrakech. From the moment we arrived the cooling hand towels as we stepped out of the car the welcoming and smiling staff the relaxed registration in the lovely lounge sipping traditional Moroccan mint tea and trying the nuts and dried fruits offered to us to the very efficient check in into our rooms the service was impeccable. A special family birthday trip was made even more special by an upgrade of our room and champagne roses and birthday cake in our room and a beautiful array of sweets and notebooks in the childrens' room. The staff cannot do enough for you and the service is superbe. Holgar the head of the Four seasons Marrakech has a dedicated friendly (in an unobtrusive way) and very efficient staff. The facilities are lovely and restaurants very good. The Bleu d'orange was our favourite the only sadness being that their roof top terrace was not open. The concierge was super booking roof top terrace tables for us around Marrakech booking guided tours and exchanging currency at a very reasonable rate. The staff around the pool were wonderful always willing to be of service. All in all a great experience for us it made a special birthday even more special. Our thanks and gratitude to Holgar and his staff we hope very much to return.

Review_Date: LC B wrote a review Sep 2013
Review_Text: Just had hamman and massage at the spa. If you are visiting please do it. Get Tarik to give you your massage. Best massage ever and I have had a lot. The property is lovely and the rooms are well appointed.

We had a week here in July during Ramadan which meant the hotel was very quiet which was just what we wanted really.  The room we had was on the 2nd floor overlooking the pool area and was large beautifully appointed with balcony and dressing room. Couldnt fault it.  All the public areas were immaculate and all the staff were absolutely brilliant they couldnt have been more helpful or friendly.  At the poolside the large parasols keep the sun away and the pool side staff regularly ply you with complimentary water and fruit nibbles.  On slight raised eyebrow although to be fair this applies to most 5 star places the breakfast is extortionate so we took a £5 cab ride and stocked up with cereals juice and milk for the week for 3 of us price of one breakfast for one person for one day and enjoyed breakfast on our balcony instead :-))

Review_Date: Maudie B wrote a review Sep 2013
Review_Text: Love our stay at his beautiful hotel. Excellent service beautiful grounds. Adult and Children's separate pools. The food was very good. Cold towel when you arrived back at the hotel were a welcoming sight it the heat of the day.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Yes the hotel is beautiful but the real selling point for me was the service.  Staff really went out of their way to ensure you had a wonderful stay.  I had booked the basic room but was upgraded on arrival which I was very thankful for.  The room was very luxurious and had the legendary four seasons bed(super comfortable).  I am very much a fan of separate adult/family pools and I particularly appreciated the service around the adult pool. Regular treats served throughout the day.  Breakfast buffet spread was alright but ask for a la carte options-ps the French toast was delicious.  On a couple of occasions house keeping hadn't quite maintained the room properly but this was very quickly rectified as soon as I brought it to their attention.  I would like to mention how helpful the concierge was(sorry can't remember her name) she organised all my restaurant reservations and provided the hotel car most evenings.  I would not hesitate in recommending this hotel and very much look forward to returning.

Great Resort Great Staff A little costly but well worth the stay. Your are treated like a Royalty. The staff bend over backwards to make you feel comfortable. Centrally located in Marrakech. I would definitely go back again in a heartbeat.

A lot has been said about the positives of the hotel. All which I agree with and will be coming again.    However areas to look out for;    Marks on bank notes will be rejected (ie pen marks stamps)    One day our room was not cleaned properly. Just say and they fixed the problem. So don't be shy in my opinion. However it was the girls room so very messy from the start lol.    Courtously Car broke down one day but no backup car which is odd when there is about 6 cars around? Might have been better to have a van that drops and picks up like other FS. However going in a top of the range 4x4 very nice (one way only).    Breakfast was "ok" but bread really hard to eat. You can ask for other things to be made ie chicken sussages as I dont eat beef. Full news papers are one day old and not always present (which is odd for FS) which is a shame as for me having a daily paper at the pool side is very relaxing.    Not much on TV channels (unless u wana pay). Mostly French and DVD collection average.    Exchange rate ok in hotel. You can get little more in madina but for me I just used hotel.    Could do with more evening entertainment for aduts but one day they did have a classical music player which was very nice    I did have some confusion about upfront money/deposit. The staff said they will take about £400 out of card but took £6k. I think it was a language barrier. Could job I have this available in my account lol. All returned on last day.    Weather can be hit and miss. We had two days of cloud but still warm and 5 days of baking heat.    Ps if you want big Mac food ask for one next to train station as it's closer and less busy. One day we just had takeaway in our room including pizza hut.    Overall it's the best hotel and will be back hopefully

We had the chance to stay here 2 nights in August and this is in my opinion the best Resort in Marrakech! You can find all facilities over here to have a wonderful vacation not only for couples but also for families with children.    Positive points:  * wonderful and well maintained resort with a main building and pavilions in a wonderful garden  * huge complete and well decorated rooms with nice bathroom (with DVD TV with very good infotainment sytem Ipod dock etc)  * awesome fitness center with the latest Technogym equipment (with two seperate areas) with very clean and nice lockers with sauna  * FREE wifi in the entire resort (very good reception)  * very good overall service even at the swimming pool (free water a smoothie etc)  * very nice breakfast buffet the best we've had in Marrakech so far (a lot of variety) and nice terrace  * two nice and huge swimming pools one for familes with children and one quiet pool (adults only) very nice concept!  * Spa center with complete distinction for male and female clients free use of sauna jacuzzi small hydropool nice terrace with bathtub  * nice and complete Kids Club with adjoining children pool with complete weekly program for the children (with a lot of activities and workshops)  * complimentary shuttle service to the city centre from 18:00-22:00 with Range Rover Sport (WONDERFUL!)  * very clean (gardens corridors rooms restaurants...)  * a real FOUR SEASONS treasure (comparable with the Four Seasons Sharm)  * ...    Negative points:  * still trying to find one :-)

My family and I (6 of us) had a wonderful stay at this resort in Marrakech which I understand opened a few years ago. The hotel lived up to and in many areas exceeded our expectations. We had a Grand Pavilion Suite with adjoining Pavilion room which meant we were spoilt for space: the rooms were extremely well appointed and there was a private terrace with plunge pool. The hotel itself had several pools fitness centre and spa the latter being a favourite of all (Tarik to be mentioned here for his sports massage). As with all great hotels however it was the staff who made the hotel. They were all unfailing cheerful and solicitous. The concierge arranged numerous outings for us and we always felt that the hotel were looking to ensure our safety and our enjoyment. We had a super driver Mohammed Bouraki who suggested interesting visits. The Four Seasons is expensive but the enjoyment we had from the stay was worth it. We loved Marrakech and our stay was made by the Four Seasons and their staff!

Review_Date: Gillian S wrote a review Aug 2013
Review_Text: The Four Seasons Marrakech is one of the best hotels that we have stayed at as a family. It is a true family resort that allows you to unwind and have a great family holiday without any stress at all.  The staff are amazingly friendly and the service is discreet and sincere. A special thanks to:  - Maryim who manages the Boutique. Maryim introduced us to Fenyadi which is an amazing design shop in the Industrial Quarter of Marrakech that sells Linens and Ceramics - well worth a visit  - Ali and his lovely wife who both work at the Hotel and have two young children and do very long hours. They were both friendly and very helpful especially when you have a picky 5 year old who doesn't eat well  - Mohammed who was the life guard at the family pool. Best of luck to him and his Law studies!  - The concierge who were very helpful in suggesting places to visit in the Atlas Mountains and organised a great picnic for us to take - thank you (-:  - The Spa was amazing as well. The first time I had ever had a hamam - you must try it when you are there  - The kids club was very accommodating. Our daughter even took her Pirate outfit with us for the Pirate day  Many thanks for making us feel welcome - We will be back!  PS: The bed and the pillows are unbelievably comfortable and the room service is immaculate.

Amazing resort with service to match - worth going to Marrakech just to stay at the Four Seasons.    Staff at concierge restaurants pool and kids club were all excellent. Only complaint would be extortionate price of airport pick up / drop off.

Review_Date: Paivi L wrote a review Aug 2013
Review_Title: Excellent kids club and kids pool
Review_Text: Stayed twice in this hotel this year and have to say it is brilliant for the kids. The kids pool together with the kids club is amazing. People are very friendly and service is excellent. Would recommend Pavilion suite for 2 adults and 2 kids.

Review_Date: Li Abd wrote a review Aug 2013
Review_Text: Four seasons is as usual a great hotel and especially so in Marrakech where people are warm friendly and hospitable. What I find excellent in this hotel was the hamam and massage. I am a massage freak. I love it and I am extremely particular with my masseuse. Mr Tarik my masseur was excellent! His acupuncture and pressure points combined with his special energy healing took me by surprised. His deep tissue pressure on the exact points were simply awesome. All I could think off during my session was 'it would me nice to have him massage my friends and I back in Malaysia' It's one of the best massages I had and I do come from a region that combines Thai Indonesian Malaysian Chinese and Indian Ayurvedic Master masseuses. Equally satisfied was my 12 year old daughter who had Ms Siham giving her a facial and a gentle relaxing massage. She loved it as Siham was so gentle and so child friendly! Thank you Tarik and Siham! And not forgetting Malikka who made sure that mum and daughter had a wonderful hamam scrubbed cleaned by two wonderful ladies! Breakfast in the hotel is ok not a fantastic spread like in most Asian countries but enough. Maybe they should include the cactus fruit that is served all over the streets of Marrakech? Never tried them but it seems very local. Kids club Ms Nabila and Ms Imane were a hit wit my children and not forgetting my son's happiness with his tennis companion Faouz and we had a great guide in Mr Mohamed Waseel! So far we all love Marrakech!

Review_Date: Waqee B wrote a review Aug 2013
Review_Text: Brilliant hotel Brilliant service all round a great stay in this Hotel. Catered for the kids and the adults. Kids club was great food was great.    The suuite we stayed in was lovely had thought of everything so baby crib bottle steriliser was already on hand in the room.    No faults.

Just stayed 4 night pavilion suite at this lovely accommodating hotel with my husband and 7 yr old daughter. What can I say impeccable service and hospitality. Beautiful surroundings and room. Pool spa and kids club all utilised successfully. Lovely splash pool and terrace. Definitely an oasis to relax and feel safe in. Well worth the money for us hope to stay in this chain again. Complimentary drop off to town in spanking rangee. Conciarge always on hand to help.

We stayed 2 nights just relaxing (after 3 nights in another hotel) and we enjoyed every minute of this amazing property!  the staff was very kind professional and polite.  The food was excellent but just one suggestion can be to have some more choice on all the menus.  Amazing hotel perfect to relax !!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The first thing to say about going to The Four Seasons in Marrakech is NOT to buy Dirhams at Gatwick! I got less than 10 to 1 whereas even in the hotel I got almost 13.    That aside we spent 10 days at the hotel in July. The service and attention to detail were excellent. The welcome was good and the hotel has a real feeling of calm about it. We have 2 teenage girls and had a suite with connecting double room near the adult pool which worked really well. As is mentioned by others it is a bit expensive and the first bill I got made me do a double take - especially when I thought it was 10 to 1 and not 13 to 1. However I couldn't fault the quality or the service. There is a very good 'teenagers' club with lots to do and the 2 pools (1 adult and 1 family) are large and interesting. The service round the pool could at times be slow but in the main was excellent - especially Fouad. We spent 1 day touring the city and had an excellent guide called 'Feta - like the cheese!'. He was very happy to talk about the current political situation as well as giving you all of the history. The hotel was quiet when we were there - probably as the English schools had not yet broken up for the holidays - but as a result The Italian restaurant was only open on a couple of evenings and the roof top bar was closed completely during our stay. This made the eating option in the hotel fairly limited especially if you are staying more than a few days. However the restaurant recommendations from the hotel were excellent especially Maison Arabe and Riad Kniza. From the hotel to the medina by large taxi (more than 3 people) should be about DAM80 but they always ask for more - there are no meters. It's only 5-10 minutes away.    Anyway our overall rating for the hotel is excellent and I would recommend it to families and couples alike.

My family and I decided to go to Marrakech to celebrate my mother's 60th birthday and chose to stay at the Four Seasons. We could not have chosen better.    The hotel itself is beautiful awakening all the senses from when you enter through the doors. The rooms were immaculate the food was delicious and the amenities were fantastic. For those keen swimmers out there...its not often you come across a 44m outdoor swimming pool perfect to stretch out the limbs!    However what really made the trip was the wonderful service that we were given. We were made to feel so welcome and so at home as if nothing was too much to ask. Its definitely the little things that count...and the team at the Four Seasons Marrakech has realised that.    I thoroughly recommend this hotel for its settings surroundings and the charming people who will make your stay unforgettable.

Review_Date: Kevin M wrote a review Jul 2013
Review_Text: Short three & half hour flight followed by  Just a 5 minute taxi ride from the airport.  We were made very welcome on arrival.  "Surpise" Complimentary Card Cake & Champagne  on my birthday made us feel very special.  Room & Bed Excellent.  Staff could not do enough for you.  Breakfast was our favourite part of the day  Plan to return. Thank You.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A wonderful Oasis away from the Madness
Review_Text: We stayed for three nights at the First Seasons. We were originally going to book a Riad in the Medina but I am so so pleased we stay at the Four Seasons. It is well placed to get to the main square (which is crazy at night!) less that a five minute drive and the Four Seasons provide complimentary transport into the main square at night.    We were met at the airport by one of the Four Seasons staff in a new Range Rover with some nice iced water which is a great way to start. Check in was one of the smoothest we have ever had sitting in the lounge with freshly brewed mint green tea and surrounded by the smell of 100s of beautiful roses isn't that how every check in should be!!    As it was our wedding anniversary the hotel very kindly upgraded up to a Pavilion room around the adult pool. The room was beautiful. Elegant good use of space and spotlessly clear. A Walk in closet which I do like and a great bathroom with a wonderfully deep bath. We had a our own large totally private terrace with beautiful flowers (all well kept) and we could access the pool via the gate from our terrace.    The breakfast was very nice not a hugh selection and some items cold but more than adequate. We weren't huge fans of the restaurants in the hotel and only ate in one evening we were excepting a little more fine dining in the Italian not just pizza and a few dishes so were disappointed with that. In contrast the restaurant at the adult pool we ate at every lunchtime and the food was excellent - it is a shame this restaurant is not open at night because we would have happily eaten here.    One thing I noticed at this hotel were the staff it seemed like they all knew the guests and would greet you by name which is very nice. The excellent pool/waiting staff around the beautiful Adult pool alway had a towel ready for us when we came out of the pool although the Family pool looked just at inviting. The fact the staff were so attentive and friendly whilst still being discrete really made this hotel standout for me.    Reception was extremely helpful and arranged dinner for us in a Riad which was an experience and just confirmed to us that having been to this beautiful Riad the Four Seasons really is the place to stay in Marrakech. I really can recommend this wonderful hotel with its beautiful pools and gardens not to mention the fantastic staff. If we are ever in Marrakech again this is where we will be staying.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Khaled B wrote a review Jul 2013
Review_Text: We went to the four seasons on our honeymoon for a week in marrakech. We got upgraded from deluxe room to a deluxe suite on arrival. The reception by the hotel and treatment from staff wa almost royal. From the rangerover pick-up at the airport to the check-in while seated in the lounge with drinks - perfect start. The room was immaculate and the presentation of everything was almost perfect. 2 housekeeping visits restock water drinks and snacks for free - luxury at every corner.  Otherwise food was amazing as well really enjoyed the breakfast buffet as was varied and delicious. Dinner was alright but not as great. We were on a bed and breakfast basis so I didnt try all the restaurants however I ordered plenty of room service and the food was great.  The facilities were mazing as well - spa pool fitness center. They had a lounge called Inara lounge were you can just sit and relax  a guy playing oud in the background and mint tea for free!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A luxurious retreat at a stunning resort.
Review_Text: This five star resort property is the perfect place for a holiday! The hotel is understated in design but if you pay attention you'll see that the architects managed to cleverly incorporate beautiful Moroccan design and furniture throughout.    The flowers are beautiful and the hotel's gorgeous signature scent (made of roses and jasmine I believe) greets you in the lobby evoking a sense of place in this city which somehow manages to constantly engage every one of your senses!    The food was superb throughout the resort's restaurants and even the room service meals are very special. Breakfast is a banquet and so you should definitely leave a good deal of time to enjoy it.    We spent a lot of time at the spa. A hidden gem is the spa garden which harbors a refreshingly cold plunge pool which was a real oasis as the July weather was warm! The staff are so helpful and the Hammam treatment is a great ritual and it was well recommended that we had it at the start of our holiday before we went out and enjoyed the pool and the sun.    We loved the resort boutique which has a selection of the most beautiful local crafts holiday clothes antiques jewelry and gifts. The boutique staff went out of their way to source items that we had seen in a beautiful book on Moroccan Interiors which they sell in store. They truly went over and above the already excellent level of service that all Four Seasons staff seem to effortlessly provide.    This was our fourth trip to Marrakech and to the Four Seasons!

Review_Title: A return visit to an idyllic spot!
Review_Text: This was our second visit to the Four Seasons Marrakech and once again we cannot really fault it. They even gave us the same Pavilion Suite as last year as we had told them we liked it so much - a nice touch. The setting is just beautiful. The pool area is particularly lovely with a gorgeous pool plenty of cabanas and beds and very attentive staff at the bar and pool area. We ate there for lunch most days and had a few meals in the hotel restaurants. I didn't make a good menu choice at Bleu d'Orange which spoiled things a little for me but it was my fault!! The accommodation really is first class - spacious cool and just a little luxurious!! Like to think we will make it a third time which is as high a recommendation as I can give.

If you want an Oasis in Marrakesh not faraway from city extravagant surrounding top notch places that your place. A bit pricy but you got what you want spa restaurant service location done. The pool perfect butlers with frozen smoothies. Quiet an d lovely built for royalty sure.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Beautiful hotel, so why the bad review?
Review_Text: My husband and I love the Four Season hotels and have stayed in many around the world hence the booking at Four Seasons Marrakesh.    There were lots of good things it is a beautiful hotel the staff are kind and helpful especially at the pool area. The food is excellent albeit expensive but that is to be expected at the Four Seasons so was not a problem. The breakfast was delicious and the waiting staff in the morning were superb however children are not supervised well in the breakfast area and this is small problem.    So what was SO wrong that I give it a ''poor'' review?    Well we chose this hotel outside of Marrakesh so that we could have peace and quiet and have lazy mornings. We were given a room on the 2nd floor and every morning the cleaner would move the furniture in the room above. The floors are marble and the noise at 0825 am would be so loud that it would waken us. If it was not the cleaners then the occupants above would move a chair and it was heard clearly in our room. Noise pollution should not be a problem at this level of hotel. We did not get a long lie once. Just what we did not want as we came tired and needing a break. We work so hard during the year that this is our once a year holiday with no children.    The hotel offered us one spa treatment to make up for it. Not really a solution. Kind offer but not a solution.    They denied the cleaners were in the rooms but a trip upstairs by my wife to have a look (seeing as we were up anyway) showed that the room was being cleaned.The trolley with cleaning products (which clatters along the bedroom floor as well) and the vacuum cleaner (on wheels!!!!!!) were outside the bedroom door in the room above which proved that it was the cleaners. Sad that a hotel of this standard and reputation denied this.    What should they have done?    Well I had hoped to be moved to a top floor so that there was no sound from above. This did not happen.Most likely as that would have been a substantial upgrade. I was not looking for a free upgrade just a good night's sleep and lie in after 9am to be honest.    I would not therefore recommend this hotel unless you are up and out at 8am for sightseeing and stay for only a few days.    We were here for 7 days for a complete relaxing holiday with alternative days of sightseeing in between. It doesn't work unless you pay for a third floor room. The room on the 2nd floor we were in was lovely but ruined by the noise from above.    On our departure we left a letter of complaint yet but nothing has yet come back. So much more should have been done to fix it.    Really special waiting staff and pool staff but the management of this hotel is lacking. They have a lot to learn from genuine complaints from genuine people.    Very poor indeed!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: john m wrote a review Jun 2013
Review_Title: Five Stars for the Four Seasons
Review_Text: We stayed for a week at the Four Seasons and the staff and service was superb.The hotel is quiet and calm and a 5 minute taxi ride from the main square.It is probably worth organising your own guide as the one offered by the hotel was not very good.The hotel staff however were extremely polite and looked after us very well.We have never stayed at this chain before and would have no hesitation in recommending this resort
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: So happy with our decision of staying at the four seasons  we were tempted to stay at a Riad but very very happy that we didn't and went with four seasons -  How can you go wrong with four seasons ....the staff is amazing -  Mr Holger Frehde really knows how to look after guests and make them return four seasons guests everywhere -  The check in was super smooth and perfect  they got everything right the first time !    Very happy with our choice  still here for another night -

Review_Date: Mark B wrote a review Jun 2013
Review_Text: The Fours Seasons is a beautiful resort close to the hustle and bustle of Marrakech but far enough away to be an oasis of calm. It is only 2 years old and is suitable for couples families and business. The rooms and suites are stunning beautifully furnished and full of mod cons. The gardens are beautifully kept the pools are large and there is a great choice of quality restaurants. I couldn't fault the staff who contributed to making it a fabulous stay. Would highly recommend some time here combined with a stay in a riad.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is a stunning hotel just outside of the center of the city. The hotel buildings are in good condition and the atmosphere on arrival is wonderful. The room was massive with beautiful finishes a huge bathroom and comfortable beds. The staff were all excellent. We booked an hour before we arrived and so had to wait for the room but the staff took such good care of us and kept checking in with us at the bar to make sure we were ok and update us on the time. Reception helped book guides and taxis and were very knowledgeable. Boutique staff were helpful without being pushy. Breakfast is nice and you can request things not on the buffet. Room service was vey good prompt and nicely set out in the room. Pools are clean and large with a dedicated adult pool and there are enough cabanas to go around. The spa was a great experience. Everything you would expect from this impressive chain.    While very good there is a limited selection of restaurants so get some recommendations of places to try in town if you're staying more than a few days.

Amazing hotel for all trips types especially family ones  Staff are amazing and very supportive and can find solutions for any issue  I got premium double room and I was surprised by the quality of room every thing was new like first time use  Always clean they have the ability to clean the room like every hour

We had a memorable stayand wonderful time. It is likely the most elegant hotel that i have ever stayed at. The experience at your property was exquisite. The initial greeting the lavish attention by everyone I encountered and the overall ambience and service make your hotel stand out above the rest.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We are currently staying at Four Seasons with our 8 year old daughter. What a beautiful tranquil and tasteful property. The staff couldn't be nicer or more welcoming. Such genuine care and concern is rare these days. We always stay at Four Seasons properties and are rarely disappointed. This hotel and staff exceed my execrations. And the Kids' Club! Nabila does such a fine job making a fun happy and safe environment for the children. Our daughter loves it. Thank you Four Seasons Marrakech! I would highly recommend the hotel to couples and families alike (btw there is a beautifully quiet adult pool).

Review_Title: Would not hesitate to recommend the Four Seasons in Marrakech.
Review_Text: Wonderful hotel. Four Seasons excellence. No complaints at all. We took our nearly 18 year old daughter for a post exam mini break and found the hotel to suit all 3 of us. The pool area was one of the most stunning I have ever seen. Well done.

Expect the very best at the Four Seasons Resort Marrakech. When you enter the resort you smell beautiful flowers and are greeted with mint tea and Moroccan sweets. We had Room 217 overlooking the fountains with a covered sitting area. The staff were very accommodating and nothing was ever too much trouble. They are the nicest people. The food was delicious with the risotto cooked to perfection. The grounds are stunning and full of tropical flowers and singing birds. The bed was so comfortable we woke up thinking we were at home. We did not want to leave. Thank you so much for the wonderful stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Great location. Easy taxis available to souk. Lovely menara gardens just outside the hotel. Fantastic breakfast spread and kids club. Very friendly staff with good english skills.  Large comfortable rooms. Wish the kids club didn't close so early at 5pm. Free car ride every evening to main square.

Review_Date: Joanne G wrote a review Jun 2013
Review_Text: We took a group tour of Morocco ending in Marrakech staying at the Four Seasons. Our room was a suite as part of a residence. It could not be any more luxurious. The all marble bath had double sinks and a fancy shower etc. and all amenities for a king and queen. There was also a walk in closet. The bed was so comfortable and we had a terrace that was almost completely private. We ordered room service and it was so professional and decadent. The breakfast buffet was wonderful and guests could also lounge in the spa area. The service was phenomenal and the staff friendly. It would be hard to beat the luxury of this property.

Review_Date: James A wrote a review Jun 2013
Review_Title: An oasis of calm in the this bustelling city.
Review_Text: We spent 3 nights at the 4 seasons and had a great stay apart from the sightly moderate climate for this time of year the 4 seasons lived up to expatations from the dates and walnuts at reception to the flowers and wonderfull grounds. The tennis and Gym were also excellent the Tennis Coach in particular was excellent. The hotel is so well located for the city centre we really had a great time !

Review_Date: Suzanne M wrote a review Jun 2013
Review_Text: We spent 5 days at this beautiful hotel and I can't recommend it highly enough. The rooms are stunning the grounds of the hotel are the nicest I have ever seen - its so lovely to wake up to the sounds of birds singing in the morning.  Its a great place to have children particularly fussy eaters as the kids menu is available in all the restaurants at the hotel so parents do not have to be confined to Italian restaurants. There's a great Moroccan restaurant worth trying too.  The staff at this hotel were so incredibly accommodating that we felt very special. Nothing was too much trouble. There are 2 great pools - one adults only and the other for children - but to be honest there was never a time that the kids pool seemed overrun with children.  If you are looking for a relaxing and luxurious experience in Marrakech you really need look no further. This hotel ticks all the boxes and we are quite picky customers!

myself and 2 friends took a long weekend away to marrakech and decided to splurge and stay at the Four Seasons. the hotel is lovely stunning. from the moment you walk in. the sweet smell of rosewater the lovely flowers the tea...a great welcome. sadly we weren't upgraded due to a "full hotel" though it seemed empty to us. the pool was fabulous and empty. we enjoyed our first evening in the bar seated outside. they provided warm blankets as the temperature dropped. the room was nice not too small.  a few of the hiccups:  -concierge wasn't too friendly or helpful. didn't seem to have lots to recommend other than their normal list of spots -wasn't willing to change it up a bit.  -we had to call for our room to be cleaned  -we had shopped quite a bit more than expected and called for their help with packing materials to properly wrap our items for the bag check at the airport. they did a poor job and when we asked them to provide us with the materials and we'd do it ourselves they claimed it was too dark outside to find materials.  -seemed the staff wasn't completely aware of the timings of the hotel restaurants. one person told us a certain restaurant was open/but it wasn't. another person had no idea.    overall a lovely hotel just not up to Four Seasons standards.

Stayed here for 2 nights on business staff were very attentive and helpful. My room was in the main building a ball of string would have been useful to find my way back the hotel is a maze if corridors but there was always someone to point you in the right direction room was huge with separate dressing room and a bathroom the size of most bedrooms! Spotlessly clean and everything and a bed to die for everything you would have expected of a 5star hotel. My balcony overlooked one of the resort pools and beautiful gardens. Breakfast was once again 5 star All in all a fantastic few days it would be very easy to stay here for a week not appreciating the real Morocco which would be a shame. Unfortunately during my stay I got food poisoning probably not from the hotel but eating out but it showed how important it is to be careful when choosing your food and drink.

me and hubby visited four seasons  and we were hugely impressed. The resort is beautiful with the décor so warming and inviting and typically moroccon. The service is outstanding  the food delicious however the drinks are largely overpriced. The hotel is so tranquil and the hotel pays minute attention to detail eg the smells in reception on arrival. the décor and courtesy shown to us on arrival. The green tea with mint and the gentleman who serves it is exceptional in reception. The lifeguards are also so friendly and courteous. The room was outstanding. The hotel was outstanding and we would certainly visit again We visited three restaurants two being in the new town  and one in the medina. The hotel staff were so helpful in arranging transport for us and we were grateful. One thing to be aware of however On one occasion however we ordered a taxi to the medina to a restaurant via the hotel staff The taxi driver took us and on arrival we were immediately met by a young boy who we automatically thought was from the restaurant. He however led us to the restaurant and then a few metres down alleyways to the square in the medina and then demanded huge amounts' of money off us. On reflection we realised that the taxi driver had phoned somebody during the transfer and stated we were from the four seasons and now we realise that we had been set up so this boy would meet us by the taxi driver. This was very upsetting and although not the hotels fault we completely trusted that we were safe in the taxi that had booked for us by the four seasons. A great advantage was also free use of the internet which was as bonus. Breakfast was delicious but pricey hotel overall though was magnificent .Thanks for a great stay
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A typical 4 Seasons property - discrete and refined
Review_Text: On all counts (including prices!) this is one notch below La Mamounia the grande dame of Marrakech hotels. It is still what you would expect from a Four Seasons property - spacious rooms great service nice gardens excellent gym very good conference facilities. It is well situated in town. The breakfast buffet is surprisingly underwhelming but they have excellent eggs tagine à la carte.

Exellent service lovely hotel fantastic food.  Imane who organised my 40th party was lovely efficient and couldn't have hoped for such a great night for my birthday supper table for 24 of us just beautiful.  All staff so helpful.

Review_Title: A very special place to stay
Review_Text: My wife and three of our children (21 19 and 18) stayed here for 6 days at the end of March 2013. We choose the hotel because we had a successful stay at a Four Seasons Hotel in the UK last year and we wanted to visit a warm country and not to travel too far.  Arriving at the hotel was wonderful and we felt immediately that we had done the right thing. The atmosphere was very special. The service was excellent as one would expect from a 5 star hotel.  The rooms were lovely and we were able to relax and forget our cares for a little time.  The hotel has two pools with one for adults only and therefore quieter for just swimming. The fitness facilities were good as were the restaurants. We chose a different restaurant each night as well as travelling into Marrakech (2 miles) on a couple of occasions to eat. Breakfast was lovely.  The hotel is clear that it seeks to cater well for children and it does (even big ones!).  The staff were never-endingly friendly and helpful. Nothing was too much trouble. Worth a special mention was the pool manager/lifeguard and the manager of the outdoor restaurant.  It was very expensive for five of us to stay there and we couldn't afford to do it more than once a year but I am increasingly coming to the conclusion that it is worth choosing such a hotel/chain for the certainty it offers for the holiday we want.

Review_Date: VSF F wrote a review May 2013
Review_Text: We arrived at the Four Seasons at 10pm to the most beautiful reception. it was lit beautifully by candlelight and it smelt incredible. it was the perfect arrival ( one of the best). THe hotel is only 10mins from the airport but you would never have guessed. You see virtually no airplanes and it is beautifully tranquil. The grounds are well kept and the pools are of superb quality (you cat even tell tehy have chlorine in them!). the room was very neat and perfectly clean with a very high quality of bed linen. The room i had had an adjacent patio with loungers which was great.  The staff at this hotel are amongst the friendliest kindest and helpful hotel workers i have come across. They worked tirelessly to meet your every desire and at no point were ever intrusive or overbearing They were utterly attentive and extremely helpful.  We took a few trips to the medina- which was something i shall never forget and despite being a blonde female i did not feel harassed. The atlas mountains were incredible and i most definitely would recommend that anyone should take a trip there whilst in morocco.  All you need to do is ask at reception and the trip will be booked  We had one sour incident involving being ripped off by a taxi driver. Instead of being charged 70Dr we were charged 400Dr. `after realising we spoke to the hotel which deducted this from our overall bill. service.  I cannot recommend this hotel enough. I am sure some might prefer a Riad and yes they are beautiful however this hotel is the perfect alternative and still very moroccan. i most definitely will return... and recommend this resort.  Thank you to all the staff.

Review_Date: abdallah e wrote a review May 2013
Review_Title: just pefect as from car parking on arrival
Review_Text: just pefect as from car parking on arrival  difficult to comment on such outstanding service and facilities  it is significant to say that when we were in our car for leaving after check out they brought us a bottle of water for each person. this is amazing they think even to help for our trip back home!!!

Review_Date: Karim Samer M wrote a review May 2013
Review_Text: This is a huge hotel located a 30 minutes walk from the Medina. The layout of the hotel is beautifully executed always giving you plenty of room. the reception and welcome are first class. There is a spacious first class gym with the latest equipment but the most eye catching parts are the amazing swimming pools. Stunning. Breakfast is the other. Delicious food.

Review_Date: Kitty L wrote a review May 2013
Review_Text: I thoroughly enjoyed my stay at the FS Marrakech. Beautiful hotel luxurious interior and rooms and a stunning garden. I would have given this hotel a higher rating had it not been the rather hit and miss service from the restaurants and room service. Room service arrived with only one meal (we had ordered two meals) trying to tell us it was our mistake although they could not explain why they had sent two bread baskets and two table settings if they only thought one person was dining. They eventually conceded and brought the second meal. Not really a good enough standard for £22 per steak.  Similar problems in the restaurants though the staff always made an effort to put things right and this was done in a good natured way. Food overall was excellent though pricy given the less than slick service.  The adult pool is well managed by Yassine who is an absolute star working tirelessly ensuring everyone has their sun beds and parasols adjusted. Pretty good drinks service around the pool although my lunch order was delivered to neighbouring guests who ate it without question! It took a a while to sort out another order but it did eventfully arrive an hour later.  This will be a fabulous hotel when these little faults are sorted out. I will be happy to return as I found all the staff very cheery and pleasant.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Gorgeous grounds, kids facilities and service but could improve in areas
Review_Text: Gorgeous grounds brilliant facilities for kids only one staff member disappointed but everyone else did everything they could to make our stay comfortable and meet our expectations. I would definitely recommend this place and especially to families. Only downside is that the food is extremely expensive but maybe that's to be expected with a brand such as four seasons?!

We went for a bachelorette party. Service was amazing the property is beautiful. Food was also really good. Had fun at a pop up club one of the nights.    I did mention that I loved all the orange blossom they used in the hotel and the food. The Pool manager went and found me some to take home! So unexpected and amazing.    I'd definitely go again even would bring the kids.

A week with our two teenagers for the end of May half term - they both enjoyed it and even better so did we.    We took 2 interconnecting deluxe rooms 37 and 38 (510 Euros per room/night). Both rooms shared a common front door ie a hallway linked the 2: ideal for us. These rooms were a fair way from reception (down on the RHS of the property) but ideal for us and not all noisy. One of the rooms had an exceptionally large balcony and both were well as luxurious as you would hope in a FS resort.    Highlights for us:    - the FS airport arrivals service and then limo is worth having  - Solano breakfasts good  - pool side restaurant (Azzera?) Mediterranean style and good food although could be slow if you arrived at peak time  - we liked the Zest roof top bar and the courtyard dining outside  - hired bikes and cycled into and through the medina  - good childrens club: our younger teen was 14 and liked it  - the gardens and grounds and in fact the walled nature of the property (bit like Mamounia) was good for us    We were not so keen on:  - Solano for dinner  - we also ate in the Inara courtyard upstairs (light meal) - essentially there was not enough choice in terms of nighttime dining. This may have been because it was May but I am unsure  - taxi or car service into the medina seemed a bit patchy ie not instant by any means

Review_Date: Sarah D wrote a review May 2013
Review_Text: Stayed for four nights very relaxing and comfortable and we had a fabulous break. The staff are all extremely friendly and helpful but a special mention to Mr Amirre Ayat Allah the Manager of the Azzera Grill and all his team fantastic service and hospitality they helped to make our holiday a memorable one.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: I always thought I would stay in a riad when I finally visited Marrakech but with two kids under the age of 4 we decided that the Four Seasons would provide the space and privacy we needed.    The hotel is superb; nice interiors; good service; lovely pools. But the best thing this hotel offers is the kids club and we took advantage if this facility everyday. The kids loved it! The girls working there are really fantastic and my kids still talk ask about them from time to time!    The only thing stopping this hotel being the best place I have stayed in is value for money and the food. It's not that the food is bad it's just not particularly good. And it's not that this place is unbearably expensive it's just that I for one ended my holiday thinking I did not quite get the value for money that I would have wished for.

Review_Title: Sadly lacks some of the glamour of nearby Grande Dame.........
Review_Text: But what FSM resort lacks in authenticity ( unfair to compare to a property built in 1923! ) it more than makes up for in the hospitality stakes. The pools are beautiful and spacious and if you happen to be a family then FSM beats the competition hands down! The scheduled activities and the genuine care the staff showed their charges was nothing short of superb. The bedrooms and suites are spacious and I recommend the ground level pavilion rooms as the patios are large and provide additional space to retire too! Service around the pool could be improved upon as they are often busy serving lunch and I did have to rely on the life guard to help me move sun loungers etc The food is generally good and the pop up bar is an excellent idea. whilst I was there they hosted a design evening and the top floor open air bar came alive with an influx of the beautiful and the vibrant! FSM is a beautifully designed resort but if it's people watching and vitality you require then you may leave disappointed however if like myself you enjoy good service spacious accommodation and pool side privacy then FSM will suit you just fine - for a people watching dressing to thrill fix then take a cab for a glass of fizz to the grande dame in the full and reassuring knowledge that the comfort and care of FSM awaits you.

Stayed three nights in a great room (211) overlooking the pool and gardens and ate in three of the restaurants and bars.  Reception area is pleasant (exchange rate on ATM not good) and all staff very obliging.  Room was large and well stacked big double balcony breakfasts were good with a wide choice  pool areas most agreeable.  Hamman can't be taken together (shame not like 4 Seasons in Sharm) and the fitness centre doesn't have a pool with it. Restaurants don't have that much choice on menu's and there are only 2 open at night. Taxi's into town 50dhm and it's too far to walk pleasantly. Staff have great attitude. Concierage arranged an English speaking guide for Souks worth it 550 dhm. Miss the gardens over the road they are pants!! Would stay in Gueliz next time as more choice of eating venues.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is a relatively new Four Seasons and if you know the brand you can rest assured that this resort now offers service which is now very close to other FS resorts world wide; in an ideal location.    The setting and the architecture are outstanding the resort is small and has a perfect air of calm similar to the FS in Chang Mai for instance. On the other hand there are fewer activities than some of the busier resorts such as Punta Mita and Costa Rica. in fact there were no additional activities during our stay. That suited us but may be not everyone.    Breakfast and food are excellent but only cater to western tastes.    The adult pool was quiet and finding shaded chairs was never a problem. Unusually for FS there is no pool service though staff from the nearby restaurant will bring drinks if you go and find them.    The staff are responsive and quickly put right anything that was wrong. Guest should not hesitate to ask to speak to a manager if there is a problem my experience throughout the FS group is that they will try to respond to any (reasonable) request.    The Concierge service was helpful and friendly. They have a good (you may even say definitive) list of local restaurants.    The one area of caution is with regard to the (outsourced ?) transportation. We booked a trip in to the Atlas Mountains the driver (....a butcher who got the job through his cousin) did not follow the itinerary given by the concierge and also took a few wrong turnings. He seemed intend on taking us to some destinations that we had not requested and to be wasting time so we would not get back to the hotel before 5pm. The air-conditioning in the car did not work. If we were to return we would consider using a local guide and transport rather than the Four Seasons facility unless changes had been made.    Overall this is an excellent resort I recommend it and would return.

This was our first visit to Marrakech and we chose the 'safe' option of staying at The Four Seasons. The hotel is set in beautiful gardens and has a really stunning pool (with a separate one for children). The choice of restaurants is good and there was a really great pop up bar open when we were there. The Medina is a very easy 5 minute taxi ride away and it is actually lovely to return to the tranquility of the hotel at the end of a busy day haggling in the souks. The staff were all really friendly and helpful.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: After having stayed at FS Marrakech in June 2012 and having encountered some teething problems I was very much satisfied with my second stay there. The resort is now up and running and staff have learnt the lesson the level of service is now to par with other FS hotels and resorts around the world. What I noticed was the management added some moroccan touches to the resort which was a great addition and created a very nice setting. Private Room pop up lounge was exquisitely decorated and cocktails were okay however it's sad to see there was nobody there on a Friday evening. The staff were great very helpful and all smiles from doormen to pool attendants. I did some shopping at the resort's boutique which had some great finds I just couldn't resist buying the hotel's signature scent that you can smell in the lobby blissful. The bed was heavenly and the bathroom great as well however some flower arrangements in the room would've been appreciated. That's what you would expect at 500+ EUR a night. Room service was outstanding (great cheeseburgers) and Azerra Restaurant by the pool served okay food if what you need is a snack in between tanning sessions. The adults pool is exquisite and quiet which is a great bonus. I found the breakfast spread to be rather poor especially after having experienced breakfast spreads in top hotels in Asia. However you can order any item you like just make sure you do that. Upon checkout unfortunately I had a very poor experience with one of the staff (Abderrahim). If you refer to my previous review of June 2012 it was the same staff that delivered a disappointing level of service. Due to a miscommunication as to a double occupation of the room (instead of 1 adult) I was told there would be an extra charge for the second adult however no mention of this was done upon checking in so I didn't expect this. And Abderrahim couldn't care less just stared and told me that payment for the room was already made so we had to pay the additional charge. This was unprofessional and I should've been notified right from the beginning. Proactiveness is a must especially in the hotel industry. A little while after though I had a much better checkout experience with Ilyas who was very courteous and dealt with the minor situation in a very professional and polite way. I hope that in my next visit check-in and check-out will be completely seamless and fast with no hidden charges or problems. And I insist that reception staff especially the one I mentioned need extensive training as to how to treat hotel guests and how to present minor issues in a favourable way to avoid customer dissatisfaction. There's a lot of competition in Marrakech and I wouldn't hesitate to book Mandarin Oriental when it opens so the management needs to deal with this especially since my last review went unanswered by the GM. Otherwise this is a great property and it was a real pleasure staying here once again. Definitely recommend it if you want a sophisticated yet very relaxing stay in Marrakech.

Review_Date: Daniel A wrote a review Apr 2013
Review_Title: Does what it says on the tin
Review_Text: This hotel is classic 4 seasons. It has touches of Morocco but you could be anywhere. That said the: service facilities accommodation and atmosphere are all superb. We are enjoying a 5 day break as a family of 4 with 2 kids ages 9 & 7 and the hotel is exactly what we needed. If you want to know what you're getting this is place to be only 3.5 hours from London.

Review_Date: Peter M wrote a review Apr 2013
Review_Title: Ideal base for Marrakech with kids
Review_Text: Having spent more than a decade in Asia I dare to say that the level of quality and luxury at the 4 Seasons and other super lux resorts in Marrakech is at a higher level than the best in Asia.    For our trip the 4Seasons was an outstanding blend of luxury location and style. An absolute must stay if you have children who will need a break from souks medina and general intensity of Marrakech.    It's rare that I can find nothing wrong with a hotel/resort but this time I am stumped.
Reviewer_Location: New York, New York, United States

Review_Title: perfect resort, fantastic staff a memorable experience
Review_Text: perfect resort fantastic staff a memorable experience. The staff cant do enough for you. The room was spotless with a great terrace and a truly wonderful bathroom. The spa treatments were first class and they did everything to accomodate us and move bookings from the sunday to the saturday as it was raining on the saturday afternoon. The gym is probably one of the best i have come across in hotels of this standing and i would highly recommend the new bar which opened the day we arrived above the italian restaurant. The resort is not cheap but certainly get what you pay for in every sense
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Nazha A wrote a review Mar 2013
Review_Title: An oasis of elegance, charm and confort
Review_Text: I went to this new hotel in Marrakech for the first time to participate in an international investment conference and I was simply charmed by the quality and beauty of the place. Superb architecture lovely deign excellent service and most efficient inference logistics. A most pleasant and delightful stay. Will certainly come back

Review_Date: Loving the crab wrote a review Mar 2013
Review_Title: An oasis from the chaos of the Medina
Review_Text: Only 3 hours flying time from the chaos of Easy Jets check in at Easter traveller engourged Garwick is the chaos of Marrakesh.    The Four Seasons sits around 5 minutes drive from the airport and 10 minutes from the Medina. A perfect location if you are looking for a split of 70% poolside and 30% culture.    The rooms are great but like every hotel they have the really irritating habit of putting you in a low grade one first - in our case a " view of the kids pool" at our stage in life a view of the airport would be more welcome anyway we were moved to room 88 and happy.    The staff is great and work with tremendous enthusiasm although in the case of the hotels Italian this manifests itself into the constant looking at order slips - missed courses and wrong orders - that said order the pizza excellent.    The Souk is worth a visit but beware of the guides favourite "vendors" ie his pals who incentivise him before you know you where you are you're locked in some shop only to escape if you are cluthing a bag of smelly herps or a fez that will at best fit into the " good idea at the time" catagory.    The Medina at night is overated but worth a look.    Outside the restaursnts are ok the best being the Comptoir which has belly dancing at 1030 ( although only for 15 minutes)    The rest serve the quality of food you wouldn't pay half the price for in London normally in virtual darkness.    Oh Tarik in the health spa asked for a mention - his sports massage is legend  One can only presume he practised on Barbie and Ken dolls due to some of the positions he gets you in.    My favourite member of staff though is the welcoming tea man - charming.

Review_Title: There is probably nothing better for the familes
Review_Text: Stayed here in January 2012 just after it opened. Everything was perfect and we even had enough sun to get in the pool. If you have a family or are looking to "dip your toe" into Marrakech rather than "immerse" yourself then stay here. You will not be disappointed but you will be a little worse off than when you arrived!

Review_Date: Sibba S wrote a review Mar 2013
Review_Text: Absolutely fabulous hotel/resort. Friendly staff everyone we came across spoke English. Beautiful interior and exterior attention to detail was obvious throughout. Return is a must and soon. The only downside is the distance to the Jemma el Fna square about an hours walk.

Not really knowing what a riad would be like or which one to chose we decided to play it safe and stayed at the Four Seasons in Marrakech. In retrospect this was a bad choice. The Four Seasons is about a 5-10 minute drive into the old town. In reality this is not a big problem and the hotel offers a courtesy car (albeit not always available) and a taxi only costs drms 50. However it does mean that you are less likely to make short trips into and out of town.    A friend of ours works at the Four Seasons in London and let them know we were arriving. Apart from mentioning this in our welcome note this made no difference to our stay (which we really can't complain about). We booked a pavilion room as we wanted to overlook the pool and had read that these were the nicer rooms. We wish we had known to ask for a west facing room as by the time we had returned from breakfast our terrace was in shade.    We ate in Solano on our first night as we wanted to experience traditional Morrocan food without needing to go into town. There were only about two other tables occupied so it felt rather soulless. The food was ok but nothing to write home about. The tagine was not served with Morrocan bread but with rice which seemed odd. At £25 for a glass of champagne it felt less Morrocan all of a sudden! The breakfast in this restaurant is good with a plenty of choice.    Our room was perfectly pleasant but unfortunately managed to get a negative score with one of my 'no nos' for 5 star hotels - a hairdryer which requires you to keep your finger pressed on it or it goes off and no cold shot button! The internet connection was not strong and you sometimes had to move around the room to catch it.    The spa is one of the best things about the hotel. I had a lovely massage during which I drifted off several times! I came away feeling thoroughly relaxed.    The pool attendants were really welcoming and helpful and the pool area is lovely and clean and well designed. The gym was good with plenty of machines.    If we went back to Marrakech we would not choose this hotel as we found a riad that we loved and felt more authentic.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: You must try the Spa and experience a Hamman.
Review_Text: An amazing and beautiful hotel a stone throw away from the centre of Marrakech. The Spa is absolutely brilliant. I've just had 2 amazing treatments including the Singapore massage from Tarik. The best massage ever.

I am a big fan of the Four Season's brand so perhaps the bar was set too high when we arrived. I was there for a small conference and sadly the hotel felt more of a ubiquitous conference center than a luxury resort in exotic Marrakech. In fact the design of the hotel didn't resemble the location at all looking more as it would be at home in Arizona than reflective of the romance and culture of Morocco. The service too was certainly pleasant and attentive but here again it felt corporately congenial. We had been promised an upgrade upon arrival and at check in no one said a word and diligently put us in a regular room while they worked their way through the check in line. The room was adequate but if you are going to raise a customer's hopes of an upgrade you put a bad taste in their mouths from the outset if you don't honor it especially in a half filled hotel. I said something to the manager at check out and I got the pleasant smile saying one wasn't available - which was interesting considering the 50% occupancy and the fact others in my conference were upgraded. A measure of care in reading our record prior to quickly processing us in a room would have alleviated this.  The grounds were well manicured and the room was clean and efficiently designed. I will say that much of the common spaces seemed empty or incomplete as if they had run out of money furnishing this huge property.  Meals were fine but the tiny bar and it's one bartender was easily overwhelmed by our group when we descended upon it for after dinner drinks and conversation. This lead to long waits for drinks.  After touring some of the charming other hotels in the city we came away from this experience as we had missed an opportunity to experience the flavor of the city and its many charms and history by staying in an overly corporate and westernized property. It's not like the Four Season's to miss this badly and I fear this hotel was designed in a board room in Canada instead of capturing the local spirit of Marrakech.  If you are a timid soul and feel more at home in the west but just want to sneak out for a taste of the Medina and then retreat back to the comfort and familiarity of a westernized hotel this place is for you. If you want to feel the full experience of being in Morocco then maybe not.

Review_Title: A Beautiful Hotel with wonderful service
Review_Text: Sadly for me I was only visiting the hotel for lunch as I would loved to have stayed. The Hotel is beautifully designed light and airy ( so different to La Mamounia which is dark and dated)If you are choosing a hotel choose this one! The staff were all very helpful and we had a lovely lunch there. The food is not cheap but you get what you pay for and it was delicious! The pool areas look fabulous as you would expect from a FS resort. Having stayed in FS Sharm  it was quite similar. Hope to return and stay next time!

What a fantastic hotel. Stayed there on a BMW Motorrad product launch event and stayed at the Four Seasons for 3 days and what an positive experience. The service was the best I have ever experienced the food was wonderful - exotic Morrocan with an European touch.    Spend a couple of afternoons by the pool and the service was absolute the best. The life guards and the waiters at the cafe were very attentive and kind. Brought clean and dry towels when we needed them (and even when we didn't need them) provided us with sun lotion moved the parasols etc. - still without being overattentive.    Would really like to stay there again.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: My husband and I stayed at the FS Marrakech in September for 5 nights and had nothing short of an excellent stay. The hotel is beautiful. I was nervous because many reviews said that it was lacking in local design but I think it had the perfect touches of local flair. It was subtle but we tend to lean towards modern anyways. The architecture and landscaping was beautiful. The spa was also worth visiting. We stayed in a Pavilion Room and it was wonderful. They are in the free standing casitas if you will overlooking the resort. Next time I would try the Pavilion suite which was below our room but had a plunge pool. The service was phenomenal from the pool person to the individual in charge of creating experiences. She helped me plan an unforgettable afternoon for my husband's birthday. I would definitely recommend the hotel to couples singles looking for some R&R and families. In fact the family pool was possibly more stunning than the adult pool! Worth the trekk to Marrakech. Well done Four Seasons.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Not what I expect from FS
Review_Text: Beautiful hotel situated close to town not that you really want to leave. Fabulous room with lovely view. We were here with BMW for a conference and the food was terrible boring and to be honest in edible.  The pool service was poor no one would come by and ask if we needed anything so 0 score there.

Beautiful facility w wonderful help and food. However for parts of our first three days we had no water and the fourth day no hot water at the time we wanted to shower before dinner. And the AC is far less than what it should be. Lastly when they took us to dinner in the hotel car it was more than ten times a taxi-i understand gross ups but the only thing missing was the gun and mask. This Four Seasons is a very poor reflection on the chain and I for one am done w them
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A peaceful haven in a sea of madness
Review_Text: My husband and I stayed here for a four night break in January 2013. We enjoyed most aspects of our stay enormously the only slight irritation was on our first night in the Italian restaurant when we were told to "Hurry up and eat your starter as your main course is here".  Other than that the staff were very helpful including when we had gone out one evening to the Fna Square and left our safe open we called the hotel to let them know and security managed the situation and our valuables were safely locked away.

My husband and I stayed here for a few days at the end of January. The weather was warmer than expected so we lazed by the pool most days. Some days we had the place to ourselves. It was very quiet which for us was perfect. The staff were so helpful. They tended to our every need. Nothing was too much trouble. Everything about this hotel is perfect not just the staff but the breakfast the cleanliness the spacious room the lounge and bar..... The hotel provides a courtesy car (v nice range rover with tinted windows and leather interior) to take you to any restaurant in the evening. The only drawback is getting ripped off by taxi drivers in unroadworthy cars with no lights on the way back!  We stayed in a standard room which had a huge bed balcony tea and coffee making facilities (expensive) mini bar walk in wardrobe decent sized safe big tv with English channels (so you can remind yourself how cold and wet it is at home!). The bathroom had a big walk in shower and huge sunken bath (big enough for 2). It also had a hilarious space age toilet which had all sorts of options..... The toiletries are l'occitane. The rooms were cleaned twice a day with fresh towels clothes folded bottled water replenished slippers laid out etc.  The hotel is a 10 min drive from the airport. You see the occasional plane but it's barely noticeable.  I would highly recommend this hotel. The staff are best i have ever encountered. The only downside is it being a 15 min drive into town and having the feeling of taking your life in your hands with the taxi ride back. If the hotel had 3 or 4 restaurants you could stay put and it wouldn't be an issue.

I've been debating for a few months about writing this review because we did like the resort: we had a lovely suite the food was good the spa was heavenly and it was a lovely setting BUT the service in general was just not up to scratch. Each of the things that went wrong was a small annoyance but not one aspect of our stay from check-in to departure went smoothly which marred the trip.    There were lots of very friendly staff and a few who really seemed to get it but there was a general lack of coordination and staff empowerment. For example it is all great to have a guy in a suit greet you when you arrive but we really wanted one of those hot/cool towels (I don't know which it was as we never got one) to wipe the travel dust off and one of those cool drinks we saw being carried on a tray (while we were waiting and without having to hunt down someone to ask). I'm not going to list everything but there were two instances that were particularly disappointing:    It made our blood boil that the pool staff reserved the best spots by the family pool for VIPs. Definitely not cool. There were at least 10 loungers at the pool edge empty and we refused to be relegated to a spot farther away. It was definitely not the case that someone had taken a brief absence as one of the sets of chairs was still empty when we left and we got to see how a target family was treated when they arrived.    We were also unhappy with the guide that the hotel arranged again perfectly nice but lacking in cultural awareness - we were put off by comments like "Berbers are tall and handsome like me Arabs are short and fat with big noses" and jokes about polygamy and enjoying shocking European women by telling them that the flag pole on the minaret tower is used to hang disobedient wives. I'm sure someone else would have found him charming and perhaps we don't have the same sense of humour but this experience was not up to the standard of tour guides we've booked through FS before.    Breakfast staff were particularly lovely the spa therapist who gave me the hamman experience was fantastic and our housekeeper was also very accommodating (once we realised no one had passed on our preferences and she and I spoke directly).    So why did I debate writing this review? Because it was a nice place to visit probably even more so if you have small children and Marrakech is a great location for a short trip in the sun from Europe. But if they want to make it as good as other FS resorts they still have work to do on the service front.

Review_Title: Outstanding. One of the best hotels we have stayed in.
Review_Text: For a winter break you cant beat Marrakech. Warm and sunny during the day but cold at night.  A great place to stay and highly recommended then The Four Seasons Hotel takes some beating. The hotel is beautifully presented and the surrounding grounds are just perfect. Our room and en suite shower and bathroom were contemporary luxury of the highest standard but with an elegant Moroccan twist. Nothing was too much trouble for the staff who were friendly and courteous but also very helpful with advice on the best places to visit during our stay. Every day fresh fruit and tiny morsels of Moroccan delicacies were left in our room for us to sample and every evening a member of staff drove us into Marrakech to try out yet another restaurant they had said we should try before we left. Nothing disappointed and nothing failed to please. It is only four hours away from the snow ice and rain in the U.K. What's not to like?

Review_Title: Ideal for families looking for winter sun
Review_Text: My wife and I have been to Marrakech a few times always staying in a Riad in the Medinah.
