On this trip looking for some winter sun we took our three kids with us and felt a resort hotel was a better option. This hotel did not disappoint and was superb in every respect. Super efficient staff luxurious rooms great pool tennis courts and gym all in a well-manicured setting. This hotel was so good that you could easily forget you were staying in a branded hotel - just great all-round. Prices for the kids was also very reasonable - though expensive for adults - and worth it.

Review_Date: Elmed A wrote a review Jan 2013
Review_Text: It was all we wanted to see trully moroccan style. Everything was just so beautiful felt like I was on Sex and the city 2. The staff was great I couldn't ask for a better service. They really have everything to make you spend the best time you could wish to have in a hotel. I recommand it to anybody that care about good places where to rest in a beautiful environment. If you want to see marrakech just stay at this hotel there is absolutely nothing wrong about it !!
Reviewer_Location: New York, New York, United States

Review_Title: Just the perfect place. Ideal for families
Review_Text: In a couple of words: we go to marrakesh every year. This is simply the best place. Everything is perfect.  The amazing stuff:  - concierge desk. They get everything done for you and are really nice;  - the kids' club: fantastic and our daughter loved it;  - rooms: spacious (we took the pavilion) and with great terraces;  - the people: all nice efficient and slick;  - the director: despite the size of the hotel he is always present and interacts in a personal way.

Absolutely beautiful elegant very comfortable. Maroccon flair staff more than accommodating. They went out of their way to fulfill our request. In my opinion a much more comfortable elegant but homey hotel than La Mamounia and Royal Monsour.

It’s just 10 minutes ride from the airport and 10 minutes from Medina center however just outside the hotel there is nothing to see or to do  My room overlooking the gardens was amazing clean and comfortable with all complimentary you could need; all the staff is very professional.  I was at Four Season for a business meeting it’s a great and nice hotel but too peaceful and calm for me; if you are looking for a very relaxing place after your “shopping” day at suck this is the right place for you.

Review_Title: Not Worthy the Four Seasons Brand
Review_Text: Not sure how this property got all the good reviews. Currently staying here and more than disappointed. Have been fortunate enough to experience other Four Seasons and this one is clearly not up to the standard.    @Check-in: They emailed me in advance asking for the guests name (good). Only then to address everybody by my name (really bad). So why bother asking me at all? Furthermore check-in was unnecessary long.    @Room: Got room with no view on ground floor (which they call deluxe not lowest category) despite promises to the contrary before. Reception told me I got worst room because only pay special rate (which is correct but still 400 Euro per night). So unless you pay top rate you are treated as second class citizen.    In addition room was not properly cleaned. Windows at least not cleaned for two weeks. If you position yourself as 5+ star property and currently charge up to 700 Euro/ night for standard room you might consider cleaning the windows more often. Room also misses a desk to work which I find surprising. Plus e.g. fittings in bathroom or furniture not of highest quality (more like 4 star hotel and not comparable to FS Park Lane in London).    Even worse my friends were put in room with connecting door and NO noise isolation. They can hear everything what is said and done in room next to theirs. Talking to reception did not even get a feedback. Manager has now acknowledged the problem (we are aware) but can´t help (as hotel booked). My advice: Tell people when they book and they can then make a decision if they want to come despite that.    @Service level: They are trying but for a hotel now open since 1.5 years they should have figured it out by now. Apparently breakfast room too small for a full hotel (don´t ask). Instead of a) opening other restaurant for breakfast b) offering in room breakfast for free or c) offering breakfast until 12 instead of 10:30am hotel has decided to use banquet chairs and tables in addition. Never mind that whole atmosphere of place is being destroyed by non fitting furniture.    @Resort: Definetely not five stars. Gym & sauna (both too small for hotel this size) not connected to main building. So guests have to walk there with coat (currently cold at night and in the mornings). Same story for spa. Tennis courts are clay - which is great in case you make sure everybody plays with proper shoes. That is not the case. Btw: Gym machines are not disinfected after usage. Sauna is not heated.    Overall this is at best a four star property (when compared to places like Dubai Maldives Austria etc.). Certainly not up to usual Four Seasons standards.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: This is THE place to stay. Forget staying in the Medina - you will regret it!
Review_Text: Luxury - peace and calm - uber stylish - and worth every penny. At first we stayed in a Riad in the Medina but what a dump! We were very happy to move to the Four Seasons. Everything here is faultless. The staff are friendly and welcoming - and very professional. The food is top quality and edible - unlike most of the stuff found within the Medina. You will be very happy to stay here rather than a Riad. As always a faultless product from the Four Seasons family.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Paulo G wrote a review Dec 2012
Review_Text: Could not think of a better weekend getaway from Europe. A short flight to paradise.  Got to the Four Seasons Resort Marrakech just in 5 minutes ride from the airport.  It is not easy to describe the feeling: great service top facilities excellent food etc...  One as to go there to feel it!  Will be back soon for sure. This time without kids.

This five star hotel oozes luxury from the miute you step onto the pathway leading to Reception.    One of the top five hotels I have ever stayed at.    The Hotel is situated only five minutes drive from the Airport and easy access to touring the local farming areas leading to the Atlas Mountains.

Review_Date: Tracey C wrote a review Dec 2012
Review_Text: This hotel was beautiful very very smart with lovely outside seating areas pools and was simply stunning Think its only very new. Food was amazing service was faultless would love to stay again. Amazing views of the Atlas mountains and only 10 mins from the airport which was great.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Stayed at the Four Seasons in Marrakech during November. It is still very warm here compared to the UK and it was nice to enjoy the weather. The hotel itself is very palatial and quite big. When I was being taken to my bungalow it felt like I'd never find my way back to reception! The room was very clean and was very comfortable the bath and shower were nice and big in all senses of the word. The food at the hotel was good at breakfast there was a fair choice although sausages and bacon seem only the same in name to that served in the UK! The location is very handy being near the airport however once outside the hotels boundaries it is a very different place to that environment in the hotel.

A Great Four seasons resort the staff are all very helpful the property is fantastic they have a super spa and separate gym facility. It is close (but without any noise) to the airport. The medina and Center of town is a quick ride away. A very well run property...Very peaceful great multiple swimming pools... Really good base to explore Marrakesh and day trip into the High Atlas Mountains...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Adam L wrote a review Nov 2012
Review_Text: Check in was bit of a task but relatively straight forward. Staff when asked questions where polite and seemed to be very well trained. The hotel is lavishly furnished and very attractive. Now this is a big hotel and it does look like there has been money spent on it and the surroundings and facility's. There is a out door pool with cabanas around the side which is really good for getting changed and relaxing out of the sun in poolside there is a bar as well. Breakfast selection was good however be warned if you ask for a fried egg it takes ages for the chief to cook :-) also they had a standard domestic toaster for the toast..not good as there was always a queue for the toast.  The reason I have rated this hotel not as high as I am sure some people think it should be is because of the multiple ''little'' things that just add up..which for a 5 star hotel is just not on... I had to ask for turn down on a number of occasions dental and shaving kits had to be delivered to me there was a mat on the floor next to the toilet (uggghhh) totally unhygienic ! toilet light switch finger plate was loose and unkemptshower slider would not stay up in the shower cubicle and to cap it all there was a spill outside of my room that wasn't cleaned up in the days that I stayed there. Now I appreciated that all the points that I have mentioned may seem small but when you are paying in excess of €500 for a room I expect a certain level of facility's and service.  Again no issues with the staff themselves who where without exception helpful just those things that shouldn't be there..

We stayed at the Four Seasons for 4 nights in November with our 20 month old child.    We were lucky to be upgraded to a very nice suite with lots of room. A few minor things in the room did not work (a plug the scale one of the shower jets--the computer driven shower took a couple of minutes to figure out...but really cool after we got it going) but was clean and comfortable. We really liked the patio. A few things in the hotel need work we got stuck in an elevator for 10 minutes and the emergency phone didn't work...we had to call the front desk on our mobile--we were told they are aware of the problem put having trouble getting parts.    The staff in the kid zone were awesome (5+stars to the staff here and possibly the most friendly resort staff I have ever met) and the facility very nice. They don't allow children under 4 to stay without supervision but they do a great job playing with the kids.    The service quality was generally very good and clearly the staff were working very hard to make the stay pleasant and were very friendly to children.    One of the pools was heated and both pools were amazing.    What made the stay unusual was that 95% of the hotel was taken over by Land Rover and they were brining a new team of car salesmen every 24 hours or so. Most of the hotel was very quiet except breafast when you shared the resturant with this large (not very friendly) group. As a consequence most of the resturants in the hotel were closed and there was limited food choice in the hotel. The Land Rover group is going to be there for a significant time (perhaps a month) and I would skip the hotel when they are there. Other than choice the food was good.    I would stay at the hotel again but would check to see if they had any large groups staying and to figure out what facilities might be closed. If we return to Marrakech I would be tempted to try one of the other five star hotels--put the quality of the staff in the kid zone would likely bring me back to the four seasons.

Spent a glorious 36 hours at this hotel and longed to stay.    Everything is perfect. The magnificent rooms (I had a deluxe and it was one of the nicest I've ever seen and I spend significant amounts of time in luxury hotels) the service the beautiful gardens the wonderful food and the sights and sounds of Morocco.    The people here are awesome and everyone seems to know your name. I highly recommend the Four Seasons and I can't wait to return.

Review_Title: Happy but not overwhelmed compared to other FS
Review_Text: We stayed five nights in October. Had a large suite which was excellent with lots of space for everything we needed. Nice spa with good treatments and facilities. Great youth center where our son had a lot of fun. The pool was almost empty a bit too quiet for my taste maybe because the water was very cold (they told me they heat the pool only during winter time). We had breakfast every day one lunch and room service a couple of times. Food was mostly good but sometimes just OK. Service not always up to FS standard and far from the service levels we experienced at Amanjena where we stayed afterwards. I had gotten the impression that the hotel was pretty close to the medina and was disappointed that we had to drive 10 minutes and more to get to sights and restaurants. Lack of Moroccan atmosphere.

The Service at any Four Seasons Resort surpasses most other premium hotels. Obviously the Four Seasons have an excellent training program because this characteristic is seen at any of their Hotels anywhere in the world. The staff will go out of their way to ensure that you are happy. I had my shirts ironed - FOC. I ordered Coffee with Warm Milk once and every cup of coffee I asked for there after came with warm milk. Also the staff are all intelligent. They are not parroting rhetoric but they are talking intelligently.  Atmosphere - every part of the hotel makes you feel you are in Morocco. It has this central atmosphere running throughout the hotel.

1. great location - close to airport and most happenings in the city    2. lovely place - good rooms  restaurant and a sprawling property    3. excellent service.    the place is absolutely a delight to stay in. you can take long walks or cycle thru the property. excellent pool. there is a spa but did not use it . breakfast was also excellence though the service at the restaurant was a tad slow. very close to the airport.

Review_Title: Ultimate luxury and peace in the heart of the Magreb
Review_Text: Besides the big rooms superior service cleaningness lux I love it because:  big yeard great garden rooms in small houses in the complex etc.    The only BUT is the restaurant- not on the level of the hotel. Sorry Mr. Chef!    European piece in Arab Marrakesh.

Review_Title: Maybe my new Nr. 1 - beating La Mamounia
Review_Text: La Mamounia was one of my favourite hotels worldwide for many years - it still is - but maybe the Four Seasons is my new local Nr. 1. I hate to say that because usually I don't like the Four Seasons Hotels due to their bland standaridzation that often fails to connect with the local atmosphere (this is also the problem of the Amanjena). Here the 4S does indeed manage to incorporate the magic of Marrakech. Great public areas with palms and ponds and a fantastic pool. The La Mamounia pool for example cannot compete anymore and needs an upgrade (even if the interior design renovation by Jacques Garcia good). The one point where the La Mamounia certainly stays ahead of the 4S is the location inside the Medina and walking distance to the Djema el Fnaa and some of the better restaurants (Jad Mahal Comptoir Skybar ...). The 4S requires a taxi to get to town but is still much much closer than for example the Amanjena L Mansion or the Palais Namaskar. Rooms and service are of the famous and solid 4S quality which is a plus in a country where tourist trapping language gap mixed service and bad food still happen.

We have stayed at many Four Season's hotels in the world and all are outstanding. However there are none better than this! Although open only one year everything works perfectly -- the TV the internet the shower and so on.    My wife and I both caught a stomach bug before we arrived at the hotel. Management could not have been more helpful having a doctor over in 30 minutes! Management continued to check on us periodically.    Service is also out of this world with friendly how can I help you attitudes. The garden's are also amazing.    What at place!!

Review_Date: robert g wrote a review Oct 2012
Review_Text: just to say the hammam experience at the Four Seasons Marrakech is one of the best ive ever had..Tariq the masseur/hammam master was fantastic as was the female assistant my wife had... my body feels totally different today!  great hotel too...so relaxing after a crazy day in the Djemma El Fna    :)

Review_Date: sabine v wrote a review Oct 2012
Review_Text: Enjoy the service at the Hotel one of the best around the world the world. Pool rooms salons are beautiful  Best location for High quality international meeting : All our guests keep our meeting as the best one !

Review_Date: W S wrote a review Oct 2012
Review_Text: During my stay I had a hamman in the spa óf the Four Seasons Hotel in Marrakech. TARIK made it to the best hamman I ever had!!! I can recommend Tarik to all guests of the hotel!!!!! He is polite courteous and friendly in a unobtrusive way. Thank you verry much

Review_Title: living the good life in marrakech
Review_Text: it doesn't get any better than this. excellent accomodations and fantastic service. if you can splurge this is the way to go.  the staff is exceptionally trained and the grounds immaculate.  the car service into marrakech was a benefit.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Wonderful stay at this well managed, charming and beautiful resort
Review_Text: Rating:  I have no qualms about giving this property a shining 5!  It is very well taken care of in every way staff will go out of their way to ensure that you´ll have a perfect stay and everything you want/need food is great and arrive duly on time the pools are large and beautiful and the rooms are very comfortable and spacious.    Before making our reservation with the FS we were wondering if we would like to go to a property that´s not on the ocean but we were pleasantly surprised how content we felt strolling around the grounds. It also helps that the resort grounds are so charming well manicured and filled with herbs and fragrant plants everywhere.    I had noticed that some prior reviewers were mentioning teething issues considering it´s a new resort. But I am happy to report that we did not notice and at all!    Location:  It´s located quite central in Marrakesh and just a 10 minute drive from the airport. But somehow it manages to be incredibly calm and quiet (I presume the 16 hectares of land helps...)! But after having taken a look at the empty land surrounding the resort i foresee a lot of potential construction in the future...?    Hotel:  It´s not a beast with its mere 141 rooms and out of those 27 are suites. So despite the size of the main building it somehow manages to give a rather intimate feel.    Room:  We had 2 interconnecting rooms (320 and 321). I do like the system they use here which is to simply shut off a 3rd door in the hallway which gives a much more spacious feel!  Our rooms were located on the 3rd floor out of 4 (there are only the presidential and royal suites on the 4th) and facing the adult pool (more quiet!) and with a bonus view of the Atlas mountains. If you do choose a similar room you will not have either direct morning or evening sun.  The rooms were spacious with a functional layout and 2 large balconies. The beds and pillows (really loved the pillows!) very comfortable with high quality bedlinen    Plus:  * Large  * Sensible layout  * Ample storage for suitcases and clothes  * His and hers sinks  * Separate shower and bathtub  * Separate toilet  * Very quiet and efficent AC. Easily adjusted  * Possible to make room very dark. Important!  * Fast and stable WiFi  * Good water pressure  * Nice view  * Sparkling or still water was replanished daily together with fresh fruits or snacks    Minus:  * Very bland decor. It wouldn´t have hurt to implement some more genuine intricate Moroccan flavours IMO. BUT!!! we were told that they are currently in the process of implementing more colours and local decorations in the rooms so that should be all improved in no time!!!  * No beach bag in the room which is always handy to have no matter if one is heading to the beach or to the pool    AC:  Blissfully quiet and very efficent. Also easy to operate!    Pools:  There are 3 fresh water pools. One small one just for the kids club (shaded) and then 1 family and 1 adult pool. Now the family and adult pools are very separated ensuring peace over on the adult side. They are both large and have a beautiful AND practical layout. They are thankfully heated during the slightly colder season  The only slightly negative thing about the family pool is that there´s not really a wading area for the smallest kids unless toddling around on the steps count...  I also like the little snacks and refreshments that were handed out. Plus there is also a small spa menu for lighter/shorter treatments to be had poolside    Kids club:  Wonderful!! It is huge and very well equipped. We can not say enough good things about Samira who was absolutely lovely with our daughter! The activity schedule is varied and should have something to offer everyone no matter of interests    Food/restaurants:  We were in general very impressed with the food. Only encountered a small propblem with our in room dining which was swiftly rectified.    Inara: They do have a nice and varied lighter menu for an afternoon snack or light lunch  Solano: This is where breakfast is served and also where their Moroccan fare is served at night. The breakfast buffet is very large has a great selection is always fresh and an appealing presentation! Dinner at night holds very high standard as well  Bleu d´Orange: Lovely setting/decor food is fabulous and service very attentive  Azzara: Nice relaxed atmosphere for having lunch next to the adult pool. Good food and good mood. They do also do an indian themed night there sometimes which we highly recommend!!  In room dining: They were always right on time as promised. Very nicely set up in room and fresh. The odd time they got something wrong it was rectified as ASAP!  Food by the pool: It´s not possible to have any by the family pool (too bad). But there is a small but nice selection available next to the adult pool  Childrens menu: Deifinitely on the small side... And no healthy options such as non fried items or vegetables. Must say that there is room for improvement here!!!    Spa:  It´s located at the far end of the property and very serene.  My husband had a massage de Marrakesh and wasn´t bowled over by it but perfectly content. I had a full hammam which was great! Not sure that i have ever been as clean as after that treatment...I highly recommend my therapist Aisha (sp?) as she was pleasant efficent and thorough!  Also nice that there is a spa menu "light" by the pools with treatments that can be done poolside!  Internet:  There are 2 services they offer. There´s the slightly slower "every day" wifi which is perefctly fine for checking emails and whatever social networking needs one has. But for things that require a bit more speed they also offer a faster wifi for 15 Euro per day and 3 devices  Also the wifi connection is more than spotty by both pools which is annoying    Staff/service:  Now they were almost the best thing about this resort! We did not encounter a single employee that were not genuinely friendly very service minded and had that extra personal touch. And they all made sure to pay a bit of extra attention to our young daughter who happily lapped it all up!  They sure do go that extra mile to ensure that you have a great stay!!!    Amenities/Minibar:  The amenties are pretty basic and they provide the usual L´Occitane.  The minibar has a decent selection but is actually very expensive... come on 8 euros for a can of coke?    Laundry:  It was done in no time almost! Back in our room before even 2 hours were up! And in perfect condition    Shopping:  They do have a lovely boutique on site with a nice selection of clothes for both adults and children plus quite a lot of nice objects for the house as well. There is also some books and sunscreens for sale. But no magazines so make sure to stock up on that before coming here!    Transfer from an to the airport:  I definitely recommend that you book this! We were whisked away before hitting immigration and ushered into a lounge where we relaxed drank water and ate cookies while our papers were taken care of. And then they swiftly sorted out our luggages too. Very painless process!!  And it was just as good when we were driven back to the airport    Things to do:  We did book a half day tour of the Medine Souk and Jeema el-Fna. I HIGHLY recommend our tour guide Ali who was every bit a helpful gentleman and i challenge you to ask him a question that he does not know the answer too!!! The Medina part was all right the souk a lot better than i expected as we didn´t feel hustled at all and it was all very calm and civilized. Jeema el-Fna should probably be visited at night time for a better experience but over all we really enjoyed our tour and that had a lot to do with our most excellent guide    Would we stay here again?:  Definitely! But most likely for a long weekend/short week. I would say that 4-5 days here is enough and perfect to just remain on the property. Unless of course one wants to induldge in a lot of excursions and activities outside of the resort

The problem with understanding hotel ratings in Marrakech is due to the lack of distinction on Tripadvisor and elsewhere between Hotels and Riads. Riads should we think be classified as B&B not as hotels. Some Riads are simply paradisiac some are disastrous and we will never again venture there unless we have very reliable first hand information. As far as hotels are concerned the Four Seasons is ... a Four Seasons. Perfection all around at a high price. The best hard trying and dedicated staff in the industry.  The resort is brand new impeccably clean. Two great pools one for families and one for adults (no shouting there !) a dream. Excellent restaurants superb breakfast (at London or Paris prices) great sunset bars good spa but this could and should be improved on. A very well organised boutique with quality items at reasonable prices. Location is fine too away but not to far from the Mediana and very close to the airport.  One important caveat between 2 and 4 in the morning the airco switches off and uncomfortable heath woke us up sweating every night at 330 AM we found it quite unacceptable. We got no credible explanation. Is it a money saving measure ? At these room prices ? That is the only reason why we can't give the Four Seasons Resort Marrakech an "excellent" rating.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Having prebooked the VIP pick up we were met off the plane and escorted through to the VIP lounge where complementary drinks and snacks were waiting. They handled immigration and after a short wait we were whisked through to a waiting E Class Merc. We had the same service on our return and I can definitely recommend this service.    On arrival we were greeted by name and given cold towels and mint tea. As we arrived at 10 am our room was not quite ready but we were allocated a temporary room and told that the bellboy would move our luggage later. In our room I was amazed to find a birthday cake (I'd mentioned that the trip was in celebration of my BIG birthday) along with champagne and roses. It was an unexpected trreat delicious and much appreciated - thank you!!    Our room was spacious beautifully docorated and had a lovely view of the gardens and the Atlas Mountains. Bottled water was continuously refreshed and the beds were so comfortable. We also had a big terrace with a table 2 very comfortable chairs and an alcove sofa complete with a mountain of cushions.    Food was expensive as expected but well presented and delicious.    We organised a guide to take us through the Souks and he was excellent - well worth it as we would never have found our way around and he made us feel very safe.    The pools were lovely although we actually preferred the children's pool as we mostly sunbathed in afternoon and we could sunbathe in the privacy of the personal sun tents. We also appreciated the fruit skewers that they served.    The staff could not do enough to help you and really offered a personal service. We had a great holiday -thanks so much to all the staff at the Four Seasons for making our trip so special. Go there - you will not regret it!

Review_Date: Loving the crab wrote a review Oct 2012
Review_Text: Typically well run 4 Seasons Hotel.Terrific rooms great Spa plus two pools with a lot of space.    Only 10 mins from the airport less to town.    Hotel restaurants good but why eat in when there are plenty a short Hotel courtesy car ride away.    Only negative are the concierge who when asked to suggest a restaurant just give you a sheet of paper so prep before you arrive.    That said would highly reccomend.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We had an absolutely superb stay at the hotel. The staff are really friendly and looked after us really well. They chatted and joked with us and made us feel very welcome.    The rooms and bathrooms were spacious and beautifully decorated with a big balcony: everything was extremely comfortable and modern with enough room that we could all spend time in one room if we wanted to be together. And of course the famous Four Seasons beds are simply the best!    There is a choice of restaurants and although the menu isn't hugely extensive everything on it is exquisitely prepared (not much variety for a vegetarian but something for them to eat in each restaurant). We particularly enjoyed the Moroccan restaurant.    There are two fantastic (and big) pools to choose from. The staff wander by fairly regularly to make sure you have drinks and anything else you need.    The hotel pick up and drop off at the airport is an excellent service and doesn't actually add much to the price. It really is hassle free (they even take care of immigration for you).    Unsurprisingly this is an expensive place to stay but it truly is worth every penny. Highly highly recommended.

We had a wonderful time at this hotel. The service was impeccable as expected from the Four Seasons brand. Staff were very friendly and treated us like royalty from the moment we arrived to the time we left. The pavilion room we occupied was spacious with private terrace and huge bathroom. Room service is incredibly efficient.  The hotel has two swimming pools one for adults and the other for families and this works well for those of us who enjoy relaxing on holiday away from the sound of children. The restaurants are well run and the food is of a very good quality with excellent service.  We did have a couple of minor concerns but these were dealt with well and efficiently by the  management and resolved quickly inspiring great confidence.  The spa is amazing and it is well worth exploring the numerous treatments on offer. I tried one virtually everyday.    We would highly recommend this hotel and are already thinking about booking another September break there next year.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Karin B wrote a review Sep 2012
Review_Text: We went to Marrakech on business and choosed the four seasons for this 5 days-stay. The building is quite new and modern as we like it. Lots of light staff very friendly. It's a pitty they don't have anyone waitering the swimming pool area and you often have to get up to order your drinks at the bar but the swimming pools are lovely and much attended by the friendly lifeguard. It's all very relaxing. Massages at the spa or the swimming pool are lovely ask for Tarek or Yanounes (or something like that) they are just the best. I have had massages all around the world I can compare this massages with ones I got in Bali. Restaurant are very nice but there is so much to discover in Marrakech they give you a list of restaurant to visit in the city. Definitely try the french restaurant of La Mamounia. The courtesy limousine of the four seasons will bring you there (5min drive) no extra charge asked. The only thing that disappointed me a little bit was the fact that I couldn't get any other pillow (there were quite big and I have a neck issue so I need a good pillow not too big) something all good hotels offer normally. Oh yes before I forget take their VIP service offer to go back to the airport it's really worth its money!  If we have to go back we definitely are choosing the 4 seasons again.

We (Me Wife son (4½) have just returned from a fabulous 8 night stay at the Four Seasons Marrakech. This genuinely family friendly hotel gave us excellent service from our initial contact prior to arrival until we departed for the airport.    The accommodation was first class which would be expected from such a new hotel. We stayed in an Executive Suite in the main building which met our needs perfectly large bedroom a lounge (which was converted into a bedroom each evening) walk in wardrobe 2 toilets 2 showers a bath which literally could fit us all in and a large balcony with table chairs and sun loungers. The room also had a good size mini bar and access to USB ports and 3 pin plug sockets which were very useful given we had forgotten our travel adaptor (incidentally the hotel also supplied one for our stay). We had a long discussion on where this room ranked in all of our holidays and it made the top 3 - final placing’s couldn’t be agreed upon but we loved it.  As you would expect the bathrooms were stocked with large amounts of the L’Occcatain range. We are personally big fans of the L’Occatain product range and we find it an added bonus to any Four Seasons visit.    The hotel restaurants are excellent in particular Solano where the food was fabulous and the Moroccan wine we tried was wonderful and something we’ll be looking for now we’re home. There are not many choices but we had no need to leave the hotel to eat. This in part was due to our stay overlapping with Ramadan and our son would not have been able to wait to eat after sunset when the restaurants in the city would open. We were aware of this when booking so despite this meaning we did not get to enjoy some of the fabulous cuisine the city can offer (we’d experienced this on a prior visit) it was of no concern and should not prevent people staying during Ramadan.    The staff were friendly helpful and very welcoming and they all seemed to know our name’s! They treated our son royally and nothing was too much trouble to ensure his enjoyment. He particularly liked his name on the door when we arrived and the personalised plate of sweets and hand printed t-shirt which was given to him. Initially we thought the children’s menu’s was limited which is something the hotel could consider reviewing however when we started asking for what he wanted bypassing the formal menu there was no concern whether it was Pizza fruit salad or a cheese and tomato sandwich. They even learnt to make his favourite drink Jumeirah Beach’s “Little Rascal” orange juice lemonade with a dash of grenadine (by the end of the stay the dash was just right).    We also enjoyed our time in the Inara Bar where a special mention to bar manager Mohamed has to made as he seemed to end up with a large percentage of our son’s bespoke requirements.    The hotel was also very caring. When our son was unwell on a visit to the city the guide quickly got us back to the hotel and by the time we had got back to our hotel room reception was on the phone asking if we needed any assistance or a Doctor calling. This was not required but knowing that help was there if required was a great relief. The hotel also checked on his well-being the next day to make sure he was feeling better (he was).    We made minimal use of the Kids Club and Young Adults centre but what we saw and used were good particularly the climbing wall. One minor point but an easy fix would be to have a greater choice of English speaking DVD’s at the young adults centre movie theatre our son loved “Space Buddies “ but I know we’d have preferred to have watch some of the other options which were only in French.    We spent most of our time around the beautiful family pool where despite us regularly getting there before the staff the facilities were excellent and we benefitted from having sun tents as opposed to the traditional sun umbrella. We particularly enjoyed the sample smoothies and the fruit kebabs but our son did miss not getting ice lollies as given out in similar resorts.    My wife and I both had treatments at the Spa which were of high quality and in comparison to UK prices excellent value for money.    We used the laundry facility on one occasion and I can say I’ve never had laundry return wrapped in tissue paper ribbon and in a leather box. It was also immaculately clean and pressed.    We had no genuine issues are there things which can be improved – yes but I believe the management are aware of them and are working towards their resolution. We had a great holiday and will definitely return.

We had a fabulous time at this resort. The resort is absolutely beautiful. The rooms are big with comfortable beds and really were the best accommodations we've ever experienced. The food is really good. The employees are friendly and the housekeeping service was outstanding. I will admit that being it's a Four Seasons we had very high expectations. The only item that did not live up to our expectations was the speed of service. On many occasions we found it hard to place a drink or meal order and on almost all occasions the wait to receive the item was substantially longer than expected.    Overall we did have a wonderful time and would return again. I would have given it a 4.5 stars if that was an option. Don't hesitate to book this resort however expect a considerable wait to receive anything you order.

Review_Title: Overall a great stay but room for improvement
Review_Text: We stayed during July 2012 for four nights. The resort was virtually empty with only about 20 rooms occupied and we were given a free upgrade to a Deluxe Room with a great view. The rooms themselves are beautifully appointed and very spacious. Wonderful bed and I particularly loved the décor. The public areas of the resort are absolutely beautiful and particularly so at night when they are illuminated.    The staff are wonderful very polite helpful and accommodating typical FS.    The food is generally great room service was tasty and hot the breakfast in Solano was wonderful and extensive. Dinner in Solano was also a treat make sure you sit outside looking out to the resort magical. Blue d’Orange had an amazing setting but the food wasn’t as good as in Solano. The Azzera Grill was my least favoured option a sub-par hamburger for lunch combined with very slow service. They also got my order wrong on the first day and completely forgot about our order on the second day.    The Spa was wonderful and the treatments we had were great.    On the flipside some public areas such as the bathrooms are not air conditioned with I thought was rather odd. The poolside service really needs attention as there are no staff at the Children’s pool to help set you up with towels etc. There is a staff member at the adults only pool but it was hit and miss if they helped you set up under a cabana or on a lounge chair. They also don’t bring you free water which is a glaring omission from a resort of this calibre. They still bring you the occasional treat here and there but the poolside service was inferior to the other resort style pools in other FS that I’ve been to (namely Hong Kong and Maui) I also found the gym to be wanting and not really befitting of a five star resort.    Overall a great stay just need to work on the service at the pool and at the Azzera Grill.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: dal s wrote a review Sep 2012
Review_Text: You can't go wrong nice hotel nice staff far enough from the madness in town... short drive. Hotel provided fully loaded sports jeep land rover for local drops. Ideal for kids but on this occasion we never took them. Hotel was pretty empty so we and another couple had the whole pool area. IN room dining was better then most 5 Stars we've visited.. went out every eve into the town. Was crazy hot in Aug outside but i did figure how to reduce the AC in my room as it was to cold!!!. We visit 3 countries per year and have never visited the same hotel twice. This one could be the one as its a lot of culture for a 3.5 hour flight on that note SVP bonjour
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Four Seasons quality is alive and well in Marrakech
Review_Text: We stayed for five nights in early September and really enjoyed this property. We were allocated a spacious ground floor pavilion room with an outdoor terrace. The room was very comfortably furnished and the huge bathroom was luxurious and well fitted.    Most days we sat by the pool. There are two large pools one for adults only and the other for guests with children. Pool service was excellent and we enjoyed lunch each day in the poolside Azzera restaurant. Breakfast too was a highlight offering a daily special hot dish and wonderful buffet tables with Moroccan and a wide choice of international dishes. There was also a special juice drink which changed every few days and this was delicious too.    The spa was superb offering a range of local treatments (loved the Hammam experience) as well as the usual massage options and treatments.    Staff throughout the Resort were unfailingly courteous and attentive and service was close to faultless. We felt very welcome in the Resort and there was nothing that was too much trouble.    There were only two disappointments for us - evening dinner options and the return airport transfer. The hotel offers Solana a Moroccan restaurant which we tried but found the food there rather tasteless. There is also Blue Orange - an Italian where the food was better but this option is only open five nights of the week. Both of these restaurants were empty when we dined there and it might be that guests mostly choose to eat outside the hotel. The only other on-site dining options were the room service menu and a very limited selection of dishes (mini burgers quesadilla etc) in the Inara Lounge and Bar. As we left there was about to be a ‘pop up’ Indian restaurant operating for one night and hopefully the Hotel will do more of this as we found the evening dining experience limited a little soul-less and rather underwhelming.    For 650MAD each way (per car) you are met on arrival at the Airport priority cleared through immigration and then driven the ten minute journey from the airport to the Hotel. Our arrival transfer worked well but on the return the car dropped us in the airport car park and we had to drag our cases some distance into the airport terminal while the driver walked alongside us empty handed. No assistance with baggage was offered by him or anyone else until we were inside the Terminal. Regular taxis on the other hand are a fraction of the cost and drop passengers right outside the terminal. Immigration queues were minimal going both in and out of Marrakech at the times we travelled so overall we didn’t feel the Hotel’s transfer service was as good as it needs to be and we would probably make our own arrangements in future.    Overall though we returned home feeling very refreshed and with very happy memories of the Four Seasons Marrakech and we very much hope to return someday soon.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed as a family at the hotel for ten days in the later part of August.  The hotel and staff are just wonderful. Nothing is too much trouble.  The service was excellent as one would expect from a Four Seasons Hotel.  Breakfast in the Solano presents an enviable choice of food .The food in the Bleu d'orange was delicious and we were particularly impressed with Karim the manager there.  The Inara bar with its air con is a pleasant choice for cocktails in the evening or a light lunch midday. The adult pool was glorious and peaceful with attentive poolside staff and good food at the Azzera Restaurant. A visit to the spa is a must!  Our room was just outstanding with room service and house keeping prompt and of an excellent standard.  We would highly recommend this hotel

I stayed with my son and his family at this wonderful hotel which exceeded our expectations.  The General Manager went out of his way each day to personally make sure we were all satisfied with our stay. All the staff were polite and most friendly they couldn't do enough for us. The restaurants are superb. The grounds delightful and the pool are is just stunning with cabanas to enjoy. The kids club is also excellent with plenty of choice of entertainment. As soon as we drove into the Palm tree lined avenue we felt very welcome by the Management as they came out to greet us. My grandchildren aged 10 8 and 6 absolutely loved the holiday and they all have asked to go back again!! Yes please the sooner the better. A most charming hotel and highly recommended!!

Review_Date: Charles S wrote a review Sep 2012
Review_Title: Tarik (Spa Masseur) is reason enough to book this hotel
Review_Text: Tarik is the best. Book a massage wih him -- 90 minutes. He's pure genius.    Overall the propertly is luxurious and grand. The food is fantastic the grounds are fantastic. The pool and cabanas are superb.    The resort location is farther from the medina than I originally thought -- it is not within walking distance; however the taxis are easy and inexpensive -- and it takes only minutes to get anywhere within the medina. I do not regret bypassing the more authentic riads and staying at the Four Seasons. It was well worth the time and the money.    I started my days with a fantastic breakfast. I have stayed in luxury hotels all over the world -- and this hotel breakfast was very very good. The afternoons I would spend at the pool in a cabana drinking cocktails and taking a swim. The August afternoons are so oppressively hot that the cabanas serve the perfect shelter from the brutal direct sun. I became plenty tan even sitting in the covered cabana.    The rooms are nice as one would expect. I was upgraded to the executive suite - 2 bathrooms beautiful balcony heavenly bed. Very nice.    I spent every evening in the medina eating dinner and watching the incredible entertainment.    The hotel recommends great restaurants in the medina -- but I have a great tip -- do not eat at Le Comptoir Darna just go there for drinks around 10:00pm and see the belly dancing. The show is worth the trip but the food is not great. Go just for drinks and to see the show. If youwant an amazing dinner - go to Gastro MK. It's an uber amazing Riad with an even more amazing dinner. Some of the best food going.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Charles G wrote a review Aug 2012
Review_Text: We went there as a family recently and were very happy. There rooms are great the food available was great; all very comfortable indeed.    Furthermore having never had a massage before I decided to try one. As a young man with lots of randoms pains from every sport under the sun I was a bit apprehensive. My advice: go there ask for Tarik regardless of who u are and have a massage just do it.    Also if you are a golf fan then there are lots of great courses out there the hotels next to them may only be building sites but the golf is fantastic (I found the 'Al Maaden' was a favourite).    Loved it!

Review_Date: Neena OBE wrote a review Aug 2012
Review_Text: I have just stayed at this resort for a week and I have to say that the experience amazing. We did not want for anything- I could not fault it. It was worth every penny. I chose the four seasons because it was a little away from the hub hub- and it was absolutely the right decision it was a haven. We were upgraded to a pavilion room and it was huge with a huge bathroom dressing room and private garden area- wow! With BBc 1 and 2!!  The restaurants were excellent and there was a lavish buffet breakfast with freshly squeezed orange and grapefruit juice.  The pool area-adult was calm and relaxing and the pool water was like mineral water.  The spa massages were out of this world and the hammam was pure indulgence. Do it at the hotel NOT in the medina!  All in all the whole week was superb and I would definitely have no hesitation in recommending it whole heartedly.

It is not just the beautiful facilities and setting that make the Four Season Marrakech so great. It's the service which I thought was the best I have ever experienced. The waiters know the guests name when we show up at breakfast. The Concierge made great suggestions and remembered everything they had arranged earlier. Courteous and helpful drivers were around to assist us with airport transport and trips to restaurants. We loved visiting the colourful and exotic city of Marrakech but the visit was greatly enhanced by the Four Seasons.

I'm lost for words to describe the experience that I just had at the Four Seasons Resort Marrakech; EVERYTHING from check-in to check-out five days later was EXCELLENT.    We arrived on Sunday 12 August and were met on arrival in the Airport by a Four Seasons Representative to collected our luggage from the baggage carousel and fast-tracked us through passport control. A black Range Rover Vogue awaited us in the carpark to bring us on the short hop to the Four Seasons Resort Marrakech located in a Rosemary scented oasis very close to the Marrakech-Menara Airport (RAK).    Check-in was done with speed and comfort. We were informed that we had been upgraded from a Standard Room to a Superior Room. Most hotel rooms are typicall nothing more than a beige box not the Four Seasons Resort Marrakech though. Our room was very well appointed with views over the gardens.    The silver-grey slate and gold sandstone surrounding the Adult Only swimming pool is a pleasant departure from the ubiquitos Aqua Marine blue mosic tiles found in many other properties. The water in the pool was as clear and fresh as bottled spring water.    The bed and bed-linen were of such a high standard that an exceptional nights sleep was guarenteed. ALL of the staff were friendly and helpful two in particular deserve special mention - Salma who worked the breakfast room every morning during our stay and Sofia at the Concierge Desk.    If I had to summarise our stay in one word it would have to be; WOW...
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Our Best ever 4 seasons stay & experience!!!!! the journey to the resort of senses!!!!!!! In Marrakech wonderland...
Review_Text: we just returned full of excitement from this spectacular resort and our best ever 4 seasons experience & stay from all 4 seasons so far.... from the very first second the vip service of the resort( of course we paid for these expenses) received us from plane straight to the vip  room to avoid cues etc for the passport control our range rover vogue 2.5 drive to this beauty in front of us.... where to start and what to finish with.... so many adorable and beautiful memories this resort left us this time on our july 2012 family vacations.... the family suite so clean beautifully decorated and fresh new morocco dark wood furnitures with marrakech touch & design on wood... with all the presents each day in the kids room to excite them as they cry on leaving.... the staff strongly adorable happy to serve us more than expected happy and lovely people giving all theirselves to serve the kids and us all times in breakfast  restaurants the newly colourful huge kids club with the babies swimming pool just combined again amazing girls there working who kept kids fully occupied  making them so many nice staff learning them so many new things every day.... the restaurants all one by one with lovely dishes  congrats to the fantastic chefs  the design of restaurants lovely cuisines perfect staff again and again.... the spa which was something breathtaking had a whole tour around with the saunas hammams room steambaths the outdoor and indoor relaxation places & areas all by the beautiful members there had a traditional morroccon massage as well as my husband we both loved it  and thanks to your master treatment people of yours fantastic pedicure & manicure.... really enjoyed .... the resort itself is just a dreamland on whole everywhere you step in is a dream from culture amazing design well done to this brand new property just finished a year ago.... spectacular oasis of gardens ready to send u in peace & heaven.... cannot be compared really  not only because is brand new but due to the awsome staff everywhere in the resort including the room service that made everything to make us feel a king/ queen!!!! i am sure whoever is stepping into this wonderland resort will be send to heaven..... cause really is worth it and for us  being to many four seasons around the world europe assia midfle east & usa  this has touched our heart  ours and our kids too!!!! by far the best 4 s stay & we are planning already to return in near future with hubby for more relaxation in this exciting & unigue destination  of course in our spectacular oasis paradise!!!! Four seasons resort Marrakech!!!! Well done & keep up the excellent work  you truly deserve it!!! one thing to add here: the restaurants are expensive  any restaurants more than all the 4 s & ofcourse the paris one George v ... but it worths all the money in the world!!!! We Love you!!!

Review_Title: Not Really A Four Seasons At All .... Yet!
Review_Text: I am going to base this review by comparing this Four Seasons with others around the globe and with similar properties around Marrakech.    I've previously given the Four Seasons in Tokyo a 5*+ - and I'd give the New York and Paris a 5*+ so there's no way the Marrakech one comes up to the standards of those great hotels so it seems ridiculous for anyone to consider giving it 5*. Perhaps we now expect too much of the Four Seasons afterall they seem to now open as often as Starbucks.    There's no excuse for people to still say the Four Seasons Marrakech has teething problems - it's now been open for 1 year. So no excuses please. You're paying top dollar so I want to be given top dollar standards in return.    We found ourselves repeatedly asking for various amenities that had not been replaced and we too would have to ask for dirty cups etc to be taken away. Housekeeping would clean the room and still dirty items would be left behind. Let's not blame the staff these are management issues. Often the basics which are in a bathroom were missing. Where's the soap? Flannels?    Yes the grounds are large - the pools are fabulous. I certainly give top marks to the fact that there's an adults only pool and a kids pool and they are virtually the same thus stopping kids wanting to be in the adult pool presuming we had something better. However anyone who thinks the grounds of the Four Seasons Marrakech amazing needs to take a trip to the Palais Namaskar Marrakech to see what the definition of amazing is.    We thought our Deluxe room was bland beyond belief - it had no sense of luxury at all. Very uninspiring no sense of decoration or art. Marrakech is such an inspiring place full of people who have done the most creative things with riads and restaurants so it beggars belief that the designer of this hotel was so uncreative.    So in truth the Four Seasons Marrakech is quite nice. It's not amazing or stunning or the overly used word 'awesome'. No hotels are awesome - the Grand Canyon is awesome not a hotel room or a club sandwich. And certainly there's no sense of being in or around Marrakech at this resort. But I guess it's nice enough for a long weekend away - but there's certainly very little WOW-factor.    In my opinion there really are better places if you want to be outside the medina and stay at a large hotel with landscaped grounds. For all these reasons this particular Four Season can only possibly be given 3 stars. And if this is the only hotel you've stayed at in Marrakech then you've not really stayed at or experienced what Marrakech has to offer at all.    .

TEN minutes by cab from the bedlam of the Medina and its teeming souks this luxurious and calming oasis provides welcome relief after the frenzy of the old town. The hotel is almost brand new and everything from bedrooms to public areas is up to the usual superlative Four Seasons standard. Staff are friendly courteous and extremely willing. Gardens are huge and beautiful scented with thyme lavender rosemary and eucalyptus. Inside the Moroccan theme is evident but done with tasteful understatement: mint tea at reception and atmospheric lanterns on the terraces but no kitsch. A comfortable siting room even has faint touches of Chatsworth about it with marble fireplace and bookshelves containing lavish tomes about life in the desert. Swimming pools are excellent: a large family one with a clever design to amuse les enfants and a superb adults-only one vast and serene expertly serviced by charming and helpful attendants who bring round the freebie ice creams and mini smoothies. Breakfast buffet first rate. Rooms opulent and supremely comfortable with latest in super-efficient aircon digital TVs and gadgetry; bathrooms ditto. We had large comfy balconies overlooking gardens with table chairs and a sofa with giant fan overhead. The hotel seems to be working hard to eliminate minor housekeeping glitches referred to previously on this site. We had two adjoining rooms sharing a common lockable entrance door which worked very well for us and found our rooms well serviced with frequent checks to ensure we were happy (although turndown was slightly hit or miss a couple of nights).The management kindly sent up a delicious chocolate birthday cake and flowers for our daughter’s 18th an impressive touch and thank you. We made good use of the courtesy car for evening trips into the city and found the concierge and his team very helpful. But you will need cabs to get anywhere at all and it’s worth paying a little extra (say £10 instead of £5) for a decent air conditioned taxi which the desk can whistle up for you. Generally cabs are very cheap even if the cabbies downtown triple the fare when you ask for the Four Seasons. It is perhaps naïve to expect anything else. Spa superb and we enjoyed two dreamy massages on a 2-for-1 special July deal costing just £70 for two one-hour massages. Not bad value. Our only other observation is that the hotel might be more adventurous with its dining options. Admittedly we have just come back from low season when not everything can be expected to be running full blast but if there had been a bit more variety on site then we might have stayed in more rather than go downtown. There is a decent Italian on site but with a fairly narrow menu: maybe expand that a bit? Or perhaps a steak and seafood bar? On the other hand going into the heart of the city is half the reason for coming to Marrakech so most guests will probably be happy. As for the fabled heat incidentally we enjoyed it tremendously after the grim British summer and it is a bone dry heat so no mozzies – a real bonus. On top of that the low season deal makes the Four Seasons great value at this time of year. One or two on this site have gently moaned about high bar and food prices and they are indeed not cheap but no more than you’d pay in a hotel or restaurant of this quality elsewhere and who goes to the Four Seasons expecting bargain basement anyway? Overall a luxurious and restful retreat.

We are big fans of the Four Seasons having stayed in many across Europe and in Sharm El Sheik for 5 consecutive years for the sunshine. So when the Four Seasons Marrakech opened we were delighted to have a shorter flight to the sunshine. We chose the VIP meet and greet which was the perfect fast track start to our 9 nights of unrivalled in luxury and service. The entire hotel is furnished as you would expect a Four Seasons to be no expense is spared in the common areas the luxurious drapes hang in the elegantly furnished bars and lounges. The Four Seasons signature fresh flowers are in abundance their beauty doesn't disappoint. Everything is exceptionally clean the cleaning staff keeping everything spotless. We had a Deluxe room with a great view of the main pool we expected a large room with high quality comfortable furnishings plenty of storage and that's exactly what we got. The bed was large and extremely comfortable. Breakfast was high quality with a lot of variety and served by attentive staff who remembered our particularly daily preferences. We ate in the hotel every night using the whole host of dining options from in-room dining to bar meals to a la carte. All of the food was very good and beautifully presented the variety wasn’t enough though for 9 nights and it did feel limited. Mind you we could have left the hotel and had a whole world of variety but we chose not to do that on this occasion.  All in all it was an excellent stay and we will return again and will highly recommend to anyone who asks for a proper 5* hotel to stay in Marrakech.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: When I heard that Four Seasons had arrived in Marrakech I wanted to visit. Some of the earlier reviews have made reference to what must have been early teething problems which in the main have been ironed out. Our experience was as follows;  We had arranged to pick up transfer from the airport and what a slick operation. Met at the gate whisked into a comfy lounge escorted through a dedicated immigration channel helped with luggage black Range Rover waiting outside and then whisked to the hotel. Slick and well worth it. And just as slick on the way out.  At the hotel we were met and in our room within 10-15 minutes even though several groups had arrived at the same time.  We had a Pavilion Room which was large with dining area and a large terrace with lounges etc.  Room service was always delivered at the time they quote you when ordering. Poolside service was spot on. Any restaurants I asked the hotel to book were done. They organized an excellent guide for our visits to Majorelle Gardens souks and the Medina.  I had been tweeting and offered a cocktail master class by Federico the sommelier. I thought this would have been forgotten but whilst in resort they tweeted me and offered up the master class in how to make a great mojito. Federico and the guys were great and we had a great evening as a result.  We did visit and dine at La Mamounia and your choice of hotel will come down to personal choice not necessarily cost. I could have stayed at La Mamounia for less then the Pavilion Room at Four Seasons. When I return as I will which will I choose. Four Seasons without a doubt.  Thanks to Four Seaons and all the staff for a great stay in Marrakech
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: 5 nights here were not enough. We should have had 7. Hotel staff are all absolutely delightful helpful and the most courteous out of the 6 hotels we stayed in on our trip. Our room was extremely spacious with a walk in robe with racks for 2 suitcases which is rare huge bathroom with separate loo outdoor area and traditional warm Moroccan decor. Beautiful and extremely comfortable.  A few friends who had been to Marrakech thought we should have stayed in the Medina though driving out of the hussle bussle back to the hotels peace quiet and open space was very settling. Its barely a 10 minute drive.  Breakfast was amazing as were drinks of an evening in the lounge and dinner outdoors even though the temps were around 35 at night. We did not have lunch at the hotel as we were always out and about during the day.  The concierge organised Hisham our fabulous driver and guide and we were taken on the most fantastic trip to Berber country. The second trip was out to the coast for lunch and a look around Essaouira.  Marrakech is the most magical place as is 4 Seasons.l

Four Seasons Marrakech is a hugely impressive hotel. The Pool areas are simply amazing and everywhere else is top class. Service was extremely helpful and the staff showed great zeal in eliminating the two very minor hitches that occured. The residences manager Nagy was particularly helpful in showing me round. A very short first trip but I'm certain to be back many more times

We have just returned from 3nights at this hotel and felt like we had been away longer due to the fact that it was so fantastic . The staff are some of the best I have come across across the board from the very elegent lady who checked us in to the duty manager who helped us with anything we needed to Rachid who served us lunch by the pool who seemed to know our name from the moment we sat down .  Rooms we stayed in were the Pavillion Suite and it was large with very nice bathroom lounge and plunge pool outside on the patio with sunbeds and table these rooms are all set around the pool area which we liked . We also saw a Pavillion room that was in the same block also very nice it reminded me of the Royal Mirage Arabian Court in Dubai.  Food we ate at Bleu de Orange and it was excellent and not overpriced at all . Zest bar was great but not open after the weekend which was a shame and the restaurant they serve breakfast in overlooks fountains so a very nice way to start the day.  Spa treatment I had a Morrocan massage and was not expecting much but it was one of the best massages I have ever had also the Spa itself is beautiful with lovely relaxation areas and gardens for after your treatment the staff here were some of the nicest I have come across. They arranged for a lady to visit the spa to do my henna paint on my hand so this way I need not bother with the hassel of the Medina to have it done . less than half the price I pay in Dubai too.  The hotels grounds are already looking very nice and are fragrant even though the hotel has not been open more than a year.  We visited La Mamoumia and Royal Mansour for dinner and although they are both stunning I found the staff at La Mamoumia to be very pretentious lots of looking you up and down.... so it would not have been so relaxing with that and we needed to re charge which is exectly what we did at the Four seasons.Staff at the Royal Mansour were charming but you are set in Riads around the grounds so not as much space to walk around as I would likealso our guide mentioned that he thought he liked the look of our hotel more than the Amenjena we did not see it ourselves so I couldnt say .  So to finish I think this hotel is doing everythig just write ofcourse the hotel is stunning it is a Four Seasons that goes without saying but it is the Staff that we found that made this Hotel . We will be coming back.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: 2 large pools lovely spa and great facilities for children. The staff are lovely - as ever at Four Seasons properties. They made a real effort with my son and had a welcome chocolate cake in the room. The kids club is really good has computers 2 Wiis and an X box and also a small private cinema you can watch DVDs on.    Nice bistro next to the pool. Italian restaurant fairly average - wasnt bowled over by that- but breakfast room lovely - could have sat on the terrace all morning. Really nice food and different fresh juice every morning. Overall would thoroughly recommend

Review_Title: stunning property, still a few kinks to work out
Review_Text: The Four Seasons is a gorgeous property. The location is great--outside the medina but a short taxi ride to almost anywhere including the airport. We had a wonderful time. I loved the pools lounge areas roof top bar and beautiful finishes. The property itself is five stars.  I give it a four star review because as a Four Seasons the service needs to come together a bit more before it is on par with other Four Seasons. For the rate paid I expect seamless phenomenal service. My other issue is that the pricing for food beverage and amenities is over the top. Prime example: the buffet breakfast is $40/person for a good but not extraordinary buffet. Either get it included in your rate or order room service which is less expensive.

Review_Date: Gary L wrote a review Jun 2012
Review_Text: A quality establishment. Not in Medina but allowing you to come back and relax and after a day in the heat. Everything is new and rooms are good.  Service was extremely helpful including tour drivers. Recommended

A truly relaxing experience in a calm setting. The hotel is new and well landscaped but it will another year for the garden to start showing itself so it is rather bare .The highlight of the stay was one of my best massages ever by Mr. Tariq ! Young adults center great for kids too.
This hotel is excellent! I thoroughly enjoyed my time there and the service was really good! I definitely will be re-visiting some time soon.

Stayed at the Four Seasons Marrakech for 2 nights on the weekend.  First impression upon check-in was bad. There was a mixup regarding the reservation. The room (superior king) has already been paid for but the check-in agent insisted on charging my credit card the equivalent of 700 EUR as a guarantee. The check-in agent (a moroccan man) even told me: "but if we don't have a guarantee who is going to pay for the room ?". I thought it was rude and unprofessional especially when it was his fault for not checking the info correctly on his file. After going back-and-forth between the reception and the lobby it turned out i was right and I was escorted to my room without any explanation or apology. Not a great start and certainly not the standard of Four Seasons !  The rest of the stay was lovely and uneventful. The poolside spa and breakfast staff were all very helpful and smiling. The room is very nice. The bathroom experience is definitely a must bathroom amenities (L'Occitane) a plus. Balcony with reading corner is a treat. Turndown service at night very nice. And the dark tiled adult pool was the perfect balance between relaxation and fun.  Breakfast buffet was good although not fantastic.  I also happened to lose my swimsuit which I wrapped in a towel in the room. Housekeeping took away the towel and I only noticed this the following morning. Staff were very professional and managed to find it for me at the laundry building.  Overall a nice and relaxing hotel in a lush surrounding. Reception staff needs to be trained further and needs to respect hotel guests.  I would probably stay at the Four Seasons Marrakech again.

We had been to Marrakech 8 years ago and had stayed at La Mamoumia and when we heard that there was a Four seasons which had opened up we decided to go as it also coincided with half term. Marrakech is an interesting place. Its changed a lot in the 8 years when we were there last become much more touristy but the good thing is that the Four seasons is about 10 minutes from the Medina and 10 min from the Airport so you can have a haven of peace away from the Medina. Inside the hotel compound it really is peace and tranquility.  We have stayed at numerous Four Seasons across the globe as we know what to expect and we are seldom let down. Sadly this hotel appears to be having some teething problems which are easily rectifiable. Management appear to missing and the staff try quite hard. There is a sprinkling of foreign staff lower than most Four Seasons i have been to. The locals try but there doesn't appear to be much direction. I ordered some lunch at the family pool and after an hour i decided to give up and went to the main Azzera restaurant. The following day I was told i had left without waiting for lunch. On another occassion we stayed in and had dinner at the Solano restaurant. After waiting for about hour for the main course the food arrived but cold. The food was sent back and once again we waited for the food to arrive but this time we gave up and left. Also the rooms were made over later on in the day often i had to phone to request it. The turndown in the evening was hit and miss in that on a few occassions it wasn't done. The main gripes we have with the hotel is the service people just forget. This is just not the type of service that Four Season is renouned for.    The positives. The hotel is near enough to the medina but yet far enough so that you can escape the hustle and bustle. The hotel has complimentary cars to the medina after 18:00 which is a nice touch (you have to make your own way back). Finally a Four Seasons that gives you complimentary Wifi ( yes its free !! ). People have commented on the fact that it does lack some Morrocan heritage which is probably true. I liked the light and airy feel of the hotel but it could easily have been a Four Season in any big city rather than one in Marrakech.    A nice hotel which is somewhat let down by poor service and an absence of management.

Review_Date: Monty H wrote a review Jun 2012
Review_Text: Our first trip to Marrakech and Morocco was motivated by the opportunity to stay at the Four Seasons Resort and we were not let down. From our VIP arrival and transfer at the airport to our upgrade to a Deluxe Room on arrival... all under the cover of darkness. Large water bottles and a selection of cakes and fruit bowl upon entering the room were just what we needed after a day of airports and planes.    We awoke on our first morning to a huge private terrace with sun lounges and outdoor dining setting and a view over one of the two large pool areas on offer (one for families and one quieter area for couples). The resort must be only 2-3 years old as everything was in perfect 'new' condition - as you'd expect from Four Seasons but from time to time is not always the case at top hotels. The room was very spacious a walk-in robe separate bathroom and toilets large shower and giant bath tub.    Concierge Patricia was outstanding in helping transform our holiday from an exquisite stay at the Four Seasons to an exceptional visit to Marrakech. She organised dining options in the Medina a guide through the Souks (markets) and perhaps one of our all-time travel highlights - a private tour of the tiny Atlas Mountains village of Toulkine where we had lunch with a Berber family.    The pool areas are magnificent and importantly provided a logical delineation between couples wanting quiet time by the pool and families with children who were each able to enjoy the facilities free of each others disruption. The spa was sensational and reasonably priced. They even arranged bunch of flowers and sang 'happy birthday' for my partner - a nice personal touch. The gym well appointed with all the mod-cons although I only got to use it once!    We dined at the Blue Orange for some traditional Moroccan cuisine this was pleasant as was the Moroccan wine which we'd previously not sampled. The breakfast buffet presented endless options and the room service was exceptional - service of a very high standard and priced fairly too.    Thank you Jean-Claude and the whole team at Four Seasons Marrakech for making our first trip to Morocco a memorable one and a destination we are sure to visit again.    Enjoy
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Four Seasons Marrakesh I'm here now weiting a review, what's that say!
Review_Text: Strange thing is I'm sat here in the Four Seasons Marrakesh writing this! There are better hotels in the Four Seasons chain and many others! Having stayed in four of the chain now I think sitting here half way through the 7 night stay writing this speaks for itself. Not believing what I had read on trip advisor and having had great experiences in previous stays with the hotel group we packed our bags and here we are. Hotel is great well designed rooms  great looking pool and all in all a great location. So why the low mark......service service service or real serious lack of it. Never before have I seen such chaos as herethat being said the local staff are great and friendly but if you are prepared to wait in excess of half an hour for a drink if you want to struggle to get food if you want to watch the management throw staff at a busy period in the Azzere restaurant which meant the ratio of staff to guests was 2 to 1 but still fail to manage it thats great but not what im paying for. We felt sorry as we watched staff running round being given no direction and also found it embarrassing . I am a great believer in when you stay in a hotel you shouldn't really need to reserve a table for dinner too well that all depends if they get a little busy you will get "Have you a reservation Sir" where exactly in the hotel does it say I need to reserve nowhere unless it suits them. Staff are great Management poor with no management skills at all meaning they are ruining what should be another flag ship hotel. If you have come just for sun and a relax go to Four Seasons in Sharm where you will get the service period.

Review_Title: Not the best place in its category for Marrakech
Review_Text: I just spent 3 days at the four seasons in Marrakech. Not much to complain about but there are simply many other options at the same price point in Marrakesh. Definitely a 5 star experience but here are the drawbacks: The design does little to respect its local surroundings and charm it looks and feels like a 4 seasons too much- at times you could think you're in Palm Springs not Marrakesh. There is something austere that permeates the whole experience the bar the restaurant the pavilion room I had was very large but only a marble floor was also so far away from the main building that I had to be driven in a golf cart. Fine for a quick business trip but not up to the standard of the other great properties in Marrakesh The 2 days prior I spent at La Mamounia were truly special.

Review_Date: Deborah G wrote a review May 2012
Review_Text: What a superb hotel. Our room was lovely and the staff were fastidious in their desire to make our stay stress free and enjoyable. There were so many great touches. If we left our books lying around in the room the staff popped in a book mark for us; if we took a taxi from the hotel they provided us with fresh water bottles for the journey; they provided us with free water melon and ice cream when sitting round the pool. The general manager was attentive and responsive to our comments and has done a great job in ensuring his staff follow strict guidelines in customer service. Food although a little on the pricey side was extremely well-presented and tasty. Thank you Four Seasons. We had a lovely time.

As usual Four Seasons perfection. Our room was spacious and immaculate. The staff were top-notch and service was excellent. The FS Marrakech has done a wonderful job of incorporating local design and flair into this property while balancing the brand's usual tasteful neutral style. At this property you know you're in Morocco- from the plethora of beautiful lanterns elaborate archways the man serving mint tea in the lobby- the whole hotel is beautiful. The grounds are gorgeous- palm trees everywhere. They have done a great job with this hotel. It's also a great location very close to the Medina but away from the hustle and bustle.
