I've been wanting to go to Morocco for a long time and when the FS opened a hotel in Marrakech I knew it was time to go! Just a perfect stay all around. You can't go wrong with a FS!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We stayed at the Four Seasons Resort for four nights in a Premier room (490 EUR/night) with a great view on the entire resort and the Atlas Mountains. We enjoyed a fantastic time in Marrakech and also had a good time in the hotel but the hotel was failing on some key points it just shouldn't. We have informed the concierge on our second day and the receptionist at departure but there was no reaction from the hotel.    The hotel is located between the airport and the Medina. It takes around 10 minutes to get to "la place" at a cost of around 30 to 50 MAD in a mini taxi.    The facilities of the hotel are great. The spa is reasonably priced and is very relaxing. The staff at the reception the concierge and the guys at the taxi pick up were outstandingly nice and helpful. The resort is quite large and has to offer something for everyone.    Room service is highly inconsistent. It's so inconsistent that you can't believe it especially when considering that it should be a five star hotel. No replacement of empty shower gel bottles missing toilet paper taking away half full bottles of water and not replacing them not making up the room etc... we called the room service number at least 20 times during our stay. And the best the next day they made the very same mistakes - unbelievable. I've traveled in many five star hotels around the world and I'm generally not that picky but it was just so noticeable.    One evening we decided to eat at the Blue Orange restaurant in the resort. The venue is quite spectacular but that was quickly destroyed by a disastrous service and a highly impolite manager. I must say that the staff and the processes in our company canteen are more professional than in this restaurant. And check your bills they had errors in ours. The food was ok but nothing special.    At breakfast they serve great pastries. During the week we had a very relaxed breakfast and almost everything seemed fine. Well I ordered black tea every morning and they brought some herbal tea instead - each time. On Saturday morning there were more guests at breakfast and the managers were all running and commanding around and you could feel and see that the staff were stressed by the presence of the managers.    Would we recommend the hotel? If you are not picky about an inconsistent room service and if you are willing to eat out every night then I could recommend the hotel. But they should dramatically improve these elementary hotel service components.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A fairly inauspicious start - 20 minutes before the welcome drink arrived dark room with a view of a nearby block of flats - eventually gave way to a thoroughly memorable and enjoyable stay. After a few other hiccups the hotel number two Nick Yarnell moved us to a delightful suite with an equally delightful view. From that point on we could not fault the hotel. The staff (friendly and efficient) the amenities (kids and adult only pools) the rooftop bar (great DJ) and of course the food (varied and delicious) combined with highly professional hotel management means that we will return next year.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: mike b wrote a review May 2012
Review_Title: This property has great potential but..............
Review_Text: Lovely propertygreat poolscomfortable rooms........had all the characteristics of what would be expected from a 4 Seasons Hotel. We arrived for a 13 night stay and were greeted with mint tea and a relaxed welcoming check in . The weather was fantastic and all fared well for a great restful vacation.  But..........our experience was marred by service inconsistency a very average food choice (keep well clear of the Moroccan restaurant where they destroyed the traditional tagine) the noise from an open air roof top bar. and an over night pool cleaning team scraping heavy pool furniture across tiled surfaces.  Most people would only visit the hotel for a 3 or 4 night stay and want to take advantage of the variety of restaurants in Marrakech. So its difficult to build an interesting food offer at the hotel. But after 9 or so months of operation this should have been fixed.  The lack of service consistency is more surprising. Four nights without turn down;when it came there would be a night with water then a night without. A night with replacement toiletries then a night without.Basically not the seamless service usually provided by 4 Seasons.  But I guess this is manageable.  But try 3 nights of broken sleep because of ridiculous noise levels. Two nights due to the the opening of a new open air roof top bar;which is set right in the centre of the resort over looking the children's pool. Standing in reception at 12.30 am asking that the DJ turn down the volume was not a great experience. The same happened the next night; having been promised that it would not happen again. Eventually on the second night the Front Office Manager came to the room and was visibly shocked by the noise level. But 2 nights of appalling late noise; more appropriate to the 18-30 Club not a 4 Seasons was not fun  .And then a third night of noise as the pool team jet washed the pool area and didn't bother to lift the heavy sunbeds but just scraped them across the floor.  Both of these examples seemed to illustrate just a lack of management fore-thought and eye for detail .Very disappointing.  To be fair the management team did re-act and refunded 2 nights of room charge and provided a complimentary dinner. But we would rather have had a relaxing time.  This hotel has potential to be very good...........................but needs work.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Good hotel....may even be a great hotel one day
Review_Text: We stayed for five nights in May - very hot (41C).    The hotel is on the whole very good with some minor issues that were dealt with in one of the most professional reactions I have seen from a hotel and it's management team.    Pros:  * Very well designed  * Gardens are superb for a hotel open less than a year  * Excellent beds - as with all FS hotels  * Breakfast is fairly limited compared to Dubai and SE Asian 5* hotels but sometimes less is more - the fruit was delicious and the omlettes to order very tasty. The milk seemed to be UHT so we switched to espressos - as many as you can handle!  * Great staff - genuinely friendly and aimed to please  * Superb pool area (adults and kids pools both brilliant and brilliantly separate)  * Transfer and immigration clearance was slick  * Free shuttles to local restuarants whilst busy is actually a Mercedes and driver is there's just two of you - a nice touch  * Pool service was good  * Good management - Nick the GM was a good guy  * Saria the concierge was excellent - good suggestions and left printed notes confirming what she had booked - very helpful.    Cons:  * Checking in took too long for a hotel at <50% occupancy - lot's of people saying hello and shaking your hand etc. - they should really work out a way to do the check in formalities IN the room itself  * Room service/turn-down was a bit of a farce. Example: If you called to say "can you do this later whilst we we are out?" the response was "are you refusing the turn-down service?" Er no not exactly......  * Mini-bar not re-stocked with beer and/or glasses  * Asked for extra coat-hangers - took 2 days  * Dirty cups/plates left outside room for two days...  * Laundry shrank two of my wife's tops.......I could go on but it's more important to comment that although it took a few times to get the message across when it hit Nick the GM - they really were very serious at addressing our concerns. This was highly appreciated and shows the general ethos is one of "Let's do this better"....  * Check out was a bit of a palava  * Some of the lunch food isn't great - and at €20 for a salad which wasn't that fresh or good the need to sharpen up. That said the grilled chicken (it was actually fried which why it tasted so good!) was slightly addictive.  * Club sandwich at room service - that benchmark of a 5* hotel - was also average.    However the pros totally outweighed the teething problems with service. We had a great time and if you go in warm/hot weather the pool is simply a lovely place to hang out do laps and catch some rays.    The staff and the personality of the staff make it hard not to like this place. Add this to the great sunny climate a 3 1/2 hour flight and a GMT timezone - this hotel and Marrakech itself is a wicked place for a long weekend.    In time this could be a real ripper of a hotel. They must remember that some of the rooms are the same cost as an Aman resort and the service needs to up a notch - maybe not in friendliness - but in efficiency and competency.    Go if you can!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Eyal F wrote a review May 2012
Review_Text: The service we received during our 5 days stay was nothing short of amazing. From the front desk to the pool boys to the cleaners each member of staff seemed to be falling over themselves to ensure that our experience at the hotel would be an unforgettable one. We received an upgrade to a Pavillion room on arrival which was a lovely surprise. The grounds of the resort are immaculate and pools are spacious and inviting. I could go on forever with the superlatives but it wouldn't come close to capturing how good this hotel really is - everything you would expect from a Four Seasons and more. We cant wait to come back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We were greeted and made so at ease and we were upgraded to a Pavilion Suite which was amazing food decor whole experience outstandingwe have stayed at Amanjena and Kasbah Termadot and this was equal to both and would recommend this hotel to anyone.    Front Desk manager outstanding so helpful    Negatives.........none
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Christine T wrote a review May 2012
Review_Text: Wonderful staff personalized service; any hiccups were immediately attended to. To be so close to the city yet so far removed from the all the activity was the best of both worlds.

Review_Title: More Faulty towers, than Four Seasons........
Review_Text: We were booked to stay 7 nights in a Deluxe room. We arrived late evening and checked in there were no cold towels or refreshments offered during this process which is unusual for a Four Seasons. The hotel was only 20% occupied and we asked if we could pay for an upgrade to a Pavillion room we were told that these rooms were for families and very noisy.    So we were shown to our room to say we were underwhelmed is an understatement the view from the room was what looked like a car park This is very mean spirited of the Hotel when it was so empty. So we called down and said we wanted to move rooms. After a 20 minute wait someone came to show us some other rooms. We ended up paying for an upgrade to a Pavillion Room it was not offered as a good will gesture despite us being unhappy with the room they allocated to us.    ROOMS: Air Con didnt work Wi-fi didnt work Hooks broken in bathroom picture damaged etc. House keeping inconsistant. Rooms were very clean but service was hit & Miss some days you got water some days you didnt shower gel wasnt refreshed Turn down service was luck of the draw! Beds however were amazing very comfortable.    Cabana's: My husband pre-booked a Full Service Cabana by the pool for my Birthday. They looked great on the hotels web site! The Concierge confirmed that this was all booked for us. The morning of my Birthday we called down to the Concierge and she said just to go down to the pool and see the attendant. We couldnt wait. However the reality is there is no full service cabana - its not a service that this Four Seasons offers! It shouldnt even be advertised on the Hotels Web site! Why on earth did the Concierge confirm thisTWICE !!!!!    UPGRADE: The Resort manager decided to upgrade us to a Suite as we had experienced so many problems we were told to report to Reception after Breakfast which we duly did. The Night Manager told us Yes Our suite would be ready in FIVE minutes. Wow pretty good! We went to pack. One hour later we called down to Reception as no one had come to move us we were informed it would at least another hour! We were waiting to go out that morning so we had to lock our valuables in the safe at Reception. I Complained to the Night Manager that he should have been honest with us in first place as would have been happy to move later that afternoon but instead he told us it would be five minutes. Why do that? WHATS WORSE? The Night Manager LIED to the Resort Manager and said that I had complained and gone mad as I had been kept waiting for Ten Minutes!!!!! DISGRACEFUL. The Executive suite however was lovely and they even gave us Champagne and a birthday Cake. For which we were very grateful.    FOOD & BEVERAGE; Breakfast is Excellent. Otherwise there is a lack of food choice here. The Solano is open 2 nights a week and the food is horrid bland and greasy. An Insult to Morrocan Cuisine. Bleu D'Orange is open the rest of the week and whilst the food is nice its very expensive  for what it is. Lunch at the Pool bar the menu is limited and boring. It never changes Its way overpriced as well. You are forced to eat out really. The Staff at the Pool Bar are delightful really friendly and lovely. Best thing about the hotel: Pool Attendants and Bar Staff!    ZEST BAR; Zest Bar have a VERY loud disco at weekends that goes on well into the early hours of the morning and lots of guests who were located near there didnt sleep that night at all. It wasnt advertised for the hotel guests it appeared to be geared towards locals. This is going to be a regular weekend thing so we hear... Hardly Four Seasons standards! More 18 to 30!    We cut our stay short and left 2 days early as this was probably one of the most stressful holidays we had encountered. You really dont expect this when booking a four Seasons do you? The Managements excuse? its a new hotel you get tired of hearing this! The hotel has been open for NINE months now.  Middle Management seem to care little for whats actually happening at this hotel the only way to get any kind of response is to speak to the Resort Manager Nick who seems to get things done.  Oh and a final tip leave lots of time to check out as the bill will probably be incorrect as well!  We are well seasoned travellers and cant express our disappointment enough at this Hotel.  They gave us one night free as compensation- LOL.. We now feel like we need a holiday to recover!  ( We havent just come back to moan on Trip Advisor we took up all of the above with Management during our stay but felt we had to give an honest account as this is an expensive holiday at a premium resort)    If they get all of the problems sorted outand offer a lot more food options it may eventually be good place to stay.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: I could not believe how amazing this place was!
Review_Text: Excellent. Never a disappointment. Great addition to the Four Seasons family.

I recently had the great great pleasure of staying at this property. I had spent the previous 10 days in southern Morocco and when I pulled up to this hotel entrance I knew I was in for a very special treat. I spent two nights and in all honesty was probably the finest hotel experience I have ever had. Every staff member I encountered had the highest level of professionalism the property itself is immaculate..the spa restaurants pools activities the quiteness..are something I have very rarely found all in one place. This is it. This is where you want to stay in Marrakech.

Review_Title: Nice for a holiday but not for business
Review_Text: Recently finished a conference at this newly completed Four Seasons... while the people are nice and generally try to be helpful there are alot of promises some of which do not materialize. I had the impression that the workers are responsive but management is a little less so... Give it awhile to build the learning curve.

Review_Date: Global LuxuryTraveller wrote a review Apr 2012
Review_Title: A relaxing and luxurious Oasis but still with some growing pains
Review_Text: We stayed at the Four Seasons (FS ) for several nights during April as a Family - First of all I would strongly recommend the Hotel to others - that said there are quite a lot of small issues that add up to a signifcant need for improvement compared to other FS we have stayed at globally and these comments are intended to be helpful to other guests and please do not let them put you off the Hotel - it is great ! You will see that the room rates are on the upper level of what FS generally charges ( eg we have several times stayed in FS in USA for sub $ 200 per basic roomnet of taxes) We are like others happy to pay 3 times that - but the increased quality and upside of so doing - We left feeling we had a good holiday but it actually wasnt really good value for money - it was good - yes - and the other aspects of the hotel made up for it - But like most - within reason - however rich you are ! - you still want to feel you are getting fair value. The Staff were generally VERY friendly and helpful - we did notice a lack of visible middle management (perhaps important in a new hotel to help train staff ? ) For example having spent days at the pool we saw no managers there - if they were there then they hid themselves and the bar and restuarant staff were left to their own devices - that said they were good generally very good - The Hotel totally lacks enough restuarants which compels guests to leave the FS - we ended up having room service some nights - or the alternative bar 2 nights per week was an Italian (with soon to be opened nightclubcigar bar) This is very expensive ( around $ 30 for a bowl of pasta with no sauce or $ 75 to 90 dependent on exchange rate for lobster linguini - very good but that price in Morrocco? Wow ! ) There is no small tapascasual cafefor evening food except for a limited menu in the bar - so if you have kids you are best currently to opt to go out for a pizza - but its added hassle and taxis are needed etc ) I really think FS have missed a trick not having a casual place for eat reasonably priced food EVERY evening - eg in the Fairmont Abu Dhabi we experienced a very good approach which was every night they held a Themed Night eg ArabianAsian etc and it was full of families and couples every night .....Also the charges for drinks and the mini bar were excessive - eg a can of tonic around $ 9 to 12 WITHOUT the gin ! This puts you off staying at the hotel bar ( no happy hours offered at all - again we believe a missed opportunity) No free water except in the Gym ! A beer by the pool (small) was $ 15 for a corona - yes i had one every day but if they were $ 10 I would have had 3 ! Who wins ? Also we had no instructions about walking about in Marrakech (no pedestrian crossing in most places ! ) FS should offer more induction for guests who are first time visitors and maybe offer tailored guides etc ? If they do - we werent told and nearly got run down in the most modern part of the City ! Also with a conference in the hotel they made the mistake of allowing 1 day the delegates to use the main restuarant to eat breakfast - this ended up with the restuarant resembling a zoo ! Staff couldnt cope and it was overwhelming ! Also the Business center is open plan with only 1 printer WITHIN the Kids play area- Not wise in my view --- eg kids being kids stay on the PCs and you cant work or print a boarding pass - Why FS did this i really dont know ! The Gym is fairly small so watch out for that - no jogging track ( i was told of ) and the Hotel lights a very nice fire in the main reception everynight unfortunately it permeates the hotel with a very unpleasant smell of smoke eg not perfume ! (There is no US style coffee cart or free coffee early AM for US folk please note ! ) There is a seperate kids pool - and as per others reviews the staff did not police this very well and they need to make sure this is adhered to..................    All in all we spent a lot of money - we had a good vacation and would go back but be careful and demand improvement were you see it is needed as this FS is ''nearly'' where it needs to be - but itsnt for the prices they charge ! It is recommended by me and family however and have a great stay !

Review_Date: Philippe P wrote a review Apr 2012
Review_Text: We stayed at the Four Seasons this last Easter weekend and enjoyed our stay. The hotel is however not very near the city centre and getting a taxi was sometimes a bit of a wait we did get the courtesy car on one occasion. I think the hotel is possibly still very new and there are a few teething problems. When we arrived we made a cup of tea kettle very thoughtfully provided however no milk quick call and milk was delivered there should also be a small container to put the used teabag into once the tea was made. The room was very pleasant however I found it to be somewhat pricey for what it offers 700+ Euro per night. Some extra toilet paper would be nice too. The staff were friendly and helpful everywhere. The rooms cleaned nicely  The pool is great one for kids and one for adults this is very considerate however some parents were obviously not aware of the difference and nobody said anything to them. Something that was also somewhat annoying the sunbeds were just about all booked at about 10 ie.someone had placed a magazine or towel on many of them. I get really annoyed by this practice and removed a few of them only to discover they had been placed there by the lifeguard and he was getting a nice tip from some of the guests. We weren't aware of this procedure I don't agree with it even if I had been. We stayed at the pool untill about 1 o'clock and the magazines or towels were still in place in spite of numerous guests also ignorant of the "procedure" arriving. They all had to find themselves a place in the sun or on the sidelines.  Would I go back I don't think so. I might be tempted to go to another hotel that's well known just as luxurious and above all closer.

Review_Date: Keith D wrote a review Apr 2012
Review_Text: This was our first visit to Morocco and we had hoped to escape the very cold February weather in Europe. We were not disappointed by the weather at a sunny 22deg C in the day nor by this excellent hotel with well trained thoughtful staff. Marrakesh is a fascinating city with interesting insights into Arabic culture. There is a wide choice of restaurants from the pop-up ‘stalls in the square’ to high-end hotels. Guides are necessary in the Souk and some excursions are possible outside of the city preferably by private car.    The hotel is newly built to the usual 4S resort mix of hotel & properties. It has Moorish influences in large airy public spaces with cosy sitting areas with fireplaces. We stayed in room 310 a deluxe room which overlooks the gardens towards the distant Atlas Mountains. The marbled bathroom has a double sink rain shower and very large bath. Separate toilet. There is a walk in dressing with useful storage inc safe. The fittings & furniture are of high quality good heating/air conditioning large LG flat screen with wide choice of European channels DVD player and i-pod station. Tea & coffee making facilities. We slept very well in a comfortable King Bed with high quality linen and a choice of pillows.  There are two large pools one suitable for lane swimmers with adjacent hot Jacuzzi tubs. The children’s pool was unheated during our stay. Separate well fitted fitness and weights room with nearby tennis courts. Very pleasant French tennis coach. The smallish Spa under maintenance during our stay has range of massage rooms. Active Kids club. The gardens are prettily lit at night and have extensive planting of palm trees. The garden borders will need several years to mature.  The general manager maintains high standards of staff training and service. Most staff have French and English as their second languages. Whilst occasionally a lack of fluency was a problem overall we felt that all staff shared a genuine interest in the guest’s welfare and were unfailingly pleasant. The Italian and Arabic restaurants alternated service during our stay. The cooking was good especially the fish but with a limited choice of dishes. A wider menu choice including the room service menu would be helpful for children and long stay guests  We greatly enjoyed our extended stay at this hotel and recommend it unreservedly when visiting Marrakesh.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Geoff W wrote a review Apr 2012
Review_Text: Just spent 5 days in Marrakech at the Four Seasons. Its an amazing hotel. While the hotel is only 8 months old the staff is incredible. Everyone knew our kids and they had fun with them - the kids loved Waffa in the lounge bar. The kids club was excellent with lots for the kids to do. Our kids loved the kids club so much they didnt want to spend time with us. Allowed us to relax at the Adult pool where Tiago (head of Restaurants) pours a deadly but delicious Caipirinha.    The spa is great. My wife went several times and I actually tried the Hammam treatment. Its local to the Morrocan culture and learned that most locals get 1x a week minimum. Was a great treatment and highly recommend if you want something very different (just be ready for the cold water ending) but traditional.    The kids loved the center of the old town with the Snake Charmers and Monkeys. We had a private guide which would highly recommend. The hotel can arrange. Give your guide an idea of what you are looking for and they will help keep things moving.    Finally a small reco: the hotel can arrange a car for pick up from the airport and return to the airport. The service helps get you thru customs without waiting in the lines. Well worth the extra cost.    Have stayed at many Four Seasons across Europe and Hawaii. This was one of my favorites due to the friendly staff.

Well its the Four Seasons so what else can you expect ?? BUT this one is NEW and the most gorgeous one we have ever been too...not only is the hotel incredible the guest services were spectacular making all of our reservations. We did NOT leave the resort without a guide  especially going to the Souks. We had two different ones bringing us two different experiences. It was a sensational trip one not to be missed if you get the chance to go. We flew to Madrid first and stayed at the Ritz a few nights first so the flight to Morocco would not be as long.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This is a lovely new hotel with great staff. The grounds are superb with two huge swimming pools - use the kids' one if you want real peace and quiet as it is not heated so all the kids and parents go to the adult one!  Rooms are spacious and very well kitted out. The restaurant is a bit limited though - room service has a much better menu. The spa and gym are great.  My only criticism is that the waiters' idea of a glass of wine is a bit varied - from generous to positively mean!  It is definitely an oasis of calm and quality but not of course representative of the country or city in which it sits.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Wait "Four Seasons" to get a reply.....
Review_Text: I contacted the Four Seasons hotel directly to get details of their Spa treatments. On reciept of their reply I decided to book directly with them(710Euro per night per room). I was advised to give CC details name e.t.c which I did and I requested confirmation of my booking when it was made.    After not hearing for a few days I sent another emailing chasing up and still no reply. After another chase up I assumed they either cant be bothered or as it was a new hotel they were having teething problems. I then sent a very strong email cancelling any booking which they might have made for me. I susequently booked the Royal Monsur as I never heard back from the Four Seasons Marrakech.    After I sent the very strong email cancelling a booking (if indeed they had actually made one!!) I recieve a reply from their Reservations Manager appologising for not repling to my emails and offering to upgrade my room which was a generous offer but when you are spending 710Euro per night will 50Euro upgrade make a difference to you? What hotels such as this Four Seasons Marrakech dont realise it is not about the money it is about providing the "SERVICE" right from the start.    My deal with Royal Monsur will incurr a 600Euro cancellation charge and as such I wrote back to this "Reservations Manager" confirming this and advising if they would deduct this cnacellation charge I would be willing to book at their hotel. I aksed them to confirm one way or the other however a week has passed by and no reply!! Being a relatively new hotel part of me was tempted to go and stay out of curiosity.    Would I stay at any Four Seasons based on this experience...definately NOT! If they had got it right the first time my booking would have been made at the price quoted inittially 710Euro...no need for an upgrade ...no need for me to book else where....however first impressions count and excuse the pun "have to wait for Four Seasons to pass before you get a reply" is what comes to mind if ever theis brand name is mentioned.    Pity.....
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: A truly magical oriental experience full of local culture and tradition.
Review_Text: The weather in March was a good temperature for siteseeing. Trip to the Atlas Mountains was breathtaking. The souk in Marrakech should not be tackled without an OFFICIAL local guide too easy to be taken in. The Place Djemaa El-Fna is fascinating by day and an indescribable cullinary experience by night. In spite of the hassle from traders and the general chaos we never once felt threatened and with good advice from the hotel on taxi fares it was quite fun to haggle for an appropriate fare back to the hotel. Well worth the trip!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: Four of us stayed at the Four Seasons Marrakech for a week in February. The resort is quite beautiful with well laid out gardens piped orange blossom scent stunning pools and architecture. The staff were very attentive and keen to please.    However there were a few issues indicative of a new resort which has yet to really sort itself out and which you wouldn't quite expect of a top quality resort. Not all the restaurants were open the jacuzzi was out of order for most of our stay the breakfast was open until 10.00 but no fresh food was put out beyond 9.30.    We had a fantastic stay and this will be a top resort however it's not quite there yet!

Review_Date: Carol S wrote a review Mar 2012
Review_Title: "Now I know what an oasis is".
Review_Text: The hotel and staff are perfect in every way. After spending time in Marrakech town which is a frantic exciting colourful and interesting place you come back to The Four Seasons Hotel which is peaceful beautiful calm and relaxing with the most welcoming warm friendly but professional staff. There is not one negative thing you can say about this hotel. This is a young hotel which in time can only improve like a fine wine.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Bernard G wrote a review Mar 2012
Review_Text: Excellent in all aspects.  Very friendly and attentive staff  Great food  Good location  Very comfortable room  Beautiful gardens especially at night    Finding it difficult to critise any way.    Thank you for a great experience
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Chris C wrote a review Mar 2012
Review_Title: An Oasis in the chaos that is wonderful Marrakech.
Review_Text: Luxurious rooms and public space. Expensive F&B but wonderfully willing and helpful staff. This is an hotel that will get better and better as time goes on and it 'grows' in to its own skin.

Let’s face it if you are going to be staying in a Four Seasons you will expect the best the hotelier world has to offer. This new Four Seasons is stunning! It seamlessly combines the luxury of a 5 star resort with a gorgeous place to relax. If coming to Marrakech you have lots of choose from (including amazing Riads the chi chi La Mamounia and glamorous/glitzy Royal Mansour) but if you want a stunning place to relax in luxury with laid back totally personable staff then choose the Four Seasons as you won’t be disappointed. Keep in mind this is a new hotel so the grounds are youthful and the staff are getting into their 5 star service promise but the eagerness and personality of the people here will delight you. If used to a Four Seasons rate card you will find this place very good value for money! I highly recommend it particularly during the cooler northern European months for a bit of sun!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: The Four Seasons Marrakesh is a top resort that is located 2 miles from the medina it offers close proximity to everything in Marrakesh without the noise of the other top hotels in the city. The grounds are beautifully maintained the staff is friendly and attentive and the services (spa tennis gym pool and restaurants) are all excellent.    The spa offers traditional 'Hammam' which is essentially a Turkish bath and full body scrub experience that is a must when you visit Morroco. You will feel pampered exhilarated as relaxed all at once. At the Four Seasons it is 100% traditional and without the risk of doing it at a public spa where you will feel somewhat intimidated by the experience. Ask for Hamzah he is excellent and his English is very good and he will teach you about the history of the Hammam. One of the true highlights of the trip.    The hotel can arrange everything for you at reasonable prices. Taxis dinner reservations tours shows etc are at your fingertips with one call to their converge desk. The hotel manager Nick is excellent and made our dinner recommendation and reservation for us. The restaurants in Marrakash know the Four Seasons and will generally treat you a little 'extra special' when they know you are staying there.    The hotel also has little details that will make your stay enjoyable. Things like: live Morrocan music in the lobby traditional mint tea served throughout the day dates and nuts served throughout the day free health drinks poolside and even courtesy suntan lotion provided at the pool. It's these ltlittle things in addition to the rest that makes this hotel so special.    This entire experience is a must for international travelers. The city is fantastic and I can't imagine there is a better place to stay while in Marrakesh.

We decided to fly to Morocco for a few days of sun after a really cold spell in our home country in Europe. No one in the family had ever been to Morocco before but I had been reading for years that it was a culturally vibrant city and that it was definitely not to be missed. However we like to be comfortable and I wasn't feeling very adventurous for this holiday - I just wanted to sit in the sun read my book and take a tour from a private guide in order to see something of a city I knew I would be too nervous to navigate on my own.  I used TA to see what others had experienced and I narrowed my choices down to either the Four Seasons La Mamounia or Kasbah Tamadot. It was also my birthday and I wanted to be treated really well not to mention stay in a beautiful 5* atmosphere.  I was a bit worried because the FS hotel was new and La Mamounia is historic - but I was turned off by one reviewer talking about cigar smoke smell and über-expensive prices so chose Four Seasons as it was closer to the medina than Tamadot.  I feel that for me and my family it was the right choice. The hotel is just amazing: it is brand spanking new and everything is perfect. I also love the staff uniforms. The air smells of orange blossoms when you walk in and there are fountains everywhere. I do agree that landscaping needs time to grow in but once that is done this place will be truly private and special.  My family and I stayed in the second best room in the hotel and I have to say it was really great. It was HUGE totally tastefully designed and my husband could work in peace while we hung out in other areas. I loved the bathrooms with the quasi-hammam shower area and the super giant bathtub.  The Italian restaurant was delicious and gorgeous but the food did take some time to come. As we were a bit tired after arrival this wasn't ideal but it wasn't that bad.  The breakfast restaurant is also lovely and a great way to greet the day with sunshine pouring in through the windows.  My husband and I had drinks one evening in the library which was also nice.  It was still a bit too cold to use the pool for us (although I did see people using it happily) so I can't say anything about that except that the pool is beautiful and heated (I heard); the pool bar/restaurant was next to it but left enough privacy that swimmers don't feel examined by patrons of the restaurant. Service here was also a bit on the slow side but the people who work here are really just wonderful.  Everyone I came across at this hotel was professional nice helpful and sincere. I worked a lot with the concierge to organize tours of the medina a neighboring beach town and a sunrise balloon ride and they were just so lovely I highly recommend using them to help organize unforgettable events. We didn't bring proper clothes for the balloon ride so they even lent us Four Seasons jackets!  I had ordered a birthday cake for my special day and it was delicious and beautiful and the hotel comped us a bottle of champagne and I also received a small gift when we checked out - how nice!  All in all I would say that I would definitely visit this hotel again - it came number one on all my criteria for a great vacation stay and Marrakech itself is a vibrant interesting city to see at least once in your lifetime.

Four Seasons impressed us yet again with its exquisite design superb setting sumptuous amenities and most importantly a staff completely engaged in providing an authentic Moroccon experience while intuitively attending to our every question or request.    The lighting (including a multitude of candles) water features flowers furnishings and uniforms alone are worth a visit!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Jonathan C wrote a review Feb 2012
Review_Text: Facilities and personal service 6 star. Marrakesh is a top place to visit and this hotel mirrors that. Beautiful setting. Great rooms with balcony. Good on site food and first class young adults centre. Near enough to the Medina and not far from activities such as quad biking.

Review_Date: christopher b wrote a review Feb 2012
Review_Text: Brand new hotel very much in four season hotels spirit. Bright modern luxurious. Everybody on the staff goes above and beyond to please you. Nice location  little far for walking to Medina but close to the airport. Pool and grounds exeptional. Spa in class by itself. Highly recomended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Rahul V wrote a review Feb 2012
Review_Text: Just returned back after spending a few days in this amazing hotel. Very courteous staff who made sure that we had a good stay. The staff sent a courtsey cake and champagne for my sons birthday. The concerige staff arranged for our day trip in Lisbon through their staff in Lisbon. Will surely go back again.

Excellent location close to the Menara garden and 5 mn by car from the Medina. Beautiful brand new resort with gardens great staff!    Ideal for both families and couples.    Deluxe rooms are large and very well decorated and equipped. Each has a nice terrace with view over the gardens.    We liked very much the bar and its lounge in the lobby area. You can have lunch and also dine there. They offer Moroccan and international food. Try the pool grill at the adults-only swimming-pool too. Worth it!    My husband and I had 2 massages at the spa. Very relaxing and professional.    The resort is a family-friendly one: a family swimming-pool a kids' club a young adult club. Couples can relax at the adults-only swimming-pool in the gardens at the spa. The resort is big enough for everyone to feel at ease.    What makes it really different is the staff always beyond your expectations.    A place to be highly recommended.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Perfect Service at Marrakech Four Seasons
Review_Text: People make a huge difference there anyone from anywhere will feel at home.  Simply perfect.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: exactly what we were looking for in marrakesh
Review_Text: It all starts the minute they pick you up with their "meet and greet service" and your baggage and passports are whisked through passport control and customs whilst you sit in a vip lounge. A car then takes you in 10 minutes to a beautiful hotel. Once there you feel so well looked after as if it is their only wish that you are happy and getting exactly what you want from your stay. This was apparent right through the hotel from the charming english manager to all the staff.  The hotel grounds and pool are beautiful. The bed so comfortable. In fact just what you would expect from a world class hotel.  A courtesy car in the evening takes you to restaurants. We went twice to maison arabe it was so good.  Maybe we were lucky but we had four days of sunshine in January and were able to have breakfast outside and enjoy sitting out. Marrakesh in our view did not need more than a couple of days to explore but we could have stayed longer in such a beautiful hotel.    a great winter getaway
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: One of the very, very best
Review_Text: We have just returned after a fantastic few days at the Four Seasons in Marrakech. We consider ourselves to be well-travelled having stayed at some of most recognised hotels in Asia Europe and the Americas (including other Four Seasons establishments) and the Four Seasons in Marrakech is right up there with the very very best.    The location of the hotel is ideal close enough to the old city of Marrakech for quick and easy access yet just far enough away to provide an oasis of peace and quiet after spending the day touring the palaces gardens and sights and haggling over whatever takes your fancy in the souks. The hotel buildings are designed to mirror the local architecture the gardens are huge and beautifully maintained the two swimming pools are enormous the furnishings and artwork in the common parts of the hotel are stunning and the bedrooms and bathrooms are luxurious.    But what really makes this hotel one of the very best is the quality and attitude of the hotel staff. Without exception every one of the staff we encountered was welcoming friendly anxious to please helpful unfailingly cheerful and extremely attentive. It was an absolute pleasure to be a guest in such a beautiful place with such outstanding service.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This hotel is absolutely dream-like. The staff and service are over exceptional. There is NOTHING negative to say except that they didnt offer me a couple of free nights to stay longer!! :-)  Great location fabulous breakfast and plenty of eye-candy on the property! Thanks FS Marrakech!

It's the little things that differentiate a world class hotel from the rest. Overall the staff at FSM could not be more welcoming helpful or attentive. We stayed for a week mid December.Two adults and two teenagers. The welcome was warm and very professional the rooms delightful. The setting is magic lush gardens heated swimming pools and a well equipped gym. The Spa area was still being brought up to standard and lacked a few neat touchesplants etc. The restaurant was fabulous for breakfast slightly disappointing for dinner given the very high levels that FS set themselves. The staff in any hotel is what makes or breaks a place for me and they were almost fautless.Whilst FSM is still evolving into the finished article its well on the way .....4.5 out of 5.

A new resort opened less that an year and already its placing itself at the top of all places to stay while in Marrakech.    Situated just outside the walls of Marrakech which to be honest is perfect as its a "getaway" And if you do want to join in by visiting Marrakech they even have a house car that can drop you in to town complimentary during the evening.    Our room was very large and spacious clean and everything one would expect from a 5 star hotel. with a lovely deck with couch and lounge chairs.    The resort itself is wonderful has everything one could ask for from 2 different pools (one for adults and other for kids) Kids and young adult centers boutique several dining outlets sports facility tennis courts Spa (I strongly recommend Tarik absolutely god with his hands!!!!!!!!)    But the most impressive part of this establishment has to be the staff all so so so warm and welcoming with a genuine hospitality and care.

This property is one of the best bearing the 4S name. The grounds are pristine and the service impeccable. The pools are large clean and heated even in December. The spa treatments were very good including our first hammam.    The only downsides were the restaurants which were only above average and not worth the price. The exception to this were the breakfast and lunch buffets which were very good. Fortunately most days we left the property for dinner. Also try to venture out from the hotel recommendations. They not surprisingly try to recommend the same 4-5 restaurants--and there are literally dozens of great places to eat--talk to locals or check with other tourists.    Try one the the "pure living" tours. They can be set-up at the concierge and offer 1-of-a-kind and exclusive experiences. We visited a Berber village toured their homes visited their school and cooked a tajine.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: We spent 5 nights in 4S Marrakech as a pre-Christmas break. The travelling party included 2 adults and 2 small children. We got upgraded to Deluxe Suite due to some issues with the booking which provided for an excellent start even before we arrived.    1. Location & grounds  The hotel is based west of the Medina and it takes ~3-5min to reach the walls by car probably 20min+ walk so it's not exactly central and there is not much around the hotel to see. May not be ideal if you travel with small kids and hope to walk straight into where all the action is but it takes virtually no time to get a taxi plus in the evenings the hotel offers courtesy rides to a venue of your choice (great for dinner transport). The hotel itself is brand new with decor and grounds trimmed to an excellent standard. The building(s) are max 3-floors and spreads wide into the gardens where there are several facilities - pools lunchtime restaurant kids club etc. The gardens are beautiful with lots of plants and decorations to explore  2. Reception and service  4S Marrakech gets the highest marks. All the staff without exception is very helpful professional and keen to serve (without overdoing it). This goes for the reception staff through concierge (Jinan was particularly helpful there) restaurant staff kids club youngsters centre room service valet... everyone. The whole family was consistently referred to by our name kids on first-name basis. Despite the hotel running for only a few months everything was outstanding by general standards and there were only rare occassions where we could think of a slight improvement within the 4S standards. Greatly impressed nevertheless.  3. Room  The suite was excellent - 4-poster bed fold-out sofa bed in the living room and a cot in the master bedroom provided for quality sleep. All rooms generously sized great terrace overlooking the gardens with Atlas mountains on the horizon plenty of storage and quality throughout (it's 4S after all!) including L'Occitane toiletries. Bose multimedia system in the living room was a nice enhancer (though UK DVDs sometimes played in faded colours due to the region issue). The only issue to point out in the room was the noisy LG DVD player in the master bedroom emitting high-pitch noise when switched off - we had to unplug it from power to stop it.  4. Food  To start with refreshments and sweets provided for kids on arrival in the room were a great welcome. Daily supply of fresh fruit and evening light snack added to the feeling of getting excellent treatment. The evening snacks were so delicious that we started really looking forward to them before heading out for the proper dinner. Out of the hotel dining facilities aside from the daily breakfast we only tried the evening restaurant Solano (twice) as the other venue is not open yet. Back to breakfast: fruit pastries and healthy breakfast bufet coupled with made-to-order omelettes did a good job every day. Cheese selection and salamis/ham were provided on some days but we usually had to ask for them as they were not on display - no issue at all though wondered why not offer upfront (perhaps because it's less healthy than what's on display:). Nothing was an issue - coffees made to order bowl of raspberries... without any extra charges. Everything is very children friendly - always provided with kids cutlery high chair and got the "bib cleaning service" automatically offered at the end. Great start of the day. Dinners: Great menu offering a combination of modern international and Moroccan dishes. Had 3-course dinner including a glass of wine twice which came to £100 (kids under 5 eat free btw) which we found reasonable given the food quality service provided and 4S brand. Definitely plan to eat here on one evening at least. We ate out on 3 evenings - Mamounia Moroccan Maison Arabe and Dar Yacout. 4S definitely fully comparable in terms of dining experience (perhaps just slightly behind Mamounia which was the top experience but double the price) though the environment and decor whilst great in themselves were somewhat behind the other places also due to the lack of entertainment. However 4S provides for the complimentary arrival in style to any dining destination (courtesy car - they have Range Rovers S Class Merc and Merc vans) Btw don't go to Dar Yacout with children they are awkward around them don't have high chairs and there is no menu as there is one set of courses for all (kids not charged to add silver lining).  5. Facilities  Unfortunately did not have a chance to try out much around the hotel as we spent most of the time outside. Outdoor pools looked very inviting one being heated so could have been a nice swim. Young adult centre provided good entertainment even for our little ones - mainly around the pool table with the staff helpful enough to occassionaly facilitate the game and entertaining one of the kids when I had my hands full with the other one. The centre was well equipped with video games DVD collection with big-screen "cinema" and outdoor chill-out and basketball area. The kids club was similarly positive experience though closing at 5pm meant that we only tried it once on our last day as pre-dinner time had to be spent in young adult centre. Perhaps worth extending the kids club opening hours there to cover for pre-dinner time so that younger children can be taken somewhere by the parents without potentially distracting others in the more grown-up centre (we had no issues but can imagine so if it gets more busy with younger guests).    Summary: Really impressed. Five stars throughout. Great care taken of the kids. Go for it.

This was one of the best hotels I have ever visited. The staff are incredibly courteous and helpful and genuinely seemed to care about their work. The rooms are beautifully decorated and comfortable. For a first time visitor to Morocco the environment of Marrakech can be overwhelming. Staying at the Four Seasons allows instant relaxation once inside the hotel gates. It is truly an oasis.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: This fairly new property has all the wonderful Four Seasons touches -- great bathrooms large rooms and excellent service. After a day spent shopping in the souks or sightseeing it was so relaxing to come back to this oasis. It's a short taxi ride to the Medina yet far enough away from all the hustle and bustle.  The grounds and pool are lovely -- a pool just for adults and one for families. The Kids program looked fantastic (I didn't have children with me). The fitness center has two rooms -- one for cardio and one for weights - a nice touch.  The food was delicious -- Italian food at Solano was a nice change after eating Moroccan cuisine for several days (and they have tagines on their menu). Since it was November we were able to have breakfast outside every morning.  All in all a wonderful resort to spend time.

Recently druses at this property after recommendation from friend who works for the company.  This is a great property in an amazing location. Certainly one of the nicest resorts in the world. Plus the food is great and very reasonable and the restaurants in town are great.  This is a truely great place
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great location far from the madding crowds, but not too far to enjoy.
Review_Text: This is a lovely property as you would expect from the Four Seasons. We arrived at night which was lovely as they had lights on the palm trees along the drive. It was quite a chilly night but there was a lovely log fire alight in Reception. The rooms are really spacious with a walk in dressing room and lovely large bathroom. The bath was one of the best I have ever experience really deep but didn't take long to fill. The beds were beautiful and quality of the linen exceptional. All rooms have a balcony with a couple of chairs and table and a cute little day bed area. One of the best things are the swimming pools - there is a large adult only one and also a large family pool far enough away from each other to be peaceful. The spa was a welcome relief after sightseeing in the hectic Medina which is only a short 10 minute taxi journey from the hotel. They also have a great kids club and dedicated pool just for this secure area.

We are just back from a weekend in the FS Marrakech! We had a truly great relaxing break. The children thought they were famous as all the staff were on first name terms with them which they really loved. The kids club was second to none and the kids had a great time there begging to go back all the time. I had two slight problems during my stay firstly our room wasn't cleaned on the first day so when I returned at 5 to see it hadn't been done I was rather disappointed however they were quick to come and do it and brought us some complimentary drinks and everyone from the duty manager to the head of housekeeping called to apologies. Secondly I had to request a wine glass three time first 2 times I got brought various different items!! Overall though it was a very relaxing break which I really enjoyed and I would highly recommend this hotel especially if your travelling with children! They will be treated like royalty during their stay!

Review_Title: Amazing service in a beautiful hotel
Review_Text: We stayed for three nights in a King Pavilion room. It is hard to say enough good things about this hotel. The room was large clean and comfortable with the best bed ever. The food and drinks were top quality and portions generous. Breakfast has a great selection of fresh pastries fruit cheese meats and cooked items with fresh juices and tea or coffee.    The pool area is spotless and the pool is crystal clear. The cabanas are comfortable and you are bought chilled juices and fruits from time to time. There is a great young persons room with pool able computer games pcs and a cinema.    The spa massage was lovely and relaxing in a clean friendly environment.    The best thing about the hotel without question is the staff. They are without exception the best we have ever come across. Nothing is too much trouble and they all have a smile whatever time of day.    We can not recommend this hotel enough.

Stayed at the FS Marrakech in mid-October for a total of 5 nights. As the other reviewers noted arranged for the meet and greet service at the airport which was very convenient and pleasant. The hotel is a quick 15 minute ride from the airport and it is a beautifully designed and landscaped resort. The rooms are spacious and well appointed. The hotel amenities are wonderful - the gym the pools and the spa. Had breakfast (ala carte) at the hotel everyday and had lunch at the grill once. They also provide a complimentary car service to the medina or within the city limits in the evenings.    As the hotel is still new they are probably undergoing some "growing pains". There were a couple of minor incidents but the major issue was the failure of the room air-conditioning to work in the middle of the night. This happened to me on two consecutive evenings when it was very warm outside. However hotel management apologized profusely and made accommodations to remedy the situation. Instead of being disgruntled I was very impressed with their "service recovery".    Overall this is a great hotel and I enjoyed my stay tremendously. The passion of the staff is the best part of my stay! I do not know how FS manages to do it at all their hotels - but I am impressed with the staff who were very warm genuine and always ready to help with a smile! They also always remember your name.

We loved our stay at this hotel. The staff (manager junior manager and concierge team) were all very welcoming and helpful throughout our stay. The rooms grounds and pools are beautiful quiet and relaxing. We enjoyed the fresh fruit placed in the room each day. We only ate at the hotel for breakfast but the breakfast buffet was very good.    The hotel offers many interesting day trips outside Marrakech. We did a day trip to a Berber village in the Atlas mountains. There we made tagine in the home of a villager and were given a tour of the village and a brief ride on a donkey. Learning about life in the village and spending time in someone's home was a very unique experience. One of the reasons we stayed at the Four Seasons was because this excursion is exclusive to the hotel because of their affiliation with the tour company. Our tour guide was a lovely woman who was very easy to talk to and very attentive to our questions and needs throughout the day.    The concierge was helpful in arranging a last-minute excursion to ride camels in an area outside of the city.    The concierge made recommendations and reservations at two excellent restaurants for dinner: Dar Al Yacout and Al Fassia.    We went to the souks by ourselves one evening and did not have any problems.    We highly recommend the VIP airport service. When we arrived they took us to a waiting area and processed our paperwork so we could avoid waiting in line. Upon departure they processed our check-in and other paperwork and took us to the front of the security and boarding lines. It was a seamless process. The hotel is just minutes from the airport.    We enjoyed seeing Marrakech and will definitely stay at the Four Seasons in the future since we had such a memorable experience.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: ZioL B wrote a review Nov 2011
Review_Text: I stayed at the Four Seasons just a week ago.  The property is centrally located but you need a taxi to reach the city centre (Jmaa El Fna Square). The location is therfore quiet and relaxing but in the easy reach of the vibrant centre of Marrakech.  Rooms are minimal chic with arabic touches.  Public areas are fantastic: 2 pools one for families. Care to youngsters is extreme - two different areas for the very young kids and the "grown-up".  The Arab/Italian offers gourmet cuisine.  Service considering the country is good with some excellence in Child care and Reception  SPA and fitness are very good. Overall a very positive experience and I would suggest it if you are travelling with your family.

Review_Title: Absolute Luxury and Top Notch Service
Review_Text: I booked this hotel for a 3 night break at the start of the October half term for me and my husband and our teen daughters aged 14 and 13. As we have been to Marrakech several times before I was looking for a luxurious hotel for us to spend the majority of out time at. The Four Seasons did not disappoint! With it being newly opened I based my decision to book on the very consistent reviews here and the facilities on offer although I do feel their website does not do them justice and really doesn't show the hotel off as well as it could. I did mention this and I have taken lots of photos which I will upload. So......    We booked the transfer from the airport which is around £55 for which we were whizzed straight into a VIP lounge (basic but the sentiment was there) whilst our passports were taken away to be checked allowing us to then walk straight through passport control to the carousel. We were then transported tothe hotel in a very luxurious and immaculatey clean car. On arrival at the hotel we were taken straight to a lounge and served complimentary drinks whilst check in took place. We were upgraded to 2 interconnecting premium rooms. The rooms were fabulous - the bed was so comfortable. Fabulous marbled bathroom - lovely balcony with an alcoved seating area. We both feel this is one of the best rooms and hotels we have ever stayed in. The service throughout was impeccable - we were treated like royalty and yet the atmosphere was totally relaxed and informal. Sometimes hotels of this class can seem very stuffy and full of rules but here the staff were just happy to look after us and give us a fantastic time. The teen room is very well equipped with apple macs wiis etc and even has a cinema My criticism here is that they let younger children in too which doesn't appeal to teenagers who like their own space. The two pool areas are beautiful and there are luxurious sun beds and cabanas. Lovely poolside nibbles such as frozen water melon on sticks appear at random intervals. The water wasn't very warm but neither was the weather but it didn't stop the hardy Brits enjoying their half term! As the weather wasn't perfect my husband and I spent quite a bit of time in the spa. Again this is a wonderful facility brand new and here's that word again-luxurious. I was disappointed that the jacuzzi wasn't warm but I think like the outdoor pools this is just teething troubles! I had two massages - both very relaxing. My husband was very impressed with the sauna in the men's spa. The gym is fully equipped but very few people were in there. There is a choice of 3 restaurants on site currently - we felt the menus were a little limited and the food is pricey but nice and the service of course was excellent. Breakfasts were excellent and could really see you through until late afternoon - there was more or less anything on offer. The bar was very expensive- charging between £8 - 10 for a bottle of beer! The hotel is a short ten minute taxi ride from the airport and the medina so.    We loved the four seasons and had a thoroughly relaxed and indulgent break. Make no mistake it's a pricey option but if you go with this in mind you won't be disappointed. We will definitely be returning.

This hotel only opened in June and the management have done an exceptional job getting staff trained to such an accomplished stage in a relatively short space of time.  The facilities that were opened were all to the standard you would expect at a Four Seasons.  Bedrooms are comfortable and quiet with a good supply of amenities.  Restaurant was good for breakfast. Choice was not huge but I am sure this will change as the Hotel approaches its expected levels of occupancy. Standard of food at dinner was very good and the wine list reasonable if just little expensive. This may be due to local taxes but it had the most expensive Chateau Lynch Bagee I have seen.  Public areas are very well decorated in a Morrocan/modern theme.  Where the hotel excels is in the positive and helpful attitude of all of the staff. They are clearly a group of people who not only take pride in their work but also appear to enjoy it. Staff attitude is what makes good hotels great and if the level of service is at least maintained this will be a great hotel.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Mark B wrote a review Oct 2011
Review_Text: My family and I stayed at the Four Seasons Marrakech late October 2011. We are two adults a teenager and a toddler. From start to finish this was a fantastic experience. Whilst Marrakech itself is a fabulous destination recommended to all for the sensory overload that it delivers the actual Four Seasons hotel is the subject of this brief review.    In summary we all loved it. Outstanding staff were friendly willing and provided excellent service without ever appearing over the top. Food choice was good and value was more than ok. Hotel grounds pools spa etc were all fantastic clean and relaxing. Our room (a deluxe pavilion) was particularly nice easily capable of accommodating the whole family and maintaining a degree of separation. We even had our own plunge pool.    Downsides were almost zero. Perhaps the pools were a little cold? Apparently this is being resolved (the hotel is quite new and I guess it takes a little while to fine tune).    Highly recommended. We will return.

Review_Date: alba s wrote a review Oct 2011
Review_Text: I stayed in the Four Seasons Resort in Marrakech with my Mother and my 4 year old son during the month of October. Four Seasons took such great care of us and it was a really memorable holiday.  I advice you to hire the "Meet and greet" service both for your arrival as for your departure. There is someone from the hotel waiting for you when you get off the plane he escorts you to a VIP area while they take care of all your passport controls and then take you directly to a comfy air conditioned Jeep (the taxis available at the airport arent excatly screaming comfort!)  Once we arrived at the hotel it was like a dream the decoration throughout and the gardens are maginificent. We were able to check in at the terrace whilst enjoying a cold drink this was much appreciated. We booked an executive suite but as the hotel was not very full we received a complimentary upgrade. The rooms are decorated beautifully and from our room we had direct access to the family pool which was great.  If travelling with kids this is a great place to stay the family pool is fantastic for them to be able to have fun without worrying about bothering those guests without children. They also have a great Kids Club program run by the wonderful Myriam.  The food is so good we ate lunch and dinner in the hotel everyday and it was a great mix of typical food from the area as well as classic bistro dishes. The menus for children are also great!  All in all I can say that the whole trip was amazing. The room prices are high but the beauty of the resort and the quality of the service provided by all the staff makes it very worth it! We are already planning our next visit!

Review_Date: Darren V wrote a review Oct 2011
Review_Text: Having enjoyed a great 7 night stay we would like to share our views..firstly it is essential you confirm your meet and assist at this airport as the FS let us down and we were delayed in the airport for one & a half hours. Eventually we were picked up but this spoilt the first part of our stay.Secondly there are only two restaurants open the rooftop terrace bar is closed until 2012..The pool is amazing the staff friendly and attentive as with all FS hotels and the Spa was nice but could use some improvement as all treatments were not as expected. I'm sure this will be a fabulous place next year however overall we had a lovely relaxing time here and will return.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Text: A long weekend in Marrakech at the newly opened Four Seasons.    We were there not long after the hotel had been fully opened to the public (it was soft-opened in July this year).    Room was excellent - nice size good view from the balcony large bathroom and bath with separate shower dressing room and a huge and incredibly comfortable bed.    We could not fault the friendliness and attentiveness of the staff - each one of them stopped to say hello as you passed them in the corridors or the grounds unfalteringly smiling and polite.    Food at both restaurants we ate at (on the terrace and by the pool) was excellent and though expensive (the price of food and drinks are what you would expect of a 5* resort hotel) was plentiful and generous. Breakfast selection was also excellent.    Two swimming pools - one a "family pool" and one more conventional (and much quieter - I felt bad disturbing the peach by swimming around!) both with very comfortable beds and wonderful staff circulating occasionally with a small drink or selection of fruit (complimentary).    My wife and I had both had a hammam at the Spa on the evening of our first night - an incredible experience I would highly recommend. My wife enjoyed hers although less so when she heard how good mine had been! Chaps - I highly recommend this experience not for the faint hearted but you will feel revived refreshed and sparkling afterwards mentally and physically (and you may have also learned a little about Moroccan culture and traditions).    The only gripe I would make is the transfers from the airport. Owing to a slight error on the hotel's part our car was not there to greet us and we only by chance happened upon another member of the Four Seasons staff who sorted this for us. Still it was about 30 minutes after we exited customs before we were on the way to the hotel. While the car was beautiful the drive smooth and cool and with cold towels on arrival at the car I did not feel at 550dh (about £55) it was good value for money (and that notwithstanding the lateness). It is less than 10 minutes from the airport to the hotel and for that distance I'd have been happy in a local taxi (which are a fun experience in themselves!) - for that be ready to barter and don't pay more than 100dh if possible.    Overall though a really excellent stay. When we've remortgaged we'll be back!
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Date: Semsettin J wrote a review Oct 2011
Review_Text: This place was one of the best places that I have stayed in my life so far. The service  food quality of employees were excellent. I was in there for my business. I decided to stay in this nice hotel. I strongly recommend this place to anybody. Thanks!!!!

Review_Date: Shefali P wrote a review Oct 2011
Review_Text: Stayed for 5 days. Truly enjoyed our time here. Got the airport pickup and drop off. Nicely executed.  Our best lunch was by the pool. Fresh grilled meats and seafood.  Dinner at solana was good not great.  Four seasons always pampers their guest no matter what property you are staying at.

We booked at Four Seasons Marrakech to attend a wedding in the city.  Our stay was simply perfect.  Hotel location is very convenient 10 minutes from the airport and 10 minutes to the main attractions. Our room was spacious with all comfort you might need matching Four Seasons quality standards.  Service was great with excellent staff from front desk to restaurants nothing particular to say other than that it's very good. Pools are huge with comfortable lounge chairs and cabanas. Travelling with a 1 year old baby we enjoyed the family pool and its great staff.  Spa is good with a relaxing atmosphere.  We'll return that's for sure.

We stayed in the pavilion suite with swimming pool and it was truly amazing ... We have a young baby and all the staff knew her name and we felt so special. They could not do enough for us here. We have stayed at other four seasons hotels and is new hotel is incredible.  Staff are amazing... Thank you to Mohammed at the pool ...always bringing us treats and taking care of us at the family pool.  Housekeeping were excellent.  They bought us breakfast in our room everyday and Allowed me and my baby to use spa facilities everyday indoors...which other hotel does that..??  We took a tour to medina in a VIP range rover was a great experience with an English tour guide.  Food for under 5 was free which is amazing  Now for the spa....hmmm mm....best ever massage I ever had at any hotel!! ladies you really must indulge! As only 3 hrs from London we will be returning ...thank you for a relaxing holiday we are sad to leave soon.

Review_Title: Everything is very beautiful but lack of magic
Review_Text: The regular customers of Four Seasons Hotels will love this one just opened few months ago. Very quiet in a perfect location everything is perfect but if you think to find some magic or something reminding you are in Morocco you will be disappointed. The style of the decoration is totally zen and the suite we had was as usual a perfection. The garden is wonderful and very pleasant. The staff is perfect. The restaurant inside the hotel is disappointing and not at the level of the hotel : the decor is just fine for the breakfast no napkins just sets and the food " à la carte " absolutly without interest. The spa is fine and the staff and masseuses excellents. At the exception of these remarks a great place to stay not far from the souks.
Reviewer_Trip_Type: Trip type: Traveled as a couple

Review_Title: Great Hotel Great Service, I will go back
Review_Text: I went on August 2011 to this Hotel. So lets start with the rooms. Great bed king size! Very large room with a enormous bathroom. The tub is so big i think 3 people can go inside at the same time. The Shower is also so big that i think its enough for 5 people to take a shower at the same time! Great balcony with swimming pool view. Great plasma on the room with lots of international channels. Hotel Decoration: I just love it! I would like to bring most of the decoration to my house!  Swimming pool: One of the best if not the best swimming pool I've ever been! You have 2 big swimming pools at the hotel one its more for families and other for couples. The water temperature is wonderful i cold stay all day inside it! The swimming pool is also very beautiful very clean as all the hotel is!  We had lunch by the swimming pool great hamburger! And dinner at the hotel my god it was fantastic! very nice tasteful great cuisine.  The staff is always looking if you need anything they are very helpful. Great Staff!  The gym and the SPA is also great!  There is nothing at this Hotel that i did not like! For me everything was 5 stars and I've been to lots of 5 stars hotels.I think this was the best one i felt great at this hotel! It was really a great stay!

Stayed here for work and was treated like royalty. This could be due to the fact that I was one of maybe 40 people in the hotel. Give them business so it can stick around! It's simply decorated with light beige color tones which gives the whole resort a feeling of tranquility. Perfect for those wanting to escape the sometimes overwhelming Medina. This resort is certainly more for the honeymooning couple or for family. Immaculately landscaped gardens with two pools - one adult one and one for kids. You do need to be specific about the "Do Not Disturb" sign though as the maids came in anyway. I didn't mind so much because they would also leave different food treats every day when I got back to my room. The staff here are all so nice and accommodating willing to cater to your every need. I only didn't give it 5 stars yet because it's fairly new with some kinks to work out (i.e. the do not disturb sign; another day they didn't have their breakfast buffet when I was expecting to grab something quick on my way out but since they didn't have enough people in the hotel they didn't want to waste food - fair enough reason just wish I was made aware beforehand). The spa services there were great - had a wonderful Marrakech massage. The restaurant has delicious Moroccan food but if you try to stray towards the Italian side of the menu you'll be a bit disappointed. The seafood salads though are amazing - ones with shrimp and calamari. Highly recommend this place if you are able to afford this decadent setting.

Review_Title: best hotel for a traveler who needs rest and confort
Review_Text: I live in Marrakech and never has such a great hotel existed in Morocco until now. I am impressed by the quality of the service. This sure is amazing hotel and as a traveler I have never been to such a prestigious hotel with such comfort and quality in my life. As a Moroccan and a traveler I highly recommend it; Enjoy!
If you want a great resort feeling while being able to explore Marrakech then this a great fit. Place is almost too new needs some time to mature but it's a classic "four seasons" experience.

Review_Date: Hanna F F wrote a review Aug 2011
Review_Text: A stunning hotel which just opened in June2011. We all very much enjoyed our stay here. The hotel has all facilities you would expect from a 5* hotel including a fantasic Teenage centre which the kids aged 12 and 14 loved. The centre was run by Gita Sophia and Bahia all fantastic ladies!!! The centre had Apple Mac cinema Wii loads to occupy teenagers. Stayed in a executive suite which was spacious and comfortable 2 bathrooms L'occitane products 2 massive TVs Balcony overlooking the pool. Got to mention Ahmed who works in concierge always going the extra mile to help!! I can not fault the hotel and can not wait to visit it again!! Definately recommend this hotel! You can nver go wrong with a Four Seasons Hotel where ever it is!!!

Me and my family spent a 5 day weekend on August 2011. Overall satisfaction was very high to the point that it was my family's first time at a Four Seasons Hotel and they have declared themselves Four Seasons fans.  The Four Seasons Marrakech is a brand new hotel which is overall great but can still bring around one or two very minor drawbacks (i.e. the free dvds at the Young Adult Clud did not work in my rooms DVD player because they were purchased at different regions). The special room @ around 600 EUR is large enough has a patio and the best bed I have experienced so far (much better than Westin's heavenly bed). The place is quiet the service is young extremely friendly and detail oriented. They speak Moroccan Arabic English and French. However as soon as they knew we were Spanish there was a Spanish speaking person waiting to receive us at the door and show us the hotel as the staff helped us unload our baggage and provided cool towels to alleviate the heat. The hotel's decoration is elegant with touches of moroccan decor and a nice use of fountains to improve looks and temperature. The swimming pools are elegant nice and large as are the hot tubs.
